Your Climb Leader will give you a demonstration of how to climb up and down the ladder, like a mini virtual climb and then each person will take a turn – making sure you have understood the instructions before starting the ‘real’ climb. Not only will you be in awe while doing the climb but you also get a brief history of the bridge from the beginning of its construction till present. Our Climb Leader took photos of us during our climb – group photo, individuals or your own little group of friends / family. You can even say a message or sing a little jingle to send to your beloved ones or special friend, we weren’t prepared for this, so hard to come up with something interesting to say on the spot, so we declined. So be prepared if you want to do something like this. At the end of the walk, each person received Group Photograph, Certificate of Achievement, a BridgeClimb Cap and free entry to the Pylon Lookout – all included in the price of your ticket. However, the individual photos of yourself or your own little group photos and video will cost extra. And yes, souvenirs are available to buy.Most importantly, remember to check in at the front desk with your Reservation ID 15 minutes prior to your departure time. We arrived a lot earlier, so we could view the exhibition and cinema to learn more about the history and celebration of the Sydney Harbour Bridge before our climb.
what an amazing thing to do. climbed the bridge with my son and wow all the boats and ferries just as we reached the summit !! would highly recommend
fantastic. what a place to go to and see a view, very comfortable with the height and the truing to do the walk wonderful but expensive for sure
Beautiful City!. Härlig storstad, Bodde i Sydney more than year, alltid vänligt bemött, Bondi beach is fab, what more can I say:)!

Stupidly expensive. While I accept this is an iconic part of the Sydney area , the cost to walk the arch is almost certainly to much for the average person to afford in UK values it was close to £250 for two .... It is still an amazing place to be around ... but OZ think of the costs

Bridge walk. We decided to do the cheaper option of walking across the Sydney Harbor Bridge from the Rocks to Milsons Point. It costs nothing and the views are amazing of the Harbor and the Opera House. You can then catch the train back to the city. More cost effective than the very expensive Bridge climb.

Walk across!. Go ahead and walk across the bridge. It's a nice amble. Along the way you can get pictures of the Opera House from different perspectives, as well as the city. I walked from the Barangaroo Reserve, but you can also access it from the lift at Cahill Walk. This is a great free activity, although for AUS13 you can climb a but further higher. You could also do a bridge climb way up high for a lot more money!

Windy bridge walk for a great view. The bridge climb is very easy, not a hard climb more a walk with slight inclines. There are small ladders your u have to climb for those that are nervous with heights I'd say that the only scary bit. Other than that, you don't feel like you're really high. The view is spectacular but hopefully you don't get a windy day because you can't enjoy guides were also great. I did a day climb but suggest a twilight one would be nicer.

Fun experience. The bridge climb with my family was a fun and interesting experience. We got to know a little bit about the history of the bridge thanks to our guide, who was a very enthusiastic and knowledgable person. We took some good photos at the top of the bridge and made some new friends. The whole system the organization has is effective and easy to comply with. I Would definitely recommend this for family trips. If you're afraid of heights, fear not as throughout the entire process of the climb you are distracted by the beautiful horizon and instructions you are given by your guide. He/she will make you as comfortable as possible so you can enjoy your experience.

Skip the Bridge Climb and Walk Across for FREE. My friend and I debated again and again if we should do the very expensive bridge climb. I'm SO glad we decided not to because the view from walking across it is amazing and FREE and you are only a little lower than the people paying $200+ to climb it.
The Old Coat Hanger. A vital part of Sydney, the bridge is Sydney! Linking the northern and southern approaches, one can walk/bike across leisurely and embrace the fresh air!
Iconic vision. I crossed this in a train and on foot. It is a definite visit if in Sydney. A very iconic tourist attraction.

Sydney Harbour Bridge. Nice view of the bridge from the Rocks....it was cold breezy afternoon and the view was amazing just at the dusk.....from circular quay it's around 10 minutes walk to reach the tower close to the bridge....

Thoroughly recommended. Be prepared. This is expensive but it is certainly worth it. It is something that almost anyone can manage and you are connected by harness to a safety wire all of the time. There are groups going up all the time and it is all well organised. You get a protective zip up suit and skip hat and a free group photo at the top with the bay and opera house behind. They take other photos which you can buy if you wish. For safety you can't take your own camera or phone. On a good day the view is spectacular. Recommended.

Love the bridge. The bridge is great and really adds to the skyline of Sydney. I was interested in doing the bridge walk but a local person said they didn't recommend it as it is very stilted. You have to keep stopping so it's more like a view and less of a walk. We opted to walk around it and wave to the walkers up on the bridge instead.

You know you're in Sydney.... It was when I saw the Sydney Harbour Bridge that I really felt like I was in Australia. This review will say that I was here in September 2015. I actually visited in 2012 but I can't put that. Whilst in Sydney, I had the opportunity to do the famous 'Bridge Climb'. It's pretty expensive but worth every penny. The view from the top of the bridge is incredible!

Amazing views and superb views ..... Really enjoyed walking over the bridge today .. relaxing stroll despite the slight drizzle and wonderful views of the busy waters full of ferries and amazing views of the Opera House and surrounding parks and suburbs. Access to a higher lookout point (extra cost).
Beautiful views. Ride a ferry across the harbour and enjoy the beautiful views of the bridge and other land marks around. Must see event at NYE for the firework display..... Spectacular!!

Beautiful by night. A delight for sore eyes at night. The iconic Sydney harbour is a beautiful monument that you must see and enjoy after dark. It is beautifully lit up, and best enjoyed from near the Opera house or from a Ferry. For the bravehearts, you could even walk up the Harbour bridge after paying the necessary fees.
The Famous Bridge. You can see alot from this bridge you get a birds eye view of the harbour and more, just take as many pictures as you like, memories of a lifetime.

Fabulous looking steel bridge. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is one of the most obvious attractions in Sydney. It spans the river and can be seen from most city locations. It's possible to arrange a climb if you are adventurous or you can walk, drive or catch a train across it as well as a boat ride beneath it. It's a towering structure and really a must see attraction whilst in Sydney.
Gorgeous . What an absolutely stunning place, the views from the bridge are just spectacular. I've lived in Australia my whole life but will never truly get used to a view quite like this.

Walked up the harbour bridge pier. Great view, not as high as the Sydney bridge climb, lots of stairs to climb up, if you do the bridge climb, they give you free admission to this sight. BTW - this closes by 5pm, so you can't get an evening view. Overall has a great view!!!👍😉

Truly amazing. No I didn't do the bridge walk, well I stood underneath and walked around. All those rivets, thousands of them. Repairs are carried out every day, painting etc. a true must visit historical site.

Sky high love. We did the Sydney harbor bridge climb on our honeymoon. Let me tell you, it is not for the faint of heart. It was incredible. The views were spectacular and our tour guide was fabulous. My husband has a fear of heights so this was a bit of a struggle for him but he managed. We will certainly treasure our photos and memories forever

Walk across the bridge. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is one of the most iconic sites in the city. The architecture is beautiful and the views from it are incredible. My daughter wanted to do the bridge climb the rest of us were not as enthusiastic about it (we are all afraid of heights). We compromised and Wales across the bridge on the pedestrian walk way. It was a great walk and we had beautiful views of the Harbour and the rest of the city.
On Top Of The World. This is the best thing I have done in years. A fantastic experience. Next time I hope to make it a night event. The sights and feeling of freedom on the top: fantastic!

Bridge climb is a must. Take the bridge climb its not scary( I don't like heights) but its well worth it. A wonderful experience and plenty of photos to record the memory. Its easy and safe and has excellent views on the way up.

Incredible. 100% if you're thinking about going to Sydney or you've booked Sydney but unsure whether to climb. Do it. Book it. The heights aren't that bad as the walk up gradually gets higher and you don't need to look down, just look out. I went during vivid when the lights were reflecting across the city and its amazing
Very good. Located close to famous opera house... nice place to spend evnings... lots of cruise ship around.... nearby you can find lots of resturants where you can find good australian food
Stunning!!!. This bridge is just fantastic and can never get tired of watching it. The structure is fab. Your Sydney trip is incomplete if you do not see this attraction. It's a must see :)

Brilliant fun. Tour guide Adam was fantastic. The bridge climb is a must do adventure trip in sydney. An opportunity to get a birdseye view of sydney harbour and an insight into the building of one of the most iconic bridges in the world. Loved every second.

Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb Was An Amazing Experience!. I did the Express Climb (about 2hrs all up) with work colleagues as a team reward. Our guide Max was fantastic, keeping us informed with factoids about the Bridge's construction and amused with jokes about New Zealand & our "parachutes" (actually fleecy jackets in a special pack attached to our suits). As a middle-aged woman with high blood pressure & questionable fitness, I managed the speed & few rest stops OK, although Max was kind enough to stop for me to catch my breath & cool down after a particularly steep & longer section of the climb!Larger people may find some of the tight spaces a challenge to manoevre through especially with the fleecy jacket pack strapped to your backside, and there are only water stops at the very beginning & end of the climb so try to be well hydrated before you start. There are also no toilet stops of course, so get that balance of enough fluid Vs need to pee right! Although the day was cool (apparently about 10.5c at the top) & breezy I did not feel cold at all, & in fact would probably have left off my lightweight long-sleeved top if I had known how warm I would get. The suit provided was lightweight & didn't provide much warmth but we were all supplied a polar fleece jacket in an attached pack (our "parachutes") if needed. I wore a t-shirt, cropped leggings & light long-sleeved top underneath the suit and we all received a souvenir cap to wear, but I needed to pull the suit pants up, roll up the sleeves & remove my cap to help the breeze cool me down.One of my work colleagues was afraid of heights so asked to be next to our guide, and she had no problems during the climb. You are nowhere near as exposed to the edge of the bridge as it looks from a distance & in photos, and are securely attached to a guide cable the entire time. The view at the top is just incredible, and later when you are down on the ground and watching other people walking along the top you get such a sense of achievement.Simply a MUST-DO ACTIVITY!

Second most iconic Sydney landmark. Streaming in to beautiful Sydney Harbour in the evening on our cruise ship, the "Coat Hanger" bridge was the first landmark we saw, silhouetted against strong sunset. Some we knew planned to take the famous bridge walk to try and conquer their fear of heights, but being disabled, I decided to photograph some of the many moods and angles of this stunning piece of steel instead- once you see it you'll fall in love with it, too!
Sydney Harbour Bridge. This bridge is amazing. You can see everything up there and the structure is stunning. It's a must-see attraction.

Worth the Walk. We walked across the bridge from the city to the north side and back again. We walked on both sides just taking in the amazing view. One side is pedestrians only, the opera house side while the other is pedestrians and bikes, The bikers were friendly and courteous. Best to walk in the mid morning on this side after the commuters have gotten to work.

Amazing. I live in Sydney and our harbour never seems to disappoint or get boring no matter how many times you see it. The harbour bridge is just beautiful. Views over looking the bridge, day or night is just magical.
Sydney Harbour Bridge. What a splendid architectural marvel. Spanning Darling Harbour. We really enjoyed our trip on the ferry past this famous site.Pity the climb is so expensive.

Excellent adventure. If you visit Sydney, the Harbour is a MUST, the organization and safety is very good and personnel nice and kind, the experience and view at the top is unbelievable, definitely have to try it. They don't allow cameras on top, so you have to pay for the pictures but they are really nice, they worth it
Walk the bridge.. Take a walk across the bridge. You can also bike. After you walk across you can take the train back for just .60 AUD. Or there are taxis too, or just walk back over.

Among the best experiences we had in Sydney. An incredible 3-hour walk on the bridge took us to see the spectacular view of the Sydney Opera House and much more. We started very early in the morning and it turned out to be a very pleasant time. The instructor is informative with lots of stories about the bridge and that makes the walk much more fun. This is among the best experiences we had in Sydney.
One of Sydney's icons. This place does not need any introduction since it is one of the landmarks of Sydney and everyone should visit it.

Australia November 2015. I climb the Bridge and it was aweeeeeeeeesoooooooom......
Wow.....what a feeling
And the view from the top to the Opea House was breathtaking

World-wide welcome to the New Year. Sydney is the first major city in the world to welcome the New Year. It's an event that's seen internationally every year. The Sydney Harbour Bridge fireworks are as iconic as the Times Square Ball dropping. You don't have to pay to walk over the bridge pedestrian walkway, just two feet. You can do the Harbour Bridge climb if you feel up to it.

Always worth a visit. We visited Sydney with our children for the first time recently and our 4 year old son was quite insistent that we show him the Sydney Harbour Bridge. He was very impressed. It is hard not to be. Always worth a visit.

Very good views of the harbour. Walk across the bridge, you can only now walk on one side looking towards the ferry wharfs and opera house (bike lane now on the other side.), rather than get boarded and come back on the same side suggest you go to Milsons Point ferry terminal and return by ferry via Darling Harbour or Circulay Quay. Try to pick a day that sunny and no wind ,it make a huge difference enhancing the walk. You can also do a bridge climb but it cost heaps , especially for a family.

Spectacular. Busy bridge carries multiple traffic lanes, two railway tracks, and pedestrian and bicycle lanes over Sydney harbour in a soaring span of arching steel lattice girders. The four corner buttresses are huge, and stand slightly separated from the steel arches.
Beautiful . Amazingly beautiful! Even if you are at the side of the Sydney Opera House, you can take a photo having the Sydney Harbour Bridge as your backdrop.

Great Views During Night Climb. Booked through the hotel concierge and it was $170ish for the night climb. The views were fantastic, staff was friendly, other people are the tour. Favorite part was sitting on the bridge waiting for the group in front of us to take pictures and taking in the view. It is a bit expensive but glad I did it! Would recommend going.

BridgeClimb. The team is awesome! It is extremely well thought out, organised and delivered.You feel extremely safe every step of the way, everything is done so you focus on your experience and take it all in, adrenaline, views, ...

Iconic. Yesterday, with the family, we cruised underneath, drive over and walked beneath the bridge. Previously, we have done the bridge climb and enjoyed the spectacular views. From any angle the bridge is amazing and a must see on a visit to Australia.

Amazing experience. I'd recommend climbing the harbour bridge to anyone! It's perfectly safe and the views are well worth the climb. The staff were excellent. Unfortunately you can't take up a camera with you but the tour leader takes pictures which you can collect at the end. It is a bit pricey.

Great walk. Good safe walk across a frankly amazing bridge with beautiful views of the harbour and surrounding areas. Security on duty, railings super safe and cctv everywhere. Joggers a little annoying shouting at you to get out of the way, but they're entitled to be there as much as the next person. Remember the camera!
Walk the bridge. It is so much fun to walk across the bridge. The views back towards the city are spectacular. It was so much fun.
Gorgeous Landmark in Sydney Harbour. One can climb and walk the bridge, though I just enjoyed sailing beneath it and enjoying the view of it!
Do the bridge climb!. A very nice and enormous bridge. Just looking at it is nice but it's the bridge climb that really makes it great. The view from up the top is breathtaking!
Nick60. Truly iconic. were lucky enough to see both this bridge with the New Year fireworks and walk over a few days after. Afantastic place to look at and visit.

Legendary bridge. The legendary Sydney Harbour Bridge is really beautiful. It forms a cool backdrop for any photos clicked from the Harbour and nearby areas. I have even done the bridge climb activity in which the instructor told us about history of the bridge. The view is great from the top of the bridge. People visiting Sydney should definitely go to see this bridge and click a few photos also from there.

Photography Central. Great photography spot with views to Milsons Point, Luna Park, Sydney Harbour and Circular Quay, the Sydney Heads, the Opera House, Miller's Point, the MCA, and, of course, photos of the Bridge itself.Whether standing on the bridge or underneath, this is a great thing to visit. Bring a picnic for some slow time in the park underneath the pylon (on either side).Families, solo, couples, friends, kids, young adults, adult adults, old adults, tourists, locals, business or pleasure. This is a place for everyone.
Iconic Coathanger. It is worth a walk over the bridge to get a different perspective of the harbor. You don't have to pay a fortune for bridgeclimb - you can go up one of the towers.
Relaxing. Even though I suggest walking over the Bridge from end to end, it is relaxing as the view out over the harbour is amazing and makes for great photos. You can stop as often as you want.

The mighty bridge. When you get to Sydney, the first place you want to visit is always the Bridge!Have you ever stood under something so mighty and just envisaged the amount of work done back in the day, when it was built!I Have!Take a walk up the stairs to the top of the bridge and be blown away by the views!It's a must!
Rode over it. Rode the Harley over it - after paying a few tolls to get there. We cheated by arriving via backstreets thus avoiding a bit of expense. Impressive views

Sydney's #1 Icon. Yes 'it's just a bridge' but Sydney loves it and most of the world recognises it - they see the spectacular New Year's Eve fireworks - and it's image in most Australian tourism adverts across the world. Yes you can pay to don a 'boilersuit' and climb/walk to the top of the arch but you can also walk across for free (after 80 years someone has finally given the go ahead for the addition of lifts to get to the eastern walkway - well overdue). Check the exhibition in the Southeast Pylon and the view from same. From any angle, day or night, shore or on the water, one can admire this massive engineering achievement built (in two halves meeting in the middle) well before computers, designed to truly connect the northern suburbs to the city. When built it carried 2× rail lines, 2× tram lines and 6× road lanes - the trams dissappeared in the 1960's replaced by two additional road lanes.
must see in sydney. It is one of the iconic structures in sydney. It is a wonderful experience. The view to the bridge during dusk are excellent

Pretty View. This is one of the popular landmark of Sydney. A must visit place and for those who want something more challenging, try walking across the bridge on the top curve part to get your adrenaline boiling!
Picnic by the Harbour. An awesome day spent picnicking with my little sister from Singapore. The view of the harbour with sailing boats and the Opera House to the side was priceless.

A BRIDGE FOR ALL OCCASIONS. You can climb it,drive across it,get a train over it,walk across it.You can sail under it,catch a ferry past it ,walk under it .You can see it from the Opera House,Botanical gardens,The Zoo,Darling Harbour.The Rocks Area is below it & Luna Park is on the other side of it.You can watch fireworks on it at New Year & see it lit up when the VividFestival is on.You can see it from so many vantage points around Sydney.WHY NOT COME AND SEE IT FOR YOURSELF?

Sydney Harbour Bridge Walk. I was worried initially as I have mild asthma but climbing the bridge was relatively easy due to the gradual gradient. It was 4pm so not too hot. The views were breathtaking and the sun was beginning to set as we came down. Well organised and the guide was very knowledgeable but also made it fun. Once in a lifetime experience.

awesome experience!. The price is a little steep, but so worth the experience! Our guide had a lot of interesting info he gave us, the pics he took were excellent and this is one of only 3 bridges in the world you can do this....of the 3, this is the most scenic!

Sydney Harbour Bridge is absolutely beautifull.. The view from the bridge is awesome with the ships sailing through below, a walk across takes you to Luna Park , with extraordinary rides for little kids.
Wonderfull. Another great photo opportunity especially with the various ferries that you could catch to photograph the bridge.
watching it from distance is enough. I don't think climbing the bridge is a a must after seeing the climbers always fainting while doing it.
Bridge Climb. The most breathtaking view of Sydney and of the Opera House. It's a must do if you are visiting the city. It was a morning well spent.
I recommend to walk through the bridge. The park under the bridge is a nice spot to take front photos of the opera house. You can walk over the pedestrian line and see the harbour since there.

Amazing. Wow what an experience. The walk up the bridge, the commentary explaining different landmarks, the details to how the bridge was constructed, to how many men worked on the bridge and how many men lost their lives putting together this magical piece.A must see and do.

By all means, cross the bridge so you've done it, but..... The bridge is really best viewed from the ground or, even better, from the harbour. Catching a ferry will give you great views of the harbour, the Opera House and the bridge. We recently sailed under it & were given a great look at its under structure, which gave an amazing indication of its immense size, which cannot be fathomed by simply driving over it. If you get the chance, do the free walk across the bridge or,malternately, pay to climb to the top - you'll certainly gauge its size then!

The Bridge. The Bridge looks fabulous at night when it is all lit up but during the day it is a grey metal bridge. It is hugely expensive ( $ 400 p.p. ) to climb the bridge due to the high cost of the insurance, our teenagers where disappointed they couldn't go

Climbing the bridge. Wow, what a morning, the climb is one thing, the views are quiet another. We had a clear day so we could see into the distance, what a wonderful sight. Other than those that are afraid of heights, I would recommend this to all.

A bridge like no other. This is a bridge like no other. The "coathanger" as it is affectionately known by the locals, is a symbol not only of Sydney itself, but also of Australia as a whole. It was a huge project that was conceived by some great minds and built during the Great Depression. It opened in March 1932. The bridge is all steel and requires constant painting. As soon as painting is finished on one end, it starts all over again at the other end. The total area of painting is equal to sixty sports fields! Apparently it contains at least six million rivets! As well as this its hinges are big enough to absorb the expansion caused by the extreme heat of Sydney summer. On either side of the Bridge there are two huge pylons; their presence is not really structural, they are there more for aesthetic reasons, and they make the Bridge unique. On the opening day, 19th March, 1932, the New South Wales Premier, Jack Lang was meant to cut the ceremonial ribbon, but was upstaged by a disgruntled army officer, Francis de Groot, a member of a right wing organisation, who cut the ribbon riding on his horse! The ribbon was quickly re arranged and the Premier did eventually do the honours. Horses with a rider paid much less to cross the bridge than cars, in the early days, but now a return trip costs over two dollars. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is the world's largest and has many imitators around the globe, but none like it. Millions of people use every year. On special occasions it may close to traffic, as it happened once, during the 50th anniversary in 1982. During that occasion pedestrians were allowed to walk on the bridge, which remained car-free for the occasion. The next time this will happen will be in 2032, so start planning.

Cycle across the bridge - You will love it!. We rented bikes from a shop at the rocks, AUD 19 for 4 hours and cycled across the bridge, around lavender bay, around watt park, passing Luna Park. The family enjoyed the ride. Good scenic views of Sydney skyline, Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House.

Walk walk walk....or run. Take your family, take your friends and walk the bridge.
My advice would be to train to Millions point, get a coffee from Rickies (Cafe under the bridge), and walk across the bridge, and have a feed (beer) at the Australian pub. Then a nice stroll through The Rocks...

Great way to see the harbour . We had a sunset climb which gives us the most amazing view. I've lived in Sydney many years - but from the top of the bridge- it was like seeing it for the first time. I thought I would be a difficult climb, but the ascent is so gradual you hardly notice. Well worth the climb.

Best views. Any visit to Sydney must include walking over the Harbour Bridge. The views of the Harbour, Opera House and CBD are excellent. It is safe and easy. Gain access from the city side, via stairs a short walk West from the Rocks; gain access from the North via the train and Milson Point station. Always walk on the Eastern (Opera House side) as the Western path is dedicated to cyclists.

Express Bridge Climb - So Much Fun!. We chose the express climb for time - it goes up the inner arch with views of the Opera House, stairs to top by the flags, then down the other inner arch. 2.5 hours. The full climb goes on the upper arches, but takes longer. The views were amazing. Our guide was great - several photo/rest stops and he gave us lots of information about the bridge construction & history as well as the city. They provide you with everything you need & the prep areas are so streamlined. Most of the climb is on shallow stairs, some ramps, a few of steeper stairs, some climbing over things & ducking so you don't hit your head - be prepared for an active couple of hours. You can see to the bridge/water the entire time. You cable on in the tower and aren't off the cable until you are back in the tower - I never felt unsafe or insecure. No cameras/phones allowed, so prepare to buy their photos. Worth the cost - checked one off bucket list! Try to avoid weather that is too hot, too windy, too cloudy! Includes a pass to the top of the tower at the end of the bridge.

Nice. The bridge is an iconic part of Sydney's skyline but is a bit overshadowed by the Opera House. We did not climb the bridge which is an exciting option when in Sydney. The views from the climb should be worth the effort.
Lovely views. This is best done at night. Great views from here. Especially good during vivid festival. Its free unless you choose to do the high walk.

Great way to view the harbour. We decided to walk up the bridge tower to view the harbour. It had everything you needed to look around and the history of the bridge construction. If you don't fancy the bridge climb this is more than adequate to get a good view.

Great fun , great view. Did the bridge climb, great fun. The health and safety views was out but the guides send of humour made it less painful.The view was great and we needed the fleeces as it was quite cold in July.
Iconic Bridge. Iconic landmark in the Sydney harbor. Very impressive to look at. You can walk across it for wonderful views of the Opera House and the Harbor.

Sydney Harbour Bridge an experience not to be missed. I experienced walking across the top of this famous and incredibly stunning bridge and was blown away by the experience. The bridge itself is situated in a park ,presenting many fine views of the surrounding area. However, the experience of walking across the top of the bridge was absolutely breathtaking, with stunning and uninterrupted 360 degree view of the harbour and surrounding suburbs. The safety preparations are scrupulous, and the guide provided interesting commentary on the history of Sydney.

A National Icon not to be missed. Plenty of people take pictures of the bridge, it's hard not to. It is world famous after all. But it's worth it to get that little bit closer and walk across it and look around. To see the construction and all of the rivets that were hammered in by hand. And you'll get one of the best views of Sydney to boot.
Bridge climb. Loved are afternoon bridge climb. The platforms were wide enough that you really didn't feel so high up. Really the top of the world!
Take the Ferry. Take the ferry from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay to travel below the bridge. Stuuning sight of the bridge and the Opera house emerging below it.
Walk the bridge. Great views and great walk the restaurants at the far side tube stop are to be recommended as cheap nice eats

Beautiful Views. I didn't do the bridge climb as it was pretty expensive. I opted for the Pylon climb instead, which I feel should be advertised more for tourist awareness, as not many people know about it. There are plenty of stairs to climb and no lifts, but on a good day, the views from the top are simply gorgeous.

Take a walk across...it's worth it-just watch out for the joggers. We walked across intending to go to pylon lookout but the height of the bridge foot path was enough for us. We went from Rocks to North side and caught train back over. It was raining but views were still awesome and the walk was free!!! The joggers are pretty rude though and they do not give way. We nearly got bowled over a few times so keep an eye out.

Stunning yet not scary. It is a safe walk up the bridge and not strenuous in anyway. You are tied on all the way round and surrounded my the metal of the bridge so that you never gat a bad sense of being able to fall. The views are incredible ...al in all an exhilarating experience.

gorgeous to look at. gorgeous to look at, especially at night. Take a walk around the harbor and enjoy the magnificent view of this beautiful bridge. A site not to be missed while on vacation in Sydney.
Amazing view of the sydney harbour. Likewise for the opera house, you need to visit this both in the day and at night. Truly amazing view of the Sydney harbour!
Walking over the bridge is free. A great activity for a weekend or for visitors is to walk over the bridge. Great views and some exercise! and it is free.

Do the free walk. I have previously paid to do the Sydney Harbour bridge climb . This time i decided to go for the "free experience". I started my walk from the Rocks side ,but you can catch the train to Milsons Point and do this in reverse. So i started from just up from the Glenmore Hotel. Go to the corner of Cumberland and Argyle. from here you will see the sTeps leading up to the footpath access. Very easy walk, great views of sydney Harbour and surrounds. Takes about 25 minutes to walk across. Youy can return by walking or catch train at Milsons Point. If you have the time, it is worth walking around to Blues Point for a different perspective of the Opera House.

Once in a life time. You can go on a tour and climb the bridge.Think of it as great exercise. The guide allows you to go at your own pace while telling interesting stories of history. A great experience no mater how old you are. But not for young children or carrying a baby.
Sydney Harbor Bridge Climb. In the rain, we climbed the bridge. It was worth it. It was fun, not very strenuous and the views were spectacular.I highly recommend it, even in the rain.

Walked the Bridge and took the Ferry back to Darling Harbor. We had a wonderful walk across the bridge which took 20 to 25 minutes as we took wonderful pictures of the harbor and opera house. It's a nice view of all Sydney.

Lovely landmark. It is obviously, THE landmark of Australia of course can't say anything new that hasn't been said about it. The climb was good fun, recommended but debatable as to whether or not doing it is worth it. I would recommend just doing a trip of the pylon but walking up and down this bridge between the North/South divide, anyways, for fun.
Nice spot. nice spot for photo taking , they have LED lights , can take nice picture even with a iPhone at night ,went to pancake on the Rock afterward :)

Magnificent view . Magnificent view, even from the lower part ( in the opening at the fence). It was really windy the day we walked. And there was much noise from the traffic . A bit disappointing that there was none places for view without the fence .
(Another) Icon of Sydney. Hugh bridge links between CBD and Milson Point. Use ferry to Darling Harbour or Milson point to enjoy close (underneath) view of the bridge.
Fun stuff!. Our family enjoyed this trip up the bridge...Our guide was fantastic! We would definitely recommend this tour.
Nice. I saw this and rode on the bridge in a car . I wish I had had time to walk across. It's really pretty at night lit up.

A view that can't be beaten.. We walked on the bridge to the pylon for a better view. I would recommend this to everyone well worth the effort. I have never walked on the bridge before and have always wanted to. Please do make the effort as its worth it. The views are spectacular.

Interesting view of Sydney Harbour from the Bridge Pylon. What a surprise to find out you can go to the top of the pylon on the southern end of the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Inside there are wonderful old photographs of the building of the bridge and its history. There is also a video showing original footage of the building of the bridge and you can walk to the top level for a stunning 360degree view of the harbour.

Iconic Bridge of Sydney . We passed through it during our cruise and by coach during our city tours. Lots of people are walking the bridge and some do climb up the bridge(very brave people). It's one of the iconic bridge of Sydney so we have to see it.
Famous Landmark of Sydney. It is an amazing landmark for Sydney. If I had more time, I would walk to the top. It is one of the things you have to do whilst in Sydney.
Beautiful Bridge. This beautiful bridge is a must see when visit Sydney. A great opportunity for photos. And a great spot for sunset photos.
Towers over the harbour. Iconic bridge towering over the harbour. Can spot it from many places in sydney cbd. Adventurous can climb on it. Some good views from the rocks.
Walk across for a great view of the Harbour. The bridge has a pedestrian walkway and the walk itself takes only about 20 minutes. The views are incredible.

A great wonder built in steel. It has been constructed in a sinle curve , rising 134 Mtrs above water level and is supported by massive double piers at each end. But motors can still drive over the bridge for blue water view

Sydney coathanger bridge. Made for pedestrians, vehicles, train and bicycles the steel through arch bridge across Sydney harbour is a ventage point to look at the iconic opera house , the harbour ,the central business district and the north Sydney . Opened in 1932 ,1650 feet long , 160 feet wide and measuring 440 feet from the water level ,it is the tallest , the second widest and the sixth longest steel arch bridge in the world.

The Old Coat Hanger. The Sydney Harbour Bridge or the Coat Hanger as it is affectionately called is a wonderful backdrop to view the Sydney harbour & CBD. Even has bridge climbs for those more adventurous. Hard to believe that this bridge is one of the busiest thoroughfares into Sydney while still being such a fantastic tourist attraction inits own right.

Great Views. I have been across the bridge many times and is best at sunrise. The view is breath taking and for a city, unreal. a few stairs to get up there from the Rocks, but not so bad. Bring water for the walk as it cab be hot by the time you get back (in summer time)

Walking across the Sydney Harbour Bridge . An easy walk with a good view. Take the train to Milsons Point, exit to the left and walk up the nearby steps. The walk is rather noisy as cars, buses and trains thunder by. Views to the Opera House are somewhat restricted by the railings with just enough room to get a clear photo. Walk ends at The Rocks with plenty of opportunity for refreshment.

You can walk over it for free!. We walked over the Sydney Harbour Bridge to go to Luna Park and then took the train back to the CBD. I took some lovely photos of the harbour from the bridge. It's not too strenuous and there is plenty of room for wheelchairs.
Great experience. Great experience and the best unobstructed views in Sydney! But, it is costly. The full climb takes about 3 1/2 hours.

Take a walk to the other side. Cross crossing Sydney Harbour Bridge, whether by train, bus or foot is always a thrill.This visit we walked across sedveral times from each side.An easy and enjoyable walk and great way to look over the harbour views.

An imposing structure. Even though I did not take the tour or do THAT walk - I was delighted to be able to view this truly magnificent bridge. Sydney Harbour certainly has a great deal to offer and this bridge adds to the overall aspect of this must visit place. You just watch and absorb its beauty. You need time in your schedule to walk across.

Walk across or climb?. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is a nice structure that is enhanced more by what you can see from it- a beautiful harbour, the Sydney Opera House, and the Sydney skyline.Another important wrinkle is the ability to climb to the top of the bridge. This climb has been made famous by celebrities and has helped solidify the notoriety of the bridge itself.Before you commit to a climb, note that you can walk across the bridge for free. The path is wide and comfortable enough that even those with fear of heights should be fine. High fencing is on both sides of the path.The climb is a different issue. The bridge itself does not seem all that high, yet once you factor in the cost to climb, it seems a lot higher. They offer climbs in the day, at twilight, and at dark. Climbs (guide included) start around $250 per person and increase depending on when you climb. (The cost goes up for twilight and evening climbs.) Check around for discounts and details about the length of time required for a climb.

Loved the Pylon Tour. It's stunning to see the work that went into constructing this marvel. The pylon tour suited our family of 4 quite well. 2 of us are scared of heights so bridge climb was out. This was a nice compromise for the views.

check the weather report before the bridge climb. bridge climb is a great way to experience the bridge! i highly recommend the evening timeslot for bridge climb as you can see the sunset with opera house. Although it will be a bit expensive compare with other timeslot. Check the weather report before you go , it will be very slippery during the rainy day .Last time me and my friends nearly fall down from the stair because of the rain.

Beautiful bridge. You can get a great picture of this bridge from the Sydney Opera House. I did not do the bridge climb as my time was limited in Sydney, the price, and it did not appear to be an adrenaline rush at all based on the reviews and the time to the top. You can walk across the bridge if you want to for free although obviously not as high.

Well worth the cost and the climb. This was a birthday treat from my partner, which I was not looking forward to. You cannot fall, you are so safe at all times (why did I feel I was going to fall!!!) For me the afternoon climb is the best, the sun was setting as the guide took a picture of us at the very top of the bridge. The views are FANTASTIC. Your hooked on to a rail all the way and you have all the gear you need supplied. So glad I did this .
Amazing Structure. Walked along Kings Wharf and around to Station Pier and the Rocks. A must visit when in Sydney for anyone who has not been as great location and amazing history.

Exercise with a splendid view. Walk across to milson's point for the little market,and the mandatory photos across to the main city,the stairs at either end will strengthen those leg muscles..good fun..

Sydney Harbor Bridge Pylon Lookout. We were a large group of 10 including 2 toddlers in strollers @ decided to see the view from the pylon lookout. Lots of stairs to get to the bridge itself & one of our group who didn't like heights stayed down below with one of the toddlers. The rest went on to the bridge & pylon. Good views of harbor & opera house from the bridge. 5 of us paid ($13 adults $6.50 kids AUD) to go into the pylon & climb up another (200 steps) to bridge museum & lookout from top of pylon. I'm into facts & history so I enjoyed the museum & the views were fantastic. Almost as good as on the bridge climb (which we had done on a previous trip, well worth the $) but unlike the bridge climb we could use our own cameras. Everyone in our group who did the pylon was glad they did it and the shots from the top were some of the highlights of our trip to Australia. If u visit Sydney, this is well worth the view.

The Tyne Bridge but bigger. One of the iconic views of Sydney is a must for tourists visiting the city. I took most of my photos when on a harbour cruise. The bridge was built in the same style as the Tyne Bridge in Newcastle upon Tyne (at the time the world's longest single span bridge) which was officially opened in 1928 by King George V. Sydney Harbour Bridge was opened three years later in 1932. Both bridges were built using steel from Dorman Long in Middlesbrough, England.

Climb the bridge!!!. The bridge is so incredible to see in person! It is so huge and beautiful and impressive!And then to do the bridge climb! To be on top of the bridge to see all the sights of Sydney and the Sydney Harbour!Just incredible!

The best view in the world once you actually do the climb to the summit. Was a spectacular summers day.. Would totally recommend the Harbour Bridge climb to everyone and in particular tourists who come here to visit would benefit from it the most.

Never gets old. Walking home after dinner in the city, seeing the sparkle of the city lights and the gentle ruffling of the water below, a truly lovely way to end any evening!And then there is the morning view :-)

Another bridge..... Well, we did not walk over it or up it so maybe that's why I only gave it three stars. No doubt what with the harbour beneath , the Opera House and the botanical gardens the views must be pretty good but looking from the ground up it was just another bridge. And yeah, there's the history behind it and the work that went into the construction but there is a fair few number of bridges out there which deserve more praise. On the plus side the view of it at night all lit up was pretty good . But still...only three stars.

Bridge Walk - Breathtaking. Breathtaking views of Sydney Harbour. Well managed and must when visiting Sydney. The guides are well informed and knowledgeable especially when it comes to the history of the early days of Sydney, the Harbour Bridge itself and surroundings. Fully enjoyed the climb...!
Bridge Climb. The Bridge Climb is a must do and caters to all fitness levels and definitely something to tick off your bucket list. The views from the top are absolutely worth it.

A must do----Bridge Climb . I must say I was a tiny bit terrified but this was by far one of the best three hours of my life! If you are in decent shape and not terrified of heights ya gotta do it. I did it with my 60 year old sister and my 20 year old daughters. There were people of all ages and from all parts of the world. Ricky was our guide and he was excellent. Patient, skilled and entertaining along the way. The view is simply breathtaking. We are already talking about doing Brisbane next. A once in a lifetime experience. You will be hooked on Bridge Climbing and Sydney after this experience!

1932? I can't believe it!. What a magnificent piece of engineering. So much steel! Great for photos and selfies. I sent Skype videos to all my family. Difficult to believe it is 84 years old. Very iconic.
Awesome view. First time for many many many years I've been over the harbour bridge, great views.Can see the opera house and lots of boats.Would be good to do the bridge walk!

Worth the walk to the top!. I was hesitant to do this bridge climb, but then I realized that I've hiked up mountains higher than this and it put it all in perspective. I highly recommend this activity splurge (the Bridge Climb website lists all current pricing and available bookings). The guides are very professional and safety oriented. You do go through a safety orientation as well as breathalyser test. Wear durable and comfortable shoes for this activity. They do provide secure lockers for your personal items as you cannot take them with you. Plan on 3-4 hours for the entire experience. After completing the climb, I am so happy I checked it off the bucket list and believe I would regret not having done it while I had the opportunity in case I don't venture back to Sydney.

Impressive iconic bridge. The Harbor Bridge is simply monumental and adds so much to the scene. Hard to estimate its size without standing under its pillars. And it couldn't be different, cause it carries not only motorized vehicles, but train, bicycles, and pedestrians. It is a perfect shot at any time of the day, from almost any angle. A shame my knees were injured and I didn't make it to the night climbing, it must be awesome, as I've read. Only driving through it already is.

World class views. Make sure you walk across the bridge. It is a GREAT experience and very easy to do if you are in the area. This is a stunning visual experience, particularly at night. One of my very most favorite places
Something different. My wife and I are very adventurist and the bridge was a go. It was well run and very safe. It's a must for anyone visiting Sydney.

Great piece of engineering . Just to sit with a beer on the opera house side and look at this wonderful achievement is just sooo awe inspiring , watching the people and the boats and the world go by with the bridge in the background and all for free . Wonderful spot ,

Must do Sydney Experience. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is an enjoyable experience to climb, drive or walk on! The climb was a present for my mum and sister and a memorable and enjoyable experience for all. A must see for tourists in Sydney!

Up or down ... magnificent!. From a distance, from the harbour and on either side of the harbour, from underneath, from on top, Sydney's Harbour Bridge literally and colloquially "stands out". One could easily spend half a day and still not really comprehend the wonder of this magnificent structure. Take your time ... a "quickie" is not recommended. And if you have time (and money), do the Bridge Climb!
Beautiful Bridge and Scenic View. Nice bridge view from the shore and best to view sunset from this area. But if its raining, not advisable to visit, as it'll be very cold especially during winter.
Iconic view. We all need that photo, do we? Good to have a view from both north and south sides. Easy to take a photo near opera house.

Unsurpassed views of Sydney. An unexpected birthday surprise was a ticket to the Sydney Harbour Bridge climb. What a fantastic 3+ hours! After the effective mandatory preparatory training and orientation I had unsurpassed views of Sydney to all points of the compass. Our guide (Dave) looked after us really well, pointing out key features of the bridge, landmarks and keeping us entertained with vignettes from the bridge's construction and opening and wider Sydney. It was a great experience too be up so high and be buffeted by the wind; great exposure! I'm really pleased it was on my bucket list.My only criticism would be not including individual photos of climbers within the price of the climb. A$275 is a lot of money and given the captive audience can't take cameras on the climb, I think individual photos should be part of the package. You do however, receive a group photo together with a completion certificate and branded baseball cap.

Exhilarating experience. A wonderful experience for our family of 4. You are prepared very well before the climb, suited up and made to feel very safe. The headsets provided allowed our guide to tell us fascinating stories about the history of the impressive bridge. I am not thrilled with heights, but I never worried and actually felt quite comfortable when we reached the top. It's expensive but a once in a lifetime opportunity. Since you are not allowed to bring a phone or camera, they do give you a group photo, hat and certificate after the climb. Budget in that you will want to buy the USB with your individual images on them. You'll be disappointed if you don't!

Great experience. Did the climb in the middle of Winter but at least it was dry, very windy though never felt unsafe at all. Guide was very good and for any of the more nervous climbers he was very chilled with them. This is an expensive activity but overall the experience was worth it. Definitely recommend it.

A place worth visiting. After coming to circular quay, we took a long stroll and took some stairs to reach the top of the Sydney Harbour Bridge. It took us approx 20mins to walk past the entire length of the bridge, and click some fantastic snaps of the opera house atop the bridge.We took our train towards Chats wood from Milsons point station.
Things To Do. It is a great spot to take pictures of the bridge from Sydney Harbour. Wished we had done the bridge walk. Nice during the day or at night.

Fear of Bridges, But One Not to Miss!. I should start by saying I have a serious fear of bridges, like a real fear! With that being said, I obviously did not do the climb challenge, simply driving over it made my heart race! But the Sydney Harbor Bridge is beautiful! When you think of Sydney its one of the top 2 attractions that come to mind, and it's a critical point that makes the harbor so beautiful. Don't leave Sydney without experiencing the Sydney Harbor Bridge!

The Iconic Coat Hanger. This is such an impressive bridge - you can't help but photograph it - or want to be photographed in front of it - if you are visiting Sydney.Locals call it "the Coat Hanger". You can walk under it, drive under it, sail under it, walk over it, drive over it, catch a train over it, climb it, or view it from the top of one of the pylons. The Pylon Lookout and the Bridge Climb are well worth it. Matt Lucas from the "Little Britain" TV show has climbed - so why shouldn't you?Go see it before it's destroyed in yet another disaster movie that wants to depict Australia with a single image!

Beautiful view. Time your visit around 5pm and you will get to see the daylight and evening breathtaking view. There's a tourist area opposite it where you could climb the tower for great photography.

Amazing structure. The Sydney Harbour Bridge was truly an amazing structure to behold. Though the place was very busy and can get really crowded at times, it was really festive to go there. I prefer going at night since the bridge looks really nice in photos at night with all the city lights.

Kill 2 birds with 1 stone. There are so many things you can do to see this magnificent man made structure. You can walk/ cycle on the bridge, drive on the bridge and even climb the bridge. It is a great tourist destination and the best part of the bridge is............that it is right next door to the OPERA HOUSE (hence the title).You may as well slowly take your time to enjoy both iconic figures by divulging in one of the many cafes/ restaurants that settle right along the circular quay. It is a must to do on the bucket list!

Night time tour. Done the climb 2 hours after I landed in Australia, and was worth it. Although it was windy and cold, you are provided with all cold weather gear. I would have preferred to have taken my own camera up, however no items are allowed - including any fitness watches (had to take my garmin off). Can't see why some personal items can't be clipped on when the "uniform" you wear has clips to attach clothing on.Other than that, was a great experience and glad I done it. Would go back to do one during the day when I get the chance.
Australia with children. No wheelchair/pram access so be ready to do some carrying. Excellent views of the bridge and the CBD from Milsons Point, especially at night.

Walk and Delight!. We were enthralled with the sight for one full week in May and when we returned in June with our organized tour we walked the bridge - two different scenic ways - what a treat - highly recommend the walk - we are able seniors and no problem - gives you that shot of energy we live for each day!

Coffee with a view. When landing at airport you get on underground train, that then takes you to the harbour, when you cum out on to main street walk just a few metre, you find your self look at the harbour bridge that takes your breath away, seeing we travelled from England. There is a nice cafe just on the harbour side with the back drop of the Bridge and Opera House

Great view from top. Walked the bridge, guided tour. Easy and safe for people in average good health. Excellent views from top of the bridge. Tour guide was great with lots of history about how the bridge was built.
Climb…. Climb it! trilling…fight the wind, the height and the fear, there is a lot of history attached to it, it took a lots of men's lives to build it..
Amazing architecture . Great to see and experience. Great architecture and historic site. Check out Millers Point too. Classical martime 19th century dwellings.

Best view in town. The view from the Sydney Harbour Bridge is the best in town. A segregated pathway makes your walk safe. Enjoy the views of Sydney Harbour and Circular Quay. Any time of day is good for walkers and runners. Be mindful that it may be quite a bit cooler up on the bridge, especially when the wind blows

Different view of that iconic bridge!. Take a walk from Wynyard, down Margaret Street, along Hickson Road, around Millers Point taking time, pausing and looking up.
Climbers' silhouettes seen on the arches, on the walkways underneath - it is a wonder.🙄
Finish up at Circular Quay.
Don't miss the view!. Epic just epic! I cannot find the right words to express what I felt when we saw this bridge. This a a must try and must visit attraction in Sydney, Australia. 😁😁👍❤️
Great experience. Awesome and thrill seeking adventure.. Great iconic place and a beautiful sight. A place to be,for all passing through NSW.
breathtaking. a must visit if visiting Sydney also the bridge climb is a must being scared of heights is ok as I am but this experience takes away the fear

Harbour bridge . What a feat of engineering. As we couldn't afford to climb it, we walked across it. Very impressive. Stunning views from ground level too. Not strenuous. Wide and level walkway. Must do the pylon climb when walking across.
Marvel of Engineering.... Its not just a construction to drive across but a thing of beauty in itself. I am determined to go back to spend much more time watching it...

Walking the Sydney Harbour Bridge. The bridge is an icon of Sydney. However, walking the bridge is something you can take or leave. Although the walking path is isolated from traffic (safety issue resolved), the walk across the bridge is not as breath taking as walking other bridges of the world. It is fun to walk but it can be admired just as well from several vantage points in the City without the added wear and tear of walking it.
Amazing site at night. Really beautiful at night, wish i had time to climb the bridge. Makes for really cool panoramic pictures. A landmark you have to go see while in Sydney.

Sydney - Bridge - inseperable. A walk, or run even, over the bridge, from either direction is pretty much essential if you want to truly "get" Sydney. Its busy and often noisy - traffic lanes x 8 and a train - plus the walk/cycleway but the views and understanding the majesty of the Bridge are all worth it. The walk way is secure, including the grey mesh and barbed overhangs to make sure people don't climb or jump. Its not a huge effort, not steep and perhaps 1500 meters max - one way. You really should walk the Bridge.

Walk across the Bridge. This is a must. Do it, and while you are crossing stop in and climb up the south-eastern pylon for a spectacular view and interesting facts about the old coat-hanger (That what the locals call the Bridge - obviously).

so cool. gazed upon it from my hotel window. drove over it in a motor coach. walked under it at the rocks. sped past it on a ferry boat. took pictures of it day and night from most every angle. not regretting foregoing the climb but kind of wish I'd walked across it. next time.
Beautiful view!!!. We just checked it out from the opera house side. Very cool!the view is beautiful no matter where you see it from. You can go to the Museum of Sydney to learn more about it.
Gorgeous from every angle. You can't visit Sydney without getting your tourist snaps with "The Coathanger" in the background. Enjoy the bridge from all angles as you walk all around the harbour.

Nice piece of Engineering. Its a good landmark to visit. Being next to Opera house and city makes it very accessible and humming. Bridge climb is an good option if you are looking for extra adventure but it is overpriced in my opinion. Regardless, the view from the top is amazing.

Captivating and majestic. Have seen many wonderful and bigger bridges in the world, The sydney harbor bridge has it own charm. What makes it stand out is the atmosphere around it. There is a beautiful harbor, the Sydney Opera house and museums, street performers, the Rocks area and luna park area. Walks up the harbor bridge are arranged too. Lots of things to do around the area.
take a walk across. incredible views of the city just from the sidewalks. you can do the bridge climb, but i dont see that you get a better view for the $.

Nice family outing. My grandson (8) was visiting Sydney for the first time and desperately wanted to do the Bridge Climb which we knew he was too young to do. Instead we did the stair climb up to the top of the pylon. It was excellent value for money and we had great views all around when we reached the top. There is interesting information if you take the time to stop and read it as well.
Simply Amazing. The sheer size of this structure is just mind blowing. Awesome to see either from the ferry on the water or just driving across.

Always a must at night. Love seeing the bridge at night. Especially New Years Eve and during Vivid Sydney. Driving or walking along it is breathtaking. Could become tiresome for those who use it everyday I suppose, but I never get sick of it. Whether its free toll on the weekends still, I'm not sure.

Best over New Year's. For me this is one of those must see sights (very much like seeing the Golden Gate Bridge), however the best time to see this is during a New Year's fireworks display, simply spectacular!!!
A must when visiting Sydney. When visiting Sydney, be sure to see the bridge and take to walk on the bridge. Wonderful views. Not too taxing and worth the time and expense.
Relaxation. What a fantastic place. Just have a glass of wine from Opera Kitchen (Out door) and enjoy both view of Opera House and Harbour Bridge.

A must see site in Sydney. We visited the harbour in July on our tour of the world.
It was a bright and sunny day not a cloud in sight and the view of the bridge was great.
You are able to climb it as well but it looked extremely expensive.

It's so so very big. Seeing pictures does not compare to actually being there we traveled by boat from darling harbour to the quay and we got to go right under the harbour bridge I couldn't believe how big it is. It is truely one of the greatest things to see if you like bridges and landmarks :)

Nice . We saw the bridge from circular quay. You can walk up the top of the bridge but we did not. Every day we saw people walking up it. We took a bus to the zoo (use opal card) so we got to drive over it. Take the ferry for another view of the bridge too.
Climb it!!. We climbed it and it was great! Easy climb, just about anyone can do this. Once in a lifetime experience.

Great View over the City & Harbour. Early morning walk over the bridge. Started around 6am from Kirrabilli, a nice slow walk over to The Rocks & around the Opera House before returning the same way.
Great views of Kirrabilli House, Opera House, Harbour & City.
Checked out Kirrabilli Market on return.(Sundays)
Walked halfway, nice views. Nice walk across the bridge. The views are nice and worth the walk. Doesn't get to busy so can get nice pictures.

Stunning Bridge. Seeing Sydney Harbour bridge the second time around still stunned me. It is indeed an iconic structure. We went near and under bridge via The Rocks. Though we did not do the bridge climb because it was expensive, just seeing it up close was great. I recommend seeing it in both daytime and nighttime for a different perspective.
Beautiful sight. We walked on it, travelled over and under it and climbed one of its towers. Simply awe inspiring. You cant miss it!

Sydney Harbour Bridge is stunning. My husband and I did the bridge climb. What an amazing experience for me, was my husbands third time. Whatever angle you look at the bridge it is simply stunning and such a Sydney icon.

A Photo pitstop must.. Every international exchange we host wants to see the Bridge and who can blame them it is an icon. Having been here many many times I think the best time to see it is during the light festival which has just been or at new year. The lights are fantastic.Of course you can see it anytime and its amazing but the lights add something special.

The view. It was a surprise from local friends but it was a great experience. It's quite a walk before you actually start the climb so keep in mind that it will take a few hours to complete. but when you get to the top you have a spectacular view overlooking the city!!
Pricey to walk over. It is beautiful but very expensive if you want to walk the span~up to more than $300 per person, but there were many who did! Looks like lots of fun but nothing more than a site.

Iconic Australian Attraction. Whether you do the official Bridge Climb, just walk across the main deck, or stop at the south pylon and take in the great views from the observation deck, the Sydney Harbor Bridge has much to offer. Start at either end and walk across to the other side. Great views of the harbor along the way. After the walk enjoy a beverage and meal either in The Rocks area or the Kirribilli side.

Lovely time had by all. I took a group of 8 year olds to Milsons Point train station and had morning tea at Bradfield Park. Great photo opportunity of the harbour with the Opera House as the backdrop. We then walked across the bridge and admired the structure of this iconic landmark and took more photos of the harbour and the city scape. I love playing tourist in my own city.

Sydney Amazing Bridge. Ride the bridge is a unique story, a scientist from the last adventure was fun for me to climb on the bridge and see the city of Sydney from each hand, and what I liked about it is to see the sunset and the colors surrounding it and I am happy with that distinctive and interesting journey ...

Bridge just okay..... . It was okay..... Great view..... Took pictures from sidewalk.... Lights up qhen vivid show is on..... Including opera house roof arcs...... Vivid is only from April to June, I think, though not exactly sure if they extend until July. Had a great time

Iconic gateway. I did not climb the Bridge-- which many people recommend. However, it is such an iconic gateway to the city, and its shape against the Opera House creates a unique visual signature for the city.
The Iconic Sydney Harbour bridge. On each of my 3 visits to Sydney i spend a lot of time around the harbour bridge...outstanding view towards the opera house and the Rocks..

Amazing bridge. It's so cool to see this bridge.
I didn't climb up the bridge but I saw it from the boat and also as I walked underneath and drove on it.
Amazing thing to see in sydney!

As youd believe. Just like youve seen on the tv and in photos.
Id recommend the bridgeclimb as a must do.
It looks steeper than the climb is, its much more of a bridge walk than a climb.

Walk across the Bridge. Take a walk across the the Sydney Harbour Bridge which will take approx 25 minutes. Catch a train from the city across the Bridge to Milsons Point where you will alight and make your way to Bridge entrance then take a leisurely stroll back to the city. Magnificent views of the harbour and the Opera House. Great photo opportunities.

A world icon that everyone enjoys. I love walking across the bridge down to the rocks. A great view of the harbour and. The bridge walk is a great walk and there is a lift towards the end of it which takes you straight on to the promenade of Circular Quay which is also a great flat walk for all ages.

A must see for non-Sydneysiders. My kids loved our recent visit to see the bridge. We went over to the opera house forecourt to get the best view. Later we drove over it. This is not a big deal for us having lived in Sydney but for our non-Sydney kids, they loved it.

Harbour Bridge Climb not for faint hearted!. It's historical, unique and a major Sydney landmark. It is also fully functional with constant traffic flow across the bridge. It is arguably one of the most profitable asset Sydney has for the toll charges and the fees incurred on tourists who are interested in climbing it. The panoramic view from above the bridge is magnificent! Certainly recommend it to everyone

Great Bridge Climb. Our hotel, The Intercontinental, overlooked both he Bridge and The Opera house, so afforded us some idea of the scale and magnificence of The Harbour Bridge. We had booked a "Bridge Climb" and decided on the "Dusk" tour.After some training and passing the breathalyser we set on our way and what a way. At the top we looked at the Blue Mountains the west to watch the sun set, sure they were called that! Then back over the other side to see the city skyline light up as the sun went down.....awesome experience.

What an experience. From the moment you walk through the door, even the most nervous person would feel at ease.Very organised and spacious entry with access to snacks and gift shop before you head upstairs to get your briefing and safety gear.My bridge guide was fantastic. Very methodical and precise. Our tour ran like a well oiled machine.Our age group ran from 16-80. So no excuse not to go!What an amazing experience. Loved every second. Learned so much interesting information. Especially about our fellow Scots! Climb was broken into segments so you never really knew who far and how high you moved.So, stop thinking about booking it and just do it. You WILL be glad you did.
can do a bridge climb great for overseas tourists. you can do a professional bridge climb its great for young people and overseas and interstate tourists

A photogenic ;landmark. I have lived in Sydney 44 years so I drive across the Sydney Harbour Bridge frequently despite the toll. To bypass it is a few more kilometres but takes a lot more time. The tunnel is the same fare. A few times since I've lived here they have closed the bridge to traffic, once on its 50th anniversary in 1982 and again for "Sorry Day" in 2007. I walked the bridge both ways both times. There may have been other special occasions I don't know about.The bridge was designed with 6 lanes which in 1932 was unheard of. Afterward they added the "Nippon clip-on" which made it 8 lanes. Most people overseas see the bridge with the New Year's fireworks when it has special lighting but in fact even on an everyday crossing it seems pretty special to me as it reinforces the idea we are a city on the water and you can see the Opera House, the tall buildings in downtown Sydney plus all the boats in the harbour.

Amazing and heart felt experience. The Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb is safe and offers a birds eye vista of the whole of Sydney basin. The Climb is not hard and at every step another piece of Sydney comes into view. It was one breath taking experience I will never forget.

Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. Two friends and I did the bridge climb to celebrate our 70th birthdays and loved it. The climb was on our bucket list and the guide looked after "three old ladies" very well even though we were with a group half our age. Parts of the climb were a challenge but we felt so good that we had achieved it. Would recommend it to everyone.
DO THE CLIMP. WOW! the climb is epic! thrill seeking experience not for the faint hearted that's for sure! can be a little pricey though

Great walk across bridge. We recently went into the city for Vivid. We caught the train to Milsons Point. Went to Kirribilli Club for a drink and dinner while the sun went down, the view from the club was spectacular, we could see the bridge and all the lights of Lunar Park. When we decided to go the courtesy cab dropped us at the bottom of the steps of the Harbour Bridge, we then walked across being able to see all the light on the boats and buildings from afar and closer and closer. It was a very enjoyable night.

Awesome!!!. Technically, I'm not really afraid of heights, but I was determined to walk the Harbour Bridge while in Sydney because it looked amazing and fun. Plus, I saw my favorite TV stars (from Modern Family) walk across it on one of their episodes.and I knew then I HAD to do it. It was amazing!! So much fun and not really scary at all, UNLESS you REALLY don't like heights! The only time I almost felt a little bit anxious was when you had to climb up the four flights of narrow ladder steps to get to the top. Those steps are very short and narrow and you have to pay attention or your foot will slip off on them. You're tethered to the bridge by a hook and cable so you don't have to worry about "falling." You can even be in a group that walks it at night. I'm sure that's a wonderful view at night, but I know I couldn't do it in the dark! :-) Worth the experience, though!!

Harbour Bridge At night . Go their during the evening. It is a magic place. Loved it! Great restaurants around,the Rocks and I did the Harbour Bridge walk at sunset. A must in Sydney, you can't beat the view on the Opera

Walk across the bridge bottom is free. My wife and I walked across the bridge but did it the free way by taking the walkway which offers walkers and bikers the ability to walk across the bridge and view the harbor without paying for it. A nice stroll early in the morning. Great views of Sydney Harbor, the Opera House and any cruise ships at dock. It is fun to watch all of the ferry boats quickly moving back and forth across the harbor hauling people from one side to the other.

Spectacular views from atop the bridge - must climb!!. I did a sun-set climb on the bridge. It was definitely a bucket list must. I found the walk challenging as I am scared of heights, but getting to stand right on the top of the bridge, view 360 degree views of sydney, sydney harbour, other attractions like the Opera House and Luna Park made any fears I have of heights seem insignificant. It was a moment of serenity standing on top of the bridge, a memory I will never forget. Climbing it was a great way to learn about the history, as our guide was very well informed, and the immense structure of the bridge and the engineering feats of it are much better appreciated up close. This isn't for the faint hearted however, walking above the highway with cars zooming past does take a bit of getting used to, and whilst not looking down usually is a good idea, not looking down whilst standing on top of the bridge would be a mistake.I loved climbing it and I would do it again if I had to opportunity, whilst it is expensive, it is great with family or close friends to share to wonderful occasion with. It definitely should be on your bucket lists and crossed off them!!

Sydney's, and sometimes Australia's, Icon Image.. A Bridge is a Bridge is a Bridge......my tribute to Gertrude Stein. What can you possibly say about this incredible structure spanning one of the World's most magnificent harbours? If you are able, you must experience the Harbour Bridge Walk and climb up the spans and over the Arch. It is an experience that you will never forget! For the timid, catch a Harbour Ferry and go under the bridge or simply take public transport and ride over it....at least you can say you've done it, but the views are very limited.
Old but reliable. It's considered to be one of the oldest bridges in Sydney . Ferries pass by it and it's so beautiful and its structures are very strong despite the years.

Scenic view of the Sydney harbour. A walk along the harbour bridge provides an amazing view of the Opera House, Sydney Harbour ,CBD and North Shore. The only con is the noise from the traffic and exhaust, but only in reality just a 20 minute walk.

Great view. We went to Sydney overnight last week and had a great time.We found our way to the bridge and walked across it.You can pay to actually climb the bridge or you can pay to go up one of the tower observation look out.Not keen on heights so we just walked over the bridge and really enjoyed it; as a Princess cruise ship cruised under it.Loved it.

The Bridge Climb. A "MUST DO". Do the sunrise climb it's fantastic. Even though it's an early start one has the rare opportunity to see the glittering city lights during the dark and then watch it come to life as the sun rises over the harbour gradually spreading the light of day on what is without a doubt the most beautiful view of Sydney in all it's glory.. The climb is not a difficult one and when you reach the very top it's like you are in the sky looking down.....the steps aren't steep and only a couple of short ladders to go up.and the whole thing is a lot of fun......

Magnificent. Sydney Harbour Bridge is a spectacular feat of engineering. It's magnificent during the day and rather romantic at night. There's nothing quite like seeing it for yourself. We went there 2 nights before the Vivid Sydney ended, spent our dinner at the cruise ride. The colorful lightings were very impressive indeed.

Sydney harbour bridge. Short walk from opera house but some steps to climb. Climbed the Pylon Lookout (200 Steps), good views all around, then walked across the bridge and back, about a mile or so. Fees charged but reasonable
A half day break!. Taking train to Milsons Point. Then walking on the bridge from Milsons Point to city. Great view of the harbor, city skyline and opera house!

Brilliant . I was in Sydney for one day and thought you only live once why not climb the bridge, the day I was there it was pouring down rain but the climb still went on. I was very happy with all the staff and our guide was amazing and looked after everyone, I plan to go back in the warmer weather to do the climb again I loved it that much

Sydney Harbour Bridge climb. Great activity to do on one of Sydney's biggest attractions. The walk and iconic views as you walk up and across the bridge are beautiful. The historic information from the great guides that accompany you throughout the climb is very interesting. A must for any local or visitor. Only complaint or suggestion would be to have some kind of water station as you climb as on a hot day it gets very warm.

Bridge Climb. Having Happy Birthday sung to me at the top of the Bridge was a highlight. Even tho some people shouldn't have sung it was spectacular to have that happen with the backdrop of Sydney Harbour. Amazing.

Breathtaking bridge climb. Highly recommended to all to climb the sydney harbour bridge even those with a fear of heights. Wide walkways great commentary from well trained bridge staff a must for anyone in Sydney.
Beidge climb. Great experience lasting over 3 hours. Guides very knowledgable and a great thing for both locals and tourists.

Walk in the bridge for amazing viewd. Our walking tour guide Lilly told us how to access the stairs to get in the on the pedestrian walkway. It's a bit tricky so ask around to a local or at your hotel.
Amazing views from the bridge.

Expensive but well worth the money!. Check the box off your bucket list and just do it! You don't have to be too courageous nor physically fit to climb the bridge - if I could do it, trust me you can too!
Walked across the bridge and breathtaking view. The climb up the stairs was worth the walk. The walk across the bridge is not for the faint of heart. It was a little strenuous but world the walk.
Great views. This is really great , you can walk across the bridge and take in all the view , easy walk , or you can the bridge climb it's amazing .

Amazing architecture!. The bridge is insane. The view with the opera house and the bridge take your breath away. There's one company that does climbing tours, The Bridge Climb.
