I'll review them on their site, but if you have the opportunity get as close to the bridge as possible, it's an amazing build.
Bridge walk - great fun!. Awesome views and super helpful guides! Everyone was excited to climb up to the top of bridge! Great historical value.

Sydney Harbour Bridge. It is well worth crossing the bridge on foot from one side or the other, it only takes 30 mins at most, and you get fantastic views of the Harbour, the Opera House, and the feel of the steel bridge up close. You can also climb one of the towers to get the elevated view of the city and all the surrounds, for only about 10 dollars. Many do the Bridge climb, but in my opinion, it is too expensive and takes too long, also, you have to book and if the weather is not very good, you cannot change the booking, except in the case of electric storms, and you cannot take any photos for security reasons. I recommend the walk across.

Walk across the bridge for free. So everyone talks about the bridge climb. Hard to justify the $158 they charge. Instead you can walk across for free. I went up through The Rocks and went across just after sunrise. The views of the harbor, the opera house, and city were great!

What a View. Have you walked across the Sydney Harbour Bridge? Do so now. Walked from Milsons Point back to CBD, a great view of the harbour and the bridge construction. There are other ways of viewing the bridge from walking the top, cruising underneath or just viewing from land but well worth a visit in whatever or all ways you wish.

When in Sydney...... The Sydney Harbour Bridge is certainly an amazing structure when viewed from any angle. I certainly recommend walking and taking a ferry beneath it and view from different vantage points. Do don't appreciate its size until you walk under or over it!!! The Bridge climb is definitely a must-do. The view from the top has to be seen to be believed!

Stunning. The Sydney Harbour Bridge can be experienced in many ways. At its simplest, you can walk, drive or take a train over it. It affords some stunning views back to the city and the north shore. If you really want to experience the bridge, book in for a bridge climb, it really is spectacular.

A Sydney must. Thoroughly enjoyed the 3 hour or so experience of climbing the bridge. Superb guide, even if we did believe a few too many of his tall tales, views are amazing, and the whole experience of seeing the bridge from on top and walking through it was amazing (but I'm a civil engineer so was going to love it anyway)
walking sydney harbour bridge. This is one of the best experience ive have ever done the views are spectacular and the guide was very informative

Experience of a life time . Took the short tour, two and a half hours. Had a great guide and group. Wasn't on my bucket list but should have been. My tour was in the afternoon but some friends took the night tour and raved about it. The cost seems high but the value of the adventure is priceless. I should have done the night tour as well.
Beautiful View of Sydney Harbour Bridge. Best View to experience the views of Sydney Bridge is from Luna Park. Getting there by ferry from Circular Quay to Milson Point

One of my all time greatest experiences!. This is definitely a MUST DO if you are in Sydney! The views from the top of the bridge are breathtaking and the whole experience of getting to the top was so much fun.The organisation by the staff was immensely professional with safety paramount and fun a close second. Our guide, Mich, was just perfect!Even though we climbed in very wet weather, this just added to the fun. The equipment and protective clothing meant that being exposed to the elements just added to the fun!

"Fantastic Experience"'. I would recommend doing the climb the young girl we had was a delight to climb with and made it enjoyable, it was well worth the money. It is a easy climb to do they stop along the way and tell you the history off the bridge so plenty off time to have a rest if needed. We went during the day and was not disappointed.

Just like in the Pictures. Coming across the harbor for the first time and seeing the opera house and the bridge for the first time does not do it justice from pictures you see of it on tv or movies. The bridge is beautiful and makes the trip to Sydney worth it.
Walk across for free or take the train!. Not sure I'd pay to do the climb particularly when you can walk across for free. Good views over the bay.

Nice to walk and great view. Who can resist a view of Sydney harbour? Walking across the bridge gives you amazing views of Sydney harbour on one side, and Darling harbour on the other. It is an easy walk, with lookout points along the bridge, you can also go up one of the pylons for a small fee.

Climb of a Lifetime!. I am very claustrophobic and always thought I would never be able to climb this magnificent icon. You do need to climb up through the pylons but the staff are so encouraging and you forget about any claustrophobic feelings.The views are AMAZING to say the least and if you are ever in Sydney this is one activity I recommend you do!

GREAT EXPERIENCE. Would recommend if you are in Sydney you have to go to the harbour bridge and park your car and go for a walk try going during the day miss the peak hour traffic sunny day go for a walk up and down great views took the family great fun kids loved it

Walk across the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Walked across the bridge on Saturday afternoon of 18 June. Easy to do, free and does not take long. Views were great. We walked from south to North. You exit the walk near Milsons Point rail station so we took the train back as we wanted to go to movie next.Can recommend.

Good view from the top, bit pricey to walk up some stairs and look at some displays. Wife and I went for a leisurely walk on the weekend across the bridge. Lovely walk and view just from the pedestrian walkway. I discovered the tower climb ( not to be confused with the much hyped bridge climb which I just wasn't drawn to, experience or price wise). I thought I'd get a great view from up there and I'm impartial to a bit of stair climbing. It was a fantastic view and well worth climbing the 202 steps. Just don't think it was worth $13 ( or just under 16c per step) to see a few models and information displays and a souvenir store. But a terrific view and from about the same height as the top of the arch via the bridge climb if you aren't a thrill seeker.

Bridge Climb is AMAZING. A brilliant experience and worth every cent. The first section was the most scary under the actual road surface of the bridge. Once above the road it was a very easy climb to the top. It all felt very well run and very very safe. A must do.

Great experience!. Spoiler alert: this review gives a lot of detail about the walk because I was looking for detail when I was trying to decide if my fear of heights was going to ruin this experience for me. So don't read if you don't want the blow by blow! :)I'm not terrified of heights but I have a healthy fear of falling to my death from some place very high and going splat. So I was apprehensive about paying hundreds of dollars to crap out of myself. But I am so glad I did because the views were AMAZING and I actually felt like I conquered my fear a bit. We chose the upper bridge walk (lower bridge walk is the other option but they told me it's much narrower). We suited up in the jumpsuits they provide (so your clothing won't catch on anything), did some practice ladder-climbing with the cable they hook onto your suit, and then were on our way. Turned out I was the only one in our group who was afraid of heights (really?? doesn't everyone else try to torture themselves to overcome fear??) so the guide had me go right behind him, at the front of the pack, which helped me feel more comfortable. You start by walking along the lower part of the bridge, and then climb a series of ladders to get to the upper deck. You then walk along the upper deck to the midway point, pose for a bunch of photos, check out the amazing views, and come back the way you came.The beginning of the walk was really unnerving because you walk along grates and can see through to the ground (very far) below. Keeping my focus straight ahead got me through, but I did not enjoy this part at all and was starting to wonder how the hell I was going to make it through the next 2 hours without having a meltdown. The ladders were a little hairy since they are narrow and you can only go one at a time (which had me questioning their structural integrity). But they didn't bother me as much as the first part since you can just focus on going one rung at a time till you reach the top. The upper deck- which I was the most worried about because I thought looking down at traffic and being on top of the bridge would make me freak out- was actually the easiest part. The walking path is pretty wide and is solid steel, so you can't see through to the traffic below as you're walking. Somewhere between taking in the amazing views and starting to believe that I wasn't going to tumble to my death, I started to really enjoy myself. I actually got so comfortable that I started looking down on purpose and liking it!! (Even walking over the grates on the way back didn't bother me.) All in all this was a great experience and I highly recommend it!
Just interesting. You are able to climb with as tour, well worth the steps up, hang on coming down. Good to walk over view worth it.

Best part of my life as stress buster!!. Solo harbour walk with music in ears has contributed to reduce my stress and anxiety. Loved view of harbour and opera house from the center of the bridge. On other side of the bridge, some of the best coffee shops ever...!!! Love it.
Perfect for a picture. Visited this amazing bridge in February. It is a must thing to pose in front of. Nice atmosphere with view of Sydney Opera house and clean blue waters.
Sydney Australia. I don't think it's the bridge so much as the harbour it makes the bridge stand out the best time to see the bridge is New Years Eve.

Breathtaking, once in a lifetime adventure. It as wonderful! Admitted, it's not really cheap, but it's worth every penny. You get very good instructions, even a "rehearsal" before you actually start the climb. The scariest part for me were the 4 steep ladders at the beginning... After that, it's an awesome walk up on the bridge, rewarded with an unforgettable breathtaking view.
fantastic view. this bridge is awe inspiring. You can walk the bridge and if your feeling daring you can walk to the top of the bridge not for the faint hearted

Nice catchup place with friends for happy hour . One of my purposes of this trip is to visit my friends in Sydney. While most of them finish work at around 6-ish pm I had a walk at the Circular Quay before our happy hour drinks. There are also a lot of cafes and bars around the harbour which you can always sit down and enjoy the harbour view with a coffee or a glass of wine. A wonderful place to re-visit!!!
Harbour bridge. We watched the vivid lights turn on the harbour bridge from our cruise. You could later see people doing a bridge climb with their head lamps on.

Climbing High!. My family and I climbed the harbour bridge last weekend as a treat for my birthday and what an experience it was! I am afraid of heights and wasn't at all sure how I'd cope with the climb but I thoroughly enjoyed it in spite of a few slightly anxious moments. I had a real sense of achievement at having conquered my fear of heights. My husband and son, who is 13 percent loved the climb too. Our guide, Alex, was lovely, he was funny and knowledgeable and quickly put me at ease. I would highly recommend bridge climb, it's something fun for the whole family.

Bucket List - Tick!. What an amazing climb, awesome tour guide & a view to die for. We were held up by a jumper/protester on the bridge for the first time in 18 years - we were kept informed during the whole process & luckily continued on to an amazing climb.

What a view. I go over the bridge every day on route to work. Never get over it.. Wonderful views. Definitely recommend walking over the bridge with your camera..In relation to the bridge climb I don't think it's worth it.. For a great view go up the Shangri-la hotel and enjoy the view from the bar on the top floor.

Amazing during Vivid. I visited during Vivid and the bridge was beautifully lit up with lightening, from the opera house across, you could see the beautiful lights and the cruise ships going in and out of the harbor.. beautiful experience.

Vivid dance on Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. wow it started off feeling very scary and then i have to say it was more than spectacular.I cannot fault the process and the staff are very amazing. The staff are what makes it all worth the climb. They take the fear out of you and also show you some famous sites. I have to say from below this looks boring but I think everyone needs to do this climb. Its shows your great views of Sydney and puts it in a league of tours you can't get bored with .
Best view of Sydney. Best view of Sydney. Can do it with Opera house and Sydney harbor. I didn't do the bridge climb. Very nice when Vivid lighting is on.

Iconic bridge across from another icon. The Harbour Bridge is a huge bridge across the Sydney Harbour connecting Sydney to the north end, driving across it is good be sure to pay the toll, walking or biking is definitely doable and if you are feeling brave go and do the BridgeClimb, it’s pricey but the view is spectacular. The lives lost in the construction, the opening, what it meant to Sydney. Watch boats go under the bridge, and the climbers.

This is one amazing Bridge which is useful to the locals but a great attraction for travellers..... What a view!This is one amazing Bridge which is useful to the locals but a great attraction for travellers....Learning the history of the bridge and what men endure to produce such an amazing and useful bridge, made the whole experience so much better.I recommend to see it day and also at night and hopefully it is lit up with a collection of lights to impress you.

Sydney Icon. This is one of the icons of Sydney and is used for all sorts of things at festivals times, this year at the Vivid Festival it was again lit up spectacularly. But come at New Year and it is also truly wonderful with spectacular fireworks. A true icon.

Stunning Views. You don't want to miss this beautiful and iconic structure in Sydney,Australia.The views from the bridge arespectacular and right across is the stunning Opera House.We were so lucky with our friends to take pictureson different angles of the bridge and Opera House.We walked around, nice weather,wonderful feeling.Highly recommended.Hope to be back here in the future.

Walk to the top....at night!!!!. We climbed the bridge and it was an amazing one of a kind experience.....but what made it really special was climbing it at night. To see all of Sydney lit up from so high was an amazing sight to see. Don't be afraid and climb the bridge! Climb it at night for a view you will never forget.

This is a MUST do activity!. Although it is a bit pricey, this is an experience that you have to participate in! The views are stunning and it is pretty amazing to be looking down on huge cruise ships. The ladder sections were the only challenging sections, as they are very steep and very narrow. Sydney's Famous Coathanger. Sydney is a visually spectacular city to visit because of the natural and man-made features which grace the greater city area. The centre-piece is the spectacular harbour which is traversed by the iconic Sydney harbour Bridge. You can walk around or climb the pylons of the bridge and at either end you have glorious harbour view parklands. You can climb the bridge for a unique and unparalleled 360o view . You can walk, cruise or drive under the bridge. You can even wet a fishing line in the harbour beneath it. Our bridge provides the centerpiece for many events such as Vivid, Australia Day and of course New Years Eve. No matter which way you choose to see the bridge ...just do it!

Special views of Sydney Harbour. To capture the amazing harbour views take a walk across the bridge. There are great restaurants on either side of the bridge. At Milsons Point you could enjoy a lovely barramundi at Ripples. Towards the city side pop into The Rocks to experience more of Sydney's rich history. If you are more adventurous you can climb to the top of the bridge for some of Sydney's TOP views!

Great walk along the Bridge . We visit the Rocks and asked for directions to the Sydney Harbour Bridge. It was approximately a 10 minutes walk from the bottom of the bridge.The view and walk across is spectacular.

Breathtaking Beautiful. This bridge is an iconic part of Sydney . If you visit Australia you have to come and see the bridge . We travelled under it by ferry and it was spectacular . You can even climb the bridge for all the daredevils out their .

Best view . This has to verge best bridge I have ever been able to cross, the structure is so wonderful and the view is unbelievable and it is such a nice walk across the bridge and just experience the views and you can get some very nice pictures if you have Chance to go over the bridge.

Unbelievable experience!. This turned out to be one of the most amazing experiences which I did not want to do!! I fear heights but the people who run this prepare you so well that there is no fear at all. It was so professionally organized that there was no moment when one felt alone or vulnerable. The views were spectacular and it was worth the effort. One of the best tourist venues in the world . Without a doubt. If you have a chance to do it take it.....you will not regret it . It is exhilarating and you feel that you have really accomplished something special.

Great historical bridge. It's not big or overly impressive but still retains a sense of history and importance. The Vivid light show on the bridge is highly enjoyable. An icon of Sydney that deserves to be visited.
Best bridge in the world. Simply spectacular to climb it or walk across it for great views of the harbour or of the opera house, if climbing wear warm clothing as very windy up top.

Great Walk!. I have done the Bridgewalk twice and it is absolutely wonderful. Thought I would be scared as I am afraid of heights and have bad knees, but it was no trouble at all. Both times it was a beautiful day though with no strong winds or rain, so that was a blessing. The views are spectacular. Its an icon in Sydney and much loved by everyone. What a fabulous place to visit.

Iconic landmark . As far as bridges go it is not a bad one. It is iconic, instantly recognisable. Great to see, take pictures of. There is a highway that goes straight the middle of it, but a walkway either side. Worth a walk just to say you have done it.

Magnificient is the View Along & Memorable is the Experience on the "The Coathanger". Yes, imagine that, being nicknamed “The Coathanger” because of its arched-based design! This bridge walk ranks high with my walks on the iconic San Francisco’s Golden Gate Bridge, and the San Francisco Bay Bridge. On the day of the walk, we asked a runner where the elusive bridge walk entrance was since we kept walking by what we thought was it. As it turned out, It was tricky, indeed, for lack of proper signage and we did walk by it several times! Once on our way, our frustrations quickly dissipated as we were treated to the view of the busy iconic Sydney Harbour along with the Sydney Opera House. Sharing our walk were runners, bicyclists, power walkers, tourists, and walking commuters (in their suit and briefcase) leaving Sydney’s central business district to the North Shore! This is a must do while in Sydney.

Great Walk. Great easy walk over the Harbour Bridge. Views are spectacular over to the Opera House and beyond over to Manly etc. Looks great with the cruise ships docked at Circular Quay on a sunny day. Well worth the effort

The Views are the Best. We were able to walk the bridge on a beautiful day in June and the views were amazing. We started the walk from The Rocks neighborhood and walked to the other side and back. It took just over a half hour, including stops to take in the scenery and snap photos. There were a lot of runners on the bridge, and quite a few tourists as well.Be sure to stop and talk to the security guard about 1/2 way over the bridge. He had a great sense of humor and cheered on the runners. Such a fun experience and we'd highly recommend it!

IMPOSING STRUCTURE. Massive steel structure which gives a magnificent view on the river. Heavy traffic all the time makes the bridge truly a life line. The dynamic traffic regulation on the bridge is unique.

Amazing views and experience . On our honeymoon we decided to do the bridge climb we choose the sunset tour which was a little more pricey but it was amazing from start to finish the views where spectacular especially when we saw the sun setting we will remember it forever the only negative thing to say is it's very expensive and when you buy photos the are crazy dear but if you go to Sydney you have to do the bridge climb

An Icon. We see it every New Years and it's nice to see it in person. The bay cruise is a good way to get photos and take a good look. We even saw people walking on top of the curved part of the bridge. Not me my hands sweated just thinking about it.
beautiful bridge. a bridge that has a history to learn from beautiful bridge to hang around especially near the water. Can stay to see Opera house as well as ferries go pass the water

Iconic Walk or Train. It gave me a buzz going across the bridge. Of course it's amazing to view it from various vantage points around Sydney (take a public ferry from Circular Quay to anywhere for fabulous views from the harbour), but it was particularly exciting to go across and back to a train, and then, the slower paced and better for photos, walking across. I am not speaking of the highly expensive bridge climb, but the free walk on both sides of the bridge where traffic crosses. Toll free for walking!

Memorable adventure. Climbing the bridge is a must do if holidaying in Sydney. The views of the Opera House and surrounds are magnificent. The tour operator and staff are very professional, courtesy, patient and ensure the safety and well being of all. It is money well spent.
Walk the Bridge.. Walking and running over the Bridge is a great way to start the day. It offers great views and you can follow the Cahill expressway all the way to the Botanic Gardens.

Marvelous architecture. A visit to Sydney is not complete without looking at this landmark. No matter where you view it from, it is amazing. You can even climb it if you want to (organised tour). Try catching it at a special event when it's all lit up

The link between north and south!. I cross the Sydney Harbour Bridge every working day, I travel across by train and I watch out the windows to see the beautiful steel structure, the stone pylons, the deep water so far below, I never tire of the view. Though most people on a commuter train are watching their mobile phones, I feel sorry for them they are missing out on so much. The bridge is a must see. You simply only need to walk across it to feel its strength. If you are not afraid of heights you can climb it, like hundreds do every day of the year. you can take a boat ride beneath it or even just walk under each end. It is a major point of Sydney's New Years Eve Fireworks. Some nights after work in summer, I walk home across it and I feel exhilarated from the height and the size of it. You can even view the harbour from a viewing platform on the south eastern pylon. A visit to Sydney is not complete until you have walked across the Sydney Harbour Bridge.
Harbour walk. You can climb this magnificent Aussie Wonder, well worth it if you are not frightened of heights. The view from the top is magnificent.
Twilight climb. Highly recommended. The price is a little much but it is worth every penny. The views are amazing and unforgettable.
A good walk. Just walk over the bridge along the pedestrian pathway. The bridge climb is too costly and boring.The views at pedestrian level are just as good.

Bridge climb BE BRAVE!. You need to book in advance. When you arrive you will see it is very professionally run. It is in one of the arches under the bridge. It has a large gift shop which is good. First you check in and they tell you what time to meet upstairs. When it's time you sign your disclaimer and get breathalysed. We the all had to introduce ourselves and it turned out that it was mostly Scottish and Americans (plus us Welsh) in our group of 14. The we were given our suits to put on. The lady told us that because of the heat we may want to just wear our underwear underneath. I broke the ice by telling the group that I was not wearing any (it's always good to break the ice when so many of them looked so nervous!) Then we got kitted out with our safety harnesses, with radios, hankies, caps, glasses cords which all clipped on to it. They then get you to have a little practice on a specially made apparatus just to make sure you are okay with it. Then it's straight out onto the bridge. Our guide was called, "BRANDO" and he was awesome. Really knowledgeable and friendly and a great help to those in the group who were nervous. My wife was scared about doing it and had been worrying about it. Brando put her at ease and put her at the front of the group which really helped. The first part is a walk under the bridge which is raised but you are perfectly safe as you are in your harness and it is secured to the rail. You walk for about 50 metres and then go up about 5 flights of steps/ladders and then you are on the structure itself. There are some water fountains along the way and a water spray for your face in a couple of places. The views are spectacular and the stories from Brando were interesting and amusing. My favourite was the one about the guy who cut the ribbon before the official did it on the opening day. He was annoyed because the Royal Family had not been invited! At the end you can get photos on a USB and you get a certificate. Don't panic if you are scared of heights. Once you are on the actual span itself it is quite wide and you will feel safe. Your guide will help you and everybody will be patient. Do not miss out on this experience as it is well worth it.
Walking across the bridge, the best view in the world. Took the family for a simple stroll over the length of our bridge. We all had a great time, and talked about the views for days.
Climb is amazing. Iconic landmark, would recommend the climb if you can afford it, perfectly safe and worth the view! You are hooked on all the way.

This bridge towers over everything. Its an amazing feature to the sydney view and iconic. Accessible in many ways and unique in Australia and excellent bridge improved by its location and the surrounding scenary.
Great view. Enjoyed a walk across the Bridge on sunset to see the Opera House and watch Vivid this year. The walk is easy to do and it is a terrific view of the Harbour.
Bucket List. I have been to Sydney many times. The bridge is such an impressive sight whether it be day or night time. Walking over is a must do at least once.

Stunning views . I have done the bridge climb twice, first time was in the morning starting at 9am which in the warmer months can get rather hot by the time you complete the climb. Second time we did the twilight climb that gets you to the top in the dark, this one will cost you more but can I say the extra money will be well spent.The light show of Sydney will make you stand and stare in amazement, it is not something you can describe to anyone you must do it for yourself.The climb itself requires a reasonable amount of fitness as the narrow walk through and climb can take it's toll.Pricey maybe but an experience second to none!

Beautiful bridge over a beautiful harbour. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is a beautiful bridge overlooking the beautiful iconic Sydney Harbor. The arch itself, spanning the Harbour, is over 1,600' in length, with its high point being 440' above the water. The Bridge carries cars, bicycles, and pedestrians from the Sydney Central Business District to the North Shore.There are two ways you can get above the main deck of the Bridge. The most famous one, is the Bridge Climb, where for somewhere between $200 - $300 U.S. you get a guided climb to the top of the arch. One thing to be aware of, is that you may not bring any photographic device (camera, smartphone, etc.) with you during the climb. This is for safety purposes to make sure you are concentrating on the climb, and not on taking pictures. The second way to get above the Bridge deck, is the lesser known observation deck at the top of the first pylon on the Bridge. It's a little difficult to find the path to the pylon, but well worth the effort. The observation deck is 285' above the water, and provides 360 views of Sydney. The cost is around $10 U.S. Definitely a great way to see the city and harbor.
Scenic from of the city. Walk long the bridge and also take time to climb to the pillars. You will be amazed of the view around.
Iconic must see and do. Heart of the harbour. Everyone should walk over the bridge once in their lifetime. Visit here as much as I can for great atmosphere.

First rate attraction brilliant !!. We did the climb in the morning on a fantastic morning. The guide was friendly, knowledgable and enthusiastic and made for a good tour. The groups are small ours had eight. The views from the top are unbelievable and you get a good understanding of the construction and the challenges faced by the workers.overall a great experience

Sydney Harbour Bridge climb. Definitely worth doing, it is a bit costly but worth it. I am not the most adventuress person and the highs didn't both me. A magnificent view and a really great thing to do.

Beautiful Architecture. As one of Sydney iconic landmark, I have decided to leave a foot prints to mark my visit. For me, it was a unique mega structure and a statement of engineering achievement in this area. Even if you are not fond of engineering, you should be able to appreciate this beautiful architecture.
Great Views. The Harbour Bridge has some of the best views around Sydney.You can do a climb, although we did not as the weather was not the best.

Iconic Sydney specially during vivid. Recommended before leaving Sydney!.. Right now the vivid festival is on until 18th June. Highly recommend catching a ferry and getting closer to the bridge. Can also do a bridge climb, but must book in advance.

AMAZING - especially during vivid. My best friend and I did the bridge climb in June 2016 during vivid and it was one of the best experiences of my entire life. The staff are so funny, friendly and helpful, and they had a dance floor on top of the bridge with music which was brilliant! would definitely do it again!

Picture Postcard Bridge . Yes this is one of the World Famous Structures that one will see in any Australian or Sydney Tourist Guide or Tourists Photographs and you cannot miss this when in Sydney - a bit like going to London & not seeing Big Ben (in Elizabeth Tower) One can travel underneath here by road at the edges or underneath by sea, taking great photos it just snap away from the HarboursideYou can actually walk over the top oft he bridge as well which would be an experience - too high I think for me!!Enjoy

What a sight . When our cruise docked at the Sydney Harbour the sight was overwhelming to see.. On one side of our cruise liner "Dawn Princess" was the Sydney Harbour bridge and in the other the Opera house.. We took a ride over the bridge and go the quay under the bridge to feel the grandeur..

Best View of Sydney. A great experience, if a little expensive.It's not as scarey as you might think. The staff are friendly and professional and safety is paramount.There is no great physical exertion involved and the views from the top must be the best you can get in Sydney
Fantastic. Great experience, would do it again as it is so easy. The staff are very helpful and safety is paramount.
old vintage. its a place you can explore and if you go on train you can also pass through this bridge and experience harbour through same

The Iconic Harbour Bridge. This is one of the most photographed structure in the world. Thank God that i get to travel on it twice daily. I have watched it over multiple seasons and it looks Majestic throughout. This is a must visit spot if you are visiting Sydney. You can climb over the top if you are willing to spend upwards from $100 per head.

Riding a bike or walking through it's just extraordinary. Actually you probably should do both. Because for one side of the bridge you walk and the other one you ride. Both sides are just incredible. You also can go up to the tower on the walk side it has a charge (i don't remember exactly how much) but it's totally worth it. Try to go at the sunset time, the view is breathtaking.

Iconic. A bridge system that puts others to shame.Multiple lanes and a system that works so well but still manages to pay for itself. No real hold-ups despite more traffic than many other bridges.Great design ... and of course, built with British Steel!

A sight to behold. We opted to travel on the regular sidewalk instead of climbing to the top of the bridge. We did witness people doing that and they seemed excited, we were a little scared!! The view of the harbor and the opera house are super, definitely worth taking the trip!!

Pretty!. Nice bridge, we happened to come by during Vivid and the entire bridge lights up at night in different colors. I would've wanted to do the climb but we have our toddler with us and they want 8 and up. Beautiful harbor.

Scenic Harbour Bridge. Went to this area for an afternoon walk.
Scenic and enjoyable, especially from the Circular Quay side so that you can capture a clear picture of the Sydney Harbour Bridge

Iconic Sydney harbour bridge. Lovely view of the Sydney harbour bridge from the rocks. Even better view of the bridge on ferry. It lights up in the night during the Vivid Sydney. Different colours of the rainbow in the night. Picturesque.

Nice, but it's just a bridge. I travel for the purpose of photography, and although this bridge is pleasant it doesn't have the same appeal as Golden Gate, the Bay Bridge, Tower Bridge, or even the Auckland Bridge -- in terms of art. However, it is a staple of the city and worth taking a photo in front of while in Sydney.

Amazing night on top of the Sydney Harbour Bridge. I booked for my daughter and partner to experience the Sydney Harbour Bridge climb during the Vivid festival. OMG! It was absolutely amazing. It took our breath away standing on top of the Sydney Harbour Bridge with all of the City and the Opera House lit up. It was an experience we will never forget.

My visit to Sydney Harbor Bridge.. Not only did I sail underneath but I did the night bridge climb. View is stunning. I wish they had something like this in the US. Amazing bridge and great craftsmanship. I loved climbing the top arch and getting such a great view of the city.

Simply iconic . Love Sydney Harbour Bridge. Every time I cross it I feel renewed. Every time I see it, I feel a sense of hope. I guess it makes me feel like I'm home. Beautiful lit up for Vivid Sydney or off during the day or night... You can't miss it!
Gorgeous. The harbour bridge was lit up with the Vivid lights and had a spectacular show on one of the pylons. Beautiful.
WOW. Look this is a magnificent structure. You can walk under, over and on top or just look from a distance it's up too you regardless you will love it.
Up high. This is great fun and not a scary as it looks . I really enjoyed this and the views are fantastic . Would do it again

Impressive! . Impressive!
Amazing bridge and iconic as a Sydney landmark.
Huge bridge and seen from many locations.
Walking under it and around the harbour is a must for all tourists and then you see the Opera House to complete the picture!

Best view. The Harbour Bridge is spectacular! View it from the city, ferry or my favorite - Kirrabillee side, with the city view surrounding it. I found the best time to view was early morning or sunset. Take a ferry to Luna Park and follow the pathway. You will be amazed

Great Experience!. While in Sydney on tour, my wife and I walked across the Sydney Harbor Bridge one morning. The weather was perfect in April - not too hot nor too cold. The views are well worth the time & energy in doing this walk. Truly a great experience!

To walk a icon. I driven over it for the last 37 years and in May I walked over it, I know its lame but it gave a whole different outlook from the stroll across the bridge. walked from the Rocks to Luna Park and back again. Also to visit the pylon lookout was so interesting and the history of this icon. Oh and I forgot the view from the pylon lookout wow took my breath away. I've done it and maybe do it again. Oh I also added to this venture a Bridge Climb big tick of the bucket list. Pylon lookout had a entry fee. It was well worth it.
Harbour Bridge. We just explored thisbridge and its sorrounding, it was just fantastic experience, it was drizzling but still we enjoyed a lot

Great View from the Top!. If you dont want to do the bridge climb, at least visit the Sydney Harbour Bridge. There is a nice neighborhood called "The Rocks" that has a great view and photo opportunities.I do recommend doing the bridge climb... its worth it!
Must go place in Sydney. Beautiful place to visit both during day time and at nights under lighting, specially when events and fireworkds are happening

The most amazing views of the city. This is a walk in which you will see some of the most amazing views of the Sydney harbour & the views of the opera house. I was luck to see it when it was the "Vivid" festival when it is all lit up at night.

It's a bridge.... I mean how exciting can it really be? Just take photos from the harbour... unless you want to do the bridge walk (which isnt possible in bad weather so plan ahead) there's really no need to get up close.

Top view and history. This is a must for any visitor to the harbour city. Take a walk through the rocks with all the old pubs and head toward the bridge. I would recommend the fee to climb the south-eastern pylon, it is a very small fraction of the cost compared to the bridge climb with very similar views...
Highly impressive structure. You can surely spend a good time observing the great piece of architecture and the boats on the water. The bravehearts can also take a tour to climb on the top.

The Coat Hanger. In typical laconic style this is how the 'Bridge' has been described since it was finished in 1932. It is a Sydney Icon and one of the most recognised Bridges in the World. The family have done the Climb and highly recommend it (I hate heights !) but for me a leisurely stroll over to North Sydney & back on a sunny day is hard to beat. You can also access the Southern Pylon for another viewpoint and Museum . The SHB pretty well dominates the Harbour on its own.

Beautiful old, iconic bridge.. If you ever come to Sydney, you have to take a look at the harbor bridge. You can do bridge climb tours, and there are many restaurants that look over the beautiful harbor.

Excellent view and experience. We walked up through The Rocks onto the bridge. It was a beautiful sunny day, but very windy out on the bridge walk. There are lots of vantage points from the bridge to stop and take pics. We did the pylon walk lookout also which was well worth the money. It details a lot of the history of the bridge on the way up and to take the time to read and look through the historical information is worth it. The view from the top is excellent.

Great experience, very expensive. We did the Express Walk over the Sydney Harbor bridge, lasting just over 2 hours. It was an amazing experience with spectacular views of the harbor and opera house and a very interesting narrative on the history of the bridge and Sydney itself. I am absolutely glad we did it. Having said that, $300 per person (non-refundadable, be careful!) is an exorbitant amount of money to pay. For that kind of money, I would expect a nice tee shirt and a few pics to be able to throw on the mantle at home. Instead you will get a throw-away baseball hat and one pic filled with a bunch of strangers that you climbed the bridge with. While it was a great experience, I would like to see a little more bang for the buck.

Bridge Climb. My wife and I are both Seniors in fair physical shape. We did the Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb and had a blast.It was a little hot in the jump suits that you have to wear but what an experience and What A View!We would recommend this to anyone that wants to enjoy something extraordinary, excelerating and a whiole lot of fun!
Nice scenery place. Just another place to see and take nice pictures. Most transport on land or sea will bypass this bridge as long as you need to cross or get out of the city.

Easy Walk. I didn't have the time to do any of the climbs, but just did a quick walk across the bridge. Easy to find the path to the bridge. There are fences barricading the entire bridge so it's not a great place to take pictures of harbour.
traditional landmark of sydney. good view from everyw ! here ! landmark place must visit! view from madam chair is amazing sepeartes the two sides of city !

Worth while doing. My husband hates heights, so we had never done the Bridge Climb. However, friends gave us a voucher for Christmas, as the wife enjoyed her climb, even though she doesn't like heights either.So we did it, and enjoyed it. My husband had no issues with heights (he doesn't like looking straight down, and you didn't have to do this.) It wasn't too strenuous either. It was a twilight climb, and a lovely view from up the top. It would be nice to have a café up there to enjoy a cuppa after the climb!The only downside (other than the cost) - that unflattering suit you have to wear. Even Oprah couldn't avoid that!

Sydney gets that even major transportation infrastructure can be human friendly!. You can easily walk up onto and across the bridge from the Rocks area. I know that the bridge climb is hugely popular, but walking onto and across the bridge is a great (free!) experience for anyone who doesn't love climbing or heights and it also offers a great experience.

Unique walk!. Some people elect to do the "Bridge Climb" but I walked across the bridge instead. It's a very fun walk - spectacular views - well worth doing. You can take the train back, which I did just for fun. It's "safe" as long as you keep on the pathway. Easy to do - wear good walking shoes, no sandals!

Brilliant up close - get up the pylon for a good view. You can either climb over it for a lot of Money , or for one tenth of the price walk up the pylon and see the whole bridge plus amazing views of the city

Nice View. Joined a half day tour in Sydney, and one of the destinations was the famous Sydney Harbour Bridge. It was not as difficult as I thought when climbing up. The tour guide was nice and the view was stunning. Worth visiting if you are in Sydney.
Sydney Harbour Bridge. Located close to the Opera House. It is picturesque. You can also climb up the bridge at a cost. Walking across is free

Finishing a bucket list for a loved one lost. We climbed at Twilight with Tracy. It was fantastic, she was funny, and so knowledgable. We finished a bucket list for my husband who passed in 2012 from pancreatic cancer. We had so much fun, Tracy really just made the climb. On our travels back home I lost the poster that I had made for my memory wall. I was frantic to get home and contact them. It wasn't until I was able to get back to the states before I could reach out to them. They made a new poster and certificates for me and the topper is...they refuse to let me pay for a new one, AND they are shipping to my home for free in the states. These guys know how to do business, they are the ultimate in professional. The kindness they have shown me and my family are over the top! I cant recommend the Bridge Climb enough. You will not be disappointed.

An absolute must do!. If you are visiting Sydney, you really need to do the Sydney Bridge Climb. I know it may sound scary to people that are afraid of heights, but believe me, you can do it! The views are unmatched, and the experience of being on such an iconic bridge is something you will take with you forever!

nice walk great view. We walked across the bridge and back stopping along the way to check out the view which was spectacular. Not sure why there were three very bored looking security guards? And the $13 charge to climb the towers was off putting and we didnt do it.
1st Walk on the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Very easy for everyone to walk. The other side to view the Syney Habour and the Opera House. It's wonderful.

A nice view. If you go to the north side by train you will have an amazing view from Sydney!!I did it by car too, it,s really large, directions to everywhere but the most confusing is that they drive on the right side!!i suppose that doing the bridge climb is something quiet impressive!!
Spectacular . Spectacular and iconic piece of the scenery of Sydney. We also climbed the bridge ! Great team and great experience notwithstanding my vertigo !!!
Pretty views!. I like to come here at night as the lights makes the bridge look beautiful. Walk along Luna park and on the Olympic park side. Take great photos & selfies.
sydney harbour bridge on a beautiful day. I can definitely recommend the climb .It is a wonderful experience that all Australians should do. Don't just leave it to the tourists.
Takes 4 hours, but the Bridge Climb is worth it all.. There is no better view in Sydney than the view from on top of the bridge, and climbing it is an experience I will never forget.

Bridgeclimb. The views are spectacular and the friends you will meet when on the walk will be lifelong. The cost is worth it as you will not get a better view from an outdoor perspective. At time it can be challenging but it's worth it when you get to the top of the bridge and walk across the top! Love it lots!!

Beautiful sight. The Harbour Bridge sticks out and is impossible to miss while you're visiting Sydney. The dual centrepiece of the harbour along with the Opera House, it is a magnificent feat of engineering and human will. I highly recommend walking across the bridge from the city end and catching a train back from Milsons Point or vice versa.

Famous Coathanger. You've never been to Sydney if you do not walk Sydney Harbour Bridge. This iconic bridge is a must see if you're in Sydney, NSW. My Friday will never be complete if I don't get to run in the bridge. The sunset is beautiful seeing it from the bridge and safety & security is never an issue. Whether you're running in a broad daylight or night time you can be sure of arriving safely at the end of the bridge. Getting off from Milson Point station is the best way to do the Bridge walk all the way to the Circular Quay via Cahill walk. You get to see the best view and good vantage point of the Sydney Opera House.

Like An adoring bride the harbour of Sydney stands and it is crowned with a Tiara "the Harbour Bridge". if I was to describe the the Sydney harbour as anything i would describe it as a Young bride in all her beauty , and atop her head is her crowning glory the Harbour Bridge , You can come to Sydney and see her in full flight and if you visit at night look carefully for the jewelry that sparkles at night from her tiara Sydney Harbour is a Princess The Opera house her Bouquet and her crown the Sydney harbour Bridge

Great experience. As a Sydney sider sometimes you don't really appreciate your own backyard ! Went here as a team building exercise with work and really enjoyed it. Very safety conscious and not as strenuous as I thought. Easy gradual climb to the top. In uneasy with heights but this wasn't to bad but taken by the view Highly reconend

THE COAT HANGER.. Having been on this icon in the early 1960's, I thought it was time to take another walk across it and was even more spectacular than the 60's. Everyone that visits Sydney MUST do the walk. Huge views of the inner harbour. The opera house is stunning from this vantage point.

Iconic landmark. The Sydney harbour bridge is one of the worlds most iconic bridges. It's possible to walk across but my favourite way is to access via the pylons. It allows you the opportunity to take in the phenomenal view for a low admission fee.

Unique attraction but over-priced. The Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb was a great experience. The staff were very friendly and extremely safety conscious. However, as attractions go - and we have been to many - this one was excessively over-priced, which detracted somewhat from the overall experience.
The climb itself is not difficult at all and unless one is quite disabled, accessible for most.
Awesome!. Such a lovely structure, that's so old! Definitely worth doing the Bridge Climb if you have time, day or night.

MAJESTIC BRIDGE. The Sydney Harbour Bridge welcomed us as we drove into the city. The Sydney Opera House with the Harbour Bridge at the background is the best image you can get of this vibrant city.You also have the option to climb to the top of the bridge but that is very expensive.We walked on the bridge at dusk to get a stunning view of the harbour with the Opera House. There is a safe and separate pedestrian walkway on the bridge and we saw many people walking on the bridge.
Great walk and amazing views. The walk across the bridge has great views and the Pylon lookout ($13 for entry) is a great place to look out over Sydney Harbour.

Pylon lookout offers great view of the bridge. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is best viewed one of two ways: the bridge walk or the pylon lookout. As the bridge walk is around $200, we opted for the cheaper $8 option - the pylon lookout. You climb halfway up the pylon then pay the fee to go to the top. We spent a good half an hour at the top taking pictures from all angles.

Vivid lights Sydney harbour Bridge. Beautiful display, Sydney really knows how to put on a good show. All ferries on the waterways was brightly lit and the buildings looked awesome. Great tourist attraction Sydney..well done !!
Iconic Piece of Architecture. What can be said that has not been said already. This and The Opera House are quintessential Sydney. Great to see during fireworks and Vivid.
It's a rip-off. 350 dollars to climb half of an iron bridge? Please stay away! You may cross the bridge walking and pass under it with the ferry and you'll have the same views almost for free!

Not too impressive. I was just looking at it from the opera house side so the perspective was not so great. Also the lighting during that time of the day did not give me a good view so my opinion might be distorted.

The Bridge is Spectacular!. If you marvel at the sight of the Sydney Opera House then a closer look at the Sydney Harbour Bridge gives you another reason that Sydney is on the list of places to visit. We had a closer at the bridge on this visit and actually took a walk on it. We did the walkway under the arch and it was a spectacular experience. At night the bridge gets lit in all kinds of colours that looks amazing especially if you watch from Circular Quay.
Landmark . Another attraction you just need to see to cross off your list. Its exciting to see and take a million photos of!

The Bridge is Gigantic .... Even at a good distance this bridge is huge. I have seen it from multiple angles and it is as much an architectural wonder as the nearby Opera House. I doubt I would take the walking tour as that is a long way up there and I don't care for heights.

a sight to see. standing under the arch on the walkway path was amazing. it's very intimidating once you get up the walkway under the arch. i was very taken aback by how massive it was. don't bother paying for the Pylon Lookout. just wait for the bridge climbers to come down and ask one if they plan on using their free pylon lookout ticket. The bridge is lit up all kinds of colors at night and is best viewed from across the harbour next to the opera house

Stunning view. Always in love with this beautiful Bridge - Sydney Harbour Bridge - perfect time to come and enjoy the view around 4-6 pm (winter) 6-8pm (summer) the bridge turn into magical and see the cruise ship crossing under the bridge .

Take the high or low road over the Bridge. Most people now know about the Bridge Climb experiences as one of the "must do" experiences when visiting Sydney. But, if your budget does not stretch to $200+ to pay for it, you can walk across the Eastern side of the bridge for FREE. Just walk up Argyle Street from the Rocks area and climb the stairs to the walkway which is located on the Eastern or Opera House side of the road and train tracks. The view is still magnificent and the price is right!

A great experience for anyone!. Walk to the bridge from Sydney to the North Sydney area and on your way, you may want to stop at one of the tower with the viewing observatory up at the top. From there you will enjoy the beatiful views of the bay and beyond.Be prepare to take the stairs to the top with several levels to climb, it's a great excercise to get to the top!

Take the climb on the Sydney Harbour Bridge!. I was hesitant to climb the bridge but was so happy I did it!Everyone was very helpful and the climb is not as bad as you expect. The view from up there is fantastic!

Massive!. If you have seen the British equivalent at Newcastle this one is a massive enlargement of this design. It is worth going into the gardens beneath the pillar on the Darling harbour side to appreciate just how massive this structure is. For those more agile than us and without heart conditions etc do the bridge climb. One member of our family reported as a fantastic experience - there is an excellent briefing beforehand and you go up as a group. Along with the Opera House this is one of the great icons of Australia.
Serene!. Its highly recommended to take a walk on this bridge in early morning, just during sun rise. You will have a sight of magical moments.
Amazing Structure. never tire of seeing crossing the Harbour bridge in Sydney, best example of this type of bridge and largest of thus type in the world
Pylon climb is well worth it. . We went up to take photos. Climb isn't too difficult. Cheap enough for $13 for adults and has gorgeous views. Well worth it!!

The middle of Sydney. If you want to see the harbour Bridge, just go to the harbour and you will find her. It is the biggest monument in the harbour and you can take a look at the Bridge from many different places. It is also possible to walk on top of the Bridge, but it is very expensive and you have to sign for it like 3 weeks in advance, so nothing for a one day trip.

Icon of Sydney. It is the icon of Sydney, by history it is nearly 100 years old, a lot of people from all over the world know this bridge or at least have some pictures in their mind about the shape of this bridge, the coat hanger. It connects Sydney CBD with North Shore by crossing Sydney Harbour. This famous structure has more than 1 km total length and nearly 50m total width carrying roads, cycling and pedestrian paths and railway tracks. The north pylon tower is located adjacent to Luna Park, an amusement place, and the south tower close to the Rocks, tourist precinct and historic area of Sydney, and the south pylon containing the tourist lookout. A remarkable and beautiful structure for visitors of Sydney, not only to be crossed by different mode of transports but also for bridge climbing adventurous participants. A lot of awesome photo’s angle for good shots, and to be admired from short or close distances, as well as from ferry cruise underneath.

Iconic structure with great views of the harbor. We walked half-way across the bridge and back at dusk, and were rewarded by spectacular views of the city, including the opera house. (This easy walk is popular with tourists and is not to be confused with a much more strenuous tour of the bridge's superstructure.) Finding the entrance to the walkway was a bit difficult but once located the stairs and walkway are readily accessible. The views from the bridge at night would likely have been equally or more enjoyable. The bridge is old and its pedestrian facilities could use a good cleaning; it remains a not to be missed experience.

Great vistas of Sydney Harbour. Walk over the bridge and have a coffee at either end. Vivid Sydney is on right now, so you can walk to the bridge and take photos in the evening and continue on for a drink or dinner in the Rocks or Opera House Precinct or in Kirribilli. You can also ride a bike over the Western side of the Bridge and look up river to Luna Park, McMahons Point, the western suburbs and the Parramatta River.

Worth a visit & view when in Sydney. Recent trip to Sydney had us traveling across the Sydney Harbour Bridge.I had done this many time previously but the kids had not, so thought oh well, may as well take a drive across.Best to use a GPS navigator though due to the myriad of roads and tunnels that lead onto and off the bridge.Its worth the visit given it is such and iconic symbol of Australia.
Nice Walk. We did not climb to the top and walk with the "crazies". We did walk over the pedestrian bridge and went up to the lookout which was perfect.

A must see but a little bit disappointing . I have lived in aus for 3 years and visited Sydney regularly. This is great to see but having driven over it the first time with its tolls I was a little disappointed. I know it's an icon and has great history. It just wasn't what I thought it to be close up. Still great for selfies and you can take a walk up to top of the bridge at a price(the very top as there is a pedestrian lane on the bridge deck). If visiting best to get on one of the ferries to see a unique perspective of the bridge and opera house. Or get a shot from the opera bar near the opera house at night.

Great view, must see. Sydney Harbour bridge is one of the iconic bridge and a must see. It offers the viewers a beautiful view with some great photography opportunities. There's also a ferry that run from the Sydney harbour and takes you closer and under the bridge and there is also a speed boat ride that you can enjoy which takes you also under the bridge and when you come back you will be all wet due to the speed boat ride.

Amazing structure!. Fabulous by day but even more stunning at night. Unfortunately we missed the fireworks (every Saturday) but that must be quite an experience - try to fit it in with your visit if possible.

A steady climb. The best time to see the harbour bridge is New Year's Eve when it comes a live with the fire works. I was lucky enough to climb the bridge on a sunny calm day, I'm not fond of heights so if you do have a fear I recommend you give it a miss otherwise it's a very easy climb.
A great background for photos. While the Sydney Harbour Bridge doesn't get the treatment that some of the other sights of Sydney gets, it is a great view and works well as a background for photos.

RTW trip. This, together with the Opera house, form the twin iconic features of Sydney. Those of a more adventurous type can walk up and over the span of the bridge on organised tours. (Our daughter did it but we just enjoyed her photos). sitting at an open air restaurant by the opera house with a glass of wine is the best way to appreciate this monument!

Beautiful bridge, great for a nice walk across or Bridge Climb if you're feeling adventurous. The bridge is great to walk across and offers brilliant views over Sydney and the Harbour. If you're feeling adventurous you could do the bridge climb which is a little expensive but really fun and not too tiring, the staff are really friendly too!

Bridge Climb - A Sydney Must Do. The Bridge Climb is a must-do activity for any visit to Sydney. First off, this place has organization down to a science. Better than any tour I have ever experienced. Set up in assembly line fashion, visitors are run through an in depth process that includes pre-tour briefings, medical paperwork review, breathalyzer for each participant and more. Uniforms are issued for each guest including hats and a fleece in case the weather gets too cold. These people are all about SAFETY, SAFETY and SAFETY. From the time you walk outside, you are connected to a ingeniously designed safety cable system. As you walk your safety harness flows with the safety cable. There is no way you can get hurt or fall off. Each guest dons some impressive safety gear and everyone walks through a simulator that includes the ladders and railings before departure. Everything is attached to your suit – they even give you safety straps for your glasses which are also attached to your suit. Everyone wears a headset to hear the tour guide throughout. Our guide Daniel was both a wonderful story teller and a calming voice, especially for a couple of people on the tour who weren't so sure about things as we started out. He smartly monitored folks along the way, especially in the beginning and made sure they were take care of. What was most surprising was how wide the pathway was for the climb. Railings are everywhere and you are constantly connected to the safety cable. You can't bring along a camera, GoPro, watch or anything that could potentially come loose – they even walk you through a metal detector just to make sure you don't have anything that might fall off onto the highway 300’ below. They do take photos for you and the best deal is a USB stick of all your photos - $60 and well worth it. At the end of the tour they give you a custom printed bridge climb certificate along with a group photo. Bottom line is this: the Bridge Climb is a must do for any visit to Sydney. Next time I'm doing the night tour.

on top of the city. I gingerly accepted my partners eager purchase of tickets to do the bridge climb, I am overweight, poor exercise and with a heart condition and diabetes and thought no way I couldn't do that but I did, and did it easy, the staff were excellent and I bounced up compared to some of the younger ones a third my age

Majestic bridge. Sydney's iconic majestic bridge doesn't disappoint. It is a masterpiece and I can understand why the Sydneyians are so proud of it. The view from the bridge are outstanding. Me knowingly there are three ways to enjoy it:1. Cross the bridge walking or walk at least halfway across the bridge. Cost - $0. Time 20-40 minutes depending how much you want to walk. You can use your own camera2. Do the Pylon Lookout, located in the South East pylon of the bridge. There are 200 steps to the top, which is 87 meters above sea level. There are a few exhibits along the way explaining the history and construction of the bridge. Cost - $12. Time about 20-30 minutes. You can use your own camera.3. The bridge walk. Takes you to the underbelly of the bridge and then to the way top. There are a few different versions - the more you pay the higher you get. Undoubtedly a great view. You will have to put in the effort to get to the top and in spite of this they are going to charge you a bundle of money. Cost - $200 and up. Time 1.5 to 3 hours. You can't use your own camera.

Don't just look - walk!. To climb the bridge is a rather expensive pleasure but you can walk along it and enjoy the views of the harbour and feel happy as well)) The bridge is not long, 15-min walk and you will reach the Rocks area - one of the oldest in the city.

Bridge Climb. Booked many months ago for the bridge climb, which was very easy to do online.On the day, the organisation was first class, and all the staff very helpful, with everyone's safety a priority. Our guide, Alex, was very reassuring to those worried about heights and extremely knowledgable about all the statistics regarding the history of the bridge, it's construction and the surrounding area.The day was ideal, cool, sunny and not too breezy and a great experience for all.
May. A marvellous structure. Spanning the harbour in fine style. Old style steel. Great views. Also great views from walking over and it's free

The Bridge walk . This experience has been the highlight of our holiday and completing the feat an achievement in its self was help by the staff at the desk to the main people taking us on the tour , ours a guy called Alex a superb professional who managed to get everyone in a calm easy going mood but ensuring the safety side was all complete and understood by everyone. A fantastic thing to do and a must if you visit sydney.

Sydney's Iconic Coat Hanger. I have viewed this famous Sydney landmark on countless occasions going back to 1969 and in the course of my 36 visits to The Harbour City since.....I usually view both the Bridge and the equally iconic Opera House when on the train at Circular Quay Station. On several occasions, I have either crossed the bridge by car or on a train to / fro North Sydney.I have yet to walk across the Bridge or climb it - one day this will be achieved .....

Bridge climb was amazing!! . Travelled Australia for a month over December/January 2015 and we had prebooked the bridge climb. Definitely worth the money. Had great views of sydney and the harbour. Wouldn't hesitate at doing it again. Only negative is you can't take camera/phone to take pictures however understand reasons why and they do take photos for you.

Fantastic Views and an Easy Walk. We walked across the Sydney Harbour Bridge as a climb would be too strenuous for me (knee issues). The walk one-way was about two miles from the access point to the exit. It was a little difficult finding the access point from the Sydney side and then you had to climb three flights of stairs. I only mention the stairs for those who have trouble with them. The exit also has stairs, but far fewer. The rest is fairly flat. The exit is at a train station which makes it convenient for those who only wish to walk one-way. If you look carefully, there are small wood benches built into the fencing every so often that allow one to rest if needed. That fencing makes it so children would not be able to run into traffic making this a good activity for families. The walkway is ample enough to easily walk 6 abreast so passing others or dealing with oncoming pedestrians is not an issue. If you can navigate the stairs at each end, baby strollers/prams are doable. Please note that there are no bathroom facilities at the Sydney-side entry point; the only one is in the train station on the other side.The fantastic part of the walk is what is in-between the entry and exit point. We had a spectacular view of the harbour, the Opera House, the ferries, the cruise ships and distant shores. Looking down we had a bird's eye view of all sorts of activities. We took our time and savored the view, the sunshine and the breezes. It was a highlight of our trip.
ab fab again. Every time I come to Sydney I come back to see the hanger! Its the 8th wonder of the world (im being silly) and definitely worth the walk to see.
SYDNEY Harbour bridge . This is an icon in Sydney, Australia. A must see for all visitors to the area. Very nice when lit up at night.

A very worthwhile walk across the Bridge,. This is the way to go, if you can't afford the Bridge Climb experience. You can walk from the city to Milson's Point and back if you have the energy, or just walk one way and get the train back from Milson's Point to Wynyard, or Town Hall. Beautiful views al the way.

Same place as the opera house. i seen so many bridges in my life all over the whole wide world. I just don't see anything special about this bridge. Just like the Brooklyn, golden gate, Hong Kong, Shanghai, Macau, key west.

Free walk across with amazing views. We didn't do the bridge climb due to my bad knee, but did a leisurely walk across the bridge, stopping many times for photos, which you cannot take on the bridge climb. When across, we had a quick lunch and took a taxi across the bridge as it began to rain.
Good Solid Bridge. We did the Bridge Climb sampler which is approximately an hour plus. Nice view from the bridge and the bridge is well made - sturdy and strong!!

Sydney Harbour Bridge. Sydney Harbour Bridge is one of the attractions you need to see if you fly into Sydney, we actually drove over the bridge into the city centre, but you get the best view on the ferry going over to Manly where you sail past it, the best time was in the afternoon because on the way back from Manly you get the sun setting behind the bridge itself when you can get some great photo's' you also get a great view from by the Opera House.

Absolutely fantastic!!. I've climbed the Bridge 3 times: middle of the day, twilight and night time. Two of them were with my teenage children as they turned old enough to do the climb. All climbs absolutely wonderful. Very professionally done. Mind boggling views!!

Walk from North Sydney to the CBD. A colleague suggested that I try walking from our North Sydney office to the hotel I was staying in the CBD after work.The walk to get to the base of the bridge wasn't as scenic, but once you are on the bridge, it's an awesome view!!You will have to try to dodge the morning and evening runners who use the bridge more as a running track than anything else.

A sight to see!. When in Sydney one of the favorite attractions is the Harbour Bridge! Observe tourists climbing across the top of the bridge as they overlook the Sydney Harbour. If you like adventure, dare to take the climb, you'll have bragging rights for years to come!

An Iconic Bridge. Together with the Opera House, this has got to be one of the most photographed landmarks in Sydney. The harbour bridge can be viewed from many places and many angles. Among the best views would be from the Opera House and from the deck of a ferry cruising in the harbour. I've enjoyed viewing the bridge in the mornings, afternoons, evenings and at night. Personally, the sunset and night views of the bridge while cruising on a ferry are the best. This is a must visit landmark when in Sydney. A beautiful piece of architecture and a very recognizable landmark.
Climb the Harbour bridge. One of the best experiences of my life recommend to anyone. great value. Not a steep climb it is very gradual and the view on top is exceptional

Moon over Sydney Harbour Bridge. Do you fall in love Walking across the bridge Holding that kiss For what seems an eternityFrom one end to the other Holding your love's handAcross Sydney Harbour BridgeTonight under a full moon

We walked this twice.. Loved this walk. First we took the train and walked from the other end and took lots of photos, which you can do through the barriers. You can go up to an advantage point but it was close being after 5 o'clock. You can climb it ....two different climbs at 4 times a day. You do have to pay for this. Would have loved to have doneit but as we had an elderly person with us, we couldnt leave her on her own for three and a half hours.
Unique experience. this is a unique way to view Sydney harbour, whenever I see pictures of Sydney I do remember this spectacular experience. It is totaly save and anybody can do it. Just be brave.
Nice architecture. This bridge is worth a watch. The best way to see the bridge is from opera house as you can see the whole bridge.
stunning views. Staff very helpful and well trained. Climb can be done by anyone who is mobile and wants a wonderful view of the Sydney harbour and beyond.
Great view from this historic monument. Historik landmark that is accessible on foot. Some good photo opportunities both from the bridge as well as under the bridge and from a distance.

Powerful Landmark. We took the ferry from the Harbour and were able to sail underneath and it was an awesome experience when we reached the bridge. I don't know but we all feel excited to take pictures above us.
It looks powerful and classic to me and gives me cool ambiance!

Great view! . Sydney Harbour bridge is yet another attraction that needs to be seen to believed.
You can spend all day there just admiring the view..
You have the bridge on one side & the opera house on the other side.

You visit Sydney, you walk the bridge.. You visit Sydney, you walk the bridge. We did and it was really great. We had heard stories that there was a charge and you have to book. This is true if you wish to walk the upper span, but at street level is free and open at all times. Go for it!

Walked the bridge. The bridge is a spectacular sight. Especially at night when lit up. Booked to walk the bridge which we did on a very sunny day. Enjoyed every minute of it, from the safety talk, getting kitted up to the actual walk. What a fantastic experience. The views were spectacular. A couple in the group behind us got engaged at the top! All in all well worth doing.
Harbour Bridge. Great to sail under the Harbour Bridge and check it out. Also a good walk to visit the Bridge and check it out underneath as well.

Don't miss it!. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is not to be missed. If you are in Sydney you must do this. Okay, it is expensive, but it is well worth the cost.The organisation there is second to none and they manage the vast numbers of bridge climbers effortlessly and it is clear that safe is a top priority.After you are breathalysed to ensure your sobriety, you are kitted out in all your equipment and given a chance to practice climbing with your safety line before being taken out onto the bridge.The views from the top are awesome and I felt a real sense of achievement when I completed the climb.You cannot take cameras with you (for safety reasons) and I recommend buying the photographic package they offer so you will have some photographic souveniers of your day.
COAT HANGER . There is nothing like a walk over the Sydney Harbour Bridge. ...the views are awesome. .......from North Sydney to the city we meet many people along the way. ..from all over the world.

An icon. I love the Harbour bridge. I've driven, trained, bused, bicycled and run over it countless times. And it is also beautiful to look at from afar. There are guard rails on both sides with a dedicated pedestrian walkway on the left side of the bridge and a dedicated bicycle track on the right. One end of the bridge is Milsons Point, a nice suburb and on the other is the city of Sydney. Both sides are lively and have plenty of food options.

Cool icon. This is an engineering marvel and very cool to look at. You can take a tour and walk up to the top if you feel the need or just walk across the bridge and get some of the best views of Sydney Harbour.

Amazing!. My friends and I travelled up the east coast of Australia in January and while in Sydney we climbed the harbour bridge. For me it was the most memorable thing we did in Oz. The travel agent we booked with failed to give us the time of our climb and when we arrived we had actually missed it, this was not a problem though as the staff were really helpful and promptly fit us in to a climb 45 mins later. Every member of the crew are amazing. The climb takes roughly 3 hours give or take. You fill in a quick form and get breathalysed and then it's off to suit up. As it was hot we were advised to put the jumpsuit on over underwear only. Everything you wear is attached to the jumpsuit you are wearing and you aren't allowed to take any photography equipment up with you, they take professional photos of you while you are up there anyway. You can wear your sunglasses however you must attach them to a lanyard around your neck. You get a pair of headphones so you can hear your group leader during the climb and get to practise climbing some ladders before you set off. The group leader was full of knowledge and gave us information about the history of the bridge and surrounding areas as we climbed. Although some parts are steep you stop regularly to catch your breath (if you are a bit unfit like me!) and admire the view. Reaching the summit was just breathtaking! I would strongly recommend the climb, it was just brilliant and I wouldn't hesitate to do it again.

Sydney's Hanger!!. Every Bit as much a symbol of Sydney as the Opera House....the "Hanger" holds its own as an object of beauty and appeal. I could not muster up the courage to climb to the top....my age alone prevented that anyway...but I wish I could.....it is an adventure in itself...you can't miss it once you hop on over to Circular Quay!!

Sydney Harbour bridge by any other name. Some call it the "coat hanger", but Sydney Harbour Bridge is one of Sydney's landmarks. Of course you can look at it from afar, sail under it, walk under it, walk on it, and also walk over it. Whatever your choice it will be a memorable experience. I challenge you to do all five!

Great views of the harbour. . My girlfriend got us tickets for the bridge climb and I really enjoyed it. One tip, if you have a bad fear of heights (as my girlfriend is) you might have to give this a miss. I thoroughly enjoyed it but she was on edge.

Some might say an eyesore, but it is a marvel of engineering.. Locals debate if it is pretty or ugly, but either way it is amazing to look at and walk across. Visit the South Pylon and learn about how the bridge was constructed, and walk up to the look out. One of the best views of the harbour. Albeit expensive and the bridge walk is also worth doing at least once in your life.
Worth the expense.. A once in a lifetime experience. We did the bridge climb. A great experience with the best view of the city. Guides are great.

Excellent leisurely walk. The bridge looks stunning. I decided to walk across it instead of climbing it due to time constraints. It was excellent. There were security staff manning the bridge at night, so it was very safe. The view of the Opera House was stunning.

Big $$$$$$$'s for a great experience!. Wow! $354 per person for this memorable walk! But it's a definite bucket list event so after you've got your calculator out and worked out how much this company makes per day with some 15 people per walk from early to late hours seven days a week, just shell out the cash and do it!Regrettably Australia's draconian WH & S laws means only ONE PERSON at a time can climb all the ladders at the bottom before the walk even starts. So if you are at the back of the queue you will have a long wait! I guess there's some obscure reason why even two people can't be on the ladders but that's the way it is - enjoy!Great friendly guides, lots of water stops on the way up and even if you're not super fit, you will still manage it OK, up and back in about three hours!At the top? Magnificent on a good day! Dreadful on a dreadful day and you'll want your money back, which won't happen!But for tourists it really is a must!
Icon. just to look at this amazing sculpture! I know it's not a sculpture but it feels like one, it's just magnificent!

Climbed the Harbour Bridge. Beautiful day and you cannot come to Sydney without doing the Bridge climb. It is a unique experience with photos taken en route by the guide to prove you have done it. Great.

Highlight of our trip. We had been planning this trip for almost 2 years and this was the first thing we booked. Pretty expensive but so worth while. An experience we will never forget.
