Our guide was Richard and he was fab! Really knew his stuff and took the time to speak to each of us, get specific photos and even did a mini video for our boys to show at school. He really made the climb. Would recommend getting the photo package as well. Our trip was 9am which was still hot.

Not cheap but -----. What a great experience After going under the bridge on a ferry, driven across in the car ,had to do the bridge walk .Take the twilight walk if you can afford the extra cost, it's well worth the extra cost to see Sydney, on the walk up and down the bridge in the daylight and then the darkness.The guide made everyone comfortable and relaxed.Well informed about the bridge and Sydney history added to the experience .Spent some time in the museum after the climb, to take in some of the history in there.Included in the price was tickets to go to the top of the Pylon Lookout tower, which we used the day after

Walk, ride, or train. Taking in this iconic bridge can be done any old how. It is great to go for a long walk over or step back and check it out from afar. Being underneath it in the rocks is very impressive as well... The bridge climb should be on everybodies bucket list.

One of the must sees. Seen on so many films, it's one great place to go visit. Great for a bit of exercise to. Better for adults than children but I feel you can't go to Sydney without a visit to the bridge, seen the Opera house and take the Manly ferry.

Twilight Bridge Climb--Awesome day & night persective!. We did the twilight climb and found it to be amazing. We had to show up a bit early, around 3:30, the 3 plus hour experience. The location where you meet your guide has lockers for your gear (no watches, wallets, pants allowed). Yep, I said pants. You get a jumper that you'll wear while on the climb and the guides were very direct when they said no pants--just your undergarments and shirt are allowed under your jumper. So, be prepared-- LOLThe climb itself is aweome. Be prepared as the guide will ask for a volunteer to go first. I did and got more time with him than the others...I could ask questions when he wasn't talking to the group making for an enjoyable experience. Their are 3 areas where my fear of heights was tested. Initially, when you walk out you are on a very narrow walkway, with metal grate underneath your feet. You can look through it and see down 100 feet or so. Scary view. The same effect occurs when you've reached the peak of the bridge and cross over the road. You'll be 134 meters in the air, looking straight down at cars, and thinking about how thin the metal is under your feet. Final challenging part is ascending and descending the 4 ladders that are required to summit the bridge. They are straight up and down and really a bit awkward to climb as the rungs of the ladders are very close together. The view is worth everything you go through though! Twilight climbs are the best as you get to see the city, opera house, surroundings during the day as you climb. As the sun sets, you are at the peak and get to see the same sites all lit up. Breathtaking...this has to be the best time to climb!!I would do this again...it really is amazing and one for the bucket list
expensive to clime but a great experience. if you have the spare money defiantly do it but very expensive. shop around for the best price and you will have a blast, great views. BRING YOUR CAMERA

Bridge Climb. Brought my partner a harbour bridge climb for xmas. we did the climb in February, what an experience we had. We took my eldest grandson John who is 12 years of age. We all enjoyed it so much, doing the twilight tour was worth the extra cost. We saw the views from daylight and evening. The views of our harbour were out of this world With a breeze blowing in your face it just added to the excileration. My grandson said me, when we reached the peak "Grandma I am the luckiest boy alive" what better accolade or thank you could I have wished for.

A great experience . A friend and I did the bridge walk and it was great with incredible views and a knowledgeable tour guide. The only down side as it was a little long winded. The tour time is over 3hour which is a little excessive. I would still recommend doing this tour to anyone visiting Sydney though.
Excellent site. Excellent place to visit. Circular quay provides an eye catching view. Lots of cafe's around. Ferry ride gives even a better view. A must visit spot if you are touring Sydney.

Sydney Bridge Climb. What a great experience. Highly organized and professional. My nervous daughter did great - even on a night climb. Day and sunset climbs are more expensive but the night climb was amazingly beautiful. Chilly and windy on top of the bridge. Kate - our climb guide - was professional and well-informed about the bridge and Sydney. Funny and upbeat - a pleasure to climb with. The span itself is the easy part - the ladders were the only "difficult" part but even they aren't hard just steep. You're hooked on a cable the whole time. The briefing and gear makes it a wonderfully stunning and safe adventure. Do it!

Walk the Bridge. We did an enjoyable walk over and back without doing the climb.It's free and absolutely a wonderful. We departed from the Four Seasons which offered easy access through the Rocks.Once on the north side, cross under the bridge and visit the Olympic Pool. Great 1930's architecture along the bay with views of the bridge and the amusement park.Great to do first thing in the morning.

Energetic Walk. You can walk across this bridge on the south side and have excellent views of the harbour. The Bridge is easy to access from both sides and has a wide walking platform that goes across and on the south side the Pylon Lookout is open to climb and explore the museum.

Great tour even better instructor. I was very skeptical about going on this tour. I am very scared of heights, but I kept hearing how amazing the view from the climb is so I decided to go anyway. Our instructor John Poole immediately helped me with my fears and was there the whole time making sure I was ok. During the tour itself he told us interesting historical stories that made the climb memorable and a learning experience. We went at night and were able to see the city lights, it was breathtaking. I highly recommend going if you're in Sydney even if you're terrified of heights!
Beautiful bridge - anchors the harbor. This beautiful bridge appears to anchor the harbor. It's just across from the Opera House and together I think they define Sydney.

Sydney Harbor Bridge Climb. OMG!!! This is a MUST if you are in Sydney, Australia!!! I did it twice!! The view is amazing and the climb is not really that hard.....it's a gradual climb, so you really don't feel it. Worth the money!!! The view of the bridge is amazing in itself---esp. from the Sydney Opera House...but the view of the Opera House from the bridge......AWESOME!! And it's done rain or shine.....

Amazing. Well worth seeing and walking on it. I'm afraid I hadn't got any courage to do the "bridge walk" but I saw a lot of people walking over the top of it. Fantastic piece of engineering, carrying a lot of different transport. Lovely at night and we stayed at a hotel very near the bridge and could look at the cars, trains and people walking on it.

Great Views, But Very Expensive. We had a wonderful time climbing the bridge. The guide was great. Views were the best. I can see why it is such a popular attraction. But be prepared. This tour cost us over $200 each. The picture in a frame was $35 (you are not allowed to take a camera or phone with you). If the weather is poor, you still climb, view or no view. If you can afford to spend the money, and the weather looks good, go ahead. If you are on a budget, I would save the money.

Second time doing the walk and still an incredible experience.. If your scared of heights do yourself a favor and try this one out, it really is not as bad as it looks. The staff are very good, funny, clear, precise in what they teach you but firm as there is obviously a serious side to it.The sunset walk is just spectacular, with the lights of the city twinkling away and the mass of sky with the sun setting is truly memorable. It is expensive but worth every dollar spent.

Iconic landmark. You cannot miss this, it dominates the harbours. Looks fantastic and we drove over it in our car. You can book a walk up to the top of the bridge, we saw some people up there while we were at a cafe on circular quay. Not for us.

A Bucket List? Well, this is a lifetime experience not to be missed.. Millions all over the world want to see it live, whether by day or night. Tourists from all over the world come to Sydney to view it from every angle. Tis probably, together with our Opera House, our most photographed icon, whether on it, under it or over it. Can say I have climbed it (Bridge Climb), have now also walked it from end to end as a senior. What a special time that was, enriched by the pylon experience of walking up inside to visit the harbour Bridge museum and archive. To learn that there were men who had died in the building of it, to read the statistics, history, gave me new respect for this marvellous human feat, still relevant, convenient, used to its utmost even today. Can recommend, encourage anyone, any age, any ability, disability, to walk across at least once. The views amazing.

Don't climb on a rainy day. The harbour bridge is a great sight to see and very beautiful! i had arranged a date with my partner to walk across it and sadly it was raining all day which made it very uncomfortable and not so pleasant. try to walk across on a sunny day, the harbour views are spectacular!

had to do it. We walked from city side & back again taking some pics along the way. For $13 you can go up the 1st tower for a better view. It doesn't take too long to walk over and there is a BWS store to the right and down the hill when you reach the other side.

Iconic Attraction - The Bridge. It the iconic bridge...the ferry ride under the bridge was great. It is an impressive structure and worth a visit, which I did not do. If I make it back to the city, I will visit, but not to the climb, my fear of open height will preclude that option.

Shocked by price of climb. We have been trying to think of other attractions across the world which are as expensive as the Sydney harbour bridge climb. Petronas Towers, the Empire State building, climbing over the O2 arena, are all a fraction of the price. It cost us less to fly to Sydney than it would to climb the bridge! Needless to say, we would have done it had the price been reasonable.

Im a local and this blew my mind. This morning at about 5.45am I caught a train from Central Station to Milsons Point train station and walked back to the city across the bridge. Watching the sun rise over the easter suburbs as the city came to life and the first of the ferries started criss crossing the harbour was stupendous. Even for someone who lives here set the alarm this is a truly magical time of the day to walk the bridge
Stunning!. the harbour bridge is an amazing place. we drove across it to enter the city, then went past it on the tour bus. the fireworks at night were amazing.

Iconic & grand!. No matter how many times you travel across this bridge, it always puts a smile on your face. One of Sydney's most famous residents. A must-see, whilst in Sydney. Drive over it, sail under it, or be adventurous & do the climb!
Spectacular. Simply a spectacular piece of engineering robust with history , amazing part of town , make sure you walk beneath the bridge and admire bones of the structure
Sydney Harbour Bridge. We did not find the Sydney Harbour Bridge to be spectacular in any way. It looks pretty against the night sky, but all lighted things do

Experience a walk ACROSS the Bridge. If you are enjoy history and architecture, this is a very good place to go. It is an easy walk - very flat and costs much less than the Bridge Climb. Also if you are not into the heights this is a way to enjoy the bridge without having to face your fear of heights. Lovely vantage point for taking pictures.
The best things in life are ..... Free. A leisurely walk over the Sydney Harbour Bridge is a great way to view the Sydney Harbour and the Opera House as well as getting some exercise. Great views.

A must to walk across the bridge. Walking across Sydney Harbour Bridge is a must for at least one trip to Sydney. It was overcast with bushfire smoke yesterday, however even in those conditions, it was great to walk the eastern side of the bridge; watch the ferries, consider views to Opera House, Government House, Gardens, Kirribilli house and Watch Tall Ship come in. Have walked it in past on bright sunny days and even better then. Would also recommend the pylon climb, which we didn't do yesterday due to overcast skies, but would recommend that on a more clear and sunny day.

This is so fun and interesting. Many people do the Bridge Climb, but a cool thing to do is to go up the Eastern Pylon to the Bridge Museum - if you are into history and architechure, this is a very good place to go and costs less than the drama of the climb.

One of the best spots for a picturesque view of the Sydney harbour. I would recommend doing the walk from The Rocks to Milsons point at least once on your visit or stay in Sydney. It is also one of the best spots to take photos of the Vivid event during May and June.

Great scenery. I went up to a the Pylon lookout on a sunny day. I can only say that it was amazing. You get a good look at the city skyline and every corner of it gives a breathtaking view. On the top of that, until you reach the look out point there is a museum kind of deal happening inside so in the same time you can learn a lot about the bridge. Note this is not the same as the bridge climb.
Sydney is not Sydney without the bridge and the opera . Great structure and even you can walk it for free. Popular jogging place for the locals and tourists alike.
Beautifull place. If you go wedding or honeymoon, come here.Can working some kilometers at sunset.You should be here.
You can't visit Sydney without exploring this part of the world.. Jump on a ferry and get some great photos. Do the bridge climb. Circular quay is a busy place both day and night.

Amazing Experience. We have climbed the Harbour Bridge, walked across it and driven over it many times and it never ceases to amaze us.It's quite expensive to do the bridge climb experience, but it's worth it, to experience the exhilaration of walking to the top is amazing. It's totally safe and the guide shares their knowledge of not just the bridge and it's history, but that of Sydney too.Whilst it may not be the biggest or longest bridge in the world, there is just something about the Harbour bridge that makes it so special.

fantastic. The Sydney Harbour Bridge was a great experience, to be walking over it was mind blowing, it is expensive but worth every penny and the guides were very informative and kept us smiling all the way, my husband hates heights so was conquering his fear which he did with flying colours!

Top Bridge Climb!. We decided to do the bridge climb in case it takes another twenty years until we return to Sydney. With great expectations we weren't disappointed.After some safety instructions and ladder climbing practice we were off onto the bridge.There was a couple of ladders but the actual curve of the bridge wasn't that difficult to climb.The views were awesome.We did a twilight tour a got to see a beautiful sunset. Our guide Tilly was very knowledgable and we felt very safe.Only downside you can't take your own cameras (safety reasons) and have to purchase photos taken by our guide from Bridgeclimb Co.

Thrilling experience to walk over the bridge and Triple thrill to climb it by ropes. We choose to climb the bridge by staircase and it was a super-thrilling experience. There is a separate pathway to walk over the bridge. Unfortunately couldn't opt for climbing it through ropes, but I must say it should be breath-taking experience.

Loved every second. Loved it. Well planned and well run. Great staff with interesting facts. Climb was exerting but not overly difficult. Time to look around and enjoy. Great feeling on accomplishment after!
A must visit!!!. This massive bridge stands as a trademark for Sydney. Surely it is very beautiful piece of architecture. A must visit for anybody visiting Sydney.

Best Freebie in Sydney. The Sydney Harbor Bridge has to be one of the most photographed sights in the world. Besides the view you can walk and climb the bridge. The climb is very expensive and you need stamina to do it. We were observing the bridge from the opera house one day and it started raining and got very windy, and there was a tour of 10-12 people at the summit of the arch. I am sure it was not pleasant so if you do the climb make sure you are up for it and the weather is good. I believe the cost is about $160, and higher for longer and higher climbs. The better way, in my estimation, and free is to walk over the bridge. Although there are stairs to initially get on the bridge, it is a flat straight walk across. Since you must eventually get back I suggest you take the metro to Milsons Point stop, which is on the other side of the harbor, and walk the bridge back to The Rocks. The sights are spectacular. Hope you enjoy it as much as we did.

Pricey but worth it for the views. Visited from the UK.The guide was a really cool and witty guy. We were a small group and he made it a great run.The climb itself isn't very physically demanding (just up and down some ladders is as hard as it gets).The views make the whole thing worthwhile but be prepared to pay some £££!

Great views and exercise too!. Although we did not walk on TOP of the bridge we did walk across it. It was a beautiful day and the bridge is amazing. It is a bit of a walk and the stairs leading up to it keep your heart rate up, but I would definitely recommend it!

Morning walk back to Sydney. We had taken the ferry/walked to Kirribilli (highly recommend) and then returned by walking over the bridge. The views were spectacular (in my opinion better than the bridge climb as the city is prettier closer to eye level than from above), and the sun was behind us. HIghly recommend.

Helps to make Sydney Harbour what it is.. No I did not climb the bridge - probably amazing but very expensive.I did see the bridge from many angles though:From Circular Key, from the rocks, from Bangaroo and from the harbour on a ferry. It truly helps to make the Harbour amazing. We also took the time to walk across and around the bridge. Some fantastic views from on the bridge. We also paid to climb the Pilon and see the view from the top. Cannot remember the price <$20. This was worth it as there is also exhibits that tells you about the history, engineering and construction of the bridge.

You can't miss this structure at Sydney Harbor.. During our April 2016 visit to Australia we spent several days in Sydney. Most of this time was concentrated along the harbor area and you can't miss seeing the Bridge from there.There is a private hike over the top of the bridge but my wife and I decided to just take the regular walk. We really enjoy spending those special times experiencing things ourselves just her and I. There are breathtaking views from that elevation of the harbor area below. Starting from the Rocks district below we ended our journey near an Amusement park on the other side. A great way to spend a couple hours of your day.

A highlight of our trip. Yes it is expensive, but is definitely worth it if you can afford it. We were on honeymoon in Australia so decided to climb the bridge to signify the occasion.The climb takes about 3.5 hours in total, but this includes the pre climb chat and preparation. The climb itself is not as physically taxing as you would expect. There are some ladder sections which can be tricky (especially as the train line runs alongside you!) but the main part of the climb is a gradual incline, giving you plenty of opportunities to appreciate the view, and the climb you've completed. The view is spectacular. You can see over to Bondi and even the blue mountains on a clear day.We had a great guide who told us about the history of the bridge during the climb, and answered all the questions we had on the way.The price includes a group photo, but we paid in advance for a USB of pictures, this seemed to be the best value. Our guide made sure he took plenty of pictures of us during the climb so that we had plenty to choose from when we returned.Would definitely recommend this!!
What a recommendation for British Steel. Walked over the bridge and climbed the tower for an amazing view over the harbour. Walked under the bridge on an evening stroll and that was impressive too.

Mardis Gras Climb. WOW!!! I wasn't particularly interested in doing the bridge climb but a friend wanted to tick it off her bucket list. I am so glad I agreed. The staff were all great and the group we went with really made the climb special. We did the Mardis Gras climb of the Friday night and it was amazing. The views were spectacular and we sang karaoke at the very top of the bridge wearing costume hats. It is an incredible experience and well worth doing.

Bridge is appreciated best when you know the history. When it opened in 1932, it was the greatest engineering masterpiece of its time. It was the longest single span of 160' wide of steel arch bridge (1664') in the world. This is a time when reinforced steel was in its infancy. Now it ranks 6th in the world for its span. Be prepared to walk up 200 steps to enjoy one of the best views in Sydney from the top. It's also interesting to by water and see it from underneath.

The other iconic structure in lovely Sydney!. Another icon you won't miss because it is right beyond the Opera House. This also gets many many photos. We did not, but some people choose to do the walk across the top. They do that as a small group tour.
Great visual. Always feel a mix of happy & sad when I see the bridge. Such an icon. Doing the bridge climb is on my bucket list

Climb to Remember. Wow, what a great experience with a view at the top that is beautiful!! Not as physically taxing as one anticipates before the climb, it is a gradual incline as you get to the top of the bridge. The vertical ladders are more tricky if a person should have a problem with such things, but overall a great experience. The guide was amazing and very humorous and kept everyone informed the whole time of local interesting facts and the history about the bridge as well as of Sydney itself. Not for kids or the infirm.

Breathtaking views from the top!. We where taken up the viewing tower rather than the Bridge walk which is a complete rip off if you ask me! The views from the top were stunning and once you have paid to go up, you are welcome to spend as long as you like up there! Would recommend on a clear day, but the pictures from up there are much better than pictures you take on ground level.

Climb up to the top of this iconic structure for a breathtaking view of the best harbour in the world. My wife and I did the bridge climb last year. Half way through the tour it poured rain and the wind saw it rain upwards. I have it to say that even under these conditions it was one of the most enjoyable nights of my life. we even got treated to a private fireworks display from near the opera house. A must do for any tourist or Australian for that matter.

Stunning Iconic Landmark!. Every time I come to Sydney, seeing the Harbour Bridge still makes my heart skip a beat! It's so iconic around the world, seeing it first hand, is always a pleasure. It's a bit of a walk out of the city, but if you want to walk across it, it is well worth it and will take about 15-20mins each way. A few years ago, I did the Bridge Climb and although it may be quite expensive, it is definitely money well spent. You learn so much about the Bridge and the view, of course, is stunning! Don't worry if you're scared of heights as you don't really have that feeling of being so high up as you don't look over the edge. The only time is at the very peak when you cross from one side to the other and walk across the walkway above the traffic lanes on the Bridge and that can be a little scary but just look up if you're nervous!

Bridge climb. We barely made it to our assigned climb time after landing from Cairns. With 5 minutes to spare we joined our group, got suited up and instructed on what to expect during the bridge climb. With so little time to get acclimated to the metropolitan area after leaving the tropical coast, it was pure adrenaline to walk out of the tunnel and experience the opera house, the Rocks and Circular Quay all at a glance. Our guide, Chris, was excellent. He made everyone feel relaxed and gave a good history of the bridge as we continued our climb. I have trouble with heights in certain situations and thought this may be one of them. Chris made it all good.We stopped several times to have a picture taken and spent a good amount of time getting to take in the views as the sun began to set.What a wonderful introduction to a great city and a fun part of our travels.

Bridge Walk. This is our fourth or fifth visit to Sydney and I have wanted to walk over the top buthe fee has discouraged me from doing it but we did walk over the bridge and were able to get wonderful views of some of the city's most beautiful sites, i.e. The Opera House and it is excellent exercise. You need a suuny day to make it worthwhile.

Great attraction!. When you get to Sydney always make sure that you go to see Sydney Harbour and then of course you'll see the bridge too! What a view and turn to your right to see the Opera House. Enjoy!
Famous but avg if you've seen many bridges. Well the $150 price tag to climb is a huge put off. The structure of the bridge is hard to appreciate if you've seen other famous bridges around the world.
Oh What a view!!!. Decided against the Bridge walk just walked a portion of it ourselves due to the humidity. Still great views all round.

Amazing bridge climbing at Harbour Bridge. To be able to climb the beautiful Harbour Bridge in Sydney was fantastic. The views are awesome!! The tour is not difficult and you don't need to be an athlete to do it. Our guide Adam B was funny, informative and had a air of calmness around him. He made it enjoyable will all the funny jokes. Yes it is expensive, but well worth the money, a true memory!
A must do. Travelling to Sydney MUST include a ferry ride under the bridge :-) Such a magnificent structure. Try to get over to Balmain and sit on the foreshore for the best view in Sydney.

You Don't Need To Do The Bridge Climb To See The Sights But Need To Walk The Bridge To Take Pictures. Save your money, don't bother with the Bridge Climb. While walking the bridge and or touring the Bridge Pylon is not as dramatic as the Climb, you can see the same sights and unlike the Climb you can take pictures of them. The walk provides a great view of the harbor, the Opera House the neighborhood on each side and he various ships and boats sailing through.

Even better at night. Gorgeous bridge!
Better viewed at night from the Sydney harbor or another venue with a view of the bridge, up close you don't really get the full effect.
A fantastic structure.. As well as looking fantastic from anywhere around the Harbour it is well worth the climb which is not as daunting as it might appear. It will be a memory you will always have.
So beautiful .... This iconic bridge is spectacular in size and scope. I might have done the bridge climb if I had more time.

Sydney Harbour Bridge. A beatifull bridge, one of the famous sites in Sydney and great to see. Also visable from so many different sites wich gives one an endless number of different perspectives. A spot not to be missed.

Bridge ahead of its time. This bridge was built in 1932 and the six lanes were completely unnecessary at the time but the designers were smart and knew the growth would require it. Today they squeeze 8 lanes, a train line, a walking path, and a bike lane on this amazing bridge. I did the bridge climb to the top and was happy to see and learn more about this amazing place.

A once in a lifetime way to finish a visit down under. I went here on my last day in Sydney, having been visiting a friend who was working there from the UK. We did the twilight tour and I would recommend it to anyone. A truly iconic harbour, with views you can't see anywhere else. Cheerful and informative guides who put the group at ease. Just go.

Walked from milsons point to the rocks.. We had seen people walking across the bridge and thought we'd do the same. Caught the train to milsons point and walked back to the city. Great views and a surprisingly quick walk. About 20 mins across allowing for photo stops. Great way to see the harbour and get fresh air and exercise at the same time.

Glad i did it. We enjoyed the climb unfortunately it rained when we got to the top but no regrets the guide did a great job and kept us occupied as we moved up the bridge, not sure I would recommend for someone scared of heights though my partner did it and he is scared

Cycle over the bridge. You might not know that there is a dedicated, separated and safe cycle lane over the bridge and this is a very inexpensive and spectacular way to see the harbour. Hire a bike from Sydney Bike Tours, 12 Playfair Lane The Rocks. They give you free maps, the hire rate is very reasonable, and you can hire for a half day or full day. Helmet and bike lock included. The staff are very friendly and they let me return my bike at night after they were closed.

The Bridge Climb. We are both in our 70's but managed to do the bridge climb with no problems. Once in a lifetime chance to see Sydney from atop of the bridge. Not to be missed (If you're having lunch first, forget the wine with lunch, you'll be breath tested before the climb)

Amazing Views And Easy To Navigate. Be sure and pick a good weather day as this will make or break your experience. We did the 3hour climb with my with who is afraid of heights and had a fantastic time. The guides are very patient and provide a sense of complete security. I never felt at danger or as I we were taking any major risk. Very enjoyable!

Climb this for unforgettable experience. We climbed the bridge during twilight hours which is amazing because we get to enjoy the day, sunset, and night time of the bridge. It is pricey but is super worth it. At night, it gets very cold so they provide fleece jackets. The harness is very safe so I didn't get scared at all. The guide is informative and very funny too.

Should be on everyone's bucket list.. My wife and I and friends still are talking about one of the most exciting things we have ever done. There is no other place we know of where you walk ON TOP of THE Bridge. Plan ahead and do it at sunset. It was spectacular. Our guide was awesome and safety is number one. Even with a hip replacement, my wife had no trouble with the climb. Do it and ENJOY. Please don't tell anyone... I think it was easier for her than me :-)

Fun - even in the cold rain. I convinced my parents to do this climb with me and it was wonderful. The staff was wonderful in getting us geared up to do the climb, and despite the pouring rain, we did it. It is well worth the effort and the cost, but no cameras allowed so you have to buy their pics. Still glad to say I've done it and it includes a pass to climb the pylon if you have the chance. I did the pylon climb the next day and got great pictures. Highly recommend.
Favourite Icon of Australia . Words cannot describe how amazing the bridge is. Whether you walk over it, drive over it or just look at its the most amazing icon. Absolutely love it.

THE walk with THE best view. This is the best walk to work in the world, done by 100's each week. It is also the best tourist trick in the book. Yes, you can walk over the bridge, it's gorgeous, but it's expensive, particularly if you are a family. So join the locals and walk across the bridge, it costs nothing.At the Kirribilli end there are plenty of great Cafes to enjoy, or just take in the view of the Opera House. At the city end of the walk you can pay (but not much) to climb the Pylon where you get the same view as the Bridgeclimb, and it throws in the history of the bridge itself. My go to trip for visitors.

Walk over Sydney Bridge. I would recommend that anyone visiting Sydney takes the opportunity to walk over Sydney bridge. Safety is paramount to the organisers who prepare you well & provide suitable clothing and safety equipment for the walk. I admit to a little apprehension about the prospect of looking down through the walkway, only to find that the foot plates on which you walk are solid. The bridge climb is not testing unless you have health issues & the views from the bridge are unrestricted. The whole experience was enjoyable with no concern for safety. If you get the chance...do it...it's a bucket list experience not to be missed.

Stunning views. Most day's while staying in Kirribilli. we walked across the Barbour bridge to the rocks, and had a cup of coffee or a drink, and strolled back across the bridge, a walk of about 20mins, it has to be one of the most stunning walks you would take anywhere in the world, on one side you have a majestic view of the Harbour and the Sydney Opera house, and on the other there is a great overhead view of Lunar Park, for something that does not cost anything to walk across it is a trip not to be missed.
A Must See!. The harbour bridge is a must see. We took a walk across which gave some great views. The Bridgeclimb was well worth doing and is a once in a life time experience.

See From The Other Side. I suspect that most visitors to Sydney only see the magnificent Sydney Harbour Bridge from the Circular Quay harbor-Opera House/East side, or on the top walk over. This has been the case with me on my 3 prior visits over many years. This trip I made a point of walking under the Bridge in the north Rocks, into the Miller Point community up to the Sydney Observatory. Not only are these places very interesting to see but the photo/viewing ops of the Bridge are spectacular.

We did a free walk on the bridge!. There are several articles and tours highlighting the famous bridge climb but the climb is quite expensive (more than 200 AUD per person). There is a public access to the bridge from The Rocks and this is not visible. Ask around in The Rocks for the access to the bridge and you can walk across the bridge for free. I am sure, the bridge climb would be exciting but to us, it was not value for money. Once across the bridge we took a ferry from Luna Park to Sydney harbour

very photographic. We did not do the bridge climb as a corporate group had booked the bridge for a solid week and took over darling harbor as well. There are so many places you can get great views/pic of the bridge from the land and from the ferries. The pylon is great as well, but there is a cost. It is worth seeing.
Spectacular. Loved this bridge, I know its just a bridge but it looks lovely. Some of our party did the bridge climb and had the photos to prove it! They thoroughly enjoyed it.

Its Iconic. For the average person the best way to experience the bridge personally is to walkover it. We took the Ferry over to Luna Park stop and then walked under and around teh bridge piers to get on the northern side of the bridge. Then walk back toward the Central Business District. Stop part way and climb the pylon for a great museum on the building of the bridge.Then pay the entrance fee to walk up to the top and the viewing platform for great views over the bay and down on to the Opera House. The climb up is quite easy as there are many landings and exhibits to break up the ascent.
Iconic . Most iconic bridge Australia. Do the bridge climb. It's amazing from all angles especially the opera bad deck. Enjoy lunch at the opera bar and take in both icons
Climbing and walking across. I had the time to climb and walk across the Sydney harbor bridge on two separate days. The experience will last a lifetime!
Walk. Come and take a walk over the bridge with the kids such an experience the kids never will forget. My parents have taken me many of times and I still go 30 years later .

A wonderful walk across a wonderful bridge. We did not opt for the " Climb the Bridge Tour" but instead we walked across the pedestrian sidewalk that crosses the bridge. What a great experience that offers wonderful views of the Harbour, the Opera House and the surrounding area.

Photography tour. I thought we were climbing a bridge. I could not figure out how the trip could possibly take 3 1/2 hours. I found out that you actually going up to pose for pictures. There are six different posing platforms. There is only on view of the opera house. So figure four groups are on the bridge at a time with about 15 per group. You are not allowed your own cameras, so the tour guide must take each picture. So essentially the 3 1/2 hours is standing around while 360 individual and 24 group shots are taken. Repeat, there is only on view of the opera house. The guides are also well trained bridge climbers. They are not photographers. I would still do this event, but be ready for a grind. I think this compny lost their way. Its about climbing the bridge not hawking overpriced, paper form only photos, unless of course you buy all your pictures for an outlandish $60. Oh did I mention that there is only one view of the oprea house.

Take the time to det accross the bridge. If you go to sydney you gotta come here there is no way around when it comes to take a stroll. if you have money climb up to the top otherwise you will always regret

Awesome Bridge!. This is Sydney's Iconic masterpiece. Definitely a must see in day and night. This is the worlds largest steel arch bridge, commonly known to the locals as the "Coathanger" You can also climb this bridge for adrenaline enthusiasts for a cost.

I was really scared. After going through the orientation (putting on the climb suit) breatherlizer, etc. I still wasn't sure the height factor was going to work. I spoke to our tour leader, Matt, and he promised he would take care of me. The 3 ladders of 12 steps, was the worst, but Matt made sure I was ok, and he did take care of me. This was truly an amazing experience. I celebrated my 73rd birthday on top of the Sydney bridge and I am so happy I did it!

Free walk across the bridge. We caught the train to Milson's Point using our Opal Cards and walked back. Absolutely amazing and a must do for a trip to Sydney. Got the best photos from the top of the bridge and its FREE

Unique sight above the Sydney Opera House from Harbour Bridge. The Bridge Climb was a bit challenging (at 74) but very gratifying from several 'points of view!' (Pun intended).The weather was perfect, the tour group we accompanied was friendly and engaging and the guides covered the history and related events of the bridge with knowledge and enthusiasm, not to mention an occasional sense of humor! Well worth the dollars.

Walked the bridge. During our visit to Sydney we walked the Sydney bridge. It really is something you should consider doing if you visit Sydney. The walk on the bridge gives you fantastic views all around Sydney. The staff were great as was our tour guide. The history of the bridge is very interesting. While on the bridge you have serveral a pictures taken and also an 8 second video from the top which gets emailed to you for free. We purchased all the photos. Had a great clear day and could see for miles. This is a must if you visit Sydney, it's all safe and secure your strapped onto a guideline. You will thoroughly enjoy it.

Must see must do and it is (mostly) for free. A jog across the Sydney Harbour Bridge and back should be on anybodies bucket list. At midpoint you should stop and rest against the railing. Noticing how much this thing moves will creep you out. I almost got seasick. Loved every moment.
breathtaking. Sit by the Harbour and take in this iconic Sydney site or do a Bridge climb, Not for the fainthearted.

Iconic. I can still sit and gaze at this bridge for hours. The harbour is just beautiful. You can walk across it and get some great pics of the Opera house. Sunscreen up though the reflection off the water is a killer on a beautiful day!!

Glorious piece of architectural engineering!. I have an affinity with the old " coat hanger", my school was nearby and we saw her every day as teenagers.As an adult I lived in the place where the granite for her pylons was quarried. Moruya NSW.The engineer Dr Bradfield was an Englishman, as was my Dad & I was in Bradfield House at school!Last year we had the opportunity to cruise out of Sydney, a wonderful sight & experience.Though I have never done the bridge climb, I have walked across the bridge & also climbed the pylons.An excellent place to visit!

The Icon of Sydney. We walked up the steps from Circular Quay and Argyle Street. Steep climb up but we took our time.You walk across the bridge on the Opera House side so plenty of photo opportunities.Walking off the bridge on the far side there are a grouo of shops and restaurants immediately opposute the steps......and a very good icecream parlour.We walked down to the area below the towers, agaun great views and photo opportunities, and then a short walk to Luna Park and a ferry back. A must do and cheap as chips.....even ghe ice cream was cheap...doubke scoop $7.

ABSOLUTELY A MUST WHEN IN SYDNEY. Very easy walk across the bridge, anyone can do this. Very well organised, safety plus and all clothing and footwear provided. Was pleasantly surprised at the incredible views as we chose Australia Day to do this tour which was even more spectacular. Our guide was excellent, she took lots of photos and then we purchased the pen drive afterwards. There are even water fountains on the bridge so for anyone worried about their fitness level this was a very easy and manageable activity to achieve and they even had a photo of a 100 year old lady that did it.

Worth a visit. This icon Sydney wonder is a must see. Walking across the harbour is amazing, watching the boats and enjoying the views as you go. Once you get to North Sydney stop and enjoy a coffee and one of the many cafes.
walked harbour bridge. enjoyed walking harbour bridge in excellent weather...only walked one way, home by train. opal card great innovation
last week. check out the museum in the south east pylon lookout. It is an inexpensive way to experience the bridge
Amazing. Such an amazing picture perfect bridge in Sydney. You can't miss it if you are there to see the opera house.

A work of art. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is spectacular.....a must see when in Sydney. We didn't climb the bridge, but walked across it. The view from the bridge is unsurpassable. A must if you are visiting Sydney.

Run like a Disney ride- organized very well. We climbed the Sydney bridge in the rain. They are extremely organized and move you through each room, provide all possible rain gear (except shoes) you could need and have very friendly staff. Tour was great and they get great photos on top of the bridge.

Easy walk across the bridge and spectacular views. Easy walk across the bridge and spectacular views. If need be, you can catch a train back from the other side. On a beautiful day the harbour is amazing.

Birthday. Its an ivin of australia hoe can you noot live it i have walkedon it and it was an anazing feelinh would donit all over again so cabt wait for that day to come...if you get a chance go do it..even if you are scared of heights just do it

Loved the Sydney bridge climb. We did the bridge climb at sunset. We went up in daylight and were at the top as the sunset. We then came down in the dark. The view from the top was amazing and the whole climb was very safe. This is a must do for visitors to Sydney. There is no better way to see the Opera house. Loved it

a very high place. this is one point that you have to see -- you see it from the opera house, but if you want to climb to the top, you have to get up close and personal. It is high! Too high for me, I didn't climb it and I will probably regret it the rest of my life. Crocodile Dunn Dee painted the bridge before his movie - just one interesting fact.

Best view of harbor in town. we did not do the climb over the top of the bridge, we did hike across it and went in the museum in the Pylon, It was like visiting the top of the Empire State Building with out a long line. This is a must, when in Sydney.

Excellent view. I'm not really sure how many miles altogether but I must say I was knackered when I finished walking it. (I started from Darling Harbour, must be the reason). If you don't mind walking, please go for it. You can spot very beautiful views of Sydney atop of the bridge (ahoy, photographers!). As it was raining, I didn't do the return trip by walking. Instead, I took the train from Milsons Point Station back to the other side. Do not worry if you're alone, I encountered 2 guards along the way and they were extremely helpful.

Amazing thing to do. We decided on a night climb up Sydney Harbour bridge what an experience, the guide was exceptional in his knowledge, safety was most important feature, not fond of heights but the views were out of this world and we felt very safe. We reached the top and had a photo taken, it's very hard to believe at nearly 70 year old I can cross this off my bucket list.

Harbour Bridge Visit. Harbour bridge visit you can walk up to other side of the North Sydney if you walk from CBD. Looking around 20 min walk for a 5"3 intch girl, browse n walk, once you get to the mid of the bridge there is a little library that you could walk in n visit. It's about history of how the bridge mad from n some spec about the bridge and the year of it of course. Bridge is very safe but just windy depends on what weather u hop on. There is bridge climb you will need to access from side of the bridge via backside of the rocks you may park your car there or there is a secure park close by. If you travel by train you may gtt off from " circular quay " n walk about 10 min from station.

Once in a lifetime . The highlight of our trip to Sydney was the Bridge Climb. Book the twilight tour. We checked in at 3:30. By the time we suited up and went through the safety checks it was starting to get dark. We watched the sunset at the very top of the bridge. As we descended the lights of Sydney became brighter and twinkled. It was dark as we climbed down the last set of stairs and we turned on our head lamps. The views are spectacular. This is a pricey activity but a must when you visit Sydney. It's a once in a lifetime experience....or maybe I'll do it again on my next visit to Sydney.

Must do in Sydney. Walked over the bridge again tonight as the sun was setting. What a spectacular view, I never tire of it. The stairs at either end can be steep if you aren't fit but well worth the climb. At the city end you can continue on to the Cahill Express Way which is another must do, and then continue to the Botanic Gardens. When walking the bridge stop at the pylon and climb to the top it's doesn't cost an arm and a leg but well worth the view. Make sure you look up as you walk across the bridge and also stop to look back.

Take a look from all angles. The beauty of the Sydney Harbour Bridge is that from every angle you are treated to a new sense of the scale of how truly good it is. Up close it is staggeringly massive, much bigger than you expect before going there. To see it from a distance against the city skyline gives another perspective. You can't miss it while in Sydney, you'd have to really try to avoid the area but don't do that, it's worth the look!

Exhilarating and utterly unforgettable - Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. We went on the BridgeClimb 6am with the most amazing sun rise. The Bridge Climb gives you the incredible opportunity to walk to the summit of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and enjoy one of the world's most spectacular views. It is amazing.
Beautiful. Gorgeous by day and gorgeous by night! Capturing the bridge and the Opera house together was lovely!

Amazing !!. you don`t have to walk up the bridge to enjoy it, Just have a walk around the botanic gardens behind the Opera house, with some fish and chips sit on the lawn and watch the night sky draw in, you will never forget the moment!!

Majestic harbour. The bridge looks majestic to me from afar. You can see climbers scaling the heights, challenging their stamina. Not for the faint hearted i guess. Pictures taken at night from the harbour.
the view. always great reminds me of auckland with a similar bridge.lovely during the day and looks great at night when walking around the rocks area

Best spot to view the Bridge and Opera House. Despite being a local, I have never got tired of viewing our Sydney icons - the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. The best spot is McMahons Point just down North Sydney. With just an hour of spare time, I drove my car there facing the magnificent view. The drizzle came down and the sky was grey, but still it never looked more beautiful. That made my day.

SUCH a wonderful experience!. Climbing the Harbour Bridge is incredible! It's really good to hear the history of the bridge being built, and the views are out of this world. Last year I climbed it with my children during Vivid Sydney - SO amazing!

Bridge Climb. We did the Bridge Climb in 2003. A fantastic experience. Well worth the money and as safe as houses. It looks worse than it is. I believe access to the bridge has been made easier in the intervening years.

What a landmark!. I just moved to Sydney. I love it. I love seeing that bridge around *almost* every corner, it's the best view! Every time I see it, it stops me in my tracks. I can't believe how beautiful it is. I haven't climbed it yet, but I would love to one day. I have been across it in a bus, I've also walked. I'm yet to do it in a train. Simply spectacular.
It is free to walk or jog accross. Give yourself an hour to join the crowds who savor this fantabulous view. If time take a break at the Quay or Kirrabilly where there are lots of coffee spots.

Bridge Climb. I have always wanted to climb the Harbour Bridge, but was too scared.I was invited to do it on the 19 /03/2016 for a friend's birthday.It was brilliant I would recommend it to anyone who wants to do it, the view from the top of the Bridge is fabulous.I am now planning my night Bridge Climb.

Beautiful Views. We did the Bridge Climb and loved it! The climb was not difficult, as you don't really climb anything, just walk. The views were magnificent and our guide was a lot of fun. I would highly recommend this excursion for everyone...unless you're afraid of heights!

Sydney Harbour Bridge climb. As I'm sure you've already been told, this is a MUST DO when you come to Sydney. The adventure would be great any time of day, but I found the twilight climb the best. You get the best of going up in the daylight, and being at the top by dark. It's fantastic.

50th birthday present. Magnificent. Always wanted to do the climb and it exceeded my expectations. What an experience. Gladly do it again & again. Well organised & the guides always keep you informed with all the facts & stories. Brilliantly done.

Exciting and fun. I would reccommend climbing the icon as well as marvelling at it from the Opera House. Try to pick a good day with clear skies and no wind. The tour guides you climb with are nice. I wouldn't stay it was particularly physically strenuous, or too scary for those afraid of heights; you just have to do it. Non suited for young children, but perfect for 10+ yrs. The bridge itself is a tad overrated (I believe) but I suppose it is nice to say you have seen it.

Walk the bridge. I decided to take the train and got off at Milson's point (was staying north of Chatswood). Walk across the bridge, went to pylon's lookout and finish the bridge tour and ended up at Circular Quay. All this took up the morning. It was a very nice walk.

Awesome !!!. I didnt want to do this. Thought it was too expensive. But as a travelling party of 4 and 3 others who defo wanted to do it, i was convinced at last minute. Boy am i glad.Staff are very friendly and we had a fantastic guide in Jen, who despite her young age, was very informative and was able to answer all our questions. The view from the top(we did the most expensive climb) is simply stunning and learning about the building of the bridge is fantastic.Took us 3 hours and all 4 of us loved it. You are in Sydney. It has to be done !

Holiday with family . We loved the bridge climb experience. The view of the city was awesome and the feeling of achievement after climbing to the top was exhilarating. Our guide Adam was helpful and thoughtful. He took special care of people who had fear of heights. The security systems are excellent and full marks to the team that conceptualised the bridge climb.

Stroll in the night. We took a stroll on the Bridge after dinner with group of friends who live in Sydney. It's amazing and astounding to watch night lights across the ocean and though it's was at 11.15 in the night there was adequate security. We walked through Rocks area and climbed the steps. At the end we took a train to come back to Town Hall station to proceed to our hotel. It's a bit tiring but great night time experience.

Well photographed. I've not been on the climb but my daughter and nice went on it,the 2nd for my daughter .Its quite expensive and I'm told quite a long experience. 3/4 hour long story about the bridge etc before the climb starts .Having said that they both enjoyed the day

An iconic view. It's one of those places you just need to go and see.Accessible on foot, bike or by car.Lots of photo points if you walk.For €13 I'd also go up the pylonIf you've got vertigo, it's not ideal as open in parts.
"1932" the bridge nickname "the Iron Lung". Like her nickname "the Iron Lung"....one of bridge that should be visited in world at-least one time before die!!!!

Sydney Bridge Climb at twilight. This climb was vety organized & safety oriented. Beautiful views from the top. The history of the architecture & building was very interesting. Our guide was very good & inspired confidence in climbing. Also very good at picture taking. Loved it! Not to be missed
fun event. Great experience and great guide. We did the sunset climb so we had daylight and sunset view of the harbor.

get the train across and walk the pedestrian path. We wanted to do this and had it was a beautiful day. We took the train over to Milson Point, came out of the railway station, turn right, and then walked up the steps to the pedestrian path on the left hand side of the bridge, so we go the full view of the Opera House.

Climbed the bridge . Seeing Sydney Harbour bridge was an fabulous experience but to then climb the harbour bridge, wow. The views were amazing, staff were helpful and informative..Excellent experience.
A wonder. Nice views and a must to try and climb the bridge. Harbor bridge is an Iconic place in sydney and its a must do
Amazing landmark. Love to take pictures where ever I go, this was one of those very amazing views. Crossing it and then taking pictures of it from the other side was the most amazing experience

Scary. It was scary at first climbing the Sydney harbour bridge as it didn't look to stable but once we were at the top the pain was worn it, I am lucky to have the experience. The Sydney harbour bridge is beautiful and a great memory of the visit.

Took a walk on the top ! It was windy and spooky but spectacular !. The wind was blowing and the sun was peaking through the clouds . It was exhilarating but also extraordinary !! I'm glad I was brave and tried it . I wouldn't have wanted to miss it 🙏🙏

So much bigger close up! Awesome engineering! . From Circular Quay where we completed our I'm Free walking your ( reviewed elsewhere) we climbed the steps onto the very noisy Sydney Harbour Bridge. My husband did not want to do the Bridge Climb so we headed to the South East Pylon where, for a fee of $13 you can enter a small museum detailing the history, design and construction of the bridge and climb up to the outside viewing platform for wonderful 360 degree views of the harbour, bridge ( and bridge climbers if there are any) , city and its suburbs. Etching on the glass parapet screens point out the landmarks so you know what your looking at. We then descended and walked along the pedestrian walkway to the bridge centre but soon returned as the traffic and trains are really noisy! A fascinating and informative way to see THE Sydney icon. Allow 2 hours to enjoy this fully. All would be perfectly safe for children but check with Pylon Lookout for accessibility restrictions.

Climb the Bridge. The most iconic features of Sydney are the Opera House and the Bridge. While the Opera House is beautiful, wonderful inside and out and a 'must see' for any visitor to Sydney, the Bridge towers over everything and is visible almost wherever you are in the city.Unless you are completely unhappy with heights I recommend the Bridge Climb as an experience you will never forget. It is so well organised and everything you could possibly need is provided for you and securely connected to you.The climb is made in groups of up to sixteen with a guide leading who communicates to you via a headset, The guide passes on lots of interesting information and anecdotes about the bridge and its builders, and there are several pauses to take photos, one of which is given to you at the end of the day together with a certificate. The others you can buy if you wish. The climb starts with a full briefing and equipment fitting and a practice climb up a "simulator", as cimbing up and obviously down some ladders is required. My partner and I both managed this easily at the ages of 79 and 82 respectively, but a small amount of agility is necessary. After this the climb proper begins and for the entire time you are connected to a safety wire so no worries there.The view from the bridge is spectacular and unforgettable. I recommend taking the "twilight climb" as you climb up in daylight with the wonderful daylight views and when at the top the lights come on in the city with the beautiful panorama that that presents. The climb was the highlight of our visit to Sydney (no pun intended). If you can do it, do do it.

I walked across the Harbour Bridge for a couple of times. I started my walk for the first time at Argle Street Bridge Stairs; I walked twice starting from Milsons Point in the morning to Circular Quay. It was really pleasant walking across the bridge to catch a little bit of sunrise and late afternoon for sunset.

Must do when visiting sydney. Walk along the harbour from circular Quay to the harbour bridge. Take a Sydney ferry ride from circular Quay to darling harbour and snap some pics of the bridge along the way. Sit on lhs of the ferry.

A bridge so far away. The bridge climb is not to be missed as the views looking over Sydney harbour are breathtaking . It's a very safe and easy climb as you will be tied to a wire hooked to your waist of the jumpsuit yuo have to wear after leaving all hand held objects at base . This is a safety precaution to stop cameras, phones etc being dropped onto people below which can be lethal at that height .Photos are taken by the tour guides and on sale with other souvenirs , so expensive . Not a cheap time out but worth every dollar .
Great views of Sydney. I paid for the harbour bridge climb and found the views from the top amazing however at around 120£ i found it bit expensive for what it is.
Amazing. Many bridges look like this but few stand in awe as this beautiful bridge does... Do the bridge climb it's awesome!

"the Giant Coathanger". Probably the most eye-catching feature of Sydney Harbour! It links the city of Sydney to North Sydney, the North Shore, and the Northern Beaches. Largely built in Britain in 1932 and assembled on site. For a fee and booking, you can climb right to the top of the arch for a fabulous view of the city and Opera House.

Coat Hanger. Sydney Harbour Bridge known to the locals as the Coat Hanger. Sydney Harbour Bridge walk is a must for any visitors to Sydney. Spectacular views of The Harbour and surrounding suburbs throughout the walk/climb.

A must to walk, run or climb when in Sydney. Of course the Bridge climb is a must, amazing, and not as hard or daunting as you might think. Quite expensive, but worthwhile, esp if you have good weather.Or walk/run/cycle across. Most people walk - approx. 1.2kms across with lots of steps at the Rocks end. Stop in Kirribilli for food, drinks, and walk or take the train back 1 stop to the CBD.
It's a bridge.. Sorry, but it's a bridge. Nothing spectacular. Don't get me wrong I really like Sydney, but....it's a bridge. I've seen many bridges, small and large with more charm and character

a view of Opera house and around is great from here.. In my opinion it's one of the best places to take a selfie with the Opera House and ferries in the background. The walk on the bridge will give you a great view of part of Sydney.

Bridge climb. I did this with my sisters, all of us in our 50's. We were a bit worried about the climb, but it was easy and comfortable. And then the veiw was fantastic. You can see the beautiful habour from its entry in from the ocean all the way west up the river. All boats and the little bays on the shore line, the big sky feeling and of course the Sydney Opera House, enhance the scene. Must do this at least once in your life.
good for a walk. it is rather nice to walk across the bridge on a nice day then have coffee at either end.. I rather like watching the harbour and the boats from there
Another Sydney Icon. Everybody knows this bridge even if they haven't visited Sydney yet. This is where they hold the fire works every New Year.

Oh what a feeling. How good is that. I have done the bridge walk twice now and it gets better each time, weather was fantastic with the sun coming up. Even though I am a country girl I can see how many advantages there are to living in Sydney sometimes. If you get the chance the bridge climb is really worth the money and you get to see all the bridge, the harbour, everything that is anything around Sydney Harbour.
Must see!. Dominates the city skyline like few bridges in the world. It's worth walking from the rocks over the bridge to end up at Luna park.

Every which way - over, under, across .... This unique Sydney icon must be one of the most photographed places in the world. Rightly so.Arriving by ship in Australia in 1958 as a ten pound pom it was a welcome sight! First we walked over it by the path/road, we climbed the Pylon, we went under Sydney Harbour Bridge in a ferry, then a yacht and much later in a canoe! The year people were allowed to "climb" the bridge my daughter and I went during the first month and 3 or 4 years ago I did it again with a cousin - always a buzz from any angle - this wonderful large coat hanger never fails to inspire.

Wow!!!!!!!. This was one absolute highlight during our visit in Sydney. We did the bidge full bridge climb...all the way to the flags. My wife is slighly uncomfortable with hights but she still completed this climb without difficulty. Sucurity was good and our climb leader did excellent job getting everyone to relax. The climb leader also gave us also a lot of good information and history about the building project and the background. The views are amazing. Excellent activity but ideally only in good weather.
The walk is amazing. The walk both on top and inside the bridge are great. The staff are great for tourism, and know their history of the bridge and surrounds. On a clear day you can see for miles.

Twilight Climb. Highly recommend the twilight climb. Suprisingly it's cheaper than the day or night climbs. I'm not sure why, as I felt it was better.As you climb up, you get to see the city in daylight and it turns to dusk at the top and you get to come back down and see the city lights.Best of both worlds! :-)

Walk across from the Rocks to get a great view. If you walk up to the Rocks you can simply walk right across the bridge for the most spectacular views. A walk across this iconic bridge is a must for all visitors to Sydney and its free.
Harbour bridge drive or walk under. It's gorgeous.. The view is amazing young kids love it too... It's a must do if you are in Sydney! You will not regret it

Sydney harbour bridge climb. Being scared of heights, this is the last thing that I could ever imagine mysrlf thinking about, alone doing it ....... but do it I did!!!!!! The team of guides and all the staff were great at making me feel it was possible. Once on the bridge I was terrified, but with some coaxing I made myself climb those steps. Once we got to the summit by the flags, I just wanted to yell ' yes, I've climbed the Sydney harbour bridge', to say I'm proud of myself is a real understatement, I must add that I did this with my 17 year old Grandaughter who took it in her stride!! I now have a photo and a certificate proving my evening of madness. If you're ever in Sydney give it a go, I did and I'm a 68 year old grandmother
Awesome views & climb!. This was spectacular! Very professionally done and safe! We are an older couple but had no probs and totally loved the experience and views!

Just like it looks in the holiday brochures!. Loved this place, I have dreamed all my life of visiting it! Sadly too late in life to walk over the top of the bridge though, but had my photo taken close to it.
Do the Bridge Climb for a real experience. Great to look at or walk across but the Bridge Climb is the best experience. You can also sit under the bridge with a picnic

Must do when visiting Sydney. The Harbour bridge climb is a great way to get a good perspective of where everything is in Sydney. The gorgeous harbour views are unforgettable. The climb is 3-4 hours. You are given blue jumpsuits and safety harnesses etc, a little practice run is done on the stairs before you head out. The guides enlighten you with history about Sydney and the bridge and provide a few good laughs to make your experience even more enjoyable. It is a costly experience but well worth it! I would suggest the sunset tour which provides for cooler temperatures and awesome sunset viewing!
A landmark of Sydney . A "must" when in Sydney. Great view at any time during a day and by night. This was the first and the last we did in Sydney........

We did it on Australian day!!!!!. We crossed the bridge on Australian day (jan 26th)It was crowded like a marketplace. The view of the harbour was fascinating.Full of ferry boats, an aircraft show, even a carrier......Ended up in the other side (Kiribili) with its small cafes and deli (also a must see)....

Got to do this when you visit Sydney. 8 of us did the full climb for son's 21st. It was a great experience and definitely a memorable occasion. The guide had great knowledge. Very safe and great views.
Sons 21st on the bridge. A must if you travel to Sydney. Did climb once before when it first opened. It is a lot slower now and easier for people of all fitness levels.

Very Nice Structure. We went here and visited the Sydney Harbour bridge Last 2013 i was so happy that from the bridge itself you could appreciate more the beauty of Sydney Harbour View as well as the Sydney Convention Center. We pas thru the bridge to be able to go to the Sydney Wildlife Tours.

Walk it. We almost paid the extrodinary cost to walk uo the bridge... rather we took the ferry over and walked back to the Sydney Harbour. Brilliant! Great views. Unless you are the adrenaline rush junkie... save your dollars and walk the bridge. Bonus: you can take your own pictures.

Gorgeous!. Four of us traveling from the US walked around by the opera house. The bridge is an attractive structure. You can walk across it. I am afraid of heights so I didn't do it but I can imagine the gorgeous view the walkers have from the top of the bridge.

What an Adventure!. We visited Sydney for the first time in late March, 2016. The weather was perfect for a walk across the bridge. The views were amazing. I'm 66 with a replaced knee and still had no problems with the walk... It was worth it! We went all the way across and had a great lunch at a place I can't remember the name of, then walked by the governor's mansion and had a look at the Harbour from the other side! Go for it!!

Great Views!. We walked across the Harbour Bridge and took fantastic pictures of the Opera House and ferry docks. We have amazing pictures to take back home! You can also walk to the top of the bridge. Many people did but it wasn't what we were looking for. Many joggers on the bridge.

Bridge climb. It's a fantastic thing to do whilst you're in Sydney, but it's very expensive. For two of us it cost approx £270. Of course there are hidden extras at the end of the climb with photos & souvenirs to purchase. You get one 'free' photo, the bridge-climb cap you wear & a free 8 second video sent to your email. Everything else costs! You need a head for heights too.

Spectacular!. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is stunning to the naked eye. It is so massive and beautiful. You can see it from so many areas throughout this amazing city. Whether you climb it, or take a Harbour cruise under it, you really get to appreciate the magnitude of this iconic beauty. You will have many photos of it from your trip to Sydney, guaranteed.

Absolutely, perfectly safe. Let's start by saying I am very uncomfortable (that's being charitable) about walking near edges. Went because my wife really wanted to go. Before I went my question was would I be too nervous to enjoy the experience. The answer is: not in the least bit nervous.You could not get hurt on this climb if you tried. OK, maybe a twisted ankle. You are basically locked into a jump-suit. The jump-suit is clamped to a cable and not unclamped till the walk is finished (amazingly clever engineering). A guide walks you through the climb, stopping frequently to talk (and give you a chance to rest). We did the longer climb and I don't think anyone in our group of varying ages was ever out of breath, even us "active adults". Additional employees of the climb are posted anywhere where there was the least chance of any difficulty maneuvering around the cable, although they really were not needed.We went at a time that we would be up at sunset, great time to go.All in all a great experience, wouldn't have missed it. Plus great bragging rights when you get home.

brilliant. We climbed the bridge on 10th april our ruby wedding anniversary. From start to finish a brilliant experience. Our climb leader daniel poole was fantastic. He put everyone at their ease and confident about doing the climb. The views from the bridge are breathtaking and well worth the climb. Thanks daniel for making our anniversary day a day to remember.

Amazing, well worth the money.. First of all, this one doesn't come cheap! A friend who lives in Sydney booked this for me & him at 303AUD, £150+, but it's worth every penny.when we arrived at the bridge for a 16.05 climb it was belting with rain, but nearly an hour later (yes, it takes that long for the dreaded health & safety, practice run, changing etc) it had stopped.The climb wasn't as strenuous as I'd imagined, though there are a couple of almost vertical ladders ans a few awkward obstacles to negotiate.The views on the climb are indescribable, this is a MUST DO!!
A Sydney must see !! . Easy access while checking out the Sydney Opera House with some great photo opportunities!! Very convenient parking underneath the Sydney Opera House.
Spectacular views . When in Sydney then either walking across the bridge or climbing it are a must. The views are breathtaking and this must be the most beautiful city in the world.

Free to walk accross. You can spend $150 to climb the bridge or you can walk across it for free and if you want to get up higher you can go up the pylon for like $12. The view from the bridge is GREAT. Also, you can take the ferry back across to Sydney Harbor or Darling Harbor. Best day to travel is on Sunday. With an Opal card which is FREE, you can use ferries buses and subway for $2.50 ALL DAY!

Exciting & Spectacular. I recently did the Sydney Harbour Bridge climb again after having done it first about 10 years ago. It was as exciting and thrilling do do it again and strangely enough it seemed easier this time around. We had a great tour guide who was friendly and very informativeand it was such a great experience with spectacular views of the city and harbour. A definite must for residents and visitors, and being able to climb at any time of the day or whatever the weather conditions are make it even more attractive
Trip to Sydney. The building of the Syney Harbour is very significant in structural diversity for the city of Sydney, as it is an iconic symbol which is recognisable throughout the world.

always a majestic sight. There must be millions of views of the bridge, but the best thing is that you can bus, train, car, taxi, walk, cycle, take your pick. You can even climb the bridge if you want to. This bridge is just a beautiful sight and will remain so for eons.
Awesome to look at. We wanted to climb to the top but too expensive for us. Still great to look at though. Lots more to see all round the area

Unable to walk over but easy on the eye from all angles. Due to health restrictions we were unable to walk up and over the top of the bridge but still able to walk on the lower vehicle roadway (protected path).A worldwide recognisable icon which is probably photographed as many if not more times than the Opera House. Fantastic to be able to see the people (young & old) traversing the high hoop of this wonderful sight.

Forget the Bridge Walk, Climb the Bridge Pillar!. Folks, just some advice. You may be interested in the Bridge Walk and yes it looks great but the price is also "steep!" A consideration is walking onto the bridge and checking out the Bridge Pillar. It is almost as high and for some of you that don't like the open heights, this is enclosed and has some historical information on the bridge. The cost is a nominal, I think about $13 as compared to a $200+ bridge climb tour.
nice walk. my sister and I walked across the bridge and back. it was a nice walk, you can see the opera house from another angle.

A Must Visit. I climbed the bridge on my Birthday it was on my bucket list. Due to the paucity of time did the shorter version which was amazing.
We had a great guide and amazing time. The history of this bridge is great.

One of Australia's greatest achievements!. The view walking along the footpath over the bridge is totally different than driving across, it is awesome. One of Sydney's best kept secrets is that the first pylon on the city side is actually the bridge museum. It has amazing photos and facts and figures about the construction and a short film. You can go to the top of the pylon with viewing decks all over the city and stay for as long or as little as you like and all this for $11. A must do when visiting Sydney. Gain access via The Rocks area.

Iconic structure - symbolic of Sydney. This place is not to be missed if you are visiting Sydney. Whether you just view it from somewhere around the harbour, climb it, walk across it, or walk underneath it, you can't say you've been to Sydney without doing so!

Great views. Walked across the bridge and enjoyed the spectacular views of the harbour and Opera House. During our walk there was a cruise ship berthed in the harbour so this made for some interesting photos.We did not do the climb or Pylon lookout but for free we enjoyed the walk and experience of being on such a world famous bridge.

A magnificent bridge built in the 1930's. The bridge is referred as "the coat hanger" by the locals reflecting its structure. It is an amazing design. The Hudson River in New York and the harbour in Newcastle in the uk both have similar designs. Sydney is the perfection of the work of the engineers.

Walk the bridge for great views. It's free to walk the bridge (you pay for to go up in one of the towers and to climb on top of the bridge) - and it's one of those things you really should do in Sydney. The Rocks area at the end of the bridge offers lots of restaurants and shops.
a Place to Visit. Whosoever go to Sydney this is the one point of place where you should visit .. simply breathtaking place
Iconic. If you have the time take a walk across the bridge along the purpose built pedestrian walkway (free). Stunning views of the Opera House and harbour. Make sure you take plenty of photos.
We were on top of the world. While in sydney we signed up to do the Sydney harbour Bridge tour. What a treat. They gear you up, train you then take you up the bridge. A sight never to be forgotten

Walking across the Bridge. We walked the Sydney Harbour Bridge on a sunny afternoon, just as a cruise ship was departing. Great views and nice walk. We paid about $13 to climb the many steps up the Pylon Lookout. It was lots of steps, but had an interesting museum and information. We took good photos from the top of the outlook, very windy! We walked across the bridge and caught the train back into the city.

So many great sights. I tell you there is nothing like seeing a place with your own eyes to truly appreciate its beauty. I was able to capture some photos of the bridge by boat and walking around the harbor. Truly spectacular

AMAZING . Another attraction of Sydney one shouldn't miss once you are there. We visited during the day and then an evening visit, evenings are fabulous around the bridge. Follow the visit with a dinner at any of the amazing restaurants at the harbor.
Spring break/ Birthday. Took my son here for his 17th birthday on his spring break vacation . We both enjoyed walking across the bridge. Taking pictures and enjoying the views.

Great but plan for a long event. Just an iconic thing to do in Sydney and a truly unique vantage point of the city and harbour. We were lucky to be there on a spectacular Sydney autumn day and got to see Sydney at its best. It takes a long time for the tour but it is well run and the tour guides are informative and well trained. There is apparently an express version but I wouldn't recommend anything which doesn't go all the way to the top of the bridge. One of our group was afraid of heights but had no issue with the climb

The bridge climb is breath-taking. Just do it!. The reason you do it is for the view from the top. It really is as good as you think it is going to be.The whole trip takes over three hours. The first hour is taken with being kitted up. You have to wear a special shell suit with no pockets - if you dropped something you could kill someone.Attention to detail by the organisers is of an exceptionally high order. You have a guide to take you up, point out the interesting features and answer questions. The guide also takes pictures.You are locked on to a guiderail and cannot fall off. In terms of scariness In terms of need for physical fitness I would rate it as 3/10. As long as you have a head for heights the scariness factor is 2/10.The 'wow' factor is 10/10. The climb is grossly overpriced and the photos even moreso. Nevertheless, it is a wonderful and unique experience which I would recommend wholeheartedly.
