Yes it's a bridge.. Nice bridge with a few unique features. If you are feeling bold I would recommend the climb. Would recommend a look but I there are more interesting sights to see around Sydney.

Fantastic Thing To Do. I have wanted to climb the Harbour Bridge for such a long time and am so happy to have experienced it with my husband and two teenage children. It was well organised, informative and fun. Our guide, Adam, was great. The view from the top is truly spectacular.
great view. our family enjoyed the bridge walk and also bridge climbing the views were mind blowing and simply amazing, not for the heart fainted though....

A lazy walk across the bridge. You don't have to do the expensive bridge climb to enjoy the Sydney Harbour Bridge. You can access the bridge from The Rocks area and walk across at your own pace, albeit without the dizzying heights of the summit of the bridge. You still get great views and it's good exercise. On the other side of the bridge you can visit Luna Park or just walk around enjoying the foreshore of the harbour and the beautiful bays. A must visit is Wendy Whiteley's secret garden at Lavender Bay, accessed by walking past Luna Park and continuing until you get to Lavender Bay. There is an underpass on your right hand side going under an old rail siding and some steps which lead you right up to the garden. This is a magical place where all the work has been done by Wendy and her faithful band of helpers. The garden is a credit to them. A ferry ride back to either Darling Harbour or Circular Quay will complete your journey.

Good place if you have time. On the bridge you can go up to the Pylon Lookout and have a good selfie with the bridge and the Opera House. It's a bit windy up there but it is worth it. Or you can just walk on the bridge for free but the picture won't look as nice because if the fence.

Amazing views everytime, great walk or drive or train ride. Whether you walk across it, drive across it or ride across it, the bridge is stunning every day of the year. With views of the Opera House, Luna Park, Lavender Bay, Fort Denison, etc.

Do this first!. If you've never been to Sydney climbing the Harbour Bridge with a guided company is the first thing you need to do upon arrival. You can see the major city sights, have a little excitement - you go to the very top of the bridge - and unwind after a long flight (assuming you flew in from the States). You'll learn a lot of fun facts about Sydney from the guide. We bought WiFi during our long haul flight from LAX and booked via bridge climb.com about 3 hours out of SYD.

Awesome Bridge!. My bucket list said to climb the bridge, but my legs said to be happy with just walking across. No matter, the views from the walk were incredible and thrilling. Even better, we went up the Pylon and got even better views and the history of the bridge.So glad we walked across!

costs a fortune, BUT. Very expensive, but you know the price before you go, put the price behind you and it's an experience you will never forget and will drive all your friends and family mad, because every time the "Coat hanger" comes on the TV or is in a magazine you instantly say " we climbed to the top of that".Takes 3 hours or just over, most time taken up with getting ready, safety briefing etc, great experience and I am glad that I have completed the climb, on top of the climb costs you then get the " buy the photos" pitch which obviously you do as you can not take your own photos, it is very expensive but a fantastic experience.
Breath taken!!!. It was a sunset climb, the view was magnificent, the guides were accommodating great view from the top, definetely a bucket list item!!!!

Walk into the City. The walk across the bridge is simply stunning. It should not be missed regardless of the length of your stay. My tip happened by accident, as we wanted to attend the weekend market in the Rocks area, we took the train out to Milsons Point and walked into the city. By doing the walk in this direction you miss the long flights of stairs up (only 70), you also walk with the sun at your back. Much more pleasant and wonderful pictures.

Once in a lifetime. Although we do live in Australia, it is still quite exciting to see the beautiful views across Sydney's skyline. Unfortunately, we didn't get to do the Bridge climb as we may have liked, but we still went to the top of one of the support towers; and let me tell you, it was absolutely amazing, beautiful, majestic. I just can't imagine what it would be like from the top of the bridge! While walking up the stairs to the top of the tower, there is posters on the walls telling you some information about the bridge itself, so that was quite interesting. When we finally got to the top of the metal staircase, we saw the views... BREATHTAKING. In the end, DO GO HERE. You will not BELIEVE the VIEWS!!!
Wicked Day out climbing this amazing attraction. From checkin to checkout they were professional with safety in mind at all times, this is a super attraction and easy to climb.

Bridge Climb!. We did the Express Bridge Climb in the morning -- it was fantastic! It is a 2 1/2 hour climb and we were in a group with 10 other people - although you get to the summit faster I thought it was easily done. There was a young couple that got engaged at the top of the bridge - very fun to witness it. Our guide was great and overall I'd recommend this to anyone!
Majestic. Did not climb the bridge but it is very impressive just to look at. Spoke to people who did climb and said it was exciting, nerve racking but totally awesome with fantastic views.

Bridge climb- just do it!. Determined but apprehensive- we needn't have worried! Excellent organisation, safety, motivation and an overall wonderful experience. We are in our mid- sixties, a bit overweight and not very fit, but the pace was easy and there are rails to hold at all times. A couple of ladder-climbs, but you take it at your own pace and practise before you tackle the real thing.A once-in-a-lifetime experience: so glad we were brave and did it.

Exciting experience with incredible views. Our family of six climbed the Sydney Harbour Bridge and it is the most incredible experience that we highly recommend. The 'Group leaders' are so professional, informative of the history of the bridge, friendly and experienced and make it enjoyable throughout the climb. The constant and changing views from the start to finish are breathtaking. It was so impressive we intend doing it again. We highly recommend this activity for everyone.
Another must see. The history about this bridge is very interesting and if yo are in good physical shape the view form the top of the bridge is well work the effort.

It´s a big bridge after all... I did the bridge climb thing and its reasonably entertaining if you are with the family or old people but to be honest its just a big bridge which works better as a backdrop for a few photos. So my advice take photos and skip the climb, unless you are easily pleased ; )

great experience. The bridge looks very imposing indeed, and climbing on it is a great experience. I took a tour up to the peak there and loved it, its pricey but highly recommendable. The view from the peak is amazing. Pity that we are not allowed to make photos up there so buy 10 photos for extra 60 dollars.

Beautiful at Night. All part of the package. The Harbor, the Bridge and the Opera House. Its a great visual in a great city. You can walk the up the bridge towers if you wish, but its expensive. Walking the bridge worked perfectly for me.

This is the Australian Statue of Liberty . . . .. The Sydney Harbour Bridge, also affectionately known as the 'Coathanger', was opened on March 19th, 1932 You can have a close hand look while you are in Sydney by visiting the South Eastern Pylon. It is a walking trip and recommended for the fit only. It is a longish walk to get to the base of the Pylon and then there are 200 steps to the top. There is a charge, it was $13 the last time I went. The views and photo opportunities are fantastic. (If you can make it, I've got to say it is tough). This bridge was the first thing displaced people after the end of WWII saw, so many people still think of this as their symbol of liberty.Great place for families, but make sure everyone is ready for a stiff hike.

A nice walk or bike ride!. You can either take a walk or bike ride across the bridge with one side reserved for pedestrians and the other for bike riders. It's free and open to the public and a nice way to get some exercise (providing it's a nice day). A casual walk across takes approx. 20 minutes, presents great views of the iconic sights such as the Sydney Opera House, Luna Park and the harbour in general. I do the occasional lunchtime walk across and back in about 40 minutes leaving me some time to grab some lunch before heading back to work. If you're wanting to see more, you can go up the pylons or pay to do the bridge climb which I did some years ago. Note that this will take up 3.5 hours so you will need to set aside some time for this.
Unmistakable. You will see it a lot and yet you will want to take a photo every time at every angle and in every different shade of light!
Iconic Sydney. Just what you expect to see, both from a distance and up close and personal. You can walk under, on and over - at a price. Good photo opportunities

Excellent experience. We decided before we arrived in Oz that the one thing we wanted to do in Sydney was climb the bridge. Although i had previously climbed it 10 years ago, my wife wanted to do it this time round.The climb experience lasts for 3.5 hours was includes getting kitted out, practice ladder climbs and the Bridge climb itself. we were led on the climb by Meghan, who was full of facts, energy and passion for the bridge climb.Although on the day we did it the weather was a bit drizzly, it didn't detract from the experience of the views and we had a great time which all the group we climbed with enjoyed.I would highly recommend the climb as for mot it will be a once in a lifetime experience.

Splendid Indeed!. If you are in Sydney don't miss the walk across the Harbour Bridge. It provides great views, it's free and it's good for you! Beware of walking at rush hour however as the exhaust is choking! Spend a few bucks and climb to the observation tower in the first Pylon (closest to Sydney's Circular Quay). Along the way there's great information about the history of the bridge project and the vistas from the top are well worth $10 AUD ($7.50 U.S.). You can stay up there as long as you like! You also get a splendid view of folks who have paid $160 AUD to climb on the bridge's infrastructure.

Nice viuw. But it is really more impress if u see far away!u got a nice viuw to the opera. Do not go so far than 2 floors and take the right...shorter way to go to the Opera is to continue to the 3rd. Floor and take the left!enjoy
Ride a tandem bicycle over the bridge. It's great fun to hire a bike and go around Sydney on bike. There are a few bike hire places with good maps in that area and I definitely recommend it.

The Twilight Bridge Climb was brilliant but quite overpriced!. My husband and I climbed the Sydney Harbour Bridge and we chose the Twilight Option so that we could see the view during the daytime, see the sunset whilst up there and also see the night time view on the way down. Views were awesome, we got some brilliant photos up there which we will treasure forever and the climb itself was very enjoyable and you get a nice sense of achievement out of it. Tyson was patient and very friendly with us. There was just us 2 and one other couple. Tyson gave us lots of information regarding the bridge and it's history and also made the climb quite fun. The only thing which let us down was that we found it to be quite overpriced!!!! Spend the money if you have it otherwise do something else in my opinion
So beautiful. Especially when you are on a cruise ship and you can see the Opera house in the for ground. There is a walk available but did not venture on it...but looks like fun

Beautiful sight any day of the year. This is my favourite sight in Sydney. A must see from Circular Quay or the ferry. You can also catch a train over the bridge to Kirribilli and enjoy the view under the bridge at Bradfield Park.

Fab!. My 10 year old son and I climbed the bridge this morning. It was a fantastic experience and Ash, our team leader, was cheerful, really friendly and a fountain of knowledge.I will accept a lot of people will find the cost excessive - but if you can, it could be a once in a lifetime memorable experience!!
Iconic. Doesn't matter how often you see this bridge, she stands tall and is an amazing backdrop to all your photos.

once in a lifetime!. it may sound touristy but this has got to be one of the more interesting thing to do while in Sydney. not exactly easy as there were many steps (but there are stop points, for water, along the climb). great view, great experience. we got a certificate and photograph for keepsake. it was awesome!

Spectacular views!. Great views from the bridge of the harbour and vice versa! We walked across the bridge from the CBD to the north shore and vice versa.
Great walk and great views!

FAMOUS SYDNEY LANDMARK. We took a taxi from downtown Sydney to the North end of the bridge. It was a little bit of a walk to get to the stairway that led to the walkway across the bridge back to Sydney. Once we got up on the bridge it was a very scenic walk across the harbor. There were lots of places to get scenic photos of the harbor and The Sydney Opera House. They actually have a guided tour that lets people walk across the top of the bridge but we are over 70 and not interested in that sort of thing.
Bridge climb. Had a fantastic day on the bridge with a lovely guide called kimberly, very knowledgeable and very funny.

Sydney Bridge Walk. We did this on the first evening of our arrival in Sydney and upgraded to the twilight tour so we could see the sunset from the bridge. It was an easy pace for us ( in our 60s ) and not at all scary because of the safety features of the tour and the suits! The views are amazing and our tour guide was very informative. Lots of stops for photos that are sold to you afterwards. You are not allowed any cameras or loose anything that could fall on cars below. Great way to start our Aussie trip!

A view of a lifetime. Well I was really surprise, because of the preparations that you do even before you go on the bridge. They are very much safety first. Which is good to know when you are climbing that high up. You get cloths to put on and you are attached to a line

Visit the pylon and get a safer view. We had seen people Ewing along the top of the bridge, but I was not courageous enough to do that! We discovered that you can walk up one of the pylons (for a fee) and get a great view of the bridge and learn some of its history too. Would recommend walking across the bridge and visiting the pylon.
Exhilirating. Love heights, hate walking, this was an unforgettable experience. Would love to find other bridges around the world to climb.

Breathtaking . This bridge is absolutely enormous. We walked the whole distance after going swimming on the side across from Circular Quay.We also got the metro across which is terrible. There is so much fencing you cannot see anything.The views of the harbour are obviously great. It was baking hot though, so make sure you have drinks to take.
Enjoy it. Strolling along the bridge is really enjoyable. The view are amazing. The bridge is not too long, so we can walk back n forth without feel tired

I nearly missed this because I was scared of heights. I avoided it for years, instead I preferred to go up to the 36th floor of the hotel looking down on this beautiful Sydney harbour bridge.Why spend $$ for the climb when I could sit comfortably having a nice cocktail and not having to labour through the climb? maybe deep inside me I was scared of the height?When my friend's mother did it on her 80th birthday, I knew I had to brace myself for this at least once in my life time!We got into our, clean special suits and with some simple training to start, I was ready!The climb was easy, you can even look down, the safety harness gave me the confidence. With a platform at every stage of the climb. you can see below and far away where only birds could have done.The view up at the top was magnificent and totally worth $, with a photo to remember and show off!!Don't worry about the fireworks , you can't do that on New year's eve

what a view. this I bought for myself and a friend from overseas. The time was midday and the weather was exceptional along with the view of the harbour and city. It is expensive but if you can I recommend it

An extraordinary monument to engineering achievement!. A walk across the bridge is a great outing in itself but for the truly adventurous, a bridge climb to the top is an unforgettable Sydney highlight!
Harbour Bridge Climb. What a great experience! If you are in Sydney, go do the Bridge Climb. Great outfit, well organized and very efficient! You have awesome views at the top. Do the Twilight Tour!

beautiful structure . it looks so beautiful from afar as well as up close! you can see the bridge up close from the rocks. do walk down the pier if there are no cruise ship you can take pics of both the bridge and opera house

Pictures don't do this iconic structure justice. The Bridge or the Opera House? Which iconic structure draws your attention? Or can you get them both in your shots? The bridge is everything I expected and more. The south pylon climb was an inexpensive way to get up to the top of the tower for even more specatacular views - and had the added bonus of providing a great history into the bridges construction. I had no idea that they could build the bridge in two sections and then drop them against each other with a pin fitting into a slot on the other side to connect them. What a feat of engineering for it's time. Tip: the access to the south pylon tower climb is on the sidewalk on the bridge itself, and not from the bottom near the water.

Majestic architecture . One of sydneys most obvious landmarks but Def a must see. As a family we opted to walk across the bridge on the pedestrian walk and found the views of the city excellent. We could see the people walking over the bridge which I'm sure is awesome but our adventure was equally as exciting and cost nothing. The bridge is also a busy working road and rail service and is frequented by runners and cyclists. But the fact remains it is a work of architectural brilliance and most Def one of the world's most famous landmarks.
awesome. A fantastic structure, beautiful in all lights. good to walk over, drive and train over. So glad we were able to come and see, better than any photos.
Family bisit. We'd already climbed the bridge as a family but my husband wanted to walk across and see it from a different view!The views were just as good, just not as high!

Iconic structure Sydney recognition.. Wonderful project started 90 years ago with steel supplied from Middlesbrough England and designed by Dorman Long .Breathtaking views on pedestrian walkway, wish I had the nerve to climb the Bridge and walk over the top girders with the guides.

excellent views.. full disclosure, we didnt do the BridgeClimb. Instead we took an uber to the far side and walked back on the bridge in the evening. It was a great walk and we got wonderful views of the harbour and the city without having to shell out crazy money and the views are better in the dark anyway.

Iconic landmark. Great way to spend an afternoon. Walk the bridge for some incredible views of the Opera House and downtown. Be sure to do the pylon lookout as well. If you start in north Sydney you finish n the Rocks district, perfect for grabbing a drink.

Wonderful Sight. A great sight to see while we were in Sydney. We visited the bridge during the day as we were visiting other sights. The bridge is close to the "Rocks" we did not walk across the bridge but we walked under it. Some people climbed the bridge, however it is expensive. The bridge is grey in color, someone said because that was the only color in the quantity they needed.

what a high!. From a fully detailed safety briefing and with all equipment provided, even a handkerchief and water fountains on route, this is truly a 'life experience' not to missed. A good head for heights and strong legs are rewarded by fantastic views and lots of facts from your climb leader. An exhilarating time made possible due to the professionalism of the staff
Go during the day and at night . Because it's beautiful either way. At night there's a cool Ferris wheel that lights up near the bridge so it's a fantastic shot.
Obviously a 'must-do' in Sydney. We walked over the Sydney Harbour Bridge on the pedestrian path which doesn't cost anything. It is a bit tricky to find your way up there, but it is worth it.

Ticked one off my bucket list. Although we could not climb the bridge the feeling of being close to the picture perfect place is amazing, the Opera house is in walking distance, just an amazing experience.
Spectacular . There is something amazing about the bridge, it's just so big but so spectacular, right in the city. Viewing it from one of the ferries is even more amazing.
Beautiful historical landmark!. This is such a mighty structure! One must experience it from all angles to get an appreciation of it. Climb it too if you can!
Climb it, it's worth it. Bridge Climb Sydney has tours that take you to the top of the bridge, extremely safe and not scary at all, anyone can do it easily. We have done it twice already.

Cheap alternative. For a budget alternative in the city, waking across the bridge is great. It only takes half an hour each way. There is Luna Park (free to walk around but the rides cost money) at the north end which has lovely views of the bridge and Opera House, especially at night. The south end brings you into the rocks area which is close to Circular Quay and the ferries. On a Sunday the transport prices are cheaper, so plan carefully for a budget conscious day. Great wall and safe with security personnel along the walk.

Sunrise Surprise. Walking across the bridge at sunrise is not to be missed. The light on the bridge and on the harbor make rising early worthwhile. People watching is almost as much fun as the walk itself. People coming and going to work, jogging, resting, painting and just enjoying the view complete the iconic picture of life in Sydney.

WOW. Unforgettable.
Although it was pricey, this was the most amazing thing I have ever done in my life.
My 8 year old daughter did it with me, we both had an amazing time. We felt completely safe the entire time and our climb leader Tony was the perfect guide. He was funny, informative and really easy to get along with.
Beautiful bridge. Didn't do the climb but saw many people doing so. Iconic Sydney bridge. Easy to walk to, sail under and climb if you so wish

Bucket List - Climb the Sydney Harbor Bridge!. If you are in Sydney and are not afraid of heights, you absolutely have to do this! Its fun, exciting, and you will have the best views in town. Its not an easy climb, but the guides keep the pace slow and steady enough that everyone can keep up. You learn about the history of the city and the bridge, so you learn as you walk! I recommend going early in the morning as it can get really hot towards the afternoon. Also, make reservations, as during the peak tourist season the available time slots fill up quickly. An absolute MUST DO while in Sydney!

Harbour Bridge Highlights. We did this 2 different times of the day, once in daylight hours, and then just as dusk was coming and both times were able to get really good photos. You need about 45 minutes to walk across the side of the bridge both ways, but then we also discovered that you can go up to the top of one of the bridge pylons as well. Unfortunately, it was closed when we discovered this on our dusk walk. It's only $13 to do, which is a bargain compared to the other costs of ascending up to the top of the bridge across the arch. Such a beautiful view of the harbour, the Opera House, etc. from up there that this activity is also something you will want to include in your Sydney Harbour visit.

Incredible structure!. We didn't walk the bridge but it's good to watch others do it! We sailed under it which was incredible and also walked to where people go up to do the walk where they put on their overalls and get attached presumably so they don't get blown off !!! Incredible site

Bridge climb is great though a bit pricy. The Bridge climb was professionally conducted and a great experience. Nor recommended if you are afraid of heights. The actual climb is not too hard at all. Our guide gave a lot of interesting facts about the bridge, visible building and points of interest

Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. Everyone going to Sydney must climb Sydney Harbour Bridge at least once. The view is so beautiful from the top of the bridge and the instructor is also very good and friendly.

Sydney Harbour Bridge Cruise. Had a fantastic view of the Sydney Harbour Bridge when taking the Captain Cook Harbour Cruise and Fantasea Cruise along Paramatta River on 21 and 22 March 2016. What an iconic bridge! It was a real privilege to be really close to the bridge. A must visit to all tourists to Sydney.

Bridgewalk. Did the Bridgewalk with my son and his friend. Was a bit nervy going up the first part as you can see through the steps. Once you get up a ways the steps are solid so you can't see through and it isn't as scary. Thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Was an amazing view of the harbor and all the sights around it. Truly memorable thing to do with a teen son who thought it was awesome and had none of the nerves of his mother!

Beautiful views and a great walk across!. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is very high above the water, giving you fantastic views everywhere you look. My friends and I walked right across it, there were also points to walk up the towers as well. We walked from the south to the north side where we found ourselves at Luna Park. The walk doesn't take long, the stairs leading up to the bridge, from The Rocks are easy to find. There is also security a long the bridge for safety so if you're a solo traveler there is some added comfort for you. Although I didn't find anything about Sydney to be uncomfortable for travel, even if I was by myself.

Sydney Bridge Express Climb - Incredible!. Our family of 5 did the Express Bridge Climb on a beautiful Sunny Saturday morning this past March. Ann and Scott were our guides and did a great job telling us about the history and facts of the bridge. Because the weather was so great, we had incredible views from every vantage point and the view from the top was amazing. While a bit pricey, this is a must do while in Sydney. Be prepared for the extensive preparation and gear to go up the bridge - takes about 45 minutes.

JUST DO IT. Booked a twilight bridge climb on arriving to Sydney. Yes the most expensive at $353.00 Aussie dollars. But what a great experience of climbing up just before sunset and not coming down until the city lights have come on. Fabulous!!!. From the start, everybody in involved in my climb was outstanding. Greeted with a smile at the desk and explained all details before I even signed up. Guide take you where you sign waiver and check you breathe. No drinking before hand. Next come jumpsuit fitting and safety gear .Now your group is ready to climb with your guide taking time to explain about the history all the way. There are plenty of photo stops along the way , done by the bridge climb crew. Take in the sight as there is time to check everything out. You only live once and cannot take money with you when you die, so JUST DO IT.

Must Do. The Sydney Harbour Bridge climb is simply something that you must do in Sydney. The tour is extremely well run with safety as the number one priority. The climb itself is not strenuous and as you are attached to the bridge at all times, very safe. The views are fantastic but the history of the area and bridge itself are also explained in detail. It was a great experience and one when you get home everyone will ask you about.
Beautiful view. We were going to walk over the bridge, but it was hot and by the evening we were tired. We drove over it!
Great views. Not suitable if your not good at walking lots of steps to get up to the bridge, but great views, keeps to the right .....
Symbol of the Sydney's city. This bridge seems like one the most tourist attractions and important structure for the locals and the visitors to explore. Great panoramic view!!!

Massive!. The Harbour bridge compliments Opera House is a symbol itself and identity of the city of Sydney.Must take a ferry to to enjoy the views from other side.Take the free Opera walk accross the bridge or take the paid climb up if u looking for adventure.
Walk over. It's great to walk over the Eastern side and enjoy the view of the Opera house. Find the steps up above the Rocks. Even on a wet day we enjoyed this free activity.

The MUST event in Syndey. Climbing to the top of the Sydney bridge was the highlight of my two week tour of Australia and New Zealand. The tour guide was awesome and the company sure knows how to make this tour work. It takes nearly 4 hours and costs about $200 US but it's worth every penny and minute. The views are unbelievable and how often can you tell folks you walked on top of the bridge. Every time you see a picture of it, you can point out where you stood...400+ feet above the ships below. You must do this!

Climb the Bridge if Time Permits. I was unable to Climb the Harbour Bridge due to shortage of time. But I went beneath the bridge in a boat travelling to Taronga Zoo. It's bang opposite the Opera House.

The Coat Hanger. The Old Lady of Sydney or The Coathanger is one of the stand out landmarks of Sydney.You do not need to make a special trip to view it as you will see it from many vantage points if you are staying in the Downtown area.Situated on one side of Circular Quay it links the main area of Sydney with the Northern shore of the harbour. You can take a pleasant stroll around from the ferry quay under the bridge. You can cross it by car, train or bus or even walk across it. You can sail under it on a ferry up the river or around to Darling Harbour. You can even climb it but this needs to be booked well in advance.This is another iconic landmark of Sydney, one that is hard to miss

Great views. We walked over to Luna Park and back again. Took about an hour but we weren't rushing. Very nice views and totally free to walk across. (You pay to go up the pylon towers and to walk over the arch frame.)Nice bars and restaurants nearby too.

Bridge to the sky... I had seen it in the pictures but never knew it was so humongous and beautiful. We took an AAT Kings trip and our tour guide took us to a spot from were you could see the whole of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and it was just amazing.

Walking was a real pleasure. We caught the ferry to Luna Park and climbed up via various stair sets to the bridge level at the Northern end. Once we were actually on the bridge it was a magnificent experience to just gaze out at the Opera House, the harbour and all the CBD buildings that were laid out before us as we traversed the bridge in about 30 minutes very casual walking, fortunately in very fine weather. And it did not matter how many other pictures we had already taken, there was always an excuse for many more, including of the walkway itself. We noticed security "guards" ever watchful if anyone had plans to leap and such, but there were not so many that this was not a problem for them or for us. It was reassuring however that there were people there who cared. To say the view is 100% is really an understatement and it sufficed our need to see the entire harbour (east side at least) right out almost to the heads - or so it seemed. A worthy item on your bucket list for Sydney!

You have to do the bridge climb!. I'm going to review our bridge climb experience under the attractions area. Suffice it to say it is totally awesome and a must do. It is not that difficult or strenuous. If you can climb a ladder you can do it!

Walk or Climb a Must. The views from the bridge are magnificent. If you are not afraid of heights and it is in the budget, I recommend the bridge climb. The guides are great and help with any anxiety. This is one attraction where you do want to purchase the photos they take for you during your climb. If the climb is not in the cards, then just walk across. It takes 15 minutes or so depending on stopping for gazing and photos. If you are too tired to walk back, just take the train from Milsons Point to Circular Quay.

Iconic Sydney. You can't say you've been to Sydney unless you have seen the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Be sure to cross over it if you get the chance, but it is simply stunning and a real 'gateway' into the city.

Harbour Bridge. Visible from almost anywhere in the harbour area. Don't bother with the bridge climb since it is expensive and you can't take a camera. Free access for walkers just along the bridge path.
Walk over the bridge.. I was surprised that you can walk over the Sydney Harbour Bridge for free. what a great experience. I would do it again.
Nice,walk. Lots of cars, would not consider it a must do.nice view. However would choose harbor cruises and walk around opera house and botanical gardens for nice views
Bridge Climb a must. I'm 69 and thought it might be hard, but I managed it just fine. Its a great experience even though it's overpriced ($220)

Enjoyable . I enjoyed the Sydney Harbour Bridge climb at sunset. My reason for doing the climb was to take in the views of Sydney. As an alternative, I preferred the low flying water plane from Rose Bay as you are able to see more sights of Sydney, the harbour and surrounding beaches. The scenic flight was less expensive than the bridge climb and shorter wait.

The climb of a lifetime!!. The actual climb isn't difficult at all - more like a long walk with a gentle incline. Even if you're a bit scared of heights, you're attached to a wire the whole time and cannot fall.

A fine example of great British engineering assembled with Aussie skills and very hard work,. I walked across the bridge and back, also went up one of the 4 pylons. What an awesome experience! Unfortunately I did not have the time to do the climb but this is a must do if I ever venture 'down under' again.

Yes, probably a once in a lifetime experience!. We crossed three times: once on foot, once on the train, and once in a car! Our experience was in that sequence and will be remembered for as long as our memory functions!

David . The Sydney Harbour Bridge climb has to be experienced to be believed. We had a great time and all the staff were great. The only failing was the radios used to communicate by the leader to the climbers. The leader's commentary was wonderful but only heard about 20% of what was said.
A must do .. Climb the Bridge. A bit pricey but so much fun with great views. Enjoyed the stops along the climb with the short stories of the bridge and city.

Free walk across . We took a ferry to the far side of the bridge to get views of the opera house and the city from the water. Then walked back across for awesome views/photo opportunities. About $7 for ferry but walk back is free and beautiful.

You must climb the bridge. The bridge is one of the iconic structures in Australia. If you have the opportunity to climb then do so. It is not overly difficult to do and you are rewarded with fantastic views over the harbour and on a clear day out as far as The Blue Mountains.

Took my breath away the first time I saw it!. An absolutely stunning example of architecture and taking the ferry to and from Darling Harbour, sailing underneath it, you can't help but stare at it with your mouth wide open in wonderment.....I ended up doing the bridge climb as well which was fantastic!!
Do the climb!!!!. Worth every penny to experience this. Period. One of the greatest experiences of my life. Expensive? Maybe....but totally worth it.
big bridge. go see the bridge if you come to Sydney, you can even climb on to it. you can see the city from it and a lot of things

Iconic Sydney landmark you can't miss. The Harbour Bridge dominates the waterfront from Balmain to Watsons Bay with the equally iconic Opera House. You can organise a climbing tour of the iron structure, walking over the top for some fantastic views of the CBD and Harbour.We didn't have time for that so for the best views took a ferry ride from circular quay to Darling Harbour via Balmain and crossed the harbour waters taking in Luna Park on the north shore as well as great views of the Opera House on-route.You can't miss the bridge from anywhere in the Harbour and however many times you see it it's always an inspiring site...

Absolutely ticked the box!. Went as part of an anniversary celebration weekend! This is such a professional , safe and exciting thing to do -we really loved every second of the bridge climb! Went to Sydney just to do this walk -it was as amazing as I expected! They are so well organised and so very professional-I felt extremely safe and in good hands! We went at dusk -is a bit more expensive but so worth seeing the day-sunset-lights-so beautiful! Must admit-it was a bit of a push physically -straight up those ladders is a bit tough! Must not have a fear of heights-it's a really long way up!!! Never felt unsafe -thank you a bucket list tick !!! Loved it -a must do!!

What a great climb!. Well worth the cost for a thrill of a life time. I was frightened of heights years ago and have over come that fear. This felt so safe all the way and was not as hard as I imagined. What a great feeling it was at the top!

Exhilarating Twilight Bridge Climb. From the moment I stepped foot into the offices at The Rocks everything worked like a Swiss clock! The customer service staff were obliging, the guides for the climb were professional, helpful and had a wealth of knowledge relating to the bridge, the geography, history and technical knowledge. The staff went through all the "safety requirements" thoroughly. We commenced the climb late afternoon, the weather was superb, warm and the visibility was excellent. The Guide was at all times asking about our experience, checking everyone was safe, happy and sharing his knowledge with us. This adventure was the highlight of our visit to Sydney. I can now tick this off my bucket list. Benny Moskovic
"Under and Over". Take in the views when going over the Harbour Bridge and if you miss anything go back under/ in Tunnel and view it again.
Excellent Architecture.. I love Harbour bridge, very frequently visited this place. Great view from Sydney opera house and from Ferry.

Impressive Structure. You cannot miss the bridge when you come out at Circular Quay station! It has an impressive structure and stands very prominent in Sydney. We didn't do the climb due to the price of it but going up the pillars it a good experience in itself.

Visiting Home. Whether you want to climb to the top or walk across her, The Sydney Harbour Bridge is a work of art. Carrying thousands of motor vehicles and trains each day commuting passengers. We have walked the bridge many times and my most favorite is when it's raining. Great gloomy day activity as much as a sunny one

Walk over the harbour bridge. This was a bucket list item and did not disappoint. From the time you are called into the preparation room until the time you return to base you are guided and watched over by experienced and knowledgeable guides and the magnificent views take away all or any fear you may have had. The climb was taken slowly and paced for customers needing extra time to climb or descend the stairs. Our group was comprised of both younger and older individuals ranging from age 12 to 73. Climbing this iconic structure is a must do for every bucket list! You won't be disappointed you did!
Nice walk over the bridge. We walked over the bridge and back, after a morning rain, the sun came out and it was just beautiful to see the bridge and opera house from different views.

Worthe every penny. I convinced my wife that we should do the Sydney Harbour Bridge climb. We booked it at a booth in Circular Quay a couple of days before. We arrived at the climb centre and were taken through the safety briefing and provided with our boiler suits. The guide who took us over the bridge span was extremely friendly and knowledgeable. From start to finish took about three hours and the views from the bridge were amazing!I am so pleased we did it and recommend it to anyone who is uncertain. Completely safe and, although expensive, is one of those "once in a lifetime" moments.

What a view - Amazing walk on the bridge.. I have walked the bridge quite a few times and enjoy it every time. The pillar on the right hand side when your facing the bridge from the city you can walk up into the pillar and it has some interesting photo's of how the bridge was built and a look out at the top of the pillar. I enjoyed this and will be doing it again soon. Never get sick of the views from the bridge.

Amazing. There are few places in Sydney where you don't get an impressive view of the bridge. My favourite is from the observatory - you can see the deck shape perfectly. Second favourite would be from the opera house bar (because you can enjoy the view with a beer in your hand)
A walk from Milsons Point along the Harbour Bridge towards The Rock. For those take the metro you may drop at Milsons Point and enjoy the walk from harbour bridge toward the Rock. Very nice!

walk accross the bridge. catch a train to Milsons point walk down and up the stairs to the bridge its great, have walked across the bridge many times not over its to expensive ,so I walk across and go up the pylon and see the museum walk around out side see the view and read the story of the bridge and go down and walk through the rocks to the quay eat my sandwich on the grass and watch the shipping and the people you can then walk around to the opera house through Lady Macquarie's chair through the domain to the art gallery , St Marys cathedral, go on a walk through and under the cathedral, then go to Hyde park and the war memorial, after walk down to china town for a good but inexpensive dinner, then walk up to central station for the Mt Victoria train back to Penrith a long day but great so much to see and it hasn't cost the earth to do it just a pair of good walking shoes, bottle water ,frozen nattela sandwich peace of fruit .I have done this with my three children many times and now with some of my8 grand children the last two are 5 and 6 year old ,and I don't Carrie them at any time .theylove the day and talk of it often .regards Margaret S

Breathtaking experiences and views!. This was a bucket list item and did not disappoint. From the time you are called into the preparation room until the time you return to base you are guided and watched over by experienced and knowledgeable guides. Although a bit afraid of open heights, I felt secure and was totally enchanted by the bridge structure and the magnificent views. The climb was taken slowly and paced for customers needing extra time to climb or descend the stairs. Our group was comprised of both younger and older individuals ranging from age 12 to 73. Climbing this iconic structure is a must do for every bucket list! You won't be disappointed you did!

Climbing the sydney harbour bridge. Wonderful experience. Takes away fear. Completely safe and a great feeling of satisfaction seeing the city from this vantage point. I loved it. It was exhilirating!!!I recommend it for people that are always young at heart!

The Most identifiable Bridge in the World!. We saw the bridge from Mrs Macquarie's Point and took some beautiful photos as part of a Gray Line Tour. When then went across the Harbour Bridge as part of the Gray Line Blue Mountains Tour which was a complete surprise. It was fascinating to see the bridge structure as we travelled across - it is so complex and yet beautiful.
An amazing experience. This was an experience of a lifetime. The guide was knowledgable and entertaining. Despite initial apprehension I felt safe at all times and would love to do it again one day

Climb. First time for doing this and cannot believe how good it was. From start to finish the staff were amazing and the whole experience was well organised. The climb was amazing and well worth the effort. Would thoroughly recommend to anyone who id reasonably fit of any age to do this experience. Loved it.

Do the Bridge Climb. Climbing the bridge is a fantastic experience for anyone with an adventuresome spirit. We are in our late 60's and loved it. The guides are great and they explain the history of the bridge all along the way. It's safe and the views are amazing from up there.
Sunset walk. My 70 year old husband and our 12 year old grandson did the sunset walk and both loved it. They loved it.

Bridge climb. We had a great guide in Adam who was very knowledgeable and kept us all amused. It was a great experience getting to the top and taking in the views over Sydney. The only downside was the duration which would have been quicker if we didn't have to wait so long for other groups. The total time was within the time stated on the tour but there was a lot of waiting. I would recommend this to get anyone wanting to get a clear view around the harbour and city.
unforgettable bridge. Very nice walk path along this bridge, you can go to Paylon Lookout for a view of the Opera House, much cheaper than the bridge climb

BRIDGE CLIMB. My friend climbed the bridge, and I would have been with her except I broke my arm and couldnt do it. My friend has Diabetes and the guide had to carry her glucose tablets. tyou need to shed all your chattels, jewellery etc. She did the 3 hour twilight walk. It is quite expensive $250 approximately. The walk itself is pretty easy, there is some ladder bits that are steep. Seems they do it in small stages. Of course the cost entails your guide, and enormous amount of safety precautions. Pretty special really to be able to do it. It was on my friends bucket list, so she can tick that off now! Although, I think you can walk across the pathway on the side? I walked around and under it. Seemed like people were riding bikes and walking across to North Sydney. There are shorter walks and consequently cheaper, plus all times of the day. Generaaly, they dont stop for weather, except exceptionally high winds.

A must do in Sydney. I was lucky enough to go under the bridge in a car, over in a car, a bus and a train and also do the walk and the amazing bridge climb. The walk is really easy and the access from the train station is well signposted. There is security on the walk and it offers perfect views of the opera house and the harbor. Be sure to walk on the correct side for the views!

A must. $666 for the twilight climb is what it cost us for 2 people. You might think that this is a lot of money. It's not. This was my second climb and hubbies first climb. It was the best absolutely breath taking. Watching the sun set at the top of the bridge and watching the city lights come on. WOW! Just beautiful. Hubby was blown away by the experience.

Amazing views. Claimed this awesome bridge 3 times 2 day climbs and 1 twilight climb) if you are afride of heights the doctor says try this because you will love it and you will soon be able to overcome your fear. I would recommend this to anyone that has a fear of heights. It's safe and the staff are fantastic. Sydney is truly an amazing city.

February Mardi Gras . Two very raucous UK girls came and demolished our beautiful apartment for 2 weeks so on the 3 week we sent them up the bridge to complete a bridge climb. They gave the whole Experience a 5 stars thumbs up and throughly enjoyed themselves - at $240 each you'd expect a good time- great pics - 2 pieces of advice don't wear clothing underneath the jump suits as you sweat walking uphill. + try the express climb directly to the summit
Amazing Landmark . As with the Sydney Opera House this is an amazing landmark and best seen for the first time from the harbour. The view from the bridge overlooking the Opera House is amazing too.

An amazing sight - we loved it!. The famous Sydney Harbour Bridge is probably recognised the world over. Whilst we stayed in Sydney we travelled over it twice by motorcycle, and I climbed it with Bridgeclimb, we sailed under it, stayed near to it and shopped in the shadow of it at The Rocks markets- it's an awesome sight from every angle!

Wow OMG. having lived all my life in Sydney CBD me I just went up pylons but myLoved ones did thebrodge climb and were so enthralled with the view and the safety gear etc. I kinda wished my grandmother could see it now She was oone of the first to cross the bridge and we have a token from Dorman snd Long during construction of the bridge.Remember they breath test you so early in the day is good so 1- you get the nicest part of the day and2- you can spend the rest of the day bragging to other climbers who also faced their fears. Sering toe harbour beneath you through the stairs is the hardest part, the wind can be a little daunting but the organisers will stop any climb if danger is imminent. So go ahead put it on your bucket list. You are strapped to steel all the way up, and back.Make sure you celebrate after descent. You can get photos if you are on your own so dont Despair photos are available.Who knows a preposal on the Sydney Harbour Bridge may be planned. A little expensive but its a one off adventure.Have fun no matter how far up you go.Sharon McAnulty
Iconic!. Walk over it, drive over or cruise under it. You can not see Sydney without seeing this massive structure. Be brave and do the bridge climb!

An amazing sight in Sydney Harbour - ICONIC!. This steel and granite bridge is one of the two amazing sights you see when entering Sydney Harbour on a cruise the other being the Sydney Opera House. Both known the world over as identifying Sydney - the city on a harbour. Iconic!

Disappointed unable to climb so book early.. You need to book on line very early pre your trip in order to get a slot for this popular activity. Everyone we spoke to thought it was worthwhile and gave breathtaking views but expensive if on a budget.

A grand landmark of Sydney!. This metal marvel is so interesting to look at but also all the different noises that come from its use are exciting! Cars whizzing over it, trains clanking on the rails and the people laughing and yelling who are climbing the structure! I. Could sit all day and experience the Bridge! Be sure to get on the bay via water taxi or ferry for some great photos! Sunsets are especially nice!

Amazing views over Sydney harbour. The Sydney harbour bridge is the link between the north and south eastern suburbs. You can travel,Ove rig by car, by train, by bicycle or walk, and walking takes about 20 minutes. You can also book in for an organise bridge walk over the top of the bridge where the views are second to none!Highly recommend walk from north to south and have lunch and walk back through the rocks and circular quay. A must when you are in Sydney.

Walk over the bridge. We took the train and stopped at Milson's Point to walk over the bridge. At Milson's Point there was also a little craft market which we enjoyed (some really cool and different types of crafts). Then the bridge was a nice easy walk over to spend time at Circular Quay. Would highly recommend.

Walk across it .. This a must do for everyone . It is free and you get the best view as you walk at your own pace . You can take the train to North Sydney and walk one way , but for most it is an easy walk both ways.

Iconic. A must-see in Sydney, the bridge is one of the symbols of the city. It makes for a nice view, and, when standing on it or driving over, it provides a good, different view of the city. Other than that, it is just a bridge.

Amazing attraction which let you enjoy Sydney's amzing beauty. By doing the climb around sunset and by coincidence at a full moon date we had the pleasure to see the setting sun and the rising full moon all during our time at the bridge . An unforgettable experience

World wonder. This bridge is a marvel set in one of the worlds most naturally stunning harbours.
A must is the bridge walk, it's not all that taxing and even having a great fear of heights it didn't take long for me to feel comfortable and just appreciate the magnificent structure and gorgeous views.

Evening Bridge Climb. Doing the bridge climb was an amazing experience. I did an evening climb so I got the best of both worlds as we had daylight,dusk and night. The briefing was very professional and the guide was very enthusiastic and informative. The view from the top is something I will always remember.
Spectacular view of place you see on TV every New Year. Very impressive structure over the water. Many bars and restaurants available. Leads to the Sydney Opera House which is a must see.

Walk Across. Incredible site to see. Especially when built in 1932. Walked across for free. More adventurous can climb but expensive; can be $200+ US to climb the top arch. Walked from north side to south as suggested by tourist office. Took train from Harbor Side one stop. Walk down to the water and see bridge and opera house from a different perspective. Totally different view. Can't help to see if you fly in or take a cruise. Iconic Sydney.

Most amazing bridge in the world. There are very few global man made structure if any that match the beauty of the Harbour Bridge overlooking the Sydney harbour especially on a clear Sydney day. It is short than some of the other great bridges such as the Golden Gate and the Bay but just as amazing if not more. A walk across the bridge on a clear day (winter or summer) overlooking the Sydney opera house, some of the largest cruise ship in the world and a sea of small and meduim yahs and sail boats is a must for every Sydney visitor

A must see in Sydney. Whether you walk across the main road level or if you do the Bridge Climb, the Sydney Harbour Bridge is worth a look. Our harbour is beautiful & the views from the bridge are stunning. If you can, do try bridgeclimb though, particularly either early or twilight to see the city either waking, or the change of colour & pace in the later afternoon. Enjoy

Bridge Walk. Not one for people who do not like heights!! and that includes me!! But I'm proud to say that i did it with the helpful staff encouraging me and always there if needed. It's well worth doing if you have the courage!! Very very safe with fantastic views especially on a good day with the sunset.

First pylon!. Well worth a visit. Loads of history about the bridge. Try and avoid the school groups though. Sensational spot for photos . Such a different view of this beautiful city from this location.
Stunning!. Amazing from a distance, close up and underneath! If you're very barge (and I wasn't!) you can even climb it!
Drive over it if possible.. It just has such a grand-ness that you will take for granted until you go on it. Uber or taxi to Manly will satisfy the thirst!

Fabulous walk over the bridge and ferry back. We were staying in Kirribilli. walked up through the shops to the bridge and over early in the morning. The view along the walk was stunning with plenty of opportunities for pictures of the opera house, the rocks and the rest of the harbor. Took the ferry back across to Milsons point to complete the round trip. recommend avoiding it during peak hour as the fumes from the cars can be a little much. One of the best free activities to do in the city.

Take a ferry ride under the bridge.. A ferry ride under the bridge is a cheap way to see it's size.The bridge is the center attraction for fireworks on New Years eve.A bridge climb is worth it for the reasonably fit.There is nothing better than being on a cruise ship when it passes under the bridge.A good venue to have a lunch at a reasonable price with a view to the bridge is Kirribilly RSL.

Sydney Harbour Bridge. Another Landmark to see in Sydney, Australia. We had a nice view of it from Opera House and a much better view when you are board on ferry. For a fee, you can climb up the top of the bridge.
Amazing. My family climbed the Sydney Harbour Bridge and had the most amazing experience. They loved the views and the buzz of it. Quite pricey but its a once in a lifetime experience

Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. This was our second time climbing the bridge but this time we brought our teenage kids. It is really a worthwhile experience . The first time we did the full climb and this time we did the Express climb. We both agreed the Express climb was better. Great expansive views going up and still lots of time at the summit. The 2 1/2 hour time frame was long enough. We waited for a sunny clear day so we could enjoy the views. The temp in March is great and our guide was super friendly and funny. Negative : The price. It's too expensive. But we still did it and we are all happy we did.

Bridge climb. My husband and were told that this is a must when visiting Sydney. My husband is very afraid of heights and was quite hesitant, I wasn't sure I wanted to spend the money, but we both decided to go for it. We are so happy we went, what a great experience! Very organized and thorough when explaining the process, they even have you practice before going out on the bridge. You have a total of an hour prep so by the time you go you feel pretty confident. The climb itself is like nothing else I have ever done and it is made better by your tour guide who lets you take your time, talks you through the process and there are lots of stops along the way to enjoy the amazing views of the Harbour. This is a must do on your your trip and splurge for the pics you won't regret it.

So iconic!. Crossed this by foot there and back today. Great views looking towards the Opera House. Took a long time as I couldn't stop taking photos! If you are in Sydney, this is an absolute must. Climbing it will set you back a fair bit in cash - you can walk across it for free!

Worth every penny. Took the Bridge climb to celebrate my birthday (wife's idea). I was definitely nervous but needn't have worried. Staff are very friendly and professional. First section was a bit scary but once on the main part of the Bridge my worries disappeared. The views were awesome and it gave some appreciation of working conditions whilst the Bridge was being built. An iconic activity if you visit Sydney, definitely worth the entrance fee!

Great views great walk. Perfect for an early morning walk or evening walk. Some stairs at both ends but nothing too much. Great views of Darling harbour and Opera house. My favorite is an early morning walk starting from the city side stopping for coffee and toast before the walk back.
Great Day out. We took my father here for his birthday, walked over it actually we wheeled him in a chair, the views are amazing such great architecture recommended 10/10
Save hundreds of dollars and walk the bridge for FREE!. Nothing more to say, other than the pedestrian walkway on the bridge is stunning enough for me, also great exercise!
Didn't climb. The bridge is an interesting structure for it's length and height. We saw it from Circular Quay, the Opera House, and from the water. Might be fun to climb.
Impressive . Much bigger than I expected. Can be seen from the ferry as you approach circular quay. Iconic! I didn't climb it though - too hot for me!

The Coat Hanger. Beautiful architecture. Walk under it or over it. If you are up for it,climb it. Its not just a bridge that connects one part of the city to another. It's the one that unites the whole city ;)

awesome bridge climb!. expect it all to take a lot longer........1 hour induction but well worth it! Time your climb so you have a decent meal before you go.no cafe close to the office, and the Glenmore pub kitchen does not open til 11.30am.. the bridge cafe has very little variety and NO gluten free options....grrrrrr I was Hangry!

Bridge walk. We walked across the Harbour Bridge from The Rocks to |North Sydney. It's an amazing experience and it's FREE! The views from the centre span are awesome. There is a designated pedestrian walkway right across the bridge.

Nice walk across Sydney Bay. We took the train to the station on the other side of the Bay and returned walking on the bridge. The paid tour that offers the bridge climbing is too expensive and I think it is not worth paying it.
Still a Good Experience if Scared of Heights. I am terrified of heights, but still was able to go round the full tour. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful and understood about my fears.

Bridge Walk. This was a relatively easy walk except for the ladder climbing at the start so you could walk up the Arch , the organizers took you through a safety run before you start and all the gear you had to wear was with safety in mind All that aside the views from the top of the bridge were awesome and hard to beat , it gave you a birds eye view of the city centre and up and down Sydney Harbour I recommend it for anyone who is reasonably fit
the coat hanger. they call it the coat hanger and it is truly a great bridge, we walked across it and climbed the pylon which gave us a great view

Sydney Harbour bridge. Went over it in a taxi and under it in a boat. Fills the landscape. A beautiful feature that you can see from many places around Sydney. Loved looking at it from the zoo too. Have fantastic photos with the bridge as a background. Even from the wheel at Luna Park

Spectacular. The great icon of Sydney is worth the exercise. Fantastic twilight curtain fall on the setting sun while the city lights start to shine. The traffic lights of the CBD look light Christmas decorations. Great experience and one ticked off the bucket list.

Australia's number 1 landmark. If people around the world recognse only one Australian structure, it's probably the Sydney Harbour Bridge. I have walked across the Sydney Harbour Bridge many times, You don't need to pay a small fortune to make the Harbour Bridge climb unless you want to have something to tell the folks back home. If you walk, you get a great view of the harbour, gratis.

tourist trap. you will enjoy the walk across the bridge as much as climbing it but still have $200 aud in your pocket.it is an absolute rort.the climb should take no more than an hour but they stretch it out to justify the price.soon they,ll be sending up groups with paint cans and brushes to paint the bridge as well for an extra charge of course .

Fantastic. This experience was truly amasing. Even if you don't like heights as I don't this is a very safe climb. the safety preparation is well presented and checked right down to a breathalizer. There a several stops along the climb to ensure everyone is together and to take in the breathtaking views. Our guide was very knowledgeable about not only the bridge but also of the views and made sure everyone was comfortable.

Iconic harbor bridge. The Sydney Harbour bridge straddles the skies and the ocean, dominating Sydney 's coastline, with the beautiful Opera house by its side. I would recommend taking it it from many vintages, from land, a boat ride or two ( we took two boat tours, one by evening and another by day) even a heli ride and the bridge climb if you can afford the latter two.
Awesome. A great view whether you're on the bridge or viewing it from across the harbor. Especially wonderful at sunset.

Grand bridge!. I didn't go for the walk to the top, am sure that must be amazing too!
When you come to the Harbour, you can tour on the banks watching both the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House.
One of those pics that you need to have from your Sydney trip!

Climb the bridge. Take time out and book yourself a climb on the Sydney harbour bridge, well worth the effort, great views, but make sure you are fit enough. the staff are very safety conscious and give you a good brief before climbing. its fun and when you have completed it you will be in good company of many thousands that have also climbed the bridge. have fun

Sydney Harbour Bridge walk.. Access stairs to walking deck are in Cumberland St, in the historic Rocks area, the easy walk takes roughly 30 - 40 mins, great views of the City, Harbour, and Opera House, when you reach the other side you can return by bus, train from Milsons Point station, or ferry from the Luna Park wharf, ferries go to Circular Quay or Darling Harbour, I would suggest the ferry. Of course you can walk in the opposite direction if you choose.

Walk across the bridge. It was a pleasant walk across the iconic bridge. Grab a yummy hot snack at the pop-up food market on the CBD side if it is open, or a gelato on the other side, not far from the steps to street level again. After visiting and reading the plaques at the historic sites in the area, and walking across the bridge, we caught took the train to another destination instead of walking back. The harbour area has a great ambience - bustling with visitors, runners, walkers. boats, shops and food places. Always plenty going on.
Suprising busy. You can walk on the top, but remember - you will be checked for alkohol consumption! Do not drink champagne for the breakfast:) and choose not to hot day.
Australian Icon. We rode the ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour, and got to ride it under the bridge. A great way to see the Harbour Bridge.
Amazing. Amazing experience. Not for people who are afraid of heights. Some small places you need to climb through.
Bridge Climb. Awesome experience, but I paid waaaaay too much. If it was only the approx $200 I heard it was it would be worth it, but on a Sunday I paid over twice that
Bridge Walk. My husband given bridge walk for his birthday, he said it was fantastic, I had decided not to do this but was given complimentary ticket to view from nearby tower.

A great photo opportunity. If your visiting Sydney you gotta get a good snap of the coat hanger. If you catch the ferry across to Milsons point you can take a quick peek at Luna Park right where the ferry stops. Here is a different shot of the bridge.

Sydney from all its best angles. Doing the bridge climb is an amazing, exhilerating experience but if you're just not quite ready for that, try walking across the pedestrian track instead (it's free). I do this walk regularly by myself or with several or all of my 6 daughters. The walk is a comfortable, level 20 minutes (approx), but there's no need to rush. The view is spectacular, day or night. The only hazard is ocassionally bumping into other walkers because you are too busy checking out said view. At either end of the walking track,interesting areas await you. Kirribilli (North end) is a lovely villagey place with heaps of great places to eat,grab a coffee or wander the local streets checking out heritage terrace houses, plus there's an easy stroll down to the harbour where you can look directly accross to Circular Quay and the Opera House. At the other end of the bridge you walk directly down into the historic Rocks district. There is also much to see and do in this fabulous area, but thats another review! I highly recommend this attraction for locals and tourists.

Great Experience. Climbed the bridge and had a great time. The views were amazing. We saw a rainbow up there and our guide said he has never seen that before so it was pretty sweet. Overall a great experience I would recommend it.

Iconic Sydney Landmark. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is a magnificent structure and whether it is just enjoying looking at it or walking across the deck or doing the Bridge climb ( over the arches ) it is a must do thing in Sydney.We never get tired looking at it

How could you miss it?. If you visit Sydney it would be hard to miss the Sydney Harbour Bridge. It's iconic with a rich history which you can easily research. You can walk across it, drive across it, catch a train across it or ride a boat underneath... The most popular night for viewing the bridge is on New Years Eve when the city hosts a popular fireworks event across the Sydney Harbour. Many people stake their viewing spot 4 days in advance by camping in that spot! Popular viewing spots away from the Bridge are The Opera House, Millers Point, Blues Point Reserve, Lady Macquarie's Chair and Toronga Zoo. You can walk underneath the bridge when walking through the historic Rocks area which has many historic pubs to wet your whistle, and if you go at night you might consider booking to see the Sydney Observatory nearby and definitely pop into the MCA to see their latest art exhibits. You can walk underneath the Bridge at North Sydney near the historic Luna Park which also has a swimming pool next door that has amazing views of the bridge and you can take a really nice swim there, it's cool to swim and see the trains go across the Bridge. There are many enjoyable walks in all these areas with lots of photo opportunities. Of course if you love bridges then be sure to checkout Anzac Bridge nearby, if you want to se that check out Sydney Fish Markets and also Jubilee Park in Glebe has amazing views from across the Harbour. Another must-see bridge if you are that way inclined is the Sea Cliff Bridge along the Grand Pacific Drive, but that is 2 hours south of Sydney.Here is a rare tip you won't see many other places; In the east of Sydney is a park called Malabar Headland National Park, this has views of the Bridge that you don't see as often, far in the distance across the Harbour. If you use a telescopic lens as a portrait camera, you will definitely get a rarely seen perspective. The Park is also a fabulous place to visit to unwind, there is swimming and leisurely strolls with beautiful views.
Great views. No need to do the vastly expensive upper walk, go to the south tower and climb that, the views are great and only $10! You can also take your camera.

Beautiful - Drive over , Climb or Sail on under. Simple and elegant, the harbour bridge is a must see if in Sydney. You can choose to drive over or sail under the bridge, from ever angle its beauty. If you have a chance I highly recommend you arrange for a bridge climb, where you can get one of the best views of Sydney Harbour. Great experience. Cruising at night also recommended, very romantic :)

Great photo opportunities any time. This structure is amazing! Visited both day and night and from any vantage point within eyesight of the bridge you are able to get some great photos. At night it is lit up sometimes in different colours. Even better if you can get the Bridge climbers in a photo during the day.

Beautiful bridge. We did not do the Bridge walk which is VERY expensive and VERY scary, but we did take a tour that drove over it, and we took MANY pictures of it. Like the Golden Gate Bridge, this and the Opera House are definite symbols of Sydney.
iconic landmark. so impressive to see ,it amazes me everyday in all weather types it stands verymajestic straddling from north to south over the most beautiful harbor in the world
Beautiful. Great bridge. One of the best bridges, you should definitely see this bridge if you are in Sydney. Awesome.

Great views from the bridge. The walk across the bridge to Kirribilli offers excellent views of the harbour, the opera house and the Parramatta river. Kirribilli is worth a visit, so near to the city but has quite a village atmosphere, with shops, bars and cafes. The bridge deck is shared with road and rail traffic, but pedestrians are well segregated from these and the drop into the water at the other side, so it is reasonably safe even for young children under control.

Pylon views. We didn't want to climb the bridge but wanted to experience the views. The Pylon Lookout was the perfect choice. 200 stairs up, but resting areas are available. Wonderful views & well worth the walk up.

Iconic Landmark. The bridge is just part of the Sydney scene which all adds up to a fantastic place to visit. Even it you don't want to walk over the top of the bridge it is good to walk along the walkway and view Sydney from here.

Great view but expensive. . My wife and I climbed this in 1999. It was an awesome experience. One that is worth the effort but heavy on your wallet. Despite this many do it. Some of the best times to go are sunset and sunrise. The midday climbs are a bit too hot in the summer and probably best avoided but the choice is there. You'll get kitted up in a jumpsuit and harness and practice connecting and climbing in the climb centre before heading out under the bridge at first along suspension walkways then head up to the top. Up the east side, across the top and down the west. There's a pause for a photo at some point and you can collect the photo at the end.

Enjoy it from under it, on it and from a far!. You have many vantage points for the bridge. From Circular Quay, from ferries, from the Rocks. The best is walking over the bridge. It is a relatively easy walk. Take the lift at the end of Circular Quay towards the Opera House and you get great views of the Quay and Harbour and you continue on to the Harbour Bridge walkway takes you around 15-30 minutes depending on how many times you take iconic photos of Sydney! Take a train back to the city from Milson's Point or enjoy a coffee lunch and walk back...

Exhilarating Views!. The climb itself is an adventure and when you reach the top you are met by the best view in town... I am scared of heights so for me was a big accomplishment. If you are in Sydney you have to climb our dear "coathanger"

Incredible view!. It's an amaizing place to walk and take a look to the city, opera house and harbour. Even if you don't climv the top You can walk through It and have an amaizing view. The bridge is huge, need like 20 min to cross It, but It worth It.

Get up there and see the view!. The bridge looks fabulous from any angle. Recommend the bridge climb not only as a great way to get up close and personal with the bridge but a fantastic way to get a great view of the Opera House, the harbour and way out to the heads.
The 'Coat Hanger'!. Well what can you say? Adjacent to the rocks, partnered by the Opera House. It straddles the most beautiful harbour in the world. You can only experience it by seeing it.
Pricey but worth it. If you only come to Sydney once, put your hand in your pocket and pay for this. I have never heard anyone regret it and it's well worth the bragging rights.

A must-do. A great way to get the full harbour experience in under an hour. Get your bearings and enjoy the view. Walk to Luna Park on the north side and catch a ferry back to Circular Quay or Darling Harbour. A must do!

Sydney Bridge Climb. We found the best time to do the bridge climb is late afternoon into early evening as you get an appreciation of the day and night scenery. The climb is not arduous and is completed over a couple of hours.

The Coat Hanger. When you reach Sydney, if you can't see the harbour you are in the wrong place. If you can see the harbour but not the Sydney Harbour Bridge, you're in the wrong place. The easiest way to see the bridge is by travelling to Circular Quay which is at the heart of the city and right nearby to the Opera House and Bridge. For a structure which is now over 80 years old, the Bridge - known colloquially as The Coat Hanger (just look at its shape) - stands the test of time and adds character and interest to the harbour as well as joining North Sydney to the city centre.

Awesome view from top of the bridge. The bridge climb is the most amazing experience you can have to view Sydney from the top. A little scary if you don't like heights but the company organising the tours are fabulous. I live in Sydney and will never forget my climb to the top and the spectacular views.

Wonderful welcome to Sydney. Don't miss this if your in Australia as we are known for this wonderful harbour which has the Harbour Bridge on its skyline. enjoy sitting at the harbour having a wonderful meal and see the harbour Bridge as your back or front drop :-)

Our Coat hanger. This Sydney icon is known endearingly as our "Coat hanger" because of its shape and its history. Built during the Great Depression, the Sydney Harbour Bridge is a masterpiece, showcasing engineering, craftsmanship and human perseverance. Visitors can walk across the Bridge from the City to Milsons Point on the Northern side using the pedestrian path. The Harbour views from the Bridge are spectacular and they are free for tourists to admire. On the northern of the Harbour, you can sit down on the lawn near the Bridge pylons and enjoy the views of the Sydney Opera House. The main streets of Milsons Point are also lined with restaurants or eateries. All you need is the energy to walk the span of the Bridge. The best things in life are free.

Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. The most exciting way to see one of the best harbours in the world. The view over the opera house alone is worth the climb. For anyone visiting the harbour city it is a must do.

Engineering marvel. It is a real gateway between the city and the west. And spectacularly so. Walk across via the eastern side from the Rocks to Milsons Point, a bit strenuous. Or cycle on the western side. Or catch a train from Wynyard to Milsons Point for a brief glimpse. Sit on the western side of the train.
Glorious. I have run across this beauty daily for over a decade, there is simply no better way to experience our magnificent harbour in all its glory...it takes my breath away every day.

A Sydney must!. Take the train to Milsons Point station and walk to Circular Quay at no further cost!
Beautiful view of the harbour and the opera house.
If you want to see even better views, climb up the pylon (does cost, but it's worth the while) with its small museum.
I often walked to work this way

Bridge Climb. This is a wonderful way to see Sydney. It's very safe, but you must be fit enough to climb up and down many steps. The climb is done in stages, so it's not too taxing. It's well worth doing though.

Wear comfortable shoes.... This was a nice journey. My friend and I walked the entire bridge and it was about 2 mile walking across it. Then we walked back across. There were so many people doing the walk on the bridge. A ton of people were doing a marathon the day we walked the bridge. After we walked the bridge my friend climb the bridge and she said it was so much fun. Make sure you experience this amazing excursion but wear comfortable shoes because it's a lot of walking of all ages. A must try!!!
Sydney bridge. No courage to climb it, what a fabulous constructionEven looks good in the picturesTravelled on it n under it wow factor
Sidney Harbour Bridge. This is worth a visit, you can pay and climb over the top of this bridge both night and day. If you home in on your cameras you can actually see them doing this.

A great holiday treat. My friend and I decided last minute to do the night walk across the bridge. The guide was so friendly and made it lots of fun. Beautiful views and we felt really safe on the whole tour with great training etc.
