Walk it for Free!. The Harbour Bridge walk is advertised as a "must do," but it's very expensive and you can't take your own camera. You can walk the Bridge for free, however, and get great pics of the Opera House and Bay by just walking the pedestrian pathway across. It's awesome!

A must do when in Sydney. I walked across the bridge, drove across and was lucky enough to walk on top of it on the bridge climb. Do all three to appreciate the enormity of this piece of architecture.

Unique views of Sydney make this a must-do activity. At almost $200 per person, you might be a bit apprehensive of the high cost, but this experience is worth it. There is no other way to see Sydney from so high up unless you are in a helicopter! And to make it even more fun is the actual climb itself. We were two adults and a 13-year old and the climb was easy.You get suited up with a special outfit coverall so nothing can fall off. After suiting up they hand out a waist harness and walkie talkies. The latter so you can hear instructions and guide information from your tour leader.Once your group is all set, it's off to climb the bridge.This is a very easy climb and only the ladder steps (I can't remember maybe 90 of them) are a straight up vertical climb. Then you suddenly appear above the roadway on the Eastern arch.Cars are whizzing by as you make the steep climb up.The tour stops now at the bottom of the main arch, so photo time.Another photo op half way up and then again at the very top.All the photos are well done and make great souvenirs.The tour guide talks continuously with useful tip bit and stories about how the bridge was built, how many people were killed building the bridge etc etc.They even take an 8-second video at the very top so rehearse your video ahead of time.After you cross over from the East side, you begin your decent down the West arch.Going down seems a bit of a let down but the tour guide makes it interesting by telling lots of extra facts about Sydney.Back at the base camp, you get the choice to purchase souvenirs. Don't forget to buy your photos. The prices are structured so that you should buy the complete package for about $50 (maybe a bit from memory). You can buy prints or get them on a CD. We did both.In conclusion, you have accomplished not only a feat of climbing one of Australia's most famous landmarks, but also taken in some of the most incredible views of Sydney available to tourists.We were blessed with warm, calm conditions with cloudless skies on December 30, 2015.Highly recommend this adventure!By the way, among our group of 12 people, 9 had received their tickets as gifts! So you can see Aussies like to treat their friends and family to this experience. We were from Los Angeles so bought our tickets.
Lovely walk across bridge. Walked across the bridge a few times during our stay great views watching boats great for photos a must to do if in Sydney
You must walk across the bridge. The walk across the bridge gives you fantastic views and a great close up look at the bridge itself. You've got to do it!
Very Expensive 186$. Nice Walk over the Bridge. An amazing view over the Harbor. Big Show. To expensive. 186$ plus 56$ for the fotos.

Exhilarating!. My sister brought me to Sydney Harbour Bridge one night to cross the span. I had my reservations about doing this at night but I was pleasantly surprised to see so many people walking the bridge, taking shots of the view as well as enjoying themselves. It was a fun walk and exhilarating! Definitely worth doing again.

We Did The Bridge Climb !. Was a little concerned that it might scare the wits out of me, but pleasantly surprised that after the initial plank walk along under the brick arches, it became much easier and I always felt safe. There is quite a lot of ladder climbing, but in short stretches so it doesn't become too much, and then when you reach the actual span the incline necessarily becomes much gentler and it is easy to look around rather than just concentrating on your feet. We crossed over at the top - having had the obligatory photos - and come back down on the Darling Harbour side, so a different outlook. The safety briefing was thorough and although quite expensive we were very glad to have been able to do the climb.

Bridge climb. What an amazing adventure must must do ! Very safe to do at all times with pre climb training what a view from the top worth every sore muscle the next day which wasn't surprisingly that bad

So pretty!. I walked on this bridge at various times of day while living in Australia, oh boy, it's so spectacular. I even did the Sydney Bridge climb, the staff was so friendly and great, and explained everything with ease. It was also very safe.
Day tour. Stunning structure, the opera house and the bridge in that spectacular harbour, how could anyone not be awed.

Reviews can't capture the awesomeness - just climb it!. Everyone I know who has done the Bridge Climb has raved about it. Now I know why - it's hard to put into words the feeling of standing on top of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and taking in the 360 degree views of Sydney Harbour. This activity was better than I expected. The safety focus is immense, as it should be. The tour guide we had was among the best tour guide of any guided experience ever. He made sure our group felt happy, and told us some great history about the building & opening of the bridge - stories I hadn't heard before. We did the first climb of the morning on a gorgeous sunny February morning. This climb felt very moderate & the pace didn't feel too fast or slow. It is definitely suitable for all fitness levels. The most difficult part would be climbing ladders, but you do a ladder climbing drill indoors before you get on the bridge to help you feel comfortable (& I assume to assess any potential concerns). This is expensive, but well worth the experience. You get one free group photo from the top, then need to pay for any additional. Anyone who ever finds themselves in Sydney should try this activity!

Amazing.. Definitely something to tick off the bucket list. We scored the perfect day. Was a little scary for me (just didnt look straight down) but the view was amazing. Not difficult at all. My only criticism - would be to include the Guide putting out landmarks from the view and things like - out there is Parramatta; over there the Blue Mountains etc - helps get your bearings. And our guide had only been in Australia from England for 8mths - she said that they like to employee international staff ??? mmmmmm - thinking I would much rather be up there with someone that has lived here and is a true australian.
Great iconic bridge. Walked across the footpath to the other side. Great views. Good to watch the people doing the bridge climb. Took train back.

A bit too long. I think the US$ 319 I paid was worth it because...when will I climb another bridge? We had free time before joining our NG/.G adventure tour and climbing the bridge at sunset which is the most expensive time to do it seemed to me, like a good thing. Not to my friend who thought it was a waste of money.Our tour started at 6:25 PM on Jan, 18, 2016. We were instructed...we were given a breathalizer (do not drink before climbing) and we were given some kind of space ship suits. It was fun...we went through a metal detector, we left in the locker all our possessions and NO cameras were allowed and you can imagine why, right?You are tied with metal chains to the railing that will be other half from the time you ascend until you descent. Some ladders are completely vertical...others are just like climbing a mountain....the sun sets and you stop to contemplate the sun setting...you stop for pictures...you stop for more sunset pictures....you stop for more pictures...and slowly you reach the top...you see the opera house...and you begin your descend...When you reach your point from where you departed from...you remove your space suit...you have a survey to fill and by the time you are out on the street it is 9:30 and you have to find a place to eat. In Sydney restaurants close at 10 PM.Was it worth it? for me it was. Would I do it again, no. My main and only complaint is the amount of time wasted with the picture taking...if the group has 12 people you have to take pictures for 12 people from different locations. But here is where they make the money. I paid for my photo overlooking the opera house about US$19.00...a little diploma is given to you about the experience. The guy who came up with the idea to make this a climbing bridge is one hell of a businessman!! It is interesting to learn about the bridge...learn about the bridge before you go...Best,

Australian Engineers & the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Historic. Longstanding. Wow. Walk on top. Sail underneath. Drive across. Walk across. This is one amazing structure. Read up on your history and the building of this bridge. Impressive undertaking for those who built it.
The coat hanger. This is huge, take a walk under the bridge, over the bridge or better still there is bridge climbs available to really experience this wonderful piece of engineering

Climbed and Conquered, very underrated experience!. Climped it with my Partner, i am scared of heights, but this is actually not even scary! and for other Australians, its actally a way better experience then you could htink, great tour guides and just overall amazed by how happy it made me. Expensive but just do it!

BRIDGE CLIMB REVIEW - Cold but worth it!. This was one of the BEST things I did in Sydney!I booked this bridge climb way in advance but be aware, this is not a cheap experience! That being said, if you do book it and experience it, you can see why it's worth every single cent. It is so well organized from safety to staff.When you first arrive at the bridge climb office, you check in and they usher you upstairs for your safety briefing. It's extensive. They breathalyze you and tell you all about what you're going to experience. After you get your gear on, you go through test equipment like up and down stairs and ladders to make sure you can move properly with everything on.Then on to the bridge. It's a guided tour and you have headphones in so the guide explains things like the history of the bridge and fun facts along the way.The view from the top is incredible but the wind chill in January had me freezing even with the jumpsuit on!Definitely a must do.
Exceeded Expectations. If you only have time for one adventure n Sydney - do this! I planned my entire vacation around climbing this bridge and it exceeded my expectations. I loved it!

Magnificent . It is difficult to review this iconic construction which dominates Sydney Harbour because it has so many facets. The fit and brave can climb it but lesser mortals can choose to walk over it,sail under it cross by road or rail or merely gaze at it!
Lived next to it for 3 years. If you are young, bachelor and enjoy eating out, harbour is perfect for you. Oh during christmas and new years eve, it gets really crowded.

Amazing Experience. An opportunity not to be missed. We did the twilight climb and watched the sunset from the top of the bridge. The guide was friendly and informative as well as entertaining. Health & safety was covered well but not in a boring mundane way.

stunning veiw and looks. a must look at when staying in sydney and at night as well . We could see from our hotel as well so was even better veiws all day for 3 days stay harbour veiw hotel north sydney
Amazing bridge!very beautiful. A very amazing looking bridge! Looks perfect in any weather! A fantastic photo opportunity! Highly suggest taking the climb or just walking over it!

The amazing Coat hanger Bridge. This is an amazing piece of steel construction. An arch type construction which connects the North and South Sydney in the Harbour. Constructed during the Great recession of the early 1930's , it was opened to the public on 1932.There are tours which one can take and climb to the top of the bridge but it is pretty costly. We enjoyed the majestic site both from the ferry and from land standing from the opera house.As it is designed in the form of an arch, it is also called as a "coat hanger" bridge.A wonderful piece of design and a must see.
Iconic bridge,. Stand tall and proud across the harbour, a spectacular sight. Just couldn't work up the courage to go to the top. My loss
Surely a landmark. You've got to see it and better still climb the bridge or walk across the bridge to truly understand and feel the true landmark of a great city.

Icon of Sydney. A must see in Sydney, particularly at sunset. Enjoy a drink or meal along the esplanade or just a gentle stroll. For more upmarket, enjoy dinner at the Opera House with views to the Bridge.
Big bridge . This bridge more than competently provides the facility of allowing people to drive from one side of the river to the other. For tourists you get a great view from the local ferrys

Sydney Highlight. This was one of the many highlights of our family holiday. I recommend that you book online in advance, the price is reasonable for the experience. Our guide Arran was excellent and provided a lot of useful history and tips. The views are spectacular and I would tell anyone not to worry about climbing the ladders as they are only 6 or 7 during the whole exercise. We were lucky enough to have a fantastic day!

Amazing experience, worth the money!. The views are spectacular - I booked it for early morning as the weather was very hot (a good idea). The heath and safety aspect takes a little while but is very organized and made me feel very secure, as I don't love heights but was determined to do to it. I chose the middle priced option which gets you up on top, but not for the whole time. You are plenty high up, and our guide was great - knew all the history and fun facts. You're latched onto the bridge at all times and you can take your time and enjoy!
The Bridge Climb is a must do when in Sydney. Sydney Harbor Bridge Climb was an amazing experience. The staff are so friendly and knowledgable. We had a great time

Looks good but there are better bridges than this. The bridge looks good , gives great views when you are on it.. in fact, we also did bridge climb to get to the top of it & take a view..Has a lot of history attached to it...
Must Do. Visiting Sydney Bridge is a nice experience, you can simply walk on the bridge both ways or if you like adventure you may purchase a tour to climb the bridge

Bridge climb was amazing!!!. I did the Harbour Bridge Climb at night and I would totally recommend it! The city lit up, especially the opera house, was absolutely amazing and something I will never forget! It doesn't hurt that we ran into Ben Stiller filming Zoolander 2, but even without that the climb was one of the many highlights of my trip to the land down under!
Blew me away, amazing!. I was so lucky to walk through the bridge on a sunny day. It's hilarious how the weather can change so much the view of a person. It was stunning!

SYDNEYS ICONIC HARBOUR BRIDGE. Sydney Harbour Bridge is majestic to witness from many vantage points around the city and surrounding suburbs as much so as being on the bridge and viewing the surrounds of the beautiful harbour and all the majestic sights the harbour offers like the Opera House and especially from the top of the bridge if you decide to embark on The Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb.
What a view!!. I fulfilled another dream by climbing this bridge. I don't like heights but I had to see Sydney from the top. What a climb!
A bit of a walk. Couldn't get a booking to walk the arch so did the next best thing and walked across the pathway. Great views of the Harbour and Opera House
Great!!!!!!!. It has been one of the highlights of our trip to Sydney. Fantastic thrill, never though being an old man that I could do the climb, absolutely fantastic views. Do it!!

Iconic Bridge!. ANother fascinating place during our weeks stay in Sydney I found myself taking too many photographs each time I passed! It seems to me that wherever you go around Sydney you pass the bridge on the way! We were tempted by the bridge walk and each time we passed we could see people walking up it but we thought it was a bit expensive.
Great for walks . You can walk across the bridge, offering great views. Would highly recommend as a cheap way to see Sydney. The walk is about 1.2km each way

Another iconic point of interest. We had great views of the bridge from the Botanical Gardens, but when we left Sydney for our cruise to New Zealand, we sailed directly beneath the Bridge. A few brave souls waved to us from above on their walk over the Bridge, but our cruise Ship seemed to narrowly miss the Bridge as we glided below it!
Excellent. Great view. It is a wonderful experience. It is not a long walk and it is free. If you go to the top you must pay.

Outstanding. Yet again another spectacular tourist attraction. Sydney has some iconic pieces of architecture. Would recommend that you go see the Bridge. There is so much to do and see along the harbour for every member of the family

fantastic experience. climbing the bridge was one of the most terrifying but also exhilarating things I have ever done. You were very closely monitored and every step was explained. The feeling when you reach the top of the bridge is fabulous and a feeling everyone should have at least once in their lifetime. The staff were very professional and safety conscious.
Way Fun!. 3 days later and our calves still sore! Not a difficult climb and quite an usual activity. ...very safe and well organized. Our guide Chris was droll and made it fun.Ya gotta do this once!

TOP OF THE WORLD MOTHER! . An easy stroll, not quite, but possible for almost any level of fitness, the experience was amazing! A Disney level of organisation (that's a compliment by the way), makes it seem like yours is the only group that matters that day; a professional, friendly and humorous guide only added to the enjoyment. Yes, it was expensive, but yes it was worth it!

Beautiful structure. The harbour bridge is one of the great structures around what is the most beautiful harbour in the world. My husband and son did the Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb on 6th January 2016 in the pouring rain. Already expensive, it would have cost and extra $40 each to change the date. They found it disappointing not to have the views and really thought a discount would have been acceptable. Although it is great to have climbed the bridge; the other reason for doing this iis for the views and they were non-existent. The guides were knowledgeable and safety was reasuringly excellent.

Fun and Fun. We are both in our early 70 s and had some mild concern about how tough the climb would be. We did the full climb on a 85 degree sunny afternoon. That said ,it was great and an experience that one should not miss. The sights from on top cannot be beat and the dry humor of the guides are classic aussie. Not cheap but what is these days

The Bridge Climb. Great to experience The Sydney Bridge Climb. If you have a fear of heights it can be done. From the moment we walked into the Office we were explained with all the details and was very enjoyable. The weather was perfect made a difference. The staff professional.
Must do when in Sydney. The whole experience was easier than anticipated and we did the big climb. Instructors were informative and very safety conscious.

Amazing views. I overcame my fear of heights to achieve the climb and I was so pleased I did. Lauren our leader did everything to make me feel comfortable also at the time to my trepidation asking me to go first behind her and when I first stepped out my heart was beating Sooo fast!! However she was absolutely right being behind her was quite right and the views are amazing and the sense of achievement inspiring. Well done bridge climb your professionalism and safety are second to none. Recommend this to ALL !

Fantastic Icon. I've visited Sydney a number of times and never get tired of the Harbour Bridge. There are so many ways to view it, whether by ferry, cruise, car or bridge climb. The city is so clean and neat and it has the best variety of things to do and see. Definitely worth a visit if you come to Australia.

Great, professional tour . Our visit for the Bridge Walk was very professional and they run a very safe,friendly, slick system. Our tour guide Romeo made a conscious effort to remember our names and made sure everyone was at ease. Definitely worth doing!

Spectacular View. We did the Sydney Bridge Climb at dusk. It was an awesome view of the City and the Harbour. The only tough part was the vertical assent up the ladder but you are safely attached to the railing. I would do it over again in a heartbeat. Our tour guide was excellent.

Iconic. The Sydney Harbour Bridge was beautiful to gaze upon from every angle - except we did not do the over-the-top bridge walk. When we finally had time to do it, it poured rain and was too windy. Make sure to take a ferry ride that goes under it.
This is a bucket list tour!!. This is a spectacular tour that takes about three hours, including the prep activities, and there's nothing that compares with it!

Very slick professional operation.We were in very good hands.. An absolutely fabulous experience! We were a bit nervous at the beginning of this adventure, and there were a few challenging moments , as you step on to the iron gridded steps your vision flows through to the water below and it is a long way down and also when you stop on the bridge and the traffic is hurtling along below youThis was a bit unnerving. The whole experience was so professionally handled and nothing was left to chance.I felt very safe and am so glad to have undertaken this adventure. Well done to the management staff and crews.
iconic bridge. You can climb the bridge or walk across it.You can view it in day or at night which it looks nice at night too

Icon of the Harbour!. The bridge is an imposing feature of the Sydney Harbour area. It is so iconic and the views from the harbour, on the water and from the air in a Sydney Seaplanes plane help to put the bridge into perspective.

Lovely Stroll!. What an incredible and iconic this structure is. So ways to enjoy this historic bridge, strolling, driving across, by ferry underneath or just admiring it from a distance. This "Coat-Hanger" has you covered from every angle!

Lots of fun.. Booked this for my husband and I and we found it great fun. It is well organized and if you like climbing structures and not afraid of heights, this is a blast. It also gives you wonderful view of the Sydney Harbor.

Great view. Sydney's most beautiful views of the city if you go from the ferry or boat in the riverbed, but from the top of the famous Harbour Bridge you will see the panorama of the bay and out to the Sydney opera house

Iconic Bridge. You have to go to circular quay if you go to Sydney and the view of the bridge and opera house are fantastic. A highly recommended destination on New Years Eve - though very crowded but absolutely spectacular. Fill your senses with the beauty of Sydney Harbour - no other capital city can beat this view.

We Wanted to Walk the Bridge, but ran out of time!. This bridge is beautiful, an architects dream. We saw it everyday. We walked by it, and constantly looked at it over walks, drinks and dinner. We only wish we had enough days that we could've have done the walk across...

For the time of your life!. What a way to spend a few hours of your time in Sydney! Breathtaking 360 degree views you will never forget. Don't miss this opportunity if you can do it. It might be slightly challenging for some, but worth the effort.

Signature mark of Australia. The Harbour Bridge at Sydney has become so popular that it is now the signature mark of Sydney as well as Australia. It's a magnificent sight to view it and it becomes marvelous when lighted in the night. People say that it's a great experience to undertake a guided ride on the bridge though it's somewhat tedious and costly too.

DO IT AT NIGHT....YOU WON'T BE SORRY. Of course everyone gives this attraction five stars. It's fantastic. I've climbed it twice, once by day and once by night. Night climb is the best! The air is crisp, the sky is clear and the illuminated Opera House is a phenomenal sight. You can't take you own camera, but don't worry, your guide will take excellent pics of you with all of Sydney glimmering in the background.
Traveling . You can't visit Sydney and not cross the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Such an amazing piece of architecture. The traffic flows across it with ease and the view of the Opera House is beautiful.

Nice place to stroll and view the operahouse. Good location and nice lively environment. enjoyed the walk. The harbour is well lit in evening and place is buzzing with the pubs and food joints under the opera house.

You can walk across the bridge and take a lot of pictures. We walked from Cicular Quay to Milson Point and took metro train back to City Business Center. There is plenty of good photo opportunities. Security guards are stationed on the bridge and people are separated from the traffic by the high fence so it is safe and easy walk.

a must do. if you have ever driven over this bridge and thought that was good you will be more amazed by climbing to the top of it.your guide will explain everything you ever wanted to no about this bridge and the view at night in amazing , a must do

Beautiful Bridge at Twilight. The bridge climb at twilight was perfect! Amazing contrast where you get to see the sunset as well as the night lights. The photos you receive are great quality, and a once in a life time, however they are quite expensive for what you receive. I recommend the bridge climb as a bucket list item that must be ticked off!

One of a kind experience. The harbor bridge climb was one in a lifetime experience. even though a little costly, if you have time and can afford, its a must visit. Its story, fun staff, mere size, the height and the amazing view from the top is all perfect!

Do the Twilight Climb. Yes, it is true, the process leading up to the actual climb is a little bit long and tedious, but that is really just because they put safety first. Once you actually get out on the bride it is so exciting! The only part that might be a little scary is the four ladders, after that it is a fairly easy walk. Our guide was Bronte and she was excellent, so friendly and she told great stories. The twilight climb is like 3 climbs in one because you see the view in the daylight, the sunset, and then the view in the dark. I think that's why this time slot is so expensive but we thought it was well worth it. As we were descending, the harbor fireworks began and Bronte allowed us to watch them from the bridge! Not a perfect view but an incredibly unique one. Don't leave Sydney without climbing the bridge!

Walked the bridge - Excellent.. Expensive but well worth the money. We are both retired but still fit so we were keen to do the Bridge Walk. Looking at the bridge and seeing the other climbers it seems difficult but it isn't and the guides keep the pace slow with lots of stops and information. Perfectly safe and good fun. KIV that you are breathalysed as you kit up so no drinking beforehand.

Bridge nerds. We decided to do the bridge climb. Wow! I'm still exhausted. Sadly you are not allowed to take anything on the climb????????? No photos I'm afraid, except the company guide takes some shots along the way. You receive a group shot, which might I add is the crappiest one of all, and then you are offered to buy their copies at $25.00 a piece. A bit steep if you ask me especially when the climb was limited to the inner rafters and not the outer climb, and the cost is $230.00. We had fun but I think the premier climb wiuld be better. A lot more expensive though.
Daily walk. This bridge is my daily morning and evening walk to and from work. I take it as a privilege to be able to cross the harbour with the magnificent views it offers.
Tourist centre of Sydney!. The Sydney harbour bridge and the harbour are the tourist hub of Sydney! This is the first place you should visit if you are in Sydney!

Just as awesome as the first time!! . It was second & my partners first time climbing up the iconic Sydney Harbour Bridge! I absolutely loved it again & my partner thoroughly enjoyed it.The whole experience is second to none! The views of Sydney Harbour are unrivalled anywhere else. The staff are very knowledgeable throughout your climb & your safety is paramount to them. I would highly recommend the climb - it is worth every penny or cent in Australia! We had some great photographs on top of the bridge & our group was fantastic. 5***

Another MUST visit.. There's not much place to get a full view of Sydney Harbour Bridge on the land side. Too many tourist crowding and the noise is deafening. The only way to really appreciate the full bridge view is via harbour cruise, where one will be able to see a beautiful bridge right in front of your very eyes. Did not try getting to the top of the bridge due lack of time. In Short, a must see !!!!!
Well worth seeing. I dont like heights so wont be going up it. But many people do and enjoy the view from the top. This is something to see due to the cool design and of course age of the bridge
Stunning Views, Amazing Icon. You can climb the arch, walk along the walkway from Sydney to North Sydney - either way the view is amazing from this iconic structure. A must for any visitor.

Spectacular. This is one tour I'm glad we took. It helped that we had perfect weather. View from the top was amazing. Not scary at all especially because tethered at all times with safety the prime consideration.
Amazing. Did the twilight walk. The views are the best you will ever get of Sydney. Staff make you feel safe and the climb is very easy.
Amazing views. We climbed the bridge at sunset. It was a great experience and a special experience. We had a great guide and had lovely photos to help remember this special day.
Do it. Take the BIG one. The full tour of 3.5 hours. Good briefing, excellent equipment, excellent guides. Good views and a sense of accomplishment.

Everyday commute, everyday breathtaking.. What an engineering fete! I love travelling across the bridge by car, bus, train, push bike or simply by foot. Every single time I cross this bridge my breath is taken away by not one but countless amazing scenes. It's a bucket list entry in my book.I recommend walking it at least once to get those picture perfect shots of the Opera House and many more.
A very cool Structure. The bridge is a very cool structure. Its massive and you can even take a walk over the top of the bridge

A great place to ride or walk across fro Sydney CBD. What a great way to see the beautiful sites of Sydney, and even better it is free. I rode my bike today across the bride not knowing what to expect. Crossing the bridge, and looking at the city. After crossing, spend time just walking and doing nothing in Luna Park. Just cross the bridge without any structured plan, and just enjoy yourself. I bet that you might just decide to stay here.

The Harbour bridge is a spectacle to behold and beautiful from all angles. No trip to Sydney is complete without looking at and around the Harbour Bridge. Take a walk over to Luna Park, stop off half way and catch a photo of the Opera House, or just marvel at its size and structure.For a photographer it is a spectacle at all times of the day and from all angles and you don't need to pay hundreds of dollars to do the bridge climb to enjoy it, although if you can afford it why the hell not.Explore the Rocks underneath the bridge and work your way down to the ferry wharf of Circular Quay.Make sure to pack camera, water and sun-cream.

I took the day off and walked across the bridge was great views of the city... Even the walk across the normal walking path is great views of the harbour and the actual bridge it self amazing bit of engineering and a huge building programme to do when standing on it ..you have think how did they do it?? I looked up and seen the bridge walkers high up and I'm told you can now do a paid walk across the top that would be amazing to see and do next time..

Awesome. This is a wonderful bridge to see. Visually appealling but the engineering behind it is interesting too. The pathway around makes it accessible for the casual visitor but they also have tours for those wanting to climb across the arch. Very nice.

Three hours flies by!. I was worried when we booked the Twilight Bridge Climb that three hours would be boring and/or exhausting. Instead it was exhilarating! Great view of the city & wonderful history lesson. Strong recommendation.

Impressive View..!!. Visited on 7th February and enjoyed the view from Sydney Ferry to Manly Beach.
Moveover, I captured the best image of my Sydney Trip from mrs macquarie’s chair covering Fireworks with Opera House and Harbour Bridge..!!

Fantastic bridge climb. We did the bridge climb. The day we booked it looked as if it was going to rain so I called to see if we could go earlier than I had booked. They booked us right away so we hopped in a taxi to get there on time. The bridge climb is fantastic, the history of the construction and the points of interest are worth it. Yes, it is a bit expensive and probably a once-in-a-lifetime event for most. The climb does have a very good audio system which you are hooked into (my husband has hearing aids and he took them out and found he could hear everything our guide was saying) along with great safety equipment. We are close to 70 and did not have any problems with the climb but we are moderately fit for our age. All in all it was a terrific day, started out with a bit of rain but then it stopped (and they do have rain gear just in case).

An amazing experience on the iconic Sydney Harbour Bridge. Having only seen images of Sydney Harbour Bridge from over 10,000 miles away in England, it was an absolute must to climb it when we planned our month long trip to Australia. My wife and I are spending four days in Sydney before hiring a car and exploring the east coast up to Cairns before flying home. Our bridge climb was booked for our final day so we have enviously watched groups work their way to the top, posing for photographs along the way. So today it was our turn and what a fabulous three and a half hours it was, we started the process by getting kitted out, and sorting essential health and safety issues. Our guide for the climb was Richard, what a guy ! He is the longest serving guide with over five thousand tours to his name and he brought the climb to life with a blend of anecdotes, stories and factual information. He had been told that if he added the length of all his tours together it would be the equivilant of walking across Australia and half way back again.The climb itself was totally safe with everyone using a slider to hook themselves onto a wire which ran the whole of the climb. Most of the climb was a steady incline with the most strenuous part being a short climb up near-vertical steps to get onto the the main walkway to the top.Obviously the views on the way up and from the top were spectacular and are well worth the effort and cost. It will live long in our memories.

Visible from just about anywhere in Sydney. The bridge is situated along the Sydney Harbour. There is a nice place to view both the bridge and the Opera House across the Harbour just underneath the bridge on the south-side of the city. From there you can explore the observatory and the Rocks. Crossing the bridge via a walk or train trip drops you into Kirribilli where you'll find quaint restaurants and scenic views from the shoreline back onto the Sydney Harbour. The adventurous can also take a guided walk along the top of the bridge!

Very beautiful!. It's a must see view in Sydney, it's practically impossible to not take a picture there or do some adventure like bungee or climb it. It's very beautiful, it's the most beautiful bridge that I've ever seen. Take many pictures!

Great experience. Extremely well managed experience with safety uppermost at all times, but this was not allowed to get in the way. Super views on a lovely day with a light breeze. Not strenuous, generaly easy walking (couple of ladders). Group Leader (Dave) excellent. Not cheap, but recommended.

Dawes Point to McMahons Point via the best bridge. Port Jackson, Sydney Harbour, Parramatta River all meet under the Bridge. Helicopters fly over the bridge, so too do seaplanes, birds, kites, and aircraft of all descriptions. And then there's trains, buses, cars, trucks, to move freight and people across the bridge. You can climb it, you can photograph it and you can climb inside the Pylons. You can admire it, and it is majestic.

Birdge Climb a great way to experience Sydney. We visited Sydney for a couple of days before taking a South Pacific Cruise. It was our third visit, so we wanted to try something different, and had heard about the Bridge Climb. We made reservations online about 6 months in advance, so we had no trouble getting the specific date and time we wanted. Although sunset climbs were more expensive, the online agent checked the estimated sunset time for our intended month and recommended taking the one just before sunset. That way we got to start our climb in sunshine, and finish with a beautiful setting sun. The climb itself was not arduous or difficult, even for us in our 40s and 50s and the most challenging part (although not at all difficult) was navigating three ladder climbs in a row. Because the bridge steel arches are so wide, we rarely were right up against a sheer drop, so there was no fear of heights or vertigo. The views from the top of the arch of the city and harbor were fantastic, and we could see all the way to the ocean and the harbor heads. It was an exhilarating experience!!

Harbour bridge walk. Fantastic experience.. Was n`t sure if this was a good idea. Not too good with heights. Glad I did it, it was amazing. I recommend it to everyone visiting Sydney. Oh and by the was what a lovely city.

Good view from all sides. Whether you walk or pass by a train. Road or ferry under the bridge you get a beautiful view from all the sides. it's quite busy while we ride and very very calm when you have a view under the bridge from milsons point. visited earlier.
Good. An easy walk across and good photo opportunities of the harbour. Interesting to see the more adventurous tackling the climb!

Stunning piece of engineering.... ...it's a nice walk too. There are some really lovely views - not least the Sydney Opera house but you get a good view of Sydney harbour too and of the theme park below.We didn't do the climb as it's VERY pricey but we saw a few up there and it did look pretty cool. However, if (like us) you're on a budget, just take a stroll across the actual bridge footpath instead, it's a nice walk (albeit it a bit noisy with the traffic) and it doesn't take too long.In fact, even if you don't get to walk across, I'd recommend going to the Rocks to see it from up high, it really is a spectacular structure. If you're lucky enough to go during Vivid Sydney in May, you HAVE to go and see it at night when it's all lit up; it's stunning!

Beautiful landmark. The best way to experience the bridge is doing a bridgewalk! While it's great to see from the ground, you can't really comprehend the sheer enormity of this iconic bridge unless you're on it. The history behind it's construction is also fascinating, and a must do while visiting the city!

One of Sydney's Iconic Sites. This is an amazing bridge. You can choose BridgeClimb, BridgeClimb Express or BridgeClimb Mandarin, which are options to reach the summit of the Sydney Harbour Bridge, 134m above sea level, right in the heart of Sydney Harbour for an uninterrupted panorama of the city and surrounds. The prices for getting geared up and taking the tour is expensive, but you can figure it as a once in a lifetime experience. Or, just choose to walk the bridge. At the end of the steel bridge on each side is a pair of concrete pylons. They are pretty and one has a unique museum, but they serve no structural purpose. Worth the exploration.

Beautiful views of the bridge at night.. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is the perfect backdrop to the harbour with the Opera House to the side. Beautiful area to wander at night and I have always found it very safe.
Very Lovely Place. Really love this place, took pictures here. Love the architecture of this bridge.A Must visit place whenever in Sydney.

Great views of the city form the bridge and even better from the other side!. Walked over the bridge- great views of the harbour! Nice to stop down at the other side - where there is an amusement park for kids.If you walk over you can get the ferry back if you get a ticket. Nice views of the city!

Marvel! . Architecture marvel it is ! I was so inspired to watch the documentary on making of this bridge after I actually saw how huge it was in reality! It's a landmark of Australia and this is how whole world knows Australia . Definitely a must visit attraction and the view from all sides! Great place for pictures and sit down and enjoy the marvel !

Beautiful Iconic Part of Sydney. Be sure to visit this bridge during your stay in Sydney - You wouldn't of fulfilled your trip without it! It's such an iconic part of the city. I highly recommend doing a bridge climb while you're there.

Climb of a Lifetime. Although a bit on the expensive side you should not visit Sydney without doing the bridge climb. My wife had some trepidation but we were really well looked after. Staff were great at putting us at ease and our climbing guide Kimberley was probably the best guide I have had at any event anywhere in the world. I thought she was simply excellent. She was funny, had great local knowledge and made the experience a pleasure. The views from the top were stunning. Whole experience took 3 hours but the time just flew.
interesting bridge. I like the view itself. It feel so calm and warm here.There was a lot of tourist but not pack.Good for walk at anytime.
A definite walk over and visit. Its one of those landmarks where one must see to get a good over all view of the city. In the Pylons there is a museum and also a viewing point.
Walk the bridge is a must!. Gorgeous view from ground to the bridge, but highly recommend walking across the bridge! Breathtaking views of opera house and waterway.

Showing oour overseas visitors around. Loved showing off our Harbour Bridge.Our visitors did the Bridge climb, BUT ,you can also go up the first pylon lookout which is not scary ! Its not much to walk up the easy stairs to the top and you will see a presentation inside of how the bridge was built. Well worth it.We walked over, drove over, several times under the bridge on the ferry, walked under the massive pylons on the south side and the north.Walking straight up through The Rocks there is a big stone bridge over the road ,and just before it RH side is a hole in the wall and a staircase that will take you right up to Observatory Hill. There is a good lookout near giant fig trees and great for Harbour Bridge photos.

Experience Sydney at its best . We walked over the bridge from neutral bay to Sydney centre.. It was baking so make sure you have sun screen as my neck got burnt to a crisp!! It took about 40 mins to walk across slowly but worth it! You can pay $150 dollars and walk over the bridge ( climb the highest point with a guide) but I felt I had seen enough just from walking across the main bridge for free! There was lots of people, cars and Sydney locals out for a morning jog! Certainly helped me to feel I was in Sydney for sure

Our Bridge!. The Sydney Harbour bridge is an icon for locals and tourists - as you fly into Sydney - it either welcomes a new friend, or signals greetings to welcome you home.I am often on the harbour looking up, but one of my favourite things is to walk across the bridge.

Iconic bridge. Called the coat hanger it is truly an iconic picture opportunity. I thoroughly recommend walking over the bridge for those of us who are afraid of heights. For the brave, Sydney harbour bridge climb.The bridge is access for cars and trains alike. You have the opportunity to climb one of the support towers which I think will give amazing views. If you are lucky when walking over the bridge you may encounter a liner underneath!
You can enjoy it without paying for the climb. Through North Sydney you can enjoy walking below the bridge and enjoy the view. Advisable to use public transit as parking is expensive.

Take the pylon climb. Everyone has seen the video about the 4-hr $200+ bridge climb. Plenty of people (mostly young - and Oprah) do it. However for $13 and 1 hour you can climb up the 202 step pylon and get almost the same view. The climbing is indoors with an observation deck at the top. The views are magnificent and certainly worth the effort.

Iconic!. Took a cab across and then walked back towards the Opera House side. Longish walk but well worth it - some excellent views towards Sydney and down to the water. Perfectly safe as walkway is a separate part of the bridge. Good buzz as there is plenty of foot traffic.

Sydney's Coat Hanger. One of the most iconic bridges in Australia, The Sydney Harbour Bridge is a breath-taking feat of architecture. Tip: if you have time, I recommended the bridge climb. The tour will take about 3 hours to complete the walk and you get some instructions beforehand. If you want to see Sydney in a different perspective, come and do the Harbour Bridge Climb.
you can't miss this view from the harbour. I will never actually take the bridge climbing tour, but I will watch the people from the ground in amazement
Just a bridge. We did not find anything remarkable past the general architecture, did not feel compelled to climb it, good for pictures, but pretty much, just a bridge!

Do the Bridge Climb!. An Iconic structure of Sydney. If you ever get the chance, do yourself a favor and to the Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. Although it is a little pricey, it is well worth the experience at least once in your lifetime.

The Coat Hanger. Australians have a delicate and wonderful method of naming their attractions. The Sydney Harbour Bridge has the nickname of the coat hanger and is opposite the Sydney Opera House in the harbour. It is impressive during the day and stunning at night!

Bridge to go over over under and through. Have walked over, drove through and sailed under this bridge. One of the iconic landmarks not just of Sydney but of the world. Bridge climb is not as bad as you would think it's very safe and wonderful views from the top
Great day out. Fantastic Piece of Art its wonderfull you can walk under it over it or on top of it unbelievable we walked over the bridge take your camera for great photo opportunities
On top of the world. This iconic landmark lives up to it's reputation, we had a great guide (thanks Dean) and the views from the top are spectacular - well worth the effort

I love Our Bridge. I have always loved our Harbour Bridge, I used to cross it daily to go to school and then in later years for work. When I fly into Sydney and see the bridge, I know I am truly home.The walk across the bridge is a great activity so to the Pylon tour and of course New Years Eve, when the bridge is the highlight of the fireworks display!
Good for photography. This giant bridge looks awesome... Good place to take photos with Harbour bridge in background... With view of opera house as well....
Icon of the city!. You can see this beautiful bridge from almost anywhere in Sydney! Thought about walking across, but it was an exceptionally hot day, so took the train instead.
A must visit place. Well worth walking onto the bridge, ten years ago I climbed to the top on a organised tour but guess won't bother on this visit but a must see place

Hire a Bike. I hired a bike from sydney bike tours and rode on the bridge it was good fun it's a bit hard at the start if your not fit as its uphill take your time going down hill you can get some serious pace highly recommend it.

The Bridge you can gaze, walk and climb. Unlike any other famous bridge, this one is the symbol of Sydney. The best part is that, its near to harbour and other major attractions. You can climb or walk over it. The walk is about of 20-25 min (depends how fast you walk). You will get an excellent view of Opera house from the Bridge. Do not forget to take a walk at least if you can't find a chance to climb.

A perfect birthday adventure. . After a guided tour of the Opera house and a super lunch at Café Sydney atop the old Customs building, what better than a surprise birthday Bridge Climb for my wife.  It had been a 30C day and was still very hot and humid when we turned up at the Bridge Climb Office for the 4:55 pm slot, pre booked by Internet.  The whole organisation is thoroughly professional from the suiting up and equipment briefings to the young guide accompanying us. Jackie, a 2nd year Uni student, was very experienced, socially skilled and as a blue eyed blonde, got my attention from the start, though there is nothing particularly attractive about our grey and blue polyester jump suits.  Everything was done with safety in mind, and at a pace to suit the slower members of our 12 strong group. We did the full Bridge Experience, which was not too strenuous, but lasted in all over 4 hours.  We were fortunate to have a lovely clear sunny day with winds of about 25 km/HR which was pleasantly cooling.  The views are spectacular, and the commentary on the construction and history and anecdotes were very interesting. We saw a lovely red sky as the sun began to set, and we're presented with certificates and a group photo at the top when we finished.  Though it may be considered expensive, it was a great experience which I am so glad to have completed.

Great cycle.. I cycled from the CBD to North Sydney along the Harbour bridge. The views are breathtaking. I stopped a few times to enjoy them. I went to Lavendar Bay after. Took great photos from Luna Park.

One of life's best experiences. First of all I don't like heights! Having said that the safety procedures are excellent and at no time did I feel afraid. If you're in Sydney you have to do this or you'll regret it forever! The view from the top is fabulous and the guides sensational.
Walk across it!. A wonder bridge with the most amazing view! You simple have to walk across it to get just amazing views!

HIGHLIGHT OF SYDNEY!. If you are visiting Sydney - this is a MUST! The view is stunning and the experience will be one you will never forget. It is a quite expensive but 100% worth it! I am afraid of heights and found it to feel secure, safe, and I didn't even get nervous. We did the Bridge Climb Express so the majority of your climb is on the lower track which feels safer and not as exposed. We also bought the picture package with up to 10 images on a USB which we recommend so you are sure to get the photo of your choice to keep. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Not to be missed. Climbing the Sydney Harbor Bridge climb is a unique experience and not to be missed. We did it at twilight. The views are majestic and truly 360. Can be a bit scary but my wife did it and loved it and she has major fear of heights.

See and Climb!!. You can gaze at the bridge from many places in the harbour, walk across the pedestrian walkway, or even better---climb it!The three hour climbs, in fully guided and attached groups, is an experience to remember!!! You learn so much about the bridge and Sydney and they guides are great. It is the best view in town and just plain fun to do.I wouldn't suggest it if you're incredibly out of shape, short of breath, or unsteady on your feet. There are some tight turns on the stars as you move up the bridge, but you are always attached to it. The website is pretty clear, and we made our reservations online. Families also seemed to love it.
Beauty.. Whether it be at a distance or you actually climbing the harbour bridge, this iconic structure is a marvel to see. It is perfect during a beautiful sunny day to have your picture taken with.

Walk the Bridge. A must do and it is free! Great views. After the conclusion of your back and forth jaunt hit the pubs Glenmore and Harbor View on the Sydney side right at the entrances to the bridge. Definitely recommend you do the Bridge Climb Sydney that occurs right over your head as you walk the bridge. You can't help but notice the climbers over your head!

A bridge with a View. I have wanted to walk the bridge for years and finally went for it. This is a pricey attraction and one could argue better ways to find value for the money. But, the views are really nice. I went for a twilight bridge climb. It was interesting to see the transition from day to night as the climb progressed. The views of the city, opera house, and harbor were amazing. Watching the sun set and the lights come on was beautiful. The whole package from check-in to leaving was around 3.5 hours. I never felt unsafe nor did I think there was much to fear from heights as you are attached by cable the entire time. I would recommend the Bridge Climb as long as you are ok with the cost.
Worth walking across. Its further than it looks but a great way to get from Circular Quay and The Rocks to Luna Park. Great views of the harbor and the Opera House.

Great bridge to jog over. Being a morning jogger, I enjoyed staying downtown and jogging over the bridge each day.It has stunning views of the city and the opera house. A must do walk or jog as a part of the trip.A tip is there is an elevator at the quay ( on opera house side) that takes you up to the path that allows you to run the entire area and back.
Beautiful!. I always like to go and see this lovely bridge, no matter day or night, early or late, sunny or cloudy, it is always giving me a nice feeling.

Excellent . The bad bit first, it's expensive but you know that when you pay.Secondly, we prepaid for photos but not enough were taken. I'd advise not to pay for this package but to but what you want when you get down.We took the twilight bridge climb and loved it. It's so safe and I have a fear of heights and was OK. Safety is paramount and we were guided by Jessica who was great. It was still light as we set off and pitch black as we came down but we're able to appreciate the lights of the city. A great experience.

don';t be afrain of the hype. the walk is far easier than advertaised and a must for the adventure lover and one who wants to see
sydney harbour and the opera house from a different vantage pointl. Extremely safe and not nearly as steep as expected this is a walk that if you have time, do.

Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. What an experience! My friend and I climbed to the top of the arch on the harbour bridge. As luck would have it, as part of the Chinese New Year celebrations there was a fireworks display as we reached the top - what a vantage point! The opera house was lit up in red as was the bridge. The views of the harbour and the city were amazing. One of the best experiences of my life, loved it. Megan our we Welsh guide was terrific, very patient and informative. We all wore head sets and Megan gave us lots of interesting info and facts along the way. Although not allowed to carry cameras etc for obvious reasons, photos are taken with the opera house and the city in the background. Everything was perfect until we went to pick up our photos when there was a little bit of confusion. We were the last party of the day and my friend and I were the last customers. The girl on the desk was impatient and clearly wanted to go home. It only slightly tarnished an otherwise awesome experience. One further disappointment is we haven't received the free video taken from the bridge despite entering our personal code and leaving my email address - that reminds me must contact them to see if it can be located. If in Sydney do it or regret it!

A nice walk along, even better if a cruise ship is leaving. The walk across the bridge is very manageable too. If coming from the South side, take the train to Milsons Point and then walk back towards the CBD. You'll end up in The Rocks, another great place to explore.Am a bit of nautical nerd so very much enjoyed watching one of the huge cruise ships leave while I stood on the bridge looking down.

Sydney Bridge Climb. A fantastic 3 & half hours climbing the Old Coat Hanger, at our age we might not travel to Oz from the UK again, so the bridge climb was a must, our climb guide was brilliant with loads of facts and figures about the bridge and she made us so relaxed before and during the climb, would recommend the climb, 4 drinking fountains on the climb as you are not allowed to carry anything with you, and she took great photographs of us during the climb.

Iconic ..... Our first view of the Bridge was at night from our hotel suite on the 14th floor, beautifully lit and its reflection shimmering in the dark waters of Sydney Harbour. Our hotel was a stone’s throw from the bridge so our daily strolls were always in the shadow of the bridge. It was great to pick out from our suite window, the tiny figures making their way on the Sydney Harbour Bridge walk. We were delighted to be seeing this iconic structure upfront and personal.

Great for morning walk. Walk over & back is a great way to feel part of the city. Take the Argyle steps just across the corner off Harrington St in the Rocks. Steps go up & up but then you'll be on the bridge.Walkers (& runners) on the East side, cyclists on the right.Walk over to Milson's Point, grab a coffee at one of several. Bay 10 is good for the urban cyclist hipsters.

The coat hanger. I can understand why this bridge is called the coat hanger, we arrived in Sydney by cruise ship and the bridge with the opera house in view on a lovely dawn sun rising morning was fantastic. We never got to climb the bridge as we were not brave enough but plenty of people did
Impressive, even after 10 visits. Totally impressed by it, even after living here for 4 months. Do go on a walk over the bridge, you get nice views as far as Rose Bay

Pretty from a distance.. Not so much close up . When you think of Sydney you think of the harbour bridge and when you see it for the first time it's pretty but when you see it close up not so much! Fireworks on a Saturday night are not to be missed!!

Wow a great site at the head of the harbour . Loved the bridge and all its stands for in Sydney. Fantastic but if you fear heights not for you. Easy to get to from the harbour but cost to climb 150 dollars. ( Aussie)

Great views. Thrilling, views of the overall harbor that can't be matched. Very well done with safety first. Having a fear of heights made me apprehensive. However, it was worth the effort. An accomplishment I will never forget. Highly recommended even for the faint of heart. We climbed on a warm clear day at noon. Fabulous.

Not the photo ops I had hoped for. Full disclosure: before getting to the bridge, I had not looked at up close pictures of it. When I got to the bridge before sunrise with the intention of taking lovely sunrise pictures, that was not possible. There is a very high fence running the length of the bridge that allows you to see out, but unable to take proper pictures. I enjoyed the walk, though, so not all was lost.
Sydney harbour bridge. Good fun and very safe. Not just for youngsters if you are reasonably fit. Bit over priced but the views and history were great

View half way up. We took the shorter bridge tour (senior discount!) and really enjoyed the views. They had a bit of history and pictures on the walls going up to the platform which was interesting to read. There were nice pubs and restaurants just a short way from there, including the oldest (smallest also!) pub in town. We were there on a Saturday and enjoyed a street market close to the bridge.
Great experience though cost a lot..:-). Perfect scenery,cool view, very very safe ..just a very unique experience that I would do once in lifetime :-)

Well worth doing . We hadn't really thought we would enjoy this but had heard & read so much about it we thought what the heck .Well it was fantastic and definitely worth doing , surprisingly not strenuousIt was a highly professional set up and the views were unrivalled .Our guide was very informative and if in doubt just do it
never tired of this icon. The place where I call home-history, timeless for cars, walkers and even climbers (yet to do!) A truly unique icon for Sydney-worth a wonder along...
A MUST!. i am not a height person but my lovely talked me into it, what an experience it was, perfect day with little cloud cover, you must give it a go!

Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. What a fun time we had doing this!!! At first we were hesitant because it is costly, but then we figured we'd make an online reservation and just do it since we don't go to Australia very often. We've got to try everything and we're so glad we did this! We decided to do the express climb which was a great decision for us. It's about 2 1/2 hours instead of the 4 hours it normally takes. There is less stopping and standing around and you still get to see everything everyone else sees. The views are awesome. The preparation is very thorough - paperwork, breathalyzer, headset, climbing suit, harness, clip on for the tether, etc. Everything is explained very well. You take nothing up there except for what they give you to take. This is all for safety reasons. They take pictures of you which you receive a free group shot and you have an option of buying other individual pictures. They are not pushy about buying the pictures at all. You don't need to be in great physical shape to do this climb - I'm not in super shape. But, if you are hesitant about going a little faster on the express climb due to not being able to keep up, you might want to choose the longer climbs where they stop more often. I would also recommend doing the climb during the early morning hours if you will be visiting during the warmer months.

best in te world. The Sydney Harbour Boasts an array of boats cars ships and Sydney itself, the best way to enjoy the Bridge is a tour of climbing it, but many people are on a tight budget or time limited, so for a couple of Dollars if you catch a train to Milsons point and walk over the bridge, taking in the sites, you will arrive at the rocks where it is great for breakfast lunch or dinner or just drinks,,, Allow yourself maybe 1-2 hours for the walk so you can have time to enjoy the views... good for Day or night
Magnificent sight. Stunning bridge even more impressive up close, fun to see if it from both sides as most of the pictures are from "the Rocks" side but just as impressive from the other side

The Stunning Sydney Harbour Bridge. Funnily enough you never think of a bridge as too many activities but Sydney Harbour Bridge offers amazing views and some great activities to try and visit as well.Firstly a must when visiting Sydney is the Bridge Climb yes you can actually take a tour of the top of the Sydney Harbour Bridge , great adventure and exhilarating to view the harbour from the top.You can catch a ride by train across the bridge and view it from that way if you are not into going ontop. You can also walk it and view , there are pylons you can visit then on Sundays under the bridge fabulous markets on Sydney side and Kirribilli side . Enjoy this icon.

Walk to the top of the harbour bridge. If you have the opportunity, the Harbour bridge walk is just an unforgettable experience! What an amazing view from the top! Doesn't matter if it is during the day or night you always will be surprised with the freedom feeling and the view from the top! It's something which I will definitely do again one day!
grand old coathanger. a major landmark of Sydney - great photos from ferries. Do the climb over the top, not as bad as it sounds.

ONE OF THE BEST ALL ROUND VIEWS. I live about 2 kilometres from the bridge and frequently run over the Bridge from home to the NSW Art Gallery and then turn around and get to go over the bridge for a second time - all up it is about 14 kilometres BUT the view from the bridge makes it all worth while. The 360 degree vista is simply breathtaking.

Totally terrific and such fun!. This climb was a Xmas present from my daughter Lyn. We arrived bright and early and excited. The day was a bit overcast but that proved to be a bonus as it kept the climbing cooler. After we were kitted out in our very fashionable gear and given a short talk on what to expect, we were off. There were 13 of us and our guide Chris. He proved to be very knowledgable about the Bridge and kept up a running commentary while we negotiated walkways and ladders. Climbing proved to be very easy and there were water fountains along the way. We were soon way above the traffic looking out over the most beautiful harbour in the world. The views were just marvellous and Chris pointed out many of Sydney's landmarks including, of course, the magnificent Opera House. For safety reasons, nothing can be taken on the climb, including cameras and mobile phones. Chris had a camera and was more than happy to oblige with photo opportunities and when we returned, we could see all the shots he had taken and decide on which ones we wanted.I would suggest before the climb, go through the museum and see how the bridge was built. It is fascinating. And also note all the celebrities who have climbed before you, including a 100 year old lady! Definitely an attraction not to be missed when visiting Sydney.
One of a kind!. Walking over the Sydney Harbour Bridge will take your breath away. The views you see from the bridge are incredible. If you are a thrill seeker try the bridge climb!

This makes Sydney Harbour. Don't waste your time paying to walk over the Harbour Bridge you can do it for free over and over again. A Sydney treasure that you can view from a distance, by foot, under it by boat, day or night.

Harbour bridge climb . This is a sydney must for anyone coming to AusThere is no better place to see the harbour than from the top of the bridge Night tours are great as well to see the city and harbour light up

Must do bridge walk.. Very pleasant easy 20 minute walk over the harbour. Wonderful views and a great way to get a different view of the harbour. We went from the city across to Kirribilli. Easy to find the start as you can get maps it just ask anyone in the area. You can stop at the pylon if you want to pay for a little history.

Nice walk across the iconic bridge.. We had a bit of difficulty finding the stairway in the Rocks to get up to the bridge, we asked many locals and they didn't know. We wanted to watch the sunset from the bridge but with all the problems finding the way up we missed it. It was still a nice walk with great views of the harbor and a different view of the opera house. The area on the other side of the harbor was pleasant with little cafes and shops.

Awesome experience, 'bucket list' ticked off. If I could start with a negative,….. the cost!! over $500 for two people……. We flew to Perth for less.All good apart from that. Our guide Phoebe was a delight. She was knowledgeable and made our three hour experience very enjoyable. Not the best with heights, I was quickly reassured that it wouldn't feel that way once on the bridge ascent. The views were better than I imagined and the walk, interspersed with commentary from our guide Phoebe was very easy, with stops along the way for photographs and views.

Best views in Sydney!. If coming from North Sydney on the train alight at Milsons point and walk the entire length of the bridge. Fantastic views and a sea breeze. Opera house, cruise ships in port, circular quay are all easy to view. End your walk by walking through the historic Rocks and down to circular quay.

Don't leave Sydney without climbing the bridge!. Admirably the bridge climb isn't cheap, but it is well worth the price! It was the most amazing experience.The entire experience takes about three hours but you only spend about half of the actually climbing. The first half of the day is spent going through safety and getting kitted out in your jumpsuits and hats and radios.The climb itself isn't particularly strenuous, for the most part it's just like walking up and down stairs (Though my calf muscles were a bit tender for a few days afterwards!!) and you're clipped on the entire way up and down.The guides are very informative and entertaining with lots of stories about the bridge and when it was being built. The stop you in about 3 or 4 places to take photos. I don't think I can describe how beautiful the view is, it's just breath taking. There are points where you can see straight down into the water, but the higher up you get the less that happens. When you're climbing the arch itself you can't see through at all. I'm afraid of heights and I had no problems at all. Seriously, if you do anything in Sydney, let it be this!
Must Walk. A 30 walk. Bring Walter. Great experience. Cooler in the morning. No benchs so if you get tired, tough luck.

Walked over. Nice relaxing views . Heavy traffic on one side and serene views on the other. Onslaught of joggers and runners right at the middle.May not be a good idea to pose for pics,but the people were patient nevertheless.

We loved it. .well worth it 😁😁. Went on the bridge climb at 5.15pm. O.M.G...it was just brilliant. Our guide was a great young man called Adam who was so friendly and helpful it was like we had known him for years!! Very knowledgeable and very reassuring....however his jokes were terrible....funny but terrible!! The climb was really easy not a physical as you think.....very safe and great fun. The views are just amazing!! You will not be dissapointed. It was a 2 hour climb for $260 this includes a group photo. A hat and video. Overall takes 3 hours with safety talk and to get all the gear sorted. Our group was 10 people of mixed ages and we all had a great time. We loved it!!

Don't Miss Walking Across the Harbour Bridge. As beautiful as it is impressive in stature, the Harbour Bridge offers a unique perspective of the opera house and the harbour itself. It's worth the hike up the steps to get to the walking path. It's a great place to get some exercise while taking in the amazing view. There are security guards posted periodically, not that we ever felt unsafe or exposed in any way. We really enjoyed walking from The Rocks area over to North Sydney and then down by the shore as far as the path would allow. We watched groups of people climb to the top of the bridge, but we were happy just walking across on the pedestrian path.
Must Visit. A must Visit for any traveller to Sydney. I would recommend hiring a bike and cycling over the bridge and also doing the bridge climb although this is expensive.
Midnight hike. After visiting Bondi and Manly in 1 day, we decided to hike the bridge at midnight. All I can say is "AMAZING"!!!!!!!!!!!

visit the place during sunset. a must visit place when u visit Sydney.have a walk near opera house where u can see the Harbour bridge very clearly..we saw some people climbing on the bridge..which is on my list on my net visit to Sydney

Great views, and a nice walk!. You walk across to Luna Park from The Rocks, one side is for pedestrians, and the other for cyclists, what a great idea! There's an option to go over the top, I wish I had the time to do it, it would have been amazing!You get an awesome view of the Sydney Opera House, The Rocks, North Sydney, and more that I don't know about. A great way to spend an hour or so.
Awesome. A great sight to see! We walked over the bridge and enjoyed looking toward the Opera house very safe and then we climbed up the python to top! $13 very worth while!

Great Bridge Climb. The climb takes about 3 hours. You change into climb suits and are all tethered together with a guide at the lead. Our guide was very informative with all the spectacular sites that you see from the bridge. We took the tour in the evening and it gives a great night time view of the city. I highly recommend it.
Walking the bridge . This is one of your things on your bucket list:-) quite expensive but worth it. Amazing view and a bit scary if you are afraid of hights.

Walked Across not Over. We were not brave enough to walk along the top, but did walk across the span, at the level of traffic. Great views of Sydney and did not cost $200+. Not well marked, as to how to get there, so make sure you have a map

Great views & exercise!. My wife and I walked across the bridge both ways. One side is for walkers and the other for cyclists.Great views of Sydney, the river, Opera Circular Quay. Had a lovely coffee & cake on the other side before returning.

We climbed the bridge. We're not that young, so wondered about doing this. It was fantastic and can thoroughly recommend it. You need to be fairly fit but if you are, then do it. The climb staff are helpful and caring.
Fantastic climb. On Friday my 2 friends and I climbed the Sydney harbour bridge .. Best birthday experience ever and a huge thank you to Matt who took us up there .. He was awesome ..
valintine. this is one of the amazing bridges I have seen the way it was built and at night it even looks better

Best is the Twilight Climb!. Best to take the twilight climb as you climb during daytime and as you reach the top, you are in time to witness the sun setting and descend as the night fall. Great photo opportunities during daytime and night time!

Beautiful day to climb our Iconic Bridge. We chose the twighlight climb and it was fabulous, the view is amazing. We enjoyed the commentary as well great for tourists or interstate visitors like we were. I loved watching the sun go down and the Sydney landscape begin to change. A definite must !!

Amazing. Thoroughly enjoyed the overall experience even although it was a wet windy evening with the threat of thunderstorms. My wife who is afraid of heights felt safe and secure thanks to the staff and the whole process. Would recommend it to anyone visiting Sydney.

wrong day selection. overall it was very nice
we went there on 31 dec.
the day selected can never be worse!!!!
no parking
rush rush rush!!!!
nobody advised(we never ASKED) it will be so packed on that day!!!
The view!!!. The view of this bridge and the harbour behind it is simple amazing! and it only gets better! The view FROM this bridge is simply breathtaking!
One of the most amazing view in Sydney. It was in the afternoon on a busy day. But it calms you down with the peaceful environment. You can take 100’s of beautiful photographs.
awesome. Defiantly something to climb if you can afford but either way there is a museum in the bridge that offers an amazing view as well defiantly something that you should check out and explore.

stunning beauty. All aspects of the Sydney Harbour bridge are stunning. The free walk to and across allows you to see many aspects at your own pace and take as many photos as you like with you in them and of the magnificent views. For a greater experience and to view the magic of the bridge itself along with the harbour it crosses there truly is not better experience than the BridgeClimb. As a Sydney Sider who has watched fireworks from the bridge for years, been on the water, walk, driven and caught a train across the bridge I wasn't so sure I would find the bridge climb even more captive but I was very very wrong. The bridge climb is just amazing. Try the last climb before sunset, it is a little cheaper and you can often get the sunset too. To see all aspects, to hear about the amazing engineering of the bridge, how it is so strong and walk its beauty is just magical. If you are worried about being afraid of heights... I can honestly say I was shaking prior to it and for no reason. The arch steps you walk are not steep and its a gradual climb, its not on the edge and you are harnessed in the whole time. The guides are great and allow you to take your own time and check in with you. There are two vertical ladder areas that are not wonderful for those of us scared of heights but if you listen to your guides advise to just pace yourself, and focus on each step, not looking down rather across , it truly makes all the difference.

Easy Climb with an Amazing View. The Sydney Bridge Climb is a great experience for any first timers in Sydney. The climb itself is very safe, climbers are harnessed to the bridge 100% of the climb as well as the climb being almost more of a walk then a climb. Short of a few sets of stairs that a bit steep, the "climb" is more of a low inclined walk, you don't have to be super fit to make it to the top.The top of the bridge offers an amazing view of the harbor, opera house, and the city that you can't get anywhere else. Unfortunately, climbers cannot bring cameras along (because of potentially dropping them onto an active road), but the guides stop a view times along the way to take pictures of the climbers. The guides also offer some history and information of the bridge and city during the tour which is interesting to hear.The tour takes a few hours between the preparation, ascent (which includes stops and pictures), and descent. In my opinion, the stops were a bit to frequent and long in duration but some people may enjoy those stops more. For others that may be looking for a bit quicker experience with less stops, there is an accelerated climb option available (which is cheaper and I wish I had given more thought beforehand). The accelerated climb apparently goes further along the underside of the bridge (instead of walking along the top arch) before ascending stairs to the stop of the bridge. I did not take the accelerated climb so I can not say exactly how the experience really compares, but I would consider it if you think ~3 hours may be too long for the climb.
Amaing. did the bridge climb, will do it again if i have the money. to bad cant bring my camera up there.. great experience
Great views of the harbour . Do the free walk across the bridge rather than the expensive bridge climb if you want to take photos. Fabulous views and a refreshing breeze on a hot summers day
Beautiful Old Bridge. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is truly a beautiful old bridge, especially at night with all the lights on. Best view is from the Opera House at night.

Magnificent View. Thanks to Mr. Bradfield we have a wonderful symbol. This is especially if you have the chance to do the BRIDGE CLIMB. It may be considered expensive but once you have done it you are so glad you did. It is an amazing sight and experience.
Impressive. Great to discover that this bridge was constructed by Dorman Long Steelworks at Middlesbrough, England.

Had to pinch ourselves. Could hardly believe we were in Sydney. The bridge we've seen so many times in photo's and on TV was where we were. It was an easy and wonderful walk with people from all over the world. The views are amazing. Lots of security people around. We did not walk the arch, although many did.
An engineering marvel. This bridge is an absolute marvel of the modern world! it is so beautiful and looks so nice in any weather!
An Engineering Marvel. A mammoth steel structure, is a testimony to the great skills of the engineers of those times. Provides facilities for thrilling adventure for those who seek thrills.

Walk the Bridge and Enjoy the Harbour (for FREE). The Bridge is free to walk on the Eastern side. Delightful walk to take in the beautiful views of the Sydney Harbour.
