It's safe and guarded by security in various place and you can walk at your own pace, stopping when you want. The Western side is for bikes only. Enjoyable and Free!

View View and more View, must be the best in Sydney!. I have done a day and night one but not sure what is the best, they are so different, the night one is so beautiful and the day one is full of sail boats, ferries and Huge ships so do two!

Great technical achievement. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is one of the most iconic bridges in the world and one of the first things people think of when they think Australia. Exciting to drive accross but much better to look at!

Retirement round the world - second stop and a "Should do". Don't do heights, but climbed the Sydney Harbour Bridge. So pleased we did, it's an achievement in my book. It's not actually that strenuous but the views are "Wow".You are totally safe attached by a cable to the bridge and the "Guide" is invariably brilliant and relaxed and puts you totally at ease.My wife and I (60+) loved it.

Sightseeing. one of sydney attractionss is the harbour bridge. You see it from Circular Quay, havea loook from the Opera, from a harbour cruise, climb it, go and drive over it. You can visit the museum in one of the towers near the Rocks.

Iconic. We climbed the bridge on Australia Day! Wow what a view, what an experience. I am afraid of heights and not very fit or agile but I found the climb no problem. They really let you control the pace.

Checked off the bucket list. Climbed the bridge, saw a beautiful panoramic view of Sydney. Overcame my fear of heights (with the help of excellent and patient guides) and saw a view more spectacular than expected. Would recommend to all
horribly expensive. The charge for climbing the bridge is ridiculous, it is a nice sight but not worth climbing up. Dont waste your time here

The bridge is an icon. To see the bridge you have to climb it.That is a unique experience and no to be missed. You go to the top where the flags are and come down on the other side. The views of the Opera House and the harbor are simply breathtaking.

Great walk. Walking across the bridge may not be quite the thrill of the bridge climb but it is free and offers fabulous views of its own. You can climb to the top of one pylon for a small fee and get some history too.

View to remember. Sydney Harbour Bridge is the link into the city. Sometimes the traffic is very hectic. One challenge not to miss is the bridge walk. Very exhilarating! For the less brave, just walk along the fenced off road. The views are absolutely stunning. It gives you a very good idea of areas nd the vast space that you are in.if you are lucky, you will see one or more of the cruise ships in the harbour. Amazing sight to see the size of these ships.A visit to Sydney is a must and definitely the unforgettable views of the harbour bridge are not to be missed.

The "Coathanger". One of the great bridges of the world, spanning one of the greatest harbours of the world.You can drive over it, walk over it, catch a train over, sail under it and you can even climb it.Built during the Depression era and is highly recognisable from many aspects.Synonymous with Sydney, it beats at the heart of this great city and one can only imagine what Sydney would be without this connection between the two sides of the harbour.Well worth a visit, a crossing, a climb or just take it in from the many vantage points
Ride over the bridge. I recommend you grab your motorcycle and ride it over the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Just one of those things you have to tick off.
Must go for the Bridgeclimb !. I took my whole family to climb to the top of the bridge. It was the highlight of our visit to Sydney
Spectacular example of engineering.. We walked along the footpath on the bridge well worth the walk for the views and the journey across the bridge.
Superb cracker show. Most amazing and beautiful cracker show on new years eve.. I feel it's a must watch in life.. Best view from garden closest to bridge!!

I did it easy. I was worried about the climb as I do has a fear of heights. But you have nothing to worrie about. You are locked onto a line and I felt very safe. We had head phones on so you get a running commentary of facts about the bridge. The view was the best too much to take in so I'll have to do it again. Put it on the bucket list.

Great Time Filler. When in Sydney take the opportunity to walk across the bridge. Either side their are great places for walks (Kirrabilli to the north and the Rocks and Circular Quay to the south). The views from the bridge are spectacular and free.
Been over this bridge 100 times. I recommend to go see Sydney Harbour Bridge in your life time It's a must Travelled of it countless times.Amazing Structure

Taking a boat ride around Sydney Harbour. Absolutely breath taking one of the most iconic sights you may ever see along with the Sydney Opera house and all the lovely views around the Harbour. And one of the best things we found that for a few Dollars you can buy a couple of tickets that allows you to hop on a train bus and the green boats in the Harbour The last time we were here we took a boat ride up the Paramatic river I think I got that right it took about 1 1/2 hours each way we also took a train ride to Bondi Beach and caught the bus back and to top it all there are some lovely places to eat along the Harbour highly recommended well worth a visit Frank and Rosemary Devon UK
Incredible. We climbed the bridge! It was amazing and an absolute must do when visiting this city! The staff were fantastic and made sure everyone was comfortable every step of the way!!

See it, Climb it. Harbour Bridge is a part of our everyday lives as we zoom past it. Couple of things to do take a ferry the ride is beautiful, climb the bridge the view is spectacular and ofcourse go to the Rocks...

Must do, for visitors and residents alike. Bridge climb, what a fantastic way to see Sydney. The bridge may look huge, but surprisingly, it is a very gentle climb, with long and shallow steps up to the top of the arch. Before they let you out on the site you are walked through what to do and try out a trial set of steps. The approach to the pylon (the sandstone towers at each end of the Bridge) you actually walk underneath the roadway above and have a great view of the old fort archaeological site below. You are attached to a line securely for the entire time, wearing your very fetching grey onesy. It is not the cheapest attraction, but well worth it.

Great view from the top of the bridge or just from the pedestrian walkway. When in Sydney you should walk across the Harbour Bridge for a spectacular view. If you don't want to spend money then just take the pedestrian walkway across the bridge for views down the harbour and watch the activities on the harbour - ferries, cruise ships, sailing boats. If you want a really sensational activity then take the bridge climb to the top of the arch with views up & down the harbour and across the city and surrounding areas.

Climb it , bike it ,walk it or sail under it. The bridge is a great way to get a free view of the harbour. Walking path is on the eastern side and bike/skate path on the western side. Enter from the north at Milsons point or the Rocks near Circular quay. Bridge climb offers an expensive way to climb to the top with a 2-3 hour experience. East side pylons is open, 9-5pm to walk up with the history of the bridge and a good view ($13 adults/$6.50 kids) which is just as good as the climb in my books. A fun way is to walk one way and get the ferry back so you sail under it. Weekend markets at the Rocks is a great way to finish.

Great for climbing on a sunny day. I did the bridge climb on Australia Day in beautiful weather so it's very easy to say how great it was. The guides are friendly, interesting and knowledgeable and the climb itself is not at all taxing. We were in a group of 6 people, all of different abilities and ages. It isn't even too bad if you are slightly wary of heights as the walkway is so wide.That said, I can imagine a rainy day would be miserable and very cold at the top. My only slight gripe was that it took such a long time to do, you need to set aside a few hours and there is some waiting at the top so you can get cold.

One of those places that looks amazing no matter what. The sydney harbour bridge is one of those things that looks absolutely amazing no matter what! I've seen it twice, once during perfect weather and once during a thunderstorm and I honestly like the look of it during the storm better!

Wonderful experience, great views!. I was lucky enough to climb to the top of the bridge before the present Bridge Climb was introduced, so I had the added excitement of climbing without ropes, although it was pretty safe. You feel on top of the world. It really feels as though you are on top of the world.
Amazing..simply amazing. The beautiful Sydney Harbour Bridge with the magnificent Harbour backdrop, restaurants, cafe's it has it all

Fabulous Views. Walking from The Rocks across the Sydney Harbour Bridge is one of the most pleasant things to do when visiting this wonderful city - and it's free! The walk only takes approximately 15 minutes at a leisurely pace. Many local Sydneysiders walk across the bridge to work, beware of the joggers and keep to the left. The view walking from Kirribilli to the city is the best, and if one doesn't wish to walk both ways, there is a train from Milsons Point which will get you back into the city in minutes.

Nothing says Sydney more eloquently than this magnificent bridge. Spanning the popular harbour, this fabulous structure joins the South to the North with 8 lanes for vehicles, two for trains and one pathway each for pedestrians and cyclists

A beautiful walk across the Sydney Harbour Bridge. I have lived in Sydney my whole life and still found the experience breathtaking..the views of Sydney Harbour from the top of the bridge..you just cannot beat it...don't worry if you are a little concerned about heights as it an easy climb and your attached to the railing the whole time and very well briefed before you start...I have seen it during the day and at dusk and I will do it again....a must when visiting Sydney

Beautiful. The Sydney harbour bridge is one of the worlds most well known bridges. You can drive, catch the train or walk from one side to the other enjoying the beautiful harbour view. If you like more of a thrill take the bridge walk over the the top of the bridge

Had a great bridge climb. Took a bridge climb with my Dad a few years ago on the occasion of Father's Day. The climb was fairly easy and we were secured to avoid any accidents. The view from the top was to die for. Highly recommended.

amazing view for a good day. I tell all my friends (including locals) that this is a must do - it can be windy and there isnt much protection from the elements so choose the day - easy access and quite a pleasant stroll with a million dollar plus view

One of the great Icons of Sydney. Sydney is situated on one of the most beautiful harbours in the world. No visit is complete without a harbour cruise, which will show case both the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. notable for its fireworks display on new years eve. And there is a bridge climb option as well.A must see in Sydney, but hard to miss wherever you happen to be.

Takea Walk on Harbour Bridge. Harbour Bridge is an important icon of Sydney. It has stone piers that you can walk up inside for a view. You can also sign up for a walk on top of the bridge and the prices range from $225 to $350 depending on the time of day you wish to go - dusk was the most expensive. You where jump suit coveralls and there are sturdy wire railing on either side of the walk. They have groups of people walking together. Give it a try.

What a Sight!. This is a beautiful sight to see! The architecture of this bridge is wonderful. I had hurt my leg so unable to walk on top of it. Something I would love to do though. When you think of Sydney, you think immediately of the Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge. They are right across from each other and both are must sees.
Beautiful view!. I been on, over, & under this bridge..Lovely scenery and you can feel the history! and a short walk to the best fish & chips in the world!

Its the one place you cannot get bored with in Sydney but how does karaoke come into it?. If exhilaration be your oxygen, than the Karaoke Bridge Climb is the rarefied air- zone to aim for. There are lots of pluses to this adventure. It stands there, an icon of girded steel, a testimonial iconic landmark visible from anywhere on the harbour and its pretty suburbs,You join groups of 12-14 other 'happy-chappies' with an assigned instructor who guides you while climbing with you. We did the Express Bridge Climb as we had further pursuits to accomplish, so the lower rim of the bridge took us up to the summit by crossing over to the upper rim at the centre. The entire fantastic experience took a little over two hours but what an exhilarated two hours. Accompanying you and the whistle of the wind is a babel of tongues ... Mandarine... Korean, Japanese... Israeli and various versions of English. But how does karaoke come into it? Well, when you get to the top, flushed with the gigantic good-feel of your experience, what better way then to express your love than to sing or bellow your version of a song marking the success of your epic climb. We chose a k-pop song and have the memory in an 8 second video to keep nauseating friends entertained. Its the best $280 bucks per person ever.

Must climb it!. The harbour bridge is wonderful seen from a ferry ,from the Opera House and from the Rocks but it is great to climb it and it is not scary at all! So book ,get your ticket and go on a beautiful day ,this is the must and if you climb it at the sunset even better....

Best view at harbour and Opera. We were in Sydney druring spring and the sun was really bright. I had some affraids that walking on the bridge might be exchausting under the sun but indeed it was wonderful to be able to see all this beauty from above! Dont miss its not that long walking but use a sun protector.

Spectacular! See it! Climb it! . My wife and I did the Bridge Climb tour a couple years ago and it was amazing! It is totally safe! For Chinese New Year, and maybe other occasions, they light the bridge up with red lights. See pictures. Even if you don't do the "climb", you can walk across it! Visiting Sydney? Take the train to Circular Quay stop and see the bridge and opera house.

Bridge near the Opera House. You can visit the Opera House and glance over the bay to see the Harbour Bridge.. the largest (not longest) steel arch bridge in the world. Apparently you can climb it, but we did not as we only had 3 days in Sydney. Interesting to look at.
Walk the bridge. Visiting Sydney well this must b top of list great views all round don't need b super fit 2 complete guides are very knowledgable about the bridge and surrounding areas
Quite a Stunning Bridge. We did not climb---- however if you are a thrill seeker go for it ...you can see the climbers as they make it to the top-- this bridge is a great backdrop in the harbor

Amazing climb. The climb may be expensive, but you won't regret it for a second. If you're brave enough do the full climb, pay the extra, it's well worth. Our instructor was so helpful and informative, making the climb enjoyable throughout. And the views are amazing, couldn't recommend it more.

Had to cancel .... Personal tragedy meant leaving Sydney the day I arrived. I had to cancel this once-in-a-lifetime experience a few days before. They were very accommodating and graciously refunded my pre-booked fare. I WILL be back to Sydney and I WILL climb this bridge!

Amazing amazing amazing!!!!! . The climb was amazing!! The guide Mich was so funny and really knowledgable about the bridge and Sydney. We watched the sunset as we did the twilight walk, which was fantastic and then as we walked back down massive fire works started which just made it even better. If you get a chance to go you must go it is a once in a lift time thing!!!!

Another view of Sydney. Take a walk from Wynyard to Milson Point and see the difference in scenery that will wow your imagination. Love the architecture and how symbolic the Harbour Bridge means to locals.

Climb it!. It is not cheap but it is definitely worth climbing the bridge. The views are amazing and it is one of those activities that you will always cherish. They won't allow your phone or camera on the climb but will take plenty of photos which you can purchase for an arm and a leg... but again, worth it!

A view from above. Spectacular view from the top of one of the worlds most recognisable landmarks, the Sydney harbour bridge. Tour guide was well informed and fun. A bit pricey, but if your up for something different while in Sydney, it certainly is worth it.

Iconic bridge for S hemisphere. Beautiful from underneath or on top must do whilst your in Sydney. Take a ferry from circular quay to Balmaine and cross below. Or bridge walk (careful you must book...$400AD)
Super experience. Brilliantly organised, fabulous experience. The guide who took us up was really knowledgeable. Expensive but highly recommend

A Must See. We didn't have time to walk the bridge, but we got great views of it from The Rocks neighborhood. It is a Sydney icon, of course, but it also is a fine piece of engineering that has held up well over its 80+ years. If you can walk it, by all means do it, but the view from the ground and the harbor are great too.
sydney icon. what a amazing place to feel like woo.outstanding landmark.Perfect for any time to walk through.Nice environment.

Fantastic Experience. Climbed the bridge mid January. Fantastic. Spectacular views, Highly recommend as a must see-do when visiting Sydney. Can't wait to climb the bridge again - and I used to be scared of heights!!!!!!

A must visit when in Sydney. This is a great place to be. Sydney Harbour and the Bridge plus the wonderful Opera House are well known all over the world. But to be actually here is quite wonderful. If you get the chance do THE BRIDGE CLIMB. It's mind boggling, the views fantastic.

Under, over and through it. . We went under it, on it, looked at it from above and touched it! Kids had it embedded in their heads from the media and now they can relate. Clean etc but really it's just a bridge. To climb it was $892 for 4 of us. A little steep unfortunately.

Best seen from the harbour. Sorry to say that close up and driving across it it is pretty unremarkable. However once out in the harbour & looking back towards it WOW. Together with the Opera house it's amazing

Another tick off the list. It was great to see the bridge from the ferry the views are stunning in every direction so much to take in I took a ferry from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay for 6 Australia Dollars. No need for expensive sight seeing trips.

Bridge Bonanza. Sydney Harbour Bridge is waiting for you to walk across it, go by train over it or just drive to the other side. The panorama as you cross is stunning and everyone should experience "The Coat Hanger".

Expensive but it worth! They could invest in a professional photographer!!. I was luky to be not rain, and your photos be an disaster! The guide was great! But they could invest in a better machine and a professional photographer to take our pictures! The photos could be more than just that!

2 days in Sydney. This together with the Opera House are two most important landmarks of Sydney. You can see the bridge together with the Opera House and if you were in the city on weekend, you can go to the Bridge Market just next to the bridge.

Walk the bridge on arrival. Landing in Sydney after flying from the east coast of the USA leaves even hardened business travelers stiff and tired. To get into the mix quickly my colleagues and I walked across the Harbour Bridge on a beautiful blue skies day. The walk loosened the muscles and the views kept us looking every step of the way. The iconic opera house, different community views and the bridge itself drew our minds into a place of creativity and teamwork. Many new ideas and recommendations were born crossing those blue waters. It's fantastic that the government keeps this walk open and available to all. Great for families, there is no risk of falling and there are foot police walking the bridge so it is safe. Afterwards make sure to walk down by the water on the opera house side to read the big plaque about the building of the bridge. Then walk up to the right and thru the park. You'll end up at the top of the area called the Rocks, a wonderful area of eclectic shopping and dining. The more adventuresome will want to walk up to the top of the bridge. Visit the storefront where the bookings begin at least and see the many celebrity pictures of them on top of the bridge. Enjoy refreshments at one of many pubs down under on the Rocks. (The pun was unavoidable.). Happy views. J

A walk on the Bridge. To walk across is a walk in time, it has been there over eighty years.From the bridge you get top views of the Harbour and the Sydney Opera House.If you go from circular quay side on the way back you can drop down the stairs and walk back around the water front.

Harbor bridge clumb. The bridge climb is something everyone talks about and it is really a unique experience and view.It was not cheap, our trip was $200 US and it took about 2 1/2 to 3 hours but time flew by. I was a little concerned about the height before we went but never really noticed it once we were going.The crew was very friendly from the get go. From the check in desk to the prep people to the climb guides, they were all sincere in their efforts to make us comfortable and welcome. The prep stage includes signing papers, getting "suited up" and a practice climb. You wear a jump suit and everything is attached so nothing can fall off. Even your sunglasses are given clips so you don't loose them. They give you a breath test to be sure you are not impaired. It is really and air test- they have you count to 5 and check what you exhale. They offer a photo package for about $69 USD. While it sounds expensive (and it is) the photos were awesome and they included extra photos of the bridge from the day and night. I think the package was worth it. I love the photos. Everyone gets a group photo.While prepping, we were told due to heat, strip to underwear under jump suit so when you finish you have clean dry clothes to wear. So as a tip, you may want to bring a change of clothes. They give you secure lockers to store your belongings in. The guide told many stories and took the photos while climbing. He made it interesting and continually checked everyone asking if they were ok or had questions. As for the height, it wasn't something to worry about. First of all you are in a harness attached to the railing. The tether slides along as you walk hardly noticeable. The walkway or stairs are about 4 ft wide. The bridge is big enough you feel no fear or worry about being exposed. Prior to going on the bridge they had climb a small set big stairs up and down to be sure you were comfortable and able to do it. To me the climb was more a leisurely walk on some stairs, with numerous stops to take in view and rest. There were two or three water stops. There were ladder like areas in the climb going up to the bridge and quite a few of us banged our shins but nothing serious.I loved it, would do it again and recommend it!!Ps. They go in almost all kinds of weather. They showed up rain gear, headlamps, and fleeces for chilly nights or mornings.

Viewed from the ferry. We hopped on a ferry at Darling Harbour and went to Circular Quay, this was a great way to see the Harbour Bridge (and the Opera House) there was a large cruise liner manoeuvring in the busy harbour at the time which added to the spectacle

Spectacular and unpredictable. Together with the Opera House, they are Sydney's most famous landmarks. Nicknamed Coathanger it was opened in 1932 by Premier Jack Lang and carries 8 road lanes, 2 rail tracks, 1 pedestrian way and 1 cycleway. It is the sixth longest spanning-arch bridge in the world (1.149 m) and the tallest steel arch bridge (134 m).It's equipped for tidal flow operation, to suit better to the direction of the traffic flow during the rush hour. 8 lanes: 1 and 2 always flow north, 6, 7 and 8 always flow south and the remaining 3, 4 and 5 are reversible. It's a toll bridge and the amount varies from $ 2.50 to $ 4.- depending on the time of the day.Many people want to climb on the top of the arch, something difficult and only for very fit persons. But you may take no photos, because you aren't allowed to carry anything with you. Since 2006 there is an alternative climbing to the upper arches of the bridge.For the pedestrians it's not so easy as it seems to be. From The Rocks area, it's a little bit complicated, because the signposts are not enough.You see the bridge from almost every point of The Rocks but you can't reach it.In short, you must be well prepared for a long walk uphill and another long walk on the bridge itself. The Pylon lookout has another 200 steps to climb but I think the view is almost the same from anywhere on the bridge.Good luck and be patient, the view is worth it!

No matter your age, just has to be done. Having climbed the bridge a few years ago, I encouraged my wife to join me the next time I went. She was a little nervous of the potential effort involved however ended up elated at the thrill of doing this great activity. It isn't just the view that is exciting but the great feeling of being on top of this spectacular structure and surveying everything going on below and around.The leader put is completely at ease and once we went through all the preparation everything was quite leisurely. The few sets of step ladders were climbed with reasonable ease and once you start on the bridge properly it remains a gentle climb. You don't have to be particularly fit and energetic (though it helps) as you frequently stop and points on the way.I cannot speak more highly of this activity. It isn't cheap however a must do if you are in Sydney.
Beautiful Even In Bad Weather!. An absolutely beautiful place! the whole harbour was beautiful even in the rain! I can only imagine what it looks like in good weather.

Fabulous view. The "coat hanger" as it is affectionately known as spans Sydney Harbour and is an icon of this beautiful city. The area around the rocks also features cafes,old pubs and architecture from Sydney's first settlement. Definitely do the bridge climb its very safe and the views from the top are spectacular.

Bridge Climb. This was the second time for me but the first time for my wife. I would not say its a hard climb but not for people who don't like heights. Last time I done it was 8 years ago and it still impressed this time around - I don't think I would do it again as I think twice (for me) is enough but still it was a good day. Twilight climb was well worth it.

Climb!!!!!!!. One of the wonderfull attractions in Sydney.Don't have a simple walk on the bridge.Climb on it and feel the king of the world.The great view and the feelings on the bridge can't be described.

Cool bridge. Awesome bridge. Go for the "museum" and observation deck - good views and good insight into history of construction of bridge. Interesting and only ~$12. Skip the $300 climb. You get almost same views from walking across for free. Don't forget your cameras!
Brilliant experience. I did the main climb. It was well organised and lead. The climb not too bad as there are plenty of stops, tour guides very knowledgeable and friendly.

A World Icon. If in Sydney its impossible to miss this imposing structure.
It is a beautiful backdrop for the opera house.
There is a tour to walk over the top of the bridge for those adventurous types.

Nice view of the Circular Quay and Sydney CBD. I walked across the bridge to the end on a sunny mid-afternoon and walked back. There were tons of fit people jogging across the bridge. Saw people simply walking in work clothes. There were like 4 security guards several meters apart. My guess is thousands of people walk this bridge daily. I think on the other side are cyclists.I used the map given by Imfree tours to figure out the entrance point for walking across the bridge. Started from the Rocks. As I got closer, I noticed there were people walking to the bridge so I sort of followed their direction. I definitely recommend doing the walk. Not too long of a walk. Great views. Fresh, cool air. I stopped several times to take a photo.
Glad we did the climb. The Harbour Bridge is very impressive wherever you see it from, doing the climb is something else and I'm so glad we did it.

Pleasant half hour walk. Walked from the Luna Park side back towards the city. I guess Aussies walk on the left instead of on the right as us Americans do but I'm deathly afraid of heights and got nervous walking close to the edge. I got a few glares for walking in the center and nudged by a large woman with a larger tote bag. This was the first time I experienced rudeness from an Aussie; they've been exceptionally friendly and down to earth otherwise. So, if you're afraid of heights, I would walk in the direction away from the city so you walk on the left and still be away from the edge.
Must do. This is a must for any visitor to sydney. Walk across it and tale in the beautiful view. Great for photos. You can even pay to do a bridge climb

The Bridge Climb is a must do. The Sydney Opera house and the Harbour Bridge are two of the worlds iconic structures that most people want to see. Climbing the bridge provides an unforgettable perspective of both and a real sense of achievement - even though this is not a physically demanding thing to do. We had originally booked a twilight climb to see the bridge in both daylight and at night. It was pouring with rain, but we were provided with rain gear - all we had to do was to wait for the storm to pass as lightening makes it dangerous to climb. We were unlucky that evening and all the climbs were cancelled. We went back a couple of days later for one of the early morning climbs. Although rain was forecast, it stayed dry, cool and clear the entire time. The organisation is just great, our leader/guide was a lot of fun and everyone in our group was delighted with it. The only negative is the price of the bridge top pictures - they just don't need to be that expensive. All in all though, if you are going to Sydney - do this climb - you won't regret it.
It's part of the Harbour. As part of the Harbour it was easy to snap a few photos. Kids enjoyed the area. Unless you're a bridge fanatic there's not much more to it...

Great views, fascinating history. I'd never really considered doing the climb, but then took part when a member of my family wanted to go. I had no idea what I'd been missing! It was a fantastic experience! Absolutely loved it. You feel on top of the world there with the harbour spread out far below and views all the way to the heads and the Blue Mountains. The guides were so informative and knowledgeable, and it was exceptionally well run. Do it!
Best walking path.. A walk over the harbour bridge for breakfast at Milsons point is sure to impress, Almost inspires one to take up jogging.

A must. We booked on line and were very lucky with the weather today.On entering the whole experience was well organised with a view to safety. Our guide today was Bec who made sure that all guests were ok at all times. In fact she helped to make the climb a fun experience.

Great experience and way fun tomdo. First off, the bridge climb is expensive. It is very cool though to climb to the top and see the 360 view of Sydney from there. The harbor is beautiful, the city is beautiful, and the sites are beautiful.We had a wonderful guide (Allison) who was knowledgeable, fun and kept things moving. Great Scottish accent by the way.You cannot bring cameras up which is a shame, but the guide does take lots of pictures for you, which you can pick from (and pay for) when you are done. The pictures are overpriced - they could be much more reasonable because of the base price of the climb itself. You do get an 8 second video to take with you.We had a great time doing the express climb, which takes from start to finish about 2 1/2 hours, including prep time and changing time (you wear their outfits). This is a must do attraction if you are in Sydney more than a few days.

Bridge climb express. Absolutely fabulous. We had only 3 days in Sydney so were limited timewise to fit everything into our stay. The express climb was just what we needed an certainly did not disappoint. We did not feel shortchanged by doing the climb quickly

Must do in Sydney. This was a present from my partner and what a wonderful present it was. The experience was fantastic from start to finish. The staff were amazing and the time there was well organised and so professionally done. Once you have sighed your forms before the climb you are given your suit to put on then given all the equipment you will need. Once ready your guide gives you some ladders to practice on before going on the bridge just to make sure everyone is comfortable with what you were about to do. Once you start the climb your guide checks your are OK at all stages and tell all about the bridge on the climb via a headset. The view are stunning and the experience is something else. Thanks to all the bridge climb team for a wonderful day.

Love it so much!. Love it - saw it from the train, from the ferry and on the ground. Breathtaking. We loved Sydney so much. Free place to visit. We walked so much during our stay in Sydney that we couldn't find the energy to walk over it. But will definitely next time. Loved going over by train - so much fun.

Very costly but worth it!. You get to not only climb to the top of the bridge on top, not on the walkway, but this experience offers you a closer perspective and window into what the workers who built it must have gone through at the time 1924-19???? It also affords magnificent views and is fun to do! Highly recommend if you can afford it!

A nice day. I didn't walk up the bridge because I was broke. Instead I parked my car and walked across the bridge through the pedestrian walk. I continued down to the rocks markets and it was such a nice walk. The walk back to the car at the end of the day was the killer!!

save your money. bridge climb way to expensive save yourself some money and walk over wont cost you anything lots of photo ops. to be had get yourself a hop on off ferry ticket and you can see all the harbor has to offer for a fraction of the cost of the sightseeing tours 320 bucks a couple goes a long way in sydney without blowing it on a bridge climb which is nothing special

Mandatory. One goes to the bridge to take pictures of the opera house and then to the opera house to take pictures of the bridge! It's very impressive to stare at this miracle of ancient technology, even nicer if you have the chance to walk past it. Recommended!

Harbour Bridge Climb. This is a must do for anyone visiting the city. I have experienced this twice and the thrill of the climb and the views of the city it exposes are truly magnificent. Your guide will answer all questions and furnish you with details of every point of interest on view. An experience not to be missed !!!

A must do in Sydney!!!. There are lots of ways to cross the Sydney Harbour Bridge - walk, cycle, car/bus, train, or climb the bridge. I recommend them all. The views are spectacular even if all you see is the bridge because it is an engineering marvel (interesting to think of how many famous bridges were all built about the same time). Climbing the bridge was probably the most enjoyable, but it isn't cheap (and plan on spending about 4 hours). Cheapest time is right before sunset.

Bridge Walk. If you want a really out there experience do the bridge walk. I'm scared of heights but did it a second time because my 12 year old daughter was desperate to do it. It's a challenge but not too bad......you're perfectly safe and the guides are excellent - super friendly (Chris), knowledgeable and support.

Just a bridge. Although it was once a unique, instantly recognisable landmark, this is simply a bridge. Been across it, it wasn't that interesting. There are now loads of bridges throughout shaped exactly like that so it's not unique any more. Sorry, I wasn't that impressed.

Majestic, One of its Kind - Feast to the eyes..... Always had this fascination to view this landmark....finally got to check it out this January. Stands out to the expectations...you just can't take your eyes off it. I wish I could do the "going over the bridge" tour but travelling with 7 year old, we had to skip that part. Got a chance to go under it via cruise more than a couple of times and back and forth on our tour bus....Two thumbs up
Stunning Bridge. This bridge is simply stunning, a great piece of architecture that has stud the test of time.May it be here for many, many years to come.

Rail, road, cycling path and pedestrian walkway on this iconic bridge. A huge arch type, steel bridge which is a great viewing point also. During the day, do a walking tour. If you have the time, see it during the night as well. A memorable climb and enjoyed it thoroughly.
Big version of the Tyne bridge. It's a bridge, not a Tintoretto.What more can you say...it conveyed me from Sydney to Hunter.Erm, need more characters.Great marketing to make it a landmark.

Beautiful all lit up at night!. We enjoyed walking around the Harbor Bridge. During the day, we walked across to the other side and back. The views were amazing! You can pay to go up along the top. We didn't feel like the views would be that much better to pay for it though.At night, the bridge is all lit up and you can see the bats. Don't worry, they are really high up and won't both you. Seeing the bridge at night was awesome. It gives the city a totally different feel.There is security around the bridge 24/7. So we felt more than ok walking around at night. Enjoy!

Wonderful landmark!. We rode across the bridge on a couple different tours and actually stood underneath the southern end for the 9pm New Years Eve fireworks. We didn't do the bridge superstructure walk as we were forewarned re: the cost, time and prohibition from taking a personal camera on that walk. You can enjoy the pedestrian walk if you really want to walk across the bridge.

best view ever. you can have a good view of the harbor from here and this bridge is famous in the world for the new year's eve fireworks display. I am still planning on doing the climb probably when it gets a little bit cooler here in Sydney

Great experience, but terrible photo service!!!. Twilight tour was great! Highly recommended!!!But the photo purchase service was TERRIBLE. And the compensation was ridiculous. During the climb, our guide took 16 photos of us. We purchased the basic photo package (10 photos), plus extra $5 for an additional photo (the 11th photo). So totally we purchased 11 photos. The service girl saved these photos in an USB. As she was not friendly and looked absent-minded, when I returned to hotel room, I checked the USB and found ONLY 10 photos!!! So the next day, which was our last day in Sydney, we had to WASTE our time going to their office. The photo purchase service desk was another girl, who definitely ruined my whole experience. She first apologized and told me she couldn't give me any compensation but only giving me the missing photo. She wanted me to tell her the missing photo's ID number, so that she can save that photo into the USB. How do I know that number? It's like 10 digits! She was then stuck! So I had to figure out a solution. I asked her to give me pen & pencil, and let me know the ID numbers of the existing 10 photos in USB, then we know which photo is missing. For some reason she didn't respond to me even though I kept repeating. She insisted me telling her which photo was missing! I then told her, why not just give me all 16 photos, because after all, your company wasted my last day in Sydney! She refused and kept asking me the ID number of missing photo! Finally annoyed, I told her: if you were me, would you know a specific photo's ID number AT ALL!? Then she told me she couldn’t read that USB on their computer! That was ridiculous! They sold me the USB and they couldn't read it!? And she didn't want to figure out how to solve the problem and keep passing the ball to me???!!! I was then all angry and started to talk loud, so other customers started to notice something was wrong at this service desk. She finally asked her colleague how to read USB but failed. As I started to get really angry, she finally just save all 16 photos in the USB and THREW THE USB TO ME. I was very angry, so I went directly to Customer Service Head. After listening to all what happened, this Customer Service Manager gave me the 2nd ridiculous compensation proposal: he can refund me the extra photo purchased! THAT'S AUS$5!!!!! I didn't want to accept that compensation at all. I told him this does not make me feel any better AT ALL. He gave me a "there's nothing more I can do" face. I can only say: terrible experience here!!!!!All in all, the Bridge Climb is a must-do in Sydney! But if you purchase any photos, MAKE SURE THEY GIVE YOU ALL THE PHOTOS IN THE USB, AT THE TIME YOU PURCHASE THE PHOTOS! Otherwise, be prepared to share my terrible experience!
ITS A MUST TO SEE AFTER DARK. went down at dusk breathing views. Taxis are easy to get also The whoke area is nice. The pics I got were great!!! Several benches to sit and enjoy the area.

Highlight of the trip to Sydney. We visited the Sydney Harbour bridge and completed the full bridge walk. Absolutely fantastic experience and our guide George was very informative about Sydney. He was great.

A cool way to see Sydney and the Opera House. Yes you can climb the bridge but it isn't cheap and you won't be able to bring a camera. For an alternative you can climb the tower closest to the Opera House for a lot less and bring your camera with you. There are some stairs but if you are in even less than decent shape you shouldn't have a problem It is worth the view of the harbour

Bridge Climb. We we lucky to have been given the bridge climb as a Wedding present.From start to finish the way the climb is set out was brilliant. You start with a briefing then you are togged up in a onesie with various attachments and headset so your guide can talk to you. Our guide was very informative and had the odd one liner to settle you for the walk. The walk itself was at a gentle pace and nowhere as strenuous as you think.The views from the bridge were absolutely stunning. You have a lot of photos taken during the climb which you can purchase at the finish. From start to finish the tour took nearly 4 hours

Works as intended. I was able to cross this bridge. I did not fall into the water below me that I was avoiding by taking the bridge. Without this bridge, I would not have been able to cross over to the other side. This bridge has earned not only mine, but my best friend Steve's gratitude.
Walk. Great experience and not as scary when you get up the stairs! Tour guide was funny and knowledgeable.
Fantastic sight. This iconic bridge just has to be seen and photographed. It is quite majestic, and the views from near the opera house are stunning.

What a view!. We did the Sydney Harbour Bridge climb..really not knowing what to expect...my other half not liking heights. ..but it was brilliant. In all it took about 3.5hours..but that includes briefings and getting ready. But the time just flew..Our guide David was so informative...with the history and stories of the Bridge.. you forgot that you were 134m up in the air!. It was very humid..but there are water stops along the way..and photos taken at various points.(no cameras or phones allowed) You feel very safe and the walk not too much of a challenge. The views are amazing and we were grateful that the weather had cleared up so we could enjoy them!
Enjoy the view !. We did the bridge climb on New Years Day and thoroughly enjoyed it. Not as physically challenging as I expected and a great view at the top. Very safe with excellent tour guides.
Lovely, Iconic. A simple 'you must do' if in Sydney, iconic Sydney Harbour Bride' we walked to the base of the bridge, took loads of photos and took in the stunning views of the harbour!

Sydney Harbour Bridge Visit. The bridge was a great icon to visit but it's difficult to find where can we do the climb - there was no information or sign on which side of the bridge you have to go to do the climb.

Bridge with a Life of its Own. The iconic Sydney bridge is a sight to watch. We were lucky to get the evening sun shine on the bridge and the view along with ferries plying under it and the buildings behind was just fantastic.Of course any visit to Sydney is incomplete without a visit to the Sydney bridge. Wanted to do the Bridge walk, but could not due shortage of time.

Just amazing. This bridge is one of the worlds iconic sights, I never tire of looking at this amazing structure. A walk along the bridge is a must do. If you have time, there is a museum in the south pylon, which is worth seeing. Great views from the top.

A birds eye view. How exciting to climb the bridge...very safe with excellent guides. The hardest part is the ladders but once on the arch it's a dream come true...the views are spectacular. I am in my late 50's and walk regularly so it was easy for me Highly recommend it ...
Iconic. What more can we say. We were there for six days and saw the bridge on every day and from all angles. Just Iconic.

A great view over Sydney Harbour from the Bridge.. We walked over the Bridge to North Sydney. It's an amazing structure, and even without doing the Bridge Climb you can just walk across the bridge to get a good overview of the Harbour. From Luna Park you get a great view of the Opera House behind the Bridge which makes a great photo.

Aussie Aussie Aussie !. Did this on Australia Day, got to the top at midday for the gun fire, national anthem,yatch race, jets and helicopter stunts. Amazing view of all the entertainment. The best day and time! One of my most memorable and enjoyable days ever! Matt the tour guide was great. An expensive trip to do but the memories will last a lifetime.

sydney harbour bridge climb. a very professional team that work in this industry. from the time we set foot into the building we were welcomed with friendly staff. our leader was excellent and there was no rushing at all. it sounds pricey but its well worth every bit and the experience is worth it.

Once in a Lifetime Experience. We were blessed with wonderful weather which really enhanced the awesome views from the top of the Bridge. Fabulous experience. Expertly organised. Great fun! Everyone was thrilled with the expert assistance we received and the good humoured encouragement from the Climb Leader, Darren.

Great wALK. Stayed on the Northern side this time and took the family for a long walk!Walked across the bridge for the first time-fantastic - great day and sun was shining - a lot of boats on the harbour - even walked up to the top of the pylons - small fee - but great views! Finished up with coffee and markets in the Rocks area - great day!
Iconic Landmark. Such an iconic landmark that is a must see. The ferry from circle harbour takes you directly underneath on its way to darling harbour.

Beautiful!!!!. When you visit Harbour bridge plan accordingly to do a bridge climb. You miss it and you miss the real fun. Absolutely stunning view from right of the top of the arch and very helpful staff and well protected climb up. Walking across the bridge itself is an experience but I would reccomend the bridge climb.

Worth a quick visit. I took some local advice and walked over the bridge (okay, halfway) instead of paying the high prices for the bridge walk tours. Due to its location and height, you get great views of the city as well as the Opera House. Worth a quick visit/walk, but you don't need to spend hours here.

Architectural achievements yet merging with surrounding environment. World's tallest steel arch with height of 134 meters connecting northen suburbs with city center. It is said 200,000 cars pass this bridge every day also there is a railway line on this bridge .Many climb this height to enjoy the scenic beauty around.

One of the landmarks of Sydney. We were fortunate enough to be here for New Year's Eve. Sadly we didn't have enough time to climb up the bridge but certainly will on another visit. The view from the harbour looking up to the bridge is wonderful it certainly is the heart of Sydney.

Awesome views. Sydney and australian icon smack dab in the centre of Sydney Harbour. A lovely view from the footpath on the way to or from North sydney. You can even bridge climb to the top of the bridge for an extra cost. Definitely a place to see whie in sydney

Climbed the bridge! . Can experience! Never felt unsafe at all. Our guide was brill & kept talking most of the way so concentrating on the history of Sydney & the bridge rather than the height :) Took over 3 hrs too, not cheap to do but worth it, felt we got our monies worth. Pick a morning slot on a clear day. That way can see as far as the eye can see, & you won't become over heated.Safety gear & health & safety talk can not fault at all.Book & enjoy! ! :)

We travelled under the Sydney Harbour Bridge on the Dawn Princess ship. A highlight of our trip to Sydney was when we travelled on the Dawn Princess ship to travel to New Zealand. We passed under the Sydney Harbour Bridge on the ship and it was an exciting experience as we stood on deck and the Captain blew the ship's horn. We also travelled on many ferries on Sydney Harbour and experienced the thrill of travelling under the bridge on many occasions. We were also excited to be taken over the Sydney Harbour Bridge by taxi.

Unique. Harbour bridge climb is not only exhilarating and very safe but unique to have the opportunity to climb one of Sydney's top icons. The view from the top is simply SPECTACULAR with a photo opportunity to prove you did it. Go ahead and just do it!

Impressive!. Before going to Sydney I thought that maybe the more stunning views were going to be of the Opera House. My surprise was this fabulous and enormous bridge that crosses the bay connecting North and South Sydney.The views of the bridge from a boat are incredible.

Wow...Climb the Bridge!. The Sydney Harbor Bridge Climb offers a unique way to view Sydney, learn about this history of the settling of Sydney, and get a good work-out. Unless you are fearful of heights, consider climbing the bridge! It's completely safe and great fun.

NYE 2015. We met family here who live in Melbourne they had travelled 12 hours and we waited 4 hours for the fire weporks the governors has said this year would be the best and it was the atmosphere was brillants and with over a million people we had no fights no negative atmospheres it was great

Iconic. Having now visited Sydney three times I'm proud to say I have witnessed all angles of this icon of Australia and seeing the bridge never ceases to make me smile. The best experience was BridgeClimb (expensive but worth it - just amazing!) but you can also gain wonderful views from climbing the Lookout Pylon at the end of the bridge near The Rocks for only AUD$13. I've crossed the bridge on foot, by car and by tram. And have sailed under the bridge on a harbour cruise and just recently on a cruise ship. The best sailaway I've ever done! Sydneysiders - you are so lucky to have this wonderful view every day. :-)
Stunning!. The Sydney Harbour bridge is simply stunning in design and location. An icon of Australia it really shouldn't be underestimated. Beautiful to see at night.

wonderful bridge. the first glimpse you get of this bridge gives you butterflies in your stomach . you get a very good view of it from circular quay especially when you walk around to the right up near the opera house and get some great photos there. my husband did the bridge climb and says the views from up top are amazing it cost £560 for 2 this year

The most famous coathanger in the world. Free access from either end although walkers are restricted to the eastern pathway and cyclists to the western side.The south eastern pylon also can be entered from the road level and climbed for an even better view. Fees apply.One of the best views of the Opera House and Circular Quay.If there is a cool breeze around, take a jacket and there is almost always a breeze there, sometimes stronger.You will note security guards in fluro jackets always around. Theye are there to protect the bridge and will not approach. Feel free to ask the questions though.

Another item off the bucket list. I'd seen pictures of this beautiful bridge for years and always wanted to see it with my own eyes. Finally was able to during my short visit. I didn't actually go on the bridge or do the climb but it was incredible to see it as the sun was going down and clouds rolling in. Hope to visit again and possibly do more exploring of this landmark.

Iconic 1932 structure still wowing the crowds. Take your walking or running shoes with and do the walk/run over the bridge. Very little incline and an excellent bit of 'centre of the universe' exercise

You just have to do the climb. Did the bridge climb very recently. It is not the cheapest thing to do, but is a bucket list item, and the view is the best going around.Alex our guide was terrific - friendly, funny and very professional - and made it a very enjoyable experience. Thanks Alex for a great experience.I've given this a 5 rating for the climb, the views and Alex.I do understand that there is alot of OH&S associated with doing such a climb, but the other staff were rather unfriendly and abrupt - I think they need to smile a little more and remember that we are all paying big dollars to do it. Getting ready to proceed on the climb does take 45 minutes or so before you even start, and you feel like you're back in cadets given how obsessively regimented the process is, and how much like a drill sergeant the other staff are !Given that it is already expensive, this recent tendency with attractions to 'offer' people photos taken on the climb that staff take (given that you can take nothing on the climb of your own other than your underwear, socks and shoes unless it is tied down - you even have to pass through a metal detector) for an extra $68 is just another way of extorting money from you.
Sydney visit . Only stay the one night in Sydney so had a lot to squeeze in so could not miss out on the bridge very impressive a must do if your here
Absolutely Beautiful. We live in the best City in the world, every time I come home to see this I love it, its a must to climb, excellent views and a lot of history on the walk
Iconic Sydney landmark. Can't help but be impressed by Sydney Harbour Bridge every time I see it. A spectacular landmark dominating one of the worlds most beautiful harbour cities.

Bridge climb is amazing!. A friend and I decided to climb the Harbour Bridge and we were not disappointed! Amazing views and friendly staff, it was a little pricey but if you have the time and funds then I would definitely recommend

If you get the chance, do the Bridge Climb!. The hubby and I were fortunate enough to win a double pass for a Bridge Climb. It was fantastic! I can highly recommend the twilight climb as you get the benefit of seeing Sydney and all it has to offer in daytime coming into evening with the beautiful evening lights highlighting its best features. The weather was superb and the staff were great!
Stunning. Just amazing views. I would sefinitly do thia while your on holiday here in Sydney also do the bridge climb too!

Bridge at sunset. Walk to end of nearby park and join others taking photos of the bridget and city outline as the sun sets. Cockatoos are spectacular in the park giving area a truly Australian ambiance.

Iconic bridge. Visited this as part of my Drawing Art challenge.Felt awed by the structure.Lots of cute cafes around as watering places.Need to visit again to finishing drawing off as spent too much time discussing its merits...!!!
Amazing . So we climbed the bridge, we drove over the bridge, be went on a boat cruise under the bridge. Such a fantastic piece of steel and engineering.
It's the main part of the city.... You have to see it. It belongs to the city like the Opera House. It is part of the city and I think it is very nice to look at.
Awesome bridge. Did you know it was constructed by someone from middlesbrough UK ? lovely to photograph, id recommend going on the ferry to get a view of both the bridge and opera house in one pic

Sydney landmark. You almost can't help but see the bridge on any visit to Sydney....it seems to be ever present in the background....serving both a practical and artistic purpose in framing the harbour.

If you can, walk it. Walked over the bridge on the pedestrian bridge, just to do it. Found a great place for lunch on the other side and got some amazing photos on the way. So happy I did it, be aware that it can be quite hot as there is only shade thrown by the bridge (other than in the pylons).
Such an Aussie Icon!. The " Coathanger" stands proudly across the waters of Sydney Harbour. Able to be viewed from many angles across the Sydney CBD.
Do the climb. The climb is not nearly as scary as it looks. It is amazing. It takes a while to go through the prep, etc., but it is worth it.

Bridge Climb. We were a little concerned at the high cost of this experience but it was just fantastic. Our wonderful guide Max made us feel safe and comfortable. He provided a great narrative of the bridge history with some great humour too! I am so glad we had this experience!
Main Stream Tourism Place. A must place to visit and take picture and great view from the bridge but nothing much to add to it.

SHEER ELEGANCE WITH BEAUTY. Not only does this bridge look so royal and elegant but its one that even lets you climb to the top to view even more of its beauty n experience life from the top. A climb thats a must do when visiting Sydney

Yes, this climb is for the fainthearted!. Dressed in grey boiler suits and helmets and drilled on safety you are prepared for a breathtaking experience. The group leader is informative, humorous and a mine of information. The ascent is punctuated with stops. The steps are shallow and easy for the not-so-fit. And the view from the top? Worth a million dollars!
Good for a look. Don't forget your camera for this one and good walking shoes, noticed 4 security guards keeping watch on the bridge.

A Bucket List Checkmark. This was my only must-do activity on my return to Sydney, a major bucket list item for what was likely my last visit to Sydney. It is indeed a climb of a lifetime, and the experience is totally worth it! I would recommend it to anyone who has good mobility and is not afraid of heights. Don't let age be a discouraging factor if you have good balance.The sights were incredible. The commentary and guidance by our leader, Alex, was second-to-none. I would not have missed this experience for the world. It takes a little nerve, but the pace is reasonable with many stops along the way. The hardest parts are the 4 long sets of open steel stairs to climb up and down, and the wide steps coming down that make it harder on the knees to stretch your gait because you can't really double-step them. Some places you have to bend down or step over to avoid girders. The stairs are not steep, but some steps are long. And.... what I was most concerned about, I didn't need to be... as the steps were not "open" to the bridge below. The path is well-planned and safely managed. It took 9 years to develop the Bridge Climb, just as long as it took to build the entire bridge!The safety of the climb is taken seriously, and that is well appreciated. We were asked three times if we had eaten breakfast, if we needed to bring medication with us, had to fill out a complete medical/liability form, and were given a sobriety breath test. You cannot take any cell phone or camera with you. In fact, you can take nothing, not even your clothes, as you have to strip down to your underwear to put on your one-piece zipped climb suit! Sunscreen was provided at the beginning of the climb. There were water faucets available before the actual climb. A safety line was tethered to you and the rail the entire length of the climb, both up and down, even along the stairs. As well, a headset with an FM system was provided so that you could easily hear all instruction and description along the way. There was a preliminary "practice" climb of stairs while still in the main building to understand how the safety line worked, and the angle of the stairways on the actual bridge. There was nothing missed in terms of preparedness for the climb, so safety should not be a concern.As part of the fee, you are given a free hat, a certificate for having completed the climb and a picture of the group. There were 14 climbers in our group, and that seemed to be the general number, based on the spaces to sit, etc. before the climb.So, why a 4-rating rather than a 5? Well, there are several reasons. First is the expense - nearly $300, more at specific times or on weekends. Second was the difficulty in understanding the first gal, Jen, who did some of the preliminary preparatory work with us; she spoke so quickly and I had difficulty with her accent. The time requirement, the three and a half hours as advertised, is very deceiving as a "climb" experience, as so much of that is spent in preparation. Everything is done in very slow sequence, every clip, hanky, belt, line, hat, form, test, etc. etc. is done one at a time by one group leader who must check every climber for every distributed item (and the reverse at the end). As suits are distributed, time to go to the change room, change, return, help zip... it just takes so much time. Then for the climb, rest spots are as much for individual commercial picture-taking as they are for actual rests. I had not intended to purchase the picture "package" at the end, and assumed we would be able to pick our group picture, as many were taken. However, the one we received was a "be silly" picture taken as the last one, when everyone had arms flailing or tongues out. It wouldn't have been my choice for this memorable climb.Don't let my negatives stop you, but you should be aware before you decide, especially if you have family members waiting for you. For sure, it is an experience you won't soon forget!

The Bridge is a symbol of Sydney. Our first stop during the sightseeing tour of Sydney was the Bridge. Amazing structure .We didn't walk on the bridge but we took a lot of pictures and admired the area.

Had to walk across the Bridge.. After visiting the Rocks I decided to walk across the bridge. The 4 flights of stairs to get onto the bridge was hard enough and then the 1km walk across. Have to say it was well worth it, the views are spectacular and you can appreciate the work that went into building the bridge. Got the train back though.
Huge boat. Really crowded peace because the botanic garden and the opera house are nearby. However lovely to sit and relax for a while and see what happens around.

Centre piece of Sydney. The harbour bridge is the centre piece of Sydney. It's certainly a must visit and if you have the chance the bridge climb is worth the cost. You need to book ahead though as it is quite popular.
Most popular place to go. If you visit sydney, opera house and sydney harbour are the most popular places to go. One can easily go via train.

Once in your life. I have done the Bridge climb on two occasions and both times I enjoyed it and would not hesitate to do it again. Very safe and well instructed before the climb unfortunately you can not take a camera for obvious reasons ( dropping it on a car or pedestrian below ) A good tip when you book your climb book the last day climb and you will see Sydney at it's best in the twilight you will save a lot of money this way instead of paying for a twilight climb.
If you want to walk. It is a long walk to the bridge from harbor. Don't feel it worth the money to climb the bridge ($250), but walking on the flat level is free.

Climb of a lifetime. If you are looking for adventure with the best views of Sydney- then you need to book with Bridge Climb Sydney. We had an amazing journey over the Harbour Bridge. We learned a lot about Sydney while walking and climbing over the bridge. The climb was very safe and not too strenuous. Enjoy the fabulous views!

Walking the bridge. I didn't have the inclination or the nerve to climb the bridge but just walking over it is a very pleasant experience. Not as inspiring as Brookland bridge but nevertheless very good views of cruise terminal and Sydney Opera House

Morning stroll across the bridge. Well maintained pedestrian path which is separated from vehicle traffic. Our original intention was to walk the bridge and roam through the streets near Luna Park. Our plans changed when we reached the south pylon. We entered the pylon and climbed the stairs to the top. There is interesting photos and information about the bridge construction. Highly recommend going outside to the observation deck (for a reasonable fee). We had an excellent view of the bridge climbers below us. The walk across the bridge was safe and enjoyable. Abundant photo ops every step of the way.
Did the climb!!!!. Climbing the bridge at twilight for my 55th birthday was amazing th see the sun go down and the lights come up over sydney is certainly in my top 10 of life experiences
Just great even for a Melbie!. Walked up, well half way up this beast and what an amazing experience! I highly recommend the walk, even if like me your scared of heights just do it!
Amazing view of the harbour. Amazing view of the harbour! You can take a bridge climb if you want but we took the "safer" option of just walking across it!

A FREE and fabulous walk for locals and tourists alike!. I've lived in Sydney for twenty years and have already completed the bridge climb (which was incredible and highly recommended) however, if you are looking for a free and picturesque, easy, short walk in Sydney, go for a walk across the bridge at road level. My parents have been visiting from the UK and I took them to see the fantastic views of the opera house, water, bays, landscape, and of course the bridge! We parked next to Milsons Point railway station and within a couple of minutes were on the bridge. My dad has difficulty walking however after the steps at the start this was an easy walk (perhaps 1km each way) and the views were impressive - even for me as a local!
21st birthday celebration . Thank you Lauren for a great climb and your knowledge of the bridge was great. We had a great time with you and our group had very interesting people.Cheers :)
At its best during NYE. The NYE fireworks literary burn this bridge , but this mighty bridge stands tall and strong over looking the heart of Sydney.

Best Staircase!. Having known about Bridge Climb, I finally had an opportunity to do it myself. I was not disappointed. From the first minute through over 2 hours, it was fantastic. The details of safety, our leader informing our group along the way with interesting facts, to ensuring that we worked as a cohesive and enjoyable collection of people; this was indeed a Life experience.
Bridge Climb. Our family enjoyed the bridge climb. It was not as scary as we had initially anticipated! The guides are great.

I can see you (ha ha). Still havent done the bridge walk Yet although from where im staying its right beside me ,every day and night the tourists walk to the crest of the bridge and all yell at the same time

Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. After 10 years of watching others climb to the top of the iconic Sydney Harbour Bridge, I decided to make the climb. It was very well organized,and the group leaders are well prepared, supportive and knowledgeable. I felt safe and confident throughout the climb, and getting to the top was much easier than I expected. I would highly recommend this adventure to other Sydney visitors.

Great history or just transport. The Harbor Bridge is great with an amazing view and a lot of history behind it, being over 80 years old. It has a train and many lanes for cars. Overall a great view with great transport and accessibility.

Bridge walk. In august 2010 we visited Sydney and went on the harbour bridge walk during sunset and was probably the single best experience during out stay in Sydney, i physically cannot recommend it any higher.

Iconic view. There are so many places to view the bridge from. We thought of walking over the top but as older people decided against it. We did however walk across the bridge and spend some time on the other side.

Exhilarating. I don't like heights, but yes I was going to do this. So glad I plucked up the courage as it was the best experience ever. Quite expensive but considered that the experience was worth the expense. And although it was poring down with rain the sights were magnificent. Well the climb if you can afford it, my view was, how can I go all that way and not do it.

Great experience. Loved it , well organised . Not too strenuous , hardest part is right at the beginning and at the very end when you have to duck your head and manoeuvre through some narrow bits. The experience at the top was amazing . We picked a perfect day for it which was lucky. Once in a lifetime experience . Express climb recommended .

Harbour Bridge Climb. Absolutely tremendous experience for all ages. Staf are very helpful , reassuring and knowledgeable. The climb itself is not difficult, very safe and affords great views of the bay , the Opera House and the city. This is a 'must do' when visiting Sydney.

Night Time Bridge Climb. Highly recommend paying and taking part in the Sydney Harbour Bridge climb! We visited on holidays and climbed the bridge at night. (Absolutely breath taking)The tour guides point out locations & tells you a bit about the backgrounds etc.Worth the money!!

A Lovely Walk. We felt the climb was much too expensive for us. And due to time constraints we did not go up the pylon to view. But we did walk more than half way across the bridge. There were some terrific view from there. This was very much worth it and we would do it again, given the chance.

More exciting than dangerous. There is almost danger in the bridge climb. Not only is one tethered to the bridge but the care with which climbers are briefed and watched makes it 99.999% safe.We are young at heart but 76 and 84 and the climb was a highlight of our Sydney stay in more ways than one. Any moderate walker can do this....Pick a bright clear day for maximum enjoyment.
Wow. Amazing view harbour is crystal blue water. The ferries bring great vibe to harbour front wat a place to be Sydney harbour

A great opportunity to see Sydney. We booked before we left the UK, and everything was well prepared when we arrived. The whole experience takes about 3 hours, with about 30-40 minutes of briefing and kitting up before hand, then the spectacular walk itself. Be prepared to leave your dignity behind with the regulation jumpsuit, and utility belt. But it is well worth it. The walk is not particularly challenging so those who think they can't do it, should give it a try. It is well worth it. Although it seem quite expensive, it is well worth the effort. Also it is worth booking for around midday if you are travelling from outside Sydney. It means an early start to make sure you get there on time, but if you can park at a river boat station (we chose Abbotsford) and take the river cruise, as the views of Sydney are breathtaking and sooooo worth the time taken. A return trip is around $16 so great value and a perfect way to avoid the hassle of driving to find somewhere to park.

AWESOME!!!. I did the Sydney Bridge Climb(3 hour climb) on Christmas Day while visiting Sydney, and what a way to spend Christmas! I was a little nervous that the climb would be too strenuous, but I should not have been scared. The climb was surprisingly easy and the views from the bridge were unparalleled. This is definitely a must do when in Sydney!

An incredible and memorable experience. Before decided to book the bridge climb, I saw photos of previous participants all having big smiles on their face when climbing to the top of the bridge. I thought it must be a fun activity. It turned out it just more than that. Not only we enjoyed the sense of participation through climbing the bridge together as a group, but also we enjoyed the spectacular view of Sydney Harbour and the stories behind the construction of the bridge. Alex, is very helpful, reliable and knowledgable. As expected, everyone has a genuine big smile when we are taking the group photo. We initially hesitated to climb the bridge as the only available time slot during our visit in 6:45AM in the morning of Jan 1, 2016. We were not sure how late we will be finishing the new year countdown. Being the first group to climb the bridge turned out to be a blessing as the temperature is cooler and the sunlight is not as harsh during the 3-hour climb. It is an incredible and memorable experience.

climb of my life!. We completed the evening harbor bridge climb and it was awesome! The thrill of the height coupled with the adventure of reaching the summit had already engulfed us. Sydney looked beautiful in the moonlight! It was indeed the climb of my life!
Amazing. A beautiful sight in its own right. Climbing it is an even more wonderful experience. Certainly the centre point of this lovely city.

Views to Amaze. From the very start of the tour, you are made to feel welcome and the staff ensure you are happy at all times. You take things slowly which was really good as we were climbing with 2 kids aged 10 and 13. Prior to climbing the bridge, we thought it might be hard going for the kids but it was really easy. If your in Sydney and have the chance to climb the bridge, just do it. Once we were up, we could see as far as the blue mountains and past Bondi beach in the other direction. We were not rushed whatsoever, the guides are brilliant passing on a lot of information.
Fantastic. We walked through the rocks, had coffee and hot chocolate at the Vintage cafe,then did the Pylon tour,then walked the bridge.A great experience

Just Beautiful!. Sydney Harbour Bridge is beautiful. Watching the huge cruise ships coming in near the bridge is amazing.
While we did not walk to the top we did drive over it and it was beautiful, both during the day and at night.
While you will see pictures that are beautiful, seeing it person is so amazing!

Great to see. If on a visit to Sydney, the harbour bridge is a must. Options to climb to the top of the bridge or great to just admire from a distance. Lots of activity on the harbour to watch and restaurants nearby to enjoy the view.
DRIVE IT!. You can look at it AND drive over it! So functional for a landmark. Make sure to check out the sweet Eastern Bloc looking apartments while you cross it.
Must see. Walk/drive around and across it. We didn't climb it, as it looked boring. The views are great if you cross it on foot or driving.

The climb - fantastic views and experience. I am scared of heights and gaos in walkways so the Sydney Harbour Bridge climb was something I would not usually seek to do. However, having talked through, with my son, the limiting impact fears can have on what we do and experience in life I decided to be super brave. Before we travelled to Australia I practised walking on openwork walkways to build my confidence and tolerance of such things - almost a desensitisation process. This helped however I was still very apprehensive. Before we started the climb the group were asked if anyone was apprehensive - I was the only one who admitted to this. Safety was very much high on the agenda of all the staff - we had to pass a breathalyser test and a climbing assessment. During the climbing assessment techniques for safe ascent and descent were taught.Sarahh, our leader was absolutely superb. She was so knowledgeable, fun and her enthusiasm was so infectious. She kept a discreet yet watchful eye on me which was very reassuring. Due to the care, support and encouragement of Sarah, my son and my husband - I did it, so enjoyed it and would have missed out on the most breathtakingly, beautiful experience.You are fixed to a rail at all times so oh so safe. The climb is made up if a few ladders but mainly a guarded walkway the incline of which is surprisingly gentle or so it seemed to me. Sarah was also very good at using viewing points as opportunities for us to have a breather. It was all so well managed.The views, oh my goodness, how do I describe them - spectacular, beautiful, breathtaking, just so good for the soul. We did the twilight climb which had the advantage of us being able to watch sunset over the harbour - another wow experience.The whole experience was so good in confidence building that I am going to try indoor climbing with that inspirational son of mine.A totally, amazing experience - not to be missed. Our other son has a walking disability and wasn't with us on this part of the trip. Having done the climb I am wholly confident he could do it so in 2017 we are back to Sydney for us all to do the climb together. Keep your fingers crossed for us that he will pass the climbing assessment.If you're apprehensive do grab your courage in both hands - it is so, so worth it!
Awesome. Sydney Bridge climb is a 3.5 hour activity but definitely worth the price. Easily accessible from the train station itself.

That's the bridge you want to climb???. Well I just could not do it! I really wanted to but --- I backed out the wind was blowing to hard , the steps were to step or or well Iam 72 wanted to make it to 73!!! It looked like a great thing to do but I just walked across and loved it , it did look like a lot fun wish now I had done it of course I do Iam thousands of miles away from it now. But I think all of you should do it!!!!

Definitely worth the hike!. If you visit Sydney you should hike the bridge. The view is awesome and it is one of those things you want to say you did when in Sydney. I felt very safe but do not have a fear of heights. I had people of all ages on my tour and everyone enjoyed it from an 8 year old boy to a woman celebrating her 60th birthday.

Aussie Icon. For the best views. Iconic walks. Visit the pylon museum for uninterrupted views. Ever so popular bridge climb. Catch the train, take a walk, ride a bike. The bridge links the two Sydneys: north and CBD.

New Year Trip. My family and I booked to walk over the bridge while on holiday in Sydney. The views are amazing but they have too many groups going on at once and it is very much like a conveyer belt service, I think it is over priced for what it is.

Moonlit walk across Sydney Harbour Bridge. To appreciate this walk you need to research when the full moon rises early over Cremorne Ridge line of the Lower North Shore of Sydney.
