You want the moon at least above Cremorne Ridge line and commence the walk after sunset to see moonlight shimmering down the Harbour illuminating Fort Denison, Clark and Shark Island and the Sails of the Opera House. So the walk is best done well after twilight. This is not "Bridge Climb", merely walking as pedestrians at night across Sydney Harbour Bridge at street level toll free with a view of the main Eastern approaches of Port Jackson/Sydney Harbour. I suggest that you walk North about one hour after moonrise (once it is dark). Then you will have the moon shining towards you from the Harbour's entrance. Enter the Sydney Harbour Bridge Eastern (Ocean) side, as the Western side of the Bridge is a bicycle route (Olympians even training every night) at: (1) Circular Quay as the Eastern side provide lifts (near Wharf 2) up to Cahill Expressway and walk, enjoying the view looking down over Circular Quay. (2) Argyle Street, up the steep stone steps under Cumberland Street leading up to Cumberland Street and the steep stairway entrance up to the Sydney Harbour Bridge from Cumberland Street (do not be tempted until later the same night on your return by either or both pubs being the Australian Heritage Hotel or the Glenmore Hotel that are diagonally opposite the entrance); (3) if coming from CBD, the steps in Cumberland Street just north of the Shangri-La Hotel. One exits at the Northern end of the Bridge at Milsons Point/Kirribilli, just before one gets to the Milsons Point Railway Station. Walk is under 20 minutes each way. One can: . have dinner at Kirribilli, as their are lots of restaurants as you descend the steps at Milsons Point/Kirribilli; . consider the Sailing Club, Sydney Flying Squadron in McDougall Street; . take the train back to Wynyard Station (easy) or ferry back from Milsons Point wharf or Kirribilli wharf to Circular Quay (if you know its timetable, as many ferries are only hourly at night). I used to walk on my home from work in the CBD to our house in Neutral Bay. Plenty of fit young people are walking or jogging home, especially as working hours finish. Take your camera, wife and mistresses to see who enjoys the walk the most. This is a very cheap idea for anyone visiting Sydney who wants a magnificent evening out (moon permitting). The article probably needs technically improving by those who use it. Great training I suspect for the Golden Gate Bridge, San Francisco. Daily weather (including rain radar) and moon updates see can be found on the following web sites:• Bureau of Meteorolgy (BOM) with focus on Sydney weather and Sydney rain radar – but no moon information• Weatherzone – Sydney• Searching the words “Moon Sydney”.

Nice walk across. We took a ferry across from wharf 5 at circular quay and hopped of at Milsons Point. We walked up to Kirribilli station and found the entrance to the start of the walk on the bridge. It was a pleasant walk with great views along the whole way.

Sydney Icon. A visit to Sydney specially if its the first time is not complete without the visiting the Bridge. Nice place to walk. Bridge climb is a good option but quite costly. Avoid the souvenir stores around since these are expensive places
Bridge climb. We are both bad with heights and managed the climb. The tour guide Jason was excellent, very reassuring and knowledgable. Great memories and photos.

The arch of Sydney. If not just to admire it from afar the Sydney Harbour Bridge is an architectural icon worth appreciating. If you're comfortable enough, I'd recomend the bridge climb. It'sslightly expensive, but the overall experience and view from the top is definitely worth it. I've now done the climb 3 times and would go back for more!

Best Known Sydney Landmark!. It was larger than I ever imagined and it adds lots to the landscape. Now I want to be there on New Year's Eve. You'd never catch me doing it but it was fun to watch groups walk the top arch, even when tethered to a railing. The bridge is architecturally bold and beautiful and has outstanding industrial design.....often imitated, I suspect. I was much more intrigued by this landmark itself than it's function of carrying heavy traffic to the south and north. Try to see it from several different angles. Check out a variety of views from a ferry boat?

80th birthday . We did the bridge climb as a family group of 5 to celebrate my grandfathers 80th birthday, and sang to him at the highest point.fantastic views and a memorable experience. Would be great to climb again at dusk.
We took the "Bridge Walk" tour. This was a highlight on our trip of a lifetime. We had great weather to climb the bridge works and met some really adventurous fellow travelers.

Iconic and a great walk experience. I decided to go on the walk and it was one of my better ideas. Exceptionally well organised and taken by an enthusiastic guide. I would recommend it to anyone. You do not need to be especially fit as there are stops along the way

Walk the talk. You just cannot miss experiencing this iconic landmark: the Sydney Harbour Bridge. It's the world's tallest steel arch bridge. It connects the city to the northern Sydney suburbs and is affectionately called the Coathanger. There are many ways to experience it: you can take a helicopter ride or do the BridgeClimb. They cost a lot and to visitors on a tight budget, every little bit counts. A BridgeClimb can set you back by about A$200. Fret not, dear visitors, you can get an equally exhilarating experience by just walking the bridge from one end to another. Just head to the historic CBD suburb, The Rocks, and make for Cumberland Street where Shangri-La Hotel is. Diagonally opposite the hotel are steps that take you up to the top where you can start your leisurely walk and take in the spectacular harbour views, the Opera House, and gawk at sunbathers by the pool of the A$1000-a-night Hyatt.The walk takes between 20 and 35 mins depending on your pace. It ends at a flight of steps and if you have time to spare, descend them and head towards the Kirribilli waterfront where more harbour vistas await. At Kirribilli, you can catch a ferry from one of its public wharves to Circular Quay and to Manly, Mosman or Taronga Zoo to see the bridge from the harbour.

Iconic. Walked across this beautiful bridge during our visit to Sydney. Great free activity and only takes 25-30 minutes to do one way including taking photos etc. Gives great vantage point down over the city. Also appreciated the bridge from a ferry sightseeing cruise.

Head for the heights. It's only like climbing a steep hill - or so the guidebook said! But you need to be reasonably fit and active to scale this Sydney landmark.Well I thought if Paul Hogan (Crocodile Dundee) worked up here before becoming a super-rich megastar - then I had better give it a go. The word "terrifying" actually pales to insignificance as you gradually become a dot on the great steel girders. But the proof, as if your stomach needed it, is to be photographed with the national flag fluttering in the background.The guides are tremendously helpful and of course there are strict safety procedures. It is another world to find large ships and small boats passing beneath - not too mention the constant roar of the traffic. There are easier ways to view the city and waterways but few that the grandchildren will respect as much!

Amazing Experience. I've lived in Sydney for all of my life and have had the bridge climb on my "bucket" list since it opened 17 years ago. I finally crossed it off my list recently. The weather was horrendous, wet and windy not the greatest of days to climb the bridge. Even with the inclement weather, you are still able to see down the harbour, across to the Opera House and down the harbour. Nonetheless the experience, staff and safety that they take was amazing. Hoping to repeat the occassion again but hoping for a clear day of sunshine. Better luck next time.

The worlds greatest multi-functioning bridge!. Not just for buses, trains, cars, cyclists, pedestrians and of course, the view: it is the worlds greatest fireworks launcher/focal point that you can pay to climb (if you are rich!).

Absolutely fantastic!. We chose to climb the bridge at night and we were so happy we did. The views of the city lights were just beautiful. Yes, it is expensive but it's not something that you'd do every day. The overall experience took 4 hours which included health and safety and some basic instruction. We had plenty of time to take in the sites and lots of photo stops. You can't take your own photo's but the guide had a good quality camera and took plenty to capture the experience, at a cost of $60. It's a must do and we're so pleased we did :D
Beautiful and huge bridge. An amazing bridge. As well a must see while in Sydney. You can even walk across the bridge, but you need to be free from giddiness...
The Bridge. Its not just a bridge, you see from the quay when you are there try to walk along the rock. The bridge that the world always seen for the best welcoming years in the new years eve.

Sydney Harbour Bridge. Can get a great picture of the Harbour Bridge from the Sydney Opera house. A walk across the bridge can also get you a good shot of the Opera House. Did not do the Bridge climb as too expensive.

Stand upon an icon. It takes a bit over three hours as you have to get fitted into jumpsuits and practice on the stairs inside first. Interesting guides have you hooked up to the bridge and a communication device to explain the history and the sights. Quite awesome.

Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb - Brilliant!. Must do if you are visiting Sydney! Having grown up in Sydney and moved away, our recent trip there included the Harbour Bridge Climb and so glad we did it! It is not cheap but worth it and the whole experience runs perfectly. The staff run it like a well-oiled machine. I am a little afraid of heights, was a bit tentative and they looked after me well, once you get on the arch it is fine and is an easy walk, not steep at all. Our guide Nick was great, wealth of information with some added humour. Thoroughly recommend this experience!

The good thing about this bridge is that you can walk or cycle over it. This is a landmark site for Sydney and makes a very pleasant return walk - or even one way and catching the tube back. If you have some spare time in Sydney it is a great way to see the city as it surrounds the harbor.

An australian icon. What can you say. She dominates Sydney Harbour and still remains the most stunning sight in Sydney. The beautiful thing is you can enjoy the SHB without spending a single cent. Do the Bridge climb if you really want to and can afford to but you can walk over it on the footpath (free), photograph it from the Opera House or circular Quay or Kirribilli. Cross it by train. Stand underneath it in the Rocks and marvel at its size and then remeber in was built in the 1920's with no computers or electronic devices to help.

Best views of harbour. The bridge is majestic and you do not have to do the expensive bridge climb, although it is a wonderful experience, to get up close and personal. You can simply walk across on the pedestrian lane. Costs nothing. If you only want to do one way you can take the train back to the city. Stop for a coffee at one of the great coffee shops at Milson's Point first.

Mid Life Crisis ! . My husband booked for us to do the bridge walk before we left the UK and I didn't take much notice.. Once we got there and I saw what was in front if me I could have died of fright ! However, the whole experience was one of those " once in a lifetime " moments. We went up at 4 which was perfect as not too hot and sun just setting on the way down. It was well organised, staff put you totally at ease from the minute you got there to the time you got back. You felt safe .. Even though petrified ! It's a must do .. And too expensive to do again !
Great experience. A must do in Sydney.Well organised and professional operation. Great views just all round wonderful.

An Amazing Trek. The Harbour Bridge is easily accessible from the Rocks and can be crossed on foot for no charge. The views of the city and the harbor are fantastic and the neighborhoods on the far side of the bridge are charming. Climbing one of the towers (a modest charge is involved) is also well worthwhile. If you are a construction buff, the design and size of the bridge are also fascinating. Take the walk and bring your camera.

Bridge Walk Gives a great view of Sydney. We walked the bridge on Christmas Day 2015. It was a beautiful day, perfect weather for it. The staff prepare you and even test your ability to climb before setting out. They pace it very well and the views a spectacular. Never have a steep edge so even the one doubter in our group had a good time. This area of Sydney has wonderful restaurants where you can celebrate your accomplishment!

Icon of Sydney. Another Icon of Sydney, the Harbour Bridge is something well worth a visit. Something that us locals probably take for granted because its always there, its a great backdrop for Sydney and surrounds. Great to have photos taken with the bridge in the background and I also highly recommend the Bridge Climb itself. A must see if you're in Sydney.

It's a bridge!. One of those "World" must see sights - Big Ben, the Statue of Liberty, the Eiffel Tower, you get the sort of thing. We decided not to do the "Bridge High Level Walk" but did walk across it, explored the grassy areas underneath it and passed under it when taking the ferry. It affords great views, although when you see the "protective guarding" underneath in terms of the frames and indeed the security guards you realise that for some this is simply a bridge too far - something I can fully understand.In terms of excitement, it reminded me of the Golden Gate in SFX and is certainly a must do when you are visiting the beautiful SYD Harbour area.

High and Mighty. The Bridge Climb provides a magnificent view of the wonders of Sydney and its majestic Harbour.It is very well organised, not difficult and, at all times, you feel safe whilst being exhilarated.A must for everyone, particularly for a Special occasion.

Has to be done !!. We booked this trip up months ago and when we arrived and looked up at the bridge I got a little nervous. But no need. The organization of the event is great. It takes about an hour just to get ready to go up. They really look after you. Once up its absolutely magical. Try to get Brandon to lead your group.

Good experience. We walked the bridge and it was an excellent experience! you could see for miles :) The guides are really nice and very helpful.It does take about 4 hrs from start to finish but its worth it.

Great views . Whilst I didn't do the Bridge climb as too expensive for me, just walking across the bridge was great. I did take the stairs up the Pylon Tower which offered great views across the harbour as well as an interesting museum about the bridge construction.

Brilliant. Ok this is an expensive experience but don't miss it when in Sydney. The staff were great and the attention to safety can not be faulted. The views from the bridge were stunning and far reaching. We climbed in group of 12 with Callum as our guide who supplied us with anecdotes and facts without over cooking it. This was one on my bucket list and despite the cost I enjoyed every moment and would highly recommend the experience to all.

Lives Up To All The Hype!. The bridge is really fun to watch all the people do the famous "bridge climb". We walked over the bridge, walked under it, took a boat ride under it and sat at the harbour and enjoyed it with the rest of the beauty of the harbour. There were grassy areas below the bridge for people to sit. Just make sure you enjoy Sydney Harbour at night...we found it mesmerizing. (Look closely at the photo I attached......the dots at the middle top of the bridge are people!!)
One of sydneys greats. One of sydneys greatest attractions for a bridge it sure is magestic and provides many photo opertunities

A BRIDGE TO .......... Waited over 12months to do this then in RAINED on our day..Staff on Bridge tour desk quickly changed this for us at an additional cost of $80 well worth it. Michelle our climb leader very good with all in our group of 13. Pre climb training gives you a small glimpse into how it will work....lockers provided for belongings but not suitable for very large rucksacks.... Its a funny thing to see pedestrians/cars/cruise ships below you and then a train at the side of you as you proceed to the climbing point. Photo stops along the way give you the opportunity to capture your moment o the while others in group have theirs taken you soak up your experience..over 3 hours well spent..
Iconic Harbour Bridge. it's a nice tourist iconic spot to hang around and a must location to visit while you are in Sydney. don't forget to take a video or photos with your loved ones.

amazing bridge. We took a cycle trip of the bridge ourselves. Simple amazing views and one of the most enjoyable activities. The bridge itself is fantastic. Being able to cycle over it and getting up close was amazing.
Beautiful . Very relaxing a great site to see with your family and friends or a romantic walk My friends and I had such a wonderful time we took a million pictures!!!

An incredible experience :). So glad we finally done the Bridge Climb. It was fantastic. We are so lucky with the best weather, the night view from the top was just beautiful. We'll do it again with the kids!

Awesome view!. On our first day in Sydney, we decided not to do the bridge climb. Instead, we simply walked across the bridge and back. Walking across gave an amazing view of the harbor and the opera house. It was an easy walk, but it was a little difficult to find where it started!
A great of engineering. It is recommended that you cycle across it, drive across it, take a bus across it, walk across and climb it
amazing stucture. took loads of pictures from many angles of the bridge even got photos of folks doing the bridge walk,

If you can do the bridge climb. This is such an iconic bridge, as soon as you see it you get goosebumps. You can see it from various points in the city, but the best way to experience it is climbing it! I know its expensive, but its definitely worth it. Didn't do it this time but have in the past and loved it. They tell you some great stories about the building of the bridge too.

Iconic sight!. Fabulous bridge - felt like we knew it from all the pictures but so much bigger. Fantastic to stand underneath it and look up. Didn't quite get the courage up to climb up it although you can. Wonderful

Beautiful!. We came from the U.S. to Sydney to spend a few days prior to boarding a cruise ship, and stayed within walking distance of the Sydney Harbour Bridge (The Menzies Hotel). The bridge and all around the area is just beautiful! We took the ferrie ride around the area to get a better view. We highly recommend allowing time in this area during your stay in Sydney!
Great view of city. We did the Pylon tour, did not climb the bridge....too high for us. The Pylon Tour was good, not difficult, great view and some nice historical background.
Be there at NyE. We were there at the NYE and saw the fireworks from the bridge which was really impressing. The bridge itself is wonderful and belongs to Sydney like the opera House

Yes I climbed it. Prohibitively expensive( over £100 ) but it is one of those things you HAVE to do ifyou are in Sydney. Its easy enough, I am a pensioner and did not have any trouble,the hardest part was climbing into the suit you are required to wear, one guy had it on completely the wrong way around..There are a few scary moments if you do not like heights but it has to be said it is not a frightening experience.there is no danger that you will fall off, you travel in a group[ and soon become a team and the sense of achievement when you reach the top and have your photo taken is palpable. so whatever your age if you can afford it GO FOR IT.

Amazing. We climbed the bridge just before we left and I am so glad we did. Jack was our leader and he was a fun knowledgable guy. The views were amazing and the climb wasn't bad at all. Would suit all ages and fitness levels. You can't go to Sydney and not do this. No phones allowed which was a pity!

Newcastle Tyne Bridge mk2. A big bridge over Sydney harbour although not very family orchid friendly it's bigger than its smaller sibling over the Tyne, they do not serve breakfasts or any meals stall but great for driving a car across

Amazing Views. Not only did we walk from one side to the other on the bridge, we also did the bridge climb in the evening. What a fantastic experience, both times. The views from the bridge (top and bottom) are amazing. And the history of the bridge is fascinating. Take the time to do one or the other (or both). Well worth the time.

Fantastic climb, even better staff. The bridge climb was a fantastic professional experience from start to finish. The staff was friendly and informative throughout the entirety of the walk. George, our bridge guide, quickly calmed my nerves of heights with his confident professional attitude and witty humor. George seemed to know the answer to every question we threw at him not only about the bridge but about the surrounding area as well. This was without of doubt one of my highlights in my visit to Sydney and I will be recommending this to friends and family for years to come.

Walk The Bridge. Took the opportunity to walk the bridge At $290 pp not cheap, but definitely worth it Afraid of heights, not a oroblem, the walk ways on the bridge are wide, rails to hold on to and a safety harness for extra safety.The actual walk was about 1.5 hours, padded out with POI's, photos and narration via headsets The walk is easy and well paced, suitable for fit and unfit people you wear their gear, except for shoes, wear comfortable non slip shoes. When wearing their jump suites, it was recommended to wear only under garments - I am glad I did, as can get quite warm .Fantastic views up there - 360 views of Sydney. Understandbly you cannot take anything up with you, no cameras, phones, jewellery etc, don't want anything falling on traffic below.We purchased the photo pack, it was worth it. If you can afford it, definitely suggest you do it. The history around the bridge is interesting as well

Nice easy walk with breathtaking structure of the iconic Harbour bridge. Coming to Sydney, people often look forward to see Opera House albeit I was more blown away by the iconic giant of the Harbour Bridge. You can have a nice 30 mins walk across the bridge that starts from The Rocks to the other side at Milsons Point. The walk is picturesque with the hustle of traffic and infamous Sydney Cityrail on the other side. The pedestrian area is cordoned off with railings on both sides and it is truly a magnificent structure. Preferable to go in Sunny weather to capture the true beauty of Sydney Harbour as seen from the Harbour bridge.

Fabulous experience - not to be missed. The view from the Bridge Climb cannot be beat, it was absolutely awesome. I was concerned about fitness level but the grade is so gradual, it is no problem whatsoever. Even though we were on a windy day, following one rainshower before a thunderstorm blew in (you can see the clouds in the background of the picture), I would do it again in a heartbeat. Just hold onto your hats if it is windy.

Still Amazes after 30 years. I have lived in Sydney for 30+ years and still take every opportunity I can to walk across the Harbour Bridge. The walk from one side to the other is approx 1.5Km (3.0Km return). Views are simply amazing. Walkers are on the eastern side of the bridge and cyclists on the western footpath. If you are visiting Sydney don't miss the Pylon lookout - (Adults $13 Children 5-12 $6.50 4 & Under - Free) at the top of the South East Pylon - enter from the footpath as it crosses the Southern pylon. Walk up the stairs to an exhibition all about the bridge and up to the viewing deck which has 360 degree panoramic views of Sydney. Much cheaper than Bridge Climb! If you are particularly keen on the design of the Bridge go down to the waterfront and inspect the hinges on each side that essentially support the bridge. Amazing engineering from the 1930's. Options for those who want a shorter walk are walk across and catch either the train (Milsons Point Station) or ferry (Luna Park Wharf) back to the city. Longer walk options include continuing south at the southern exit by heading UP the stairs and walking along the footpath on the Cahill Expressway to Circular Quay for another view of the Quay from the undercover viewing platform. Great shots of the bridge from here too.

As good as it looks in photo's!. Mesmerising indeed, unbelievable that something that everyone has seen multiple time in photos can be so impressive in reality in spite of being old & not so big. Its iconic image lives up to expectations. It looks even more beautiful during fireworks on every Saturday or the New Year Eve day each year. Also one may consider climbing it since this is very popular & can be fun for someone interested in such activities. If you are planning to take cruise in the harbour then be prepared to be even more impressed by it as you get great views from the ship.
Nice walk. A few friends and I walked across and took the train back after eating brunch in North Sydney. Nice views and can be a bit chilly with the wind.
Amazing. A beautiful easy walk across a wonderful harbour. Easy pace or run this is a must do when visiting Sydney

Good 2 km walk. You are able to walk through the bridge, and go explore different parts of sydney from there, like circular quay, Sydney Opera house, the rocks and many more,I consider this walk a must for anybody visiting Sydney... You can start your walk from Milson's point station and go all the way to the other side of the bridge...

Okay. Expected much more.
Go in sunny weather. Otherwise the wind will turn your umbrella inside out.
Overall still worth a good look.

Climbing the Bridge. Was amazing did not think I would be able to do it, considering I was 80 in 2015. But I did.... The training given was seconds to none. The care and Patience by all the staff was superb. Well done to they all, from the reception area, the guides, the staff on the sales area. Were all very willing to assist for what ever reason. So Thankyou everyone for being kind to an old girl..... I need not have been scared.

Sydney Harbour Bridge. If you are going to visit the Sydney Harbour Bridge the best way is to climb it. This can be booked which has different levels? We did the full climb which with the safety brief, putting on all the gear etc takes around three and a half hours. The views from the summit are amazing. The summit is around 134 meters. I am not going to spoil it by giving you all of the information about the bridge as the best way to learn about is is during the climb but definitely worth the money. I think we paid around $933 AUD which I guess is around £150 each for the three of us, well worth it. You are given a certificate and a group photo included in you fee and can purchase extra photos if you wish. We booked through a company called Viator, booking online and payment was really easy.
Twilight climb. Got forced into this by my family but I am so glad I experienced it. The views were amazing, staff excellent, well worth the cost. Scary in parts but so worth it.

Iconic..... After an early arrival into Sydney airport our private driver took us to see the bridge in all its glory at sunrise. This iconic landmark looked amazing at first light and you can't miss it from most places in downtown Sydney including our harbour view room in the Shangri-La hotel. You can walk, drive or get the train all the way across and I would definately recommend visiting the pylon lookout (see additional review) whilst crossing the bridge, a cheaper and quicker alternative to the Bridge Walk for the views.
Just gotta see it. We didn't do the walk - but it is worth heading to the rocks so you can have a look underneath the bridge - see the structure and get some cool pics

Better than Bridge Climb!. Why pay $$ to climb it when you can get the train for $4 to Milsons Point and then walk back over the bridge for an equally fantastic view? For an extra $13 climb one of the pillars for a great view....
A Sydney icon!. Choose to either walk, drive and/or climb the bridge. This is an historic attraction. It can get windy, not much in the way of shelter available.

Amazing Climb and Views. We booked our climb in advance of our arrival as we knew around New Year's Eve they'd be pretty full, as was definitely the case. If your afraid of the climb - DON'T BE........ I have a fear of heights and although there were some moments i thought what in the world am I doing, they make you feel so safe at all times, that there really is nothing to worry about. There's additional staff along the way in addition to the staff. If your going to Sydney, please don't pass up the opportunity to do the climb, it's amazing the views and sense of accomplishment, once you've reached the top. Worth every penny ! ! ! ! !
Adventure time. I climbed the bridge a few years ago n it was awesome. It is safe n adventure. I wish to do it again one day

Iconic. Always a joy to view. Focus for all sydney events. Beautiful in early morning as photo depicts. Take the ferry around the Harbour to view it. Great to walk over it and of course the new years eve fireworks with the waterfall effect from it are one of a kind. Best seen from lawns below blues point tower. Take a picnic lunch & the dog and enjoy the full span of the bridge. Early morn & late evening are the best times.
beautiful view. great view from the Opera area... you can take shots from the opera, the river and the bridge together...

'The Bridge Climb' An Experience NOT to be missed. We knew once we were going to Sydney, this was top of the list, as far as attractions go. We booked on line, direct with 'Bridge Climb' before we left the UK. We wanted to make sure we got the day and most suitable time for us. We only had a short stay in the City before moving on. We arrived in Sydney on 1st December and had booked our trip for 3rd December at 11.05 a.m. We did the full climb. I'd recommend this to everyone. Please give it a go. Such an amazing thing to do! The day before our climb, we strolled from our hotel, The Tank Stream in Pitt Street, which was approx 10 mins from the Bridge Climb, which is 5 Cumberland Street, The Rocks. We wanted to ensure we arrived in plenty of time on the day, and also to get our bearings. So easy to find, not a problem. Before the climb, everything is explained, your group are all showed what to do, you're given all the equipment and you get to practice before, going up the ladders. using the safety harness. Our instructor was brilliant. He had a great sense of humour and was a great tour guide. You are required to take a breath test before doing the climb, to make sure you are fit to climb and not under the influence of drink. You have everything you need equipment wise, including headphones, to hear instructions and take in the commentary. Don't let age put you off, we are both senior citizens me 65 and my husband 71. We are fit and active but this is not strenuous. We had lady in our group who was celebrating her 80th Birthday, accompanied by her granddaughter. This is a very safety conscious environment, without spoiling the thrill of the climb. The ladders are a little bit daunting at first but then the steps on the bridge are easy to do. The views are mind blowing. You can't take a camera with you but you can have photographs taken and purchase as many as you like when you've completed the climb. You're given a photo and a certificate as part of the 'Climb Package'. We purchased the photo pack, which we had on a pen drive. Reasonably priced. We are so pleased we did it!!! The organisers of The Bridge Climb have every reason to be proud of this attraction. 10/10!

The Bridge, the Climb and the View!. What a majestic bridge. I must have taken hundreds of photos of the bridge itself during my trip to Sydney. I was so fascinated by it that I decided to do the bridge climb and it was totally worth it. I did the express climb and it gets done in just over 2 hours. You get to the top most point which is 440 ft above the harbor. The view from the top is just to die for. They recommend that you do this climb during twilight so that you can see the city lit up. But it's just beautiful whatever time of the day. The climb leaders are also very knowledgeable. You get to take photos at the top too. :) Also, once you finish the climb, you are awarded a climber certificate.

Sydney Harbour Bridge. I love the bridge and the view from the bridge climb is amazing. The bridge climb is fun and exciting. My hubby is scared of heights and he enjoyed the climb. It is very safe. I recommend it to my friends. You can also walk across to North Sydney from the city side or climb the pylon. You can always just catch a bus or train across it.

BridgeClimb. I was told by friends that I absolutely HAD to do the Bridge Climb while I was in Sydney and now I understand why! It was a rainy and windy day so I was nervous about how much I liked it but once I got to the top--the views were AMAZING! They equipped us with everything we needed and even gave us a rain jacket and rain pants. (Only thing was our shoes got wet.) Our guide was so knowledgeable about the bridge history and really helped you to appreciate what we were climbing on and the significance of the bridge to the Australian people. Don't be turned off by the cost of the Bridge Climb--it was worth every penny!

Great Climb. My two children (10,13 yrs old) and I climbed the bridge in December 2015 and WOW what a great time. The guide was very good and the whole tour was very organized from start to finish. I would suggest doing this when visiting Sydney.

We did the Pylon Climb.... Instead of doing the bridge walk (like 1,300 steps), we did the Pylon Climb (about 225 steps). Really nice views from the top of the pylon out onto the harbor, Opera house, etc. Much cheaper and worth it. Remember though, it's still really a bridge.

Awesome bridge. Iconic Sydney sight. Kids enjoyed seeing it from the public ferry and got lots of good pics walking round both sides. Can walk across it, go to the pylon look out and do the bridge climb. Absolutely stunning
Worth it and it's not that scary ...honest :-). Book the sunset an you will not be disappointed, also go for the long tour as the short on does not give you enough time.
Awesome!. Awesome place to visit. Walking distance from the train station & ferry station. We also did the bridge climb which was an amazing experience in itself

Iconic part of the Sydney foreshore that you can look at, walk across or even climb over. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is one of the most iconic bridges in the world. You cannot miss seeing it when walking around the foreshore of Sydney and for its age it was built with a lot of foresight to carry the amount of traffic it carries. You can walk across it or even walk over it with the Bridge Climb which I highly recommend. You can also walk up the pylon closest to the city to look at some of the history of the building of the bridge. On New Years Eve it is also the highlight of the New Years fireworks.
Amazing. What a sight especially at midnight on New Year's Eve with the best fireworks in the world. Bridge climbs look spectacular but are expensive.

A must do!. Well, obviously the Harbour Bridge is the main icon in Sydney, and it's as impressive as the pictures suggest!I walk across it as well as over it whilst in Sydney and both were amazing experiences. On the way back from Luna Park, we opted to walk from the North side (where Luna is situated) back to the South (where the City is) The views are incredible and well worth doing! I also walked over it with a group of friends and was one of the most exhilarating experiences of my life. The experience from start to finish is incredible. Our guide Callum was extremely personable and made each and every one of us comfortable with both the safety procedures and also the entire walk, and was extremely knowledgeable about the all aspects of the history of the bridge. If you have a fear of heights, this will conquer it! It's extremely safe, and if you can do this, you can do anything! It may seem pricey, but you do have to remember this is around a 3-4 hour incredible experience, so make sure you book in advance and do it!
Nice. It was very good! I climbed on this bridge. It was scary, but i liked to do that! You can see beautiful views from upstairs!
bridge climb. fantastic fun went with family group, even good if scared of heights as cant see too much looking down but view outwards excellent

Spectacular view of the Opera house even if you do not do the Harbour Bridge Climb. This bridge connects vehicles across both ends of Sydney and is also available for to cross by foot. Get up onto the bridge like daily commuters do and lookout from it! Spectacular view sans entrance fee cost!

The best way to see Sydney!. If I had limited time to visit Sydney the first thing I would do would be to walk across (and over if your budget allows!) the Sydney Harbour Bridge and feel the impressiveness of this iconic construction built long before the time when anyone could have imagined how much it would be used. Walking across is free. You can do it at any time of day and stop and soak up the views for as long as you want. Early morning sunrise would be spectacular. Walking over the curve of the bridge is a great experience offering arguably the best views of Sydney Harbour. It is not scary at all, unless perhaps if you suffer from vertigo. The tours are conducted safely and professionally. Having the permit and safety facilities to run such an operation must be expensive so do expect to pay for the privilege. It's not something you can do on every bridge around the world ... we thought it was worth it as a unique experience.

Excellent views and nice walk. We walked the bridge during the day and again at night to get a view of the city. During the day it is crowded with tourists and commuters as pedestrians can only walk the east side of the bridge. Make sure you walk on the left to not get in the way of others walking. Worth the steps and the stairs to get there.

The climb is a must!. Booked the climb for Christmas Day and was a really delighted with the experience. Focus on safety is impressive and the briefing was very thorough. The climb itself is amazing. The views are incredible. The guide did a great job keeping us informed and entertained and there was even a visit from Santa! Whilst not cheap I felt this was real value for money and would recommend to anyone visiting Sydney. Was one of the highlights of the holiday.

Unmissable. You think of Sydney, you think of the bridge and opera house. I'm sure it's one of the most photographed icons ever. Absolutely huge when you get close. We went under it on a cruise and over it in a taxi. And of course, it stars in the NYE celebrations every year.
small bridge but fun to experience. The bridge connects the north side with or north shore with Sydney proper it's not a long bridge but going across you have good views

Great views from the Bridge pylon viewing platform. We decided to resist the Bridge climb (so expensive) and take the stairway up the Bridge pylon - from which we had magnificent 360 degree views of Sydney and the harbour. Interesting museum and video about the building of the Bridge and its history. Fun, informative experience with stunning views.

Besides Opera house, another place you won't miss. It's been a while since I was in Australia, but I remember the beautiful view and having photos from the bridge. Moreover, the NY eve fireworks on the bridge is nothing but beautiful. You can also climb up the bridge; years back I think would cost you not sure if 50 aud to a 100 aud; not sure if it's the same.

Harbour Bridge Walking Tour. We went as a family of four and whilst the initial expense seemed off-putting (it was nearly AUD900) my wife who persisted in saying we should go, won out. I am so glad she did. Truly memorable, professionally put together and the guide was excellent. He was well informed, entertaining and certainly added to the overall experience.The whole trip took around 3 hours and at no point seemed stretched out. The pre-climb training session initially seemed unnecessary (how difficult can it be to go up and down a ladder?) was handled efficiently and the value of doing so became very apparent; as on the bridge, where it became very obvious, just how difficult it would be to teach someone on the bridge itself.We were in a party of 12 (ish) and this seemed very manageable. The climb itself is gradual but continuous. Members in our groups were afraid of heights and there are some moments that those with vertigo really might struggle. The guide was great at constantly being considerate of this. The kids took it in their stride and at no point did any of us feel unsafe or ill prepared.We had a blue sky day and amazing views. It was quite warm but a breeze took the edge off. I would be wary about doing the climb on a super hot day as there's little shelter from the elements and if it was raining or very windy it could ruin it for you too. It is very exposed!The walk included 'a' picture and this to me was the only downside. You can't take your own cameras. I would have loved to take photos and considering they allow you to clip other bits to your jumpsuit (sunglasses & hanky) this seemed particularly draconian. In the age of gopros and camera attachments it seemed a real shame they didn't have an option (even if it came with a cost) to shoot your own footage. The views are incredible, the ascent majestic and when the seaplane skimmed over us at the top of the bridge (so close we could see the passengers clearly) and waggled his wings at the waving kids, it was one photo opportunity after another!To be honest though we went for the memories, not the photos, and it will be one ingrained in my families travel log forever. It's certainly not the cheapest of tours but we all felt it was well worth every cent!
Striking Landmark. We did the Bridge Climb on our first visit in 2013 and realy enjoyed it so much that we returned this year for NYE.
Spectacular view from the bridge climb. The bridge climb is an amazing experience. Highly recommend it! The views are incredible from the top of the bridge!

The jewel in the crown of Sydney Harbour. We went under it on a ferry to Luna Park, then walked across it and walked up the 200 steps to the Pylon lookout. On another day we climbed it at sunset. We just loved everything about the bridge, it is an incredible engineering marvel. Walking across is on the pedestrian path is free. Climbing the stairs up the pylon is a small fee. Climbing it is more expensive and will require you to book well in advance, especially during busy times of the year.

Beautiful views from the bridge, you can walk over it, go over it by train, drive over it cycle, or climb it!. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is a real Sydney icon a beautiful amazing looking bridge. The pylon lookout point (which can be reached from one of the pylons, for a small fee) has wonderful views of the harbour and the sydney opera house and city skyline Even more impressive views if you go to barangaroo down by the water or observatory hill park to look at it! WORTH A LOOK!!

Sydney's iconic landmark. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is an iconic landmark. Cannot miss it while in Sydney. It's a very interesting piece of engineering as well. I highly recommend going up to the lookout on one of the pylons. Awesome view of Circular Quay and the opera house (and of course the bridge itself) from up there! :)
Spectacular. We did the Bridge tour which was fabulous, but if you're on a budget, just walk over the bridge. So beautiful!

Bridge climb. this was such an amazing experience i went with my family and it was just awesome. the views from the top were amazing. We went during the day but the evening climb looked incredible however you had to book in advance!

Such a beautiful landmark. Me and my family have a chance to walk on the harbor bridge. We took lot of photos with a amazing view, the opera house for the great background. It was a sunshine day, we are so lucky to see a blue sky on a amazing bridge in Sydney, Australia. If we have a chance we will climb the bridge next visit.
connecting Sydney. I was able to go over, under and saw it from afar at night thanks to some friends. It was a spectacular view.
Lovely place to visit. If your in Sydney this is a must to come and view the bridge and we walked and drove across it and went under on boat New Year's Eve .

World's largest steel Arch bridge. Sydney Harbour Bridge is the world's largest (but not longest as thats the New River Gorge in the USA) steel arch bridge, and, in its beautiful harbour location, has become a renowned international symbol of Australia.

One of my favourite Australian landmarks.. I tend to squeal like a little girl when I drive over it every time. I haven't climbed it yet but it's on the list definitely.Many places to enjoy a picnic under the bridge and gaze at it endlessly.

if you are brave then climb!. we viewed the bridge from the Opera house and got some excellent shots. because of the heavy rain it was not open for climbing when we were there. It is expensive to climb but I suppose if you like that worthwhile. some good views but it was getting dark because of the rain. Go again? Yes.
A landmark. Any visit to Sydney should include a walk across this famous bridge. It's right near many tourist attractions including the Sydney Opera House.

It's what it is all about . There is a reason why, along with the Opera House this has become one of the most recognised structures in the world.
But take time to take in the history and understand what a massive over engineered build this was. When built there were just five registered cars on the north side. Now there are 250,000 crossings daily.

Overlooking Sydney. Well one has to climb the bridge while in Sydney. So I did. The safety aspect of it was meticulous, and not nearly as scarey as I thought it might be. Perhaps a little bit pricey but it is a tourist trap. The actual climb turned out to be a gentle stroll, with a few ladders to climb. The views were impresive, probably the night time ones even better, but worth the extra cost????

Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. The Sydney Harbour Bridge climb is a must. We took the evening climb and it was amazing to see the lights of the city start to come on as we climbed almost to the center of the bridge. By the time we got to the center, all the lights were on and showing a beautiful city from an unbelievable vantage point. I won't kid you, there are a few spots that I thought I wasn't going to make it but there are many times when you stop as the rest of the group catches up so it's not bad at all. The staff was very professional and took the utmost care to see that EVERYONE followed the rules and had all needed equipment on. You can't take anything, including cameras, cell phones or even your watch with you on the climb. They provide all the outerwear you will need for whatever weather is like the day of your climb. They do take several pictures of you on the climb, and ever though they are an extra charge, it is well worth it. This is something you may only do once in a lifetime and it is well with the money.

Stunning views!!. Its kind of a must to climb the bridge really in Sydney. Yes I admit it is really expensive to just walk up a bridge but it is the joint icon of Sydney and the views you get are amazing. Unfortunately you cant take anything up there with you so that means no photos! So as I'm sure many of you will guess that means they will charge extra for you to have your photos taken- yes!!!! But if you are in a group then you can all chip in to buy all your photos and videos to be put on a USB stick which costs 60 AUS dollars. There are many different types of climbs you can do also at different times of the day. I did my climb in the middle of the day and sadly it was cloudy. On a clear day I could imagine it would be a lot better and I would love to have done the climb at night.

The Rock!. purchased Opal card, took the train to Circular Quay, walked around the area by the harbor, then walk to the Rock, rode the train back to CBD. There are many restaurants and cafes, nice to spend time.

Sydney NYE fireworks 2015/2016. We came here to see the New Years in for 2016 and were most certainly not disappointed! The fireworks were amazing!!!! It's been on our bucket list for a while and we decided to do it this year - so glad we did - is certainly worth it !!!!

Stunning views from every side of the Bridge. The bridge is at the perfect location with the sky tower building, sea side, opera house and king park on one hand. One can just experience the beauty of the bridge walking across from every corner especially from the CBD side. There are cruise starting from the corner of the bridge down. Nice shops are nearby with a park down side. The bride can be climbed by stairs and for over the top climb there are tours operated. There are walkways on the bridge to cross. The bridge looks stunning when the lights gets on, even if the day time if the sun is shining the bridge looks amazing combined with the blue water. In the evening, local street performers come up to shoe different talents and is a fun to watch. Overall, a true icon of Sydney...

Great Climb. We had booked a bridge climb and thoroughly enjoyed it, complete with pictures. It's not hard anyone can do it, except if you are afraid of heights. Great views of the city from the top. A must do for all visitors.

Climb at night time in summer. Went with my 10 yr old son and did the climb at night. it was absolutely amazing. He loved it and so did I. Also an easy walk across if not interested in the climb. When we walked across the cruise ship was exiting so very exciting. the view is a little bit obscured on the walk way due to safety fence but you can still get some good pics.

Sydney's Icon. When in Sydney how can you not go and see this amazing bridge.If you have the time i definitely recommend catching the train to the other end and walking back across. The structure of the bridge its self is very photogenic. Plus you get great views of the city and the opera house. Plus if you walk back accross you get to come back through via The Rocks.
Nice walk over the bridge. Any person traveling to Sydney should walk the bridge and take a selfie with opera house on a background!

Awesome Experience!. Climbing the Sydney Harbour Bridge is definitely a "bucket list" experience! It was one of the highlights of our trip to Sydney. Steve, our guide, was excellent. He made our climb fun, informative, and relaxed. Even my husband, who doesn't like heights, felt safe and comfortable on the bridge. Definitely a must do!
Walked accross the Bridge. Great and casual walk across the bridge, nice and clean well patrolled by security staff , fantastic views from the bridge lots of photo opportunities.

NYE at it's best. A bucket list moment to experience NYE on the harbour close to the iconic Harbour Bridge. Well this was the year and what a memory. Harbour so magnificent at all times, watching the cruise ships come and go, the movements of the ferries, the splendour of the harbour views and an extra bonus on New Years Eve. Big tick on the bucket list.
Walk across for free. Many people pay to walk across above but it is very expensive ($300). Instead just walk across... You still get great views of the city.

Beautiful by Day and Night. Such an iconic attraction that makes you feel truly a part of the lovely Sydney landscape. There's always something to watch by day or night either over the Bridge (bridge climbers), under the Bridge (yachts and boats) or on the Bridge (vehicles and walkers).

Amazing experience!. My family of 4 did the bridge climb and it is an amazing experience! You've got to try it at least once! The climb leader, Leah, was great and took good care of each person and she was also very knowledgeable and able to answer most questions.
Beautiful bridge. The bridge is magnificent and you can see it from each side as well as on the cruise. You can walk on it or you can walk to the half and go back to the city center.
Fun walk!. We walked across the bridge on the lower level, which was wonderful. It is well-protected and affords wonderful views.

Not just a giant coat hanger. An iconic structure recognized world wide. Driving over the bridge is not as exciting as climbing the bridge would be. If you are able bodied and have the time ( we ran out of time, it's on our to do list for our next visit) this will be an experience you will long remember I am told. From different vantage points like the Opera House, ferries and other areas, around the bridge, you can make the bridge a spectacular part of the background in your family happy snaps or even in your selfies.

Cool activity to do or just watch. I was so impressed when I saw that people could actually climb the arch of the bridge. There were tons of people doing it, and it looks like there are 2 different arches available to climb. I'm not brave enough to have done it, but it was pretty cool to see!

Must do in Sydney. Beautiful!Lovely romantic backdrop for pics..Try and take a ferry ride that takes you under it and you will be able to get lovely shots of the opera house and the bridge...Iconic symbol of Sydney..

Sydney Harbour at its best.. If your coming into Sydney from the North you will probably travel either over the bridge or the harbour tunnel. Don't do the tunnel but take the bridge. This is one of the best places to view the harbour. Both a friend and my husband did the bridge climb. They loved every minute. They did the climb close to Sunset. So initially they saw the city and harbour in daylight then when the sun set they saw all the beautiful lights. Sydney is a fantastic city to visit. Make your stay as long as possible as their is so much to see.
Just Amazing. been here once . you cannot miss this if you are in Sydney. there are lot of bars and cafe to eat.it is a Magnificent Structure.Trust Me This this the memory which will last forever.

Once in life time experience indeed!. It's expensive but it's worthy! Their office location is a bit difficult for tourist like us to find it. The tour guide is good & a cheeky one (good!!). He gives us (in our late 60ist), time to catch our breath. The group full with young people who understand us. I, particularly would like to thank the powies young married couple who look back to check for us, now and then. GBU. The climbing experience itself, is indescribable! We have a soar legs for days!! The should improved the slippery steps, to anticipate the wet weather, though. I highly recommend it!

Entertaining Overseas Visitors. My wife and I have done this climb before,but we had visitors from Keil in Germany and they requested to do the climb.The views were great as last time but the rain started and put a bit of a downer on the climb.Overall another great aussie experence

climbing the Bridge in Sydney. I climbed the bridge around lunch time and will have to do the night climb as well. The view is breathtaking the staff knowledgeable and friendly. Spend some time before or after at the Rocks area market. Fantastic.

Magnificent achievement . Truly magnificent piece of engineering. You can see the individual rivets and massive bolts holding it all together. Worth a walk across to the pylons exhibit to see the history of construction .

Bridge Climb -MUST DO . Fabulous tour. Ok, over the top on safety for those who are hesitant. Best views of the harbor and opera house. They sell you a usb of pics at the end for 60$. Sure it's a lot of money, but worth it. SO to Richard, he was the best guide. Fun, informative and got some great pics of us.
Best place to be on New Year. Time zone, location, weather and perfect logistics makes this place THE PLACE to be for New Year celebration.
nice views. my family and i walked the bridge on a windy day, views were beautiful, and a great place to visit Not to be missed

Expensive experience. Was good, I think.
A must do but it's expensive and feel a rip off just like some Italian restaurant in Sydney harbour charges $9 for a little scoop of Gelato ice cream.
Mind you to read menu and price before ordering in those restaurants in Sydney Harbour. They are totally not Australian
Iconic Sydney attraction. Together with the Opera House, this is an iconic Sydney attraction. I recommend taking the train to Milsons Point station and walking back to the city over the bridge.

Always A Thrill. Coming from Sydney originally, and recently back for a visit with family, I was amazed to realize when walking the bridge with my Mum, that neither of us had ever gone up a pylon. As we crossed we discussed whether you still could, and as we came upon the one closest to the city & Circular Quay, there was an open door with admission price sign, and a staircase beckoning. My 84 year old mother easily made it up all 200 or so stairs - which are shallow-rise and in sections, with things to look at on the way up. The top is the next best thing to doing the Bridge Climb if you can't afford that, because the views are amazing. Even just walking across this gargantuan bridge is an adventure and an easy and wonderful way to get high above the harbour, the city, the boat traffic, etc. Start at one end and catch the train back to the other, or a ferry or even a bus. It's so easy. Then of course there's the Bridge Climb - which is probably a separate review topic - but is the only way to go up to the very top of the bridge. I've done this twice in the past, and it's a little pricey, but an iconic activity, and very safe (in spite of what one might think).If you're not into heights, just walk down around the two bridge ends, from either The Rocks/Circular Quay on the city side, or from Milson's Point Station on the other end - or from the ferry at Luna Park and at Kirribilli (Jeffrey St Wharf). Stunning stunning stunning, any way you experience this iconic piece of engineering.

Climb it if you can - it's worth the money. A great place to see the city from and very worth the climb. I've climbed it twice and loved it both times. The experience is amazing and the views can't be bettered.

Sydney never disappoints. Fifteen years ago we took our kids to Sydney and enjoyed being on the harbour looking at the bridge, ten years ago we climbed the bridge and this year we walked across it. It is a magnificent structure and Aussies can be proud of the architectural achievement. Apart from the deaths during its construction it is a wonderful story. Go to the bridge and find out all about it.
Just amazing. It's a must in Sydney. Crossing the bridge us even nicer and just around 1,5km. The view to the bay is amazing.

Iconic. The iconic Sydney Harbour Bridge - easily glimpsed from between cbd buildings , but looms large the closer you get to Circular Quay and The Rocks. Spectacular view if you walk around the the Opera House.

Iconic. Even as an Australian who visits Sydney often, there is something about the Bridge that gives me butterflies every time I see it. Such an iconic part of Australia and looks great in photos. I am looking forward to climbing it one day

wonderful walk over from milsons point. It is such a plesant walk over the street/footpath level of the bridge. Its free and has beautiful opportunities for panorama photos amd opera house and harbour snaps.

Iconic but nothing to write home about. the view you see on tv shows a nice harbour with this well-known bridge. up close, it is like any other. don't do the bridge walk - really expensive and not as good as other views, e.g. top floor of the shang ri-la hotel
Bridge climb. Good experience but over priced for the money you pay. Plus no pictures allowed they sell you the pictures they take which again are over priced.

Just what I expected. Drove over it, went on the river cat under it, train and bus across and walked to the viewpoint museum and viewing platform. It is all I expected and more. Do the bridge climb if you can and have enough time.
I agree was smaller than expected!. First impression was that I thought the bridge was a lot bigger than it actually is! Golden gate more spectacular ! I think it is over hyped somewhat!

A wonderful walk with stunning views of the city. We just did the pedestrian walk but it was well worth it. They have a good system so pedal cycles use one Sid of the bridge and pedestrians the other so you are not buzzed by bikes.
Beautiful. The walk is quick and easy, great views of the harbor. I recommend spending the money to go up in the Pylon Lookout. Even better views of the city, the opera house and harbor.

New year eve. The best moment here! Milsons point is a huge park where the people take place to sight the new year fireworks. Arrive at least 3pm, enjoy a picnic, the sunset and wait until 9pm the first spectacular and then at 12am the final fireworks!
It's a unique experience!

A very expensive bridge to climb . Before we arrive in Sydney, I read from TripAdvisor review that it cost about A$160 to A$250 to claim the bridge but when I wanted to book a trip at the reception counter of Novotel Rockford where I was staying, I was quoted $300 for the day climb and $350 for the sunset climb. I decided to give it a miss as it was too expensive. My wife and friends with their 11 year old son then decided to walk across the bridge which is free of charge. It was a nice walk with cool wind blowing. We could see the view of the famed Opera House. The only setback is that of the metal fencing which is understandably necessary for safety reason but marred the photo taking. Overall, it was a nice walk across.

Climbed the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Our family climbed the Sydney Harbour Bridge as a birthday gift and it was an experience that we won't forget. The preparation took quite a long time and we had to hand in any items that could fall off the bridge such as mobile phones. The international group that we shared this experience with, seemed to enjoy it as much as we did. It was over too soon as we wanted to stay at the top longer!

Breathtaking Bridge Walk!. If you're not too afraid of heights, consider taking the Bridge Walk, as in OVER the span of the bridge! Two companies offer tours and both seem to be very similar in terms of: safety, cultural and historical knowledge about the bridge and price. And go with a friend, because you want to share this tremendous experience.

Good - but not sure why so hyped. The bride is nice, heavy, etc. - but not sure why this is so hyped. The first time I saw this, I thought 'nice, but...what is special about this?'. I find the Golden Gate Bridge and others to be more impressive.

Best in Sydney. Aside from the Opera House, perhaps this building is the best in Sydney especially at night. Easily reachable from Circular Quay station, there is some walk which can be done to walk across this bridge or to capture photos of the Opera House from the bridge itself.
Beautiful Views . Was thinking this would be grueling and uncomfortable but it was a great experience. This was involved with a tour and very much worth it.
unique attraction. It adds a lot of character to the Sydney harbour. It looks even beautiful during dawn and dusk. We saw it during sunset and the sight of people taking the sunset climb was amazing.

Cool bridge! . Really cool bridge, pretty massive too when you look at it in comparison to people. You can walk across the top for a pretty steep price, if thats your thing! A must see either way, go to opera house side for the best photo.

Iconic. Everyone going to Australia wants a selfie in front of The Bridge, and why not? I've never done the climb and don't know the details but the best views of Sydney Harbour, The Bridge and The opera House can be cheaply found aboard the Manly Ferry departing regularly from Circular Quay. On a fine day, Sydney Harbour is pleasant and spectacular and if you are anywhere on the East Coast you should take the tour. Access to The Quay is easy from the airport by train or a much more expensive cab ride.

A day out. The bridge is a stones throw away from the opera house, with a wonder hand crafted market underneath it on Saturday's and Sunday's. There are places to eat and lots to see. Well worth a look at the market and if you are feeling brave you can walk across the top of the bridge. A sight to see.

Classic Icon of Sydney. There are many fantastic points for taking photos of this Landmark - a great angle from Blues Point, Luna Park etc. Take a walk across the bridge is fascinating. Climb the pylon if you are not able to participate in a Bridge Climb.

Walk, climb or take photos. Lovely to look at, picture perfect, great location, walk across it, or do the excellent Bridge Climb - not that hard - caters for all levels. Allow 3.5 hours for the climb - its also a bit tricky to get to.
Must do. This wonderful bridge was called The Coathanger years ago. Not so much now, but it is a Sydney must do.
Simply Beautiful! A must see.. I can never get tired of watching that bridge. It is so beautiful and if you like architecture of civil engineering, this a fascinating work of art... and pure genius.

Amazing excellent prefect . I did the bridge climb with my girlfriend at the twilight time and it was Amazing to see let alone climb it. I would defo recommend people to climb it but if you can't do that you must visit it and walk under it, just amazing

Walk over the bridge. We didn't pay to go over the top of the bridge, however you can easily walk the length of the bridge and get a beautiful view of the harbour from across the bay. There is also a section near the middle which you can go up for a higher lookout and costs just 13 dollars per adult, so a much cheaper alternative to the actual bridge climb! An enjoyable walk with lovely views.
Bridge Climb. 3rd time we have climbed the bridge but our 1st day climbEverything from start to Finnish on this trip was superbVery profession and friendly staff

Walked over the bridge.... Fab Views. Walked over the bridge and the views were amazing! We didn't do the bridge climb, just walked over the bridge as a pedestrian to the other side. We were put off the bridge climb as you can't take a camera and the cost is expensive in my opinion so this was a good alternative.
Good Photo location for Sydney Opera House. Enjoyed walking the bridge. It is also a good location to take photos of the Sydney Opera House . ..

A Memorable Way to see the Sights of Sydney Harbor and the Opera House. The ability to get some exercise as well as see the breath taking views of Sydney Harbor house and Sydney Harbor were absolutely amazing! This is a definitely for everyone's list to do in Sydney. Enjoy with many cafes' on either side.

On everyone's bucket list!. It's the one landmark on earth you just cannot miss. Great views from all sides of the harbour, but definitely catch a lunch or dinner down at Circular Quay where you can dine with a view.

Bridge Mania. There are so many ways to see the bridge other than the climb. I walked it once, but this time I took a bike tour that went half way and stopped to allow us to take all of the bridge photos we needed. The views of the opera house and the harbor do not disappoint.

Awesome walk. Walking on the Sydney Harbour bridge was very relaxing and easy as well as free.
It took about 25 minutes to cross with great views along the way.
I love bridges . I love bridges! This is a beautiful older bridge. You can't miss it if you go to the harbor. We may do the bridge climb but even getting to see it is fun!
Lovely view. Great view of the harbour bridge from the opera house. If you have the chance, try and climb it. Alternatively you can go to the "tower" bits and climb that for a fraction of the price!

The 'Bridge' in the Forties. I remember my Dad taking my brother and I over the 'Bridge' from the city to North Sydney on many a Saturday. In those days' you travelled on shanks's pony - your feet. What an experience. A stop at the pylon to view the city from way up there was a treat and a half. The best thing about the pylon were the cats. They used to live up there (until some idiot thought it was a good idea to throw them off, albeit one by one over a great period of time). We heard about the demise of the cats over the radio. There were no television's in those days. Now I'm 72 and it's still a pleasure going over the Bridge. Of course the desired method of travel is by car. Maybe one day I might 'stroll' over the Bridge one last time.

A must do. Before you spend crazy money to walk over the harbour bridge do it yourself. Yes you can walk across the harbour bridge for free. It is a terrific walk and you can take as many photos as you like without having to pay for them.

Fabulous views from the Coathanger!. Try walking across the bridge and back early in the morning for a different view of the beautiful Harbour. Also less traffic & noise at that time of the day so a much more pleasant experience.

Beautiful Sight!. It is a beautiful bridge. It is accessible by the Hop-On Hop-Off tour bus, and climbing it (BridgeClimb) is one of the things people like to do (great photo op); we watched from the deck of a cruise ship! The view from the top of the bridge would be incredible,

Can not say you have been to Sydney without seeing the Bridge. We arrived at the Opera House across from the bridge early enough to get a good view and standing spot to see it. Asked one of the very friendly police officers who was standing there about what time the light show started on the bridge. He gave me a very funny and concerned look then told myself that he knew of no show tonight or any night other than New Year’s! I then asked why he and the other officers were standing there as he then explained it was to keep tourists like "myself" OFF the road so that it was clear for emergency vehicles. Next time I need to do more research before going out plus stay off the emergency access roads. Lol. We did really enjoy the area.

Wonderful walk every morning to get the blood flowing. We stayed at the Marriott Circular Quay so the entry to the bridge was about a 15 minute walk. About 50% flat and 50% uphill on the way there. We walked from the circular quay side to the other side every AM and enjoyed a cappuccino and fresh pastry at a small street-side café on the other side. Then we headed back across. Absolutely stunning view. Note that you can only walk across on one side of the bridge and the other side is for bicycles only.
Pride of Sydney. Stunning view to watch from sunset cruise.. Definitely pride of Sydney..Was awesome to watch it when sun setting down..

Wonderful Sight. This wonderful iconic structure does not disappoint when you finally see it in all its glory. Wonderful piece of engineering and a great view is guaranteed when you climb to the top of it apparently.

I must confess..... Okay, I confess, we didn't take the bridge climb...it looked too scary, but we walked across the bridge, which was free, and enjoyed the walk and the phenomenal view. Whether you do the bridge climb or not, visit the bridge! It's a beautiful bridge and an even more beautiful view.

Excellent views, once in a lifetime experience. This was one of, if not our single favorite part of visiting Sydney. The views were spectacular despite a rainy evening. Try to go at twilight if you can for sunset views.
A couple in our group got engaged at the top... Very romantic!

BridgeClimb Sydney was UNFORGETTABLE!. When planning our Sydney visit, we were looking for unique ways to experience the city. We quite enjoyed the many waterways and the Harbour - it reminded us of a larger, "big city" Venice experience.We discovered the BridgeClimb Sydney adventure as a different way to experience the Sydney Harbour Bridge. After a safety briefing and getting outfitted in safety gear our guide lead us to climb up into the iron work of the bridge until we were walking along the top of the arch. The views were absolutely incredible as we could view the entire expanse of the harbour. And it was a bit surreal to be nearly at eye level with a helicopter flying overhead at one point, as well as ascending the bridge directly next to the train tracks and motorway. Reminiscent of a cartoon character popping its head out of the manhole only to have cars whizzing by :)The guide was awesome, providing an informative talk track to our journey up and over the bridge, sharing the history of the bridge so we could appreciate the beauty of the bridge and the effort that went into its construction. Participants are not allowed to bring ANYTHING with them on the climb. They provided lockers where we stored our cameras, wallets, clothing, etc. It was disappointing not to be able to be able to photograph our experience; however, the guide does stop periodically to take photo ops and those pictures are available for purchase at a fairly reasonable cost. She also took a couple videos that they also copied onto our photo disk/flash drive for no extra cost.I would recommend allowing at least 3 hours for the experience, and would suggest reservations as a must to guarantee your participation at a time that is convenient to your plans. It was truly a once-in-a-lifetime experience, a big hit during our family vacation!

Twilight tour. The bridge climb is an experience which will make your visit to Sydney unforgetable. Arrive at the centre in good time at least 15 minutes ahead of time. The staff welcome you with open arms and go through a series of essential safety messages to make sure your climb is faultless. The equipment you are given is comprehensive but definitely not for the fashion concious! Your guide, in our case a very charismatic guy called Romeo, will know you by name before you set out, amazing given the number of people he takes each day. The climb begins easily with a flat section followed by a narrow and quite steep climb up six ladders. Then the fun begins! The rest of the climb is moderately easy. As you go higher the views become more awesome. We did a twilight walk so started in daylight with it getting darker the higher we went. There are plenty of stops to enjoy the views and get your breath back. Although you are not allowed to take your own cameras there are good photos taken buy your guide which can be bought for about $20 each, well worth it and a great souvenir. You get a certificate, hat and group photo in the initial cost of the climb. Once at the top you feel as if you are on top of the world, physically and emotionally, WOW!! On the way down it was dark, seeing all the lights of the city was spectacular. This is something you have to do and is worth every dollar.

Sydney Harbour Bridge. Sydney Harbor Bridge is a symbol of Sydney and a very attraction of Tourists.Bridge is a steel through arch bridge across Sydney Harbor that carries rail, vehicular, bicycle, and pedestrian traffic between the Sydney central business district and the North Shore
Walk the bridge. We walked to vehicle level of the bridge. Very safe and. Secure. Beautiful views! About 20-30 minutes each way. Busy during rush hour,
Beautiful. Amazing place- a majestic landmark which also offers a walk up the bridge at a price. Super recommended.

Unforgettable experiences!. I have climbed the harbour bridge both by day and night.... and loved every single second of it. There's no better way to get panoramic views of the city and across the water.

Harbour bridge walk. What a good activity.recently walked across the bridge for the first time.the walk is so easy, you meet lots of interesting people and of course the view is spectacular.So easy even pre schoolers were doing it. Another good thing about this activity is you can go at your own pace and take your time to cross having lots of time to admire the harbour as you go.I loved it,

Definitely a Highlight. The Bridge Climb is expensive to do. More or less 180 USD for one person, but I don't regret it one bit. It takes about 3.5 hours to complete the climb and that includes changing into the climbing gear, the safety instruction, etc. once you reach the very top of the bridge you are rewarded with this incredible and memorable view of the Sydney Harbour. On a good day, you can see as far away as the Blue Mountains on one side and Bondi Beach on the other.

At its best at night time. We been around the bridge at all times of the day for the last couple of days. Its really worth taking a walk over it, to enjoy the view over Sydney harbour and opera house. Visit the pylon for an even better view - do notice the cost of around 16 aud pr. Adult.Go down to the harbour or take a walk in the parks around the barangaroo area at night, to experience the bridge all lit up, with the city in the background, also filled with lights! Enjoy!

Family adventure. Great activity with the family - totally safe and fun for all ages in our family including our 10 year old. Great safety briefing at the beginning with all equipment provided. Great guide who walks you through everything and even narrates your climb as you go through the provided headset. Don't miss this!

A bridge with a fascinating history, worth the visit.. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is not just any old bridge. It wasn't completed until 1930 and was the first bridge to join north and south Sydney. It was crafted by British engineers and steel workers and built by and large by hand. An amazing logistic and engineering feat.I would advise one does a tour of the bridge to learn more, it is well worth it.

Superb Experience. A really well run organised and professional operation from start to finish, from the kitting out, pre climb breifing and the actual climb out up and over the bridge. The views were amazing and the insights and the guides ermmm jokes were great fun. It's a got to do very safe trip if you are in Sydney.

Walk from The Rocks to Milson's Point and back, simply awesome.. As a Sydneysider I get the pleasure of walking the bridge whenever I want and I am not saying this ironically.At least once a month I go to The Rocks up to the bridge (really nice to do it at night, also is a beautiful walk early in the morning at sunrise) and walk to Kirribilli (east to the bridge) or to luna park (west to the bridge) just for the fun of it, admire the scenery or grab some food with a little of a walk back. Even my missus has grown this habit and every now and then tells me to take her to our 'special date' and off we go with our camera, some comfy shoes and a coat (is always windy) just in case anybody gets cold.
