I have Angina, which I take pills for and had no problems with the climb.The crew there are friendly and great and go through a lot of safety checks with you. Don't worry about falling off, because you are connected via a safety wire throughout the climb. Total time is about two and a half hours, but if you are only in Sydney once, do it. You will find, by looking at the many photos in the entrance, you will have taken part in an experience that many famous people have had. They include English Royalty, pop stars, movie stars and of course, your fellow mortals. Enjoy.

nickname the clothespin. beautiful and elegant to look at but i was not brave enough to walk to the top of the bridge.i also think kthe 245 charge was another good reason not to walk the bridge but i ran into young people who raved about the bridge walk.i might have thought about it 30 years ago.

Bridge climb to remember. We climbed the bridge and it was a very worthwhile experience. The guide knew so much if the history and that made for a very interesting tour. It was fun, with heaps of photo opportunities.
Amazing. Bridge amazing we walk than go on top tower in middle bridge great view from top building. It was nice experience :-)

You've seen this in so many places. The iconic Sydney Harbour Bridge has been used as a backdrop for so many things but it is amazing to see it with your own eyes.Great to view it from the bar at the Opera House and you can see the walkers taking the tour up and over the bridge (Feb 2014 was my latest visit)

Walk across this amazing icon!. If you are looking for something to do on a sunny day take the kids and go for a walk across the famous Sydney Harbour Bridge. It has amazing views and you are able to talk up one of the pylons to a viewing deck!

DO THE BRIDGE CLIMB!. Yes its quite expensive, but what an experience - you're not going to do it everyday!We did the Twilight Bridge climb which was fantastic- go up in the daylight, watch the sunset and the lights come on over Sydney, and go down in the dark. Well organised with knowledgeable guides and looked after us well.

Sydney Harbor Bridge - Walk Across For FREE!. The bridge crosses from The Rocks over SYD Harbor to Milson's Point.Of course it is walkable to the bridge from most places, but you can also take the train to the Circular Quay train station/ferry docks to start your journey.Walking West from the Circular Quay ferry docks/train station:A 12 minute walk to the Bridge Pylon Lookout (which is in The Rocks)You can continue on afterwards, and walk across the harbor bridge from the Pylon lookout.Then, take the ferry or train back to CQ from the Milson's Point ferry dock or train station.Or, take the ferry from Milson's Point to Darling Harbor.From the CQ ferry docks is where you can ride the ferry to Manley or to Taronga Zoo. Additionally, a ferry from CQ to Darling Harbor travels under the SYD Harbor Bridge.These ferries provide excellent photo opportunities of the SYD Harbor Bridge. However, the best photo of both the SYD Harbor Bridge & Opera House is from an area near Mrs. Macquaries Chair.Walking East from CQ boat docks/train station:It is an easy 5 minute walk from CQ boat docks/train station to The Opera House .A 15 minute walk from the Opera House to Mrs. Macquarie's chair in the Royal Botanic Gardens.
One of the most beautiful bridges in the world. Every tourist coming to Sydney should see this. Lovely piece of architecture. Great to have a meal with this kind of view any day.

Fantastic view from the top. Just got back from walking over the top of the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Did the twilight tour and it was amazing. Was a little scared when I first set off as it looks a long way down but the higher I got the safer I felt. The hi light of the walk was getting to watch a perfect sun set as the sun disappeared behind the blue mountains. That alone was worth every penny. The photographs that were taken have turned out brilliant. There is some great history to be learnt too as you walk up and over

Spectacular view--and you can walk it for free.. No need to pay for a tour to see sights from the bridge--just walk it...There are tours that will guide you above the traffic level over the arch of the bridge, and we saw people on that tour when we crossed the bridge. But, you can easily walk the bridge without spending the $100+ and get some panoramic photos all on your own. We walked from Circular Quay, through the Rocks (Argyle Street to Cumberland), and across the Harbor Bridge toward Milson’s Point Station on the northeast point of the bridge. Distance is approx 2.5 km (approx 1.5 miles); time, about 50 minutes one way (going 2.5 -3.0 km/hr). Access to the Bridge is a set of steps near The Rocks at Argyle and Cumberland. Except for the steps up to the bridge access, the walk is wide, paved, and mostly level with slight rise in elevation from each end to the midpoint. There is a fence separating you from traffic on the bridge. There are excellent photo opportunities to the east. Best photos after sunrise are in the afternoon with the sun at your back. (Photos toward the west are difficult since you would be photographing across traffic. Sunset photos are better quality on the paid tour where you are on the arch above the traffic.) We walked the bridge south to north, and back, on a windy afternoon in late October. It was invigorating but very do-able. Beautiful shots of the Opera House, downtown, and Harbor areas. Restrooms: none. Refreshment: none. Patrolled by security officers at intervals. Take water, wear a hat securely fastened and walking shoes, apply sunscreen, take your camera. Enjoy one of Sydney’s icons up close and personal. Excellent photos of the bridge with Opera House are possible on ferry rides, day and night, from Darling Harbor to Circle Quay. My favorite photo of the bridge with opera house is from Macquarie Point (near Mrs. Macquarie’s Chair).

Also know as the Coathanger. The whole bridge will be on fireworks every new year's eve. A sight not to be missed. There is a bridge walk might cost you few hundred bucks to reach the top. Or you can just walk across the bridge for free.
The Coat Hanger. We are visiting as people around the world are mourning the tragedy in Paris... The bridge has the French flag raised in their support.
Conference. I never get sick of the sight of this amazing structure or the magnificent harbour and river it spans ..

Must Do in Sydney. Wife and I did the bridge climb and it was money well spent. The guides do an excellent job preparing you for the climb and the climb itself offers both an experience and a view you will be boring you friends with for months after you return home

Great climb and great views. well worth the cost of the experience. I have done both the top bridge climb and the one that goes up along the lower pylon and I actually preferred the latter as you get to see more of the construction of the bridge and if you are lucky get to meet maintenance staff along the way carrying out repairs. Views are spectacular and both climbs allow you to walk across the top of the bridge.
A must. great Architecture indeed... a photo with the Sydney Harbour bridge background is a must... a cruise ride will be helpful to enjoy the scenic moments...
Mazing arcatecture. I saw this bridge two times we drove over it and when we where leaving the harbor on our cruse ship we saw it it is amazing

Not brave enough. Was not up to walking the over the top,but we did walk across and enjoyed that. Seeing Sydney from the other side, amazed at how many people run across. The million stairs leading up to it were enough for me lol

Iconic Attraction of Sydney. You can get a nice view of the Opera House from underneath the bridge. You can choose to walk along the bridge, take a train across, or even signup for the harbour bridge walk which doesn't come cheap.

Way over priced, but you may buckle under the pressure of saying you walked on top of the bridge. Way over priced to walk on the bridge. Cheaper to pay at the bridge than to reserve at your hotel, but still over priced. $500 for the two of us to walk on the bridge and that doesn't even include your photos.

Views from bridge are amazing. The " bridge walk" is steep and not for anyone that fears heights or the cost of the walk. You can walk across on the pedestrian walkway for free and the view couldn't be that much better.

ICONIC . ... but it may lose the war to the opera house . By just a bit .. a slightly weaker cousin to the opera house .. but definitely an eye candy .. of course . There are couple of things you can do 1 you can take a walking tour over the arch of the Sydney Harbour 2 you can Cycle over the Sydney Harbour 3 you can walk at the basement 4 you can take a car ride over the harbour  5 you can take a train ride and enjoy this magnificent engineering marvel

GORGEOUS. We sat and looked at this bridge lit up every night while sitting on a deck on the Rocks overlooking the Sydney Harbour. It is not as impressive during the day. You can walk across the bridge, and if you wish pay a fee to walk on the top. A young couple got engaged up there, how cool is that?

Pylon Visit. Less well known opportunity to "get up close and personal" with Sydney's iconic bridge via one of the pylon towers; great opportunity to learn about its construction and appreciate fabulous views of the harbour at a sensible cost!

Fabulous experience despite the rain!. This was certainly a highlight during my stay in Sydney. Although the weather wasn't on our side the few hours spent climbing the bridge and taking in the views was definitely with it. Our guide, Pete, was knowledgeable and funny. I was very impressed by his ability to remember everyone's name and his attention to safety was paramount. Thank you for a fabulous morning!

Bridge less used for connectivity and more for phtographs. This is a unique bridge where people go to take good photos of Opera House or of the bridge itself. There is also an activity of bridge climbing which is very interesting.

Fabulous Experience. We were a party of 4 and were lucky enough to get a clear, sunny day for our climb. We opted for the shorter climb and didn't feel that we missed out on views or experience. Our guide was very knowledgeable and good fun. The tour was well thought out and everything was well organised. Would thoroughly recommend this tour.

An icon!. Enjoyed a beautiful break in the weather and had some sunshine while walking the bridge today. We opted not to join the bridge climb group priced at $300 each and instead opted to walk it ourselves which was easily completed from our hotel in the rock within half an hour. The view were magnificent of the opera house and darling harbour. If you really wan the height to get a good vantage then I would suggest visiting the pylon lookout which at $15 each for entry is still a significant saving the the bridge walk for the same views!

It's a bridge.... While I'm not saying don't go and see the bridge, I think the experience is very different looking at the bridge and climbing the bridge. Unfortunately we couldn't afford to do the bridge climb and while it was very impressive initially after a while, it's just 'there'. It was great to see this iconic landmark, but it wasn't as awe-inspiring as I was expecting it to be.

Landmark. From most viewpoints in Sydney you can see this high and long bridge. If you want, you can also climb the bridge booking with specialized companies that are located on The Rocks foot end of the bridge. Doing so at sunrise or sunset seems the best.
Greatest bridge in the world. Greatest bridge in the world! The bridge itself is maybe average, I don't know... But this bridge at that place is just awesome!!!
Worth booking a bridge climb. Must be pretty fit and not for those afraid of heights! But the view is is STUNNING! A wonderful experience!!

Must see and drive or walk across. Must see when in Sydney as a visit to Sydney without seeing the Harbour Bridge is like not coming to Sydney. Its an iconic structure. You can drive across, take the train or walk across the bridge
Bridge walk. A very enjoyable and worthwhile experience provided you have no problems with heights or walking over open grid walkways.Summary - take the walk

bridge climb is a must do. Loved every minute of our climb wasn't scary at all and i dont like heights ...great guide think his name was Darren very imformitive and funny which made it relaxing as told you what to expect

Sydney's Golden Gate. Just a beautiful bridge majestically floating over an amazing harbor with the Sydney Opera House, beautiful boats and a beautiful city as the backdrop. We crossed by train and it was grand. Beautiful views

Its a Bridge. It just adds to the sky line of Sydney but other than using it to get to A to B i wasnt as impressed as maybe i should have been??
Certainly dont want to climb it. Quite ugly infact.

A great way to celebrate a birthday.. A great way to celebrate a birthday on the bridge climb. Great views, easy walk, very relaxed. Very professional. Don't have too many drinks before you walk, very strict on 0.05 blood alcohol limit.
Great views. Exercise with a view. Always great to see what is happening on the harbour and on the city skyline. Good restaurants at either end of the bridge.

Beautiful bridge....cost to climb outrageous. The bridge is beautiful to look at and certainly stands out in the Harbor. The cost to climb it, while friends who did said it was a great experience, was outrageous, and changed depending on the time of day you wanted to climb.

Great Sydney Icon. A marvel of engineering construction, finished in 1932, it has stood the test of time. Much foresight in it's design, to allow for the enormous expansion in Sydney's road and rail traffic volume over the past 80 years. Well worth a climb or just walk across.

Great way to see beauty of Sydney Harbour. The harbour bridge built in 1932 has a wide walkway along the east side of the bridge which is free. Can start at either end wander across at leisure and gaze out a the amazing views of the working harbour and Opera House.Takes around 30mins or however long you wan to make the excursion. While on the northern side walk down into Kirribilli Village and visit one of the many cafes or walk around the shore line to Luna Park and beyond or the other way . Kirribilli markets are also great and right at the entrance to the stairway up to Bridge. Check weekends operating .The southern side starts down near the historical area of the Rocks" in the heart of the city. Have big markets here at weekend. Unfortunately the access onto the bridge requires walking up stairs on both side. Once up there the walk along is flat.  Probably avoid on a very wet or windy day as a bit exposed. There are also museums within the pylons to view as small cost.
I love this well known Australian Icon. It's very special to see it in person. A wonder to marvel at up close. You can even climb it if you dare.

If you only do one great thing... Climb the Bridge. Please do not miss the opportunity to climb the Sydney Harbour Bridge. I chose a day climb as I wanted to enjoy the view and I think the climb is more exciting on the day . The view is something you can not imagine...amazing! Don't go if weather is bad as it can get windy.

Must the the most iconic thing to do in Sydney!. The is no mistaking where you are.... We took our staff on the Bridge Climb. It is a thoroughly professional, challenging and interesting experience with the WOW factor. We did the express climb which was perfect. Jucinta our guide was fantastic. Most of our people were from out of town, and they are still talking about it....Thanks for the iconic experience

Tourist love it!. It has to be done whether you climb it, drive or sail under it. I did all of them. It's an experience, it's a lot bigger than you think too. You can get a great panoramic iPhone pic standing next to the opera house. A boat trip can said underneath it and get some great pics too.

If You Can.......Climb It......It Really Gives You So Much More. A bridge is one of those things that you can take for granted, but once you hear the stories and get some of the facts about this bridge, you then realise how amazing it is and just marvel at how it managed to get built all those years ago with no computers etc etc etc but and it is a BIG BUT, if you can cope with it the Bridge Climb is a totally fantastic experience and in my opinion worth every penny. We did the twilight climb, which delivered daytime views & also early evening and sunset views so you get to see the amazing views in various stages. The guides are excellent, the safety & guidance they give you is superb and they take great care of you & you are totally attached to the bridge when climbing so you are really, really safe. As part of the essential safety measures though, you can't take any personal belongings up with you other than sunglasses. Go on be brave and give it a go This is a memory that will live with me forever & physically I don't believe it is that demanding, so give it a go....

Wow Factor.... What an amazing iconic bridge, arrived in Sydney went to Darling Harbour and got a small boat round to Circular Quays as you turn right your at the bridge and such a wow. Its magnificent we also did the bridge walk which I highly recommend

Excellent view but very pricey. excellent view and good exercise. the tour guide alex was funny, articulate and informative. id give it a 5-star rating if it weren't for the price A$283 for an hour and a half climb is kinda pricey. we only regret going there after coming down.
A Great Land Mark. A beautiful piece of history. Worth seeing. Expensive but thats what you pay for something like this.
Some great views. Worthwhile taking a walk or runover to see sydney. Save yourself some money on the bridge climb. Not quite in same league as golden gate but still worth a look.

Amazing!. Our tour guide was Ellie and she was so great! We did this after doing the Brisbane bridge climb and we preferred how you are more enclosed on this one and you can't see through the walk-ramps at all times. The views of course were amazing. They do have ladders at the beginning, but there are only 4 sets of about 24 steps on each ladder. You are more enclosed (not tightly enclosed) when climbing the ladders. They make you go one person at a time on each ladder for safety. The stairs are wide and easy to walk on. We would absolutely do this again. We stayed in The Rocks area so this was about a 5 minute walk from our hotel - very convenient! The whole thing lasted about 3-3.5 hours, with about 45-60 minutes of that being the orientation/hooking up your harness/hats/sunglasses, etc.

A nice walk across the bridge. We walked on the bridge from the Rocks to Milsons Point . It was only 40 minutes, easy way all along and enjoyed a nice view of the harbour. Definitely will do this again when we visit Sydney again.

They offer walks along the top!. I was content just looking at the bridge. Then we saw people on top! Later we saw people tethered to a rail who had just come off the top of the bridge! Whether you take the walking tour or not, it's a beautiful sight and worth seeing, even if you have only a brief stopover in Sydney. Get an electronic Visa and take the train into the city from the airport.

Beautiful. Fantastic experience. The bridge climb is a must if you go to Sydney. It takes 2-3 hours and it is worth the price and the time. An incredible view with lots of rewarding moments and you feel like you climbed on top of Australia. Very nice..

Twilight climb. We decided to pay the extra and do the twilight climb so glad we did. We had the best of both getting in the sunset as well as seeing the night lights of Sydney. I was a little nervous to start of but didn't need to be found the climb easy even through a couple of tight corridors. The view was amazing only negative we couldn't bring our camera to take some shots of the beautiful scenery though our guide took several photos of us individually and as a group. I'm glad I did it a tick of my bucket list. Yes you can pay $13 and see a great view from the pylon but you don't get to experience the thrill of the climb.

Amazing views. Take a stroll over the bridge and take in the magnificent views of the Opera House and the cruise liners that berth in Sydney. Views of the city are brilliant too. Would recommend walking all the way across the bridge down the steps at the other side and you will find yourself in a beautiful little village called Kirribilli. Here you can wander round some lovely little shops. Have a bite to eat and if you turn left when you get to the bottom of the stairs walk straight ahead and you will find yourself at the waters edge from here you can take in the views of the Ooera House and Sydney itself. You can either walk back over the bridge to Sydney or wait for the ferry to take you back to a Circular Quay in Sydney. Would also recommend walking to the centre of the bridge at night the views of the Opera House and Sydney at night is truly breathtaking.
Fantastic tourist attraction. What a great way to see the view of Sydney ? Three hours well spent. Jack, our guide was informative and friendly. Safety was assured at all times.

Awesome. My wife (who is scared of heights!) and I, did the express tour which takes you up the lower arch and then up steps to the very top. We had a great guide (Chris) who gave my wife the confidence to do the climb. It was raining when we started so they gave us waterproof jackets and trousers. You cannot take anything with you other than prescription glasses which is right when you consider the height and danger of dropping anything. Don't worry though as your guide will take plenty of photos (and a free video) which are not expensive to buy.Views were obviously amazing, a must if you are in Sydney.
Get a good view on board with All Ocassion Cruises. enjoy the cruise with All Ocassion Cruises. Watch majestic sunset and enjoy cocktails party with your friends. Best romantic sunset, I may add!

Most beautiful bridge in the world!. You just haven't seen the Harbour Bridge if you haven't seen it in person up close. It's majestic and iconic. You are doing yourself a dis-service by not visiting the Harbour Bridge whilst you are in town.

WOW! OMG! Outstanding!!!. We did the bridge climb in early evening. What an experience. They dress you in blue coveralls, buckle you into a safety harness attached to a cable and give a very informative safety lecture prior to embarking on a once in a lifetime opportunity!!!You are a little apprehensive at first but your guides have a very calming effect and before you know it you are moving up at a good pace. The views of the harbor, opera house, and city lights are incredible and once you reach the top, the photo ops spectacular. You hate to come back down but like any good thing this comes to an end---not true as you will recall this experience like it happened yesterday. Oh and it will bring a giant smile to your face!
Great place, very busy. The view from the bridge is amazing, worth a visit. The only problem, which is inevitable, is that the roads are very busy. Again, it is worth the visit!

Amazing icon. Went for a walk around the harbour and wow what a bridge.. It was great to walk under it and have a look at this magnificent structure.. It was not the best day but when the weather is good it would be amazing to climb

Climb the bridge! See it properly!!. Take a train, bus or car ride or walk across the bridge to feel the flow of traffic, then book in for a Bridge Climb!! Well worth the effort to experience this wonderful icon of Australia, and get a great birds eye view of the traffic below you, the beautiful harbour and opera house, and all the attractions of Sydney as far as the eye can see!Pose for your photos & take them home as great souvenirs, and great memories ! A absolutely must-do experience if you only ever visit Sydney once or more often. Take a walk under the bridge to visit the cafes, restaurants and lovely shops there, and walk around to darling harbour only 15 mins away. Or jupmp on a train or ferry ride anywhere from nearby Circular quay. Walk through the historical Rocks areas, and maybe join a Ghost Tour around the area also. Some stories involve the Harbour Bridge!Don't forget there's a twilight bridge climb also, see the city light up as dusk falls, magical! Be a dare devil , do both climbs during your stay!!!! I absolutely love going to the harbour to see the bridge, from all different view points.
Awesome view. Even on a wet and rainy day this view is still awesome for all. Its a must to do. Even if you take a train ride your view is great
Stunning bridge in a beautiful location. Sydney Harbour Bridge needs no introduction but it's sheer size blows you away. My husband did the bridge climb (I wasn't brave enough) and loved every minute
Wonderful building . One of the must important in Sydney too see very beautiful building. Every time you see it it's not enough to stop and take a photo

Spectacular. The weather is great on most days; go on the walk over the arch, or just stroll across the bridge. Great food and atmosphere on both sides. Naked water with you if you do either walk. Spectacular, enjoy

Harbour Bridge is a must see. Driving over it is for locals who most of the time do not have time to take in the view.Take a Walk thru the rocks and up to the start of the bridge. Lots of stairs. Then walk over and check out the harbour from above. Stunning views. Then go down to Luna park and after a nice rest or picnic on the grass under the bridge, catch the ferry back. You can also walk Over the bridge with bridge climb. Can be pricy and takes a few hours. The bridge is a Sydney icon and worth the time.

Unforgettable. When I was considering doing the Sydney Harbour Bridge climb, I wasn't sure it was worth the cost, nearly $300. That's like a few nice dinners. I thought I could get a close-enough view by walking the bridge. Ah, but the difference between walking the bridge (like a normal person) and doing the climb (like a crazy adventurous person) is like the difference between seeing a nice juicy orange from a distance and taking a big bite of the orange and letting the juice run down your face. It's expensive because the whole event is run very well. It is well organized, staffed generously, and provides you with good equipment and enough basic training to make you stay safe. My climbing guide, Chris, was excellent. He got to know everyone in his group, elicited conversation amongst the group members, and provided us with a lot of information on the history of the harbor and bridge. He was even funny, a bonus attribute of good guides everywhere. Worth it? Yes!!!

Must do attraction!. I highly recommend doing the bridge climb! The views were spectacular and you were able to learn a lot of history while getting some exercise. It is worth the price! If not up for the climb, they have look out sites that you can visit or simply take a stroll along the bridge to view the gorgeous Sydney below!

Love it. I love the Harbour bridge, the icon of Sydney! I enjoy a casual stroll across the bridge were you can enjoy the amazing views, then you can do the plyon tours up the inside of the Pylon taking the history of how this great bridge was made.
Bridge Climb. So worth the price! Would recommend going around dusk to experience the amazing views of the harbour and city!!

Fascinating walk with wonderful views. We walked across the Sydney Harbour Bridge early one morning from The Rocks area. It's really interesting to see the continuous flow of traffic and the ferries dashing about the harbour. Terrific views of the harbour, of course, as well as the Opera House. You can only see that side of the Harbour but it well worth the effort. There are a few steps to reach the walkway from the Rocks but easy enough. It can be quite hot if sunny so sunscreen, a hat and water are essential. We stopped and looked and took photos so it took us about an hour for the return trip. We were too early but the Pylon Lookout is recommended and opens at 10.00.We marvelled at the design and construction of the bridge, quite a feat all those years ago.

Incredible views. The walk across the Sydney Harbour Bridge is an absolute must do. The views of the harbour, opera house and city are spectacular. We went on sunset and it was amazing watching the city lights come to life. The bridge is very well set up with a large walkway with security along the way making sure you feel secure at all times. Highly recommend!

Amazing experience! Amazing team leader Romeo! . Visited Sydney with the bridge climb right at the top of the to do list! It was absolutely breathtaking and made me appreciate the bridge so much more! Romeo was an awesome leader with great knowledge and a good sense of humour! My only constructive criticism- Prior to our arrival there was a storm and we weren't 100% sure whether or not it would be called off. I called and was advised that it was up to me whether to risk doing it in the storm or they were happy to re-schedule. I explained we are only in Sydney for one more day and because it landed on a Saturday the lady advised me it would cost an extra $50 for us. I think that in those sort of circumstances they shouldn't bother asking for extra money. We decided to stick to our original booking! Luckily for us the weather turned for the better! Overall an awesome experience and highly recommended!

One of Sydney's best kept secrets - the bridge's pylon museum / lookout. I am a local and live about 1Km away. I have done both the bridge climb and the pylon lookout. If you are on a budget, the government-owned pylon lookout (only $13/adult) it the best way to get a similar experience to the commercially-owned bridge climb (from $158 to $353/adult) - The pylon lookout is between 1/10th and 1/20th of the price. The pylon lookout is not heavily advertised simply because it is not a big commercial money-spinner. It is almost as high as the bridge, so the views are great. You can take your own camera and linger as long as you want, which you cannot do on the bridge climb. Google 'website: Sydney Harbour Bridge pylon lookout' and it will give you all the details.I won't repeat what everybody else has said .... look through Tripadvisor section entitled: "Pylon Lookout at Sydney Harbour Bridge". There is a particularly good review from 'Dave_from_MN' of Eden Prairie, Minnesota who Reviewed 26 October 2015

Amazing building. Well worth a look when in Sydney. Plenty of bars and restaurants to enjoy a great view and plenty of good photos spots. Nice to see from the water, don't need book a tourist cruise can just catch the local ferry for the same view
Great Views. Easier than doing the bridge climb, the Pylon Lookout is a great place to learn about the history of the bridge and take in gorgeous views of the harbor.

Amazing views. Sydney Harbour is just the best place. Everything you see is amazing. Bridge, opera house. The Taronga zoo especially. The botanical gardens. The hop on hop off buses around Sydney and Bondi 24 hour ticket for $40 is true value. Loved this friendly, calm, beautiful city
Walk the bridge. Its totally safe to walk during daytime or night time. There are security men watching out and families.

Bridge climb was amazing!. We went on the express bridge climb and it was just perfect. We moved at a good pace and our guide narrated along the way. We went through some tricky spots which really gave us a good look at the inner structure of the bridge. It felt very safe and was a good workout, but not strenuous. Being at the top was spectacular and scary at the same time. I highly recommend this activity!!

Watching people walk on the top of it was great. The bridge is like many in the world, it's just that we were in Sidney and it was fantastic!Watching the people as small as ants walking over the top of it was great, especially with a beer in hand at the harbour bar!
Beautiful bridge!. Huge bridge and nice view from the bay. It's nice to see it from the ferry (you can get some nice pictures).

A Must Do When in Sydney. Due to time constraints we decided to do the Sampler Bridge Climb (2 Hours) rather than the Full one which takes almost double the time .Was well organised and the staff are friendly and knowledgeable . Great views well worth the time and effort , and next time we will have to dgo right to the Top .

Bridge Climb. We did the Bridge climb and absolutely loved it. I'm not very good at all with heights but despite a few nervous moments I made it through and you can't compare the views with anything in the world on top of the bridge. Great photos and memories. Already planning to do it again.

Lots of fun. This was my second time climbing the bridge (last time 8 years ago) and the experience was just as good!
The whole thing takes about 3.5 hours and the guides are very friendly and try to make your experience as good as it can be.... Everything you need for the climb is provided and they climb rain hail or shine!!
beautiful/thought provoking. it is beautiful on its own but seeing the brave soles in groups climbing to this height is really interesting...looks well organized but WHAT ARE THEY THINKING!!!
Amazing bridge in Sydney.. Although we didn't walk the bridge, we did get some great photos, on and under the bridge. Bus tours also will take around both edges of the bridge.
mashaallah. a great experience.really enjoyed the view.the opera house and sea was really worth the visit.and also a good walk.

Majestic and Iconic Bridge. I have always wondered why people mention to Harbor Bridge when they talk of Sydney, not after I visited the place. There are few cities that have such icons of course Sydney has two major. The combination is stunning, but harbor bridge is so evident even from the air as you descent and when you are any where near it. I traveled along the bridge and it gives a special feel. The Milson point gives a fantastic view of the bridge, I would say any angle the bridge looks special. Never ever miss the bridge if you are any where near Sydney.

The walk up the bridge is amazing. The bridge is nice, I walked from The Rocks entrance, it is quite a good walk to the other side of the bridge. There are two cafes once you get off the bridge which you can have breakfast there. Walk in the morning is beautiful. It is cool and not as hot.There is a lookout place, so don't rush to take a photo and block the whole road, and there are security to protect maintain people's safety.
Harbour Bridge Walk April 2015. Very well run business - fantastic staff all safety precautions were thought of. Well worth the money nothing like a million dollar view!

Its a must see ...!. I last saw it 23 yrs ago, & had forgotten how imposing it stands over the harbour !!! It is a a bit of a cliche but you just have to get your pic with the bridge in the background !!! lol

AN EASY CLIMB!. Don't just look at it.. CLIMB IT.. there are several departures most days of the week. with an express climb or a normal climb.. go do and get yourself up on top of the Sydney Harbour bridge for one of the best views in the city! The bridge connects both North and South Sydney and features prominently in the history and artwork of Sydney.

Must do!. How good can climbing up an old bridge be? It can be the best thing you do in Sydney. From the moment we arrived at check-in we knew this was going to be something special. All the staff were great, and our guide was awesome. We were given all the gear we needed, a practice climb, then through the door to clip on to the bridge. The bridge is huge, but the climb isn't too hard. We climbed at night and the views were spectacular. I can't recommend this adventure too highly.
beautiful land mark. for a fee you can climb to the top of the bridge, we did not do it but the young couple that we met said it was worth the money for the view.

Highly recommend - Awesome. If you go to Sydney then it's a Must Do... I don't have a head for heights so this was always going to be a challenge.You are taken in small groups to a changing area where you leave all your valuables, loose clothes, cameras, bags etc in a locker. You then don a boiler suit and have a short training course in securing yourself to the safety wire and climbing up and over a mock-up gantry before being taken in a guided party for your Bridge Climb...I felt completely safe, which I was, and apart from one or two bits of the walk out on the bridge before you start the climb my vertigo wasn't a problem. Once on the climb up my vertigo was no problem at all, perhaps in awe and excitement of the occasion I was just taken over by the beauty of the magnificent view. An unforgettable experience...

Beautifu, but a bit oversold.. Granted, this is a beautiful bridge. But there are many beautiful bridges in the world. What makes Sydney Harbour Bridge special is the combination with Opera House. Combined, you get a really beautiful scene.

A Majestic Icon. Everyone one who comes to Sydney comes to view the bridge. We were no different yet it felt like a very special and unique experience for us. That is the power of this bridge! Rather than scare ourselves we chose to walk over the bridge and back just for the experience; stopping serveral times just to enjoy the views.
The Bridge. What a sight, awesome structure, so interesting to see in real life. So many people walking and travelling over this amazing bridge. So busy
Bridge climb. This is a must do while in Sydney. Not for people with significant fear of heights but for most it's not terribly challenging. Highly recommend the twilight climb.

Just a bridge. If you are in Sydney you are going to see the bridge. I do not think it is a nice looking bridge. You can walk across it for free I am not sure why you would want to do that. For a lot of money you can climb to the top

Pricey but worth it. The walk over the bridge, albeit pricy, is also worth it as the views are great and guides are also very informative. It is not as hard or scary as you think and that is coming from someone who is scared of heights. We did the sunset tour which was really great. A top tip, you will have your photo taken which if course they hope you buy, while we were viewing these we saw arty shots taken of the sunset and Opera House that the guide had taken along the way and asked if we could have some as we hope to make a photo-book of the trip so we're delighted to find that as long as we bought "a" photo on CD $20 approx we could have these shots as well and by on CD they come as Jpegs which we can use how we want.

worth the walk. Beautiful historic bridge. Pedestrian walkway on the east side, bicycle path on the west side. Nice views of the harbor. Recommend climbing the pylon, on your way, for an even better view.

Fantastic to view and I only wish I had the nerve to walk over the top.. A scenic wonder- beautiful day or night. In the evening the lights at the top of the bridge attract bats that swarm around over the bridge and look white in the light. One more wonderful sight that is part of Sydney Harbour.

Bridge climb once in a lifetime experience. Although it seems expensive , you can appreciate the cost once you have completed the climb. The care and attention to detail that the staff convey makes you feel less nervous and more comfortable. The climb itself was not as physically demanding that we thought. It was also much more informative than expected, our guide Pete helped us to understand what an amazing engineering project this was. Don't think twice just do it.

Awesome Views. We were a little worried about the bridge height but the staff were very thorough and detailed on preparation and set-up for the climb. The hardest part for my wife was transitioning from the cat walk to the bridge. You have to climb a steep, somewhat confined ladder. She almost gave up but pushed through and was glad she did, the climb was awesome. The staff were very helpful and encouraging to help her overcome the fear. My fear was climbing up the bridge itself with openings beneath the steps. After starting the walk, it was clear my fear was for nothing. The area beneath the steps was solid and you could not see the ground/water below you. Our guide was great, taking lots of photos and answering our questions. We took several breaks along the way. They have a great operation and almost anyone can and should take this tour. I suggest the twilight tour as you get to see Sydney by day and then the lights of the city come on as you make the trip down. Beautiful!

excellent view of sydney. First of all our tour guide Maria was such a delight to be with and explained all the different aspects of the climb. highly recommended and request Maria for your experience.
Scenic bridge. After the Opera House the most famous building in Sydney.It's just next to the Opera House so from the bridge you can see the Opera House.

Walking the bridge over to Kirribilli and Luna Park. This bridge walk has been on my list for years. Not to climb it, to walk across it. What beautiful scenery of Sydney Harbour and all it's delights. It delivered !

you can see this enroute. the Sydney bridge is visible from the opera house or the Sydney Harbour. You can have a look at it when you are sight seeing, carry a good camera so that you can take some good shots.

Must do for any local or tourist . To find the Bridge climb entry, access is in "The Rocks" district. You can walk here, just get off at Wynyard station then walk in the direction of the Rocks, the bridge will be on left side of George Street behind the Glenmore Pub. As a local of Sydney, it took me 31 years to climb the bridge and witness the spectacular views of Sydney harbour for myself - I think you always tend to explore elsewhere before your own backyard. Although doing the bridge climb is VERY expensive compared with entry fees to ancient sights all across Europe, I still feel it's a must do as the panorama is unparalleled anywhere else in Sydney. The guide we had was a Sydney local and very knowledgeable for its history. Tip: Definitely stop at the Glenmore afterwards for a schooner!

Wow!!!!. In my opinion this is a must do activity!!!! The whole experience was amazing, I have to admit we were a bit nervous but the staff are excellent at putting you at ease. Our guide was called Romeo and he was great!!! Our group consisted of 13 people and he remembered everyones names!! He must get asked the same question hundreds of times however every answer he gave sounded like it was the first time he had been asked! Safety is paramount and we certainly felt safe and secure the whole time , all in all wow!

Great views, historic bridge. It might not look like it from beyond the bridge, but it's possible to take stairs to an area that ascends to the top part of the bridge for spectacular views. A must-do if you are in Sydney and don't mind heights.

Pillar Climb. Much more affordable than climbing the bridge itself. Walk to the bridge and climb to the top of the pillar, its not as tall as the bridge, but it does get you up high enough to get a grand view of the harbour and instead of $125, it will cost you $13.

Not to be missed - a highlight of Sydney. I suggest a walk across the bridge starting at either Kirribilli in the north (Milsons Point train station) or from the Rocks by the city (look for the staircase on your right as you head up the hill on Argyle St). The views are spectacular from the walk way but do yourself a favour and spend a few dollars to go up the pillon. It is a small fraction of the cost of doing a Bridge Climb and the view is spectacular!
Sydney icon. The bridge climb is ok, but I would save your money and walk the pedestrian path along the bottom. You can walk from The Rocks across to Milsons Point (or visa versa)

Quite an experience, especially at sunset. We climbed the bridge and enjoyed the spectacular views. Anyone who can walk up a slightly steep hill could manage it - the safety arrangements were very thorough.

Awesome for a date. We went here on a date day! Staff are amazing, so helpful. Awesome views, much better than the Westfield tower. Small groups of people make you feel safe and well looked after. I am a little afraid of heights but I felt 100% safe up there. Also having a small group meant our time up there could still be romantic! The picture packages are 100% worth it, good quality and a nice souvenir. Definitely recommend for everyone! Some would say it is expensive and it does take some time to prepare before you can go onto the bridge. But it is sooo worth it.

Awesome. Our satnav took us over the bridge only a few minutes after we had collected the rental car from the airport, and that was a truly awesome experience. Later we examined it from all sorts of angles. We walked over it and beneath it, and we sailed beneath it. In addition, we climbed one of the pylons at the south end.so we felt that we had really done as much as possible to enjoy the bridge.

Don't miss. We did a sunset walk on Sunday and we were very lucky to actually get a good sunset. What we didn't know just so you plan for it is that the whole process takes about three and a half hours, that's safety briefing kit issue practice and setting off. Once you get going it's quick and very professional with great staff. You can't take a camera they do it for you so remember to take off your head set for the photos or you'll look a biff like I did but a great trip

A spectacular Australian icon. Harbour bridge very close to our hotel and we visited the bridge several times. We did not climb it because of our age It is certainly very spectacular and one of the highlights of our trip to Sydney
Great view at night time. I went up with long walking, but finally it was very worth. Amazing view of Sydney Opera, harbor and river from Bridge. Highly recommend here

Views you will remember for the rest of your life. Climbed one of the pylons open to the public only cost $23 for 2 adults and a child much cheaper than the $173 each to climb the bridge, still have amazing views of the harbour plus a museum and video to watch highly recommended
Bridge . One of the most iconic places in Sydney. One can walk through or above it and get amazing view of opera and harbour. Not expensive and good adventure

Climb the bridge or visit the museum in the tower. We were not able to climb the bridge but we did climb the tower and visit the museum within. Very interesting watching the movie and seeing the displays within the museum.
Good family experience and the view from the top of the tower is fantastic.

Watching the sunset below the bridge ending towards the church....... Sublime view of the ocean and the church at the western end, suddenly the bridge is above you and you realize the enormity....Spectacular place and must visit...

Nice but too expensive!. I did the longest harbour bridge climbing tour and it was nice to walk on the bridge and the guide was funny and knowledgeable but the walk is too expensive. The tour just takes so long, 'cause you stop all the time to take pictures. You are not allowed to take pictures by yourself which is fine but the pictures they take of you are quite expensive and not really good ( just the group picture is included in the price the other 10pic they take of you you have to buy = 10 pics =60 aus. dollar) In my opinion the entire experience is interesting but too expensive! The view is pretty nice tho but it should cost less...
EXCELLENT. WHAT A WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE I would recommend it to anyone as it is a once in a lifetime activity and the guides are very informed and helpful
Driving. Absolute drivers nightmare on all days. Definitely suggest walking across and also doing the bridge climb.
very nice view of the harbour !. drove past this place during the drive back to Sydney, very beautiful place to look at ! such wonderful scenery !

Make a day of crossing the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Breakfast and lunch could be consumed while taking in the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Take the train to Milsons point. Leaving Milsons Point station walk down towards the harbour. Grab a coffee, a muffin - something easy from one of the many locations and walk down towards the harbour front. From her you can appreciate the magnificent Sydney skyline. Take time to wander around Kirribili area. Back up towards the station but this time take the stirs to the Harbour Bridge Deck. Follow the walk on the bridge and you will locate an exit - a set of steps to the back of the Sydney Rocks area. The Australia Hotel serves a mean meal. Enjoy

A Must See Icon!. Not much to say about this - it is after all just a bridge. However it is an historic icon and if you are in Sydney you can't not take a look. Its quite a walk from the Opera House but it has some fantastic views, even without going up the lookout, and you do get a different angle of the Opera House. Sadly the Lookout was closed by the time we made it across to the bridge so we didn't get to see the even better views from up high.

You really should climb this rascal.. The views are outstanding, the wind howls and you will have the time of your life when you climb the bridge. And don't worry about the heights and the steps. You go up gradually and the steps aren't very far apart. Our guide, Helen, was so entertaining that we forgot to be worried and just relaxed and had a great climb.The company that runs the tours could not be better about worrying about your safety and comfort, so no need for you to do so. They give you everything you need and actually give you some hands on training for climbing the short ladder portion of the climb so you know what to expect before you get there. Helen explained that the lower portion is a little scarier than the upper portion because you are looking down at that point and she was right. Once you get out on the arches you don't see straight down anymore.Helen took us up in short spurts and then you get quite a bit of time up on the very top of the bridge for pictures and looking around. You cross over the middle and go back down the other side. The gear they provide is all first rate and you are attached to the bridge through a safety line from the moment you step out on the bridge until you get back down, no exceptions.You cannot take anything with you that they don't supply so you don't accidentally drop something on someone down below, so expect to pay for some pictures. We took a few and did't mind paying a few dollars extra for them. This was a highlight of our trip and we would recommend you give it a go, you won't be sorry.

Iconic and a must see. There are so many places to view the bridge. And yes, it does look like a coathanger (or the Tyne Bridge). From Macquaries Point. Or the Opera House, it must be one of the most photographed bridges in thr eorld. You have not been to Sydney if this bridge is not amongst your photo collection. If you are feeling adventurous, without a fear of heights, think about the climbing tour.

Beautiful. The bridge is quite impressive and you can walk along it to have an incredible view of Sydney and the harbour. You can also walk to the opera house to have a lovely view of the bridge itself!

One of the iconic images of Sydney. The 'old coat hanger' as it is called by locals is one of the iconic tourism images of Sydney, along with the Opera House and the Harbour. Construction commenced in 1924 and it was officially opened in 1932. The bridge now carries a huge amount of traffic (I think it has around 8 lanes of traffic and trains going across it daily). You can walk it for free (toll southwards for cars) or, since the late 1990s, you can climb it for a fee. There is a similar style bridge in Newcastle (England). The steel arch bridge in Newcastle England is a smaller version of this one, although that version doesn't have the stunning Sydney Harbour as its backdrop. This is one view of Sydney that I never get tired of. Most Australians know this, but an interesting fact is that Paul Hogan (Crocodile Dundee) once worked as a permanent bridge re-painter worker for the Sydney Harbour Bridge i.e. once the workers repainted the bridge, they turned around and started again on a permanent basis. (Not sure whether that happens anymore). File that one away for your trivia night knowledge.

We climbed the Bridge. We had a GREAT experience when we climbed the Sydney Harbour Bridge> The tour was extremely well organized> we received clothes, equipment and we even practice. It was NOT scary and less physical demanding than I expected. Our guide Lexi was fantastic. She thought us a lot of facts but also good stories about the bridge and the people working on it. If you come to Sydney I truly recommend that you climb the bridge. Booking can be done on internet.
The "Coat Hanger". This icon of Sydney was in it's glory today as the beautiful day showed off the architecture of this bridge.

Climbing the bridge is a must!. I visited Australia in October and had every intention of completing the Sydney Harbour Bridge climb.We opted for the daytime full climb taking around 3hrs to complete and it was worth every penny.The day started with a safety brief and a pre-run on the equipment prior to heading out on the bridge itself.Climb leader was brilliant and made it all the more enjoyable with plenty of knowledge and jokes.The climb has to be done if you're there and the views from the top are amazing!

Nice Bridge.. We taken hundreds of photos of this bridge from the botanic garden. Its really a engineering marvel and testament to man's ingenuity. We are able to cross the bridge by bus and its also a sight to behold.

Walked across last February and again this October:). I'm just grateful to be here again visiting with my family. I was so engrossed with the view, I totally missed what my observant son noticed --- a few padlocks on the bridge grills...just like the lovers padlocks on the Pont des Arts in Paris (which were eventually removed last June 1st). See photos attached.

Do it do it do it! . Okay it's a bit scary to begin with but once you have got used to the height - it really doesn't bother you and before you know it you're on top of the bridge. Health and safety is very strong and they prepare you so well before. A fantastic view of the city and you'll learn so much about the bridge. You really should do it if you're Mobile.

Tour the Harbour. The ride around the Harbour is worth it. We just got on at Pier 6 & got off at Darling Harbour. Bay is beautiful & lots to see. Taking tour of zoo, Manly Beach, Q Station probably worth it. But we were just looking to see harbour from the water & it was rainy, so we took 2 hour eco hopper. Can get off & on for an add'l $7 or $8. Woman who sold us tickets (Oct 22, 11:30 am) was very knowledgeable, no pressure. Glad to do business with ecohopper.com.au. Guys on board gave good, concise info. Thankfully they didn't chatter, but gave pertinent facts you'd want to know

Spectacular engineering and view.... I've walked the bridge a couple of times and every time i do i get lost in the marvel of engineering that it is. It's simply beautiful. The view is spectacular and the walk is easy. The only downside is traffic.is right next to you. There is a barrier between you and the cars but it doesn't do anything for the noise.I recommend early morning to watch the sunrise.

A view that mesmerizes me whenever I see it. I have been here in Sydney three times and everytime I am seated at the window of the plane coming here or leaving Sydney the Sydney Harbour Bridge is one of the very best view of Sydney . At the Opera House this is always part of the view that tourist come for. I love the bridge anytime of the day but the view is truly mesmerizing at night with all that lights. Sydney is not sydney without the Coathanger and the Opera House, these are the best landmarks of the place.

Walk the bridge! FREE. You can begin on either side- I started from the George st. side. ( coming from circular quay "Turn right at the George st and Alfred st. Intersection and look for the bridge walk sign on the left side of George st) the walk is easy- took me less than 15 min one way. Then at the end I chose to take the Milson ferry back to circular quay. The bridge walk offers spectacular views of the Harbour!

Hey, it's a bridge! But a beautiful one.. The bridge is a point of reference for travel around Sydney - close to Circular Quay and the Opera House. You can take a very expensive climb to the top (about $300), or just enjoy it from a safe ferry.

Do the climb!. We did the full 3 hour bridge climb. The pre-climb prep was thorough and impressive. We had to take a breathalyzer, we practiced using the safety harness, and practiced walking across a very high see-through/grated walkway to get acclimated to the actual climb. Our guide was fun and knowledgeable and paced our climb perfectly. Bonus: There were some really good freebies included!
30mins. Been in Sydney for a few months now but opted to walk the bridge over the weekend. Nice walk with plenty of cafes / restaurants on the luna park side to stop off at.
Climb the Bridge. We climbed the bridge and had a great time. I can honestly say there was never a scary moment. The views were great, but the real treat was learning the history of the bridge!

I dare you. Well I did it ,god I was scared,but staff amazing and helpful,views to die for,the opera house was amazing ,the habour fab, be around this area at night ,great resturants and a great vibe,do enjoy,after the flight ,it was worth it

Another "View". There are several ways to "take in the Bridge experience": walk halfway across, walk all the way across, climb to to the top of one of the Bridge's pylons, or walk up to the top of the highest span. We did the first and was enjoyable to view the harbor from a different perspective--of course, we had great weather. Otherwise we would have chosen not to seek "another view." Walking all the way across does not add anything except exercise. Going up the pylon was not worth the price; the price ($200/each) to be strapped into a harness, to hold for dear life in the prevailing winds and hike to the very top span was outrageous. If you have a free couple of hours, take in the view--from halfway across.

It's a long way down. This was a 13th birthday present for two children. They were very nervous when they got their blue suits on, but by the time they returned, they were 'buzzing'. Very safe and secure, and the commentary was excellent

what a view. Had a great time. We had a clear day. Some lite rain in the morning. It was cleared up for our climb. Everyone was helpful, friendly, and knowledgeable.
There were 12 in our group, I think that's the max.
It wasn't nearly as difficult as I thought it would be.
Do it and have fun.
Down side is the price.

Walk the arch of Sydney Harbour Bridge.. It does not matter if you are a local, from interstate in Australia or overseas to walk the arch of the Sydney Harbour Bridge is a must for all. You can walk it both day or night. The view of the harbour is superb and to see a ship passing underneath or coming up the harbour from the heads is exciting . This is an experience one never forgets.

The Bridge Climb. If you are in Sydney, you must climb the harbour bridge. The 3 hour adventure is well worth doing. It is well organised and there was never a feeling of being rushed. The staff are very supportive (I was a bit nervous) , get to know you and the rest of your group and help to make it really special. It would have been nice to know that I didn't need to worry about what to wear, because the overall goes right over your undies!! No-one in my group knew that!

Amazing Place. My recent trip to Australia include this place. The view from the Opera House is simply amazing. If you are the type who likes adventure, may be you would like to climb the bridge and get an awesome view of Sydney from top of the bridge. Just to caution, the fees to climb up the bridge varies, so go check out before you enroll.
Epic!!. What can I say about the bridge that has not already been said, iconic design, British of course, and such a perfect fit for the harbour.

Stunning bridge in Sydney. This stunning bridge is one of the central pieces of architecture in the Sydney, Australia harbor. No matter which side of the bay you see it it from, it is a visual focal point. In the past four days, I have traveled over & underthe bridge by both land and sea, and each time had a new perspective on the architecture.

Must do in Sydney. A walk across the Sydney Harbour bridge is a must do when visiting Sydney, and it's free! Although there is fencing the whole way across the bridge, gaps allow for photographs and what better way to see the Opera House and harbour. We took a trip up the Southern Pylon on our last day in Sydney and were rewarded by spectacular views plus a wonderful set of photographs as a moment of a great visit. For $13 it's a bargain.
Shame about the fencing. Not sure how long its been up for but its a shame about the fencing. Its great that you can walk over it but it would be good if they got rid of the barbed wire.

Free to walk across. Sydney Harbour Bridge is another icon in Sydney, and it's free to walk on and across the bridge. There is a pedestrian path on the east side of the bridge and is quite popular with locals walking across the bridge in the morning to come to work in the city, or a lunch time walk or run across the bridge and back.The views from the pedestrian walkway are great, with views of the harbour and the Opera House, and you only need to walk part way across to get excellent views. For free.Must do in Sydney.

A must place for Walkers. I Love to walk on this beautiful bridge that Connects Norther Part of Sydney to Sydney CBD. Always equipped with security guards day & night, makes it an iconic place for a walk. Visitors If you are in Sydney Don't miss to walk on the bridge and take picture of Opera House and Circular Quay. Would Love to Climb the bridge one day.

expensive but well worth the "strike 1 off the bucket list" list :). do this on an absolutely clear sky day. allocate at least 3-4 hours to do the complete BridgeClimb. If you're afraid of heights, time to grow a pair and just conquer your fear.Remember to visit the loo and pee, before heading up.At ~$365 AUD, this is hugely expensive, especially for Asians coming from other Asia countries. For that price, you get the full BridgeClimb experience, a cert and a nice team/group photo, FOC. Recommend doing it just to strike this off the list and to tell your kids.
Excellent view. Excellent view of the Harbour and the Opera house. You should first view the Opera house from the bridge... before actually walking down there.

A must do climb!. We did the bridge climb in the morning. It takes about 2 1/2 hours and it was an amazing experience. Everyone was very friendly and Pete our guide on the bridge was very friendly and knowledgeable. The views were stunning and we had the perfect morning weather wise with a light breeze. Its a must do if your going Sydney. We bought the photos as well and they were excellent. Will do the twilight climb next time we come to Sydney.

It's always there in the heart of Sydney. No one should have missed the bridge in Sydney as it can be seen almost everywhere. Yes, it is so outstanding. The best way to see it is to climb on top of it. It costs a fortune to do so, unfortunately. The next best thing to appreciate it is to take a ferry to sail below it. For picture taking, a blue sky is needed for the best results. I have a collection of hundreds of this picture now.

Partial bridge climb, amazing staff. I had booked my climb in the UK before travelling and chose the shorter climb as my husband is in a wheelchair and it was a shorter time to leave him on his own. When I arrived to check in [having positioned my hubby under the Bridge for photos] I was told the time allocated did not exist, but the Staff, on knowing that my husband was already under the Bridge, consulted with their supervisor and I was given a guide all to myself as it was inconvenient to rebook for me. This was such an amazing gesture, one that I will always treasure as I felt very special and I thank everyone so much.

Definitely a must see. For the most imposing and grandiose view of the Sydney Harbour Bridge, I recommend standing close straight to under it on the south-east side. Sensational and breathtaking, definitely recommend also walking over the bridge too.

Every morning for a blend of work and life go for a stroll across the bridge. When away for work in Sydney i find it so refreshing to take an early morning stroll across the bridge. Warning, walkers are only allowed on the one side, other side of the bridge is reserved for the cyclists.

climmed the harbour bridge. this was amazing .a bit expensive to do but if its once in a lifetime then do it.i climed right to the top and the views of Sydney brought tears to my eyes .it takes 3hrs by the time you get trained up takes half hour .just do it its brill.
Lovely walk. It a nice walk over to Kirribilli for a coffee. The view is beautiful of the harbour. You can always catch the ferry back!
Just do it. We have done this twice. Both times for special occasions with friends. Its not as scary as people think and very safely run. Just do it, you will be pleased with yourself when you do.

Hard not to miss it. Obviously a Australian icon, I haven't done the bridge climb over the top of the arch, but have walked across it a few times which is a lot of fun. On the southern side Pillar you can actually walk up into it not many people realize you can.There is a Museum inside with the bridge history and a viewing platform and its free no charge, worth a look.

The place to visit in Sydney . I would highly recommended the bridge climb if you like to have a great view of Sydney and the budget, otherwise the pedestrian walk from the rocks to kirrabilli is free option that would give you a good view of the harbour

Great walk along the bridge. Majestic looking bridge. Specifically, the four pylons are certainly grander than what you would expect from a bridge. Walk across the bridge is about 30-45 mins free of charge.

A Walk on this Bridge is Essential to Seeing Sydney. Second only to the Opera House as a "must-do" in this fabulous city is a walk on the Sydney Harbour Bridge. (There are two ways to do this: walking across the bridge at the top, tethered to the structure (not for the fainthearted) or walking along the span at road-level on the pedestrian path.) We chose the later. The views are spectacular, as is the "sense of place" about the city provided from this perspective.

Walking the Bridge. Walking across the Sydney Harbour is a must. It is safe with four security guards patrolling along the route, well lit and a really great way to get to the Rocks. You'll enjoy spectacular views of the Opera House and Circular Quay.

An iconic and amazing structure. As easily recognised as the opera house, the Sydney harbour bridge is a beautiful structure. Connecting north and south Sydney it's lattice work of iron girders is an essential part of any visit to the city.
go across the bridge. it is very beautiful across the bridge.take the walk across the bridge and enjoy the other side.it is so beautiful and there is a walk to take along the coat line.
More than just a bridge. a monument with plenty vantage points. You can drive along or climb the bridge. Best seen from opera house side.

Sydney harbour bridge. An iconic structure that we have all seen on TV , I wasn't sure if it would live up to my expectations, I was wrong, what a structure everything I expected, a must see if your in Sydney.
Visit this famous Sydney icon known to the locals as the 'coathanger'. Don't just look at this fabulous feat of engineering - go climb it. The view from up there will not disappoint.

Great view from Opera House. Sydney Harbour bridge has a great drive but not worth the walk on the bridge
i would rather suggest get the view from opera house itself
Very touristy. Plenty of shops around and activities, restaurants not the cheapest but what you would expect to pay on the waterfront. Museums, cinemas and bars all located around here, fascinating
Was not impressed!. Our plan was to do the bridge climb, but upon seeing the bridge, I thought Brooklyn bridge has more character. Additionally, the price to do the climb is expensive.

A fun test of pushing through a fear of heights.. For me this was a great adventure and left me feeling exhilarated having accomplished a test of courage. For my hubby who tests that courage regularly in risky sports this was a stroll in the park. However, we both loved the views and how the company runs their operation. The process to get people up and down safely is excellent. Even with the extreme height I felt quite safe. I was told they've never lost anyone so that helped push me to finish. :) Our guide was very knowledgeable in the historical and technical information as well as very sensitive to those needing reassurances throughout the climb. It is a bit costly, but if the price is feasible for the budget, I highly recommend it.
over 23 years of visiting Sydney and it was the first time I've walked over the bridge. well worth the walk over the bridge great pics great stroll, lucky integer rained takes an hour or so
big bridge you cannot miss it. you see this sight from anywhere in Sydney. massive and the history behind is also worth to know. do a sight seeing bus tour and you will get it.
what a bridge. overlooking the best natural harbour in the world, you can walk over the bridge but for a bit of fun why not do a bridge climb over the top

A sartorial highlight!. We booked the 'sampler' tour given that my wife was very scared, but determined to overcome her fears. As it turned out, we were the only couple on the 09:10 sampler, so we had our guide (Brendon) to ourselves. What a great experience and at the end my wife was absolutely elated, to such an extent that she was talking about going on the main tour next time (result or what!). Our guide was excellent and made the whole experience really enjoyable. Thoroughly recommend the tour.

Walking the bridge. Its a nice walk. We started out early, picked up a pastry from Burke st bakey first. Not as much traffic and you get to see Sydney in all it glory. Beautiful harbour, opera house and you get to take pictures that makes great wallpaper.

Express Bridge Climb. Had a fantastic day climbing the Bridge, we took the Express Arch and it wasnt as much of a incline which made it easier on the thighs, amazing Views and beautiful scenery once up there, our Host was great, very informative and funny, the only negetive was the photo that was taking of me but the Host was a great one but I had my eyes closed and it wasnt till I got to the bottom and looked at them that I realised and I was a little bit gutted about that. No momento to take home which was a shame. However a once in a life time experience

Still impressive. We had crossed the bridge by car and train, and sailed under it on a cruise ship. Finally we have walked over it. We left our train at the northern end and took a leisurely stroll across a structure that is, despite being 83 years old, still impressive. The views experienced by those doing the bridge climb can only be imagined. Sail boats, ferries and other water craft can be seen, as well as Circular Quay and the world famous sails of the Opera House. It was only a short walk from the southern end of the bridge to the newly created Barangaroo Reserve, which is also worth a visit, with its parkland, native plants and stunning sandstone blocks used throughout the landscaping.

Pylon cheaper than bridge climb. Just as great views!. Had every intention on doung bridge climb but were time poor so chose to see Bridge in Southern Pylon.This cost around $12 and is an informative display on history of Sydney Habour Bridge.There are considerable stairs to climb to get to top but once there you get a 97m high 360° view od City and Habour!You can see all the otgers walking over the top of the bridge and traffic below. If you are on a budget or time is an issue, or perhaps have not tge courage to do bridge climb, this is a cheap, informative and spectacular way to see Sydney and surroundings!
Good lookout. . You will have a magnificent view at the city from here. No need to climb to the actual top. Just enjoy the view from the side walk.
Beautiful sight. The harbor bridge is a beautiful sight. I did not do the climb over the bridge but I will next time I am in town.

A fave *free* walk :). The iconic bridge is not just a beautiful sight to behold, but it's a great walk too. You can access the steps at The Rocks and walk both ways or get the train across one way and walk the other. If in the city, you can get the train to Milson's Point - turn left as you exit the barrier then right as you exit the station. Start at Kirribilli with brekkie or lunch at one of the fab cafes/restaurants - I'll add reviews for some of these too - then climb the steps to access the most stunning views of the harbour and of course the Opera House. A fave time of year is, of course, the Vivid Festival, when the harbour, buildings and ferries are brightly lit in vibrant colours. A photographer's dream! You can also go up the elevator of the column but this costs $$s - I've never done. If you're a cyclist you can access the cycle path at the other side of the bridge (North Sydney side - turn right then left out of Milson's Point railway station). Of course there's the Bridge Climb too - they are at the city side of the bridge if you want to organise.

Truly an amazing site. Truly an amazing site. Go to one of the pylons and climb up and see all the history of the Sydney Harbour Bridge Book a time to climb the harbour bridge all the way to the top absolutely breathtaking

Sydney Harbour Bridge. No trip to Sydney is complete without at least a ferry ride past this icon of Sydney. An architectual marvel that has to be seen to be believed! Set with the backdrop of the beautiful Sydney Harbour you'll be in awe as you pass under it on the ferry!There are tours full of the history of the bridge and for the adventurous, you can climb it on a guided tour. Not got the faint hearted! It's very high! We ALWAYS visit the bridge on a ferry ride when in Sydney. Just magic!!
Bridge climb . Awesome, a must do. Breath taking views. Staff are great for those who have a fear of heights - like me - they look after you every step of the way

The best thing you can do to appreciate this city. I have been on the bridge a few times, both the "usual" walk and the one on the middle levelThe conventional one is so informative and fun for all ages. I am not a big fan of heights but there are only a couple of places than can be scary. For these just dont look down. The climb is so safe and informative, the best way to see and find out about our city, for Sydney-siders and visitors alikeThe "inner" walk is different, and probably more architectural as you see all the cross supports as wellJust do it, you will have a ball

The Sky is the limit. While climbing the Sydney Harbour Bridge may be a bit daunting, it is an exhilarating experience. Safety first all the way and once at the peak......you can see Sydney in all its glory. Well worth the money.

Watched the beautiful view of the bridge on the ferry. If you are in Sydney or looking for transportation to get around, taking the ferry is a must do. Very easy and affordable and the best tour of all Sydney which will show you the best view of the bridge. I used the ferry as a means for transportation from Watson Bay to the city. Very easy to understand and get around using the ferry as well as a great place for photos. Check out my photos @brubunce via Instagram, Twitter, and Tumblr.

Wonderful Views. It's amazing to walk from the North side of the bridge towards the rocks at anytime of year but our favourite time ever was during Vivid light festival and we were on the bridge at 6pm as the lights of the opera house and the harbour started to light up. Awesome

5 ways over the bridge. Almost free way to experience 5 Sydney harbour bridge crossings: walk, cycle, train, climb (up the free museum on the northern pilar, or if you've the $ bridge climb) and river cat/ sail under.

Bridge walk. It was amazing. Loved every minute. We were in a small group of 14 from all over the world. Completely safe and no need to worry about fitness as we had plenty of stops to take in the view and catch our breath before moving on. Awesome would do it again in a heart beat.

Great Walk and amazing views. This is a great walk - you can access the walkway from the Eastern side of the bridge. (Note - the Western side is for bicycles only.) Walking the bridge is a great way to see beautiful harbour views on a sunny day. OR you can pay and do the full bridge climb experience - also really great!
Awesome view. This iconic site lives up to its billing. My wife and son did the tour which is pricey but the twilight views from the high point were "breathtaking".

don't miss this. It just my dream to cross this bridge, going up from circular quay area and walking through the bridge at drizzle weather was not made me having bad mood, the weather just perfect.. and the view was amazing.. opera house from far. you can see the whole circular quay area. anyway, it just walk through the bridge not the bridge climb.. a must do activity..
Windy but fabulous. The views are fantastic from the bridge, especially when there is a Cruise Ship passing underneath. The Bridge Climb looks brilliant - I wasn't brave enough though!

Climbed it!. Being deathly afraid of heights aside, took on the challenge for my birthday and so glad I did! Pre-climb prep was excellent & Guide did a great job - views were spectacular and the architectural explanation fascinating (coming from a non-techie!)

Atop The Coathanger. Great adventure. A little wet for our climb but we were safe and comfy in our rain gear. Knowledgeable and entertaining guide. Fantastic view of the Opera House and Sydney city center. Well worth the effort. We are senior travelers in decent shape and found the climb only moderately difficult. A couple of ladders and steep stairs but doable for anyone in reasonably good condition. An exciting and different way to see a new city.

Take the slow way not the Highway!. We were in Sydney in April 2015. The famous Harbour Bridge walk appeared to be too steeply priced (about $275 AUD per person) for us. In addition, it involved booking a certain time, donning gears etc. And you could only stop at a few occasions to take pics and enjoy the view for only a short while. Instead, we discovered that there is a sidewalk crossing the bridge only a few dozen yards below the expensive option. We took our time stopped as often as we wanted. Climbed up to one of the pillars that housed a museum about the history of construction of the bridge. We walked just before sunset and captured magnificent photos of the Opera House and the Circular Quay and the Sydney Harbour and the Skyline. Our return walk -again free- was after sunset and then we enjoyed the view of the lights and again the Opera House in a tottallty different setting and captured memorable pictures...What an experience! and saved over $500 too!
