Australian Sydney Icon. Wonderful bridge. Great views and wonderful walking across looking at the sites around. Photographic options on and off the bridge.

A true national icon.. The name says it all. A bridge over Sydney Harbour. If you feel energetic on a fine day with blue skies walk over it and take in the view. If you feel energetic and rich you might want to try the Bridge Climb.

A must see and do!. We wanted to climb the bridge however it was just soooo expensive and speaking to many people they said if you walk it you get a great view anyway. So we made sure to walk over the bridge a few times, the views are amazing.

A must see & do!. I am not a big fan of heights but I felt so safe doing the bridge climb due to the fact you wear your safety harness the whole time and there is always sufficient railings to hold onto. The view from the very top of the bridge was absolutely amazing! The whole experience took a little over 3 hours and was worth every cent. Our guides name was Sara and she was so helpful with all our questions and made the whole experience an absolute delight!

Good views but not the best. We walked the bridge and back. The views of the harbour and opera house are great, but I prefer the ones from the botanic gardens. It is a little difficult to find the access stairs from the Rocks, the signs are few and far between. There are a lot of locals jogging the bridge in both directions, which can make the footpath hard to navigate.
A truely amazing Australian icon. We walked over the bridge and travelled underneath it on the Ferry. We also had a great view of it from our hotel room. It is an amazing structure.

Good to do the Climb but do it in the day time. The views from the climb are amazing and would recommend doing it during the daytime as we did it at night there was a high crosswind so couldn't heard anything the guide was saying and there was lighting that night there were a few people scare and feeling sick and wanted to return to the base but the guide refuse to let them return to base and continue the tour.

Amazing experience. I climbed the bridge on my 50th birthday. It was awesome. The guide, I can't remember her name, was brillant. Very knowledgable and a great communicator. The bridge itself was a fantastic experience. We did the 3 1/2 hour tour. It was easier than what I thought. I throughly recommend this climb to everyone.
Refreshing. Refreshing to walk from one end to another as you enjoy the scenery and admire the bridge structure. The walk takes apx 20 mins about 1.36km.
normal. this place was not very good to me. it was just a normal bridge to me . i found the places better than this one
Sydney bridge climb. The Sydney bridge climb was great fun! If you want a dazzling view of Sydney and the Opera house I recommend the bridge climb.

Great climb with stunning views on a good day. Have done this climb twice - one around late morning and the other early afternoon. Both climbs were done in April (not too hot or cold) a few years apart. Both climbs I could see from Bondi Beach to Blue Mountains. spectacular! You will need stamina as it is a 3 hour climb, after safety demonstration within building.

Fantastic!. My partner and I done the Twilight climb!
They kit you out with everything for all weather's!
Definitely a must do!
Go up in the day, come down in the dark!
Beautiful!
Such great and knowledgeable staff!

Great scenic walk. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is an excellent way to spend half a day to no cost. Start out early in the morning and have a quick breakfast in The Rocks area. Then walk towards the bridge following the signs which will lead you to the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Once on the bridge, take a slow walk across the bridge, savoring the spectacular views of the Sydney Harbour. The walk takes about 45 minutes from end to end without going up Python lookout($11 AUD). Once on the other side, you can have a meal at one of the local eateries before exploring the surrounding area.
Must go!!. Lovely walk with excellent view of the city. Cannot be missed if you are not scared of heights. Go for it
Best view of the Sydney Harbour. Bridge climb was awesome. The photos they take for you to purchase are very good. Great experience..

experience of a lifetime.... amazing views.beautiful structure.u can see the opera house and amazing sydney views from the brdge.you can be on top through the bridge walk.it was an amazing experience.one of the best things to do in australia mate haha.amazing cafes and restaurants on both side of the bridge.fresh air blue sky and blue water what else u need in life .memories will be in my heart forever.
Must do (for free). Stereotypical "must do" when in Sydney. Beautiful view from top. worth the walk across, however quite expensive to go to the top.
delightful trip. back in Sydney having an awesome time there is so much to see and do, 5 days is just not enough so much to cram in.

Bridge climb experience . Booked the bridge climb with my adult daughter. Was an amazing experience with the best views of the amazing harbour. The tour was well setup and staff were great. Surprisingly it was not physically taxing. A must do experience.

Walk across it. You know you want to.. It's free, the views are amazing, you can shoot the Opera House from here and you'll probably remember it as one of your best days in Sydney. Often skipped by travellers who can't imagine what could possibly be so great about walking over a bridge, this is one of the best cheap activities in Sydney. Yes, you can pay a lot of money to climb it, and that's fun too, but there's something great about a nice long stroll across the harbour, particularly if you head out just as the sun is setting (or for the really keen, rising).Don't worry too much about trying to choose a time when there's less traffic. The bridge is pretty much always full of traffic, unless you feel like walking it at 1am.

Great city walk. You can walk across the bridge for free on the opera house side. Bike riders cross on the opposite side. Well worth going for a walk early in the morning for an awesome sunrise. Or at night for the city lights.

Undergoing work. A group of 10 of us climbed the bridge and I found it very scary but am now glad I completed it. What made it scarier was that they are currently undergoing work, so where you normally climb the bridge, cross the top and have photos and walk down the otherside - but due to the work you have to cross via a mesh bridge which you can see through and is utterly terrifying! Cross again on the normal bridge where you have photos, and then cross back again using a logged slim bridge with gaps in the double railings again utterly terrifying! The way back down is a delight but the way up I found a real challenge.I would recommend it to friends and family but would discourage anyone with any fear of heights as it is rather challenging!
The one and only. This world renowned structure is well worth a visit and a climb up one of the support towers. You are rewarded by views across the city and bay.-

Took a run across the Sydney Harbour Bridge. I didn't opt to do a $200 bridge climb as I didn't have the time but felt like running across it (or of course you can walk) had the same great views. Opera house not looking so white anymore though. :)

Relaxing stroll in Sydney. Spent a couple of hours walking across the bridge and wandering around the local areas. Was a lovely way to spend the morning and "discover" more attractions. Didn't do the bridge or stair climb - just a nice stroll on a warm spring day.
Quite a Walk. You can walk over the bridge - span or footpath. BUT - not if you suffer from vertigo. It is such a sight/site and gives you a really top view of the City. Worth a thought.
Iconic. An iconic landmark in a beautiful harbour. Great to sit and admire the view of the people making the climb too!

Fantastic Adventure - Climbing to the top of the Bridge!!!. Climbed the bridge over the October long weekend and what a marvellous experience it was! Climbing to the top of the bridge is a must for anyone with a sense of adventure! The staff are attentive and more than happy to accommodate your requests.Highly recommend completing the trek to the top of the bridge!
Awesome. Looks spectacular but is an amazing experience if you go up... Very safe and amazing views. Choose a sunny day.

One for the Bucket list. You can walk near it, under it or even over the top of it for a price. Flying in or just walking around Sydney you cannot miss it. This bridge just suites the city so well and has earned its place as a must see.

Great Views. Great views of the Harbor bridge from many places of Sydney CBD. I have been on this in private transport. The train also goes on this bridge on one side. Eventhough I have not had the chance to do the bridge climb tour this is also an attraction/activity to do on the bridge by going through the relevant tourist agents for tickets and tours.

Bridge Climb: Pricey but Unique. To be honest the Sydney Harbor Bridge Pylon Lookout offers nearly as good a view of the city as does the bridge climb and the cost is appreciably lower. But the bridge climb is a much different experience and I’d recommend a properly timed dusk tour to get both the daylight and evening views of the lighted city. We were lucky enough to witness a warm sunset and a nearly simultaneous full moon rise. If you purchase a bridge climb it will include the Pylon Lookout pass but the pylon is only open from 10AM to 5PM. Go to the bridge climb office early to get this pass well before your scheduled climb. Within the pylon is a modest set of photos and discussion of the bridge and its construction which serves as good background before the climb.Now about that bridge climb: If you want a day and night view then check the web for the sunset of the day you hope to climb. Because it takes 50 minutes to prepare a group and because the climb takes some time you should then pick a tour with a starting time about 1.5 hours earlier. Really? Yes? That will put you well up onto the bridge at sunset. In order to insure the safety of the climbers and motorists below, you are very carefully coached and garbed. They did not just think this up and every detail is engineered. You will begin by removing all but your basic clothing and a back zipping jumpsuit is provided. Next comes a robust safety belt with an attached glide that will secure you to the bridge for the entire climb. It follows you along a permanent cable on the bridge and you cannot detach. Eyewear is secured with a strap and a coat, gloves, and hat are provided as needed…all with lanyards to connect to the suit. There are literally no loose ends. Now fitted with a radio headset you will take a short trip over a demonstration set of ladders to give you a feel for the climb and the behavior off the glide restraint. The climbing guides work like a team to orchestrate and oversee your movement and safety. You will clip in as you step out of the preparation building and onto the bridge and you will unclip upon return. I won’t provide any additional detail because it is to be an adventure.We are in our early sixties and it was not particularly taxing. Your tour will stop several times for group and individual photos so be sure that you are clipped in adjacent to your buddies. One group photo was provided at no cost along with a hat and completion certificate at the end of the climb and other photos can be purchased. I did not ask about electronic copies.So in summary the experience was unique and I’d recommend it over the Sydney Tower Skywalk, particularly if you are on a budget. But then it is rather pricey and requires a three hour window. Be sure to eat and purge before you begin to avoid distractions.

Nice walk from The Rocks. If you have some time, take a walk from The Rocks and up the hill to an historic neighborhood that is under redevelopment. The row houses in the area remind me of the architecture of Bourbon Street in New Orleans. The Harbour Bridge isn't that long and you can walk across it to the North Shore. There is a vista point on the bridge where you can pay to get a higher view. However, just walking across the bridge gives you a great view of all sides of the harbor.

Bridge Climb is a once in a lifetime experience.. The bridge climb is a little pricey but its worth every dollar that you pay for. The views of the harbour, opera house and water are spectacular. It's great for young and old.

One of the Best Views in the World. didnt do the Bridge Climb but just as good is taking the train across to Milsons Point and walking back across the bridge. A bonus is it is free and there are security men positioned all along. The views on a sunny day looking down the Sydney harbour towards the heads are breathtaking. You can see the ferries and boats sailing about everywhere. If your lucky there will also be a huge ocean liner moored in Circular Quay close to the bridge. Then the gem the Sydney Opera House is there in all its glory plus Circular Quay ferry harbour and the Sydney CBD. A stroll across the Sydney harbour Bridge sure is hard to beat anywhere in the world and there are a few people doing it.
Iconic landmark!. This is a must see if you are in the Sydney area. It's very close to the opera house so why not right? Driving over the bridge is pretty incredible as well.

Must do in Sydney. The bridge is an iconic landmark. The only real decision people have to make is to do the bridge climb, or simply walk across the bridge. It's $250 AUD to do the climb, or free to walk across. However, I do recommend if you choose to walk go up into the Pylon lookout. It does cost approximately $20 AUD to walk to the top and look out at great views of Sydney Harbor. But it is well worth it. I have nothing against the bridge climb other than I didn't believe the experience was worth the money they were asking.
leisurely stroll across the bridge is perfect day activity. I walked across the bridge for free and got the best views of Sydney Harbour on the most beautiful day!

Pylon climb. If you don't like heights or don't think you can manage the bridge climb, do yourself a favour and do the pylon lookout. Yes, there are stairs, but plenty of places to stop and catch your breath if you need to. Well worth the small effort involved. The views over Sydney are amazing and photo opportunities are huge. All I can say is; Do it!
A must see if you are in Sydney!. A must see if you are in Sydney! Walk over the bridge at sunset to see the opera. More attractions in walking distance.
Bridge of life. An iconic bridge which epitomizes the style an flair of Sydney. A definite must see for any tourist visiting Australia.
The Great Coat Hanger. A beautiful arched enhancement to Sydney Harbor. It majestically spans a beautiful expanse of water as well as a practical answer to joining both shores.

Magnificent Sight of Sydney Harbour!. Beautiful to walk across for a morning or arvo walk, or to view from the Opera Bar, Circular Quay or Milson's Point! Particularly lovely at sunset, creating a brilliant silhouette across the sky. If you can, catch a ferry from one side of the harbour to the other to see the intricate structural work underneath, or you can walk underneath from the Rocks. One side of the bridge is dedicated to bike-riders only. I haven't climbed it yet - but tickets can be purchased to climb and tour the bridge from the top!
Awesome landmark. Didn't climb it but it looks amazing and if you have a head for heights I'd recommend the climb. But it makes great photos for the album

Gotta do it, for the exercise & views. The views are fantastic, so it is a must visit. The side benefit, is that the hike across the bridge & back, is great exercise, all while enjoying that fantastic view. There are some additional adventures that cost some additional dollars, including the climb to the top of the bridge (expensive) & a climb up one of the bridge support structures at the start/end of the bridge (inexpensive) . In the end, it is an idyllic structure with a great view, so must visit.
True landmark. So proud to be living next to this awesome structure. Just beautiful to look at, to climb and to show off to the visitors.

A beautiful walk. As I used to live in The Rocks as a child we often walked across the bridge and back, then I used to jump over the spaces in the pathway, now I don't. It is a must to do as a Sydney resident or a tourist and it is FREE!

The Best View of Sydney Ever!. It owe it to yourself, your family, your friends ... whoever you visit Sydney with to talk a walk on the high side of Sydney. Scale the "Coat Hanger" securely attached to a trouble-free cable and absorb the magnificent views that await you with every step. Exhilarate in the rush to your senses. Then afterwards, walk the length of the bridge and get a whole new perspective of the jewel of the South Seas ... Sydney Harbor.
A bridge. Nice bridge but really not much more. There are tours climbing the bridge but we did not join one of those.
Birthday celebration. I have been at Sydney Harbour for my bday celebration. It's an awesome place. You can enjoy view. You can take ferry a d go to many different place.

One of its kind. This is such an iconic landmark for Sydney. If you cannot afford the over $140 to do the bridge climb then you can walk over it for free to see fantastic views anyway from just a bit lower than if you were on the climb. The Opera House view from the bridge is so good. Not at all crowded as not so many people know to do this. Also free in the area is a guided tour of The Rocks area every evening around 5pm. Top spot in Sydney and great photo opportunities.
The coat hanger.... An iconic symbol of Sydney. Whether you are walking on it, over it, ferrying under it, or catching a view of it from some spot on the harbour foreshore, just make sure you see it.

Amazing views from the top!. I was encouraged to climb the bridge by my Husband, feeling rather unsecure about it I wasn't sure, but I decided that perhaps I wouldn't get the chance again so went for it!I was so glad I made this decision. It was amazing!! The views were stunning & although it was very safe it was also very high up!! A must do while in Sydney!

Amazing centrepiece. Amazing feature of the city that dominates the skyline and the harbour.Historical significance to the development of the city and it's population.Strongly recommend climbing the bridge for spectacular 360 degree views of the city and surrounds. The climb is excellently run and very safe.
Bridge Climb a must do.. Climbing the Sydney Harbour Bridge is a must do the view from the top of the bridge is spectacular, and it is quite an easy climb.
bridge climb. I was given a bridge climb as a gift I found it to slow and a bit boring the view at the top was amazing

Stunning. Yes, its only bridge, but its an iconic bridge. The walk to it is brilliant, passing the architecture and shops / cafe etc.. I even used the oldly worldly toilet right under the bridge... a must do!

Top tip. i travelled here in nov 2012......if your budget doesn't stretch to the bridge walk u can climb the steps inside the tower to a viewing platform. inside the tower is a mini museum explaining how the bridge was built. once on the platform you aren't too far away from the highest part of the bridge anyway and unlike when ur on the bridge walk where u cant take ur on photos, u can take as many as u want from up here. This trip is my top Sydney trip as it only cost 12 dollars to enter rather than the 200 plus it cost for the bridge walk.

A bucket list thing to do. I lived in Sydney for years, but never ever walked over the bridge. Now I have. It was great. I thought about doing the scaling the arc thing but it was too expensive for my budget and as you can't take your camera and photography is my thing, walking across the bridge is perfect. Just do it. It would probably be horrid on a miserable day. As it was, I swigged lots of water as it was unseasonably warm. A nice option afterwards is to go to the pub and have an ale – my companions did that, while I persisted with my water. Then take the train back to Town Hall (or where ever) from Millsons Point and go out to dinner with friends, overlooking the harbour. Perfecto.

Morning Walk on the Harbor Bridge. Oh My god must take walk when you are in Sydney. When the sun is rising, the beauty of the city rises. Photographer enjoy this trip alot. Must carry your camera. We took lots and lots of photos and is very accessible with Public transportation

Many ways to experience this landmark. Depending on your budget and preferences you can gaze from afar at the wonderful architecture before you, you can walk across on the pedestrian path to take in Sydney from the other side of the harbour, or you can climb across the top for a pretty hefty fee. Seems like all options are great-- can't go wrong!

Take the time for a closer look.. I'm a bit too old to do the Bridge Climb but am sure it would be a blast. I contented myself with strolling across the Bridge on the pedestrian path. Being dwarfed by such a massive engineering feat was very impressive. I was pleasantly surprised to find a display in the South East Pylon depicting the history of construction etc. A walk around the base where the arches meet the shore was impressive too.

Beautifull. This is another astonishing bridge to go through. Walking is fairly easy access and provides beautifull views. If you want to try the bridge climb however, be aware that the fees are in the neighborhood of $250 AUS. Also providing beautifull unique views. A must for bridge lovers !

Spectacular landmark.. We actually travelled in October 2013, but the site keeps asking bus to update, so I'm doing so now. The bridge is a spectacular sight. We walked across it, enjoying magnificent views of the city. Our friend actually did the famous Bridge Walk, and said that it was exhilarating.

So many views, so little time. Decided to do the Harbor Bridge tower ($13) after walking across this wonderful bridge that gives you so many ways to enjoy the city. This is one of the best deals for a peak view all around short of climbing the bridge(a little more expensive at around $200 and which I did not do). One of the best views for the money. Walking the bridge will give you some excellent photo opportunities but you'll have to deal with some bridge barriers whereas you won't have to on the tower...just don't drop your phone/camera.
Great Bridge. Great Australian Icon and nice bridge to walk across, its also free to walk across on foot and a worthwhile activity.
Wow!. Takes your breathe away A fantastic iconic piece and beautifully dominates and enhances the harbour . Get the ferry across the harbour and travel under , it's awsesone

Great experience, great fun and a great view.. The Bridge climb is a exhilarating experience for the regular person. The climb is relatively straight forward. The views are breathtaking. We did the express walk.

The view!. The Bridge climb is well worth the price as it provides possibly the best view of Sydney. We suited up and received some basic training and an understanding of what we were doing. For the average person it's not difficult and for the less able, it is still do-able and you are attached by a wire to the structure so no chance of falling. A fun thing to do and great views at the top, now I have good memories.

Sydney trip. The view was amazing! I had so many pictures taken where the Sydney Harbour bridge can be found. The scenery is really nice. So curious to have that tour up the bridge. Not sure about the price but for sure it will be another life experience. The bridge would always be an icon on anyone visiting Sydney.
Bridge Climb. Not to be missed. A bit on the expensive side but so glad I did the climb. Fantastic views. Well organised and knowledgable guide.
Awesome. Fabulous experience X took boat trip from Sydney harbour under the bridge well worth doing the scenery was spectacular and well worth doing the trip x

Fantastic experiece. We booked the bridge climb online and the experience was outstanding even before my partner got down on one knee and proposed . Our guide Jack was funny, relaxed and knowledgable. The stairs were the scariest but overall it wasn't scary at all. Plenty of guidance and support with ample opportunity to have photos taken by your guide. Thank you for a life altering experience that I will never forget.

WOW What Views. We climbed the bridge in the morning and found it easy (We are both over sixty).The views from the top are fantastic !!.We have climbed the Story Bridge in Brisbane but this climb is more fun and exciting.

Climb it!. Definitely recommend going to the top of the bridge with BridgeClimb Sydney for some spectacular views. It's pricey but I a great experience. Another alternative is to go to the top of the tower. Less expensive but still beautiful! Tower admission is included free with BridgeClimb experience!
Bridge. You can view the bridge from many angles but the best view in my opinion is from the many boats that go to and from Sydney harbour

The Climb of our Life!. Brilliant Tour that brings you to the top of the famous Sydney Harbour Bridge. Stunning views over the whole city, the beaches, the river and the amazing Opera House. Great memories forever...

Beautiful, Amazing. The view form Sydney Harbour bridge is as impressive as the view of the bridge itself, what an incerdible piece of engineering, built in a time when form was as important as function, don't just admire it from afar, take a stroll across the bridge, Awesome!
love to walk on the bridge. love to walk on the bridge and watch whats going on in the Harbour. The view is great. On the other side of the bridge walk down and enjoy the view from Misons Point.

Walk across the bridge free . Visiting Sydney and realised we could walk across the bridge as pedestrians. It was an easy walk. Had to climb some steps to start with. We started at The Rocks. About 3km across and back all up. Fabulous views. Very safe.

Sydney Bridge Climb. It was a fantastic climb. We all love it. Our tour guide - Romeo was very knowledgeable and shared a lot of information on the bridge and its surrounding. Will definately recommend everyone to try this.

Sydney Harbour Bridge. We walked across the bridge up to the Pylon Lookout. Cost us $13 each to climb up the the lookout. Fantastic views across the city. About 100 stairs to climb but was not too hard. There are souvenirs to buy in their shop and articles in the museum to read. They have a clip to watch but we did not stay for this

Beautiful lights. Again everyone has seen this on TV and knows what it looks like.But you will have no better experience than going to see the bridge at night.The lights are stunning.Everything is so peaceful.Just beautiful.

Eh. Fancy Bridge, Sydney has quite a few bridges but I don't get why this one is so special. It's just a bridge that is kind of fancy. A bit further down there is an even cooler bridge that has "metal rope" holding up aspects.

CLIMB THE BRIDGE. If there is one thing you do when in Sydney, do this!!! The views are stunning, the tour guides are always brilliant and the information they provide is interesting. It is 100% worth paying that little extra to do this activity.
Must see. The views are superb, you are standing on history and it's great excercise. What's not to like? Worth the effort.

Iconic Sydney Landmark. Great for Photos, Both Of and From. The Sydney Harbor Bridge is an iconic landmark that is an integral part of what Sydney is. It is fantastic location to take photos of the harbor and is also photographic in its own right. If you are the adventurous type you can even take a walk to the top of the arch. We just walked down the pedestrian walking path to get some photos of the Sydney Opera House since my wife is not a fan of heights. At night it is lit up, if you have a tripod you can get some very nice photos of the bridge reflected in the river.

Must see. You can see the bridge from a distance but to really appreciate it you have to walk across the bridge. It can be accessed from a flight of steps in the rocks area of the harbour. Magnificent bridge and one if the first of its kind when it was built. Marvel of engineering and you can get some nice photos of the opera house mid way across.

Great views once you're at the top.. This is a must do for all travellers to Sydney even if you don't like heights. You have to make yourself do it as I did. Safety is the staff's paramount issue. Nothing must be loose; every single item is clipped on to your boiler suit including a handkerchief. If your phobia of heights is really bad then be aware that you can't have any help going up the 5 ladders or coming down again on the other side where the trains run. There is also an open walkway where you cross to the other side of the bridge. You are out a very long time, so make sure you've been to the loo about 6 times beforehand. The views are amazing and the experience is worthwhile albeit quite expensive.
Impressive. ... Even thou we did not physically go on the bridge we saw it from opera house. This would be great experience to walk up to the top of the arches. Truely amazing engineering.

Do it with a free city tour !. I walked to the bridge with a free 3 hour walking tour and got to really know its history and see it up close. Its really beautiful and you get a good view of the Sydney Opera House too !

Beautiful. Magnificent bridge. Don't do the climb though, not worth the money. You can walk across it though, and one of the best places to get a picture is on the North side of the bridge, heading down towards Luna Park, you can get a great picture of the Opera House under the bridge.Also an essential place to be if your lucky enough to be in Sydney for New Years Eve!!
Even more impressive in real life. It's an icon but the pictures just don't do it justice. Take time to walk around the bridge and soak in the surrounds... Very special!

Place this on your 'Bucket List '. What an amazing feeling walking onto and atop the Sydney Harbour. Whoever came up with this amazing event needs thanking over and over. To be able to climb this icon and view Sydney from all directions is something else .Writing about it cannot explain the thrill and achievements of those that built this iconic structure. I really recommend everyone gives this ago..

Just do it!!. Not a lover of heights but decided to climb it anyway. What an amazing experience. I did the Twilight climb,slightly dearer but you get to see the City and surrounds,including the Opera House,in day and night mode. Standing on the top of the arch as the sun was setting was awesome and watching the city light up before heading down was just spectacular. Well worth the money and not scary at all.
Must try climbing the bridge. sydney harbour bridge is a must in sydney....you should try the sydney harbour bridge climbing in twilight sunlight..
Bridge visit. A lot smaller than I imagined but great to see. I thought the cost of the 'bridge walk' (walking up the span of the bridge) was just too dam expensive.
nice view. good view and nice on photos. Just as what i have imagined. Area is cool and despite the number of travellers, view was spectacular

This was everything and more. We landed at 6:30 am in sydney, checked into our hotel, and immediately signed up for the 11:45 climb. We were determined to fight jetlag by continuing to move about town and not settle into the room. This was just jaw droppingly awesome. The tour guides are really nice and knowledgable. The climb is not overly intimidating--they go out of their way to keep you safe...and to help you overcome anxiety--the climb is broken up into various starts and stops so you don't get too tired along the way. But lets be clear...it is not a constantly steep climb although there are some steep ladders, but it is a rather long climb---you won't work much harder in the actual climb than you do in the prep session---for those afraid of heights---trust the tripadvsior on this one...DON'T PASS ON THE BRIDGE CLIMB. YOU'LL BE SO GLAD YOU DID

Never ceases to amaze. This is a great bridge, in a great location of a (more often than not) great city. I'm 36 at the time of writing this but I still gaze in awe when I drove over this iconic landmark.It has become an integral part of our New Years celebrations and the bridge climb is awesome.

Great views, ridiculous price, very well done. It goes without saying that the views from atop the bridge are amazing. It also goes without saying that the $258 price-tag is outrageous. I must say that the company really has this operation down to a science. Every possible part of the climb is fine-tuned down to the smallest detail. From the pre-climb speech, to the donning of gear (suit, harness, hat, sunglass straps, towel, headset), to the practice climb, to the actual climb, to the photos on the bridge, to the removal of gear, to hand washing- they have everything perfected. This company is very safety conscious and I can assure you that you always feel safe. There is a harness on your belt that is always connected to a side rail on the bridge, so there is literally no way you can fall off. You are not allowed to bring anything with you on the bridge (other than sunglasses or meds), but they give you a locker to store things in. You wear a headset so you can hear the guide giving a talk on the history of the bridge while you climb. It is not strenuous at all. I was surprised to find that there were water fountains present on several parts of the bridge (~4). I can say that this climb may be difficult for tall people because several parts of the bridge that are not 'outside' (rather underneath the steel) are relatively short. I am 5'11 and I had to duck for several parts. Luckily the very short parts have styrofoam covering the steel such that even if you hit your head, it will not be so bad. They take 2 pics of you at the top with a point-and shoot camera that you can buy at the end. We bought 1 photo which cost 18.95. (needless to say you cannot bring your camera with you).While on the bridge I learned a very important fact-you can climb one of the bridge pylons (one of the two closer to 'The Rocks' neighborhood) and get a view that is about as high as the bridge for a mere 15 AUD. You heard right-you can enter the pylon on the street level, climb to the top (about 10min or less climb) and you ONLY HAVE TO PAY AUD 15. Of course they don't tell you this ahead of time. This cost is included in the bridge climb ticket if you elect to climb the bridge. We did climb the pylon the following day and found the views to be great and it was not very crowded. Thus, if you want comparable views to the harbor bridge, but don't want to spend 258 AUD, then just climb the pylon.Overall it was a cool experience, but the cost prevents me from giving it 5 stars.

Must-see (hard to miss) attraction of Sydney. Such an icon that can take your breath away. Would recommend catching the ferry between Circular Quay to Darling Harbour, this will go underneath the bridge.Bridge walk is good but overpriced.

Good hang out area!. Great place to hang out with friends, lovely views, the restaurants are very nice - must try the Lindt cafe! Hot Chocolate is a must! In the evening, there are many places to hang out! Not far from the chinese quarter - good for a night walk.

Walk over it. Climb it. Experience it.. Do yourself a favour and check out the pylon museum. Better yet do the Harbour Bridge climb its expensive but worth it. I took my 70yr old grandma and gf and they both loved it. Book the last day option and you get to see the sunset if youre lucky.

Impressive. No I didn't go on the bridge walk myself but my partner did. It's very well organised and safety is first in mind. When I knew the set up, I wasn't worried for my partner; in fact I was envious. The area around the base is quite interesting; there an art gallery, a market, and sailing boats for trips out of the harbour.

Awesome view. What an amazing bridge with great history.I didn't have the money to do the walk over the bridge which is disappointing however even going over by car or train (which I'd recommend) was amazing.It's a must see in Sydney
Just a big bridge . And nothing else. Okay, you can do the skywalk for at least 150 AU$, I think you would have a pretty nice view, but I haven't done that.

Walk across then sit back and enjoy the view. My favourite way to enjoy the bridge is walking from The Rocks, once the sun has set, via the pedestrian walkway to Kirribilli.Grab a takeaway from Stir Crazy Thai and sit in Bradfield Park under the bridge and look back on the city, Opera House, Circular Quay... Luna Park lights on your right... Sparkling boats on the water.Priceless.
Australia's Best Icon Bridge. Walk in the Circular Quay towards Sydney Observatory. Have a big park to sit and relax with awesome view of Harbour Bridge and Ferries as well.

Number 1 icon of Sydney,,, well some believe that,,, it is at least in the top 3.. Sydney harbour bridge, if you are lucky on flying into Sydney you will see the harbour first and then the bridge. It is a focal point down at the quay. You can walk across it, run across it, drive across it and even walk up to the top of it as well as sail beneath it. It is a feature during the new year eve's fire works, it has interesting stories on it's building and it's opening. A place not to miss when in Sydney.

Bridge climb is a must do.. If you are not scared of heights - the Bridge Climb is an amazing experience and while it is expensive - it is well worth the money. A walk over the Bridge to Milsons Point is also worthwhile just for the view to look back over at the Opera House.

Best climb ever!!!. We climbed the harbour bridge yesterday!!! From beginning to end staff were attentive and fun! Our guide Rhys was brilliant!!! He was informative, funny and personable... He had us laughing all the way through!The views are astounding and I would recommend this tour to anyone!!! It's simply brilliant!!!!

One of the best wonders of AUSTRALIA. If someone visits Australia without seeing the Sydney harbour bridge, then the visit is incomplete. It is an absolute must to see this iconic structure and take a photo with the bridge in the background. Do also take a ferry ride across the bridge.
Worth the time and the cost. Do the bridge walk. It's expensive but it is amazing any the story is worth it. We did the expedited tour which was great.

Amazing Views!!. A lot of people moan about the price of the official bridge climb ($250 - Sept 2015) but when you see what a professional set up they have you appreciate why. Very safety aware and they cater for everyone regardless of fitness levels. Despite being reasonably fit I could feel it in my legs when reaching the top but the views were amazing and defo worth the money. If you're visiting the city this has to be one of the trips you do. Worth the time and money and something you will never forget!

Bridge Climb is a must do when in Sydney. Hang the expense it's worth it.. We booked this for myself and the kids, unfortunately my wife had surgery lately and was unable to come. The whole climb, preparation to finish was well executed, friendly and amazing. The tour guide, Phil was personal and catered for everyone. The views were breathtaking and something we will never forget. A must do in Sydney.

Love. The Sydney Harbor Bridge was definitely one of the most breathtaking landmarks that I saw while visiting Sydney. I would definitely recommend taking a tour boat around and passing by the bridge at different times of day (especially during bright sunshine and around sunset). Being in this area will also give you great views of places like the Opera House and Darling Harbor.

Faboulous view from steps leading up to bridge - lower end of bridge going towards Sydney City.. Visited the visitor area for where you went for bridge walk. Good information to read but I was too chicken to do actual bridge walk ..if you are into heights and want to be on top of the bridge go for but not for me. We continued to walk down and there was a staircase of steps going up so follow your nose and you will be rewarded with lovely views
A landmark. An awesome experience to walk or run across the bridge from the Sydney CBD to Milsons Point. The views are spectacular.
Short stay Sydney. Beautiful bridge and you get a perfect look at it from the harbour. There is acces onto the bridge to do a walk.

Harbour Bridge Climb. My wife and I done the harbour bridge climb at night, the views were fantastic and well worth the money. My wife doesn't like heights and was, well scared stiff, our tour guide Bianca made my wife feel very safe following right behind her and talking to her. The commentary was fantastic and we stopped for pictures all the way round. Would recommend this activity to everyone, its very safe and awesome fun.

Australia's Most Iconic Bridge. Not only is it recognisable by travellers from all over the world. but this bridge has to be seen to be believed. Photographs don't do it justice. When you see it close-up, it takes your breath away. It is an amazing feat of engineering. John Bradfield, the designer, had incredible foresight to design a bridge in the 1920's that has eight lanes of traffic and can carry over 200,000 vehicles a day. The bridge is not only visually appealing, but practical and has certainly stood the test of time.
Visit this icon. Great experience! It is kind of a must see! You can walk over it, climb it (legally of course!) or sail on under it, really interesting stories and history!

Walk across the Bridge it's easy and free! (not the bridge climb). Walking and running across the Sydney Harbour Bridge is so good. Spectacular views easy to walk. We went early morning to watch the sunrise, and take photo's - so impressive! Running across and back is a short 20 minute run. Try adding Circular Quay and The Opera House for a scenic early morning run

Great Walk & Picnic. I had been to Sydney before and paid the big bucks for the commercial, escorted tour up and over the bridge via the top arch. This time we opted for the FREE do-it-yourself version and just walked across the pedestrian walkway. This was about a half hour excursion and at the other end we picked up take way fish and chips and had a picnic in a lovely park under the bridge. Got a photo of the opera house framed by the bridge supports that you don't often see. Go for it!

Harbour Bridge. Great to look at from any angle, have done the Harbour Bridge walk but wouldn't recommend it because of the price. I would recommend walking across it though and you can go up one of the smaller towers.
" UP AND OVER ". A good experience and great views from the top of the Sydney Opera House and the CBD. Must thing to do if you are in Sydney.
A bridge to see. Although we didn't walk on it or over it, it is still a sight to see. you can take a ferry under it but the view from the Opera House is still as good

Great walk spectacular views. This is one of the few things you can do in Sydney that won't cost a cent. Start your walk at the Opera House end of Circular Quay. Take the lift up and turn right and start walking. The view is lovely and the walk is easy. If you want to pay a small fee you can walk up the 200 steps for the pylon view. The ferries, the tall ships and the yachts on the harbour all add to the colour and movement.

Fantastic view and climb, but no pictures. My wife and I did the express climb. The staff provided jump suits and were very helpful with getting all the gear on. It was a little bit weird having to take a breathalizer before the climb. Even the children had to do it. They provided radios so that we could hear the guide while we made the climb. There was also a strap with an attachment that you dragged along the tour so that you were always attached and safe. We had a perfect day. There was a gentle breeze and lots of sun. The climb was not physically intensive and anyone that can walk a decent way can make the climb. The only reason that I gave it a three star and not a five star is the fact you can not take anything with you. They made me remove my fitbit and would not let me take my GoPro. It is a bit of a downer to know that they do it just so you have to buy photos at the end. They charge a lot just to go on the climb and then nickel and dime you by charging at least $20 for a single photo at the end.
Best walk to remember. Best walk to remember , this walk gives great feeling to watch opera house & backwater. Its fantastic experience to have.

Awesome Bridge Climb. Don't let the seemingly long climb deter you. The actual climb is a lot less than the 3.5 hours due to the detailed prep work that took almost an hour. There are waiting times while doing the 8 sets of vertical ladders & more waiting on the upper arc of the bridge, stopping for photo shoots or for the previous group to continue ascending or descending. It is an easy climb & not even for once we felt we were that high above the sea! And even when we looked down, it wasn't scary either. Definitely a very very doable climb. The view is awesome at the summit. We applied some muscle rub after the climb & the next day saw minimal muscle aches. Go for it if this is what you want to do.

If you haven't climbed it you have a lot left to do. Though one may worry whether this could at all be risky...Not at all. It's extremely safe, you are well harnessed and after the climb me and my wife realized it was actually quite kid friendly. Even if you are scared of heights it's quite easy to handle and even looking down (at an angle never feels frightening). A must try experience.
Pylon exhibition worth the time. We went to the pylon lookout (beautiful sight) and took the time (1h) to read about the bridge's construction and its history. Definitely worth the entrance fee.
It was a pricey tour. If you want to get a great views of Sydney get on top of this bridge. It is little bit pricey but it is worth of experience.

Sydney Harbour Bridge climb. We did the evening climb in November. The preparation leading up to the climb itself was very Indepth if not a little drawn out, well maybe a lot! From the health. Heck sheets, to the fitting of protection wear, to the safety demonstration and the practice, that took up almost as much time as the walk itself.The walk was on the whole fabulous, to see the beautiful lights of the city and beyond was spectacular. Just be prepared for the numerous "photo ops" that the guides take, just a money spinner at the end when you get to buy them. We just opted for the complimentary group pic as our memento.
Hotwheels!. Nice place to move in Sydney, high speed and sensations offered ^^That's a very nice place, you can go anywhere from there, I enjoyed.

The old coat hanger. Did the bridge climb in March, it is a must do on the bucket list, even if you're afraid of heights it is so safe and well organized you don't realize how high up you are. Don't miss it.

A must-see and must-cross. Not only an icon of Sydney but also the way connecting the south with the north. You can cross it by train, by car or even by walk. The bridge well deserves the 15 minutes walk to cross it. From it you will cross from North Sydney to the Rocks or viceverse, with a beautiful view of the Opera and the bay. There is also an option to climb it for about 150 Aud which is rather expensive, considering it only costs about 20 Audi from one of the two towers of the bridge or you can stilt enjoy a marvellous free view by crossing it by foot. The only disadvantage if you are crossing it by car is the almost daily traffic jams.

A real engineering landmark. Engineering accomplishment that is 80+ years old. The bridge dominates the Circular Quay and North Sydney views. Local people seem to have a story about the bridge they like to tell.You can walk across the bridge to the north side along the roadway sidewalk. The west side has a rail and bike path. You could do the paid bridge walk as well but the roaday can be accessed anytime.

Walk the bridge. I walked over the bridge one day from North Sydney into town, took a some time but well worth the effort. Took some amazing photo's. When I was finished it was time for a few beers in The Rocks.

Sydney's biggest icon. it's all ways great to walk over the harbour bridge or catch the train across the views are amazing and if your a thrill sealer get up and do the bridge climb just make sure your not afraid of heights and enjoy the views back into the city or neutral bay or Neilson point

Sdyney Harbour Bridge. The Sdyney Harbour Bridge over look the beautiful Opera House & its coastal area around Circular Quay. We took photos around the bridge as background. With slight dizzy, we manage to capture rainbowl over this beautiful bridge.It you have the time, stamina & will to fork out to climb the bridge , it would have a wonderful view of the harbour front. It can be reached by free shuttle bus No. 555 or by train from Central station or Town Hall.

Amazing!. Although it's quite expensive is is well worth going up the bridge! You get spectacular views and great memories from climbing up there. The whole experience takes around 3 hours and you have a tour guide with you the whole time who are filled up with cool facts about the bridge!

Check out the museum and lookout in the southern pylon!. A must do when in Sydney.Tip - Rather than spend a fortune on a bridge climb, you can enter the museum inside the southern pylon and climb to the top for a look out and a view over Circular Quay. It only costs a few dollars compared to the real climb experience.
Sydney Harbour Bridge. Went on bridge several times, but best was on Australia day when you could look down on the "yacht waltz" and all the other maritime activities.

Sydney Harbour Bridge Famous Landmark at Sydney. Harbour Bridge is a Famous Landmark at Sydney. Is a must to take picture while you are here. This Harbour Bridge we can do Climb here, it's an optional things to do if you are brave enough. This is a venue that usually be a landmark to do New Year Celebration to put all the Fireworks. This Bridge connect The CBD Area and Old Part of Sydney.
View. You needs to have few hours to go on the top of Harbour bridge , it s really very expensive but it s worth the view ...

Riveting Birds Eye View. With a mixture of anticipation, trepidation and excitement, I approached the Bridge climb. My main concerns were how strenuous would it be, would I be too warm or too cold and would I suddenly develop a fear of heights? I needn’t have worried. The whole experience takes about three hours but the actual time on the bridge is much less and the actual time spent in “climbing” is less again. There’s lots of time to admire the views, listen to the informed commentary and to have the inevitable photos taken by your tour guide (personal cameras not allowed). The experience was exhilarating and a real sense of achievement. The day I climbed it, the sky was overcast and the temperature perfect i.e.not too hot but even it had been, there’s water fountains at various intervals and a cooling mist spray at the top. I loved being at the top, feeling the wind in my face and looking over to the iconic Opera House. Only disappointment was the poor quality of the commemorative “free” photograph. A few seconds of editing could have brightened this and provided a more memorable souvenir. But I do have the hat! Would definitely recommend it.

Scary but great!. My partner and I decided we couldn't visit Sydney without attempting the the full bridge climb. It takes around 3 hours + from start to finish. The tour and climb are timed to military precision and is extremely well organised. Our guide Peter was amazingly friendly, very informative, knowledgable, charming and amusing at times. The climb itself scared the life out of us to say the least and we were shaking a lot of the way through it! Our legs very often turned to jelly! But the thrill of completing the climb is very much worth the cost and the fear! The views of the summit are amazing! You are well looked after and supported the whole time. Great photo opportunities at several points. You are not allowed cameras up there but your guide will take some great photos of you and your friends and tour group to purchase after.It was the most scariest yet thrilling experience! I would highly recommend pushing yourself to complete this bridge climb - you really won't regret it or forget it - thanks to all the staff at the bridge climb who are very professional and friendly.
Wow. Another popular landmark of Sydney. Go and get a chance to climb over - it's very pricey but I didn't do it due to personal commitments. It's fab in the evenings too.

An internationally recognised Sydney icon. Being a proud Sydneysider it always a pleasure to take a ferry into Circular Quay and take a trip under the Harbour Bridge, either day or night. A centrepiece of the harbour it provides brilliant backdrops to any photo.
Harbour Bridge climb. Loved it, loved it, not as difficult as I thought. Magnificent views and a very informative tour guide. Do not have to be super fit to do this.
Great walk. Good views. Can be difficult to find the entrance up to the bridge path. Pay attention for signage when walking down George st.

Vertigo. My husband, who shows odd signs which cause concern, climbed the bridge. If you stand under the bridge you'll see how ridiculously high it is. Do not do this if you hate heights. You get the it's as safe as crossing the road thing. Do not be sucked in. At the end my husband was like a little kid however. Oh and don't buy a picture of yourself in a blue helmet. No one looks good in them.

My bucket list ticked off. A must for everyone who has the money and time to do this climb, would highly recommend wearing comfortable hiking shoes or any shoes with good grip...mild fitness required... The view is spectacular, so save some money and don't miss this when visiting Sydney!

Great view of the harbour below and the cityscape. There are a few great things about the Sydney Harbour Bridge.The best of them is that you can walk across it and get a fantastic view of the harbour below and all around, as well as a view of the city buildings and North Sydney. It's a good walk to do on your day off especially on a sunny day.The other lovely thing about the bridge is the design which is quite impressive.Thirdly, if you catch the train across the bridge ensure you sit on the upper level of the train where you can get a view of the harbour below. It's a great start to the day.
must see!. One of the most recognizable bridges all over the world. Really nice specially during christmas time. Worth to take a walk or climb up.
Breathtaking views. Well this is exactly what you expect from seeing it on the TV but still stunning and a great place to view the harbour from

"Coat Hanger" walk a must do. Take a slow walk across the Sydney Harbour Bridge to enjoy brilliant views of the harbour. You can walk from Circular Quay through to The Rocks to get to the bridge. This is a walk best enjoyed when the weather is great and skies are clear. Views are simply breathtaking!

Alternative Harbour Brigde experience. Walked along the Cahill Walk to the first pylon. Cheap entry at $13 and a magic view at the top. No need to do the bridge climb, just do this and you can take the littlies.

A must when in town. Just over 2.1km to walk from one end to the other and back. Each side has a train station nearby surrounded by quaint bars and restaurants. I make this part of my weekly run. Great views of the entire bay
Bridge Climb a must!. Got to do the bridge climb if you're coming to Sydney. It's fantastic, breath taking and the harbour view is so much better from up there.

Walk across the bridge. We took the train across the bridge - $8 AUD for 2 people - sit on the top compartment of the train on the right hand side you will get a better view - have a coffee/something at the local cafes and then walk back across the bridge on the left hand side - great views of the harbour and Sydney Opera House - watch out for people running!! It does not take too long to get across to the other side and back in to Circular Quay.

Bridge Climb. I would recommend a Bridge Climb to everyone who is visiting Sydney. The organisers are very professional in the way they give instructions and safety procedures. There are a number of tours available but I took the 3.5 hour one which is more leisurely. Anyone who can comfortably walk around for a few hours could do it. Nothing strenuous. You can't take any personal belongings on the tour as everything needed is supplied. A group photo is included in the package but there is an opportunity to purchase individual photos and a video. It really is a must do.

Stunning!. The bridge and the Opera House definitely dominate the Sydney Harbour and are by far the main reason why the Harbour is...what it is! We spent so much time there just starring at both the Opera House and the Bridge and could not get enough.The bridge has such a flair to it and the walk across offered us spectacular views of the Opera House and the Harbour. I particularly loved the bridge at night as it lights up the whole Harbour and stands tall in the middle of it. I cant wait to go back once more and enjoy that magnificent structure!

Take a walk (or a ride) across the Coathanger (Sydney Harbour Bridge). The Sydney Harbour Bridge, with the Sydney Opera House, are icons of Sydney. Whilst the Bridge is the main roadway between Sydney CBD and North Sydney, it also has walkways on the East & West sides. You can also ride a pushbike on the Western walkway. If you want a great view of Sydney Harbour, Circular Quay and the opera House, take a stroll across the Eastern walkway.
Hike the bridge.. Another wow for Sydney. Great walk great boat tour great food All around an amazing place to visit. Loved it

A must defiantly a must thing to do in Sydney. We booked the express climb which took about 2 1/2 hrs, its a more interesting climb as you go through the middle part first which you get to see more of how the bridge was built and the views are different, then you start to climb gently to the top and come back down the opposite side, fabulous day out something I knew I would do on our Australian visit, and was not disappointed at all, our guide was so helpful and very knowledgeable and made it fun as well, you are all perfectly safe you are fully kitted out with clothing etc, the only draw back was you are not allowed to take your own camera, you can purchase the photos your guide takes after the experience, (extra cost), the cost of the climb is so worth the money. If your ever in Sydney please do it your won't be sorry at all, what an awesome experience and the memory will live on to

Wow!. We just had to walk the bridge. We cruised under it almost daily during our two weeks in Sydney and then walked it on our last day. The views were great and the structure of the bridge is to be applauded. From below you see this iconic landmark and watch in awe as people climb to the top but when you get up there you suddenly realise that this is a serious working bridge with a relentless flow of traffic. if you are in Sydney you MUST walk the bridge. My friend did regret not actually doing the bridge climb but it is expensive....maybe next time!
Awesome. The bridge is awesome. Every visitor should walk across it. If you cycle ypu must use the west side as it is dedicated for cyclists.

Go see the Coathanger. I've lived in Sydney for many years and the sight of The Bridge always stirs the heart! I have walked across it many times, and recommend it for every visitor to the city. It is a great way to see the harbour and enjoy views of both the CBD and North Sydney.

Wonder of Sydney!. A Wonder of Sydney! It's a landmark you wouldn't want to miss. Take a walk down the contemporary passage of The Rock and you will get a good panoramic view of the bridge. If you have the extra time then take a tour by climbing up to the bridge and take a bird eye's view of the city.

Magnificent. This bridge is the heart and soul of Sydney. Every time you see it or cross over it you have to take time and take in the magnificent structure. A must see attraction while visiting Sydney. The cheap way to see it is to get a train to Circular Quay and you cross over the bridge see the bridge from the bottom up once you get off the train and walk to Circular Quay.. The expensive way to see it up close is to do the Bridge climb. This is a fantastic way to get a great view of Sydney from the top of the Bridge. You can also walk the length of the bridge.

Awesome. I was unsure as whether I would be able to achieve the climb but with help of the guide and the other people in the group it was worth it. Steve, our guide, was great, had good knowledge of the bridge and surrounding area and made the climb very humourous too. If anyone is considering doing the climb do not hesitate you won't regret it. Awesome views. AWESOME!!!!!!!!!!

Walking on the bridge. It's not a very old Bridge, but it is imposing and elegant at the same time. If you cross the river on foot, you will have the chance to see the harbour below and the sky above. Inhale the breeze and let your imagination fly.

A beautiful, iconic bridge in the best city in the world. I've had the pleasure of climbing this bridge, running, cycling and driving across it as well as riding my motorcycle across it. I never fail to be awed by this magnificent structure. Doing the bridge climb is fantastic, but many people don't realise the south pylon can be climbed also. This climb also provides a wonderful history of the bridge along with photos.
wow. Who knew bridges could be so beautiful. Whether you are standing below it, opposite it, waling or driving over it or even climbing it - it is spectacular,
Iconic Views Across the Harbour. Great to stroll across view the harbour. The bridge climb is costly but worth it if you can afford it. If not, just enjoy the surrounds and views.

A great climb!. Excitement mounts as soon as you put on the jumpsuit and get ready to climb. I was a bit nervous crossing the grid on the way to the first ladder but after that no worries. The climb was easy and the view magnificent. Will definitely climb again at sunset.
Sydney's memorable experience.. Climbing on the top is one of my most memorable time ever had.It is absolutely safe and also spectacular.Total Sydney view.I would do it again.

Do the Climb!. We've been to the Bridge twice now, and you can't miss it. The Bridge Climb is an experience of a lifetime (if you can afford it), but even without climbing it, it's a beautiful sight from all over the city. Our favorite shot is with the Opera House right in front of it from either the pier or Mrs. Macquarie's Chair.

Sydney Icon. to take the walk across the bridge , always best to start at the Milsons Point end as the view towards the city , Opera House is best walking from there .Then spend some time around the Rocks , have a drink something to eat and walk backWe have taken friends and family on several occasions and each time is goodThe view changes the boats on the harbour everything is different Well worth doing and even better for such a icon it is free

Just walk across - it's free!. If you want to walk across the bridge but don't fancy the high cost of the bridge climb you can do it for free. There's a pedestrian walkway across the deck of the bridge and the views are just as good as those from the top. The bridge walkway is signposted from The Rocks. There are a few steps so this is not a great option for travellers with mobility problems or prams.

Historic structure. Well it is standing tall from years and still in this modern world this historic bridge is having its own place. A view from far away will give you a feel of this gigantic structure. A walk on this long bridge will give close look. And if you want more adventure, just go for Bridge walk till top of the bridge edge, you will not regret it for sure. Lots of other stuff around to have great fun with family and friends.

Iconic and Fabulous. I have seen some similar build bridges in other parts of the world(photos) but they cannot compare to the beauty and strength of the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Its history bringing the two sides of the city together and the great views of the harbour, the city, the fore shore, the Opera House, the ferries scooting along and the occassional Ocean Liner. Its only about a kilometer across to walk and there is pedestrian access too. Its a lovely walk straight out of the rocks and not far from Circular quay so easy to access. I use the stair access but if cars can get there there must be wheel chair entry a little further down the road. This is Not the bridge Climb. This is an amble for anyone and FREE.

Crossing everyday. I live on the south and work at the north. The bridge is my fixed route everyday. But I never get tired of the place. It is the true spirit of Sydney. Doesn't matter if you simply cross it or climb it. It is one of the most beautiful place on earth.
Awesome Views. We love taking photos of the bridge from different angles. One day we are going to do the walk over the bridge as i think the sites would be amazing.

A very special experience. My wonderful staff gave me a gift voucher for two people to experience a Bridge Climb. I was a little anxious as I smiled sweetly and thanked them all very much. But, nothing ventured, nothing gained. It was a very special experience. The team at Bridge Climb are all very well trained and once you arrive you get the feeling that these people really know what they are doing. Firstly you are shown into a room where you remove extra clothing like jackets, bags etc, and lock them into lockers. You are given a cover-all jump suit to put on over your clothes. This makes sure that nothing flaps around up there if it is windy, and protects your clothing. Then you are given information about what the process will be, and taken into a training room, which simulates the climb, including practice climbing the ladders, steps and general information on how you are connected to the Bridge at all times by a very strong clip. Depending on the time of day (there are climbs all through the day and night) you may be given a headlamp too! Then, when everyone feels safe and ready to climb you are led out to begin. It is so exhilarating! You feel extremely safe at all times, but nonetheless, you are climbing an amazing iconic bridge and it is hard to keep the smile from your face. My husband and I were surprised at how easy this climb was. The walkway up to the top of the bridge does not seem steep at all, and is quite wide. You are secure at all times and always in the company of your guide. The guide will boggle your mind with information about what you are seeing, what you are doing, but one thing that stuck with both of us, was that we felt unhurried and as if we had a lot of time to spend up here on the top of the world. We were given plenty of time to soak up the view from the top, and then laughed and exclaimed our way back down to our lockers where we shed our outfits and prepared to go home. A very professional and worthwhile few hours.

Must do . I was never going to do the clime , but one day my overseas friend asked me to come with her not to clime just do things after she had finished but she asked me to bring my comfy shoes . Her clone was for 9.20 am so she booked us in for 9.30 as there was two spots . Let me tell you it was the best day ever . Must do for every visitor or Australian citizen definite bucket list

Great FREE walk over.. Walked across the Sydney Harbour Bridge on the pedestrian path from The Rocks to Milsons Point. It's an easy walk with some great views over the harbour, Sydney CBD skyline, Circular Quay and The Sydney Opera House. There are a few flights of stairs to go from street level up to the pedestrian path so bear that in mind if planning this walk with young children or the elderly.

What a view from the top. A must do for anyone visiting Sydney. The climb is a gentle stroll up this beautiful piece of engineering and the stories on the way up make for a very interesting history. Our guide was fantastic, and the photos will remind us of our trip for years to come. Not cheap, but well worth it !

Walk it, Climb it, drive or train it or simply view. A Sydney icon along with The Opera House. You can get a great view from the Pylon good value or you can do The Bridge Climb beat at Sunset or Sunrise (expensive by comparison). It's a lovely walk too on a sunny day. You can view it from the walk to the Opera House or on a pleasant Manly Ferry trip. I travel across it by car twice a week rather than use the tunnel.

Sydney's iconic bridge. This is where the best fireworks are held on New Years Eve. This is where you can walk to the top on a Harbour bridge guided tour and see all of Sydney. You can also walk across the bridge. This is Sydney's iconic bridge. Just don't drive across if you are in a hurry. Loads of traffic, especially in peak hour after work.

walking the bridge. walked over the bridge and back.Loved it although I am scared of heights..... there's a viewing point in one of the towers (pay) Had a look at Lunar park and loved the pool.... Great views from the bridge, plenty to look at.I also noticed a couple of security guards ......ps there's a train station if you do not want to walk back

If not up for an expensive bridge climb. The best way to see and experience the Sydney Harbour Bridge start your journey with a trip on a train from Wynyard station in George Street.Alight at North Sydney station take the blue street exit and head east toward the eastern side walkway of the bridge.Talk the stairs to enjoy the walk across the bridge with the best views of the harbour and city.Have fun and finish up in the historic Rocks area of Sydney.
pretty view !. beautiful !! view of opera house from top is gorgeous. we walked on the bridge which is about a mile and a half one way . one of the landmarks you dont want to miss if visiting sydney.
A Must Do Iconic Walk in 20mins. Walk across one of the worlds most recognised landmarks with incredible views. Take pics of the Opera House & City scape!

Breath Taking. Both in appearance the adventure and the views of beautiful Sydney the bridge experience is one you shouldnt miss whilst holidaying in Sydney. Sydneysiders and tourists were amongst our group who ventured up for a twilight climb that was absolutelty stunnuing.

Love this City only for a few days not long stay.... This Iconic Bridge built by the Brirish. I remember in 1964 the Aussies complaining about it saying that it was expensive & generally knocking the British for it's existence. Different today if you ask about it however it together with the Opera house, Circular Quay (Key for US), and surrounding areas including Darling Harbour is well worth a visit. Sydney again is a very walk able City.

My favourite Sydney site. Like most Sydneysiders the Sydney Harbour Bridge is a wonderful icon of Australia. I just love crossing the bridge by any means. Walking on the eastern side gives a fantastic view of the Harbour and Opera House. You can go up the pylon for $13 for a even better view. Catching the train always makes the journey better and crossing by car, when not stuck in traffic, is great too. However to complete your crossing you should take your bike on the western walkway. Great views of the western harbour and Luna Park. Yes I love the bridge.Wandering around the base of the bridge is easy if you pick your times and again has great views. I suggest going to Milson's point after 7PM as the area is quiet and usually easy to park at.If you have the cash then the Bridge Walk is fun, but expensive.Blackmores Running Festival and Spring Cycle are other ways to cross the bridge as well as Seven Bridges Walk.

Splendid. you can either walk across the harbour bridge which is free, or you can catch a train from wynyard to milsons point which also cross the harbour birdge where you can have a splendid view of the sydney harbour

A brilliant view. Rather than just simply view the bridge from the Opera House, or by ferry, which, by the way, is amazing, do the Bridgewalk. It's a stunning view for the top of one of the world's best skylines.

Bridge Climb . It is one of the greatest structures and is without doubt a huge tourist attraction but the best part is the view from the top of the bridge once you do the bridge climb. Being one of the people who has actually done this, I would really recommend it as it surely is once in a lifetime experience especially for people who are not adrenaline junkies or great athletics as the whole climb is well paced out and extremely carefully organised with utmost care for wellbeing of climbers. Definitely need to try. Especially for special occasions or a memory with family or friends :) Thanks for reading Cheers

Magnificent . I never thought a bridge could make me go wow. This one really impressed me. Right in the heart of Sydney is this most amazing bridge. It is so well constructed and is a real Australian icon. I crossed it twice because I took a wrong turn. Glad I did because I got to see it close up. 5 stars for this one

You can walk the bridge for free. Like many other Sydneysiders, I walk the bridge daily. If you plan to visit the great city of Sydney, a walk across the bridge is a must. While you can do the Bridge Climb across the top of the arch for a fee, you can walk across the platform for nothing. Entry onto the platform on the Sydney side is via the steps to the east, near the Rocks, which is an easy walk from Circular Quay. On the northern side, the steps are near Milsons Point railway station. On that side, you can go under the bridge to Luna Park to the west and take a leisurely stroll along the harbour foreshore to Wendy's Garden, another close by landmark. There are many cafes and restaurants nearby on both sides.The walk across the bridge will give you many photo opportunities, particularly of the Opera House, Fort Dennison and the Quay with constant boat and ship activity.
Aussie Vacation. Beautiful bridge from a distance, its amazing seeing visitors and residents walking the top of the bridge throughout the day and evening.

The jewel in the crown. The other half of the jewel that is Sydney harbor. ,You can walk over it, under it, around it, and even climb it. You can drive over it, take a train or a bus over it. Or just have a coffee and gaze at it. Truly a spectacle.

A national icon.. What can one say? It's a sight to behold - day or night. Great that the Bridge and the Opera House are so close to each other. Truly the top two icons of Australia. If you don't want to climb the bridge at least do the pylon. Great views from the top.

The Coathanger: Sydney Icon. The Sydney Harbour Bridge , which took 8 years to construct, was completed in 1932. There is a famous story about how a disgruntled army cavalier, De-Groot, high-jacked the opening ceremony by riding in and cutting the ribbon as a protest, before being carted off to a mental asylum.The Bridge is the worlds tallest single span steel bridge, and sixth longest, and connects Millers Point to the south and Milsons Point to the north. This bridge was inspired by New York's Hell's Gate Bridge.The Bridge has made its global fame by being the launching point of Sydney's famous New Year's Eve fireworks. You can walk over the bridge, and sometimes it is closed down on special occasions for people to walk on the roadways. A fun thing that people like to do is the climb to the top of the bridge. This is safe and well guided.A favourite vantage point for photographs is lady Macquarie's Chair near Sydney's Art Gallery. This vantage point lets the photographer include both the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge in the same shot.
Long walk good exercise. Long walk good exercise while enjoy the scenes. Me and my friend went on the route at almost sunset and walk till completely dark. You can enjoy the breeze

Many ways to see this iconic bridge . Jump on a ferry and travel beneath it. Sit at Opera Bar as the sun goes down and watch the sun set as your view the bridge. Climb it with Bridge Climb if you are feeling energetic. Or, walk across it and visit Luna Park on the North Side. Hire a water plane from Rose Bay and fly over it. Or walk underneath it near The Rocks. Which ever way you decide to see it, you won't be disappointed.

Climbing it is a must in Sydney. Climbing it is an amazing experience. Not just because of the view but also because of the interesting insights you get about such an amazing worldly known monument. I did it at 5am so I got to see the view in both day and night time. It is expensive but highly recommended.
A great way to start the day. Walk or jog over the bridge on a sunny weekend morning, the best start to a day. such a great way to look at the city and harbour.
Take the Bridge Climb at dusk on a weekday evening. The Bridge Climb is awesome ... especially at dusk on a weekday as the lights continue on in the buildings ... quite a magical sight.

what a view. It was a great experience. It is not cheap but it was an experience of a lifetime. .my son is disabled so not the experience for him but he loved the pylon an excellent opportunity to gain the view with the opportunity for photos which we all enjoyed as the bridge has no opportunity for your own photos.only to purchase there expensive or posed one's

no sighs at this bridge........ Another wonder which left us awestruck at the sheer size of this structure as you walk under it, you can buy a ticket to walk over it if your brave enough all safety equipment is provided I'm not keen on heights so gave it a miss, but there are markets and places to eat in the shadow of the Bridge, wonderful experience Sidney is just awesome

Spectacular. Fantastic sight from the Opera a House and Circular Quay - and also many other places, you can do bridge climbs bur I am happier with my feet on the ground so did not participate with the Bridge Climb although we did see some doing the climb.

A Sydney Icon Right Next to the Opera House. Referred to as the Iron Coat Hanger, we have sailed under it twice in the past 4 months. Departing Sydney in May we were fortunate to experience the Vivid display, where the bridge is lit with all sort of coloured lights. A simply amazing display.On return to Sydney, we again passed under the bridge, no Vivid display this time, but still impressive. Definitely planning to walk the bridge during our next visit to Sydney.

Excellent morning walk!. My wife and I woke up early to catch the sunrise. We walked from The Rocks and headed north. Lots of great photos, spectacular views of the Harbour and the opera house along with the Sydney skyline. We enjoyed the walk around the Kirribilli neighborhood and found a nice spot for breakfast.

The Iron Coat Hanger. The landmark that must be seen in person. If you like structures like bridges, you must see the Harbour Bridge in person and you must climb this bridge. What a great icon - the iron coat hanger.

Walk along the Bridge.
