This walk itself if you really know should start at milson point in the morning you see people jogging cross the bridge.it have one of the best view in Sydney you can see the opera house from the bridge while walking is safe even in the night patrol is around 24 7 round the clock that is how the Australia is safe beautiful nice place to go enjoy the view remember to take the walk both the night and daytime you will find it very different I promise you that. Also is free walk but do check around on the net some online group do organize to tour around and pay only as a donation out of good will.

Don't be scared - JUST DO IT!! One of the best things I've ever done... I am THE biggest chicken in the world and get woozy standing on a chair to change a light bulb, but never once felt scared or unsafe on this climb! I had been sick for a couple of weeks before and was still unwell when we went, so was concerned I would be able to manage the climb, but it is not strenuous at tall. Anyone could do it! Our guide, Helen, was absolutely fantastic. She has a great sense of humour and is also helpful if you feel that you might be frightened on the climb. She puts you at ease with her banter and informative chatting the whole time. I would recommend this to EVERYONE! We were even standing around chatting on the top of the Bridge and I didn't feel scared for an instant. The views are to die for. We did the Twilight climb which I would also recommend because we got to see it all in the daylight, and then witnessed a magnificent sunset and watched the city light up, and were privileged to a full moon in a gorgeous pinky mauve sky....Just divine!!

Awesome experience. We went up the bridge very early in the day. You get changed into a suit, have a quick induction then get trekking up the bridge. The views are outstanding and the guide is really informative.
Best present ever. Bridge climbing for my birthday. Awesome and will never forget. The guide was friendly and I have so much fun

One of the iconic sites of Sydney. Walked across the bridge for free, which takes about 30 minutes. It provides a nice viewpoint of the harbor. Did not do the bridgewalk to the top, which was quite expensive at >$200. As a bridge, it seems very sturdy and dull; it is nicknamed the "coathanger" by Syndeysiders. But it is an iconic site of Sydney and a must do for tourist. Tip: Prices in North Sydney ( after crossing the bridge) seem lower.
BridgeClimb. Went for BridgeClimb. Really an experience of a lifetime! The view from above is fantastic and beyond words! A must-do in Sydney for sure!!

lovely walk. walk on the other side of the bridge was a good experience .we went over the bridge to the other side which was so beautiful and had so many cafes and places to sit there and enjoy a meal.so many pictures to take from all angles of the bridge and opera house and the luna park.we took the ferry back
Never dissapointed. Always a great site! Never leave Sydney without walking/riding/driving this beauty, the view is just stunning!

Another must see Sydney Icon. Wonderful view either from the shore or cruise. Had great views while cruising under the bridge. Did not get a chance to visit at night though. Something for a future visit

Great architecture to look at from a distance, and great view of Sydney once you are on it.. The world famous Sydney Harbour Bridge looks so amazing when viewed from a distance. A great work of architecture that has dominated Sydney's skyline since 1932. Love it. It does look a grey and a bit ugly once you get too close to it though. I walked across the bridge and the view from the bridge was so spectacular, but the bridge itself look grey and boring when you are up close and on it.
An impressive structure. It's a great looking bridge and has an interesting history. Haven't done the climb but have heard inly great things about it

Fantastic. Booked the bridge climb from the UK and it didn't disappoint. Children did the climb in a small group of 5 which made for a more enjoyable experience. During the climb the instructor shared information not only about the bridge but also about the Harbour and Sydney itself. The children loved it. During their climb I went up to the observation point which again provided lots of info regarding the building of the bridge. Although there are lots of stairs to climb the view from up top was amazing.
It really is just an ordinary bridge. This is an average size bridge linking 2 sides of Sydney. Apparently, Syney-siders refer to it as "The Coathanger". Go see but you will not be amazed

Worth the climb. A friend and I did the climb in a small group of 3 which was nice. It's a great couple of hours and find out lots of info about the bridge and Sydney itself. It's a little bit expensive and you can't take your own camera but still worth doing for the views.

Been there, see that with your eyes. One of the must see place when visit sydney. Go together when u are visiting the opera house. Good place to take photos. You can try to climb the harbour bridge (:

Glamour City !!. Glamour City!!! Shining! Glitsy! Glorious... all that kind of stuff! What an amazing creation ... I would not live anywhere else in the world! And YOU should not either! Come and see this beautiful city befor it is sold out!
Interesting Bridge with interesting lookout. From the bridge, You could see the Opera House, The River, the docks/pier's, the parks also the skyline of Sydney.
Photogenic structure. Located from easy walk from rocks. Offer a best viewing point of the harbour. With the Opera House adjustent to it makes Sydney a very desirable place to visit and to live.
The Bridge Climb - A must do. Mammoth and monumental. Do the bridge climb. It is an awesome experience. The guides are very friendly and very attentive

Highlight of Sydney. Great way to spend 4 or 5 hours in Sydney. You change into overalls and are lead up the bridge to the midpoint where you cross to the other side with all the traffic visible below you. Then you return back to the starting point. All the time you are latched on to the bridge for safety. I timed it for sunset and it was great.

Once in the lifetime experience.. We climbed to the top and it was amazing, the view of the harbour, the history of the Sydney bridge, everything was great!The company is very professional, they will educate and instruct every climber properly before the tour, you will need to change into the suit and put on the equipment, so I would suggest to go with shorts and casual outfit with a pair of comfortable walking shoes (no flip-flops or sandals) The whole tour is about 1.5 - 2 hours, including the preview and preparation. Your bags, accessories, everything will be stored in the lockers including cameras. They will take photos for you in 3 different spots on the bridge and you can purchase them after the tour. The tour is quite safe and fun, the climbing is not very tiring or difficult so I think as long as you can walk and is not afraid of height, every age group could go.I'm glad that I went and I enjoyed a lot!

A must do if visiting Sydney, great views & interesting. Fantastic experience, very interesting, learnt lots, teens also enjoyed the whole experience. A must do if visiting Sydney. Twilight time slot was great was still daylight going up, but night views coming down.

An amazing British designed icon.. One of the world's most iconic structures, but imagine my British delight to discover it was designed by an English engineering company based in Middlesborough, as an expanded version of the bridge in Newcastle (UK). Like many I had hoped to take the escorted view across the bridge, but at almost AUS$200 each I thought that was a rip-off. Instead, for around AUS$10 we climbed up one of the towers and got an even more amazing view as it is much higher at its summit. There's also a small interesting exhibition illustrating the history of the bridge and its construction. Walking over the bridge as a normal pedestrian, we took in the delights of the 1950's style NY Coney Island funfair and awesome views across the bay, especially at night when all the skyscrapers are lit up.

Iconic attraction with some of the best views in Sydney. the harbour bridge is one of Sydney's most iconic attractions and links the two sides of the harbour. It's a pleasant walk over the bridge (excluding the stairs) which will give you great views over the city, harbour, opera house and Luna Park. It's about a 15 minute walk.
Amazing. A great icon and an amazing construction. Worth seeing and driving or walking across. A definite must see.
Spectacular!. Of course this bridge is assume. Great to sail under and also go to the lookout which is 200 stairs up!
Gorgeous!. This is such a beautiful bridge, I just loved it. And there are a lot of different spots in the city , where you can see the bridge from many angles!

Just walked the free pedestrian access. I didnt climb the bridge but walked across the length of the bridge - great views. Make sure you wear comfy shoes as it is a reasonably long walk - but worth it provided the weather isnt too cold.
Wish I climbed. The bridge is the highlight of the harbour in all its glory my only regret is not doing the bridge climb but still great to go and see! Highly recommend
One of the free things in Sydney.. Walk on the pedestrian path and enjoy the harbour. Much more fun than just looking. You can go right over the Cahill.
There and back. From ;The Rocks. go up Argyll Steps to get on the public walk way across the bridge. Easy level. though crowded stroll across the harbour. Good views and lots of photo opportunities.
sydney icon. You should not miss the harbour bridge climb. Its a great exciting experience. go for sunset timings.

Poor man's Bridge Walk. A bit of history first. The Sydney harbour bridge was built during the "Great Depression" and gave many Australian families sustenance during a period of worldwide deprivation. It was finished in 1932 and at that time (and possibly still may be) was the world's larges single span bridge. A very popular, though not cheap, tourist attraction is the "Bridge Walk" over the top of the bridge, affording, I imagine, spectacular views of the most beautiful harbour in the world. Advance bookings are required and some popular tour times are very difficult to arrange and poor weather can disrupt best laid plans. For those of us with limited financial resources there is an alternative and it's FREE. Albeit not as spectacular, but available, without pre-booking, 24/7. There is a delightful walkway on the east side of the bridge. Furthermore, unlike the "Bridge climb" which, due to safety requirements precludes using cameras, you can snap to your hearts content iconic harbour features such as, the Opera house, Fort Denison, The Rocks and Sydney Skyline. Add a telephoto lens and the entire harbour is there. You can walk either way, City to Milsons Point, or catch a train to Milsons Point and walk back to Sydney (or catch a ferry if you're fit and don't mind an uphill walk from the jetty to the bridge or do the less tiring reverse trip). I've enjoyed this walk many times and never fail to finish with a smile on my dial.

biking across. We went on a bike tour around Sydney and one part of it went right over the Harbour Bridge. One side is dedicated to pedestrians and the other is for bicycles. There's an amazing view of the harbor from the bicycle lane or the pedestrian lane. You can climb the bridge for a price or you can also take an elevator up to a certain point as well.

The Bridge You Can Talk About for Hours. We were curious enough to avail of the Bridge Climb, but we were not sure if we were brave enough. The trek started in one of the bridge tower and from there our guide would tell more than two hours of stories about the harbour bridge. Ive never seen a bridge with so many stories in its history.The trek was really wonderful and the views around was really fantastic. The walk was slow and safe (many safety features). The stories along the way made the climb even more interesting. Curiously, there were many drinking fountains along the catwalk. By the time you're halfway through, you'll definitely want to try to take a drink. I guess the most thrilling part is when you have to climb a series of stairs and ladders. Its really steep and sometimes a train would pass by and the noise would just rattle your brains out.When you reach the arch, everything starts to slow down. The view is spectacular and you would like to stay there for as long as you can. The experience at the top of the bridge is priceless. The views cannot be explained in writing. You'll want to have a cup of coffee or tea once you reach it. :)
Great bridge. spectacular bridge, also saw this in person for the first time and loved it. You can get very close to it on the opera house side, compared to some bridges

Mothers Day climb with my boys. What a fabulous experience! We were a little concerned that the weather would turn bad, but lucked in, clouds broke up and moved off shore, sun was shining and what a view. We had spectacular vision, dark and stormy clouds off over Manly, the sun beams coming down over Parramatta, really highlighting the west in the best light, and the harbor just shone. We timed our climb for 4.30 during the Vivid festival, and were entertained by Julia and Angus Stone playing in the Opera House Forecourt, a display of Chinese warriors and a rousing sing along at the pub on our way out, such great memories to share with my kids. A must do if you are travelling through Sydney.

YOU MUST DO IT!. You have to do a bridge climb! It is awesome, pick a clear day preferably without too much wind as a little on the ground is a lot up there, ideally just before sunset or early morning.
Not sure of the price but really worth ticking off the bucket list!

Iconic icon of Sydney. Love seeing the Sydney Harbour Bridge when I'm in Sydney. Definitely recommend doing the Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb (at a cost) at twilight - you get to experience both daylight and sundown/night & it's just stunningly beautiful!

Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. A definite `Must Do`. You will not be disappointed. Climb one of the worlds icons and have a terrific view of another icon, Sydney Harbour itself. Awesome! Not cheap but what the hell, you only live once!

Bridge climb. Went on the bridge climb (2nd time) for one of my childrebn's birthdays. It was good. The guide was excellent and of course the views are spectacular. Even though they were painting part of the bridge, we were still taken to the summit on a round about course and so we didn't miss any part of the trip. I did find that the price this time had gone up considerably compared to only two years ago. The price is starting to become a bit high for what you get. Yes the Sydney Harbour Bridge is iconic and a wonderful experience, but if they continue to increase the price, many Aussie families may forfiet the climb for something more affordable.

Beautiful bridge!. The bridge is beautiful, and you can see it from all over Sydney. It's an iconic structure that is so much better seen in person. Although the Bridgewalk is expensive, it was well worth the price. I've never seen this type of experience anywhere else. The people there were very knowledgeable and friendly. I did the Bridge Sampler shorter tour (or tried to) which is only 90 minutes because I'm afraid of heights and my daughter did the regular 3 hour tour. I'm sorry to say that even the Sampler trip was too much for my fear but the staff was very nice about it. My daughter loved hers though. I highly recommend this!

Great walk, great view. The first thing we wanted to do in Sydney was to walk across the Harbor Bridge and we did just that. Access from the Argyle Stairs (Argyle and Cumberland), after several flights of stairs (landings with great photo spots for the Opera House), you will be at the pedestrian/bike lane (on the right side north bound). Very pleasant walk with great view of the harbor and the Opera House, although the fully enclosed 'cage' (understandably for safety reason) makes taking picture a bit tricky. No matter, it is just as enjoyable. After crossing the bridge, we took the stairs and went down to the little park under the bridge. We saw two groups of 'bridge climbers' (looked like ants from the distance) on the bridge and took some good close-up pictures of them. A very relaxing afternoon strolling the shore and enjoy the magnificent view of the harbor, the bridge, the Opera House and downtown Sydney. And adding that, it is totally free. Don't miss it!

Signature of Sydney. The view of the bridge, the harbour and the Opera House is stunning, especially during night time. Love it! Although the Bridge Climb was a bit expensive (around 250 AUD), it was definitely a life time experience, to be standing on the top of the bridge and look down to see Sydney Opera House.
Walked over a Landmark of Sydney.. We walked across the Bridge and caught the train back. Just looking at the view was great, you could see all around.
Nice architecture. You can easily walk it through and get very nice pics of the Opera House. But you can get nervous if you do not like heights.

Walk the Bridge. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is a magnificent structure with so much history to reveal. The best way to experience it is by walking across it. The Western tower is usually open to the public for access to a viewing area as well as a museum with some very interesting facts about the building and design of the bridge.

A world iconic structure. My more could one say about this iconic world structure & an essential part on any visit to Sydney
Sydney would just not be the same without it

What an experience. This is, in my opinion, the best attraction in Sydney. I climbed the outside of the bridge, 1332 steps to go to the top, you need to be in good shape to climb it, have a general level of health and fitness and the ability to climb independently, not so easy but not too difficult either. Not only spectacular 360 degree panoramic views of the city, lots of fun, a great way to exercise as well. Price around $250 but it's worth it. Do not take your camera since no photos are allowed, however, pictures and short video are taken by crew and you can purchase the pictures. The video is included in the price. Do not miss it and take the Bridge Climb 3 1/2 hours upper bridge.

Impressive. When I first saw the Sydney Harbour Bridge up close I was in complete awe. The contrast of this beautiful bridge with the ocean and the houses on an hill on the other side are absolutely amazing. I did no climb to the top of the bridge, but I did walk across it, and it was a bit long but worth it. There are some amazing views but it's hard to take a good picture from the bridge because there is a steel net all across the bridge, it was kind of disappointing but safety is paramount.

What a view. Family climb to the top of the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Called the day before to find our climb had been brought forward 45 minutes, so essential to call the day before to confirm details. The day was beautiful, sunny and warm and we arrived plenty of time ahead of our climb. As I am type 1 diabetic and wear an insulin pump, a manager came to chat with me and discuss what I needed to take on the walk with me and to check that my blood sugars were stable before we started. Safety is paramount at all times, and everything you have to wear or carry is checked thoroughly. There is also a test ladder to have a quick practice on how to ascend and descend the steps. Our guide was great and was informative and funny, we had loads of photos taken to really which is a great way to look back on a spectacular event. Possibly not for those with a fear of heights, but the views from the top of the bridge were breathtaking and I could not recommend the climb enough. an amazing view of the whole of Sydney, practically. In our group, we had a broad range of ages, from more senior people to my 10 year old, and all enjoyed it. This is a must do when you are in Sydney!
Must see. Must see, add it to your bucket list and make sure you tick it off. We walked across and back, took about 2 hours - we stopped to take a lot of pictures!

Professional , amazing, safe and exhilarating. Booking as easy on viatour, clear directions to find the start point, and on arrival we were greeted by friendly staff who were obliging. The operation is one of precision, and the safety focus is obvious from the start. Our guide was interesting, and funny, while doubling as our photographer. The views from all levels on the bridge were beautiful, and made us proud to be Aussies. WOULD RECOMMEND fitness isnt really a big requirement, would suggest being agile maybe more of a benefit.

Amazing. One of the most famous bridges around the world is worth a visit in itself.And come evening , the bridge shines in its full glory. And for the daring types, do not miss the Sydney Harbour Bridge climb.

Can you be in love with a bridge?. A different view of the bridge can be found by way to see the bridge is to take a commuter ferry. Grab an Opal card and you can do unlimited bus train and ferry trips for $15 a day. Any of the ferry rides will give you great bridge views. The darling harbour ferry will take you under the bridge. Stunning. Simple. Cheap. My kind of adventure!

sydney harbor bridge climb. Fantastic, so glad we did it, husband had wanted to do the climb for a long time, I was the reluctant one, but we had a really good day, the views of Sydney were spectacular. We did the early afternoon climb, but the evening one would be good too, probably better during the summer months. Staff were very helpful and good at putting your mind at ease. The safety equipment puts your mind at ease also. During the climb the guide was constantly giving us a lot of history of early days in Sydney particularly regrding the construction of the bridge itself.

Incredible experience - climb to the top of Sydney Harbour Bridge. I am scared of heights and was super scared about the thought of climbing to the top of Sydney Harbour Bridge but I did it (Express Bridge Climb) and I have to say that this was absolutely incredible and recommend that everyone does this! The views, the guide that lead our group and the feeling of completing this was just a WOW experience (even though I was hanging on for dear life through some of the climb & shaking like a leaf). Just do it, you won't regret it! Don't forget that you need to do a breath test, so make sure you haven't had a big night the night before or any drinks with your lunch / dinner on the day of your climb etc.

A must do. In all the time I lived in Sydney I never walked over the Harbour Bridge. Returning as a visitor, I investigated doing the Bridge Climb but at $238 minimum and without being allowed to use my own camera, I decided that was not an option for me. But walking over the bridge was a tremendous experience. We walked from Potts Point and through the Botanical Gardens to Circular Quay and the Rocks and onto the bridge. Despite being 28 degrees, it was fantastic. We saw pretty much all of Sydney's scenic icons. The view from the bridge was amazing and it was wonderful to be able to cross it at our own pace. Once we got to the other side we had a well-earned drink at a nearby pub before catching the train back. A great way to spend an afternoon.

A stunning bridge in a stunning city!. This is iconic Sydney! Love our harbour & what absolutely completes it is this stunning structure. If you're a visitor to this beautiful city you just must walk across the bridge , stand in the middle & appreciate the harbour & of course another iconic place, the Opera House! You can go up one of the piers for a fantastic view & history lesson.The bridge is also beautiful viewed from underneath on the foreshore walk from The Rocks area & if you can from a boat or ferry on the water where you can travel underneath it.And of course, if possible, do the bridge climb - expensive, but something you will never forget!

The Coat Hanger - worth the walk. The Bridge Climb can be expensive, but just walk over the bridge to the north side and be impressed at just how damn big it is. (And feel how it sways when the trains pass over it!)Some of the best views are on the North Shore, under the bridge by the North Sydney swimming pool.

Harbah Bridge. The easiest bridge to end up on by accident while driving. Seriously, one minute you're in the city center, take one bad turn and BOOM, on da mo fkin' harbour bridge! With that said, it is the 6th longest spanning-arch bridge in the world and the tallest steel arch bridge, measuring 134 m from top to water level. That should be enough of a reason to visit this mo fk'in giant dope fk'in bridge. This bad boy took almost ten years to complete. It's way more impressive than the Opera house. The pedestrian footway is free and a great little walk to North Sydney.

Third climb. After having previously done both a day climb and an evening climb, I joined friends on an Express climb. The shorter climb gave a different perspective again. We were fortunate to have fabulous weather and the views were spectacular. Our guide was friendly and knowledgable, and can thoroughly recommend it
One of the landmarks. You simply cannot miss the bridge once you are in Sydney. The climb up is so exciting, is a must do. Awesome view from the top.

Stunning. Walked over the bridge and sailed under it on the water. I was not disappointed at all. There were great views of all the city from both sides of the bridge. It helped I went on a beautiful summers day. Glad I got to experience the famous bridge.

Absolutely Brilliant. Dont miss this and get the photo to remind you what a fantastic day you had .The climb is extremely safe,the guides are very friendly and informative.You are put in jump suits and make the slow climb over the bride.The walking area is covered so you dont have to look through the floor ,so you dont feel you are high up (if that makes sense).The views are fantastic and you have lots of little stops to take it all in.You have a harness which slides across a steal cable so there is no way you can fall.Its totally safe for all ages.We had a very old man in our group and he had no troucble keeping up with the group,albeit we walked slow .This is a once in a lifetime trip for most people ....so dont miss it.

Brilliant Bridge Climb. My husband and I did the bridge climb on a Saturday morning. It takes a while to get kitted up but it was worth it. The view from the top is breathtaking! Our guide was fantastic, telling lots of interesting facts and entertaining tales. It's good to know that the money raised goes to pay for the upkeep of the bridge. Really worthwhile. Xx
The Famous Sydney Bridge. An excellent place for those who love adventures. For me, I just like to capture the moment in my camera...

Beautiful - worth every $. One of the main attractions in Sydney. Book well in advance. I would recommend the late afternoon tours, cuz it can be very cold and slipery in the morning and there is nothing worse than frizing and not be able to relax and enjoy the tour (if you doing it during the winter time). Expensive, but worth every $ Would do it again in the summer time. 3 x Yes, yes, yes from me - well recommend ;)

Iconic Australian Image. Enjoyed a visit to the Sydney Harbour Bridge. You can walk across the Bridge for free. The best vantage point for a photo is further away from the bridge, so you can get it in the frame e.g. from the side of the Opera House, or Lady Macquarie's Chair.

AMAZING EXPERINCE THAT YOU HAVE TO DO!. I'm afraid of heights and I did it... Yes its a bit daunting at points but its a once in a lifetime experience! Just to say you've climbed over the harbor bridge, the views will blow you away! Well not literally as you are fixed on a line the whole way round, nice and secure!Our guide filled us full of knowledge and was very thoughtful with my partner who was very scared the whole way round and he made sure she was ok the entire time! Loved this experience that we'll remember forever!

Walk it, and walk it again. I used to live in Milsons Point and for about four years I walked across the bridge every day to my work in the CBD.I love the bridge, looking at it and walking over it.It is an icon!Thanks to a burst water main in the CBD which diverted my bus to North Sydney I got the opportunity to walk it again after some five years since I last did it. If you get the opportunity I suggest you do the same. Take the Cahill Walk from Macquarie Street to Milsons point and admire the views.
Breath taking. Well worth the expense. Fantastic views, not all that strenuous and safe for the faint-hearted. Guides with a sense of humour - especially Richard - top man!
Great experience . Lots of fun, you get to see a very different view of the city. It's an iconic part of visiting Sydney, would def recommend for visitors

Amazing harbour views from the free walk across the Bridge.. The icon, also known as the "Coat-hanger", bridges the City with the North Shore and beyond. You can walk across the Bridge for free! If you start in the city, walking across the bridge can take you to Kirribilli, with small quaint cafes. It is primarily a residential area. The walk is safe as there is a dedicated walkway for pedestrians. Take water, hat and sunscreen. You may find it windy as well. You can always buy the "Bridge Climb" packages which walk along the arch of the bridge. I am sure you will enjoy this amazing bridge with its stunning views of Sydney City, the magnificent harbour, and surrounding suburbs. (In case you're wondering, there are No toilets on the Bridge).

Bridge Walk at night Amazing. So we did the bridge walk at night. It was awesome. I am not a fan of heights, but it wasn't a big deal. Your strapped in really good and they have handrails.If you go at night, bring the handkerchief and gloves that are supplied, you won't regret it. It's very cold and windy.You wont be able to take any pictures or bring anything up with you. They check VERY well ( pat down and metal detector). They also give you a breathalyzer. Views were magnificent tho! It's a few hours longs.
Fav Sydney Spot. Beautiful spot to relax and grab a bite to eat. Must do the bridge climb. It's a bit scary at first, but so amazing!
Harbour Climb. It was a fantastic experience and one that I climb I am would not have missed I thought it was over priced bit glad I did it

AN ENGINEERING MARVEL!. Whenever I see this bridge I know I'm home.... It not only an icon but simply beautful from both an engineering and architectural perspective. No visit to Sydney would be complete without a trip across and up the bridge. The views are incredible and you'll be walking across the backbone of modern day Sydney.
Must see!. Sydneys iconic Harbour Bridge is a necessity to see when in the City. Its amazing to walk under it and marvel at how it was put together.

What an experience. My 15 year old son was desperate to climb the bridge. Nicola Lewis couldn't have been more helpful, even calling me in the UK, to enable him to climb without me. He had the most amazing experience. Many thanks to all the staff who made it possible. Wonderful customer service.

One of the highlights of our trip of a lifetime. Great experience from the moment you step through the door. Knowledgable friendly staff stress the safety aspects without taking away the fun. Our guide, Engkish chap from Charlton and Northapton was great. Both in terms of knowledge and inclusion of all of the group. At 60 with a dodgy knee, was worried beforehand about my fitness but you do a small training exercise before you go and after that it was far easier than I thought. There are lots of stops on the way up for the guide to tell you about the history, the landmarks etc and at no point did I feel outside my comfort zone. Would recommend to everyone.
great. iconic, worth a visit, if you brave enough you can walk over the arches and get great views of the city and harbour

A must do for a Sydney visit. The Sydney Harbour Bridge walk is an absolute must for locals and tourists alike. I have now done this twice and really enjoyed both times. It is not overly strenuous and a moderate fitness level is fine. Obviously weather plays an important factor and I have been fortunate that both times the weather has been great with amazing views over Sydney and the Harbour. The guides have been excellent and are very informative. Safety is key and I felt very secure the whole trip. I highly recommend taking the time to do this walk and it is worth every cent.
Amazing view from the top. If you come to sydney or you live is sydney and still haven't done the climb. It is well worth it's money and don't recommend missing out on the birds eye view experience.
Never miss this!. Never miss this! It is more than enough if you could stand at the opera house and take a beautiful shot from that angle.
Just do it. Great experience, gradual climb with plenty of breaks for photo opportunities, very well organised, excellent guide in Phoebe, allow 3.5 hours at least.If your in Sydney just do it
Great views. We took a walk across the harbour bridge and up one of the pylons. The views from the pylon are great and it is much more reasonable than the bridge walk.

Bridge Climbing. If you fit enough you can climb up the bridge for difference climbing experience. ( ~2.5 H)
If you want to take a close look of the bride, take a ferry.
Nice bridge view no matter day or night.
Must go to have a look.
Beside is Sydney Opera House

Driving through the Sydney Harbour bridge for last Fifty years !. I driving through the Sydney Harbour for last fifty years . I still enjoy watching the bridge scenery . It always have a fresh look .I used to live in North Sydney and driving through in the morning to work in the city with the heavy traffic . It may take at least half an hour to cross from North Sydney to City . I have took some fantastic photos for the bridge. You can go up to the top of the bridge , that is spectacular scene up there !

Twilight climb is tops!. We recently climbed the Sydney Harbor bridge and it was fantastic! Grandma and Grandpa climbed with our 12 year old grandson. We weren't sure our knees could do it but it's a surprisingly easy climb. There are four ladders to go up/down but otherwise the steps are shallow and easily navigated. Everyone is given a jumpsuit and safety gear, just wear comfortable sneakers. We climbed at 3:15pm and had wonderful twilight views of Sydney! We loved the experience and all the great photos that our guide took. Would definitely do again!

Wow. I wasn't so sure about doing this climb, but thought hey I might never get the chance again, so plucked up the courage and booked it for myself and my husband - I am so glad I did, the views were fantastic, the guide was great fun and very knowledgable and he made sure he went the speed of the slowest person. We had pictures and video taken by home at the top and he pointed out things of interest on the way. Dont miss this opportunity when in Sydney, you won't regret it. You are harnessed at all times and the safety measures are excellent, you are in very safe hands. Go for it.......you wont regret it

Expensive but worth it for the experience. We did the daytime harbour climb, which takes about 4 hours (including prep time before the climb). The actual climb was about 2~2.5 hours long.It is not strenuous but you should be able to climb a lot of ladder-like steps!The architecture, stories and the experience of walking through this majestic structure make this a once-in-a-lifetime experience. The only problem is that this is expensive, so much so, that we paid less to go diving off the Great Barrier Reef! If it pinches your pocket, just do the side structure near the bridge (the Pylon) - this has some steps to climb.
A must!. My wife and i did the Sydney Harbour Bridge climb. We did the big arch not the little one. It was FANTASTIC! Totally worth it. A must for anyone visiting Sydney.
Wow! what a view. As always, you cannot but be taken back by the beautiful scene of Sydney harbour and it's bridge. You must always make time to take in this spectacular view.

Sydney Harbour Bridge, Sydney, Australia. Sydney Harbour Bridge is a beautiful sight and a great experience if you enjoy climbing and aren't afraid of heights. You can take a tour up to the top, but better wear good walking shoes. The views from the bridge are great, including the Sydney Opera House and the bay, the quay and all the ships coming in and out. It is especially pretty when it is lit up at night.
Bridge walkover. A must visit when in Sydney, the walk over the bridge was stunning. Well worth the waiting and organising.

Walk the coat hanger!. If you want a great walk with magnificent views, that's free, park at North Sydney and walk across the Harbour Bridge and head down to the Rocks. Its a great family outing that takes in the best views of the harbour!
Symbol of Sydney. You must visit here, since it is the one of the symbol of Sydney and Australia. Especially you want to check out this place during sunset, or night.

Just Do It! - Even if you think you can't. We did a daytime climb and enjoyed the entire experience. I have a bad leg and managed (with a few rest stops) to to the whole climb. It was amazing, fun, and very different than anything else I've ever done. The view is spectacular.
Wonderful. Beautiful architecture, and a pleasure for the eyes, a must see ! And if you can afford it, don't hesitate to climb on top!

Famous Bridge and an icon of the city. The bridge is a fantastic example of architecture and craftsmanship. It spans across the harbor and connects Sydney with its Northern burbs. A wonderful building that can be walked and even climbed.
Too expensive. To walk over the bridge costs $261 per person. I opted for the view from the side tower $13. I was looking forward to the walk over but couldn't justify the expense of that - shame :(

Absolutely stunning!. My husband organised this for my bday. It was an amazing experience and I recall about this experience every time I see Harbour Bridge. It's a bit pricy and not suitable for small kids but I do recommend. Must do!

Drive across one of the most spectacular bridges in the world. Seeing Sydney cannot be complete unless you cross the Sydney Harbour bridge. Drive across and view the spectacular harbour and City. It's really fun in a convertible!

Amazing Australia. Amazing!! All of Australia is amazing. The people are very friendly and want to tell you about their country. Be sure and visit China town and enjoy their 10 course meals served in steamed carts. What an experience. The harbor this bridge is over is so pretty. Take the boat ride down the harbor to really enjoy the sites. And for sure, don't miss the Opera House.

climbing in the sunset. we did the twilight climbing of the bridge, it was fantastic, we were dressed up and equipped like austronaut and were ready for any meteo condition, views over sidney amazing, not to miss, worth the money
Spectacular!. This is a spectacular piece of architecture. Everytime I see it I want to climb it.. but I have not yet done it. On my bucket list

Gotta do it. Variety of different climbs throughout he day/twilight/night, Is a bit pricey for the full bridge climb, though the do also offer shorter cheaper 'express' climbs that dont go all the way but still give you a great taste of it. - Worth to do the full thing though. Loved it!
Not to be missed. Walk across the bridge. It is free and the views are super. The climb up the steps is not difficult and if you go out of peak traffic time it is not too noisy.

Amazing Experience. Amazing view from a stunning landmark,
The security & safety are first class,
A 50 minute safety setup, A total of 3.5 hours, They supply jacket ,hat,gloves and even a hankie, no lifts only stairs, some are steep but safe.
We had clear blue sky and light winds and did not need a jacket
We thought it was fabulous

Expensive, but worth it.. The cost of this trip would put off a lot of people, especially if you're a large family, but I would highly recommend it. This is much better than the Sydney tower. While we were there a large section was closed for reprinting, but we were diverted around this. One more thing, remember to remove your headphones for your photos, otherwise you will look ridiculous.

Refreshing. This is two is connecting each other. If you aare fun of plants, flowers, trees Botanical is beautiful to visit. Have a least few hours to see the whole area. It is wide and big to see by walking. But there is also a cart to ride and pay for people who doesn't want to walk.
Views from the top... Amazing!. We climbed the bridge and it was fantastic even though I hate heights I managed to do this! Something to remember forever and view the beautiful city.

Very Impressive. I was honestly more impressed with the bridge than the Opera House. The views of the bridge from the harbor are just amazing. We did the bridge climb in the evening to enjoy the views of the harbor and downtown with daylight still remaining for the beginning, but completely down by the time we reached the top. The Bridge Climb tour takes longer than i would have imagined, lots of time spent in preparation for the climb and too many photos opportunities in my opinion. Overall the experience was much better than i thought it would be. The bridge climb is a bit pricey but i would recommend it to those considering the climb.
Iconic!. Must visit! For interesting people, climbing the harbor bridge is an exhilarating activity. Don't forget to visit the Rocks marketplace on your way back

Bridge Climb Experience. Ok, so I have the height-fear thing, but the climb was purchased for me, so... It was great! Yes, my legs turned to jelly with the fear, but the views were amazing and the experience of the climb was worth it. I'm not doing it again! But I've done it and highly recommend it to all. Conquer your fear and climb!
THE BRIDGE I WALKED ACCROSS. It was a great feeling to walk from one end to the other with the fantastic view of the creek and the surroundings. Great feeling.

Great walk. Besides the noisy traffic Harbor bridge still a nice spot for a stroll! With an amazing view of the city is a nice walk to take especially when show out of town friends. For who has some money to spend try climbing the bridge

Great View. The Sydney Harbor Bridge is a stunning landmark and was definitely one of my favorite things to see in Sydney. However, I didn't see the point in paying for the Pylon Lookout, it's so expensive and the view of the Operat House etc. from near the bridge at water level is far better than the view from atop.

True Craftsmanship. Beautiful feat of architecture. Not to be missed when visiting Sydney! It spans over the Harbour and is a lovely site from all vantage points in the harbor. If you get a chance either walk or drive across the bridge. And for those of you that are more adventurous, be sure to check out Bridge Climb Sydney!

Views Galore. Walking around this world icon is great. Do look you directions prior to walking, it can get a little difficult to find. The walk their is a bit steep at times. Once you make it to the bridge deck, just watch the boat traffic below for awhile.

Bridge Climb. Harbour bridge climb is quite fun and very spectacular. It will take you 3 hours to do it (the first one only to get dressed and listen to safety speech!). It is really easy except if you are afraid of heights and the view on the opera house and the bay is splendid. Very expensive though for a quite industrialized tour.

Sydney Harbour Bridge. Sydney Harbour bridge is visible from far distance and when you are nearby the harbour then you can take a walk over the bridge. Its more than a km long but the experience is awesome.
Bridge. You an climb the bridge and get great views,but at a price. You an walk ,drive or ride a bike over the bridge. Best way to get good pics is a cruise of the harbour. Worth seeing
Went over it, on it and under it!. This has to be one of the most well known views in the World and what ever way you view this structure it still amazes you!!!

Amazing - a must do!. The bridge walk was an amazing experience. It's on the expensive side however well worth the climb and view at the top! Staff take pictures along the way... Brilliant keepsakes. Do it!

On top of the world. 3 hours. That is what you need to put aside to experience the bridge climb and it is truly unforgettbale! no need to bring anything, as the tour operator will provide you with everything (hair tie, cap, sunblock, water, safety guard for your glasses ... they've even though of hankies in case you have a cold ... or get emotional at the top and decide to cry) ... all your personal belongings will be stored in a secure locker.your guide will take breathtaking pictures so don't worry if you forgot to bring your camera. it is a leisure climb and you get to enjoy the 360 view of the entire harbor and landscape of the city ... no trip to Sydney will be complete without this .. the whole experience is a bit pricey if you go as a family .. check their websites for promos .. i think the late afternoon climb is discounted :)

"Truly spectacular". An amazing piece of infrastructure in the heart of Sydney.
It casts a beautiful sight on the skyline, day and night.
I hope all those Sydneysiders who get to see this fantastic bridge every day truly appreciate it and don't take it for granted.

Take a Hike if you dare!!. If you are brave enough (and I'm not - but the rest of my family are), for around A$200 you can hike over the top ramparts of the bridge, and many do. For a coward like me, I'll just quaff a glass of wine or two, and watch, while the idiot's of the planet demonstrate how macho they are. I might to it one day. Everyone comes back with infuriating level of testosterone and say its fab! I can't disagree

Excellent experience. The Bridge Climb was one of the things on my bucket list to do whilst in Australia. It did not disappoint! Our guide was very knowledgable & good company. Our climb was paced at an easy pace. Very good views from the top. Really good thing for anyone to do when visiting Sydney

A "MUST DO" IN SYDNEY. I am a chicken, I am scared of heights, yet I demand that you get on this bridge! For the adventurous among you, go over the top -- literally. For my fellow fowls who are too scared for that, get on the Pylon Lookout . . . you won't regret it. :-)

Fantastic. The Bridge and its setting is breath taking! Simply a must see in Sydney. I wouldnt waste money on climbing the bridge because there are many ways of seeing it for free from different angles and you can also walk it!!

The coat hanger of Sydney City. This bridge is so quintessentially Sydney. You will not see many photos of Sydney without this bridge. It connects the North side of Sydney City to the South side. The bridge becomes the focal point come Christmas eve fireworks celebration.
Awesome views of the harbor. The bridge is quite an amazing structure in Sydney. You have have the most amazing views of the harbor. Great photo op!

Bridge climb. An amazing experience that should not be missed when visiting Sydney.. Guide was informative and certainly knew his stuff.. Views are to die for..Cannot rate this high enough . It is a brilliant trip.
Ride or walk the Bridge. The walk from Milson point is a must. Walk down to Luna Park and around the bay.from the Sydney side go into The Rocks.

Fantastic experience!. The bridge climb is expensive but worth it. I booked three of us on it using their website from the UK. Right from the word go we knew this was going to be good. The staff are great and so professional. The process of safety briefing and getting kitted up was like a well oiled machine and made you feel totally safe and relaxed.We did the "express climb" which took just over two hours including briefing and kit issue. The guide was informative and amusing the views were spectacular. You get a group photo, certificate and hat to keep. We pre booked the option of a couple of family photos which saved a bit. The ticket also includes entry to one of the pylons and is valid for a month. We did this the next day and allows you to climb one of the pillars for great views of the harbour area, an informative display, film, museum and you can take your own camera up here.If you don't do the bridge climb there are great views anyway from the bridge walkway and you can buy a ticket for the pylon lookout on its own.

A bit of a side trip. A bit outside the main Harbour area (or at least outside of where I was staying), this area did have a few really good places to eat and the bridge is interesting. I didn't walk it, though I have heard you can.

The greatest free thing to do in Sydney!. Friends of ours came to Sydney on a limited budget. So our challenge was to come up with things to do for free. This was the best thing. Yes, there are beaches you can walk on for free, and city streets and precincts. But this is a Sydney icon, overlooking at Sydney icon (Harbour Bridge overlooking the Opera House). It was free; it was magic. Do it! Even we Sydneysiders who accompanied our visitors enjoyed the experience tremendously.

Bridge walk. Myself and 13 year old daughter did the Sydney bridge walk. Brilliant experience. Amazing views from the top of the bridge. Guide was great and knowledgable about view an had interesting stories about history of sites. Bit pricey, but great experience
Good walk!. Never did the actual paid bridge walk, but simply walking across the bridge gives you some great views of the Opera house and the rest of the city. Recommend!

Bucket List? Climb the Bridge - CHECKED!. If you are visiting Sydney, physically able, and without a fear of heights, climbing the Harbour Bridge should be at the top of your list! This was an absolutely wonderful experience affording you a view of the beautiful city and the Opera House unlike any other you can get. Our guide, Jessica, was kind and knowledgeable, and I know that with her guidance at least two on our tour (14 per group) were able to make the climb even with a fear. Safety was of the utmost concern and we all were breathalyzed before and tethered to safety cables via our provided suits. All gear is available to give you the best experience; a strong gust of wind and a brief shower happened during our tour but the fleece and the rain gear - all attached to the belt - made it tolerable if a little more thrilling than anticipated. You have to be able to follow instructions, to be able to properly climb the ladders and stairs, and you have to be prepared to wait a number of times. And for safety reasons you can't bring your own camera, cell phone, or GoPro. The only criticism I had is that at times we had to wait for other tours. This was also fortunate as it gave us a chance to rest a bit! Even though I am in great shape I could feel the next day that my calves were challenged. This is a 'you only live once' bucket list item. I'm glad I checked it off while in Sydney!
Sydney Harbour Bridge. I always get excited to drive over this iconic bridge, it seems amazing that it is only 83 years since it was builtSimply amazing

Amazing view . A great walk from the rocks to milsons point, approx 30 mins (slow walk) with a great view of the opera house along the way! There is a lookout somewhere in the middle but that is $13. The view from the bridge is already priceless so I gave that a miss. Take a train back to circular quay or walk around milsons point for some cafes!

Bridge Climb- Really Worth it!. The view of course - is what you expect it to be - magnificent! But the reception and check in staff and the tour guides make it really special. At no moment do you feel insecure, hurried or stressed. Every single little minute detail has been thought of- including thermal wear, loves, beanies and hooks to secure them so they do not fly away with the wind! You get to have a practise session before the actual climb. In Sydney - an absolutely must do!
a devilish trip over the harbor!. A super thrill when you are enjoying a bird view,,,,and a panoramic view extraordinary high view of sydney.climb overvoyage has been reponsible even in

What a gorgeous sight!. Not only did we climb the bridge but we also walked across it from one side to the other and back again. When you climb the bridge it is spectacular. Even for myself, who has a small fear of heights, I found the climb really easy. You feel completely safe and once at the top have the best views in the world. We also walked across the bridge which is free and you get amazing views of Sydney Harbour.

Icon. The Harbour bridge is such a prominent structure in Sydney. It looks beautiful from many angles & can be seen from many places in Sydney. Such is the size & location, it often surprised you by appearing at the end of a street you happen to be serving or walking along and the surprise is always a bit of a thrill. Go to Milsons point so you can walk around the north side of the bridge and take the steps that allow you to walk across to Circular Quay. Do the bridge climb or just look at the bridge from Circumar Quay, juxtaposed alongside the Opera House... Splendid

Brilliant views without the climb. After a terrific pause at the Glenmore Pub in The Rocks, we headed up the stairs to go for a walk across the bridge. Beautiful day and great views. We debated on doing the climb but could not be bothered at the time with booking, rather winged it and took a walk across instead. You can walk over on the Opera House side and cycle over on the other side. Ended up at Luna Park and caught the ferry back. There is no ticket machine for the ferry on the jetty but you can pay for it when you get back to Circular Quay. Take note that the ferries charge full price, around $6-7 whether you are going one stop or to the end of the line.

Amazing to see live. There really is something about this particular bridge (as there are many in and around the city), and we saw it during the day and at night. we didnt do the climb or the pylon climb, but i reckon that would have been awesome to do. next time!

Lovely Stroll with Spectacular Views. Well worth the visit. Casual stroll, approximately 15 minutes each way with spectacular views. We walked from Mrs Macquaries Chair around past the Opera House, Circular Quay and then over the bridge and back before stopping for coffee on the way back to our hotel. Lovely afternoon in the sunshine!

Great Experience for ALL!!. We had every type of person you could imagine on the tour... handicapped, kids, fear of heights, runners and people that had trouble walking up stairs and it was a great time for everyone. Everyone could keep up with the pace and the guides so were wonderful that you forget you are climbing stairs and the VIEW!!!! It really is worth the price.

DO THE CLIMB!!!. Don't be put off by height or fitness. The day we did the climb, a gentleman in his 90s was doing his umpteenth climb with a film crew and loving it! It couldn't be safer and you are attached to it at all times. Fabulous experience!
Quite good. Other landmark of Sydney. Quite good bridge and quite well view from above to see Sydney. The harbour bridge climb i think too expensive, but should try once and took a pic from above :)

Good fun and good info. More interesting than I thought that construction of a bridge info could be. The organization was very orderly and safety standards very high. The guide had a well worn script of nicely dry humour. We had beautiful weather and a great background on some surrounding landmarks.

We crossed the COAT HANGER TWICE!! On electric Bikes!. We booked a tour with BLUE BANANAS an electric bike tour outfit at Clarence street Gaffa House - the bike tour brought us to several vistas of the harbour bridge and we also got to bike across to North Shore as well as back on the bike lane on the bridge! The Bridge was everything we heard about it - beautiful, graceful, full of history and the icon of Sydney that it is!

Main attraction of Sydney is Harbour Bridge and Opera House.. Man made wonder. Bridge constructed using steel is having roads and rails on it. People can walk on the bridge and climb also even though tiresome for elders.
Great Experience!. We had a visitor from the UK, so flew up to Sydney to do the climb. Enjoyed by all. Great experience!

Iconic. Sydney harbour bridge is one of the most iconic landmarks in Sydney. You can view it from many places in sydney and in particular it looks fantastic at night. You are able to walk over it which offers great views over the harbour and to the opera house. If you are in sydney, go for a walk to kirribilli on the other side.

Walk across. A free way of seeing the harbour from the Bridge is simply to walk across it. Views are impeded by the security fencing, but even so it's lovely. Please keep to the left when you're walking!

A lot of nuts and bolts holding it up.. A very iconic structure, which has obviously been inspired by Newcastle bridge, over the River Trent, or Humber, sorry, cant remember. We hired a car, and drove over it, just for the view. Very tempted to scale the ladder over the top, in an organized party, however calls of "what at your age" from my wife (Spoilsport) I thought I'd give it a miss until my next visit, (when I'm 90) ha ha.

Brilliant Bridge Climb. My wife climbed the bridge with our 12 & 14 yr old sons. We booked the climb prior to leaving the UK as it is very popular - if you want a particular slot/day (we were also checking the long range weather forecast). Allow either a whole morning or afternoon for the event. We booked for 1.40pm, so ensure you have lunch before hand. By the time we got through the briefing we didn't start to climb until 2.30pm. Please note you are not allowed to take any personal cameras, phones or GoPros. Our guide was extremely helpful and great with the boys. Your guide will take various photos of you on the climb which you can purchase in various formats at the end or decide at time of booking. It is a must when visiting Sydney - offers great views of the city and harbour area. You are provided with overalls & a fleece if necessary for the climb - so I suggest, shorts and T Shirt are probably sufficient.

Scenic Ferry Ride to view the Bridge and the Opera House. Taking the ferry is the best way to view this bridge with Opera House. Do this on a sunny spring day is the best thing to have a complete different perspective of the Opera house and Bridge.
wonderful views.. We walked over it rather than do the expensive bridge climb. if you walk from Pots point to the city you get wonderful views and photo opportunity of the opera house all along.
Impressive. This is a fantastic architectural statement & dominates the harbour. I was very disappointed at how expensive the tour to go to the top of the bridge were.

Amazing views!. This was one of our best experiences from our visit to Sydney. Our guide Max was very funny and made the tour really enjoyable. It was a bit pricey but was a once in a lifetime experience!

Sydney Harbour Bridge Rocks!. What can you say about one of the most iconic bridges in the world? It's fun to walk around and you can go up the towers on either end. I have done the bridge walk in previous visits, and while pricey, is a fantastic afternoon!

That Iconic Bridge . Been on, under, alongside or near it so much I don't even notice it much anymore which is a shame. It's a beautiful bridge and offers so much. A beautiful part of the skyline, something to look up to literally when sailing under it. Here's a little tip get down at Circular Quay and find the lifts to take you to the Walkway along the bridge. A nice walk and great views of the Harbour.

Free and beautiful. I ride along this daily and i never get tired of it, the bike path is on the west side and is great especially at sunset. Real commuters wont appreciate tourists stopping and blocking the way to take photos, but if you keep to the very edge so people can zoom past they will forgive you. The walking path is on the East side which is also delightful this is where you can get some semi birds-eye views of the opera house and circular quay. I've never done the bridge climb, which i'm sure is great, but this is the quick and cheap alternative.

Climbing the Sydney Harbour Bridge. The view was AMAZING, the stairs were not too difficult and you weren't rushed to climb. The preparation (getting into the suits and the gear), safety talks etc. took a bit long.

Respect.... In my opinion, there is no many structural attraction in Australia that would deserve above title. Naturally, one must be fascinated by the genius and vision of anyone who builds impressive piece of urban infrastructure for the future. In this case, that genius and vision belongs to one man, John Bradfield, and has been unmatched since. That was many, many moons ago... In the backdrop, Opera House looks like a supporting act. This bridge can be walked, cycled, cross by a train or a car. You can even climb, if you wish. Surely, there is no singe piece of infrastructure that has better served Sydney that this bridge. What ever you choose to do, enjoy and Respect...

Spectacular bridge and harbour. You can just walk around either end of the bridge, walk over it, catch a freey under it, or admire it from places like the Opera house. It's an amazing piece of engineering from early last century. I climb to the top can be arranged.
Bridge walk. a great tour, totally professional, thrilling and safe. I went late afternoon, saw the city by day, in sunset and by night. Breathtakingl

Sydney Bridge Museum. if you don't like heights then go up the bridge museum in one of the support towers nearest to city end you go up in side ands see the history of the bridge and at the top is an amazing viewing platform where you can look over the bridge and amazing views of Sydney harbour

Every chance I get to go on it, I do. The structure affectionately know as the 'coat hanger' is a must see must do. But don't worry if you can not afford to pay for bridge climb walk across it. Catch the train to Kirrabilli and walk back to the Rocks.If you are driving, take the bridge not the tunnel. Every chance I get to go on it I do. You should too.

great experience. We were a little anxious but once you start your realise its going to be great and you then kick into a different mode and just go for it. I wouldn't call it and easy climb, you need to be healthy, not necessarily fit but not carrying too much excess baggage. There is some times when you have to climb fairly vertical stairways and climb/walk on surfaces where you can see through and that can give you a strange feeling. Getting past all that, it is a great sight when you get to the top and you feel really great that you have done it. It can get breezy up there but you are supplied with jackets so its not a problem. Just do it.
Spectacular views. This is an amazing experience. The views are spectacular. its a great way to Sydney from a different perspective.. You can see in all directions.
Fantastic. One of the best tours we've ever done. Darren our tour guide was excellent (very friendly and knowledgeable). Definitely advise to do the tour.

Bit pricey but a must. Landed at 5am and was climbing the bridge at 10am! The reviews pretty much sum it up. It's a great experience and provided the weather doesn't let you down its a brilliant view point! The whole experience lasted around 3 hours and the climb itself was at a leisurely pace. I think we lucked in with our guide... Chris was a top guy with a great sense of humour and was literally a fountain of knowledge! He made time to talk with everyone in our group and took some pretty good snaps whilst we were up there! Only down side as I mentioned was the cost... So get saving!
iconic walk. Iconic! Always an enjoyable experience to run across the bridge - a gentle up and down hill. There are a couple of spots you can stop and take photos and enjoy the view.

Sydney Harbour Bridge Walk - Free. Had a free day in Sydney last week and walked across the Harbour Bridge (at road level, not the Bridge climb) south to north and back .The pedestrian path is on the eastern side so there are uninterrupted view of the Harbour, Opera House, Manly Ferries coming and going etc.- simply beautiful and the best thing is it's free. Access is from the South East corner of the bridge via stairs from Cumberland St near the Australia Hotel (a lovely old pub worth having a beer in to celebrate your feat. I recommend their Tasmanian dark ale).

Australia rules!. Well what can I say! I'm Aussie and proud of it! I left my travelling a little late (in my 60's) but altho I live in Adelaide, I leave and return from Sydney. What an experience in itself tobe on a cruise ship (Princess) and sail under the bridge to and from a holiday. Or return from a long distant flight from Dallas, tired, a little cramped, ready to sleep in your own bed, and you see dawn over the bridge! Welcome home! Nothing else to say - that covers it!

Worth the effort of getting there.. A little difficult to find the steps to the walking platform. You will find them Just outside The Rocks.Worth the effort to walk across. Stunning views from the centre across the harbour.
Great to look and admire. Wow, and wow. Enjoyed the view and very clean and tidy. Worth a visit, living in Sydney itself, but we take it for granted.

Climb every mountain, I mean bridge. We had a great time on our climb. It wasn't too scary and the guides are super helpful. I would highly recommend this tour to get the great views of the harbor and opera house. They think of pretty much everything, hankies, hoodies, hats and eyeglass leashes. Only thing missing is a restroom. Go before you climb!
Iconic Views. Best viewed from the water if you like us left the harbour by ship. Don't miss the chance to climb the bridge if you have a head for heights.

WOW!. Wasn't too sure about doing the bridge climb, but so glad we did. What an experience! The cute grey boiler suits that you get to wear are actually o.k. too.BTW.....although this review says we travelled in Dec 2014 we actually travelled in Dec 2003.....just don't get the option to go that far back!

Amazing. One of the best things to do in Sydney - if you have a head for heights, can listen to and obey safety instructions and have a few hours to spare. The experience is fun as you get kitted out and set off in anticipation of an adventure. A lot of the time is spent concentrating on the climbing of stairs and gangways, safety line constantly attached. But when you get to look around the views are awesome - best of all from the very top. The city and harbour are laid out before you - simply unforgettable. I went on the Night Climb which in March starts around dusk and I thought the views at night were probably tops. One of the best things I have done to date! Unmissable (though quite pricey).

Climbing the Sydney Harbour bridge. One of the best experiences of my life. I was a little apprehensive at the start but after the training the experience and the sights you see is fantastic. The guide was great, there were a couple of women who were very nervous and the were supported and reassured while doing the climb.

Bridge Climb - Great experience. A memorable climb to the top of the bridge. A different way to see Sydney Opera House. Though it was a little expensive but money is worth the experience and thrilling climb.

Massive Structure..... The backdrop of every Sydney picture, the Bridge its the centerpiece of every Sydney New Year celebration. Easy to spot, requires a little bit of sweat to go through it and a little of madness to go up and climb it, but above everything, its a nice place to see.

Views of the Opera House amazing. We loved this walk across the bridge so much we came back again to do it at sunset. The views of the Sydney Opera House in the glorious colors lighting its shells were fantastic. The skyline in every direction is great, but looking over traffic is not so much fun.

Nice structure well blended in the landscape. Beautiful construction. It is worth to cross it and admire the structure. It's design blends it very well in the landscape. To see the bridge you can do the bridge climb, go to the pylon lookout, or simply grab a beer in the opera house and admire the bridge.

Great walk...Better View!. Son wanted to walk across the Harbour Bridge before doing the Climb the next day. I figured ok ...let's go for a walk. Great decision.We jumped on the train at Wynyard Station just south of The Rocks and went across bridge to Milsons Point station. Easy cheap way to start your walk so you walk looking at the Harbour...and likely heading back toward The Rocks, the Circular Quay, the Opera House or your hotel. Fascinating to look at bridge structure. Plenty of security screening if worried about safety, And a fabulous view of the harbor. Highly recommended.
Sydney Bridge. Some people walk the arch of the bridge which is an excursion on its own however we simply walked the bridge as a normal pedestrian and we had a magnificent vey over the opera house .

Superb!. We've just climbed this bridge with our 2 children. The kids absolutely loved it as did we. It was easy to book at the desk with a friendly chap, the lady who we filled the paperwork in with was a little over enthusiastic but rather that than miserable but just needs to tone it down a little. Our bridge climb guy was brilliant, he gave us a great insight to some history about the bridge along the way. It's not scarey at all, it's utterly amazing. We booked the same day we climbed because if you book in advance you risk the climb in rain and that would completely spoil it. Would thoroughly recommend if you're visiting Sydney.

magnificient views. time didnt permit us do the bridge climb but walked and went up the stairs and studied the amazing workmanship of the bridge and it is plain to see why everyone makes such a big deal about the sydney harbour bridge because just being there gave us a great feeling.
Walk across the bridge.. If you are not up to the walk up the bridge then walking across is just as good and so are the views.

a fantastic view from the bridge. we walked from darling harbour up on to the bridge then we walked across it taking in the extensive views of the city and beyond. it was great to see such a busy harbour.

Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb....do yourself a favour!. If you can afford it...do the bridge climb...It's truly a spectacular way of seeing Sydney from an incredible vantage.. I baulked at the price initially...but then decided to give it a go.

Iconic. In isolation, it could be one of many other bridges anywhere in the world. In context, with the other wonderful sights of the Sydney harbour, the bridge is elevated to iconic stature. On the surface the bridge is quite attractive but learning the history of the bridge again elevates it and makes it a gem. The bridge climb is an amazing experience. We did the dusk climb and experienced light, sunset, and dark. Fantastic even though it rained.

Blown away by everything we could do here!. You can walk or jog on the bridge, drive through it, get the train through it, climb it, go under it by water taxi so it's an amazing attraction. The Opera house is close by as well as the Royal Botanic Gardens so you can spend all day here. We got the water taxi for over a hundred Australian dollars and it was well worth it to see the Harbour, the Navy ships and their base, the old prison at sea, the beaches, the suburbs of Sydney and Luna Park. As well as going under the Harbour Bridge twice!
Great Walk. This bride is stunning!! great to take a walk and it offers an wonderful view of the opera house and the skyline. Very beautiful.
Sydney. fantastic location , iconic landmark of Sydney  Close to darling harbour , circular quay and all city Amenities

The structure is fastinating. If you have read any of my other reviews you will know that I love my architecture. This is just a stunning structure of a bridge. Although we didn't walk up into the main frame because there is an age limit and my daughter was to young, you can still be in ore of this bridge

Grand and Majestic Structure. Should be view from afar in day and night. Best means of viewing is from just outside Sydney Opera House. Would be nice to have a drink at Opera Bar and admire the bridge.
Amazing. An amazing bridge and is very nice to go over. I would love to climb this the next time I go because I think that will be an amazing experience .

Bridge walk. My daughter and I walked the harbour bridge and my wife was reluctant to do it as she did not think she was fit enough but the walk is a steady slow climb with lots of stops and afterwards we realised she would have coped with it easily. I would recommend this walk to all.

A day before the Meetings started. . Walking the Sydney bridge was terrific. The views are great and the excise is a bonus. Lots of runners on the bridge during many times of the day. Great views of the bridge from next to the Opera House.

She is nice bridge. We did not do the walk over the arch of the bridge but you can walk across on the roadway. A few stairs on the opera house side is the start but the view and the photo you can take make the stairs worth it. We went to the other side and down to Luna park to get pictures then walk back

Breathtaking Views. Absolutely breathtaking views! My group got lucky on the timing of the bridge climb. It was daylight going up the bridge, and the sun was setting by the time we went down. We got to see the harbor in day and dark, and it was beautiful!

It doesn't get better than this ! The best view in the world - and for free.. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is spectacular. And you can walk across for free. You can take a train across. You can drive across. You can do the Sydney Bridgeclimb. Not to be missed no matter which way you do it.

Majestic Bridge. After the Sydney Opera House, we like viewing the Harbour Bridge either from Circular Quay, The Rocks, or aboard a ferry. We also like looking at the bridge climbers, having done so ourselves.
Walk across a bucket list item. Great place for a walk and not too strenuous. The views are just unbeatable, being able to see the Harbour and Sydney Opera House.
Lovely walk. We enjoyed a lovely morning walk across the bridge. Takes approximately 30-40 mins at a comfortable stroll, stop and take photos pace.

A Sydney must-do. What an amazing experience doing the bridge climb. We did a lunchtime climb, our next visit to Sydney we will do a night climb. Nowhere near as difficult a climb as I expected, felt very safe and comfortable the whole time. Brilliant guide Peter who was very humorous and informative. Sensational views as far as the Blue Mountains.

Bridge limb. My partner and I completed our first Bridgeclimb on a Monday morning early August 2015. It was an amazing experience and we recommend it to everyone able. Best to pay the extra and get the photo package but remember when you are up there that it gets you ten shots so be creative and have fun. These memories will be yours forever!
Fantastic experience. This was such a fantastic tourist experience. The views were wonderful, attention to safety meticulous and the guides were just superb. Loved every minute and worth every penny.

Relaxing; great seeing people enjoying themselves. Walked over the bridge on a beautiful day. Great photo opportunities. The view was spectacular. Good atmosphere. Very pleasant and what a treasure on the other side. Cafes, bakeries, quaint houses and lots of streets to explore. Have done this walk a couple of times.

Very Beautiful at Night. The first time I saw the Harbour Bridge from the window of my train I was like, "WOW!!!"...it was night and the bridge was lit up so beautifully. The next time I visited Circular Quay and I really loved looking up at it and especially the photos turn out great with the bridge as the background. I recommend you visit it twice, once in the day and second in the night to enjoy its complete beauty
Another must see Sydney attraction!. All the grandeur of this harbour bridge is a must see in Sydney. Numerous restaurants abound and you will have your selection of cuisine to your satisfaction.

One of the most spectacular bridges in the world. The Sydney Harbour bridge is without doubt one of the most best recognised bridges in the world. Its size is truely immense as it spans the north and south side of Sydney. You can walk across it, the entrance is just up from the Rocks area, you can climb over it, you can drive across it, travel across on a train, and even sail underneath it. Its a fantastic backdrop to an amazing skyline.

Awesome just the best Aussie experience so far.... We did the bridge climb with the bridge climb company, in January. The experience was awesome, the staff were just so supportive and helpful. Carol is afraid of heights, but with the support of the staff and the reassuring safety measures we managed the climb easily. The views are incredible and cannot be matched from anywhere else in Sydney. Whilst it took us about 3 or 4 hours it wasn't too strenuous, more a stiff walk than a climb really. Would recommend it to anyone fit enough to walk round a shopping precinct. If your in Sydney it is a must do...

A Sydney must do. Walking across the Sydney Harbour bridge on a sunny day is a fantastic experience. I gives you fantastic views of the opera house as well as the city skyline. Once over the bridge you have an alternative view of the city. You can then catch a ferry back to the over side from Luna Park.
Bucket List. Must take this walk if ever in Sydney. The experience from beginning to end was top notch. Beautiful view and climb was very exciting.
Not cheap,but worth it...... No way a cheap treat,but defo worth the effort,if you've got the cash,breathtaking views,knowledgable guides,very safe,in fact,looks way harder than it is...do it!!
Great walk ; superlative views. What a great place to walk. Great views of the harbour as well the Opera House. Feel the history as well as the present. Well worth the 20- 30 minutes.

Best view while walking. Fantastic walk and view. Easy to walk from either way. We walked from Milson Point train station. There is a few steps to go up to start/finish the walk. However after that it is easy walk. With the best views. Even tho there is wire on the side of the bridge you can take photos anywhere you like. This is a must while in Sydney

walking the bridge. Finally walked the bridge, all I can say is "awesome". Staff were brilliant and the experience was everything I thought it would be. Well worth the money. Would totally recommend it, will definitely do it again.
Nice walk and great view along the bridge. Nice view along the walk especially during this time of the year when it's not too cold but cooling.

Bridge Climb. This is a must do if you are in Sydney. It is not at all scary, even though it is a high climb. The guide, Maria, for our group was the best guide I have ever had. The whole thing is extremely well organized and thoroughly worth while.
Amazing , beautiful view . Walk across Sydney harbour bridge was a great experience for me ,the view from the top is extremely beautiful. What a marvelous work of engineering.
Iconic landmark in Sydney. Iconic landmark in Sydney. Well worth taking the Bridge Climb all the way to the top for a fantastic view either day or night.
