beautifull. lovely to look at and makes for very great pictures. It is possible to clim the bridge for a small fortune, I didi it many years ago when it was less expensive and it was very good, great views. Not worth 200 dollars in my opiniun.

Majestic bridge with a grand city skyline. A very majestic bridge blended with a nice city skyline. Here's some pics of this bridge taken at different times during dusk.. Including one from Sydney Tower!

bridge climb a must do.. This is a must do, how many other places give you such an opportunity?The whole set up is so professional and helpful from beginning to end of tour.It's quite funny as you sit and wait with your group waiting to be called to be kitted out and instructed, the look of fear on some of the faces was priceless!I,m not the greatest with heights but there was only really one point coming down was I concerned.Yes it's not cheap,but the views are amazing and you learn so much about the history of the bridge and the area.Cannot take your own camara but the ones they take are very good.

Is this not one of the best experiences. One for the bucket list and a must do is the Sydney Harbour Bridge. The badge climb us awesome and well worth the money.for the feint hearted the the walk across the bridge to the markets on the north shore is still worth the effort. The Bridge Climb not only gets you on top of the bridge but also you gain an understanding of the engineering and construction of the iconic coat hanger. The views of the greatest harbour in the world are fantastic.

Bike the bridge. Hired a bike from Bonzo Bikes (great valve, and good bike). Easy to get to the south side of the bridge. Very cool to ride across the bridge. The steps on the north side were a shock, but easy to get up and down with the concrete path in the middle. Bridge access is free.

A fun experience. A self guided tour, try taking a wander across Sydney's Harbour Bridge. Stop at the city end pylon and ride the levels to read up the history of this Sydney icon from inception to current. Beautiful on any day, as one experiences the different moods of this attraction.

Milestone Bridge. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is a landmark bridge and is extremely beautiful. There is a bridge climbing activity at the center of the bridge and the view from the top is one which can give jitters to a person.

A Great Sydney Experience. It was a real thrill climbing on this iconic structure and the views were fabulous. I have travelled a bit, but I cannot recall any other places with a similar opportunity. Stories about its construction are fascinating. It is somewhat pricey, but it is definitely worth the time. After the tour, take the free views from the pillar.

Dont miss it - absolute fabulous landmark. Possibly one of the most under-rated landmarks in the world, and not as celebrated as other less deserving ones.Called the Iron Lung when it was built, because it provided livelihoods to hundreds of construction workers and related services, for nearly a decade during the difficult depression.the bridge is indeed a fabulous marvel with pedestrian walk away. We didn't try the pylon or try going up the walkway - it certainly is not for the faint hearted.But the views of the bridge are unbeatable - its like watching a cinemascope supersized beyond IMAX. The evening view of the bridge from the LUNA park is unbeatable. Dedicate at least different parts of the day to view and visit thisbridge. Also recommend you walk around the bridge if you have the energy (go from the LUna park side as its easier to walk up)Don't miss it

Engineering at its best. Marvelous work of engineering. In conjunction with the opera house, what a perfect marriage. You can visit the bridge but I would recommend spending time walking round the bridge and towards the opera house. The guided tour for the bridge is quite expensive.
Pride of Australia. One of the most spectacular sights you will ever see, when in Oz you must see this place me and the family go once a year

Climb it, you have to. An icon - we decided to do the full bridge climb - 3.5 hours. What a memorable morning.Pop on your boiler suit, get kitted out and climb. We were disappointed it rained but the benefit...a rainbow over the opera house and our group photo showed it all.I have a fear of heights so the ladder part was horrid (going up and down) as was crossing the beams at the top of the bridge however I have the photo, the cap, the certificate and the memory. Done it once so never again but I am more than pleased I did it - a memory of our once in a lifetime holiday.The history of the bridge, the location and it being a worldwide icon makes it so special

Always a great sight. It is just a majestic sight but what I think is a pity that they really have commercialised the bridge. With tours and bridge climbing etc.Some things are best left alone. I feel it is a pity for this grand dame of bridges to be abused for commercial purposes. The construction is just awesome.

One of the most iconic bridges in the world. I didn't do the Bridge Climb as I found the cost a bit too pricey (I did a heli tour instead), however I would totally recommend the pylon lookout. Its cheap, and provides stunning 360 degree views of the city.
Wow. This has to be visited when you are in Sydney. It is iconic and lives up to expectations! Situated by the opera house you can take in the views of this wonderful country. Enjoy!

Iconic...Must Visit. Wee bit short of time, so couldn't do the full over the top and back bridge walk. If you're short of time or a bit fearful of the walk....do what we did, walk across (and back) the flat bit.......with the bonus it's free to do! Easily accessible and well sign-posted from The Rocks area - walk to the top of Argyle Street and pick up the signposts. You can also add in a trip up the pylon (a charge applies) hosting the story of the bridge and a viewing gallery at the top (approx. half the height from the bridge deck of the overall bridge height). Good to get a better understanding of the history behind the bridge and the views are stunning. Of course, you could also do the over the top walk and the bridge walk and fit in the pylon visit too!

Great Views by train!. This is a great idea for families and people on a tight budget. Catch the train from Central station across the bridge and for only a few dollars you get some of the best views in Sydney.

Quite hard to find the steps up to the deck.. Heading up from the Rocks takes a bit until you find the steps heading up to the deck.Too walk along the bridge is not too special, its loud and windy. We headed to the first Pylon and went up. (The best view of the Harbour!)Another great view of the bridge is taken from the ferries cruising the harbour, for example the Zoo Ferries.

Fantastic experience. Walking the bridge was amazing, time slots available were also impressive.. Fantastic experience. Walking the bridge was amazing, time slots available were impressive also. Could pick a time I wanted.
Iconic, just beautiful. it is huge, stunning, a beautiful piece of architecture set in a brilliant harbour, you can even go on a walking tour up the bridge.

An experience you must have in sydney. The walk across the harbour bridge is one of the most beautiful cross of nature and engineering wonders. On one side you have a huge blue harbour with white sail boats and on the other side you have huge iron pillars managing tons of vehicles and humans everyday! Must walk across the bridge once you are in sydney.
What a view!. Fantastic way to see all of Sydney, an experience not to be missed. We had a great guide who talked us through the history of the bridge and of Sydney itself. Highly recommended!

New heights. Even if you are afraid of heights this is for you. Both my husband & I don't do high things but for the most part of this climb you are within the bridge & by the time your climbing the arch you feel safe & secure and the view well….. absolutely fabulous.On arrival you are taken through the process, you are breathalysed, you change into "overall" style clothes.. you have a "harness" style cable & do a practise over an arch on the floor… then away you go… one of the best things to do in Sydney

Definitely worth it!. Although it is quite a pricey tour, it is absolutely phenomenal. We went on the dusk tour, where we made it up to the top of the bridge of sunset. There were amazing views of the city. The tour guides are very friendly, and they know lots of history past and present. For example our tour guide knew that Lady Gaga was staying at the Grand Hyatt when we were there, slightly creepy but also awesome!
Very nice view and walk. A very nice walk over water with superb view on Sydney. Good experience to visit when in Sydney, also an opportunity to get a sunny view of Sydney bay

As iconic as Tower Bridge, but better setting.. I wanted to go up the pylon of the bridge, but could'nt find the entrance despite following the signs and the map I had. Never mind! Instead I took a ferry to North Sydney and then had a pleasant walk of about a mile to Milson's Point train station just to take a southbound train that took me over the bridge. If you are given the chance to visit just one bridge, make it this one.

Climb the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Well, I was terrified. But determined to climb this bridge. Booked in for the twilight climb. Basically on the way up it was light, and on the way down it was dark. We had to get suited up first. So remember to wear comfy clothes. I had on gym pants and a singlet as it wasn't cold, so with the suit over the top I was a good temperature. Then we had to climb some stairs and do some safety training. Which is good, because that bridge is pretty high.Harnessed, suited and terrified we began. The guide was fantastic - educated, humourous and put me at ease really quickly. There was one scary part - the beginning. Once you get used to the noise of the traffic you get lost in the view. The harbour looks amazing from that height.You can't take your own camera - but the team gets photos of you. Could not recommend highly enough. Best way to see the Sydney Harbour.

Gorgeous to Look At. The bridge is gorgeous to look at. However, a walk across it was not as awesome as we thought it would be. We walked about half of it and then turned around. It's essentially a six-lane highway so you get a lot of noise pollution and true exhaust pollution. It's worth checking out, but I wouldn't carve out hours to walk the whole thing and back. The entrance stairs to gain access the to the bridge are a bit hidden so look closely or feel free to ask for directions!

You must do the bridge climb. And, you could do the bridge climb over and over if you go at different times. I highly recommend the morning sunrise climb, the daytime climb, the sunset climb and the night climb. The view is like nothing you will ever see for a city view and each of the times of day the view will look different. Buy the package with the professional photo from the top. You won't want to miss this even if normally cheesy.

HEADY HEIGHTS!..... WOW! This adventure was FABULOUS!....and I HATE heights!It was SOOO well organised there wasn't really time for my fear to creep up on me!I WAS afraid that I might FREEZE and spoil the walk for other people and I mentioned that as we checked in....I think this must have been filtered to our guide because she deliberately pulled me out to be first in our climbing line...ie. next to her....where she could be extra reassuring to me!...it worked!Before we were kitted out we were all breathalysed....I was called back to do another check...I HAD had a glass of wine but several hours before....the second check proved clear!....if it hadn't I would not have been allowed to do the walk!We were asked to remove rings, watches and anything that could potentially drop off ....to the road below!We were kitted out with jump suits and all sorts of paraphernalia....necessary equipment....and off we went!The initial climb is a little steep but not too daunting!...our young lady guide was FULL of knowledge which she imparted to us via our headsets. We were linked onto the main rail by a heavy clasp so there was NO danger of falling/slipping off!We had taken the option to walk ACROSS the bridge and down the other side....I write it like that as I thought we would walk right across the bridge and end up on the other side....but,actually walking ACROSS the bridge means you reach the apex and walk across the MIDDLE and down to where you came from! As we reached the top there was a bit of a hold up as there was a rather large group in front of us and they all wanted different photographs taken....by the professionals as personal cameras are not allowed!....in case they are dropped!Whilst we were waiting the sun was going down, the view was tremendous and my legs had stopped shaking!....then a firework display in town started,,,,just the icing on the cake!WONDERFULLY organised and worth every dollar!A MUST....even for those without a head for heights!

Worth walking once atleast. We walked up to the bridge from the Rocks. We have to climb a lot of stairs to reach the bridge footpath, but the climb is worthwhile. Once on the bridge, the view of the architectural structure of the bridge amazes everyone. The views of the Sydney harbour and of the Opera house are stunning. The cool breeze keeps us comfortable even after a long walk.

Superb!. Happy to see up-close & personal this engineering wonder. Well, it is just a bridge but is an icon. Stoked to see this in person & discovered that it is only supported by 4 strong bolts. Really amazing!

Well worth it!. Walking across the bridge is a must in Sydney! The views of the Opera House alone are worth it. I was surprised that it wasn't too crowded on a Saturday morning. It was a little longer than I expected, but well worth it!

A very long walk. As our hotel was very close my wife & I walked across the lower section. It's a very long walk so wear comfortable shoes. You get a great view of Sydney Harbour. We did not go on the upper tour where you walk across the top of the bridge. It;s quite expensive ($220 Aussie ) & you have to be in great shape to make that trek.

Nice walk and photo oportunities. We returned for our second visit to Sydney this year and once again walked over the bridge. It is simply an awesome experience to do so. We took stunning photos of the harbour below and enjoyed the chance to get a little exercise. There were a little less people than last year, and we enjoyed every moment.

An Iconic Bridge in Sydney. I just got home from sydney. The same as with all the tourist, I also went to the bridge. I stayed at Novotel Darling Harbour, so to get to the bridge, I walk about 10 minutes to George street and there is a free bus station to circular quay. And I took 2 hours boat tour around harbour bridge and opera house.
Great Views. If offers breathtaking views and you can also walk along it and do the harbour bridge walk where you walk above the traffic which looked pretty awesome

Love seeing this icon!. When people say Sydney, this amazing bridge always springs to my mind! It sit so perfectly over the harbour and I could never get sick of checking it out.If you have the time, make sure you do the Bridge Climb (I did it on a previous trip) - the views on offer whilst climbing the bridge are spectacular.

Iconic Bridge. Iconic Bridge at the heart of Sydney. We did the Bridge Climb, which was quiet fun. But it was at a hefty cost ($328 AUD). If you don't feel like spending that kind of money, go to the Pylon Lookout at the beginning of the arch of the bridge. For $13 AUD, you get to go up the Pylon and get a great view of the bridge, the Sydney Opera House, and the high rises of Sydney.

Very nice walk!. We walked the bridge in July, it was pretty cold, but beautiful and felt very safe from the traffic. We had great views of the Opera House and it was just beautiful scenery all the way across.

great view ,nice place to walk.. the bridge is very safe to walk across ,there is walking lanes on the outer sides away from traffic ,great pace to watch the cruse ships come into the harbor .I wasnt brave enough to do the bridge climb but it looks like a perfect photo op .

Breathtaking views. Took the tour just before sunset. Nice preparation information session before walking on the bridge. The climb was not too hard, and too scary until a subway train went by. The tour guides were very nice and took pictures of everyone and of different combinations for families. This is definitely the highlight of our Ausatrlian visit.

Once in a lifetime!. Having heard from other friends who'd traveled to Oz that this was a must, we couldn't agree more! This was a tip-top operation; timely, efficient and most reassuring regarding the safety piece. We even received extra clothing because it was a chilly and breezy day! Our guide, Graham, was wonderful as he lead us through the ins and outs to the summit of the bridge. The views were incredible and the entire event was truly a "once in a lifetime" experience!

A must do walk. The gruelling steep climb to the top of the bridge didnt appeal so we decided on the walk (beside highway) a very safe, easy 15 - 20 minutes. The views were as spectacular as what you would have that bit higher, but without the huff and puff. Kirribilli at the other end, is lovely , perfect for lunch or coffee at one of the many cafes. A short walk to the Luna Park ferry for the 10 minute ride back to Circular Quay completes a very pleasant few hours.

Beautiful but a bridge. I love architecture and the bridge is a lovely specimen of human achievement. But in comparison to many of the wonderful bridges throughout the US and Europe it somehow has lost of its pizzazz. We took the free bus (555) to the harbour and walked around to view the bridge and Opera house as well as the botanical gardens. Worth a look and a photo opportunity but most things related to the bridge are expensive (ie climbing it) so recommend just taking out half a day and walking around the different vantage points for photo opportunities. Still a must see!

Go by bicicle, great view. If you have the opportunity, take a bike I try to cross the bridge during the sunset, it is a very good experience. It is really one of the best places to see the sunset in Sydney.

an enjoyable achievement!. Stunning views, fun climb, interesting commentary, friendly and professional guide and staff, highly organized, an experience that you have to do once in your lifetime! Expensive but worth it!For ages 10 and above.

Every perspective is possible . We were not booking a climbing tour but you can see the bridge from everywhere around the harbour. A ferry goes from main harbour to darling harbour, it's 13 dollars and starts from wharf 4(?!). It's a good price for cruising around 25 minutes through the whole area under the bridge and near the luna Park and operahouse.

Great Aerial View. I’ve gone across the bridge several times by car or by train, and passed under it a few times by ferry. I saw it many times from Circular Quay and Opera House, and also saw the people climbing the bridge. But as for me, its aerial view is the best. Every time when our flight approached Sydney Airport, I hoped to see the bridge through the window. Last time when I was returning from Tokyo, I was so glad to see it under the bright morning sun.
Got an engaged here. I have been here many times but my favourite was when my fiancé proposed to me ,afterwards went down to opera bar for dinner which was fantastic for a Saturday. Night

Absolutely fantastic!. The best experience of my life! I never imagined doing the bridge climb with me being so terrified of heights but I'm so glad I did this. Our guide was amazing, looked after us all the way and constantly reassured myself and the rest of the group how safe we were. Getting to the top was fantastic - the views were breath taking. If you get the chance to do this, then do it! Bit on the pricey side but worth it a hundred times over.

great walk, amazing view.. Caught the ferry from Circular Quay over to Luna Park. From there about a 600m easy walk to the end of the grassed area beneath the bridge, to find the stairs which take you onto the bridge. A fantastic walk across which takes about 10 mins, ending up with some winding stairs down through the rock face down to The Rocks where there are amazing restaurants and cafes. Not hard going, my son managed it on crutches! Highly recommended.

The Bridge Climb is a MUST. Loved every moment of the climb, very exhilarating. I did the express climb which took 2 half hours found it very easy going. The briefing was very thorough with a breath test required all the guides are very safety conscious and dedicated. You are hooked to a cable which runs along a wire the whole distance, views are spectacular.
A must do. So much fun, informative and hey how many people can say they've climbed it, awesome experience, friendly fun staff reasonable price

"a little pricey .. but WOW". Time your tour to coincide with the sunset as you make your way back. You may be able to save quite a bit of money as there is a premium fee added when the tour starts right before sunset

Brilliant views, nice trip, bit e xpensive. I prebooked this bridge climb just a few days before after I had checked the weather forecast, you don't want to be doing this in the rain. The bridge itself is impressive and the bridge walk is not for those with a fear of heights. There are open catwalks to negotiate before actually starting on the arch climbing bit which has a solid floor. (Except for a couple of cross members you have to go over) The views are stunning and it's well worth the trip. The staff are friendly and helpful and you are looked after very well in terms of your safety and the kit you are given to use. The only downside to this trip is that I feel it is very very expensive at about $850 for three adults and a picture package !!! Yikes. But if you are only every going to do this once, then I guess you just have to do it. There is only one company offering this trip so you can't shop around for prices.
Great view. The bridge is a Sydney icon and should not be missed when visiting Sydney. The walk across the bridge is great as is the Bridge Climb.
Stunning views. We walked across the bridge which offered great views of the harbor. We did not do the bridge climb.
Nothing else quite like clinbing the bridge. I must see & do climb the bridge with spectacular views over sydney during the day or at night for pure magic.

Sydney Harbour Bridge. I went there with a friend a couple of weekends ago when I just arrived to Sydney, and I must say it was quite the experience. Unfortunate for my friend and I we didn't climb the bridge. But since we're both staying here in Sydney I'm sure we'll have time for that. Though we really should do it off season since it's quite expensive. Anyway, visiting the bridge is an absolute must if you're visiting Australia, it's so massive and really quite impressive, and I'm guessing I'll only find it more impressive if I climb it!

Romantic Getaway.. Great place for eating out, many restaurants to choose from. So much activities, highly motivated area. Fun,fun,fun....Dont go when processions on. crowed will make you loose your partner.

Really Enjoyed this Walk. We spent some time in the Rocks and then made our way up to the bridge to walk over it. It was really pretty and had great views of the city. I think this is a must do in Sydney. You'll see the city and the Opera House. We did it during the sunset and then spent sometime getting dinner on the other side. Then we walked back across when it was dark. We were there during Vivid so the lights were amazing. But the views are great anyways. I'm not sure why people pay to go up in the tower. We did not and I see no reason to go higher. And I can't for the life of me figure out why people pay $250+ to climb to the top of the bridge and cameras aren't allowed for that tour. We didn't think there was any reason to go higher than the street level and along the walking path and we are very happy with our decision. But definitely walk across this bridge and then go under the bridge on the other side.

Iconic Landmark. Whether you are travelling over it, across it and under it or viewing from a distance you know you are in Sydney when you see the Harbour Bridge. Great pictures from Luna Park looking towards the opera house.

It's big!. The sheer size of the bridge is breathtaking. What a magnificent engineering feat! You can walk on it, over the arch, drive across it or take a train across it - all offer a different experience :)

Another must do in Sydney. Here you have a couple of different options and if you can, do all of them :) you can:1. take a train to Milson's Point and have a picnic under the bridge, from Kirribili you have a view not only of the bridge but of the entire Circular Quay and the Opera House. 2. cross the bridge on foot3. take a boat cruise4. climb up the bridge
Bridge climb. Fantastic way to view the most beautiful harbour in the world! The climb is not strenuous. Lots of time to enjoy the views.

"Must see" during visit of Sydney. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is an icon of the city and a "must-see," offering spectacular views of the city Opera House, and ferries coming in/out of Circular Quay. I suggest walking the bridge as the sun goes down and as the city lights come on.Follow this up with riding the ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbor to see the bridge from a different perspective. On Sundays, the Family Funday pass allows for unlimited travel on all trains, busses and ferries in the city for A$2.50 per person.Walking the bridge is free. For those who want a to get a higher view, there is the Pylon Lookout for A$13, or BridgeClimb that will harness you as you walk across the steel frame of the bridge. This adventure costs A$148-368, depending on time and day of the week.

Superlative. Aesthetically pleasing, impressive in its scale. Interesting history and what I loved most was the incredible capacity. To know that when it was first being designed, there were only 5 cars in Sydney....Bike path, footpath, cars 6 lanes? Plus 2 tram lanes become car lanes, plus train tracks. Did the Bridge Climb as well as rode across it on a bike tour. Not enough time to go up into the pylon. Great attraction, and it's also actually a bridge.

Sydney, Up!. It was a perfect day with a clear sky, cool weather and timing; and it was one of the most unforgettable experience that I had when I was in Sydney; (it’s hard to choose between cute Marsupials and natural scenery.) The entire tour takes around 3 hours including the time to gear up and pre-bridge climb briefing. In fact, the Bridge Climb website has a lot of information, which I recommend all participants to read it, get prepared before the climb.Afterthoughts: http://wp.me/p5Lw9a-dr

Sydney Up!. It was a perfect day with a clear sky, cool weather and timing; and it was one of the most unforgettable experience that I had when I was in Sydney; (it’s hard to choose between cute Marsupials and natural scenery.) The entire tour takes around 3 hours including the time to gear up and pre-bridge climb briefing. In fact, the Bridge Climb website has a lot of information, which I recommend all participants to read it, get prepared before the climb. Afterthoughts: http://wp.me/p5Lw9a-dr
Bridge walk. A long walk but amazing as the sun is setting to take photos of the opera house and harbour. Quite interesting to see what the bridge is made of and everything.

The guide made it!. This was our main must do activity when we booked to visit Sydney. We were very lucky on two counts. The day that we climbed the weather was kind and it was an extremely clear day. Our climb leader was a guy called Mitch, he was a stereotypicall Aussie bloke and was very funny. He ensured that this experience exceeded our expectations.
An architecture and and old bridge. Another site that you are happy to be visiting for the first time then it immediately looks like any other bridge after the visit.

Brilliant view. You can have a few ways to tour this site.First, I take the cruise to pass underneath. Terrific view and breathtaking view angle of the bridge.Second, I take the view from the opera. Great phototaking area.Third, u may try to climb up the bridge to have a panorama view of Sydney.I hope I can go again during new year for firework photo.

Nothing else like it. Whether you are an avid explorer, budding photographer, thrill seeker or just looking for something different to do with your partner or friends, you cannot go past the climb up Sydney Harbour Bridge.I have done it three times now, day time, sunset and evening...each have their own advantages, but on a clear day all are amazing.Overlook an amazing city, enjoy the views and get some fantastic exercise.
Symbol of Sydney!. must see! reserve a full day.. climb & walk around, you will not regret.. take the ferry ride to see the full bridge view from far...

Tourists should walk the top of the Bridge. I would highly recommend tourists to walk across the top of the bridge (if you aren't afraid of heights). It is a great way to see Sydney on the most iconic infrastructure in Sydney.If you are a Sydneysider.. don't bother, its a 2-3 hour history lesson.

Stratosphere Sydney. We had a breathtaking guide, climbing the outer arches of the Bridge and also traversing the arches three times. The tour guide was very friendly and knowledgeable recounting the history of the bridge, this was very interesting. The climb itself was very easy and recommend it to everyone.

Impressive!. The structure in itself is impressive, and it is no surprise that Sydney is identified with the harbour bridge...it is truly eye-catching! The bridge climb was too expensive for us and we were also not confident about it with our young child, however the normal pedestrian walk across the bridge was exhilarating enough for us. The views are good, we walked across after sunset and enjoyed good views of the city lights. This walk is especially impressive during the Sydney Light Festival when we can see the sails lighting up with beautiful designs as well... It was a pity that we had to carry our baby buggy up and down the stairs to the bridge.
Amazing bridge walk. This trip is well worth the money and effort. You get to take a walk to the apex of the bridge. Unbelievable views

Nice view but not overwhelming. I walked from Milsons Point towards the city. You are almost fully enclosed by steel and safety netting all the way across with a small gap underneath to take unobstructed pictures of the harbour and opera house. One slight disappointment was the $13 fee to climb to the top of one of the support pylons to get a wonderful view of the opera house. I thought it was very expensive for a long tiring climb to the top.Although this walk is a must for tourists, to me it was a little disappointing

Stunning. This is another great experience but a bit pricey. You can marvel at the bridge for free or you can walk on it, either way you can't go wrong. Definitely not for someone who is afraid of heights though!
Fantastic Views. Not for the faint hearted, a quite gruelling trip for the unfit(me)! But giving a memorable experience.
Sydney Bridge. We climbed up the pylon. There was a great view at the top. My children and I enjoyed seeing how the bridge was built. It was interesting and worthwhile doing.

Beautiful metal structure. A huge structure. when lights illuminate it in the evening, it looks impressive. We did not take the climb as we have too young kids. They say its okay of the kids to climb but we were afraid.Many ferries passing by. Can take a ferry to darling harbour, as it will go under the sydney harbour bridge and you will have another beautiful view of the same.

Walked the Bridge. Excellent Day waling the bridge, joining the sunset walk.Staff is very professional. Even though it was a bit rainy at times the 3 hour walk was still worth it.It was not scary at all and we found it to be very easy, with lots of stops and time to look.The only bad thing was that i could not take my camera.
Dont miss seeing. Great to walk across the bridge and see the harbor. It is picturesque as we were led to believe. Very beautiful city.

Harbour Bridge Climb....AMAZING!. I did the sunset harbour bridge climb with my partner. At first I thought it was expensive for what we were doing but looking back on it I would have paid double! This is a beautifully unique experience that you will never forget. My tour guide was the perfect combination of fun and knowledgable. We bought the photos that are now are favorite of all time. DO IT!

Route to Bondi Beach across this Bridge.. I believe this is the second largest suspension bridge after the Golden Gate bridge in San Francisco. I drove across it a few items and the exits will probably get you lost like I was a couple times. Don't worry though. Eventually you will find your way.

Bridge walk. Liked it all, well recommended, a must do, excellent views Safety talk very good had to wear all the gear even got to keep some of it excellent commentary with plenty of stops on route well impressed
Harbour Bridge. I have walked over the bridge drove over it passenger in a bus and on a train .. I have not walked to the top of the bridge
Good to visit!!. Really nice. The harbour bridge is really huge and gigantic. This place is a worth a visit to get a view of the city skyline. I even enjoyed visiting at night.
Harbour bridge. Fantastic views and great walk, well worth doing the harbour bridge climb especially the twilight climb. Catch the ferry to Luna park for more great views

bridge climb. I've done many thongs over the years but this has to be one of the best.all staff very helpful and the climb itself is not rushed had plenty of time on the upward climb to watch the world go by and take in the fantastic views of SydneyYes it is expensive but well worth every penny

Marvalous peice of architecture!!!!. Walking across the bridge is a Life time experience. View of Sydney and Opera House is amazing from the bridge.
Worth every step you take on It.
What an awesome place to go. If its a Harbour bridge climb or simply walking or riding over the Sydney Harbour bridge its an experience and the view is totally awesome.
Great Steel land markm. Great landmark with real history a flat walk of roughly two miles there and back .Got to be done somyoumcan at least say you did it.
Iconic. Before there was the Opera House, this was THE symbol of Sydney Harbour. But it remains recognizable; see a picture of it and you think Sydney. But it still has to be seen "live".

Gateway to Sydney. Unfortunately it was during a big storm with high winds and torrential rains. We walked up the stairs to the bridge walkway and continued back towards the Circular Quay area. Beautiful views of the harbour and Sydney Opera House. It also provided a good overview of the down-town core of Sydney.
Must do. Not only do you need to see the bridge you really need to climb it, this was one of my best experiences and if you are scared of heights by the time you have finished you won't be

Bridge Climb. Highly recommend the bridge climb. I have a fear of heights, but I felt no fear on the climb. It is well organized and the views from the top are spectacular. The climb is not very strenuous.

Exciting climb. I have climbed the bridge 4 times and have loved each time. I have experienced extremely strong winds, beautiful clear perfect days and one evening climb. All as good as each other. The staff are always helpful, very friendly and very informative. The last climb was a '3 generation climb' with my daughter and grand daughter, so very proud to have done that! Hopefully there will be more as my other grand children get older.

Look on with wonder. Sydney Harbour Bridge is spectacular in its own right but set against the harbour it is even more impressive.I would recommend walking over the bridge to Kirribilli and also paying to climb up the Pylon Tower where you get great views for $10 instead of the $250 bridge climb.
Interesting architect. I took a bus from Whale beach area to the city and passed by the Harbour Bridge. It's interesting to actually been through the bridge and see it from afar!
the bridge. were on bycycle tour on the bridge, too many tourists on the bridge, even in winter (july), I think it is overrated, but the view is nice.

Have to see it!. Some Aussies told me, "It's just a bridge." But it is so much more than that. It's an awesome, magnificent structure. On our ferry ride we crossed below it and got some photos from all angles, making it seem like we were so much closer to it. It's much bigger than I expected it to be. If I hadn't been with my 92 year old mom I would have climbed it or walked it. That looked fun!

Pylon Lookout climb Sydney Harbour Bridge. Decided not to do the bridge climb, instead walked from the Rocks to the Pylon Lookout, the steps are not too bad, you can go as slow or fast as you wish! $13 entrance fee. This is the original Sydney lookout, and can highly recommend. Lots of history from the beginning of the building of the bridge. Photographs and maps, panoramic views of Sydney and you are able to take your own camera!

I CONQUER BRIDGE CLIMB. i did joined the bridge climb which had 1300 steps more or less and i did it at night, it was an unforgettable experience so to speak. Try for yourself i recommend at night to enjoy the sydney lights.

Bridge Climb. Whilst it is some time now since I climbed the Sydney Harbour Bridge, I will always remember this amazing experience - the highlight of our 5 days in Sydney. The preparation by the staff was thorough and I felt totally safe and secure the whole time. I highly recommend taking the opportunity to do the climb. You won't be disappointed!

Wonderful view and lots of history. Climb the bridge. Yep, you won't regret it! The walking tour isn't very strenuous and the guide we had was fantastic. The views from the bridge were incredible. The downside- you can't take your own camera for fear of dropping it onto traffic or people below.

Go up the South Eastern Plyon Great View. Take the time to go up the south eastern pylon, remember to take your camera.It is worth the steps to see a great view of Sydney and take your time while you are up there.Better value than the bridge climb ( A lot cheaper, you can take your camera and you can stay up there as long as you like )

There's never a Bridge to far. The very sight of this Giant of a Bridge fill one's heart with the achievement that went into building such a splendid girl. You have to see it to to understand just how proud Australia should be at this magnificent structure. The view from the harbor and the walk to this bridge is worth the time spent. You could also walk up the bridge for a small fee, we missed out as it was nearly sundown. But we enjoyed the view of this very lovely girl. I wish I could find the pictures to share with you, but go see this beautiful structure and it will stay in your mind for a long while.

Iconic Sydney Landmark. This is an iconic Sydney landmark and a must see. The great thing is that it is easy to catch some breathtaking views of it from a number of locations around Sydney. As a tourist Circular Quay and The Rocks provide great vantage spots from land or if on a ferry from the harbour itself. By car you can drive over the bridge and I believe you can also walk across it. Not that I did.If your out and about in the surrounding waterfront suburbs sights of the bridge are easy to spot.A trip to Sydney isn't complete without at least one sighting.
sydney harbour bridge. went under it /over it watched some climed it (not for me dont like heights but if you do give it a go
view of a bridgeWow iconic site. to see the coat hanger for real wow. And even bigger wow to those brave enough to walk up it, sorry I'm not that brave, bet the view is fantastic
Bridge climb. A must do in Sydney, not cheap but do the full climb or express, the sampler is a waste. The views and commentary are brilliant, thanks Helen, our guide.

Great but expensive . I went with my brother but wouldn't have otherwise. Both French we are travelling around Australia and have seen more extraordinary landscape without having to pay 200-300aud for it... Nice experience but not a must-do if you visit Sydney! The walk from Cremorne to Mosman via Taronga Zoo, Spit bridge to Manly, Coogee to Bondi or even the scenic walk in the Royal National Park offer amazing and mind-blowing views (for free!)
Best place to drive. Drive & Experience Sydney Harbour bridgeNarrow lanesVehicle moving fastLane for train which connect people to both side of bridgelooks even better when it's raining
Experience plus. We did the dusk climb to watch the sun set over the Blue Mountians. Had a wonderful experience and the climb itself was very easy. The staff are very helpful and you are not rushed

Better to look at then to walk on. The price to climb the bridge was too much for us walking across it was ok but I wouldn't make the journey again to many other sites to visit on a walking path..it is beautiful to look at especially at night.

Tour of Oz July 15. If you have 3.5 hours to spare this is one attraction you have to do! Very professional setup to get you on the bridge safely. The views are magnificent and the commentary from our guide very informative!

Beautiful views of the city and water.. It was a great way to see the city and water activity. It was very nice and relaxing to be able to look out and see the whole view. After crossing the bridge we walked further and got a boat back to the harbor. It was very enjoyable.

Seniors and family Walk across Harbour Bridge. A highlight of Sydney. Train to Milson Point (interesting picture of bridge on Southern end on platform) then go to East Side of concourse to walk up approx 50 steps. Take you time as there is no rush (Steps are a great picture especially groups). Walking across enjoy the spectacular views of Sydney Harbour and Opera House. Note all the movement, ferries, sailing boats and speed/motor boats and at times large cruise ships. At night view the spectacular city lights of the city. There are 2 exits one which bring you down to The Rocks area the other via a lift at the eastern end of Circular Quay. On the way if time permits and you and your group could walk up the Pylon. (Great information about the harbour bridge) all for under $15 pp.

See her in all her glory!. The bridge is as amazing from afar as up close! Highly reccommend if you have time to take part in the bridge climb and see her in all her glory! Not only an amazing icon of Sydney but also one of an amazing deisgn and past!

Just amazing. Amazing to walkover, climb or sit and eat under at Ripples just outside Luna Park. The bridge climb is well worth it but a tad expensive (Still recommend). However you can climb the Pylons for free and have an amazing view of the harbour.

Good veiw of the harbour. Apart from being an icon of Sydney, it is a great place you can see the city. You can walk across the bridge on the eastern side ( cycle across on the western side). The eastern side shows the city off well. The veiw from sunrise to night is delightful. You can walk up the southern pylon (at a cost). Which improves your view out to the ocean. I took my grandchildren and they where impressed too.

A Bridge so close!. So uniqe in every way! It looks like a hanger, my daughter and her cousins went to the Top, this is not for the faint of heart (like me), I enjoyed just looking at it and all the vistas around it. I love this city!

Don't Let Fear Stop You. I have a morbid fear of bridges, but this was the lovely lady that enticed me to attempt to overcome that fear! The walk across "The Coathanger" is suitable for those a low-medium level of fitness if you can tolerate steps, lots of steps. The walk across the bridge (footpath not up in the rafters like all of the thrill-seeking grey jump-suited daredevils) is quite pleasant and the view is amazing. If you walk at night, there is security and it is very safe. For those who want a better view, be sure to visit the lookout in the south pylon, not many people seem to know about it, it is a much cheaper (and less terrifying) alternative to the bridge climb.

It's great the first time . It's amazing don't get me wrong though what's all the hype about Do the bridge walk you would love it but it's something you only do once I'd rather go on a boat ride or on a train this way I'll be able to view it' in its glory and get the full pic of it

Go for the tour it is well worth it. We actually climbed to the top of Sydney Harbour bridge, You do not realise how big it is until you get to the top and look down on the opera house.We went in on one of their organised climbs, first of all you put an overall on and then a harness belt. you are then given various items that you clip to the harness including headphones so that you can listen to your guide.You are then a health and safety talk. They lead you to the special walkways where you are clipped on to a safety rail that you are attached to all the time. There are two walks one takes you to see the workings and finally the top, the other is scenic all the way. Even looking down on the traffic beneath you is amazing.Finally at the top you have your photo taken by the guide. Looking down the Opera house you realise how high you are.
One of the symbolic sites of Australia.. If you are feeling energetic you can walk up the bridge - but there are a lot of steps - amazing view, so go for it !
Climbing this is a heart stopper. My nephew and his wife climbed this as we chickened out but what a beautiful structure. Awesome day here. Must see and do if you dare.

You have to do this!. Did the Bridge climb, what an experience. Don't mind heights, but even the more timid in our group felt secure as you are attached by a safety line for the entire climb and descent. Not as demanding physically as I had imagined. You gain height quickly by climbing ladders, before you walk up the curved span. View from the top is amazing. Well worth the cost.
wow and wow. We did the night walk and the tour was fantastic staff extremely pleasant and helpful from start to finish.well worth the cost

Love the architecture, paid tour is way over priced, free tour is better option. Pedestrian can walk on the bridge without any charge. You will see stunning scenery. Senior visitors please be aware of stairs walking.The paid tour to climb/ walk up walk high on the bridge is exciting, but the price is way overly expensive. We would rather save that money for international flight tickets. Well, true that there isn't lack of tourist paying a fortune to up there. We spoke to a group of them, they all think it is overly expensive, but somewhat worth to try, doubtful on second visit.You will like the scenery, that's for sure.

Great sunset views / photo ops from Sydney Opera / Botanic Gardens. Beautiful iconic piece of Sydney! We saw the bridge from our ferry out of Circular Quay to Taronga Zoo, then again on our way back and stuck around the Opera House / Botanic Gardens area in order to photograph it at sunset. Stunning! And the good part is you don't really have to go out of your way to take it in!

Well worth the cost.. Do the climb. I am not a fan of heights but at no stage did the climb worry me at all. Well worth the effort and money too. After you have done it you will be so amazed at yourself that you actually did it. At the top it is a paradise for photos.

What a View!. Don't worry if you don't like heights. This is the most amazing experience. The climb is very safe and easy - even for a senior like me! If you don't look down, you wouldn't know you were so high up but you are attached to a safety rail and the views are just fantastic.
An Eyecon of Sydney. We say the Sydney Harbour Bridge whilst on the Ferry which enabled us to get some really great photos of the Bridge.

It just... is.. As with the harbour and the opera house, you have to see the bridge while a tourist in Sydney, because you're in Sydney and it the harbour bridge... and after the opera house its on every other aussie postcard! But it is just sort of... there. Its exciting to see as part of the Sydney skyline, but not something worth making a special detour to see.
stunning. climbed it...it was the best experience ever....you cant take anything up with you, but the guides are more than happy to make sure you get great shots safely....well worth the price

climb the bridge. What can I say !! Climbing Sydney Harbour Bridge was an absolute dream come true for me.The climb starts with an hours tuition on safety, dendurance, helping each other up the climb and most of all enjoying the whole experience.The leaders of the climb instill confidence and enthusiasm, all health and satety aspects, support and lots and lots of fun.

Bridge climb. Really enjoyed the Bridge Climb. It's quite expensive but luckily I got it as a present so didn't have to worry about it. It's in or around $250. We did the 3pm one so when we were coming back down the sun was starting to set which was nice. It takes about 3 hours in total and at least 2 hours of that was spent on the bridge. You get plenty of time to enjoy the experience and take in the views which was great. The views were fantastic! It's not a difficult walk, I thought it would be but it's all gradual steps so it's fine. It's not scary either unless you have a serious fear of heights you're fine. Our group only had 6 people which was brilliant but the guide said there are usually about 16. Our guide was brilliant, really informative, interesting, good fun and easy to listen to. You get a cap to keep afterwards, a group photo and a ticket for the pylon lookout which also gives great views. I really enjoyed the bridge climb, it was even better than I expected. What I loved most was the amount of time given on the bridge to just look around and enjoy it without being pushed on or hurried.

Fantastic!. I enjoyed it so much, it was great fun!!!! Whenever I am in Sydney I send a big smile to the top of the bridge! It wasn't as hard as I thought and I loved the view from the top! A great experience and a "must see".

Must do experience . I can recommend this to any body thinking of doing it, staff were excellent and very informative.
The walk up to the top of the bridge was relatively easy and the views from the top were fantastic.
What a view. I only walked a little bit of this but I did do the bridge climb and went under it by boat so I saw this bridge from every possible view its a must see what ever way you go to see it.

The iconic Sydney Harbour Bridge. What more can be said about the Sydney Harbour Bridge that hasn't already been said? It links the north with the south, spanning one of the most beautiful harbours in the world. But not just something to look at, it can be walked, climbed, driven over, sailed under, at it's base in the Rocks you can eat within its shadow. The bridge is a welcoming beacon for people who've travelled from around the world or around the corner.

AMAZING. im not scared of heights i am scared of falling off heights we had a great time my friends and i went to the Sydney harbour bridge and climbed it was so much fun!!! first you meet an instructor who tells you what you will be doing also calming you down with some funny jokes. Before the climb we got to practice doing everything in a big room with practice stairs for climbing up and down, practice bars to attach the buckle on and headphones so that you can hear the instructor. We went on the climb at sunset and other than the fact i should have worn more clothes (it was really cold) it was the most beautiful view i've every seen!! totally recommend it foe everyone who likes long walks above a bridge!
Beautiful site!. We enjoyed visiting the Sydney Harbour Bridge. We also did the bridge climb which was much more thrilling. One of the "must see" sites in Sydney.

Impressive. We walked the bridge and it was a great experience. Great views of the river and the opera house. Impressive structure. Our boys climbed one of the towers and I can recommend it as the view from the top is amazing.
Nice day out across the bridge. We opted to walk across the bridge and not over it. Was a good walk, view is somewhat obscured by the fencing, but still well worth it.

Bridge Climb. We climbed the bridge for our anniversary. It was an amazing once in a life time opportunity. We captured incredible views at the time the sun was setting. Make sure you do the last day time climb and you get to see a little bit of sunset and the sun over the city and water.Our tour guide was good. I think they should group people according to age with who they climb with. We were with 4 16year olds.All in all, we wouldn't pay to do it again but we are glad we can tick it off our bucket list!
A MasterPiece. A Sydney harbour bridge is a master piece. An example of engineering excellence. You can use this bridge to cross the Sydney harbour either by road or by train or by walking.

Lower, Free Bridge Trek. Didn't do the up high, pricey Bridge Walk (which looks like fantastic FUN!), but just walked over to North Sydney. Great perspective of the harbour below and the Opera House, etc. It's free and north Sydney is cool. Check out Luna Amusement Park. There is a ferry stop there so you can cruise back to CQ or take the train back. Time well spent.

Bucket List Experience. This is a once-in-a-lifetime experience. On holiday in Sydney my wife, myself and two twelve year old boys did the bridge climb. We were apprehensive for so many reasons. I am not in great shape, my wife is afraid of heights. Having completed the climb, we would absolutely do it again. The guides are friendly, enthusiastic and full of knowledge about the bridge. It was fun to learn all about the bridge, it's history, it's stats, all while taking in the unique views of Sydney Harbour. The weather in Sydney was not good while we were there. We were afraid they would not conduct tours in the rain. We were wrong. They operate in rain or shine. I felt so safe during the climb. This is a must for any visitor to Sydney.

Did the "Express Climb". My friend and I did the Express Climb on the Bridge Climb. "Express" vs "Regular" Climbs:- 10 vs 14 in a group- 2.25 hours vs 3.5 hours- 500 less steps! (but still have to climb over 1,000 stepsYou are not allowed to bring any loose items with you (e.g. cell phones or cameras) because if anything fell, you'd hit cars underneath.It was a lot of fun and spectacular views of the Harbour and you can tell the tour guides simply love their jobs! Another must do in Sydney.

Bridge Climb is a MUST DO!!!. We walked across the bridge on foot, and we also did the Twilight Sydney Bridge Climb with Dean as our guide. The Bridge Climb is exceptional, and a "must do" in Sydney. It's expensive, but well worth the money! The views are amazing! The feeling of accomplishment is surreal, and the pictures that they take are fantastic! I would highly recommend Dean as a guide as he was funny, experienced, professional, and informative.

Great day out!!. We chose to get the train across to Milson's Point (1st station on the north side of the bridge)..,grabbed a coffee & hot chocolates for our sons & walked back across the bridge to the city. It was a perfect day so the harbour looked amazing. There are great informative boards along the walk sharing the history of the majestic bridge .

It is all that is supposed to be. Must Do. The best. Very well organized. We had a blast. What an amazing experience. The trip is very well organized. Safety is the their top concern. You get to walk out on the bridge over all the traffic. Weather was not the best, but that again is is no one's control. Highly recommended.

Get a view from the pylon. The harbor bridge is one of the "must-do's" if you're visiting the harbor / quay. It's a fair bit of walking to get through the rocks and onto the bridge but it's well worth it. Every time I go to Sydney heading to the bridge is on my list. Fun fact - you can climb the pylon and get a great 360 degree view of the entire harbor (as well as learn a little about the bridge construction). It's good to do because it costs $13 AUS and most tourists don't want to pay to climb up there so there aren't really crowds trying to get their photo of the opera house from the bridge's walkway. Lots of steps but well worth it for the views ( without paying a few hundred $ to do the bridge climb).

Bridge Climb. This was my second time and there was an "express option" available this time. I liked this option as I have a a bit of a height phobia. Not having to climb up the bridge pillars was much nicer. The trip was much quicker but hit all the highlights. A must do when in Sydney. Wear good walking shoes and don't worry about anything else they have it handled right down to your glasses leash.

A walk in the clouds. My husband and son did the bridge climb in the afternoon and were able to watch the sun set over the harbor. They loved the info their tour guide provided, and thought this tour a highlight of our trip to Australia.

Spectacular View. Went to Sydney Habour Bridge as I headed to Sydney Opera House for tour. Got a chance to catch a glimpse of the bridge before I went for the tour and I thought it was.. hmm.. just alright. Not until I ended the tour and the sun is almost setting, the view is really spectacular! My next place to go is Luna Park which gave me even more chance to have great view of the bridge.Tips: If you want nice pictures and views of the bridge, stay throughout the sunset and during sunset, go and get a ferry ride!!

Great walk on the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Loved the sheer beauty of the walk on the bridge....stunning views of Sydney CBD, the sea and the Opera House.....close-up view of the architectural beauty of The Rocks too....highly recommend this one...

beautiful. Actually this bridge is wonderful with the sea, and you can sea the opera of sydney and sydney city. during the night, it s fantastic. but you need to pay for go with your car. it s for that i put 4 stars

Must do.. Walked across the bridge and then took the train across the bridge back to the CBD. Great way to take in the size of the bridge and get great photos of the Opera house and naval shipyard. Drove across it on laater date just to experience all modes of transportation!

Great valje. I received the bridge climb as a birthday present and I really enjoyed it. The guide was really knowledgeable and told us a lot of fun facts about Sydney Harbour Bridge and its surroundings. It is completely safe - which if you're an adrenaline junkie like me is a bit annoying as I wanted an element of danger and I didn't feel that at all! A great life memory though.

Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb - Awesome views of a Lifetime. Last month in June I undertook the Bridge climb with my thirteen year old granddaughter. If anyone is visiting Sydney I would highly recommend this. The views are awesome, absolutely breathtaking. Safety and a highly informed guide made it a positive experience. It takes over three hours, so don't drink too much water beforehand as no toilets up there. It was 49 knot winds but you are advised of this and kitted out in appropriate clothing and safety gear. Just do it!
Do the bridge walk!. Do the bridge walk! its a great and easy experience. you are firmeley secured and its a great way to see the city

An absolute icon. What a magnificent bridge, really appreciated by walking over it. For those fit people the climb would have a beautiful view but the thing I find worthwhile is to see it from the water especially underneath, it is truly remarkable.

Breathtaking Views. Make sure you have comfortable shoes on if you plan on walking across the bridge, it's deceptively longer than you might think. Once you begin the journey of crossing the bridge, you will be amazed with it's grand structure and the incredible views back onto the city. Simply breathtaking!
Night climb. Liked the night climb the best as I do'nt like heights and views from the top were brilliant , we booked the trip a couple of days before so no waiting.

An Iconic bridge and a must to walk over.. If you are coming in by train from the northern side then get off at the last station before the bridge then walk in over the bridge. It is easy then to decend down at the end of your walk into the "Rocks" area.

The bridge walk is a must.. A great walk across the bridge my husband and grandchildren climbed up the first pylon and said it was a spectacular view and they felt it was just as good because the children could not do the climb the bridge. The structure is fascinating and history even more so. We did not do a tour and the cost was only $8AUD to do the pylon climb so a pretty cheap educational excursion for a wonderful experience and a must see Australian Icon.

Sydney Harbour Bridge. It is a nice walk across the bridge with great views of the Opera House and Circular Quay. We started at the Rocks and climbed the stairs to the bridge. The Pylon Muesum was very interesting with the history of the building of the bridge.

Sydney Harbour Bridge. I love arriving in Sydney and just seeing Sydney Harbour Bridge right in front of me as it is 1 of the best parts of Sydney in the world and after seeing it on Sunday it just makes me feel happy and it is amazing .
Spectacular!. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is simply amazing! It is definitely worth going for a walk along the bridge!

You HAVE to climb it!. We climbed this bridge summer 2008, just like many celebrities like Oprah & Nicole Kidman have done, and we would HIGHLY recommend doing the bridge climb! You should especially do so right before dusk, so you can walk up during the afternoon sun, see the buildings start to turn on their lights as you reach the top, and then walk down seeing the night lights. This is a MUST DO in Sydney!!!

Harbour Bridge climb a must in Sydney. We did the bridge climb to the top and it was fantastic. A once in a lifetime thing to do. The whole experience was interesting and informative. At the top of the bridge you could see the entire city.

Harbour Bridge Walk. I started this walk from Milsons Point.It is really wonderful experience,walking on the Harbour Bridge.Breathtaking views of the Sydney Harbour, Opera House ,Circular Quay,Fort Denison and So many islands around the bridge.It takes 40 minutes to walk from one side to the other.Walking the Harbour Bridge has the plus point of stopping anywhere during the walk to enjoy the Harbour Views.You can not do it if you are driving or riding.Stop on the way,get yourself photographed with Opera House in the background.Enjoy all its glory looking up and see how magnificent and huge the bridge is!When ever you are in Sydney, try this wonderful experience of walking on the Harbour Bridge.

Great View. I didn't do the bridge climb (quite pricey to be honest.) But you can still walk across the bridge on pedestrian sidewalk. Even from here the views of the east harbor are stunning with the Opera House and most of the city in site! You can even look down into boats are they cruise under the bridge. Be sure to check out this marvel of a bridge from dry land at the Opera House, some great photo opportunities for sure!
A memory to treasure. Did the bridge walk, just amazing. Great guide, really friendly and knowledgeable. Would definitely recommend to anyone wanting a great memory of Sydney to take home.

A nice landscape. When we went to Sydney, the harbour bridge was the first thing we expected to visit for it is one of the many things that distinguish Sydney. Climbing the bridge is an awesome experience; nevertheless just watching it from afar is just as spectacular.
Stunning. Many places around the harbour to get a great view. If you get the chance, make sure you climb it, once in a lifetime experience.
Offer nice city view!. Its simply awesome feeling to watch the city skylines from the bridge. I love walking from Milsons Point to City through bridge.

Sunset walk on the bridge!. We had taken the evening walk on the harbour bridge when we were in Sydney on our honeymoon. It was spectacular to say the least. The view when we climb the bridge before sunset and when we come back afterwards is truly breathtaking and a memory that shall stay in our hearts forever!

Walk the Harbour Bridge and View the best harbour in the World. What a vantage point to view the best harbour in the world in all its glory. Stay in the rocks for lunch before or after, if the weathers nice try the evening climb - spectacular

One of the most iconic sights of Sydney. While it's incredibly hard to take a photo of the Sydney Harbour Bridge which has not been taken thousands of times before, don't let that stop you from marvelling at this iconic feature of Sydney. Try photos during the day, at night, from Luna Park, from right below, from the Opera House. Take the time to look from many different angles. And once you've done that, take a stroll across it for beautiful views of the harbour and Kirribilli. You won't regret it.

Sydney bridge climb. Loved the climb, my husband and I did it at night, the lights across the harbour looked amazing. We had a great guide who was funny and interesting. Would be suitable for most fitness levels, wasn't hard at all.
Fantastic. Fantastic views, excellent guide lots of local knowledge, definitely a must do when you travel to Sydney. You do not need to be overly fit to do this climb.

View of the World. Wow, wow, wow, wow, wow. What else can I say. View of the harbour and beyond. Did the climb at night and was a bit worried it might not have been as good as daytime. I was wrong. Could not recommend highly enough and I will definitely do it again. Family memory that will last a lifetime. Sydney Vivid in the background was just a added bonus.

A Must Do!. I am writing this now but actually did this climb back in 2001. It still sticks in my brain as one of the most exhilarating things I have undertaken. We had a clear day and while the climb is not too stressful you should be in decent shape as it can really hit you in the quad muscles. From first hitting the superstructure until you reach the top the climb is breathtaking and the views unbelievable. The you get to the top and it becomes clear why this is one of the top attractions not only in Sydney but the world. They of course will take your picture with the Opera House and Circular Quay in the background to sell you when you get back down but 14 years later these pics still occupy a prominent place at my desk! If you are healthy and adventurous this is a must see and do!

Favorite thing we did in Sydney. Our family of four (two teenagers) arrived at 9:50 to meet up with others to form a group of about 12 people with one guide for the Bridge Climb. It took nearly an hour to go through safety briefings and get suited up, with all gear securely attached so that nothing could fall from the bridge. Everyone is clipped in to a safety cable that runs the full trip to the top and back. The trip is not strenuous (my fitbit said an elevation gain of 80 flights of stairs over maybe 1.5 miles? ... I can't quite remember) and the climb was slow with lots of narration by the FABULOUS guide who described the history of the bridge as we walked. The climb was not at all scary -- the most difficult parts being coming down two ladder climbs of about 100 steps each with lots of handrails and landings. The rest of the climb was very mellow, with great views of the city. It was also fun to see the underside of the bridge. We bought the photo package and are glad we did, but I really wish I could have brought my camera and spent some time taking photos of the underside of the bridge itself.
A Great Sydney Icon. Great view, terrific architecture, fabulous experience to walk over it. A perfect Sydney icon which is always worth seeing what ever the weather

Beautiful bridge, try the climb.. Bridge was really cool. We did the bridge climb (booked in advance). If you are scared of heights it is probably not for you. (because of where you are walking and climbing you are out in the open)

Fireworks at the top. My husband and I took a night time stroll across the bridge. Much to our surprise, just as we crested the top, fireworks galore just overtop the Opera House. What an amazing way to end our evening.

Fantastic views. So glad we made the effort to climb to the top of the tower. The views were really worth it, so lovely looking down onto the Opera House, unbeatable photo opportunities. The stairs are quite steep but not unmanageable, the unfit may just take a little longer.

The most amazing family memory. From the moment you arrive - safety is the theme of the day and is taken seriously but in an understandable way - the whole experience is going to live with us for ever - after you have done the safety brief and donned your suit etc. the excitement begins as you leave the building and start the climb - up a couple of short sets of steps and then onto the bridge - clipping on the safety cable that connects to your belt and you are away - the views are AMAZING - the experience as a family of fear and elation is just great - this is a must do even if you are a little bit scared of heights the guide will get you through it and you can "only live to regret" - best afternoon out EVER.

An experience you should not miss!. An experience you should not miss. Professionally operated and made very welcome. Put our minds at rest as I am not good with heights. The views are fantastic and the weather was great which helped. Pictures worth the price to bring home as memorable souvenir.

Amazing exhilarating well worth the money. I am 54 overweight and very unfit, I found the bridge climb to be very easy, walking up over the arch is slow going as there are plenty of stops on the way and the steps are wide and you climb slowly, the hardest part of the climb for me was starting out on the straight flat section as I'm scared of heights and you can see all the traffic and water under you and every time a train goes past you think it is going to run over you, the climb is very safe very well run and organised and certainly worth doing I loved it and hope you do to.

Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. An amazing experience, guide was fantastic and having heard about the loss of my eldest son to suicide in 2014 she arranged for me to dedicate the climb through a video on top of the bridge. My son was a photographer and just loved architecture, buildings, construction and he would have been inspired by the construction of this bridge. This is a must when in Sydney. I was also lucky enough to have fabulous weather so the views were stunning across to Sydney Opera House and beyond.

Great climb. A must-do whilst in sydney, the climb gives you great views and the guide gives lots of history about the bridge and sydney as a city. Its very safe and the staff ensure you have all the equipment you'll need and talk you through the whole climbing procedure and give you a chance to practice before hitting the bridge. One of the best things we did whilst in sydney

Bridge Climb. It's one of the thing to do when you come to Sydney. We climbed it as a family and it was fun. I was worried about how hard it would be as I am very unfit. It was very easy and although very expensive , it is a must do just to say you have done it.The team were very helpful and informative during the whole experience.
Amazing Place. Amazing place, I love Sydney!! You can feel the nice breeze n nice view. Seating at Opera House n you can feel amazing.
A must do. Amazing climb never done anything like it! Would highly recommend doing it at night the lights are amazing. We did ours during the vivid festival and if you can hold out and do it then!
Bridge Climb. Loved it? Wasn't as scary or hard as I thought and the views are amazing. How good is Sydney. Watching all the action below on the harbour, just beautiful.
Mesmerising Sydney Harbour. Climb the Bridge the view is amazing, but if your scared of nights then the walk or cycle is pretty good as well. Great views of the magnificent Sydney Harbour.

Always a stunning sight. It doesn't matter where you view the 'hanger' from - flying into Sydney, from the water, driving over it or from any one of the great vantage points or restaurants around the waterfron - it is a magnificient sight.

The Bridge with History...... It is worth doing a Twilight or Night time bridge Climb. The faffing around at the beginning is a bit annoying but once you are up there it is a fabulous experience. It does take a few hours so be prepared. Always worth having a cheeky t the Harbour View Hotel Afterwards.
The Bridge. We never claimed it were to old but just going over it was a treat for us it's an icon something to remember

Climbing is a bit too pricey. Climbing it is a lit too expensive and tiring- it's around a thousand steps during the three hours, so not suitable for everybody.
But walking it's quite nice, although you dont have the best views due to the security nets
As expected.. As good as you would expect, nice views of the Opera house, but difficult to get a photo, due to all the wires.
Harbour Bridge. We climb the bridge for my 50th, absolutely fantastic. The guide was very informative and helpful. Best views of Sydney to beyond. Would defiantly do it again.

Go right to the top!. No doubt it looks nice, but just being around the Sydney Harbour Bridge is not enough. You must go right to the top. There are organized walks that you should be part of. Do get your photos clicked when you are up there! The walk becomes more interesting with the guide telling you about history and some interesting facts along the journey. Eat something before you start the walk! its a long journey (with breaks)

Best way to see the opera house during Vivid. We regularly catch the train to Milsons Point and then walk back to the city over the bridge. It's one of those walks where you see something different every time. The highlight for us was walking over at dusk during Vivid and seeing the city and in particular the opera house light up

My favourite piece of Sydney. Seeing the bridge for the first time in the flesh, left me with tears in my eye's ...it was just incredible, definitely blown away by the magnitude and size of the bridge.

Absolutely must see!. I took this trip with my daughter. She climbed the bridge I didn't! Scared of heights but it was so amazing just being in Sydney. Loved Darling Harbor and pit street mall. The metro to China town was a lot of fun too.

Birds eye view of Sydney. Had a very good experience doing the climb with my family. The views are great and we had a great winters day to do it but averaging out at over £100 per person. It's a bit on the steep side. I did the climb myself 14 years ago and I don't recall it being this expensive. When you now include my wife and two children at over $850 aud it's a big chunk out of hols money. Any way good experience The tour lead was good fun and made the tour interesting and good to meet other people from other countries.

Georgeous Bridge. You can drive on it, you can ferry under it, you can even climb over the top of it. The Sydney Bridge, the place where every New Years Eve, Fireworks shoot out of the top....it's an icon of Sydney and shouldn't be missed

A must see in Sydney. The iconic coathanger. Whether you walk it, view it from the harbour of any of the vantage points, climb it or drive over it it never fails to dazzle. At the same time do a bit of research on it and you will enjoy it all the more!

Must see in Sydney. If it's your first time in Sydney you must visit Sydney Harbour Bridge and Surrounding areas. Circular Quay is great to get to either sie of the bridge by ferry, or to get the manly, otherwise you can walk the bridge as well. Great photo stop.
The view was amazing. it's just amazing! YOU MUST DO THE BRIDGE CLIMB! It has an amazing view and lovely instructors and is very popular with the Americans!

Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb - awesome views. Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb a must if visiting Sydney, easy walk up and across the bridge as the tour takes three hours to complete. Great views and the tour guide takes photos along the way for you to purchase at the end of the tour, even does a short video from the top you can email or FB for free. You cannot take cameras with you so you'll need to purchase photos from them , a little expensive but worth the $. I suggest you wear runners or shoes with rubber soles. Not suitable for toddlers.

Awesome bridge climb. I was a bit hesitant to do this bridge climb, but wow it was worth every cent. We were lucky enough to get a small group and had the most amazing guide by the name of Dan who was funny and very imformative. We did the sunset walk and wow what a view we got. If your going to Sydney this has to be a MUST do activity.
Bridge clumb. Don't have much to say really accept amazing experience. You can't miss this out on a trip to Sydney highlight of our tours while there

Bridge climb - amazing view!. Event though it's a bit expensive to take the bridge climb it's really worth it! Not much fun being afraid of heights, but once you get going and figure out all the safety involved you will start enjoying the beautiful view of Sydney..
Awesome. Every time I can see it from a different park or building it still excites me like the first time I seen it.
Harbor Bridge Walk. Outstanding place to get a beautiful view of Sydney Harbor, the central business district and the Opera House. Access is from the Circular Quay.

The Twilght Tour of the Sydney Bridge was Great. The twilight tour of the Sydney Bridge was worth it. Our tour guide was great and made it fun and interesting. Great stories. He planned it so we were at the top when the sun was setting. While I was nervous about the potential height, the width of the beams you climb on was wide enough to make us not even think about it.

Nice Walk Across The Bridge. It's the Sydney Harbour Bridge, what else do you need to say? I would not do the climb (very expensive) as you can get a nice view and pictures by walking across the bridge. When you do the paid climb, they do not allow you to bring a camera...climb that high and you can't take your own photos?!

Bridge Climb. This is a must do if you are visiting Sydney. It is expensive but totally worth it. If you have a fear of heights...don't worry. It is not scary at all. They do the climb in any weather (unless there is lightning). So you don't have to worry about it getting cancelled. I did the regular full climb. It rained like crazy on our tour but that made it unique. They give you an informative briefing and lots of equipment. They provide everything you need including jumpsuit, fleece, rain gear, hats, gloves...Because it rained many people did not do the climb which left our small group (usually it is groups of 14 but we had a group of 5) and were able to take extra time on the bridge. I felt safe the entire time. Our guide was fantastic. He went out of his way to get great pictures of everyone. Prepay for your picture package on line. It is cheaper. I went for the full 10 picture package and it did not disappoint. Well worth the money!

Remember the traffic. I am at two minds whether to recommend this attraction. The walk from the Rocks to the pedestrian level of the Bridge is an easy one.
