The stroll across the Bridge takes about half an hour. There are excellent views from the Bridge and it offers many photo opportunities. There are many joggers and visitors - so no concern about security. What I do not like is the non-stop traffic (and hence the noise) behind me. If you are not bothered by this, the walk across the Bridge could be a rather pleasant one. At a fee, you can try the Bridge Climb, going up to the top of the Bridge, and test out (a laugh) if you fear height!

Amazing ! a must. Amazing, a must do attraction, great views of the harbor, knowledgeable guides, only complain was the horrible quality hat that you receive, its better not to give or give something as good as the tour.please fix it!

Spectacular . Wife and I decided at last minute to do bridge climb. Was a bit pricy and only option was last climb of the day. Wasn't wild about all the preparations as this seem to take a really long time. However it was all worth it. By going late the weather was cooler and the view at dusk and evening was spectacular. It was the highlight of our entire two weeks. Not that difficult to do. We are both late 60s and I have bad knees. If you are really in poor shape and badly overweight probably not a good thing to do but otherwise do it!!!

Night climb Sydney harbour bridge. I cannot rate this attraction highly enough. Not only is it a unique experience to climb such an Aussie Icon but the staff make it an experience to be remembered. Mel, our preparation guide and Daniel our climb guide were superb. Dan was loads of fun, very knowledgeable and personable. The climb was very easy and even though I had just got over pneumonia, I had no problem with the climb. There were plenty of rest stops to admire the view and regroup.

Sydney Harbour Bridge. This is a must do/see in Sydney. For a taste, walk the foot path to the center point. It is possible to take pylon tours or a tour over the top, but for no cost and the full experience it can be walked. Pick a sunny mid-day and enjoy sharing the walkway with joggers and business people on their lunch hour power-walks

Walk from one side to the other and enjoy. You can climb the steps near Nurses Walk at the Rocks and get views of the Harbour and Opera House and if you continue up and along the path you come to the bridge and can walk over it to Kirribili. We did this on a clear afternoon and it was lovely. You get great views. Decided to go back at nightfall and the scenery with the lights sparkling is amazing. Also, there are security guards on the bridge at night time. Good move.

Great experience. We did the Bridge Climb - it was not as hard as we expected. The views were tremendous and the experience was wonderful. Jackson was a great guide, very good knowledge of the bridge and great stories.

Our coathanger. The bridge is close to my I love walking over it with my dog never get tired of our harbour and sites. Its takes about half an hour for an average crossing unless your taking photos could add more time. There is also a pilon the more energetic can climb the 200 steps to see a marvelous view. From the bridge its an easy walk down to the Rocks and Circular Quay.

A good hike. One of the big attractions is to climb up the Harbour Bridge, which I am sure would be exciting. However, a less strenuous hike across the bridge in the pedestrian walkway at the traffic level is also very good, and free. You get some great views from the bridge, and it is less terrifying for people who do not deal well with heights. We definitely recommend this alternative, if you do not want to climb up to the top of the bridge.

A must visit in Sydney !!!. You have to be at the Sydney Harbour bridge if you are in Sydney. The opera house view from the Bridge is simply Awesome. If you choose to climb the Bridge and reach to the top, its a little costly but worth going for if you are an adventure lover.

Everyone should do it. I recently did the Bridge climb and it was great. Albert was a great guide so as well as climbing the bridge you were informed about its history and how it was built. The views are magnificent, it is a bit pricey but well worth it.

Walk Across the Bridge. On a recent trip to Sydney, our lodging was at the south end of the bridge. We were not interested in making the well publicized "Bridge Climb", but did decide to walk across the bridge. It is a pleasant easy walk on a well protected pedestrian walkway. Once across we took the Harbor Ferry back, using our Opel Pass. The Opel Pass is a must if your spending more than a day or two in Sydney. It allows access to all three forms of Public Transportation, Bus, Ferry and Trains. You tap on and off and the fare is deducted from the preloaded card, the maximum cost per day is $15, on Sunday $2.50, it's the best bargain in the City with a fantastic public transportation system. If you use a taxi, be sure and ask the driver for a fare estimate to your destination. From the Circular Quay to our B&B, we paid anywhere from $6.20 to $17.40. The meters run constantly, so rush hour can make a difference, but some drivers like to take the long way about, so be sure to get an estimate before you ride.

Very Expensive to Climb. I had planned for my daughter and I to climb the Sydney Harbour Bridge during our recent trip. However when we arrived and tried to book it we found that it was going to cost $516!!! You can't take anything with you either. Not having your own camera defeats the purpose. They just want to sell you their pictures. VERY disappointing!
Massive architecture. This bridge is really one of the symbols of Sydney. It's so beautiful at night. From Opera House, a view of the bridge behind is definitely art! :)

A Sydney Icon. I have lived in Sydney for most of my adult life yet every time I see the Bridge I am thrilled by it.The best view of it is from just inside the Botanical gardens on the south side, or over by Luna Park on the north.To get a real feel for it though climb the (pedestrian) stairs at either end and walk across it. When you get to the Pylon climb the stairs and view the history of the bridge, then come out on top and marvel at the view.
Great view of Bay. I strongly recommend climbing to the free walking path and appreciating the view from the bridge. Entrance is located in "The Rocks" and directions are easy to follow.
Great view if you are willing to climb to the top. If you are not afraid of heights, you could get a great view from the top especially during Vivid Sydney festival.

A must visit attraction.. Obviously if you are travelling to Sydney a visit to the iconic Sydney Harbour Bridge must be included on your list of things to see. Well worth walking or riding across the bridge (no charge) to get some amazing views over the city and harbour.

Pricey but worth doing once. The bridge climb is typical Australian and seems to be on most Sydney visitors lists. We chose a hot and sunny day in January and opted for the express version. This involved climbing below the upper span which we both felt offered a greater feeling of scale as, apart from the final few minutes we were enveloped in the structure. The guide was informative and ensured we had a potted history of the construction, statistics and history. It is not particularly strenuous and fine for any relatively active person. The only downside is the cost and which we did not feel represented value for the money. The express option lasted about three hours and would be our recommendation as even this is anything but 'express'.
Wow. What a great experience, fab views of the harbour. Felt like I had "made it" in Sydney by crossing the bridge.

Iconic!. I booked my bridge climb the day of the climb. It was one of the few days that it did not rain while I was in Sydney. Although it is expensive, it is worth the experience! The group is limited to about 15, and there are numerous photo stops as you climb. The climb is more like walking along a path, except for a few ladders at the very beginning and at the end of the descent.I only wish that I could have taken my own camera up, but that is not allowed. You can't even wear a wristwatch! Our guide was great, and we had a fun time as we climbed, enjoying the view. I did buy a couple of extra photos, because, after all, I wanted the proof that I was at the top!
Iconic Sydney experience. One of the great bridges of the world. Walk across and get anamazing view of the Opera House. Lunch in Kirribill then walk back or get the train.

Breathtaking Fireworks - Harbour Bridge Sydney. Harbour Bridge is connecting CBD of Sydney and North Sydney areas. It takes around 30 - 40 minutes walking from CBD to North Sydney. Some people try climbing Harbour Bridge. The organisors provide a certificate to the people who climb the Bridge. Harbour Bridge has stunning fireworks in particular Christmas and New Year seasons (9 pm and Midnight). So many people are watching the breathtaking fireworks from Harbour Bridge. Certainly worthwhile watching!

Fantastic views. Great experience. This is a must do....tick it off the bucket list.I purchased this experience for a 16th birthday present and we were not disappointed. Yes it could be viewed as expensive but it is a 3hr tour.Dan our guide was enthusiastic and easy to chat to very knowledgeable.We arrived 15mins before our walk time of 11am. I was nervous....not because of heights but going 3hrs without a loo break!I had limited liquids prior to the walk so all ok.We filled in a health questionnaire and then were presented with the standard blue/grey boiler suit to change into. The staff member was excellent and instinctively knew peoples sizes....he didnt get anybody in our group wrong....brilliant for those who may be self conscious.This is the last opportunity for toilet stop....i took advantage!We were then briefed on how we were attached to bridge and practised with the slider device and kitted out with radios to hear our guide, fleeces in case it was cold and an equipment belt to hold all the gear.We then practised climbing a demo ladder set up to check our comfort levels and ensure health & safety was observed at all times.Prior to climb we had a breath test...similar to police test.Then we were off. It took some getting used to traffic flow underneath us and the occasional train. Weather was perfect no wind! Climbing the ladders was scary but there is another guide their to assist...slow and steady the best method.Dan paced the walk well and took photos of the group and individually along the way as you cant take anything on the climb. No bracelets or watches either....small earrings ladies.The time went so quickly and then we were on our way back down. Dan got the group to sing happy birthday right at the top of the bridge to my daughter, she was embarrassed but I thought it was a nice touch.Would highly recommend. Picture souvenir at the end great reminder of a fantastic day plus a certificate to prove we did it! Loved it

Great view of the harbor from the bridge. Walked across the bridge in the morning and loved the view from there. It's completely free and worth your time if you want to take a picture of the harbor/opera house. I would say that it's a very easy walk across, and fairly quick too. You'll see a lot of runners/joggers and people going to and from work. I did see that you can go up the pylon for $13. I didn't do it because it wasn't open when I was there but wished I could have. I guess you could spend a lot more to climb the top of the bridge, but if you want to save some money, just use the free pedestrian walk.
Climbing Sydney bridge is relaxed adventure. It may look big and tall.. climbing the bridge is a must .. it is very relaxing and Adrienne pumping experience
Ok. Didnt quite live up to expectations, was thinking of something grand. There are paid tours to get on top - please skip

Sydney Icon. Sydney Harbour Bridge, a Sydney Icon, walk on it, walk over it, have a ferry ride under it, which ever way you want, it is spectacular from every vantage point. The Bridge Walks are great and gives a great view, so are the Bridge Tower sites.
Aussie trip. Amazing way to see the city from the top of the bridge. Views are unbelievable and the climb is easy for any fitness level.

A view and experience you'll never forget. Did the Night Bridge Climb on a summer's night and it was the most amazing view. The weather was clear and warm, you could see the lights from nearby stadiums, the Star casino and the Opera house. It is quite pricey but it's definitely worth it!

Sydney bridge. We went by taxi to the bridge from hotel. He dropped us street below the bridge we went up by stairs and took s stoll to the other end and came back it is wonderful man made structure, iconic for Australia , very good to take pictures.

Interesting and intriguing. I was pleasantly surprised to learn that the Sydney Harbour Bridge had different kinds of travellers that uses it. The motorists, the walkers and even the train-users. I am not sure about what goes on with the other bridges in the rest of the world, but I was highly-impressed by this attraction. Everyone should at least try to walk through the bridge to get the full experience of Sydney Harbour Bridge.

Excellent Piece of Art. It is more than a bridge, it should be viewed as an Art. Magnificent steel structure to view it from close, beneath it. When you drive through the bridge you may realise it. You should go beneath the bridge to appreciate it.

Cycling with Trailer and Child. Obviously iconic but a little tricky if you are a solo bike rider towing a trailer with a 3 year old. Access from North Sydney for cyclists is via a steep set of stairs with a ramp in the centre and a set of slow down barricades at the top. I have done this ride a few times and cyclists are more than happy to stop to assist and pull-push the trailer up for me, while others carry my bike so I can help my 3 year old walk up the ramp! Thank you fellow cyclists as the views are incredible and a wander round Darling Harbour with your kids is a fantastic experience (make sure you do the water park past the Imax theatre). Many more dedicated cycle paths in and around Sydney now.

Iconic bridge. Sydney harbour bridge has great historic link with Sydney all major photos and advertising campaigns have this bridge in it and would think a lot of people's first thought of Sydney would be this bridge.Lucky enough a few years ago to see the Sydney Harbour Bridge on news year eve it was stunning.One could not come to Sydney without seeing or crossing this bridge.

Leisurely WALK on the SYDNEY HARBOUR BRIDGE is AWESOME!. My teenage children and I did the walking from MILSON POINT to CIRCULAR QUAY last Saturday (13th June 2015) on a bright sunny winter sun! Fantastic views as you would expect and the panaromic scenes, the ships, the ferries, the yachts, everything are superb! And one thing for sure, the walk is FREE of CHARGE! Worth doing. No excuse of not doing it.
Tick that box.. Not to be missed. A well organised business, incredible guides and spectacular views. Another one ticked off the bucket list for me. Who doesn't look good in a grey onesie anyway :)

A nice walk that can be done at no cost. While it would be nice to do the bridge climb, I wasn't willing to spend $258 AUD per person. I was glad to find out that we could walk across the bridge at no cost. We were able to take great photos of the harbor. If you are in The Rocks area, look for a sign along George Street - just south of Argyle Street - pointing you towards the long and covered flight of stairs leading to the bridge's southern end. These stairs are located near Gloucester Street and Cumberland Street. The entry to the stairs is not far from the Sydney Visitor Center and Danieli's Cafe.
Quite a walk. The walk on the bridge gives you an incredible view. We chose not to do the pylon lookout or the walk along the top of the bridge. It was nice just to walk across it.

you got to do it. wot an amazing climb , you get kitted out in all the safty gear and shown all the walks , great views all the way to the top , you get some free pics with the tour wot an amazing trip
An iconic drive. We really enjoyed driving over the Sydney Harbour Bridge on I recent visit to SydneyIt really is the one thing you must do
Just beautiful. So beautiful! Couldnt fnd the place to get up onto it which was a shame as we wanted to walk over it, will try again next time

Fun & Exhilarating Experience. My family and I did the climb as a Christmas treat. Fantastic views as you would expect and an informative guide with some very interesting trivia and facts regarding the bridge. Parts of the initial start to the climb could be quite challenging with narrow steep walkways and not for the fainthearted. I would recommend it and can now check another item off my bucket list! Worth doing.
A Sight Even For Aussies to Enjoy. Wonderful experience to actually see the bridge and opera house.. Aussie icons that every Australian will appreciate.
Why wouldn't you visit?!?. If you're already visiting the Opera House, it is worth tagging this on to as it very close to another one of Sydney's iconic structures.
Want to be back again. just an awesome place to be there, amazing view in morning n evenings. You need to make sure you go via ferry too and enjoy the ride.

Wonderful! Climb not necessary to enjoy. We walked across the bridge our first day! It is breathtaking with a great view. It has placards with the history on it as well. I don't think the climb is necessary to get the effect. I would spend the money on other excursions

WOW !!. An iconic structure that speaks volumes. The Bridge dominates as one can imagine. Some of us climbed it while others sat and admired whilst picnicking also walked underneath it Just an amazing site....WOW !!
A must...local or tourist. The iconic harbour bridge is a spectacle from land or see and is a must see when in the city of Sydney

Huge - Climb is a must. the iconic bridge is ideal to explore from so many angles and places. Years ago my husband and I climbed the bridge and I would recommend doing this. learnt some really important and interesting facts along with understanding the height and enormity of the structure. Walking across is great and going under on the many ferries / boats is great too. Seeing the sheer size up close is awesome.

Fantastic View. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is unique in that the continent of Australia is over 50,000 years old, and here lays a modern bridge which generates thousands of $$ per day as locals go to work, as well as providing a view of the Sydney Opera House and downtown Sydney. The view at night is spectacular, and you can walk to the top of the bridge for a fee.
The place to be at New Years. We enjoy the fireworks show here during New Years. Very busy and the hotels in town are so expensive but it's worth it if you're traveling and want to see such sites.

Sydney Bridge Climb. The climb was high organised and professional from beginning to end. Everything needed was supplied and attached to me. Views were spectacular, with informative and entertaining commentary throughout the climb. A great experience and to be highly recommended.
What a landmark. You have surely seen this Icon in a movie or T.V. show. Take the time to walk this Landmark. The views are spectacular.

Not vivid. It was the Vivid Festival but the Harbour Bridge wasn't illuminated brightly after midnight.the Opera House was also in darkness. Loved the light show at the Customs house prior to midnight. Ice cream at Circular Quay late at night was a bonus.

Best view of Sydney. We did the full walk over the arch of the bridge at sunset. Very romantic easy walk, as the sun sets all too quickly along the beautiful opera house sails. It is worth the extra money for that peaceful time of day. Be quick with your camera as nature doesn't wait. Remember to take your light off your head as it isn't becoming in a photo!

A site for sore eyes. When the iconic "coat-hanger" structure looms up from a distance and then it sort of jumps out at you..............wow!!! It looks fantastic from any angle and even better if you walk across it and then do the Bridge Climb. A MUST to experience.

Bridge Walk. Harbour Bridge Walk was amazing. I am absolutely petrified of heights and our guide was brilliant, reassuring me all the way, a wonderful experience, another adventure ticked off my bucket list

Bridgeclimb - Fantastic. My sister bought us this experience as a gift for our birthday and we loved it! Guide was great, experience overall was warming as you met the other travelers in the group so you know a little about who youre climbing with. Climb was gradual so not over exhausting - easy fitness level would manage well. Great commentary from the guide learning about the Construction and history along the way, Highly recommended!

Bridge climb awesome. On Saturday night my husband and I did the twilight Sydney Bridge Climb during VIVID festival. It was awesome. For anyone worried about heights I'd suggest doing the night climbs as you can't tell how high up you are but have a spectacular view of Sydney. Staff were wonderful and contributed towards the experience

Sydney!!. The view from the bridge is one of the best of Sydney.The guide takes a picture of you and your group (friends/family) and whole group photo.Afternoon climb was great we had a storm come over us lil wet but still had a great time.They give you Equipment (overalls,headphones for the tour and you get to keep the hat that you get)
Bridge Walk. Do the bridge walk at dusk....gets the day and night experience. Bit pricey but at 3hrs long i'd say it's value for money.

Climb away. I did this several years ago when the crossing of the guard occured on Sydney harbour as the sun was setting. What a fantastic experience. Worth it. Felt safe through the whole climb. Just do it.

An amazing structure and superb views.. Top of my wish list of things to do in Sydney was to climb the Sydney Harbour Bridge but was advised on health grounds not to. On my last visit, January '15, I did the next best thing and walked the road bridge "there and back". To get to the walk way involves a series of steps which I accessed from (Cumberland St.?) area near the Glenmore and Australia Hotels (another story). Once up the walk was level and spacious with a few fellow walkers, some joggers and a few Securiy/Safety officials. These officials were also very helpful with general information. There was a nice breeze, on an otherwise sweltering day, and the views were great. You can see all the main structures and destinations all the way out to the Heads (?). You get a great idea of what a busy waterway the harbour is. On that day there was constant waterborne activity. Ferries (many), water taxis, ditto, a massive Cruise Ship, War Ships (2), dozens of assorted Yachts with multicoloured sails, assorted Motor Cruisers and barely visible, some Kayaks. I am not qualified to describe the Bridge other than to say it is massive and multifunctional. Having got to ground level on the far side I had lunch in a small cafe and returned. On other days I was on the harbour in various craft which gave another aspect of this amazing structure.

Great place for views of the Harbour. Great to walk along with views to the city and the opera house. Try walking on the eastern side of the bridge. One of the pylons has a viewing area. Well worth the walk and it's free! Plenty of room for runners, walkers, strollers (push chairs). Although reasonably sheltered take something warm when walking there in winter.

Well worth the climb.. Sure its a bit expensive, but it truly is a unique experience. We did the twilight climb and got to see the city at sunset which is breathtaking. I would highly recommend the trip to anyone. The place itself has everything down to a science--very professional which instills confidence. Out guide, Lisa, was great--knowledgable and key everything light and entertaining.
Great views. My family did the Bridge Walk but heights are not for me!!! I did the footpath and got some lovely pictures and it is free!

Iconic!. This bridge is iconic in its own right, and worth getting to see. I didn't do the bridge walk, but I did just walk along the pedestrian sidewalk of the bridge and still got some great views and pictures.

Awesome Icon. This by far is one of Australia's Awesome sight. Such a fantastic construction. I really think people take this monument for granted. It doesn't matter what time, night or day this is a must sight to see when visiting Sydney.

Best View in town. The whole experience was Great. They kit you up and make you feel great. They take a lot of pictures and don't kill you with the extra cost. But, it is expensive and the free hat is a BIG disappointment. Overall, A great experience.

Walk across (not over) the Harbour Bridge. As a person who hates heights and would therefore never do a "bridge climb" (that's over the top of the arch) a walk or a skate across the bridge at road level is just as fun. leave from Milsons Point walk across and then wander around the Rocks once you have crossed to the other side.I live and grew up in Sydney, and I still find this a fun thing to do on a nice sunny day.

Breathtaking Views. Sydney Harbour is a must visit attraction for any travelers visiting Sydney. Its impressive structure makes it a great click. I am in awe of the beauty of Sydney Harbour Bridge and make it a point to visit it every time I am in Sydney.

Excellent exercise plus excellent views with many 'side' options. The Sydney Harbour Bridge was the iconic symbol of Sydney even before its official opening on March 19, 1932. For its time its scale was massive and, even today, carrying eight lanes of road traffic plus two parallel railway tracks it provides a vital link between the City and the North Shore.The pedestrian walkway is on the Eastern side of the Bridge with a dedicated cycleway on the opposite side so that cyclists and pedestrians don't mix. The walkway is wide enough for four people to walk abreast and the railings have gaps suitable for positioning the largest camera lens for spectacular shots of the Sydney Opera House and the City skyline as well as the apartments that come right to the edge of the northern shoreline.The Pylon Lookout is a must visit for first timers (there is an admission charge) with lots of information about the building of the Bridge as well as a an elevated vantage point for a more panoramic view of the surroundings. Bridgeclimb is also a separate attraction that is very popular, but this review is just for the totally free of charge and recopmmended walk across the bridge to enjoy the view. On a windy day it can be quite cold so take that into account in your planning.From the steps at the southern end to the steps at the northern end took us a very leisurely 40 minutes but it can be done in half that time if you just want a brisk walk. I recommend you take the extra time to enjoy the views and don't forget to admire the engineering above you and roadside too - most people are so busy looking outward they miss much of the impressive elements of this structure, which has been awarded heritage status by the International Society of Engineers.

Spectacular views. We didn't do the guided walk over the top of the Bridge just walked across .Spectacular views of the harbour the boats and cruise liners and of course the Opera House great photo opportunity .A must do on your visit to this great city .

Beautiful to walk across. Having walked across the bridge many times, the views over the harbour as you progress across the bridge never fails to be one of the most beautiful sights I have seen. I am yet to walk up the bridge, but for now I am content to stay with walking across it with the other pedestrians. And finishing in The Rocks is lovely as well.

The bridge climb is a must. Book in advance to get the sunrise or sunset slots & don't worry about needing a head for heights. You feel secure & more enclosed that I'd expected. I did this 3 times in the 9 years I lived in Sydney, it really is that good.

Take a walk across it. Sydney harbour bridge known affectionately as the coat hanger connects the city to the northern part of Sydney. There is nothing like a cycle or walk across it early in the morning or in the afternoons the sun set. Get some exercise , enjoy the view of Sydney from the northern end , then you can capture the Sydney skyline and Opera house. During New Years eve the bridge is closed as fireworks light up the bridge. For the more adventurous, you may want to try the brigade climb.

"Over the top" scenic!. Loved our exhilarating walk up, over & across the Sydney Harbour Bridge! Our guide was extremely knowledgeable, fun, and paced our group walk perfectly. The views of the busy harbour and beautiful environs (including the opera house) from the top were absolutely stunning! While we were atop the bridge - we even had the thrill of a large cruise ship cruise under the bridge and 'blow it's horn' greeting as we waved! Excellent experience - and one I will never forget.
great cute place. all the restaurants there were great, and there are many little shops that you can purchase souvenirs

Harley Davidson motorcycle pillion ride. What a great way to travel over the bridge! Book at the Rocks Tourist Centre or in Circular Quay. The rider gives you a full briefing and makes sure that the helmet fits properly and also advises on staying still when seated on the dual seat.

Less daunting than it looks from the ground aand well worth the effort. Not only one of the "iconic" views of the world but the Sydney Bridge Climb experience is a lot less daunting than it looks when you see if from the ground - and of course you get more wonderful views from the bridge. All climbers have to practice climb before and we are all securely tethered to the bridge - no real risk and a little bit of exercise - a little on the pricey side but they have a lot of equipment to buy and keep safe, plus overalls to wash so I forgive them - and bought a "I climbed the Bridge t-shirt too - for my husband of course!

It's iconic; you have to walk it AND climb it!. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is a functioning bridge, supporting tens of thousands of commuters each and every day. You can walk across the bridge (easy walk) and enjoy views of the gorgeous harbour as well as the city's other iconic structure, Sydney Opera House. For more majestic views, climb the bridge. I did with my 11 year old daughter and it was well worth the (relatively) high price. The time flew and the views were spectacular.

Great views from the Ferry!. The best views of the Bridge can be found from taking the Ferry on the Harbour, this will also take you under the bridge as well and only costs around $4.50 for a single journey or $2.50 on a Sunday. So its definitely a cheap way to get some good views, and if you want to see it again, just stay on the boat, don’t get off, and have another trip around the harbor at no added cost! You only get charged when you get off of the boat.

beautiful. The view from the opera house is so beautiful especially as night falls.With lights illuminating it feels magical to see both the opera house and the bridge. Please try both the land and sea view,day and night.An experience worth your time.Land by day and in the evening i took the ferry from Darling harbour to the Circular Quay.
Well worth it. This is one of the best run tourist experiences I have ever encountered. It is run like a well oiled machine. The staff are friendly and efficient. It really is world class.
Always eye catching. Walk across it to the North and visit the Lavendar Bay gardens just past Luna Park. Splendid views from the Bridge.

Bridge Climb. I typically jump on the Red Bus Tours while traveling to maximize my knowledge of the city I'm visiting. I traveled to Sydney with my 2 teens, only had a day and a half there. We opted for the bridge climb even though it was quite cool. They provide jump suites, ball caps, beanies, handkerchiefs, gloves...They really know what they're doing. There is quite a bit of prep to get ready. We thought the climb itself was 3 hours, but it wasn't. The gradual climb was a piece of cake. Photos they take are awesome and our guide Sarah was very knowledgable and gave great tips on the surrounding area.

Scenic beauty and great structure. Amazing place to be. You should have sufficient time to climb up to the bridge, a guided tour. History for this bridge construction is also mesmerizing. Best time to visit is during morning and evening hours for a walk. An iconic bridge made by man.

Bridge climb during Vivid. Did the climb last week while the Vivid light show was on. The view from the bridge over looking the whole Vivid event was very good. The Bridge climb itself was excellent too. You really walk away with an appreciation of just how difficult it would have been to work on the bridge. The quality and safety of the Sydney Bridge Climb company was world class. They are professional and courteous. I would recommend it to anyone.
Harbour Bridge. Very impressive. You could even see the people walking across the top! I declined that experience....
wow factor. Climbing the bridge is a fantastic experience - - its easy and no stress - absolutely fabulous on a clear day
best bridges of Australia.. We had visited the bridge for the first time in night. The view is absolutely stunning. The light effects enhances the beauty much more.
Worth while climbing the bridge. Fantastic climb. A warm fine day so could see everywhere. The airforce flew around too so quite spectacular

Amazing Engineering marvel. It is a wow at first sight. Needs to be seen. A must see place. Night illumination was superlative. During the cruise the lights at the bridge were changing giving a wonderful look with the Opera house also dazzling in the lights special effects.

Known as 'the coathanger' by some oldtimers-it is a bridge to take you places. This icon is a must for anyone visiting our beautiful city. It is amazing morning, noon or night. Grab a ferry to broaden your horizons, take a leisurely stroll across the bridge and see the Northern suburbs too ( Kirrbilli markets on Saturdays-grab a bargain) Luna Park for the kids or go for a swim at North Sydney Pool (fees apply)Lots to see and do!

Australian icon. What can one say about such an Australian icon. It must rank with Eyre's Rock (Uluru) and as such any visit to Sydney one must walk in and around the opera house to get a great view of the bridege. Take the ferry to Maley and it is even more spekky. If you are there at New Years go for the fire work, all I can say is WOW.
must visit. must walk. brilliant. is a great experience to climb it. if you are not adventurous types then do surely walk it. has lovely views of the harbour and opera. plus get a feel of sydney life

Amazing! In love with it~. Sydney is always one of the city in my travel list pocket. I feel honored and finally visited this city in April. I used to view the Harbour Bridge view from books/magazines/websites and finally i paid a visit to it. It is charming, very charming and it looks very attractive. I used my DSLR cameras snap a lot of amazing photos of this bridge. I am in love with Sydney, never feel bored to live in this city.

Do it whichever way you can. Forking out hundreds for the Bridge Climb gives you a wonderful, tell people experience, but walking across the bridge for free gives you exceptional views at a slower pace and when the weather is perfect. Once booked, the Bridge Climb goes ahead even in inclement weather. Failing that you can take the lift up one of the pylons to the small museum and viewing platform and enjoy the views from there. A few years ago it cost about $10. That experience is still fantastic and you get history thrown in and lots of spare cash...trust me, you will be thanking me.

Best view ever.... Beautiful bridge, beautiful walk. Stop and gaze every moment of it. You can book in advance to to up the bridge to have a real good feel about the bridge and the views from the top or just take a bridge walk down below which costs nothing to do. It is a good healthy walk.

An iconic experience. This Bridge is well known around the world. You can hardly miss it if you visit or live in Sydney. Apart from physically crossing it by car, taxi, bus, train or on foot, the Bridge figures in photos, advertising, television and tourist items, in fact everywhere. It is a staggeringly imposing structure, still I believe the largest single span bridge in the world. There is a paid bridge climb you can sign up for but you need to do so in advance as I understand that there s a waitlist. Of course you might be lucky and get a cancellation.

Amazing and free. Find the entrance from the city walk across and backif you can't afford the bridge climb! which is $$$$$$go up the pylon for a fraction of the price as good as viewStop at the Glenmore hotel as to the roof bar and see the Opera house while enjoying your favourite beverage
Not great on the world stage. Its home, but now I have travelled its not the most beautiful thing in the world I was led to believe growing up in Sydney.

Bridge Climb. We did the Sydney Bridge Climb and highly recommend it to all Aussies, there is something very special about climbing a national icon! And what a great way to show off our beautiful city to tourists. As other reviewers have mentioned it is expensive but worth every cent. It is extremely professionally run with terrific instructors that make you feel safe & comfortable and also share some fascinating history with you as you climb. And of course the view is amazing!
Great bridge. Darling harbour it such a great place to get around by public transport, ferry, trains and buses. The Sydney harbour bridge is such a neat place to be.

Once in a life time climb. Climb it - do it at sunrise - its breathtaking to see the city waking up, you only need to do it once but it is a really unique experience. If you cant't afford the climb then just walk across -still awesome.
GREAT WALK. Doesn't cost anything to walk over Bridge you can either walk back or catch train or bus - fabulous view

viewing climbers on the bridge. seeing the small figures from below, seeing the iconic bridge in different shades of light at dusk, morphing into a glow at night. Luna Park in the back ground gives it a party feel!

Do the Bridge climb!. I'm a 74 year old man with Atrial Fib. I have to admit, I thought at first that I was going to have trouble doing the Bridge climb, but my wife talked me into it. I am really glad she did. The climb itself is not very strenuous once you get going. The company putting on the climb is very safety cautious and takes every safety measure to insure that no one can fall from the bridge. You are provided a suit to wear that has a safety belt and harness that is literally tethered to a cable that runs the full length of the climb, both up and down. You are also provided a two way radio that is in communication the guide that takes you up and down the bridge. No cameras are allowed, but the guide takes pictures of the group as you go up the bridge and a video when you get to the top. The price for the pictures and video is very reasonable.

A True Wonder. I am one of many fortunate people that get to see the Sydney Harbour Bridge on an almost daily basis irrespective of the weather.Spaning the harbour and joining the north and south of the city it is a truly remarkable construction that never ceases to amaze both in the morning or in the evening.There are many different ways to enjoy the bridge if you have time. It is most picturesque by ferry as the leisurely journey allows you considerable time to enjoy its wonderous form. If you have the energy it is a great experience to walk back and across as the view of the harbour and city is quite remarkable. You can always walk one way and take public transport back. This is one experience that should never be missed on a trip to the city whether you are new to the city or a local.

Even if you don't like walking don't miss this one!. Sydney is one of those rare cities in the world where you feel safe walking downtown almost at any time.Walking from Kiribili to Circular Quay, over the Harbour Bridge is a very special experience. It is particularly spectacular during the Vivid Sydney Light Festival, however, this walk is worth at any time, provided it is not raining. Walk the bridge and keep on walking over Circular Quay for the most beautiful views and then take the lift to get down to Circular Quay. It is worth not being tempted to take the stairs but walk all the way to the lift.

The best free trip. As a regular walker over the Sydney Harbour bridge I have to say that the views are spectacular. The best thing being that they are free with an added bonus that you are getting some excercise!

Walking gives the best views. We read that walking across the Sydney Harbour Bridge gives the best views of the city. We were not disappointed.The bridge is organized very well. Cars and trains in the middle, cyclists on the Western side, and pedestrians on the Eastern side. So you can walk the bridge at your own pace. It's almost impossible to do the walk quickly because we were frequently distracted by the incredible views of CBD. A must do!

Over the top. We did the bridge climb and what fantastic sights. On went all the gear, our personal stuff in lockers, practice with our belt on steps up and down and then the real thing. Walk across to the other side and then up, cross over and down and then walk back. Well controlled. Always looking out for the people doing this climb and of course pictures to sell later

Would have been worth it. We would have loved to do the bridge climb. The views that we caught and the adrenalin from climbing the bridge were amazing. Unfortunately a storm popped up when we reached the external part of the climb and had to take cover underneath the bridge. Due to timing of our flight we had to ask for a refund. This process was handled very poorly. Since we were unable to make the full climb we asked for the one picture we got on the outside of the bridge and they told us it was their policy that they wouldnt provide it even though they brought the camera down with us. Finally we convinced them to let us buy the picture. They didnt want to provide us a refund of the climb either. We had to convince them that coming from the states, we wouldn't likely be back to complete the climb and they eventually provided a refund.

Bridge Walk is a must. Was only in Sydney for 4 days in May 2014 in-between travelling around, booked the Bridge Walk for the evening during the Vivid Lights Festival.. Didn't know what this was, never heard of it. Bridge walk was thoroughly enjoyable and not an experience to miss out on! I am so glad I was able to witness this festival as well, especially a view right down onto the Harbour and around. Such a shame couldn't take your own photos for memories!

Best Bridge in the world.. We have walked over the Bridge hundreds of times and have NEVER tired of the experience. The views are fantastic. Not a huge walk, but worth every minute of the 30 minutes or so it takes to walk the distance. There are quite a few steps at each end of the Bridge so not good for wheelchair access.

Exceeded expectations!. There are many ways to view the iconic Bridge. You can walk across it, sail under it, climb the Pylon or gaze at it across the Harbour. But nothing compares to climbing up to the very top and soaking in the breathtaking view. The guides are knowledgable and keep things moving along, and there is plenty of time to enjoy the sights. There is a real sense of accomplishment when you reach the top, especially if, like me, you find tackling heights a challenge. This was a wonderful experience and one I would recommend .
Beautiful. I cross this bridge every day for work. Sometimes my husband and I visit the Rocks and spend a relaxing morning around the Harbour Bridge. Take public transport.
Great place. The area is a buzz with people, restaurants and just good life. A big climb if you are game. You can just walk along the edge and still get fantastic views.

A Wonderful Iconic Site!. The bridge is ultra cool! You can climb on top of it as well and take a guided tour that is breath taking and gives you an awesome view of the harbor and surrounding area's! This was my 2nd time here and wont be my last!

So Amazing and Awesome!. One of the great wonders of the world set on one of the most beautiful harbours of the world. Great place to visit and take a walk, good for photos with the most amazing views. Especially good to see at the vivid colours festival or New Year when the whole bridge seems to come to life constantly changing colours and taking on a new look. Simply so amazing with its very own unique personality!

Bridge Climb is Amazing!. We did the Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb, and although we reconsidered when we saw the cost, we are so glad we went through with it! The views are spectacular, the bridge itself is beautiful, and our guide was really fun and incredibly informative. I would recommend this highly. Even my husband, who has a mild fear of heights and was sort of dreading it, had a fantastic time.

great to test my fear of heights. the guides were amazing at times made me feel comfortable.I will definately do this climb again.I fell in love with my husband again.....he supported me throughout the climb

Iconic. The bridge from every angle is a piece of architectural greatness. Going underneath the bridge on a ferry was a fantastic angle to this icon as was from the top stood looking down during the bridgeclimb

walk down the bridge... take a walk on the bridge or climb the bridge ..which is very expensive..400 dolallars..but walkin is free... take a train back to your place once walked ...amazing feeling...take a run..go for stroll...u will love it...look for weather...evenings or mornings...

One of the most amazing things I have ever done!. I am not affraid of heights so I thought I would give this one a go. I travelled on my own but a few others on the clim were on their own too. I arranged to do a morning climb but it was full so they offered the "Dusk to Dark climb". I didn't think I liked the sound of that option, but when they explained it to me, it made sense. You start the climb when its still light, the sun is shining and the view as you are walking up is amazing and clear. You can see for miles and the view is simply breathtaking. By the time you reach the top, the sun is just setting and a few lights are starting to twinkle and everything feels calm and peaceful. By the time you start your desent back down the bridge, its dark and the light show around Sydney is just brilliant. The photographer took everyones pictures while it was still light, then at dusk then when it was dark. So you get 3 fantastic pictures with the 3 settings. On the other time climbs, you just get one backdrop. Day, or Dusk Or Dark! I got all three. The training/health & safety talk beforehand may seem boring to some, but its necessary. The staff were brilliant. They were fun but serious when needed. I felt completely safe with them, and they do a bit of a history lesson about the bridge too. The safety harness system in place helps you feel totally secure. It didn't matter that I was on my own. Everyone was so friendly and chatty. Everyone was happy to share their moment. A young couple from Brisbane got engaged when they reached the top. He arranged it beforehand so that the guide could take the ring for him (as you can't take anything with you) - which added to the lovely atmosphere at the top of the bridge. I was originally going to book a helicopter tour around the harbour, but they wanted to charge me double because I was on my own? But I am glad I did the bridge climb instead. It has to be one of the most amazing things I have ever done and I was on a high for days afterwards. You stand under the bridge the next day and its hard to imagine you were stood on the top!!If you go to Sydney, you MUST do this. You would be mad to miss it.
Sight to behold. What more can one ask...the bridge and magnificent Sydney harbour. The opera house is an added attraction.
Yes, probably good. My daughter and I started to walk across but rain descended on us. Much quieter than walking across the Golden Gate bridge in NY. Some good views.

Climbed the bridge.. I climbed the bridge courtesy Bridgeclimb.com. What a wonderful feeling atop the bridge. Spectacular views of Circular Quay and Sights of Sydney from atop. Please climb the bridge if you are in Sydney. You would not forget it for a lifetime.

Great view of the city. A walk across the bridge is a “must do” in Sydney. From the bridge (and the north side of the shore), you get amazing views of the city. If you do not want to walk both ways, there is a train station just north of the bridge. Do not miss this.
Walk the Bridge. Took the train across the bridge to Milsons Point. An easy walk back across the bridge for free. Fantastic views of the harbour and Opera House. A must do!

UP, UP AND UP.. Whilst a price to pay for it the sunset Climb is one that you may well only do once in your life. So, go for it. The climb I did saw blue skies, grey clouds, a small light spray of rain, wind, a fabulous sunset and a walk on the way down in darkness with all the lights of Sydney aglow.

Amazing. Having driven over it, walked under, across and over it; sailed under it and taken thousands of photos from every different angle around it, The Sydney Harbour Bridge still amazes me. A beautiful and iconic major part of this city that offers so much more than just a traffic hazard.

Amazing. Always thought it would be the opera house would be the highlight (it was great) but the bridge is very impressive - would recommend a bridge climb as it gave more information of the building of the bridge which only made it more impressive

Huge. The bridge is larger than I realised and definitely worth a visit. I wouldn't bother paying for the climb to the top, we just walked over the bridge for free. Great views of the harbour, opera house and city.

DO the Bridge Walk!!. It seems very expensive, yes. But I can't stress how much it is worth it! It is not difficult, not scary. But it IS such a great experience! And the views are amazing. Our guide was excellent, and shared lots of facts and history that you would never appreciate unless you were standing up there! Do It!!

An interesting bridge. Along with the Opera House, this is what tourists will have seen most of prior to arriving in the city and it does not disappoint. Now it is possible to climb to the top of the bridge on an organised trip - mind you, you have to take an alcohol test prior to doing so. Its size is impressive and considering when it was built it is a feat of engineering achievement. You can walk over, under and as said now .... to its apex.
Good but very expensive. The idea is great but at $300 each is a bit much. You get a similar view from the pillon which is about $13 each. The view is good but I'm not sure it's good value for money

Fantastic experience!!!! Do it!!!!!. If you have any doubts about whether to do the climb I highly advise you to do it! Was worth ever penny, and was the most amazing experience. We had so much fun from start to finish and the staff are so helpful and friendly. We had Bronte as our guide and a very small group of 4 (something about the 12.30 climb). Learnt so many interesting facts about the bridge and Sydney itself and the views and indescribable! I was very nervous and not sure if Id actually do it. The beginning is the hardest. You start by walking a 'catwalk' which is kind of walking on a metal mesh that you look at the ground below you, and then you climb the 4 ladders. This is the hardest part (which really isn't hard at all, and not scary). After that the arch is so easy and you forget how high you are and what your doing because its just so amazing. Its surprisingly very peaceful up there after spending the morning in the busy city!A must do! This was my 2nd trip to Sydney, I was so disappointed I didn't do it last time! And now if/when I go back I will do a night time climb!

A bridge with great history behind it!. Had a bicycle ride over the bridge. Our guide explained the history behind the making of this bridge. Glad to see a dedicated and clean bicycle lane along the bridge. A nice way to experience Sydney.
Walk across. We walked across the bridge. It gave wonderful views of the Sydney Opera House and the harbor. There are a lot of steps though getting up to the bridge walk.

Iconic bridge awesome harbour. The thing that makes the Harbour Bridge so special is the harbour in which it stands... Surrounded by the Opera House, The colour at night of Luna Park, the ferries buzzing too and fro and the beautiful cty skyline - it is just great.

Amazing Experience. This is something everyone should do in their lifetime whether they live here or are a visitor. To walk the Harbour Bridge & see the spectacular views of Sydney Harbour is an amazing experience.

The famous Sydney Harbour Bridge. It is a Magnificent sight and one which should be experienced by all, truly spectacular. We passed underneath and took in the enormity of it all, it was a wonderful experience and as the cruise commentator was talking we learnt more of the history behind the building of it.
Twilight . Wonderful experience, Kate our Guide was fantastic, so knowledgable and a great comedian, breathtaking views and great to see the skyline at night with vivid being on.

Harbour Bridge. How often do you get to climb inside and on top of a world famous iconic bridge? There are fantastic views in all directions from the top and during the climb. it is not so much of a climb as a walk. While I am somewhat apprehensive of heights, there are no issues here. The scary parts are when you are just getting to the point of actually walking up the supports. You are tied into the bridge at all times and the staff does a great job of prep and all of the little details. Expensive but worth it.
Words cannot describe. Everything is fabulous. Such a professional outfit. Nothing left to chance, great value. A MUST do in Sydney

INCREDIBLE!. You must do this, I was truly blown away by the spectaular views from the bridge. You don't need to be mega fit to climb the bridge either. Group goes at a steady pace. I done my climb in the evening would like to try it in the day time even though it was great to see all the city lit up. The tour guide was fantasic too and answered all our groups questions really well. Expensive but worth it much better than the Sydney tower!

Day and Night.. Two stories!. Stayed in sydney for a year and obviously this was one of the most famous attractions.The harbour area, the day atmosphere is very nice, the air from the circular quay area, the seagulls and what else... the bridge is fantastic and a pretty nice piece of modern architecture.. But dont let the day sight blind you too much because at night, harbour bridge is just magic.. the city sides on both sides. the lights and what not. Dont miss the best fireworks in the world. The New year's eve from the bridge.

A Fun Way to See the City. In order to get to the Bridge Climb base point, you'll need to make your way down Cumberland Street in The Rocks area. It is well worth the effort to find it. The Climb is an adventure you won't soon forget. There are many variations to choose from: shortened climbs, longer climbs on the upper arch, sunrise climbs, sunset climbs, etc. It is easy to buy your tickets on-line, and that way you can get the start time you prefer. You certainly can walk up and buy a ticket, but you might have to wait for a while when it is busy.There is nothing to fear!!!!! The climb itself is not too difficult, and your small group moves at a slow pace. There are a couple of tricky spots where you have to duck, step over a beam, or climb a vertical ladder, but generally you are just walking up a gradual, continuous, well-spaced stairway. This is the most organized, well-run, safety-aware organization you'll encounter. Much of the time at the base is spent on equipment procedures and safety rules. You are given a jumpsuit to wear over your clothes, so dress lightly. There will be a locker for you to store personal items. Depending on the weather you will be offered a fleece, gloves, rain poncho, baseball cap or warmer beanie, and even a cloth handkerchief. All if these items get tethered to your jumpsuit or safety belt. The belt is tethered to the continuous wire which runs the length of your bridge climb, keeping you safe as you climb.Once you get through the paperwork, orientation and suiting-up, your leader will take you out to the bridge. The climb does not take that long, but when you add in all the preparation and time for returning all of the gear, it is about three hours. No cameras are allowed, however, the group leader will shoot video of you and your party, as well as take photos at numerous stops along the way. Fear not, because you exit through the photo sales area, where you have plenty of time to order prints, CDs, and other items. You will get one photo included in your climb price, and there is no pressure to buy additional items.The climb is not inexpensive, and the tickets are not refundable. Once you buy your ticket you must be prepared to climb no matter the weather, but hopefully you will have a glorious day and an unforgettable experience.
Absolutely wonderful experience. Excellent trip with good instructors who took time to explain things. Whilst a tad pricey, it was worth it.

World Famous Australian Landmark!. The Sydney Harbour Bridge opened in March 19th 1932 after six years of construction.This Bridge is the world's largest (but not longest) steel arch bridge located on beautiful Sydney Harbour and is a famous landmark worldwide.Whilst I have never done this there is a bridge climb available that starts at $148 per adult and takes approximately 1.5 hours to complete. The bridge has eight vehicle lanes, two train lines, a footway and a cycleway and is important for the flow of traffic in Sydney.It’s a fantastic sight and I have taken photos of this bridge both daytime and nightime, from the ferry, from the great opera bar and it looked spectacular during the recent Vivid Light Festival.It’s a must visit whilst in Sydney!

fantastic activity. Chose the twilight tour which meant we went up in daylight and came down in the dark. fantastic view of Sydney at sunset and then the fantastic lights of Sydney. vey safe and easy climb - recommend to all.
climb. it was a lovely day and we climbed the bridge and what an experience . climb not to demanding and views were spectacular

A world great. Sydney Harbour is breathtakingly beautiful. You can walk around the shores in central Sydney, harbour side suburbs or through parks and gardens.
You can also take cruises but my favourite is to catch a ferry to get where I want to go and then wander around, unless I'm going with a purpose.

A view that burns 550 calories!. It's $200, but SOOOOO WORTH IT!!!!!!! I took the last tour of the day, which means the sun was setting when we finally started out and it was full dark with the city lit up when we reached the top. The guide said the lights are best around New Year's, but that means a dark climb will be pretty late. There is a full safety briefing (with practice climb!), and they provide a jumpsuit and goggles for trip up. Do NOT attempt this in anything but hiking or athletic shoes! You're hooked up to a safety line and there are handholds the entire time. At the top, they'll snap your picture and you have the option of recording a brief video message for posting on Facebook. The pictures are available for purchase at the end of the tour.
Go to the pylon. Skip the bridge walk and the exorbitant prices. Go to the pylon instead and for 13 AUD get 90% of the view and a small museum and 15 minute film to boot.

An icon. This is an amazing ,piece of engineering. To walk across and marvel at the construction is amazing. You must either do the platform walk across the car level or do the bridge climb to see a totally different view,

Best experience ever. If you are afraid of heights you can still do this climb. You get an eye view of the whole Sydney Harbor and the Opera House!!! If I was to ever go back this would be the first place I would book!!200% worth it!!
Must See. Amazing architechture. A must see in Sydney. If you have the time, money, and gumption, take a bridge climb. The views are even better. Or simply walk over on the pedestrian path.

Very nice adventure. We have not hiked over the bridge, because we had 2 kids with us, but it looked very interesting to go for it. the view from below was amazing, so i expect that it was great from the top.

Bridge Walk. My husband walked the Harbour Bridge and loved it, the height, the views ,the wind ,the challenge. Next best thing to being a bird and he has the photos to prove it. We booked on the net and got the day and time we wanted and a good deal.this is a popular tour especially on Cruise Ship days so prebooking is a must. well worthl the the cost as he will never forget the experience.

Not for the faint hearted. Wow! What a view. Excellent but not for those scared of heights, you should stick to the road. The climb is well organised and the guide we had was superb and extremely knowledgeable.A great photograph is taken at the very top but you have to pay for that (expected of course).We did the walk after we did the Tower and I am glad we did. We would have been so disappointed with the Tower Skywalk if we had done the bridge first.

A bridge climb worth paying for. This was the 4th time I have climbed the Sydney Harbour Bridge, so you must know by now that this will be a rave review. My 1st climb was in 1999 and I have seen the prices climb too!! But I still think it is worth it. This time I paid AUD268 each for a daytime climb for 2 of us. And a further AUD50 for the photos and a video on a souvenir USB drive.I say it is worth it because of all the safety measures in place and there is training provided. Except for a short 3 or 4 vertical "ladder" type ascent/descent, the remainder of the climb is very gradual. You get great views of Circular Quay/ Opera House, North Shore/ Taronga Zoo, Darling Harbour, the various Bays (to the east) up to the last (Watsons Bay) and views of the west too. And you get trains passing by (above and below you, depending on the timing).Of course, you get better views from the twice as high Sydney Tower, but this is the Coat Hanger (local name for the Sydney Harbour Bridge).

long awaited bridge walk. After many years I finally made it, I walked north side to south side, (easiest approach) however bit disappointed with high wall hindering the view, but coming down on the other city side, through 'The Rocks" around Circular Quay made up for it. Fantastic

spectacular night bridge climb. Our climb was set for 5pm in May during wet and windy weather - so by time got suits on,safety lines, training etc it was dark outside. We were supplied with suitable clothing for rain and cold. We did get light rain on & off but did not ruin the spectacular views of harbour, opera house, circular quay at night - it was set off by the "Vivid Light Spectacular" that was on at the same time. The climb was easy, not hard at all. There are lots of stops along the way waiting for others, listening to commentary, taking in the views, so didn't feel rushed at all. Even though the weather wasn't perfect it didn't spoil it at all. Would definitely recommend to others.
Bridge Climb. What an amazing experience. Every one should do the Bridge Climb. Well organised, magnificent breath taking views. Caters for young and old. Nothing to fault!!!

Fantastic Climb and then Magnificent Views. I had visited Sydney on business years ago and didn't have time for the bridge climb so I was thrilled to have the opportunity.The bridge itself is an architectural one built it is amazing that it's held up as wonderful as it has. The bridge climb company make sure that safety is of most importance and consequently give an hours worth of briefing as well as making sure that your equipment that they give you is in tiptop shape. We were given jumpsuits, hats, handkerchiefs, radios, raincoats and a practice climb before embarking. The safety briefing was extensive.We were connected to a very thick cable for the duration of the climb up and down the bridge and there is a feeling of total safety as a result. The guide that we had was very thorough and knowledgeable about the history of the bridge I gave lots of interesting color commentary about what is happened and where we were what we were doing. Initially we going to a cat walk that leads to a very large concrete pylons where there were they were letters that went to the top deck of the bridge I imagine those letters total of six stories high going up and going down. The client to the top was really a gradual slope and it was made all the more exciting on our particular trip as a storm and thunder started as we reach the very very top of the bridge. Once we reach the top we traversed about 75 meters across the highway below as well as the train tracks. Upon reaching the other side we started the trip down.All told, the entire adventure took 31/2 hours and was quite memorable.All told the entire adventure was about 3 1/2 hours
Great views and a nice relaxing walk.. The views of the harbour are unrestricted from the bridge and you can look right over the opera house.

Beautiful. I have been lucky to visit during Vivid; a fantastic 2 weeks of light shows around Sydney. The whole area has different things going on to amuse the senses, ideal for any age. The buzz in the area is amazing with a 'holiday' feel to it all. I got the train from Central which was really easy to find and takes you right there. A must do!!

Great Views of the Harbour!. The Sydney Bridge is another iconic symbol for Sydney and also a great place to see views of the harbour. Your can walk across the bridge along a pedestrian pathway, or you can pay money to climb the top of the bridge. I did the climb and loved the experience and views.

Excellent. Excellent afternoon on the Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. Our Guide for the afternoon was Richard. Firstly, you are fitted with suits and then all sorts of attachments to make sure you are totally safe and comfortable. You obviously cannot take anything with you on the climb, like camera or phones etc but you are given a locker to put everything in. The only thing you can take are sunglasses and they are fitted with a strap that is then clipped onto your suit. You are then fitted with headphones and radio so you can here your guide speaking rather than having to pass on what was said to the person at the end of the line. When everything has been checked you then go through a tunnel and your safely line is slid onto a metal railing which you are attached to for the whole climb. If you don't really like heights but determined to do it as I was, the advice I will give you is grin and bear it until you get to the start of the bridge and then you will be fine. The views are fantastic and Richard's stories and facts were brilliant. Richard took lots of photos on the way around. I was worried as I thought you may need to be really fit to do the climb and I was worried I would hold everyone up. But Richard took lots of stops to talk and take photos so it wasn't a problem. It was a fantastic experience and I would totally recommend it.

Walk over the Harbour Bridge. Not having the courage or funds to do the bridge climb, we decided to do the walk over the bridge. We took a train to the other side then walked back over the bridge which took about 45 minutes. Good views of the city. We have done the same over the Golden Gate in SF and the Brooklyn Brdge in NY and it was just as enjoyable (and free!)

Not to be missed. Decided to climb the Harbour Bridge while staying in SydneyFantastic views of the harbour and opera house!A really well organised tour and the staff were great.Would defiantly do the climb again.Check weather before you book
Awesome. You know exactly where you are when you see the bridge. Have a look during the Vivid festival, the projection is awesome. Take a walk under the bridge it's beautiful in this part of Sydney.

Magnificent Sydney Harbour Bridge.. Most people know about the bridge climb, which is great but you can simply walk over the bridge for free on the pathway, which is good for people who can't handle all the stairs. You can get great pictures from the bridge. Very big part of the Sydney landscape.

Great views from the Bridge.. I walked over this bridge many times while staying in Sydney. It's a great walk with great views of the city & the opera house. If you don't want to pay £150-£200 for the bridge climb, you can pay £6 & go up the south eastern pylon lookout. You walk up 200 steaps & out to the lookout platform on top of the pylon. It's worht it for £6, it is also a museum & tell you the story of buliding the harbour bridge as you go up the steps to the top.

Sydney bridge clib. We booked this before we got to oz, as it was the few days leading up to NYE's we didn't want to miss out! Great tour guide, good size groups, amazing views over sydney. They gave you a group photo and certificate whichw as included in the price, other photos were $15 which personally didn't think was bad, in london they charge you close to £20-£25 for a photo at a tourist attraction! A must for sydney!
The size of it. Not quite home like my Tyne Bridge but wow loved it, nothing to dislike. Did not realise just how big it is. Even saw the brave climbing it.

More than just a bridge. Lots of other posts re options such as climbing the bridge but here are some different aspects. I have been to Sydney many times but last visit I looked at the bridge from two different aspects:1. From the Rocks you can climb up to the pedestrian walkway which runs along harbour side (opposite side is for cycles). From the middle of the bridge there are some wonderful photo opportunities of the Opera House.2. Again, from the Rocks, you can walk under the bridge and find some photo opportunities of the bridge from a very different angle to the 'standard' view from the Opera House. When we visited, this was also a popular spot for photos of newly weds.However you look at it, he bridge is an impressive achievement one of the true iconic structures in the world.
awesome free views of the harbour. Great way to view the harbour and get some exercise especially after eating a big breakfast. Lovely cafes on either side to grab a coffee or a Cool drink

Vivid Lights. We cruised the harbour to see as many of the VIVID lights on show as we could. Have to say we were a little disappointed with the lighting of the bridge & only one side had a ballet/dance video displayed on the pylon of the bridge...would have been nice to see on both sides.

an incredible view from the top of the bridge for those who venture up there. I did the walk over Sydney Harbour Bridge a couple of years ago and found it incredible. The instructions beforehand give you confidence in the people taking you. You are attached to the bridge at all times, and the walk under the bridge to get to the starting point is very interesting, as you can see through the walk way to the street below to the cars, people walking as well as the street market with the stalls. The walk over the bridge is not exhausting, the steps are low and very easy to negotiate. We had plenty of stops along the way and had places and things pointed out to us. The photo on top is the best, an exciting day for me.
A bridge with a view. Always love to visit the bridge. It never ceases to amaze. Climb the pylons or just amble across taking in the harbour views. Beautiful on a sunny, clear day

Best activity to do in Sydney!. This may be a bit of a pricey trip but it is worth ever penny. Me and my partner did the day climb and had an amazing experience. The views are spectacular and the staff are great and full of info all about Sydney. It is something you will never forget, one of the best things I have ever done! You won't regret it :)

Great perspective of sydney. Fabulous views of sydney harbour and access to the rocks, the opera house and circular quay. A perfect way to see the highlights of Sydney - take a stroll around the Opera House, them walk to the Rocks where you'll find great markets on the weekend. You can access the bridge via stairs from the Rocks or Milson's Point train station if you are on the northside - Aussie icons not to be missed
Attractive. visually very attractive bridge, but we saw it up close from underneath while exploring The rocks area, which was kind of interesting ..also the old gun battery is up there.

Sydney Bridge Climb. Awesome experience. The detail to your safety on this climb is more than impressive. They make you remove all jewelry, you cannot take cameras with you, etc. Our night was a very windy night and i can see why trying to pull a camera out would be an issue. They have stops on the way for them to take pictures for you to purchase at the end. The view is magnificent, and the experience is something that will stay with you forever. We went twilight, best of both, sunset and night skyline. Other than the strong sustained winds, it was perfect. Suggest you buy the USB of pictures and get all of them to take home. You get one group picture for free.

comparable to golden gate bridge. Sydney's heritage!! Must visit.. we didn't go for bridge walk but drove over the bridge twice in 3 days. At night it looks so light up from harbor which looks great. In morning time, it looks even better. Stand on circular quay & enjoy the view for some time!!
Get your cameras ready. Everywhere you look while on the bridge is an awesome sight. And the fireworks spectacular a evening walk a sunset is not to be missed.

Climbing this bridge is something you'll never forget.. It's an exciting adventure to climb to the top of this exciting bridge, and see all of Sydney Harbour below you.It's a very safe climb because you wear special clothing,you're connected to other people, and it's well supervised.

fantastic experience. The bridge is 1149m long and 134 m from top to water level. Crossing the bridge by car or by bus is interesting, but you don't have time to see much. Crossing by foot is excellent. But the ideal is to climb the bridge and enjoy an incredible view and fun experience.One company is licensed to to do that, BridgeClimb. They organize 4 different types of climb. You can find all details and can book a climb on their website.I took a night climb which was extraordinary experience.

Great Structure. Do the bridge climb you won't regret climbing this iconic structure! The views ain't bad either! Watching the new years fireworks over this bridge was a highlight of my year in australia!

Great view of this from water. Take a ferry to anywhere really to get a great view during the day if you aren't up for the walk across it. Coming back on Manly ferry or rivercat in early evening if great for lit up view as well as a great view of opera house.

Iconic part of Sydney. Easy to walk over and if you go from the City to Milsons Point there are some great cafes to drop into. Take the time to go up the Pylon if you cant afford the Bridge-Walk. Its a great view, very reasonable and has an interesting little museum in it.

I walk it often. Take the steps from Milsons Point or from the Rocks, and it's a gorgeous walk, one of the best views in Sydney. It's not strenuous, only getting up to the bridge from either end there are some stairs, after that it's flat. It's one of the best things you can do in Sydney.

Spectacular walk !. Only walked across from one end to the other on the main pedestrian footpath. That's high enough for me! It is an engineering marvel that makes you feel proud about this country. Anyway you can see right out to the Heads,lots of beautiful bays, boats and the majestic Opera House. Yes this a must do when you are in Sydney and nice restaurants and / or pubs down at the southern end- the Rocks area.
Do the Bridge Walk. The bridge walk is amazing and the views are spectacular. Sydney looked great and large ship passed underneath while up there.
Spectacular view. We walked across this iconic landmark. The view of the harbour was exceptional and worth the 20 minute walk from the north side (which we reached using a ferry) to the CBD.

Harbour Bridge Climb. Excellent experience! So well organised & fantastic climb guides & assistants. Views amazing on the way up & back & even better from the top. Great stories of interest told by our guide as we climbed the stairs, through our headsets provided & very clear listening. A must do while in Sydney.

See Sydney city from a whole new perspective. An interesting experience, admiring the beautiful design and gaining an understanding of the extraordinary workmanship that built one of our cities icons.

Amazing views amazing customer service. This is my third time at this attraction. I have done Day climbs, Sunset climbs and Night climbs. Each and everyone unique. It's never dull. Staff are ALWAYS friendly and polite. Above all they make the time fun without ever taking their eyes off the safety of the clients.

AMAZING VIEW. Took the sunset climb, it was really good. I did find the time before getting out on the bridge - the safety and practice time a little tedious. I know it is important and your are catering for everyone but I just wanted to get going. The views and stories told once out on the bridge were really good. The climb was no where near as scary as I thought it might be. We did get some great photos and had a lovely time.

don't just call it the Coat Hanger. Melburnians refer to the SHB as the Coat Hanger- well it might look a little like one but it not only joins the two sides of Sydney together but a walk along the eastern walk way gives a spectacular view of one of the two greatest harbours in the world- which is made even better if a cruise ship is in the bay below. Its other contribution to fame is that the comedian Paul Hogan was a painter on the bridge when discovered and as they say the rest is just history

Shows Sydney at its best. I have walked across the harbour bridge many times and on each occasion, I'm impressed with how beautiful Sydney is. If you don't want the expense of climbing the bridge (I haven't done it), then a stroll across is very pleasant. There are quite a lot of steps at either end so maybe not a great idea if you have mobility problems. An interesting way is to take the train across the bridge from Wynyard and get off at Milson's Point station, then walk under the bridge and up the steps to get onto the bridge. The walk then finishes in the Rocks area and it's an easy walk down to Circular Quay and around to the Opera House.

"Great experience". Definitely a must do! I was a bit nervous not about the heights but if you had to be super fit to climb the bridge. I was pleasantly surprised at how easy it was, you can pretty much go at your own pace. The guide that we had was awesome really interesting and made the climb even better with all the stories and history about the bridge. The view was amazing especially from the highest point it really is breathtaking! So glad I did it!
