a classic, must do!. Yes, you are in Sydney, you have to do it! I walked from one side to the other, took the boat back. Amazing pictures, quite windy though so go prepared.

Pylon Lookout has a great view with no time limits. Pylon Lookout is located off the pedestrian walkway at the top of the South East pylon of the bridge. Great city views at a fraction of the price of the Bridge Climb ($13 for adults @ May2015) and you can stay as long as you like - no walking in a queue roped to a guideline. Open 10am to 5pm every day except Christmas day. Downside - 200 or so steps up and no lift. Don't forget to walk over the bridge to North Sydney and pick up a coffee at Milson's Point

Gorgeous views!. I took the Express Bridge Climb package - a 2 1/2 hour climb, instead of the normal 3 1/2.Was a bit nervous initially, but once I was strapped in, I felt safe and sturdy. The pace for the express climb was just perfect for me, left me just slightly out of breath, which I like.And the view!I took the 3pm tour, and was lucky enough to catch sunset! For free (the usual sunset climb is about AUD100 more expensive)!! GORGEOUS!I would definitely recommend the 3pm Express Bridge Climb tour. And cheers to the ever friendly and informative guide(s)

This one should be on your bucket list. I have climbed the bridge many times and the experience just gets better and better every time. You learn lots about the harbour and our iconic sites and the history of our famous bridge. Breathtaking views are to die for.
Very enjoyable. Amazing to walk across such an iconic bridge. Super views of the Opera House & Harbour. We thoroughly enjoyed it. Wouldn't have paid to climb it ad it is far too expensive!

Visit the museum and cross the bridge for free.. I just can't see spending the $260 for the bridge climb. Views are great from the deck of the bridge. You can see the Opera House and much of the harbour. I actually did go to the top of one of the pylons, with a free voucher from friends who did the climb, good view there, too, but I am not sure it's worth the $13 or so fee when the deck is so good already. Museum under bridge where you buy tickets is free, too. Explains how, to Austrailia, it's not just a bridge. It was the first man-made object in Australia that was the biggest in the world. Before the bridge, the great engineering works were all elsewhere (UK, France, US, etc.).

Bucket list ✅. Something I have always wanted to do, not something you would really say I gotta do that again. Yes absolutely breathtaking view, very informative, maybe a little to much.... Strenuous not at all. If you have a fear of heights, they really do look after you and get your through this. Yes you can do it. It is soooo safe.

such fun even in the storm!. we went up the harbour bridge in the storm day 1 and it was so much fun being blown about up there made it more exhilarating, this it wouldnt have been as good on a sunny day and the picture were amazing because the weather was crazy so the picture were too!
Great view. the harbour bridge is the landmarks must visit points in sydney especially during the evenings. Perfect place for a must photoppertunity

Bridge Climb - MUST do. One ticked off the bucket list - An incredible experience.Yes its expensive but guess what...ITS WORTH IT!!It really was an unforgettable day. Thanks to the knowledgable, friendly and reassuring staff.If you are in two minds as to whether to book this I would strongly recommend booking it. It really is a once in a lifetime experience.

Harbour Bridge Walk. Too expensive, too many stops for THEIR 'photo ops'. Cant take your own camera or watch ! Photos were over $50 to buy from them, $240+ for the bridge walk = all too expensive. Great views but cold waiting around on the forced stops.

Question the value of the walk over the top of the bridge. You need to get the base of one of the bridge supports (area know as the Rocks) to have the quest access to either the street walk or girder walk across the bridge From there it was up a LOT of steps to the pedestrian walking path on the bridge across the river. There was an Holland America tour available to walk the bridge structure girders high above the bridge, but that was a little too pricey for us at around ($400 PP) plus (most disappointing) they will not allow you to take a camera on the walk (not even our body attached GO PRO camera) as they say they do not want you to drop anything. Suspect this is just another way of getting a buck out of you for one of the pictures they sell of you on the bridge!Walk the free pedestrian walkway over the bridge for some great pictures of the harbor and opera houseBack off the bridge we wondered around the Rocks area where there was a wonderful, upscale arts and crafts show. This is a more permanent set up than the Queen Victoria Marketplace in Sydney, and a completely different venue of shops.

One of the highlights of my vacation. The bridge climb is a must do! We were lucky to have amazing weather for the twilight climb. This allows you to climb up during the sunset and see the city lights as you descend. The climb itself is very easy with a lot of stops for stories and pictures. The most difficult part of the climb is the beginning and the end as you have to navigate 5 sets of metal ladders. Everyone takes their time and it is very safe. You need to pray that your guide is not only a great guide and storyteller, but a good photographer as well. Our guy was great, but new, and a horrible photographer. Hopefully he will get better because those photos are not inexpensive and it's even worse when they are not flattering because the photog doesn't know how to photograph people in a way that flatters them. Having said that, it was still one of my highlights. Do it!!

Walk don't climb. You have two options on the Sydney Harbor Bridge: (a) the Sydney Harbor Bridge Climb AUD $200 - $300 (b) walk across the bridge FREE.Take a train from Central, Town Hall or Wynyard stations or a ferry from Circular Quay to Milsons Point. This is the station on the north side of the harbor.You have two options for walking across the bridge (a) West Side - lots of cyclists, skate boarders and you don't get the views of the Opera House (b) my recommendation is to take the East Side path.The walk takes about 20 mins and is very easy, apart from the steps up to the bridge. There a lots of vantage points as you walk across the bridge, to take photos of the beautiful Sydney Harbor, Opera House, The Rocks, Circular Quay.An additional benefit is you can pay AUD $13.00 to climb up the Southern Pylon (the large pillar you see on the south end of the bridge arch). This has a small museum inside but there are 200 steps from the bridge path to the very top BUT IT IS WORTH IT! You get some spectacular views of the birdge, harbor, opera house, and the west side of Sydney Harbor. You can walk right around the pylon so take advantage of the views.

The Bridge Climb. We did the Sydney Harbor Bridge climb in April, 2015. It was a memorable experience once you reach the top of the bridge, the views are amazing! The climb takes about 3.5 hours. It is fairly easy paced, there are a few steep steps to negotiate. The climber is harnessed to the bridge, felt very safe throughout( fir a person who hates heights)!

Enjoyable walk with great views. Not being good with heights, I'm never going to do the Bridge Walk where you climb over the structure of the bridge - but people of all ages and abilities can walk across the Sydney Harbour Bridge from Milson's Point to Circular Quay(or vice versa). Some stairs to get up to the walkway at Milson's Point - and to get down again at the other end. I was surprised to see a security officer on the bridge, and there are a number of security cameras along the route. The view across to the Opera House is fantastic, and the vantage point is very different.
A bit overhyped. I went there, walked over it, photographed it, but I got to say, its just a bridge. Not sure why there is so much hype about it (and Sydney for that matter).
SO much FUN!. Climbing the bridge is a must do for all tourists AND locals! It is a fabulous experience, quite cold and windy, but breathtaking at the top! Highly recommend!

Walk across the Bridge. Walked across the bridge. Wonderful views of the harbour and the opera house. When you come off the bridge there is a great little old hotel called the australian hotel in the Rocks. Great place to stop for a drink after walking across the bridge and back. One of my favorite places in Sydney.

Sydney Harbour Bridge & Opera House in Two Hours or Less. If you are visiting Sydney with tight schedule but want to catch the OPera House and The Bridge you acn do this by catching a train from Airport or any Sydney regional station to the Circular Quay Station which is located halfway between these two attractions with about 15 minute walk to either.The Circular Quay is also a major Ferry Terminal for the Sydney Harbour and you can buy a Day Ticket from automatic machines at train station for around $20 that gives you unlimited travel on Sydney trains, ferries and busses for one day. If you have limited time, catch the train to Circular Quay and as soon as you exit on the Norther side you will see the Bridge on your left and the Opera House on your right.It is an easy walk to the Opera House from where you have a spectacular view of the Bridge and Sydney Harbour. If you have more time you may consider walking over the bridge but this is much more physical and will take at least an hour, but it is reasonably easy walk to go under the bridge just following the water edge from the Opera House.Also consider catching a Ferry to Manly and back (about 2 hour return trip) for a great view of Opera house as you sail past it. A ferry to Luna Park will take you under the Harbour Bridge and and is only about 30 min return trip.If you have a tight time or money budget, these option will get you spectacular scenery in small timeframe for arounf $20.
A Must Do. Take the time and enjoy a stroll across the bridge. You can walk over and back or take the train one way and walk back. Don't forget the camera!
Another amazing Bridge. Another amazing bridge, I recall it needs continual painting and it was this bridge I believe Paul Hogan used to work on as well.

Try the twilight climb!. We went to Sydney during a warm period. It was too hot for a daytime climb. We tried the night time climb. It was very enjoyable and not difficult at all for someone who isn't fit. Its a shame you can't take your own pictures because the views are remarkable. And the pictures taken by the staff may not be that great.

Good landscape .... It is a good landmark ... and you can go up to the bridge and get a best view .... The only thing that matter , if you go with a group tour, you could not stay there for more than an hour due to a lot of buses also wants to park there ...
Spectacular sight.. It looks beautiful lit at night. Amazing view In the day. Great backdrop for any photo. You can climb the bridge in an organised tour.

Amazing. The walk on the bridge has an amazing view of Sydney great buildings with a beautiful ocean view. I loved walking there while eating a delicious ice cream and the nice Cristmas decorations. A most in Sydney.

One of the pictures from top of the Bridge. Great way to spend your day i will recommend taking a photo package as it comes with about 10 pics. on usb.. And is about $35 but it is a well worth it as it is a great memory souvenir..

Awe struck!. This really is an impressive structure & the fact that is on one of the worlds most beautiful harbours, makes it a must see in Sydney. I would recommend jumping on a ferry in Circular Quay & heading around to darling harbour as you will go right under he bridge. I would also recommend seeing it at night, beautiful!

One of the main landmarks in sydney. The Bridge together with the opera house give life to the harbour. There's lots of history around this old bridge. I took the time to walk from one side of the bay to the other, highly recommended.There's always the option to do the fancy, expensive, touristy climb to the top of it. Not my thing so I didn't do it

Great.. How could a bridge be so good? But it is! It looks great in itself and when you sail under it by day or night it's great too. Walk across it for more great views and pay a few $ to climb the steps up to the pylon museum for interesting info and a great view.

Sydney Harbour Bridge Twilight climb. The twilight Sydney Harbour Bridge climb was a safe, easy-paced experience. The company have their systems and processes down to a 'T', from the screening of participants, to their kitting-up with climbing overalls, safety belt, communication devices, warm jackets, gloves and hats.They have done it all so many times before they know what works.The experience was magnificent. The opera house was bathed in the afternoon sunlight, and this sight from the bridge is fantastic. The beautiful harbour can also be appreciated from this vantage-point. So if you are going to Sydney and only have a few days, a bridge climb is definitely to be recommended, though it takes 3.5 hours and is an expensive exercise, so plan it carefully.
Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. An awesome climb and a must do when in Sydney..The day I went the weather was not the best but the views are amazing.

Amazing Scenery. Amazing view specially in the evening where you see the glittering lights sorrounding the harbour bridge. You will also witness the rising moon just beneath the bridge... saw it when we were close to the bridge from watsons bay around 6pm. Very beautiful scenery! Seems like you are very close to the moon. So romantic! Well, good for couples haha
Beautiful bridge. Sydney harbour bridge is a must see when you visit Syden you can walk over it or even climb up it, but don't miss it

Sydney bridge climb - A must do!!. An absolute must do whilst visiting Sydney is the bridge climb! I'm someone who is nervous with heights but my instructor was fantastic and kept me up the front of the group and kept checking in on myself and others who were less confident. The climb took 3 hours and the guide talked us through the history of the bridge and harbour through a headset which was fantastic. The views, as expected are amazing - a shame you can't take any photos yourself but the safety risk is understandable - the guide takes a couple of photos with the iconic sites and city with you for a small price. Definitely recommend to anyone who wants to experience Sydney's best view point!

Great experience!. The staff were very friendly, and even if you were afraid of heights they were patient and helped everyone through the tough parts of the climb. I would recommend this to anyone going to Sydney! Still the best view of Australia and you learn some history of the local area!

AMAZING. The climb is really over priced which puts alot of people off doing this, I am glad I spent the money. We arrived at 4.15 the first night time climb, we were up just in time to see the sunset over the Harbour, amazing views of the city. Make sure you budget to include this into your trip!

Climb the pylon for a fraction of the price of climbing the bridge!!. Every visitor to Sydney should at least walk across the bridge, or even better, climb the south east pylon and visit the museum about he building and history of the bridge.
How cool were the Cats???

Loved this.. This was a wonderful experience. Had a beautiful day and the view of the harbour was wonderful. Had a great guide and he told us all the points of interest.
No good if you don't like heights.
Would do this again.

The Bridge of Sydney . I had seen this harbour bridge on every photograph of Sydney. And I was lucky to view the silhouette of this arch bridge first along with the fireworks on New Year's Eve and later see the steel of it on the New Year morning. It was amazing to watch the largest steel bridge of 20th century carrying rail and vehicular traffic along with pedestrians and cyclists . Watching the bridge during day and night had different dimensions. Climbing seems to be the ultimate Sydney experience for every visitor. Yes I liked Coathanger , as called by every Aussie with affection !

Stunning. Wow this was amazing, what can l say but you must visit this iconic Bridge, it is the attraction of the Harbour, along with the Opera House, you just cant get enough and don't want to leave the largest tourist attraction in Sydney.

“Take the Challenge!!”. It went so quick. Awesome that they give you every thing you require. Jumper was the best part. They should let you take up chap stick as the instructors do and strap them on too. My lips were killing the next day. AMAZING VIEWS AND SOMETHING EVERYONE NEEDS TO DO ONCE.

Majestic and romantic. If you are into industrial architecture, this is the monument you cannot skip. It's a gigantic bridge, and you can walk right under it to admire it's beautiful structure, pylons and dimensions. If you walk from The Rocks you have some beautiful views to take pics of the bridge and once you are there, it could be interesting to visit Miller's point in front of Walsh bay, which once was the slums of Sydney.
Bridge Climb. Climbing over the Bridge is one of the best things you can ever do. I did it with my dad and the guides and service were great, must do in Sydney

Bridge climb tour. This is one of the best things to do in Sydney! We landed lucky with a great day and had a fantastic time. It's not cheap but if you Can afford it, it's worth it. We had a great guide (John) who was excellent, funny, informative but also professional! The climb is easy/medium we had old, young large and small people in our group and all managed fine. The views are fantastic, not to be missed. Also got a pass to the lookout tower included, this is also great as you can use your camera to get some great shots. It's a pity you can't take your camera on the bridge climb but understandable also.

Take the Challenge!!. This is something you will not want to miss. Since I went with 2 elderly people we only did the Sampler but it goes 3/4's of the way up. It's 990 steps and you have to leave your FitBit behind. :( It's very safe and you feel very safe. The pathways are very nice. You first put on the suit, then the belt which has a hook that goes on a cable attached to the bridge. Once it goes on the cable there is no taking it off so you are attached good. They do a breathalyzer test to make sure you are sober also and fill out paperwork. You then get the belt/harness, a kleenex on a wrist band for water eyes?, the hat that is attached to the back of the jumpsuit and also eye glass ties to prevent youfrom loosing them. Now you are ready. Nothing more can go. You do not climb an incline but steps but we did take little breaks when we felt tired. It was a little tough for us old people but we made it and are so proud of it! The photo is just as good as the one at the top. A MUST do if you are in Sydney. Don't miss it!! Also don't miss the photo op at night out on a ferry. It''s simply breath taking!! The view has made me rate this city the #1 city of lights even over Las Vegas.

BridgeClimb. BridgeClimb .. This is a must do .. It's not cheap but you need to put it on your bucket list. If for any reason you can't do a BridgeClimb then climb the pylon (the next best thing). We did this with two kids (ages 12 & 13) & the mother-in-law .. Great for all ages.

great. Worth walking across the bridge for great views ,You can walk next to the road from shore to shore over the bridge free of charge!
best pictures of the harbor that you can take yourself from here.
Love the view. Eventhough it's a long walk up the peak, well its worth it. Beautiful view from above and you can see the opera house & cruise terminal.

Lovely view of the bridge. I didnt to the climb as it is costy. Being to be able to view the Bridge from the Opera house on the day and catching the bridge view at night are simply amazing. No wonder it is an important icon of together with the opera house. Just lovely admiring the view.
Take the Bridge Climb. Take the bridge climb to see awesome views from the heads of Sydney Harbour to the Blue mountains in th west or just walk across the bridge for wonderful views of Syndey.

Very Interesting piece of engineering. You can either do the big Bridge walk where you get to walk on the steel structure in a group with a guide or walk across the pedestrian path and into one of the legs of the bridge where they have a museum with the history of the "Coat Hanger" (the nickname of the bridge).The museum is up quite a few floors but if you can manage the stairs it is well worth it.

Bridge exhibits it's grand presence.... Visiting Sydney and not spending time admiring the harbour bridge is not worth the tour. The grand presence of the bridge in the quay area is amazing. It's seriously a magnificent creation. While having a good walk around the area, if you have a camera handy, you wouldn't stop taking breathtaking beautiful clicks. The view is extra spectacular in the evening when the taller buildings in the periphery, opera house, big boats and the bridge itself shine so beautifully. Come around the New Years evening and you would be able to experience one of the best fire cracker shows in the world. Besides this place being beautiful, it has a lot more to offer. The area has a great vibe, full of world class restaurants serving scrumptious cuisines, pubs & clubs get crowded even on the mid days of the week and weekends are specially maddening with enthusiastic lots, or you would see people generally having a happy stroll around. In short, the place is not to miss if you wanna see one of the best sights of sydney plus top of the range nightlife.

Panoramic Views from this Iconic Sydney landmark. When your in Sydney you must walk across the Sydney Harbour Bridge. You great views of the Harbour and the City. You can walk from the City to Milsons Point and if you are staying in the City you can catch a train back to Wynyard if you don't want to walk all the way back.Climbing the bridge has become very fashionable, but you don't have to. Walking across the bridge is just as good and you can save yourself a couple of hundred dollars.So put your walking shoes on and take a bottle of water and enjoy the walk. It will take about a good 30-40 minutes to walk one way.Enjoy !

View, Walk, or Climb to Experience an Icon. Along with the Sydney Opera House, this is iconic of Sydney Australia. Crossing the harbour from downtown Sydney to North Sydney, the bridge identifies Sydney to the rest of the world. Viewed from "Mrs Macquarie's Chair" in the Royal Botanic Gardens, this stunning bridgemake superb photographs to help you remember Sydney.You can view the bridge or walk across the bridge for free but you will pay a sizeable sum to be among those that have climbed the top girders of this structure.The best views daytime or nighttime are from a boat in the harbour or a cruise ship entering or leaving the port.

Amazing experience!!!!!. Loved every minute!!!! It was great from start to finish, if you have a problem with heights, go over there and challenge yourself!!! You will not regret it. The views are spectacular, the tour guide is very knowledgeable. A must do when you're in Sydney!!

Iconic structure and interesting history. The Bridge is a fascinating structure with a wealth of history behind it. It's impossible to visit Sydney and not head to the Bridge. Fantastic photo opportunity and there's also the chance to take the bridge climb if you're comfortable with heights!
best bridge in world. look close see the rivets in bridge and wonder this beauty in the bridge walk full length take in views look above see people waling on span best icon in world

More iconic Sydney. You've seen the bridge in every aerial shot of Sydney and it is certainly worth a visit! Great views from the pylons near the Rocks and from the bridge itself. Easy walk across the bridge for great views of the Opera House and Circular Quay.
Take a ferry to enjoy going under the bridge and viewing from different angles.

Astonishing. There are 3ways to see the bridge 1) the free way by walking over the bridge footpath that is accessible via the rocks, 2) underneath on the Balmain/Darling Harbour ferry or 3) the expensive way by the bridge walk. All are stunning and you see the views of Sydney from all three. If you take (1) take time to visit the exhibition in the bridge tower and take in the views from the top of the exhibition. The bridge walk is expensive (approx 110pds) and is not for the faint hearted or those with mobility problems. The view from the top is fantastic. Just imagine how the built the bridge ! If you like engineering this is probably the best tourist site in Sydney. Don't forget to visit the Australian after the bridge for a refreshing bear
We did the walk!. A bit scary, but you're well locked in. Kind of breezy out there in the harbour. Was not expecting to be so cold. At lest 10-15C colder than down below. Be prepared.

Bridge climb a big box ticked. This iconic world famous bridge climb is probably the most famous bridge climb in the world, it's not cheap but well worth doing, it takes about 3 hours of your day but the views and the experience is one you'll never forget.

A spectacular view of Sydney. This is must do thing when you get to Sydney it cost's about 230 dollars and lasts about 3 1/2 hours but it's worth it , the view at the top is spectacular and the photo you get is top drawer.

It is a nice bridge. We did NOT pay money to climb the bridge, we just walked across it. It is not too big a deal. It is easy to do, to get to the bridge level, there are a lot of stairs to climb. The main reason to do this is to get pictures from the bridge's perspective. We were told that the bridge climb did not allow for cameras. They are worried, rightfully so, that the cameras would possibly be dropped onto the cars passing underneath.
Magical. We stayed opposite, the Sydney Harbour Bridge, and loved it. We could not stop staring in awe, both day and night, just gorgeous!

A wonderful walk.. We walked over The Sydney Harbour Bridge,on a beautiful sunny day,with my family.What a view of the harbour.After the walk,we went to Luna Park and caught the ferry back to the city.What a great day.

Wonder of the world. Yes I know it is hackneyed. But it is a magnificent creation, probably best observed from one of the many nearby high buildings. You really cannot visit Sydney and not spend a little time admiring it.

Awe Inspiring. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is amazing, it's huge and provides for great photos. Unfortunately the Climb is expensive so we opted not to do it, but I got lots of photos throughout the day and at night when it was lit up.

Bridge climbing / Loved it. Bridge climbing is a very nice way to see whole Sydney Harbour. The price is around $150 and total length of the ture is around 3 hours.It is very nice way to soend day in Sydney and do something tht you usualy wouldnt.Tickets you can book online or get it at the bridge.They have pictures options where for $30 you can chose any 10 pictures that you like (they take them during the ture) and they are on USB.
Brilliant view. Climbed today first thing. Was brilliant, had a great time, would definitely do it again. Amazing experience.

Photos of the Bridge look good but not so much from the bridge. Firstly to be clear this review is about the walk across the bridge and not the paid for climb on the top of it, or the pylon look-out.It's a bridge and it will turn up in a lot of pictures of Sydney Harbour, as a welcome element. However it's not a great walk and most of the time it is difficult to see out through the fencing designed, presumably, to stop you jumping off. There are couple of viewpoints for some good photos.It isn't a very long bridge to walk across and, combined with a ferry one way, it makes an interesting stroll. Note that only the East side path is open to pedestrians, with cyclists confined to the West side. The East side looks towards the Opera House and the sea.

Always great. As a Queenslander moving to Sydney eight years ago, I always have had a soft spot for this amazing cities tourist spots. I love the bridge and just how spectacular it is. A day out under the bridge near the water is breath taking and I advise everyone to go do it!

Sydneys most famous landmark. the Sydney harbour bridge is a defining landmark of Sydney! check out the harbour and the opera house, and you can even walk up to the top of the Bridge for an awesome view over Sydney!

MUST CLIMB. Ive climbed the bridge twice. it is a must to climb, you can pick between 4 different time periods (dawn, morning, afternoon, evening) must do dawn or evening, as you get to watch the sun rise or sun set over beautiful Sydney

A must if you're in Sydney. This is my second time visiting Sydney and my very last days in Australia. I wanted to make a perfect end to it by climbing the bridge. You can choose different ones, I decided to do the standard bridge climb all the way to the top,134m up!! Yes it is quite expensive, but it was so worth it with the beautiful view, lovely group and a fantastic guide giving us information about the bridge and a few funny stories. It was a totally amazing one of those ones in a lifetime experiences. If you have the time and the money I highly recommend it. look at http://www.bridgeclimb.com for more info about the cilmb. If you're one of the faint hearted ones, pyloon lookout could be a good alternative. :)

Try to get higher. I ascended to the bridge to take pictures of Sydney's right and left shores. So to say, bridge itself is not assigned for this goals - cells and wires are everywhere. I didn't find any place to take a good picture. It's about right part (with opera house view). The left part is assigned only fore cyclists and I couldn't get there cause I've got no bike. But, as far as I know, it is possible to go up to the top of metal constructions for some money. If you are aiming to take some pictures, you better not waste your time trying to find easy way and just go up to the top.

Great. I walked along the bridge and the view is excellent .If you would like to pay more, you can have a bridge climb tour to really go up the bridge and have a better view and have a guide telling you the story. I didn't do that. I just walk by my self. I had a very good view of the Opera House which is just opposite to the bridge.definitely a must go in Sydney

Great climb, but pricey. Everything about the climb was great other than the cost. I think it is very pricey for what you are doing but saying that, you do get great views of the city and the guides are of high quality with a good sense of humour.

We walked across - nice walk. We walked across the Sydney Harbour Bridge we did not do the Harbour Bridge walk. We did the walk in the early morning and it was great - the views are wonderful and the walk way is wide. It was a nice walk; there were tourists walking and people on their way to work (it would be nice to walk to work). Everyone was friendly and there was security on the bridge. Beautiful and safe!

tolle Aussicht / good view and outlook. we just had stayed on the tower and not toke the climbing tour to the top of the Peak but it was also an amazing view over the Harbour and the opera house. absolute must for all visitors :-)
The Hanger. Doing the Harbour Bridge climb was well worth it. My son and I did it and it's a great memory of Sydney.Would recommend the bridge and climb.

fabulous experience. Everyone that comes to Sydney should do the bridge climb, if is fabulous. It is not dangerous, as you are attached by a line the whole way and the vews are spectacular, the guides are great, it is a must do experience
Impressive. A highlight of Sydney. A must see and chances are that you will see this if you are travelling around Sydney. Impressive metal structure.

Couples treat. The views were amazing and the staff lovely, even in the rain, thankfully it wasn't cold at all! But I'd definitely go the express if I were to do it again, 3.5hours was a little too long for us. We could have done it in half the time, maybe they should do faster tours to the top and make them more affordable. It felt like we couldn't move on because we were waiting for other groups. All in was great but we were quite eager to get out of all the gear.

Iconic landmark. This bridge is known all over the world, you can get great satisfaction from walking over it and also from the Rocks get a great view if you are not keen on heights don't attempt the climb, great scenic vistas from all angles.

It's ok. Near the Sydney Opera House and the Rocks, you wo't miss it. It's convenier to take the free shuttle bus 555 to there, so whave beed there twice and will go for the third time today in our seven-day stay in Sydney. Prefer to go in sunny days!

I could NOT see my house from up there. We loved this experience. Staff were friendly, helpful, knowledgeable and humerous. They accommodated our earlier than expected arrival and placed us in an earlier tour. You are given comprehensive instructions, a short training session, overalls to wear and all jewellery, watches and cameras must be left behind. Glasses and sunglasses are allowed. We did the longer tour and found the climb was not difficult - the hardest section was 4 sets of ladders, one after the other. However there are strict rules re; having only one person at a time on a ladder and therefore there is ample time to rest between ladders. In fact you're given many rest and photo opportunities during the gradual move up the bridge, all while being told through audio the interesting history and anecdotes of the bridge. My husband and I are 59 years old, and I have a painful knee and do not like heights - I had no problem at all with the climb and the view was spectacular. This is a must do - if you can afford it, as it is quite expensive.

I can't believe I did the bridge climb.. At first glance an expensive activity but I am so glad I did the bridge climb. I have always been afraid of heights but decided to give it a go after being convinced by my travelling companion that we could not leave Sydney without doing it. The staff are brilliant and you are taken through an hour long briefing about what you can do and not do on the bridge. You are then kitted out in boiler suit radio gear and safety equipment. The walk takes about 3 hours in all. There are 3 different bridge climbs, day time, sunset and evening. We did the evening one and had the lights of the city shinning below us. A superb ending to a superb month down under.
This bridge takes your breath away. We walked under the Bridge to receive a different aspect and loved it. So many lovely restaurants in the Rocks around the Bridge.

Just the Pontoon... We didn't feel inclined to do the real Bridge Climb, so made do with walking along to the Pontoon closest to Circular Quay (reached via the high end of the Rocks area). The view from the pontoon is great and it has an interesting museum feature, accessible for about $13.

Amazing views. The Harbour bridge climb was a fantastic experience which was a highlight of our trip. We were hesitant with the heights and we went on the Sampler climb, which doesn't go right up to the top of the bridge, it certainly goes up very high but you feel safe by being on a guide rope which is attached at all times. The organisation was impeccable with check in, through security, breath testing, safety was paramount at all times. A simply amazing experience, not cheap but well worth it.

Great experience!. Climbing the Sydney Harbour Bridge is a once in a life time experience. I would strongly recommend doing the bridge climb. The staff are very knowledgable and friendly. They were very accommodating towards the different requests of the group. There were some people in the group that were feeling a little anxious about the height of the climb but the staff put them at ease. I found the climb to be a relaxing one. It is not fast paced and even though there are many steps to be taken, at the end of the climb, I didn't feel exhausted. There are many opportunities to stop and take in the view. The staff are also very through in their safety briefings and are very stringent in their care. Although it was a great experience and I would strongly recommend others to do it, I think that doing it once is enough. It is a great but expensive experience.

Wonderful piece of architecture and sensational views from the top!. If you can afford it, as it is quite expensive, do a harbour bridge climb. We did one and watched the sunrise from the top of it and it is up there with one of the best things I have ever done. Even just looking at the bridge across the harbour from where the Opera House is, is amazing. It is so expansive and dominating. I would very much recommend doing this if you are ever in Sydney.

Absolutely gorgeous views. You need to see this work of art.. This is one of the main attractions in Sydney. You will be just amazed by throw gorgeous withe the sunset behind it..your pictures will be like postcards

Amazing view. The harbour bridge climb is a great experience and something you should try to do when in Sydney. A little pricey but well worth the effort. Not a problem if scared of heights as you can't really see much below you but as you look out the harbour and opera house are spectacular. Very safe and even though you look a little dorky in th climb suits it's a great attraction.
Stunning modernist structure. The bonus besides looking at it, either by day or night, is that you can climb up and over the bridgehead as well.Simply amazing.

Nice walk or run. It is a little over a two mile walk back and forth. Of course you can go one way and take the train back if you're so inclined. Plan on taking some time crossing as there are many photo ops (or just places to gaze) of great Sydney landmarks. It is a fun and free way to spend an afternoon.

Iconic Sydney. Never get tired of seeing the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Good to walk across as well. We haven't done the Bridge Climb but others have recommend it as well worth the cost (especially at dusk).
Amazing Bridge. This was one of the highlights of my trip - walking across this iconic and amaing bridge. It was an amazing and a wonderful experience. Worth experiencing one time in your life.

The Harbour Bridge. I didn't climb it as there are so many people doing it and the weather could change and there is not way out. Book late so you know what the weather will be on the day. Its ok if you are good for heights.

A great Bridge, and an awesome climb!. Is there a more Iconic Sydney site than this one? Working in Newcastle upon Tyne, I know that the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Tyne Bridge are exact replicas of each other, but the Sydney bridge is about four times as large. It is incredibly impressive viewed from the harbour or on a ferry, but climbing the thing is just awesome! The organisation of the climb is excellent, and every safety measure has been thought of and implemented. All accessories and jewellery have to be taken off and left behind before the climb, and everyone wears a body suit which is tethered to railings. This is not to say that the climb is easy, or that there are not difficult moments for those afraid of heights. The start and the end of the climb involves negotiating vertical stairs and walking along narrow pathways, and I found both challenges. However, most of the climb is more straight forward, with wide walkways and space to move. The views are so spectacular, and our guide was both helpful and informative. The views do not need any further comment, as they are so well known, but I was very interested to hear about the conditions of the men building the bridge, and to see the massive nuts and bolts they used to secure the parts together; literally millions of them, and in the most hazardous conditions. And yet so few accidents and fatalities in the 9 years in took to build the bridge from 1923 to 1932. Astonishing. When you come to Sydney, you don’t have to climb the Bridge to appreciate it. However, in my view, it is worthwhile to pay the money for this trip (and at £399.78 for three people it isn’t cheap), steeling the nerves if like me you need to, and to climb the Bridge and buy the photos taken by the guide at the end, which I am sure will be treasured mementoes of a fabulous, and unique Sydney experience.

Must Do. If you are in Sydney and can only do one thing this is it. It was a physical adventure along with unique sightseeing. Not cheap but worth it. Takes half day and you are exposed to the elements, so plan accordingly. The trip was well paced so 1400 steps were no problem, though we felt them in our calf muscles the next day. They took care of everything, however personal cameras are not allowed as they could be dropped on the people and cars below. Not recommended for those with problems with heights but you don't really feel on the edge at any time.

Great experience, interesting and fun. Good exercise! The whole experience from start to finish was fun, the staff are great. The views are terrific. I had always thought that you went from one end over the top to the other end, but no. You actually go up to the top then across, over the top of the road (look down if you have a good head for heights) and back down the other side. This brings you back to the start. Would do again.

Great views of Sydney from the Sydney Harbour Bridge walk. Start by taking the lift up to the Cahill Expressway from Circular Quay to get a great view of the ferries, the Opera House and the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Then make your way on the clearly marked path to the Sydney Harbour Bridge. You will walk past The Rocks area. You can also take a detour and climb some stairs to learn about the history of the Bridge in the SE pylon. Or you can just keep on walking until you reach North Sydney.
Great...... All i can say is that i loved it, so interesting to hear all bout the city and land marks. The guide was great too and also a little funny. Def a must.
Good view. While walking up the bridge you can get a great view of the Sydney ferries and the Opera house. It helps you to get a feel for the city. Great to take pics too.

Bridge with a view. You don't have to pay to cross the bridge, you can just walk over it via the footpath, which gives fantastic views of the harbour and Opera house.
Highlight of any visit to Sydney.

Stop wishing and do it. One of life's great experience's this climb is ultra safe you can't fall of the bridge hooked on all the time. Choose a dry sunny day, the views of Circular quay + Opera house and beyond will stay with us forever, just do it O.K.

Beautiful views. Didn't have the time or inclination to do the full bridge climb so followed the tip to catch the ferry to Kirrabilli and walk back across the bridge. Were rewarded with beautiful views of the harbour in the late afternoon sun.

Went to see Aida. Very pleasant walk from the Opera House through the Botanic Gardens to the Handa Opera on Sydney Harbor to see an outstanding production of Aida. Everything was so green and beautiful. Lovely!

Great views but expensive to climb. We decided to climb the bridge for a special birthday and were quite shocked by the price. It wouldn't be so bad if they included the cost of the pictures that they take of you once up there (you're not allowed to take your own camera up) but you get one group shot free and then you have to pay extra for ones of just your own party. For the price, we thought these should be included. Our guide was very informative and it is undoubtedly a great experience. However, it started to rain when we were at the top and it got quite cold. As we'd already been up there for a while by that point, we would have liked to descend quicker but the guide kept us up there for a while longer, which we didn't feel was necessary. Glad we did it nevertheless.

Awsome veiws and easier than I thought it would be.. Fantastic views of the harbor and opera house. I'm a diabetic and was concerned about taking some of my snacks and supplies with me because all the literature said you could not take anything. Our tour guide had a container and was happy to put my things in it. The climb was not difficult and the views were excellent. My only negative was I wish I could have brought my own camera and GoPro.
A good-looking bridge. The views from the opera house to the bridge are wonderful; it's a magnificent sight. For fitter tourists, the walk over the bridge looks terrific.
Wonderful view. Nice and safe adventure. Wonderful view. Its a pity u r not allowed to take camera with to take nice pictures. Not very hard to get on the top.

Be preperared to climb :). A little on the expensive side at $250 per person. However, our guide was very good. I learned a lot about the past, the construction of the bridge etc. Climbed to the top. They take photos of you which you can purchase at the end. View is great of course. I wouldn't recommend going on a hot day if you don't like to be hot. We were there on a fairly average day and got very hot climbing.

Do the Bridge Walk but....... Make sure you pick a clear day! Unfortunately we did it when the weather was overcast and by the time we got to the top, it was bucketing down! Even though the weather wasn't good, it was a great experience! It takes about 3 hours for the full walk which is what I did. It stops periodically to take advantage of views and to hear some history of the building of the bridge. It's not a fast pace but you need a medium level of fitness as there are a lot of steps and stairs to climb but the view of the harbour from the top is fantastic even on a wet day!

Nothing quite like it. I like to walk across bridges; I think it's a great feat of engineering. What, to me, puts the Harbor Bridge above many others is the view. I mean, the Opera House? Luna Park? The various harbors and bays throughout Sydney? Nothing else like that! It's an easy walk and well worth it for amazing views of the city. If you go to Sydney, take the time to enjoy the bridge.

Walked the bridge with my lovely sister. Views were spectacular- wasn't brave enough to do the bridge climb tho - maybe next time !!!! - the whole area is amazing, the bridge, opera house, the rocks and circular quay is a joy to behold
A wonderful piece of engineering. The bridge is an icon of Sydney and many people pay a good price to climb up there and view the city. Not for the faint hearted.

Awesome bridge - climb not necessary. Views from this bridge are spectacular. Note, however, that you can get just as good of pictures from the walkway on the bridge as compared to the bridge climb (where you cannot take your own photos anyway).

A Sydney Must Do. Australia Day 2015 - Lots of Rain. Our Harbour Bridge walk was booked well in advance as we had a gift certificate as a Christmas present. Although the weather was not on our side we had a fantastic time. Groups depart on a regular basis after getting a safety talk and 'dressing' for the occasion. Our guide was very informative and fun. After a little ladder climbing it's a gentle wander up and over this spectacular bridge. We were soaked to the skin. The views on this occasion were not as they should be but this did not make our trip any less enjoyable and we would recommend to all visitors to get up there!

Great views. Walked up the steps to Sydney Harbour Bridge and walked half way across, what fantastic views. This cannot be missed on a visit to Sydney. If you dare to do the bridge climb itself, make sure you're very fit as it looks extremely difficult.

fantastic. Something you have to do! We only did the taster climb and it was amazing.. the view of everything was unbelievable.. our climb guide lisa was fantastic funny and full of information.. next time we will definately do the full climb

Try a tower climb instead.. The Sydney Harbour Bridge climb is not for the faint of heart, yet the view from the supporting towers has to be a close second to the panorama enjoyed by the walkers. Only 146 steps take you to the lookout, its far less expensive and you can take as many photos as you wish. In addition, the history of the building of this massive structure is laid out, together with a large screen presentation. On a fine day the view is unforgettable with late afternoon light casting a golden glow onto the Opera House. Oh, and the bridge is only painted where needed and NOT continuously as popular legend tells us!

Visibility poor for a poor copy of what is in Newcastle, UK. The storm tells you how very few people are prepared to admit that Sydney is OK when the sun shines and that is not very often. It is the most rained on city in Australia. It has all the shopping outlets but who wants to shop in copycat outlets that are now available in most cities. There needs to be a shift in mindset for what to do and what to tell visitors what to do in a storm in a CIty.

must in sydney. this is an amazing delight for photographers at sunset and blue hour, the lights and the whole setup is fascinating. the views are both good from circular quay and luna park.Take your time and walk around, find a perfect location and you can also climb the bridge.
Epic English Engineering. Stayed at the harbour view hotel for 2 weeks with brilliant view over the harbour and of the bridge, pity the opera house was hidden by a tower block.

Pleasant walk with a view. Great view of the Harbour and Opera House. Nothing to dislike. Only issue is that the barriers to prevent you climbing the sides an possibly jumping off makes taking certain pictures a problem.

HUGE!. We cruised under it, we road over it and we went in the tunnel under it. Never got to climb it like Oprah though. Will have to come back to do that. Love you bridge Sydney - it's in all my photos

Great walk, amazing structure. I had done the bridge climb on a previous trip, so this time my friend and I just walked across it on the sidewalk, and it was just as cool if you don't have the money to do the climb. Great views of the Opera House and Harbour, and very peaceful!

Bridge Climb is Awesome. A very professional run attraction. Staff are very friendly more than happy to answer questions and put minds at ease. The initial part of the climb under the bridge was intimidating for our 11 year old but once onto the arch of the bridge it was amazing. Our guide Kate was incredibly informative, we learnt so much. We had incredible views over the city, to the blue mountains, to the heads and the Pacific Ocean. Well worth the effort and the cost.

Easy walk, steps at each end. The walk across the bridge itself is easy and not too long. The steps at the Cumberland St (Rocks) end are many, so perhaps commence the walk from the North Shore (still some steps, but not as many). Each end of the bridge can be accessed via train or ferry. One of the pylons has a museum and you can climb to the top of it.

Bold. This is a strong looking bold structure so grand in the Sydney harbour.It's great to see it up close after seeing it in many postcards in the past. You can walk to the top and view Sydney from a birds eye perspective.

Bridge Climb - Superb. Took the twilight climb and was excellent.Preparatiom for climb was thorough in respect of safety issues,excellent guide and views superb both in daylight and darkness.Not the cheapest but well worth it for the experience and the views

Excellent !. Definitely a "Must Do" in Sydney even if it results a bit pricey when you have several kids. Weather was really not great, highly cloudy with a bit of rain, and despite this we really enjoyed each of the minutes we spent on the bridge.Definitely better not to be scared of heights.

Sydney Harbour Bridge is definitely a 'must do'. I walked across Sydney Harbour Bridge having been a short term visitor to Sydney in 2014 and decided there are some things i must do to understand Sydney better. Apart from sweeping, panoramic and breathtaking views providing the perfect photo opportunity of the Opera House, harbour and surrounding suburbs there is an information centre. The information centre or museum fully explains and charts the history of the bridge in text, photo and video. I am most certainly glad I walked across the Sydney Harbour Bridge at least once.
Lucky with the weather. Awesome views. So lucky that the sun came out and we had blue skies after the cloud and rain of the previous day. Such a memorable experience.

An Iconic Masterpiece. The most famous arch-bridge in the world, once criticized for spoiling the views, now a spectacular part of this spectacular city. And now one can enjoy a stunning walk right over the top, day or night. It's not scary, its safe and beautiful, and great value for money.

Great Views. This is a very streamlined process. You get kitted up and before you know your climbing your way to the top of the bridge. It's a very easy climb with a few ladder climbs at the beginning and the end. As you would expect, the sight up there is beautiful. I could have stayed up there all day. Jake our guide was patient, informative and very friendly.

Sydney Harbour Bridge. The harbour icon, great to photograph from the pylon or footpath. Probably easier to park on Kirribilli side & walk the 1.6km to the city for a coffee/snack. Wander the Rocks then catch train back if not up to the return walk. Both sides have a footpath so I suggest East side (facing Opera House) going and west side back (which is also train side)
Best View of the Opera House. Sweet view of the Opera House. History lesson included in the tower climb, at less than 15 AUS. Much better price than 250 for the bridge climb.
must see. there are a lot of other and bigger bridges in sydney and melbourne but this one you see all the time on tvwe didn't do the walk, it's impressive enough from the water

Walking across is a great free alternative over climbing it. To save money I opted to walk across the bridge instead of climbing it. It was definitely still a great experience, though the fencing on the sides of the pathway did obstruct the otherwise beautiful view, but I guess they're necessary to prevent any unfortunate accidents. It was a simple, easy walk, which took about 20-30 minutes total. Would recommend bringing lots of water, wearing comfortable shoes, and applying sunscreen. Would definitely recommend to anyone.
BREATHTAKING. It is something that you have to see once in Sydney; the view from the bridge is unforgettable, and it is a nice walk to reach the North of the city.

Bridge Walk. The bridge walk is really good and not too taxing-the hardest part is climbing the four vertical stairs up to the bridge itself. There is about and hours prep time before the walk and this is to suit you up and prepare you for the walk. The views are magnificent from the top and your guide will give you a history of the bridge and show you things in the distance such as the Queens Residence and Kirrabilly House for example, he will also take pictures and videos if you want them. The whole experience was great from start to finish and I would recommend this walk to anyone who is keen to experience this walk.

An amazing experience. I was bought this as a gift and am so glad as I'm not sure I would have been brave enough to do it myself. From start to finish the whole experience was expertly run. The climb leader was very reassuring, talking us though the whole thing, reassuring us of the safety and what to expect. The hardest part was the initial climb up the ladders to the main bridge walk but there was lots of reassurance. Once on the main bridge the walk was fairly easy with great views of the harbour and Sydney. Photographs are taken by the climb leader and available to purchase at the end. All in all a fabulous way to see Sydney,

Walk acroos. This is a great walk, either way. It is easy once you get up to the bridge level and as well as the exercise you get a great view. There rarely seems to be a lot of walkers so there is no pushing and shoving.

Great by night. Our family of four (2 teenage daughters) traveled by train across the Sydney harbour Bridge by night and enjoyed the city and Opera. A nice finish to a day of sight seeing. Helpful Sydney Transport staff helped with direction< where to get off and on.

Free to walk, great views, a must-do. It's free, it's easy to access from The Rocks, it's quite peaceful to walk across if you ignore the traffic, and has great views, it's a must-do while in Sydney.The only problem is it can be hard to see over the fence at times, which has been built up to stop people potentially jumping over. My suggestion here would be to catch a train from Wynyard to Milsons Point. You can catch unlimited train trips from one side of the Bridge to the other doing this, and they depart fairly frequently.

Just do it!. We climbed this in the rain and wind and had a hoot! Not ideal but we did it and were happy! They offer a very secure system that accomodated even this 74 year old and his fear of heights.

A bit over rated and way too costly. I'm not sure what all the fuss is about. If you do decide to do this I would recommend the express tour. If you do the regular tour you are stalled time and again by the number of groups ahead of you. I couldn't wait to get off the bridge. Views are great and all the staff are very friendly and professional. Get ready to queue up. 2 toilets for how many people? When it's time to leave get in the queue to see your photos. After 3+ hours I opted to exit without using the toilet and without seeing my photos.
Good Experience. You need to be fit to climb this one. $250 if you miss the regular guided tour. but it has its own adventure.

Climb it or walk across it ... this bridge is a MUST. I have walked across it plus climbed it. It is an awesome history and you need to learn how it was built in the 1930's and this gave me a deeper appreciation for its engineering. It's a must if you are in sydney.

Engineering masterpeice. This is truly an iconic walk, when in Sydney take a walk across this masterpiece. It's a great walk across to North Sydney and then jump the ferry back across to Circular Quay.

The harbour sailing. Fabulous sail on the harbour. Very personalised trip, accommodating, friendly and thoughtful. Something magical about being with a special person (or a small group) on one of the most beautiful harbours under sail. Highly recommended.Note, it is an older yacht but still has charm.
Always Breathtaking. This was our 5th Bridgeclimb but this is by far the best way to see this beautiful city and the amazing harbour!
A MUST SEE IN SYDNEY. Very beautiful for sightseeing. Quaint eating right on the harbor. Not much for excitement for children but a must see to check off the Sydney must see list!

Great Walk. Walked across the bridge and back. Spectacular views of the harbor, opera house and Circular Quey.
I highly recommend this.
Syndey's Harbor Bridge. A beautiful landmark .. I wasn't brave enough to take the bridge walk, but those in our group who did the walk said it was fantastic.
Fantastic!!. We Climbed the bridge on April 7th, 2015 Our guide Leaha was fantastic had time for everyone and remembered all our names. A bit pricy but its a once in a lifetime trip!

A must do if in Sydney.. I did the full tour and climb of the bridge and it was well worth it.
Amazing views and an experience you are unlikely to find else where.
The staff were informative and helpful.

Walk the Bridge. We walked the Bridge from Milsons Point to the CBD. The view was incredible and the walk very relaxing. I had read that the car noise would be bad and the fumes as well. Perhaps we picked the right time, but neither of those things were a problem for us country folks. I would recommend the walk as the view of the Opera House and the downtown core is great. There is safety mesh, which is a bit of a problem, but there openings which allow you to get most cameras/lenses clear of the wires.

Fire works at Harbour Bridge. been her to see the the fire works for the new year. its definitely worth waiting for whole day to she the fireworks with DJ music. its a very well managed event. be early there to book a nice place to watch fireworks. opera House is the place where you can get a great view of fireworks

Highlight of our time in Sydney!. The Sydney harbour bridge climb was definitely the highlight of our stay in sydney! And a definite must do for any tourist visiting! We were very lucky and had beautiful weather with not a cloud in sight! The staff were excellent and had a good joke with you an are really informative about the history of the bridge which was actually really fascinating.You don't appreciate the bridge, harbour or opera house so much until you get up there and learn about what you are standing on and the scenery around you.One downside, i would say, is that you cannot take your own camera up with you. I know that they don't want people dropping it on the road below etc aswell as people stopping every 2 seconds to take photos hahaa.A definite must do whilst you're in sydney!

Worlds largest arch bridge. Beautiful landmark.a must see in Sydney.one can walk thro they bridge.there's also a cycle lane.the view from here is stunning.full view of the opra house and the busy restorants

We walked the bridge. We did the Sampler Bridge tour, which was wonderful. I wish we had had the courage to do the Full Tour. The views were amazing and the feeling was absolutely fabulous. Well worth it (but didn't get a certificate 'cos we didn't do the full tour - Shame!)
Beautiful Structure. What a majestic bridge. You get a true appreciation for it when you walk under and around it. Didn't do the bridge walk tour but saw many people on the bridge that did.

always stunning. real aussie icon. Something magical being near or on the bridge, I always like to find a hotel with a view of the bridge when in Sydney (even of only a glimpse) then I truly feel I'm in Sydney!
Human Heritage, hope it stays there for ever. Just beautiful, iconic, attracting, enchanting, familiar. Pass under, over, on, by the side of it, you will be conquered by its charm.

Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. Like and ferry trip around the harbour, climbing the Sydney Harbour Bridge is a must do attraction by travellers to Sydney. Whilst the climb itself is not cheap, the views are stunning, and one could say that saw a tremendous area of Sydney just by doing the climb. Whilst there is a minimum age, there is no maximum age and many have been known to do this climb for their 80th or more birthdays!

The Bridge is iconic both in its engineering and as a symbol of Sydney that is recognised around the world.. We have seen the bridge from both near and far, and passed under it by ferry more times that I could count. This time we decided to walk across it. No, not the infamous "bridge climb"; too scary and too expensive. There is a footpath on the opera house side of the bridge that any one can walk across. This appears to be a little-known fact. We caught a ferry to Luna Park and then walked up the hill to find the entry point to the bridge stairs. After climbing these stairs, we found ourselves on the footpath of the bridge, we headed back to Circular Quay by foot! As you look out to your left, there is a beautiful view of the harbour and the opera house. My partner is scared of heights so he made sure to look out at eye level, not down! It's a pleasant walk, not particularly long, certainly not difficult and it's free! We felt a sense of achievement after we finished! There are stairs down to the Rocks on our descending side of the bridge. We wandered through this area which is really lovely, especially if it's your first visit.

Great experience..... I climbed the harbour bridge with one of my friend and couldn't have better time!!!! Almost everyone can have sunny weather but us - rain!!! However, fun we had was enormous. We had a great guide and a group of people which we climbed with - lovely. This attraction is something what needs to be done if you are not scared of heights. And if you are - try it anyway!!! The view you get is worth of trying.... It is amazing!!!!
Amazing!. Very well organised and safe with amazing views, also the tour guide was excellent and very informative, would recommend to any one

Walk across Sydney Harbour bridge.. As my wife doesn't like great heights we opted to walk the bridge, going from The Rocks end across, and back again which makes for just shy of a kilometre. There are two entry points onto the bridge. The first one is for the climb, and not so easily signed is the second one for the walk, being almost out of the Rocks district. Take a wind proof jacket or extra layer, as it can get very windy.
Very impressive. This iconic piece of architecture is mind boggling as to when it was built and how!! I waited a lon time to see it and I was not disappointed

best view and very good walk tour. either catch the train across to Milsons Point and walk up to Cahill pass or catch the ferry to Luna Park and walk from there and under the Bridge North side. This is will take you about 2 hrs or longer if want to take your time or you can walk from The Rocks which will save you $.

An iconic bridge that you shouldn't miss. Do take the opportunity to walk across the bridge. It is easily accessible from The Rocks area near Circular Key and the access point is well sign-posted. Although the walk is fenced in, you can still get good photos through the fence, and it's all free. But, do pay the $13.50 (at time of writing) admission for the Pylon observation deck (it's the south east pylon, closest to the CBD) - lots of stairs to get to the top but the views are spectacular - it is completely open. One word of advice - do try to get there early (10 am) so that you avoid the crowds of people trying to jockey to get the same photos as you are.

My daughter & me.. My husband (recently deceased) was too scared of heights so I took my daughter. It was a fantastic experience and I want to do it again this year. Maybe a sunrise and sunset trip. Very memorable. I love Sydney used to live in Clovelly now Eastwood. Love the beaches but love the bush here as well.
crossing the bridge. So good to walk over and back the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Of course there are views of the Harbour itself, but it is always good to marvel at the actual bridge itself!

Bridge Climb. As a family of four it certainly wasn't a cheap day out but I have to say it was well worth it. A once in a lifetime experience. An excellent tour guide, a highly organised and professional set up. I didn't feel rushed at all, lots of time to take in the wonderful views and to savour the experience. A must do in Sydney!

Climbed to the top in 2001. Climbed to the top in 2001 - don't know if you can still do this, but if you can do it on a beautiful day then its worth it, Views are great and its totally safe as you are tied on to a metal bar and there are steps.

City icon. We didn't climb the bridge but were amazed by the fact that even elderly are doing this attraction. Sadly didn't have the chance to take the ferry and look at this bridge from the water either, but took some nice photos with the bridge in the background. Maybe we'll come back here someday and take a closer look to this bridge :)

BEST VIEW OF SYDNEY. The bridge climb is awesome. Other than the fantastic views, the guide really enhances the adventure. Mine was a talkative, well informed, entertaining fellow named Daniel. he had it all together and had us looking here, there and everywhere and laughing the entire trip
every Saturday!. every Saturday, In there make the fireworks. thats a nice!
A fabulous walk. Love crossing the bridge. It is always a must with the family, like a tradition. The walk is great and so easy with the layout for walkers. Highly recommend this to everyone.

Walking Milsons Point to the city on the bridge footpath. There are virtually fabulous views when you take the walk path across the Sydney harbour bridge. However the experience is spoiled by two elements (1) You are walking right parallel to a busy road traffic lane and there is the constant loud traffic noise for the whole distance walked. and & (2) You do not get uninterupted views to the harbour because you need to look through a criss cross of metal protecting support/fencing by your side which extends to partly curve above your head as well. For some reason, security guards are stationed at various points along the path. A far better experience would be to take the guided walk across the top of the arch, which must be paid for and organised in advance, and you would have to be reasonably fit to manage this.
Harbour Bridge Climb. We did it!!! We climbed to the top of the Sydney Harbour Bridge. What a great experience and a fantastic view of Sydney. Don't pass up the chance to climb it!

Breathtaking. If you want to,you can walk on top of the Bridge and look over the city.You will see a lot.There is lots to do over there.The people over
there are very friendly,and they will help you out a lot.You should
go over a see for yourself.
WEL
Interesting but. Depends on how much time you have in Sydney. Our preference is take the ferry to somewhere, see the bridge from the water and not bother walking on it.

Brilliant tour guide. Did the Bridge walk and was very professionally looked after and the tour guide was amazing- well informed, friendly and very patient, as i was scared of heights. Great views ( when i could look) and had to be done but never again!! Free group photo and ten second video from top of bridge and a cap to keep and other phootos avaialble to buy- we got two for thirty AUD- not too bad.
Iconic landmark. SHB is an iconic bridge just like the Golden Gate, Brooklyn or Tower - worth a visit to get a few photos and to say I've been there

A must-do if you have the time !. We did the 9am Bridge Climb on a beautiful autumn morning - what an experience ! Whilst pricey, it was absolutely worth the money, with thorough preparation, a well-paced walk (not too taxing !), informative lively commentary, and of course the views ! People can't believe the picture we had taken at the top is 'real' ! Would totally recommend for anyone who's up for an unforgettable physical activity. We'll be back to do the twilight walk soon !

Walk the bridge. We parked at Milsons Point and took our 3 year old son and 4 year old daughter across the bridge. They LOVED it. My son was going mad for all of the trains, ferries, planes, helos etc he saw as he crossed over. Well worth the effort and an amazing thing to do while in Sydney.

Nice, if you still have the energy to walk its length.. Well, the views of the Opera House are amazing from the bridge - if you don't mind looking through chain link-style fencing. We just went as far as the first pylon which you can go up (for a $13 AUS fee) for better views, but by that point, we'd done so much walking, we were too tired to invest in the full experience. The car fumes weren't all that pleasant, either.

A Spectacular View of Sydney !. One of the things we did during our visit to Australia was the Sydney Bridge Climb.If you are not familiar with this, it is where you get suited up in a special outfit, and then climb up the top of the upper arch of the bridge!It starts with a breathalyzer test (really!) and the typical release form signing. Once past that, we are given special grey/blue jump suits, a cap (ours to keep) that is clipped to the suit. Then given a harness and radio (to hear the leader as we climb), and shoes (if you were not wearing ones that were acceptable. Rainsuits can be provided if needed. You can keep your sun glasses, but they provide a harness for them that clips to your suit, so you can't drop them.You are not allowed to carry anything else, including cameras, watches, jewelery (other than some rings and stud earrings). They provide lockers for safe storage of these items, and you keep the key while you are there.The climb starts with you connecting the harness to a steel safety line that runs the whole length of the walk. The connection is via a cable from the harness to a slider that slips along the line. Once attached, you then walk an a catwalk directly under the bridge out past the stone pylons. Then a climb up 4 flights of ladders from below the roadway deck to the beginning of the upper arch span. This was the difficult part, as the stairs were quite steep. Once pas this, it was easy. The walk was a simple stroll up a series of low (vertical distance from one step to the next) wide metal steps, slowly moving up the arch to the top. It was not difficult or even tiring.I really do not like heights as a rule, but this did not get to me. In addition to being connected to a safety harness the whole time, the bridge felt very solid, secure and safe. So don't be worried about that.The guide pauses several times along the way for us to enjoy the views, while providing interesting information about the bridge, the tours, and the various things you can see.We reached the top of the arch, and the views were spectacular! We were there during a cool, sunny day. So everything was bright and clear. We looked down at the Opera house, up the channel to the harbors, and waived to all on the various tour boats below.The guide answered all questions we had about what we were seeing, and it was a great time. He also took pictures of us there with various things in the background. (One print is included with the price of the tour, and the others are available for an additional fee if you want them).We then crossed over to the other side, and took in the views there. (more pictures).We then walked down on the other arch, and then back down the ladders, and back over the catwalk.The whole tour took about 2.5 hours, and was well worth the time and cost. It really was not strenuous, and if you are in moderately good health, you should have no problems.  If you do make it to Sydney, don't miss this tour.

The Climb of your Life!. If you have a head for heights and want exhilaration, fantastic views and a true sense of achievement; then climb the Sydney Harbour Bridge, it's brilliant!I was in a party of 6 which was great and after 45 minutes preparation including breath test, health form check, kitting out and practice climb we were ready to walk ... We were 2 hours on the Bridge and I found the first 200m horizontal walk and vertical ladder climbing to the arch the worst as I became sccustomed to walking on a narrow walkway about 20m above the road and then having cars passing about 60cm away from me! But once once out on the arch it is wider and the gradual climb to the apex, 520 steps until 134m above the water, is fine with frequent stops to be told the landmarks by the guide and have drinking stops. You are tethered all the way and can take no personal possessions or cameras. The guide takes photos at various locations.It's brilliant and I did it on a sunny day and the views around and the activity below were amazing! Thoroughly recommend it .....

Go to the Pylon Lookout. This bridge is just amazing and if you go to the Pylon Lookout you can read about how it was built. This bridge is truly beautiful and it's amazing how it was built all of those years ago. The view from the lookout is spectacular.

Do it!!!. I have a pretty healthy fear of heights, and I procrastinated for the final two weeks before my trip, deciding last minute to actually make the climb.... I am so so pleased I did. Yes, I had jelly legs at times, yes I found it challenging just from a fear point of view, but oh, the delight and satisfaction completing it was amazing. The view, needless to say, are incredible, the staff are all excellent - so helpful, professional and encouraging. A must do in Sydney!!

spectacular. If you ever go to Sydney (and the weather is good) do the bridge climb as its a lot of fun and the views at the top are stunning. Your learn the history of the bridge during the climb which is fascinating. Its not a hard climb as they pace it so as you have little breaks along the way.

Different view of Sydney. Climbed the bridge with friend as part of birthday celebration. We all had a great time because of the event and the staff that support. Would recommend as a must do in Sydney

Amazing!. The whole experience is amazing. The staff are friendly and efficient and walk you through the set up procedure. All the equipment has been well thought out and safety is paramount. Our guide (Nicole) was excellent, informative & amusing. Whilst not a cheap activity it is a once in a lifetime experience.

WOW!. My niece and I decided to do the Bridge Walk and it was superb. Prep time beforehand is well executed and the climb up the bridge was awesome. View from the top where the flag is was amazing. Thrilled to have done this.
What a sight!. A must see if in Sydney, our cruise ship went right underneath it, not to be missed. I did not walk on it as you need a bit more energy than I can muster.

History, adventure and scenic views. I climbed Sydney Barbour bridge couple of years back. It was definitely the highlight of my Austria visit. It takes ~3 hours and it's worth the time and price (which is by no means cheap). It's completely safe, guides are very knowledgeable and give lots of interesting & historical information. It's a long walk and then up to the top, it grows on you and gives an adrenaline rush when you start climbing. Scenes of Sydney harbor, both sides of the city and the opera house are amazing. All in all a must do!! Will do it again during my next trip with my son!!!!!

Glad I did it. I am not very good with heights and was not too sure about doing the bridge climb, I eventually decided to do it and am so glad I did. The weather could not have been better and the views were fantastic. The climb is quite pricey but I felt it was worth the money and the guide we had was very good.

Beautiful, But Climb Is Too Expensive For What It Is. The bridge itself is a nice sight for sure. I wasn't planning on doing the climb, but once I saw people walking on top of it, I thought I'd go ahead and do it. It's 3.5 hours of your life you can't get back. It says you must be reasonably fit to make the climb, but there were 3 old people (and I mean old) doing the climb in our group, and they had no trouble. I wish it was more of a climb. It mostly is just a nice leisurely stroll. The only good thing is that I can say I climbed it. Other than that...meh. Rather boring and too many stops along the way. I guess they stop so people can catch their breath, but there is no need. If you have doubts about the climb (nervous), don't be nervous - it's not scary at all. It's just as if you're walking across the bridge. You're not close to the edge or have any treacherous paths.

1396 steps. This is a must. If you don't do the bridge climb you may well regret it for the rest of your life. The whole thing is s 3 hour experience so you certainly get value for money. Then you reach the top! Wow.

Great Views. Take a walk across the bridge to check out the views of the harbour! The photo opportunities are fantastic and you can also go up the tower when it is open to really get the best view around.

Climb it! It's worth it!. We climbed with Bridge Climb company and it was unbelievable! Our tour guide was amazing, so informative and really loved his job which made it all so much more enjoyable!
