The most amazing experience.. I am not good at heights but knew I had to do this climb as I would have left Sydney disappointed with myself. The moment I spoke to the staff I felt so confident. The whole experience was amazing and the staff quickly put you at ease and give you all the confidence you need. It was totally worth doing. Once again the staff in Sydney have shown outstanding service. Thank you.

Fantastic views. Climbed at twilight and it was great to see everything in daylight through to night. We have some fantastic photos taken by our guide Mitch. He was just fantastic and made the whole experience very enjoyable. The bridge itself is easy - getting on to and off the bridge is slighlty trickier for some on the ladders. It was really worth doing but there was a huge amount of waiting around on the bridge for other climbers and it could have been cut down by at least an hour. If you are not sure - give it go you will be pleased you did.

Good view of the Opera house. we skipped the bridge climbing which costs 200$ and 3.5 hours! instead we took the walk along the bridge where they have made a separate walkway for this from which you can enjoy a beautiful view of the opera house. the walk would take 30 mins where u can stop on the way to click enough pictures
How Lovely. Stop and take a pic of this icon, its amazing to see just how much hard work went in to this bridge. so glad that we stopped and had some pictures here.

Fantastic views. We did both the bridge climb and the tour of the bridge pylon - both are great. For the money, the simple pylon tour provides a short documentary about the construction of the bridge, and a fantastic view of Sydney Harbour. The observation area at the top of the pylon can get a bit crowded, but with patience, you will be rewarded with an amazing view. Highly recommended to anyone who can climb 200 steps. There is a gift shop.

Try walking the bridge if you're up to it.. A very impressive bridge that gets a lot of traffic. They offer a walk across the bridge that is very challenging. One of the members of our group did the walk and was very impressed.

Did It Even With a Fear of Heights!. I was nervous about this one because I have a terrible fear of heights. But I was so glad I did this. It's just and awesome experience. The staff is informative, friendly, and enthusiastic. The views are beyond words. If you have a fear of heights...only twice was if difficult for me; on the approach, the path is a catwalk (see through surface) but manageable if you don't look down. Then at the top you transverse from one side to the other across a narrow path but again was manageable for me if I didn't look directly down. The paths up the bridge are wide and you're secured the entire time with a harness.

Breathtaking , a must to do when in Sydney. I was lucky enough to do the bridge climb with my two daughters who treated me to the bridge climb for my 70th. Birthday present. Never too old . Not only was it breathtaking , our guide Graham was very informative with any questions we had and also what he knew. Many stops along the climb so was really very easy to do. Happy birthday was sung to me when we reached the top which was very special to me. Will highly recommend this tour.10 out of 10 Thank you

So many steps. This was a good tour. Great sights, and we got lucky with the weather. The tour guide was very laid-back and kept everyone relaxed, especially those who were wary of heights. There was a lot of walking and climbing but it was paced well and it was nice that there were water fountains and misters around for people to cool down and stay hydrated.
A bridge is a bridge is a bridge.... This is really just a bridge but an iconic one. Expensive to walk it but if you have dosh do it. Seems close to opera house & is easily photographed from there.

The view from the Sydney Harbour Bridge was great. We skipped the walk "over the top of the bridge" for $200 per person that took 3.5 hours. Instead, we walked to one of the of the 2 towers and paid $13 per person. The view from the top of the tower was great with the world famous Opera House across Sydney Bay. Don't waste the $200 per person, and 3.5 hours of your life.
Bridge climb was a highlight.. Overcome my fear of heights and highly recommend. Guide Damon was fabulous. Fabulous views of Sydney

Breathtaking. Of my few days in Sydney, each day we visited the the circular quay, to watch the magnificent structure under different lights. We did not get a chance to walk up the bridge, but did take a ferry around it in the evening, around sunset. Its beautiful.

Worth the $, when the weather is right!. We did the night tour and it was awesome. The stars we bright, and the opera house was lit up. You are hooked to the bridge the whole time, as long as you can ignore the fact that you are up so high, you won't even know it!! Do this!!

Iconic. We walked, drove and climbed over the bridge, as well as sailing under it. All were worth the experience and it was hard to know if the climb was more exciting than the drive ( for a visitor!). The climb is not cheap but the whole experience is most enjoyable, unforgettable and not bad value given the length of time it takes.
Magnificent views cool breeze. Walking over the Harbour Bridge is a must in Sydney. Go on a sunny day for great views and cool breezes. Finish off at Circular Quay for a refreshing drink.

Magnificent structure. The structure of the bridge had me awestruck! The designer of the bridge must have been a real genius to have even imagined this kind of a structure. No wonder people get their wedding photographs clicked here with the bridge in the background.
Great!. Really nice to walk over and get the train back from milsons point, great views of the harbour, a must for any visitor

It is big whichever way you look at it!. you can fly over it, drive over it, bus and train over it, climb it, walk over it and catch a boat under it but it is so big you can't miss it!Having said that, we were recently on a cruise ship that was so big it couldn't fit under it!Anyway it is a Sydney Icon that attracts people from all over the world to view it, film it, photograph it and generally admire its photogenic qualities along with the beautiful harbour.It can cost you nothing or hundreds of dollars (if you want to climb it).So why not enjoy it because it is much to big to ignore.

Birthday present. My present to my husband For his birthday . I couldn't afford for both of us to do it ! I watched from below with pride ! My husband was quite hesitant but as I had already paid he felt he had to do it !He was very glad he did and we have decided that if we are lucky enough to return we will do the night time walk and look back at the harbour lit up .

Climb it!. It's super expensive but a once in a lifetime thing. We had fun climbing the bridge and laughing at ourselves in the crazy outfits. Make sure to go on a clear day. We went during the day but I have heard sunset is nice too.

The Climb of Your Life. We decided on a twilight bridge climb this year as we had done the climb previously in daylight. We were not disappointed, the vies do the city as darkness fell and the city lights came on we're absolutely stunning.Our bridge climb guide Daniel Poole was very informative and attentive to our needs during the climb and bade the experience very interesting and exciting.The bridge climb is a must for anyone visiting Sydney no matter what time of day you choose to climb it the views are stunning.
Walk if you can. The bridge is spectacular overlooking the harbour. If you can do the climb it is worth it, is expensive though.mthe view are excellent.

Breath taking. We were going to do the climb on the bridge but found it very expensive at $258 each as we could only do the climb Saturday afternoon due to time constraints. So we opted to walk over the bridge and climb the first tower which was full of interesting facts and a short film. This only cost $13 each and climbed to 89metres instead of the bridge climb which goes to 134 meters!

Spectacular bridge climb. This is one of the best visitor attractions I've ever been at but because of the height and exposure it's not for everyone.We did it in the rain and while the visibility could have been better we still had a very good and entertaining guide to take us round.My only comment is that it is way too expensive and not worth the money.

We walked rather than climbed. I went to Sydney with the intention of climbing the Bridge but it just didn't look like enough of a challenge for the cost and there were 3 of us, so we just had a pleasant walk over the Bridge from the Rocks and had a drink over at the other side in Killibilli, which had a nice feel. The only thing was that the helpful woman in the information office at the Rocks gave us detailed directions on how to find the "secret" access to go over the bridge but, when we did as she said, a security guard turned us back and said it was a bicycle-only route so perhaps things have changed and no-one has told her.

I was perfectly happy to simply walk across the Sydney Harbour Bridge:). Those who want to pay AUD$185 per person to climb the bridge, my sincere best wishes. Truth is, I'm in awe of this wonderful world and I'm in greater awe of the God who made it. But I don't have money to burn on adventures I can live without. And paying so much to climb a bridge isn't in my bucket list. Already, I'm so very thankful to just have been here:)))

The 'coat hanger' is impressive. We didn't climb it (no head for heights) but it's great to see. As bridges go, it's as iconic as Golden Gate and Brooklyn when you see it up close, and of course, an engineering marvel. For me, more impressive than the nearby Opera House as a Sydney landmark.

the climb is worth every penny. we did the harbour bridge climb. its a once in a lifetime experience. the safety system is excellent and anyone of any fitness level can do it. An elderly gent celebrated his 100th climb in the presence of a camera crew while we were there. Has to be done!

A hefty price tag for a great view. I did really enjoy this - a sunny walk to the top of the bridge for amazing views of the Harbour, with a fun and friendly guide who had all sorts of interesting facts. BUT - it's incredibly expensive for what it is and I couldn't help but feel the price was something that had been arrived at as something the organisers could get away with rather than what the experience is actually worth. Personally, I think $100 knocked off the price tag would be much fairer. In Sydney the two things you want to look at are the Bridge and the Opera House, and if you're on top of one of those, the view is beautiful but you're not really seeing anything new. The best thing about the experience was the guide pointing out Fort Dennison where I went for lunch the next day and would absolutely recommend with every ounce of my being.

Definitely go to climb the bridge. If you have time, please definitely go to climb the bridge, the post card at the tower area is also deserve to buy. While reaching the top point, you can see the paramount view of sydney city, harbour. Please go and have a try

FAB. If anything bigger and bolder than you would think - a massive structure which carries lanes of traffic, trains, bike and people - we walked up from The Rocks and along to the first of the big piers - briiliant
Looks wow. This looks wow. Esp at night when lit up. Missed the climb due to bad weather. Next time would like to take a walk on this bridge
bridge climb. great experience anyone can climb its not scary and it has great view at the top...a little expensive but with it if going to Sydney
Climb the bridge for the best view in Sydney. If you want the best view in Sydney coupled with a truly unique and thrilling experience then climb the Sydney Harbor Bridge.

A great walk morning or night. One of the great things about the bridge is you can walk across in about 15 minutes. Walkers/runners on one side and cyclists on the other. Gaurds are stationed about every 500m to prevent trouble. Great views without paying.

Wonderful experience. It was an amazing experience and one I would highly recommend. We did an evening walk and the views were fantastic. Everything is organised very well. There were no delays with anything at all. Our guide Daniel was excellent, full of stories and great sense of humour. Having the group sing Happy Birthday to me at the top of the bridge was something I'll never forget.Although you need a certain level of fitness if you have that it isn't a hard walk. Plenty of time to stop and take in the views. Photos are taken at various stages with the opportunity to purchase at the end.Not cheap - but worth it

Missed the climb. Really wanted to do the harbor bridge climb but did not have the time. Will do this the next time. Enjoyed walking around the area though and will also hire a bike the next time. Undoubtedly one of the best experiences in my life was watching the fireworks on New Years eve from a boat on the harbor. A must for all to see.

A great experience to understand construction in the early 1900's. I've swum under it, dived under it, sailed under it, flown over it and travelled across it…..only reasonable that we climbed it. For no other reason, it is a must do for aussies to understand the period of time in which it was built and the shear tenacity of those who constructed it. The tour covered all that and more. Having read with interest some of the negative comments re cost and time, that is part and parcel of a safe visit. Not something of concern in the early 1900's.

A bridge .... Walkin over the Harbour bridge is great. An experience is to do the bridge climb! It sounds harder than it is ... easy walking but on top of the bridge - great views - a must do!Choose a toure early in the morning, so it is still nice and cool ...
Nice view. It is World famous spot and gives a very good outside view. Known as Harbour bridge the place is situated near the Opera house.

Breathtaking Harbor. I have visited many seaport cities in the world and in my opinion Sydney Harbor is quite simply the most amazing harbor. It is an easy walk across the bridge with great views every direction you look. Bicycles are on one side and walkers on the other which makes it a very pleasant walk. A great way to obtain your bearings on your first trip to Sydney, a must do.

Don't Climb the Bridge. I know this bridge has been on Opra with it's views from the top, but it's not place to go unless you are fit and can climb lots of stairs and then go up a hill on a three foot path with nothing but a guide wire on both sides a hundreds of feet down to the bay. Sorry this one isn't for the feint of heart or any one with bad knees.

Amazing. A tourist must see is the Sydney Harbour Bridge! However, the best way to experience this is to walk the Harbour Bridge (walking up to the top is an expensive option which I would not recommend) which will give you amazing sights of the entire city!

A dream of a place. Having a son in Australia gives us the chance to visit this brilliant place we were lucky enough to do the bridge climb in 2010 what a marvellous piece of engineering and to think we British had a hand in this, most of the steel came from Middlesborough in England, but what a climb well worth it to climb up one side cross over at the top in the middle and to come back down on the opposite side when crossing over in the middle we had a chance to stop in the middle of the bridge and look down at the road at the many lanes of traffic plus a railway that also runs over the bridge, we even had a ship pass under us as well how lucky was this the guide was brilliant and kept us interested on our trip.Australia has many other interesting places to visit.

Great Day Activity. My friend and I booked to do the 'Bridge Sampler Climb' as we had a limited budget and found the full length, 3+ hour walk too expensive! Our walk was on the lower beam of the bridge and went a quarter of the way across as opposed to half way across. I thoroughly enjoyed it, something to tick off the bucket list! Our walk was $150 approx and took 90 mins approx. Found it to be fun with great views of Sydney and the Opera House etc. Would recommend a visit to the Brudge Climb if you are in Sydney!! A peak cap and small group photo is included in the price. They offer photo packages and individual photos can also be purchased at $15 each.
Fabulous walks/runs across the bridge/lovely views.... We always walk, or run, across the bridge... amazing views, especially on a beautiful sunny day...Love it here...
Great views. Great views of the entire area and we recommend walking out. If you have no problem with heights, you can walk to the top.

A Bridge to History. I recently re-visited, what we Australians affectionately call the 'Coathanger', the Sydney Harbour Bridge which was opened on Saturday March 19th 1932 by the then Premier Jack Lang, after some six years of construction. With a height of 141m (or 134 m depending on where the measurement is taken) it is I believe still the world's largest (but not longest) steel arch bridge.Designed by Dr Bradfield of the NSW Department of Public Works he was the Chief Engineer of Sydney Harbour Bridge and Metropolitan Railway Construction. The main roadway across the bridge is known as the Bradfield Highway and is about 2.4 km long, making it one of the shortest highways in Australia. When it opened, it cost a car six pence (5 cents) to cross and a horse and rider was 3 pence (about 2 cents).OK forget the history and take stroll along the bridge with your camera in hand to view Sydney’s highlights such as the Circular Quay, the Rocks, Sydney’s central business district (CBD),the Harbour with its majestic sailing boats and of course the iconic Sydney Opera House. At night, the views are breath-taking and memorable.Take the kids, grandma, or your friends visiting Sydney. Easy to access and with parking in around the area it is a must visit for 2015.

Our Bridge is no Midge. Sydney's Harbour Bridge is undoubtedly one of the best known in the world. It is iconic - a masterpiece of engineering, standing proud and tall - spanning arguably the most beautiful harbour in the world. Volumes have been written about it. Millions of photos have captured it. Every visitor to Sydney wants to see it.There are many ways to view the bridge - from land sea or air.Or from the bridge itself!Organised Bridge Climbs are very popular - but are pricey and require a great deal of physical exertion.A less strenuous way to enjoy the bridge - from the bridge - is to walk to one of the two massive pylons supporting the structure.Begin your walk from "The Rocks" area near Circular Quay. A short walk from the Quay will take you to Cumberland Street, and from here intrepid travellers can access the substantial flight of steps that take one up onto the pedestrian walkway across the bridge. Heading north, as if to cross the bridge, a delightful walk of some 400 metres will bring one to the southeastern pylon. Follow the signs and enter the pylon where a succession of steepish steps will lead to a level where one may pay a small fee to continue to the top for spectacular views of the city, harbour and bridge structure itself. The views really are breathtaking, and provide something a little different and very special to capture as a reminder of your trip to Sydney - and Sydney's iconic Harbourt Bridge.

Fun Experience. Climbing the Harbour Bridge was a must do for my family. It was fun and exciting. Not nearly as scary are you might think. Not super hard either. You are well prepared by the staff prior to the climb.

Spectacular.. Let me be clear: we did not walk the arch. My wife was too scared (though she has walked across the Grand Canyon) and I wasn't bothered. But we walked the conventional footbridge beside the traffic and still got spectacular views. And we're able to wonder around the North shore. Views of the opera house from the bridge are unique.

Great views from the walkway. A little difficult to find the way up to get onto the walkway, but just head to the rocks and then ask someone round here. The steps up are near to where you go to do the paid bridge walk etc. lots of people running across the bridge and other foot traffic but great views and would recommend as a great free activiyt

Bridge Climb. My wife bravely climbed the bridge, express version, which is harder than the full climb. I climbed the pillar at the edge and this was very interesting... but over 100 steps.
View from here great. Also see the climbers
Great to see!. We didn't do any of the walks onto bridge, but could see many groups climbing to top. Very impressive

Awesome. my husband booked this for a tick on his bucket list ! He was very nervous but the organization is faultless, Arron our guide was helpful and calming ! The views are amazing and got a certificate, free hat and photo. Fair dinkum mate !

It is the must. Sydney means Opera House and Harbour bridge. Both are beautiful. We walked on it at night enjoying every minutes of it. Too romantic. Watching Opera house and cruises on the Harbour. We went North Sydney by train the next morning , and under the bridge there was a big park. We watched the river, yachts, ferries, beautiful opera house, and the bridge itself. The best pictures of Opera house from that point.

Well worth the cost.. Finally after numerous visits to Sydney over the years we decided to climb the bridge and I am really glad that we did. It is an extremely professional operation with the utmost attention paid to safety. Be warned if you have not been climbing a lot of stairs recently you will probably have sore calf muscles for a few days.

Must do the bridge climb!!. The bridge itself is a marvel but to do the bridge climb was an event that was "life-changing" for me. The climb helps you overcome any "imagined" fears of height and once you are up at the top you can only gaze out to the Sydney horizon in amazement. DO NOT MISS THIS!!

Fantastic experience!. When in Sydney the bridge climb is a must! You must be able to handle your fear of heights and the climb can be a little strenuous going up. Once at the top the view is spectacular and the feeling of accomplishment can't be beat. The tour is extremely well coordinated and every detail is taken care of by the excellent staff. Our guide, Peter, was knowledgeable, encouraging, caring and overall was superb. This is truly an fantastic experience!
Bridge walk. a must do even if your scared off heights .the views are fantastic the man that took us up the bridge put me at ease so glad my husband talked me into it !!!!!

Iconic Landmark. Views of the bridge come from many directions, but best are from the Opera House, or from a boat or ferry. We didn't climb the bridge, mainly because it's quite high, but it's also very expensive.

Night walk on bridge. Had an amazing night walk on the bridge for my birthday. Our guide Peter was informative and very funny on the tour. Safety was paramount and made it all the more enjoyable. Will be back to do the sunrise walk as well. A great experience and an easy walk

Bridge climb. Husband did the night walk across bridge loved it and the view was brilliant. He said his guide was really good at what he did. Had a few dinners on the harbour looking at the bridge and the queen Elizabeth was in so an extra treat

Breath taking. When you first see the bridge it really takes your breath away. We were so used to seeing pictures of it on TV that we could hardly believe we were actually seeing it. There are various walks available which : up to the top, half way and quarter way. They're are pricey but if you are physically fit and have a head for heights it would be an amazing experience. We didn't do the trip as I do not have a head for heights but we went on a ferry under the bridge which gave us great up close views.

Added to the Sydney experience. We took the metro to Milson Point and walked back along the Bridge. It adds a whole different perspective to the view of the wharf and the Sydney Opera House, which we say from some of our ferry rides. This is a good alternative to the bridge climb, if you want to have time with the bridge but fear heights as I do!
Another must-see in Sydney.. The view is beautiful and its ideal structure for their times, is places that must go, a monorail station is located in front of the bridge and you can go back on it.
impressive. rather impressive to see the bridge! You should find a better spot to see bridge. if you want to take photos with it, you have to find another spot then.

Bridge Climb a must!!!. My husband and I did the bridge climb, and I'm so glad we did...mostly for bragging rights. It's so well organized, they have the prep down to an art. To be honest I got light headed right as we reached the peak but our guide Tom was all ready with water and a sugar pill and I was fine within minutes. Also a medic was there within 2 mins and he even came back to check on me as we began our climb back down. I think anyone can do the climb young and old. I will say it is pricey, but it's something you only do once, so it's worth it. They even give you a group shot and you can record a 10 sec video. Additional pictures are available afford a fee.

Iconic and classic. We travel via car under the bridge and also enjoy the park under it..its a beautiful sight. Our City icon.Did you know that they painting the bridge all year around,never finish,You can exeprice one of the lifetime stuff by clim the bridge. Which took half day from pre to finish. It's very safe and a bit pricey...
Big. Went up the concrete supports , the landscape was fantastic , you could see the whole of sydney. You must go over the bridge if you are okay for heights

Soul lifting views. It was pricey. Originally we ruled this out because of the cost. The climb was a challenge, which we were up to, but I can see how some, who are not in moderately good shape, would not be able to enjoy the views because of the effort needed to get to the top. We were glad we did it. View of the harbor was, of course fabulous. Tour guide was fun; great stories; great history; great comic timing.

scenic view. i travel over this bridge at least three times a week .the feeling is amazing,i never gets tired of it.it is one of the great architecture of modern history.the view of the bridge from the sea is scenic .
Amazing structure. If you cant walk up the Bridge it is fascinating to walk underneath to see the immense structure. Also interesting to do a boat trip and pass under.

A hearty walk. One can easily walk, run, jog across the bridge from syndey side as it it less than 1-2 miles back and forth. One can also pay big $$ for a bridge climb (we did not choose this, but looked exciting). The views are great on a clear day. The Sydney side has an extensive street fair near the bridge entrance that is worth strolling through.

Iconic Landmark of Sydney. Like the Golden Gate in San Fran, the Sydney Harbor Bridge defines the city. One can walk over it, ride a bike, take a bus, or a train. Built in the 1930's, is is old, but enduring. Another must-see in Sydney.For the dare-devil, you can climb up to the top of the bridge.

Excellent views.. Climbing the Sydney Harbour Bridge is one of the greatest things to do while in Sydney. It is one of those once in a lifetime experiences. I was fortunate to have an extremely clear day for the climb so the view extended all the way to the Blue Mountains. Make sure you book in advance.

iconic bridge. This is an iconic Sydney site. We walked across the bridge at street level, which took about 15-20 minutes at a leisurely pace. We did not feel the need to do "the climb" , as I was told it was quite expensive and arduous.

Bridge Climb = Great views, slow climb. The bridge climb gives you great views of Sydney from the Bridge, but wow is it a slow process getting up there. After you have been suited up, you have to do a practice run of climbing up ladders. After you have all of your gear on, you start the climb (at least an hour into your "climb" time. The climb itself is not difficult - it is very slow going up the bridge, so you can take in the views, and they can take lots of pictures of you (you cannot bring a camera or phone with you). Once you have reached the top, and the photos are done, the climb back down is rather fast. You have the option to buy your photos - have them printed, or get them all on a flash drive. Expensive, but worth it since you can't take your own photos up there. It's a good experience, but be prepared to wait wait wait when you're climbing the bridge!
Awesome. Fantastic every time I see it. Climbed it for first time and a great experience and worth doing at least once.

Well worth it. Great experience! Our guide was Mitch and he was very good. I initially grumbled to myself that there lots of other groups ahead of us that we had to wait for, but it actually works like a well oiled machine and a rest after the first big climb was needed! It goes without saying that the views are stunning. The guide takes multiple photos along the way and they're not too expensive to buy - $55 for all photos on a cd; and you're also given a free group photo and climb certificate. An amazing experience that isn't the cheapest thing to do, but well worth it, as I'm not sure where else you can do something like this.

Night Climb. As a few others have said. The night climb is spectacular. Climbing up when the sun is setting and then watching the magnificent city light up as we approached the top.An extra special treat was watching the Mardi Gras guys singing (really badly) ABBA and Kylie songs on the karaoke complete with disco ball!!! The whole experience from start to finish was excellent. Graham, our guide, was really funny and entertaining.
Great Bridge. Recommend grabbing a beer at an opera house bar and watching a sun set. Also grab the ferry into circular quay for some fun.

Sydney harbour bridge.. My initial reaction when I first saw the bridge was "What a grubby bridge, what is all the fuss about?" This was due to the mass of metal imposing on a very picturesque harbour. In fact it does have a sort of beauty, but of course, it is nice to see such an iconic landmark. Not far from the opera house either. You can take a hike over the arched metalwork spanning over the bridge. It does cost $280 AUD for a 3.5 hour hike. I didn't bother. I later discovered that you can go up in the supporting towers for nothing. Too late though. The old street on the Sydney side heading back into the city, is worth seeing. The juxtaposition of old with the backdrop of new city. It also has the oldest pub in Sydney. Something Australia does have a few of, is proper British type pubs, rather than continental type watering holes (though they have them as well).

OK but.... Bridge was pretty nice but I think that we are spoilt by living in London with so many different and fantastic bridges. That said the 'Coathanger' was worth seeing but not so much like a coathanger as a smaller version of some pretty more impressive bridges. By the way Paul Hogan of Crocodile Dundee fame retired many many many years ago and most young people probaby would not even know who he is!

Excellent Climbing Experience. We climbed with the most experience host, Richard, who made the experience extremely enjoyable.Having been breathalysed and suited up (with no loose objects and hat/glasses attached) it was time for the safety briefing and then to be clipped to the metal wire that you follow throughout. Throughout the walk, much interesting information was provided and heard though headphones. Some fantastic pictures and a short video (available for purchase after) were taken as a reminder of how much fun was had during the walk.

Incredible! . We did an evening bridge climb, which began at 6.55 with the safety, outfitting and demonstration. Everything was extremely well organised and the group leader made sure those who feared heights were made comfortable. The walk itself was not as difficult as I thought it would be and the views at the top are absolutely amazing. You are given adequate time to take in the views and the group leader takes a number of photos around the bridge. You are attached to a radio the whole time and your group leader explains a lot about the history of the bridge and its design and building which is all very interesting. A must do attraction in Sydney! Definitely worth the money (and as a backpacker, money is scarce!)

Very nice. Very nice weather makes visiting the Bridge even lovelier.Because of the Asian Terracota soldiers display for the Chinese New Year at the location adds vibe to the place.Many families and couples strolling, lying on the ground just enjoying the gorgeous day and view.

Awesome twilight climb experience!. We took the Twilight Climb during our trip to Sydney in February. While I do agree that the Bridge Climb is pricey, we had a great time. The Twilight climb leaves in the late afternoon and allows you to see the City in both daytime and nighttime conditions. It really is the best of both worlds. In addition, it is generally cooler once the sun goes down. Our guide (Tom) was great - funny and entertaining. One couple in our group (of 14) got engaged at the top of the bridge. It was incredibly sweet (and she said yes). I have mild fear of heights, but being tethered to the bridge helped a lot. Climbing up the bridge was actually the least scary part for me - walking on the catwalks to get to the arch was actually the most challenging. It was something I've always wanted to do - and I'm so glad we did.

Great walk but beware joggers!. One side of the bridge is for cyclists the other walkers, which is very strictly monitored by bridge wardens, 20 min walk from one side to the other with plenty of stopping points. You can pay to go up to higher observation point. Sadly some impatient joggers made me and others feel very unwelcome, I thought maybe I was in the wrong 'lane' but the wardens assured me not. Think it is something which needs to be addressed as not a good indication of friendly Aussies.

Awesome. The Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb was on my husbands bucket list as a must do in Sydney. I booked to go along with him with some hesitancy as I do get a bit of vertigo. But I need not have worried, the organisation is excellent and health and safety taken very seriously. You are clipped on and the scariest but is the climb of 4 ladders to get to the start of the climb. Once on the bridge the steps are easy and the pace is steady.The views are fantastic and you feel a real sense of achievement having got to the very top. You do get a group photo, mini video, cap and certificate plus the option to buy additional photos.It is not a cheap thing to do but if you can do it, you won't regret it

Over hyped. We checked the place in afternoon but because of the hype came back next day to see it in the night. It was average. Though we did not try the walk. But I am sure skypoint walk would be better.

A must do for all visitors. Although its pricey climbing the harbour bridge is an absolute must.I am not the fittest person in the world but managed it easily and felt a huge sense of achievement when we got to the top . The longer walk allows plenty of time for rests on the way up and guide was very supportive and encouraging. The views were breathtaking but we were on our way down when the weather started to close in and the visibility became poor quite quickly so try and plan for a sunny day!
Walking across the Bridge. Nice walk and great views. Opera House and Sydney Harbour are just so beautiful, makes you want to stop many times even though the walk is not long

A must do.. This is worth a walk along just for the amazing views of Sydney. Go up the tower for an informative look at the history of the bridge and the engineering. The 360 degree views from up there are amazing.

Great way to spend the day. We had a great 3-hours at the bridge today. Our tour guide, Andrew, was a witty "Stayan" who really enjoys his job. He was full of great facts and interesting history, helping us understand more about what we were seeing and experiencing. The tour is really well done, well organized, and professionally led. It really feels like they have thought about every little detail and perfected it. We laughed our way to the top as Andrew entertained us. Thanks for the great day Andrew, it was "aweome" and "we really appreciate it", as 'mericans would say!!

A real experience.. Clad in a jump suit with only my underwear underneath everything including glasses and standard issue hanky was clipped on. The organisation is terrific. This is a real experience and not for the faint hearted. The roar of a train over your head, 4 lanes of traffic zooming by only adds to the excitement.Everybody is connected to a steel wire so you are safe all the way around . There are water fountains and a cooler spray for your comfort.For the forthcoming mardi gras a glitter ball can be found at the top!For the Chinese two karioke mikes for the evening!The views are not to be missed and you get to keep the cap!
Incredible !!. Amazed to see a marvel of engineering. For us it was the best part of our trip to Sydney, the views are incredible.
Climbed the bridge. The Bridge Climb was amazing. I don't like heights much but had to do it for the experience. So glad I did. It was so wonderful and would recommend it to anyone.

Slight disappointment. We were disappointed in the bridge but I guess with the opera house in the foreground it does make a great photo. Coming from Scotland it takes a lot to impress us after the bridges we have over the Firth of Forth .

Good views but very loud traffic noise.. I enjoyed looking at the bridge more than the walk over it. The views are excellent but it is very busy as it is one of the 'must dos' I guess. It can be quite windy. The noise of traffic is quite off putting as it is very very busy with traffic. We took good pictures of the Opera House from there.
Quite a Sight. Very Interesting to see all of the people taking the walking tour on the suspension bridge. Expensive and not for the faint hearted, but I am sure it is an amazing experience.

Some people are nuts!. We had a great view of the iconic Harbour Bridge from our hotel room and were able to see it in much more detail from the harbor itself and from the ferry. We could see the bridge climbers walking up, even from out hotel. It must be quite a magnificent view from the top, but I don't think that yo0u would ever get me up there.

Walk this icon at road level. I have done many adventurous things but never fancied doing the bridge climb. I have walked across the bridge a number of times and would recommend this to anyone. Make unlimited stops along the way, soak up the views and take photos (things you cannot do on the bridge climb) Go up the bridge tower for even better views. Just make sure you do this on a clear day. At the other end have a coffee and look back at the CBD, then either walk back, get the ferry to Circular Quay or Darling Harbour, or ride the train back over the bridge.
Awesome. We did this our last day in Sydney. Everyone said it was a "must do" while in sydney and we are glad we did it!

Absolutely, Positively Fantastic!!. We did the Bridge Climb and it is one of the top things I have ever done. The start is filled with details - safety, breathalyzer, test of ability (easy) and outfitting. I mentioned attention to detail because when you get your outfit you will note that everything you bring on the bridge is clipped to your issued coverall. The tether line is very secure and the instructions were very specific.Once we completed the instruction portion of the trip, we got to walk out and on the actual bridge. The walk is peppered with stops for hydration as well as education. The groups are small so you quickly make friends with your climbing mates. There are also many spots where the staff take your photo. Note no personal cameras or iPhones allowed, that was part of the security briefing. When you are on the bridge you will quickly understand why that makes sense.We had spectacular views of the harbor, Opera House, Circular Quay and the surrounding suburbs. Thrilling, exciting and beautiful. If you have time in Sydney add this to your Must do list

A MUST-DO climb at Twilight!. A definitely a must-do on your list to climb the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Book in advance on-line! Register for the Twilight Climb as you will both see the day and night perspective of the city!

I'm glad that I did it!. Try the bridge climb - you won't regret it. I can't say that heights are particularly my thing but a walk over the top of the bridge is a must! You are attached to a wire all the way, have an experienced guide who provides many an entertaining tale and the view from the top is worth every step!You do have to allow plenty of time (approx. 3.5 hours) and I'd suggest that you pay for photographs as part of the package. They also give you the opportunity to video a brief message from the top so think what you are going to say, keep in brief but the wind will probably cover up most of your words.I can't say that there was anything that I disliked except that it is pretty expensive (but sometimes you have to buy things with your heart rather than your head!).Enjoy!!

Top of the world. Well prepared for the walk by expert leaders, told of possible areas where nerves might take over, the history of the bridge was well explained, the views from all places on the bridge were amazing, a must do when in Sydney

Sydney Harbour Bridge on a tight budget!! IT'S FREE!!. Just take the opportunity to walk the bridge from Milsons Point/Kirribilli or Darling Harbour side .... and you can always catch the bus, train or ferry back...... it really is a great view and if you can get up early as the sun rises on sunset it is even better and that bit cooler.Easy walk and takes 30mins ..... enjoy it and it is FREE!!
darling harbour. One of the best ways to travel around Sydney Harbour is by ferry. For fantastic harbour views, try the Manly, Watsons Bay or Taronga Zoo ferry routes.

Go at night. The minimum AD$148 is out of my budget range to walk the actual structure to the peak. However, take anyone of a number of harbour ferry services to ride beneath. I walked across from one side to the other at 10pm when the iluminated cityscape is quite stunning. I found the city employs a number of friendly security staff 24/7 who stroll along the bridge, they firstly answered a few queries and secondly did make me feel safe walking on my own at night up there.
Take a walk or bike ride across. I wasn't up for the Bridge climb, but cycling across was excellent. Take the train back to Circular Quay if you don't want to walk back.

Why Would Anyone Pay $150-$350 pp to Climb the Bridge?. We walked across the bridge for free and enjoyed all the views. For less than $15 you can climb 200 steps up the tower (pylon) and get the same views as the bridge climb and take pictures (which you cannot do on the bridge climb). There is also history information there.I just do not get people paying so much money for the bridge climb unless they want to brag about it. You can get more from the cheaper alternative and it takes less time.

INCREDIBLE!!. This exceeded all my expectations! I expected the climb to be harder than it was, shorter than it was and much less informative. Our guide, Romeo, gave us so much information and used the headset to answer questions and tell us all about the bridge- but also gave us some quiet time to simply take in the views (which were incredible!). We also got lots of breaks so it doesn't feel tiring- although our legs were very wobbly when we got back to the ground! We were given one picture as part of the package, and had the option to purchase extra photos. I didn't feel at all pressured to buy them- but the prices were really good and the photos were great, so I did anyway. It definitely felt like we got our money's worth!

Signature of Sydney. amazed to see a marvel of engineering. We took a walk from one corner to other corner of bridge & its really wonderful. Lots of good options to take pics & feed the cool breeze. Wonderful !

another great design. You can walk along the bridge underneath (this is free), alternatively you can "walk" above the bridge by joining the day tour with their guide(this is a paid tour), you must wear their suits and everybody sort of chained to each other as a group, you will be lead to walk up and down. At the end you will be grained a certificate as a proof. No matter which path you choose to, it's a different experience. Both are great.
Sydney harbour bridge. The iconic sydney harbour bridge has a spectacular walk across it where you can view pretty images of the harbour.

A little strenuous, but a once in a lifetime experience.. Touristy of course, but a great experience. What I didn't liks after the tour they nail you good to buy photos they made on the bridge of you and the group. The method in the way they do this made me feel ripped off.

Difficult to get to.. We used the hop on hop off bus to get there and it didn't seem to stop near it at all. Signs to it was poor and took us up alleys and steps. By the time we got there we wondered if it was worth it. We walked over the bridge and it was a lovely view of the Opera house.

Outstanding Experience. Climbing the Sydney Harbour Bridge was the highlight of my visit to Sydney. I'd highly recommend this tour for anyone visiting Sydney. The photos that our tour guide Steve took of me and the entire tour group are priceless.

What a view. For me it was the best part of my trip to Sydney, the views are incredible. Our party in age ranged from 13 to 46 and we all had an amazing time. Our guide was very informative and pleasant and we felt safe and secure at all times. If you visit Sydney take my advice and book the bridge climb. The photos at the end are a great momento, we bought the disk so we could print as many as we liked for the whole family.

Great views. We did a free walk along side of the traffic dodging the joggers and cyclists. Wonderful views of the city made for great photos. I talked with one hardy soul who went to the top but he had no photos to share since they don't allow cameras or other loose items.
Bridge Climb. Marvellous views and great experience. Staff very helpful and caring. Super in summer and plenty of photo packages to remember the unique climb.

Bridge climb at twilight is a must. absoultly one of the most amazing experiences of my life. there is even a disco ball at the top for private parties how cool! our guide was knowledgeable and fun. perfect time to go up on the way up lovely sunny views, at the top stunning sunset and on the way back down a totally different sydney nighttime beautiful... we even saw fireworks over the botanical gardens which was magical. stunning views

A massive bridge. The bridge is impressive with the amount of steel they used. You can go on one of the pylons to see a small exhibition and a great lookout from the top. There is also a trip to the top of the bridge but it's quite expensive.

What a Rush. OK you think a bridge climb is, well, on the bridge level surface, but this climb is ON TOP OF THE BRIDGE ! You walk on the superstructure of the bridge underneath it as you climb upwards to the top of the iron arches....a view of Sydney Harbor that is a forever memory. The company has complete training included with safety harness, suits, etc. Not for anyone with a deathly fear of heights or vertigo but for the rest of us: go for it!!!
Iconic sight of Sydney. Enjoyed a great visit to Sydney. The Harbour Bridge was great. Make sure you have a wide-angle lens on your camera to capture it up close.
Bridge Climb. OK for visitors from O/S but as local I was disappointed. The guide was ovr the to with trivia that might amuse O/S visitors but annoyed me as a local
Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. Great views and good professional guides. Twilight climb is excellent as the view is just incredible.

Iconic Bridge with a view. The walk across the bridge - either from the south to north or vice versa is a fantastic way of seeing Sydney and its Harbour from a brilliant vantage point. You can walk across the bridge at any time - there are some great photo opportunities of the city and the Opera House. To get the best view of them all you have to try the Bridge Walk - which takes you on a guided tour to the top of the bridge. You can book this through many tourist operations in Sydney or simply book it on line. Its very popular - so you have to plan in advance to secure a spot.

The Coat Hanger. Sydney Harbour Bridge is recognized around the world and is known by locals as "The Coat Hanger".There are many ways to see and experience the bridge. You can drive across it in a car or on a train. You can walk across it. If you go to the end of The Rocks you can look up underneath it, which certainly gives you a different perspective of its size and scope.Of you can catch a ferry from Circular Quay to Parramatta which will sail you underneath it.But the most exciting and adventurous for those not frightened of heights is to climb over the bridge. But it is not cheap - starting at $248, depending on whether you chose a Day, Twilight, Night or Dawn climb.

Bridge climb. Excellent. Did the twilight climb. You get to see sydney by day and night and enjoy a spectacular sunset. This company operate like a well oiled machine! Yes, it's expensive but we really enjoyed the climb. In all you spend around 2.5 hrs on the bridge. More than enough. Views and staff, spectacular!

You have to visit this famed bridge, walk across the main level or take the walk to the top. Well had to walk to the top to experience a bucket list view. The cost of this walk is very expensive, but the size of the groups are small. But what a great experience.
Love, love, love the Harbour Bridge!. Love the history of the bridge, love the retro style and the spectacular setting. Very Sydney, very welcoming.

A thrill in Sydney. This was a thrilling thing to do in Sydney. The views were amazing, the guide was fantastic. The company who runs the operation has thought of everything, it is so well orchestrated. Find time to do this!,

Sydney Bridge Walk. A must do for those not afraid of heights. A walk to the top of the bridge span with a guide. Small groups only and you learn the entire history of the bridge and its construction. Great photo opportunities from the top but you have to purchase the pictures taken by the guide as you are not permitted to carry anything with you on the climb. Climb is not strenuous at all.
A winner over and under!. I have walked over and across, ridden across and sailed under and the bridge has looked fantastic from every angle - a truly magnificent sight!

A whistle stop tour. We only had a few short hours to visit the city so the Harbour Bridge was on our priority list, before we arrived we were excited, the reality was somewhat different and we were disappointed, apart from the view, not exciting there were too many street beggars, won't bother to return

Walked, Didn't Climb. I walked from one end to the other on the harbor bridge. It was a beautiful walk with great views. The only problem with the views was the extensive caging around the walks, which are there for safety purposes, so they're necessary. The do have lookout points for people who want to stop. You can only walk on one side of the bridge, so your views will only be of the inner side of the harbor (with the Opera House). The other side is for bikers.

Beautiful Bridge. This Sydney Harbour bridge is beautiful and magnificent in the day, and it turns into a awesome night photography subject in the night. Take it from lunar park with opera house in the background for a postcard shot.

Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. So I would recommend the harbour bridge climb for anyone who loves to take a million photos of the same thing and loves waiting around in queues… ok that was a bit mean… Overall this was a great experience and something to tick off a ‘must do list’. But would I ever do it again? Probably not. I think they may have an express climb (I think) I would recommend this for anyone who wants to do the climb in an hour or 2 (instead of 5) and not stand around for hours. The guide was great, he was loads of fun, he was more interesting to chat to individually rather then listen to his standard commentary, which I think he may have been bored after repeating a 100 times that day.I did the twilight climb, and we didn’t see any sunset but the city still looked stunning at dusk / night. The view was amazing, because there was lightening in the distance it was really beautiful to see over the harbour. Generally it was a fun experience, but the only thing that brought it down for me was all the waiting around! It was unbelievably boring. I’m talking about getting there on time and then waiting 2 hours to actually start the climb. And they take photos at about 4 different points on the bridge, and it seems like they spend 5min on every person - try waiting for everyone in the group (about 15 ppl).Maybe I just have a short attention span? But I did the climb with my sister and she felt the same way. A lot of my friends have done the climb, and they all agree the only negative is the amount of wasted time, and it can bring down the whole experience; because you start getting frustrated, fidgety, bored and annoyed. And the group photo is annoying – does anyone actually spend the $40 for the random group photo?!? I think Kids would love it, families would love it, maybe new couples would as well because there is so much opportunity for hand holding and taking in the view… and then a romantic dinner in the harbour afterwards would really make it a perfect date!

I'm the king of the World. Always wanted to do the Bridge Climb result I did & should be included as a Wonder of the World. OK the walk to bridge is scary as the walk way moves that little bit but once hooked to the bridge & you start the climb in your Boiler suit well Money well spent. The view from the top spans out to the Blue Mountains to the Right and Manly & beyond to the left. Circular Quay plus the Opera House look divine as the ferries pass underneath the Guides with the Information First Class - Makes me want to do it all again

Climb Alternative. While some opt for the expensive, heart-stopping trek across the top of the span, we simply walked across the bridge for free. You can stop and go up in the Pylon Museum (small fee) if you choose, but the view from road level is beautiful

An impressive iron bridge on the Harbour of Sydney. This iron bridge is an engineering masterpiece built in the first part of 20th century. Walking on it is so good and you can see a lot of fantastic views of Sydney (Opera House, the City, the Harbour, etc.).Moreover, if you enjoy it, you can walk on bridge top. If not, you can go up to the central towers of the bridge, where you can see beautiful views!If you travel to Sydney, after the Opera, you have to visit the Harbour!!!

Climb it, walke it, ferry it, driveit or swim it ...it is expectacular.. Except that in Australia they have to overvalue anything that any tourist would love to visit make him pay more than anywhere else in the world ... So we still pay over $4 just to drive over the bay ... So I see it best on my TV on New Year's Eve Day ... this year from Spain. Only the old timers photographers had the opportunity to photograph it properly today is almost impossible to do the same ... some one has that power and wants to keep it that way with an expensive fee and no camera!
Tower walk. This is a cheaper option to bridge walk. Was $11.00 but you get to over half the height of the bridge. Good view. See history of bridge building

must see in Sydney. One of the main atractions in Sydney is rellly worth to see. There are climbing tours to get on the top of brige but it was quite expensive. You can get a nice shot if you take a picture of it from the Rocks area.

Must do night bridge climb. The best thing to do in Sydney is the night time bridge climb. You get to see all of the beautiful Sydney lights and wonderful photos with the opera house and Sydney cbd back drop. Definitely a WOW memory.

The biggest in the world. Sydney Harbour Bridge is the biggest steel arch bridge in the world and is situated in one of the most beautiful city harbours in the world. It was opened in 1932 and remains symbolic of the people of Sydney and their way of life. As a local I strongly recommend that a visit to Sydney must include a walk across the Bridge's public walkway. If you choose to climb the Bridge with Bridge Climb then the lower arch route is my choice and will take you to the summit as you climb through the Bridge rather than on top of it. After experiencing the Bridge, celebrate in the Australian way by having a beer in a Pub in The Rocks or Kirribilli.

You just must do this.... Wow. If you ever get to Sydney - and let's face it, not many do - you just must do the Bridge Walk!! Amazing!!! Really, the most incredible experience..... It was quite humbling to think I had been one of the few to have experienced that view. But that was years ago of course, there's been hunners since!! Still a good one - go for it

Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. I thoroughly recommend the bridge climb... I cannot praise it enough... On a clear day it is the most magnificent view you will see of Sydney, it's breath taking!!! I did a 3pm climb.. The climb is very safe and very well organized... I know it may be pricey for some but it is worth every cent!!!

a surreal walk. Although we didn't do the overhead walk we still had a brilliant experience. It was our first day in Sydney (our 2nd in day in Australia) and along with my wife & sons we parked the car at Luna park and walked across the Bridge to visit the harbour. It was like all the sites we seen on television and was a wonderful start to a wonderful holiday.

Sydney Harbour Bridge. If you do not have the stamina to take the Bridge Walking Tour, the best way to see the majesty of the bridge is to take a Darling Harbour ferry. On arrival you can then explore the delights of Darling Harbour.

Wonderful views. Exhilarating experience and really spectacular views from the top. Very well organised and you do feel very safe throughout. The actual climb in terms of actually climbing is not particularly challenging. Our guide was very friendly and knowledgeable and made our group feel very comfortable together. Although this is not a cheap activity it is well worth it and was a real highlight of our trip to Sydney?

Beautiful bridge with great views. We loved the look of the bridge....and you can walk on it for free. They have a hike up over the top of the bridge that we really wanted to do, but it was way too expensive to do, so we passed on that.

Do not miss. Have a walk over the bridge - the Rocks too Kirribilli or reverse. Stunning at ant tome of day or weather. Try climbing The Pylon. The museum is interesting and well done, but there are depend a fee. Lovely meals svailanle on either end of the waK, am d the gluten at dusk are,,, lovY
Bridge walk. One of those fantastic things you will do in your life.Great experience the walk generally is an easy climb in stages. The view when you reach the top is amazing.the walk is expensive.
A must do if in Sydney on holiday. A great thing to do if on holiday. A once in a life time experience. Expensive but worth it. Anyone can do, it isnt strenuous.

Bridge Climb - a must do. I completed my first climb in November. It's an amazing must do experience. We selected a normal climb which takes around 3-4 hours. The team do an amazing job and the view is sensational. It is expensive but I think it was money well spent. Don't do the photo packages - you can buy photos at the end for the same price & we only wanted 3 or 4 VS the 10 we pre paid for. Enjoy!
Worth visit. Looks wonderful from the ferry, i as advised to climb the bridge time constraint didnt allow me. All should try that, heard its quite expensive but worth.

Sydney Harbour Bridge and BridgeClimb. BridgeClimb-What can I say? An hour to go up and 3 days to come down! Yes, it is a bit exxy and commercial, however, in my opinion well worth it. While you're there take the time to walk over the bridge, around the Rocks, Luna Park and surrounds. That way you will get your money's worth, take as many happy snaps as you like and just enjoy the experience.

Great walk. We walked across the bridge. What an experience. I lived in Sydney as a child and don't ever recall going across it in the car. We had lunch at Luna Park and walked back across in the afternoon. Lovely day.

The Bridge. The bridge is an incredible structure and well worth the walk across it.
The Bridge Climb is simply awesome, The preparation and safety measures is an experience in itself. The top of the bridge provides the most amazing views, It's expensive, but what is good any more that isn't?

Sydney Harbour Bridge Clinb. I would highly recommend the Sydney Harbour Bridge climb. Staff were excellent, friendly and knowledgeable and the company is so well run. Although it took a while (around 3.5 hours from start to finish), it is well worth making the effort. Our guide was extremely knowledgeable about the history of the bridge and also Sydney and safety is clearly a priority.

Iconic harbour bridge. Climbing the Harbour Bridge was an absolutely amazing experience - and an experience every able bodied Aussie has on their bucket list no doubt. The views are spectacular and the climb is safe and fun. Even being in a boat and going underneath the bridge is a great experience, and of course News years Eve it is the focal point for the fireworks. The Harbour bridge represents Sydney.

it's pretty damned impressive. Firstly if you cant afford the bridge climb just walk over it. IT's still a magnificent view but quite a long walk, stairs where hard to find and not as close to the bridge as you imagine. TO me the most amazing thing is to walk under the bridge and have a look. The two big rock pylons at either end do not hold up the structure but these ginormous hinges. The pylon at the Rocks/ City end is open to the public. It is reasonably priced and the view from the top is great as well. The Harbour bridge, like the Opera House is something you can lookat and say "well there it is I have seen it" or take the time to really look at it and be amazed at how clever man is at building things.
sydney harbour bridge climb. great time was had by all of our party,Very informative and the views from the top of the bridge are spectacular....We would not hesitate to recommend this to anyone.....

IF YOU CAN'T GET IN TO DO THE BRIDGE CLIMB THIS IS FREE!. In the Rocks area ask directions to the stairs which take you up onto the footpath which crosses the bridge. Great Views. You exit at Kirribilli where there are several little reasonably priced cafes for lunch or dinner. If you don't want to walk back it is easy to catch a train from Milson's Point Railway Station nearby

Scared of heights. My husband was determined to climb the bridge no matter what. So he booked the climb for himself because I am scared of heights and there was no way he could convince me to go. When he came back he said I had missed a wonderful experience and not hard to do

The best harbour in the world. breathtaking views of the Harbour and the Opera house is next to none. Seating in a cafe or a restaurant around the area or even n the park while viewing the harbour makes me feel relax.
What can I say?. People all over the world want to visit the coathanger! Walk it or get the ferry to the other side and the train back. Whatever you do, you'll just enjoy being there.

Unbeatable. There is nothing to compare with Sydney's Harbour Bridge it's amazing both day and night whether you walk it, climb it,dive over it,or take a train its a sight to rember.The views from the bridge to the harbour and across to the Opera House are a must see
Iconic. The best walk and views from the bridge and with extra money you can climb the bridge but you need to be fit physically for that.

A Beautiful Arch Span Steel and Pylon structure. There are Harbour side parks at each end. there is a safe walkway to walk across this bridge and see many sites , of the Harbour and Sydney Opera house...a commercial arch walk is available for fit and adventure seekers.. providing astounding views.

breathtakingly beautiful harbour. a beautiful place to visit I love the walk on the bridge from Milsons Point to the Rocks
make sure it is not a windy day when walking across the bridge, the views are magical and all for free

Try the Bridge Climb. If you want to experience the Bridge in all its glory try climbing it.
Its not cheap but its worth it. Its VERY safe and not that hard to do. The views and the whole experience are something you'll never forget.

Dont Miss, worth the time and money. The bridge climb is one of the best activities I have had in Sydney and well worth the time and effort. It is a easy climb with no hard activity, idea for young and old alike. 30 years ago friends told me of their escapades illegally climbing the bridge, but now anyone can do it and ejoy the experience safely.....
Just walking across is fun. Stunning views of, and from, the bridge... and you can walk all the way across. I did not do the Bridge Climb, but it looks like awesome-fun!

Sydney Harbour Bridge ...... free. While the Bridge Climb is a good experience, if you don't fancy the price or have a problem with heights a better bet would be the walk over the bridge ... costs you nothing ..... though you might want to spend a few dollars at a cafe (either end). The pylon lookout has a small charge but is very good value, has heaps of interesting information and fantastic views. The other good thing about the walk .... YOU get to pick the time you do it, and how fast or slow you want to go. You can pick your spot to stop and wonder, and admire the view. You won't be hurried along by other groups coming behind you. Just watch out for people running though, and try not to get in their way.

Best bridge of its type in the world. Walk over it, climb over it, drive over it, sit under it - doesn't matter what you want to do this bridge which is now 83 years of age. An amazing structure which when designed was years ahead of itself. The view from the top of the bridge is stunning.Enjoy

Magic views. An absolute must thing to do. Guides provide clothing, safety lecture, safety harness and whatever else you need. The walk up is mostly easy and steady. The height is no problem as you are not near an edge, but still gives fantastic scenic views. Go on a nice clear day, and you will be awed by the sights.

Mobile parking lot. Sydney Harbour Bridge is best seen from a distance, it looks great and if you are a mountain goat OK to climb, but do not try to cross it in a vehicle as it is heavy with traffic, easy to get confused when trying to reach your destination. I think it looks great on post cards would not want to use it every day.

A must for any Sydney visitor. A massive piece of architecture, to be seen to be believed. Really impressive and overwhelming. Can be viewed from various points in the city but a view from the waters is most enchanting.

Worth the climb. If you haven't time or the money for the Bridge Climb the next best thing is the Pylon lookout. The views are amazing and you get info on how they build the bridge. The down side is that there is no lift and you have to use the stairs.

Sydney Harbour Bridge. The Bridge Climb to the top is well worth the time, money and effort...a great experience.
There are daytime, sunset, night time and sunrise climbs.

Great Views. We did the bridge climb one morning & thoroughly enjoyed it. It wasn't anywhere near as scary as I thought it would be. It is pricey, but when you are made aware of the safety measures and preparation that is involved, you understand why it costs what it does. The staff are all very well trained and friendly. The climb itself is only a little taxing, but good mobility in the legs is essential. The views are excellent, you can certainly see a long way. I'd like to go again, but I would prefer to do a dawn walk. Watching the sunrise from on top of the Sydney Harbour Bridge would be amazing.

Night Time Bridge climb with son. This was the second time I have climbed Sydney Harbour Bridge, the first was with my brother, who was visiting from the UK and my two older sons. This time I went with my youngest son who was now old enough to make the climb and we chose a night time climb to see the lights. We arrived in plenty of time after walking from Darling Harbour. I recommend that you eat and drink before going on any climb as the food and drink options on site are limited to snack foods only and the climb takes about 3 hours in total. We were kitted out quickly with all the gear and did the practice climb on equipment inside the building and then started the walk.I think that anyone with a normal level of fitness can do the climb but there is a steep ascent and decent at the start and end of the walk. Once past these the rest of the walk is relatively easy with lots of stops for photos and views of the city. Hint - buy the photo package as part of the tour it is worth it as you cannot take your own cameras with you.Off the two walks (day or night) I think the night tour is much more impressive. Seeing the city and harbour lit up is amazing and we had the added pleasure of seeing fireworks from the Sydney cricket ground, a great bonus. Wear loose and comfortable clothes as you have to don a jumpsuit to carry all of the safety gear and it could get hot if you are wearing heavy or thick clothes under it.I highly recommend this tour for anyone visiting Sydney its a great way to see harbour and sites like the Opera House, Circular Quay and the city in general

Walk over the top. On a fine day the Sydney Harbour Bridge walk is excellent. the views from the top are well worth the effort to get there. well organised and be prepared for an energetic walk but very do-able
The Coat Hanger. You can drive over it, you can walk over it and you can climb it.www.bridgeclimb.com.auAnother must see Aussie attraction.
Dodge the joggers. A great walk across and back, steep steps to access in some places but worth it. Fab views of the Opera House and bays. Sunset is a good time to visit.

Unique experience. An unbelievable view and an alternate sightseeing opportunity to the generic tourism venues. It's not an overly difficult physical experience, I think most people could easily climb the bridge.

RE: Bridge Climb. So this is strange because the "attraction" is the bridge, but a lot of people are reviewing the bridge climb. The bridge itself is awesome - great to take pcitures of and walk across. I did the Bridge Climb as well, and I had mixed feelings. It was a fun experience, and the view is incredible. but they have turned it into big business by taking your picture. You're not allowed to bring ANYTHING on the climb with you - you actually strip totally naked and put on a special suit. not even bobby pins, so definitely no cameras. Then you go to climb the bridge which is easy and fun, and the tour guide had a lot of good stories. But most of the time you spend waiting around while the people in front of you get their picture taken, and then you take their spot and get your picture taken. The pictures were good, but they charge quite a bit for them, I think it was around 65 AUD for 4 digital copies. And after you spend an hour or so waiting around to have them taken, you want them! So.. good time, great view, but not so great of a value I thought.
Must Do The Bridge Climb. The bridge looks great from all views, but you must do the bridge climb to get an aven better perspective. Quite expensive, but worth it.

THIS IS A MUST DO. Go to the bridge, walk out there and enjoy the view ! It's simply fantastic. Then walk to one of the bridge towers and see the exhibition -and take a 270 degree look from the platform. A lot cheaper than doing the bridge climb, and you're allowed to use your own camera !

Bridge climb . Great thing to do, climb is well organised and views amazing but be prepared to get a bit bored... What should be great fun and exciting becomes drawn out when you have to wait around for the fourth lot of photos they want to sell you being taken . Real shame as this kills what is an amazing experience with very knowledgeable and fun climb staff.

Best free activity. One of the best things you can do in Sydney is to walk across the eastern side of the bridge and take in the view of the Opera House and main harbour. No need for a guide, it's all there to enjoy.if you like cycling, the western side of the bridge gives great views looking too.

The climb of your life but well worth it!!. Before coming to Sydney I knew 100% I wanted me and my husband to climb this iconic bridge! After all it is a once in a lifetime opportunity as not everyday you get given this chance. My husband has been in the past a little afraid of heights - although he is getting much better now. He will say that this experience looks far worse then it actually is and once you are up there you are thinking of nothing else but what amazing views you can see. We decided to spend a little extra on the tickets and book a climb for sunset time. We though this would be a lovely time to go seeing sunset and the city by day and then by night on the way down. The day that we had booked our climb ended up being a little bit cloudy so we didn't get to experience the best sunset imaginable but we did still get to see pretty colors in the sky and the city coming alive at night. Within our group was a very elderly lady who the bridge climb team were worried and conscious about her making it up to the top. She did seem to have a few walking difficulties but after the team asked her various health and safety checks allowed her to go up the bridge with her two grandchildren. I cannot fault in the slightest the bridge climb team. They were very professional and conscious of her throughout the whole experience. They were radioing each other every step of the way to make sure she was all ok. They worked together to make sure she could reach the top without difficulties. I am so glad she managed to experience this climb and see the views at the top. I would recommend anyone to do this, even if you are not 100% with heights, do it to concur your fears. It looks much worse then it is and you will be concentrating to much taking each step then you would be realizing how high you up. With each step our guide gave us very informative information with regards to the surrounds, the bridge, the history and was able to answer any question we through at him. All in all a fab experience which I will remember for a very long time :-)

Memory of Sydney 2000. You can see it from circular quay or other place and its beautiful.However, Passing this amazing bridge is highly recomended. Seenary on the middle of bridge is unforgetable.It reminded me of women marathon race of Sydney olympic2000!

Sydney bridge experience. once you go to Australia everyone will always tell you to go to the harbour bridge , well they don't lie. This bridge is an achritectual dream yet a beautiful dream to capture the momentum of being at this landmark. The views from normal height are dreamy with the sea winds lapping against you and the sun beading down on your neck. But if your that more adventurous type you might want to get a tour along the top of the bridge where you feel your on top of the world! . Sydney is a beautiful city waiting for you and I wouldn't recommend anywhere else.
Can't get tired of looking at the Bridge!. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is a historic landmark. It is as beautiful in person as I imagined from pictures and TV. We are going to do the walk next time!

Decent walk, more harbor views. I didn't do the expensive walk, I just literally walked across the bridge. You can find stairs over in The Rocks, and it's about .7 miles across (I never could figure the kilometers). Took about 10 minutes to briskly walk across one way with a few picture stops along the way. Not the most picturesque with tall chain link and barbed wire, but still worthwhile.

Harbour bridge climb a must do. This is a once in a lifetime experience and a must do. It seems a little pricey on the face of it but all up the experience lasts a little over 3.5 hours so it's not bad value. All the stuff are friendly and entertaining. Highly recommend this experience.
Excellent. The most amazing experience one could ever have.. to claim the Sydney Harbour Bridge.. the view is amazing.. you feel on top of the world

Walk over the Sydney Harbour Bridge. This is such an easy walk that anyone can do it. The views are amazing and when you get to the other side there are plenty of eateries to quench both thirst and appetite for the return journey. The photo opportunities are outstanding. We didn't do the bridge climb as it was too windy and we were running out of time.
What a view. Climbing the Harbour Bridge is an absolute must for Sydney siders and tourists alike. It is absolutely exhilarating.

YES AMAZING. Amazing yes Amazing. So wonderful was this experience you have to wonder why we can't climb the bridges in Chicago or New York? If you got the money and good health then by all means find the time to climb this amazing bridge. The wind in your face the views in your eyes. 1400 steps of pure joy. Safe but freaky some ladder climbing but mostly steps good training before hand. Do it you will love it as much as Zip lining Thumbs Up on the Bridge Climb.

Twilight. I did the bridge climb back in August on my birthday. The lady who lead us was brilliant and such a little co idea making it very lighthearted for a couple of nervous people included in our group.It's not the cheapest thing to do in Sydney but I feel was really worth it. The preparation before is great and the walk itself fabulous! I paid extra do the twilight which was beautiful. I think you could b cheeky and get a bit of twilight for cheaper if you do the last day or dirt night walk as by te time you get on the bridge or are finishing up you should get a bit of twilight.Highly recommend. It's a memory to have when in Sydney. Get the photo package and let your guide know as they will take more pictures of you. Enjoy!!

Awesome Experience. This adventure is a must. The entire experience takes about 3 1/2 hours to get instructions, suit up and make the climb. We went at sunset and back down when it was getting dark. The views are fantastic. The harbour is so interesting sine there are islands, coves and bays. The view of the Opera House are so beautiful. Its not particularly strenuous and the guides stop frequently to take in the views and rest.

Reserve before you arrive for the walking bridge tour.. I was very disappointed that I could not reserve while I was in Sydney to walk across the bridge on one of the tours. They were fully booked so make sure you reserve months ahead of time before you arrive and you won't be disappointed.

Always, always walk a bridge!. Might be a philosophy, but always walk a bridge when you get the chance.It's just a bridge is such an understatement. This is the Sydney Harbor Bridge.It's just a view is such an understatement.
