This is a view of Sydney Harbor.Take a walk, see a view and be glad you're not in a car in the traffic on your way to or from work.I hate heights so won't do the girder walk.Only takes 20 minutes or so to cross...stop at Flakey Tart when you reach the Milson's Pt. side.Really good stuff: a walk across a bridge for a way good bakery and coffee.
love this place. the views and the ships and boats and neat wild life flying around.Great food all around the park and all the eatieries

Spectacular views. I climbed the bridge in 2010 while visiting Sydney. It was an exhilarating experience. Absolutely fantastic views and it felt like I was on the top of the world. Well worth the money!

CLIMB IT and be amazed!. This is one of the best things ever! Climbing to the top of the bridge is fairly easy, no heavy straining! They have it all worked out so almost anyone can feel like they are on top of the world. It is a blast and a half and you can even record your own video from the top!
Sydney wouldn't be Sydney without the bridge!. Loved the size and scale but I ain't gonna walk up it. It is a bridge, no more no less. Simon Tarascon

Totally Awesome!!!. A must do....amazing views, never thought Sydney could look more beautiful but from on top of the Harbour Bridge it's amazing!!! Pretty strenuous but well worth it. It's also pretty pricey but it's money well spent. The staff are friendly and cheerful. Totally loved it and would love to do it again!!!

Amazing experience and views. We climbed the bridge yesterday. Our guide JC was brilliant and so were all the other staff. Everything was explained clearly and I (who doesn't particularly like heights) felt very safe. To anyone else that doesn't like heights, it really doesn't seem that high when you are up there and you are on a railed walkway and feel totally secure. The views all the way were amazing and JC's knowledge and info were very interesting. We would highly recommend this experience to others. A truly wonderful way to spend 3 hours.
unbelievable view. what can I say you have see it for yourself. if you choose not to pay for the climb the view is awesome and you can take a selfie with the opera house in the background.

If your in Sydney you've got to go. Just walking the brige is very cool. We did it at night and loved it. You can also jog on it or ride the train to the other side of the harbor if you want. The best though is walking on the top of the bridge - I didn't do it but other we know did and it's very high up but safe. You have a special suit you wear that has a extension that locks you onto a safety rail so you can't fall - it cost about $200 and the cost varies for a night or day trip. Figure a half day to do it.

Bridge walk very safe with lots of security guards. Bridge walk is free and very safe with security guards every few hundred metres 24/7.Also did the bridge climb which was fun but not as challenging as I'd expected. Overpriced.

Iconic. You have to go & have a look at the iconic old coathanger. Snap the classic view of this & the Opera House from Mrs McQuairies Point or from further away on the Hop on & off Bus on the Bondi Beach loop

Would love to have had the nerve to walk over the top... We travelled through/over the bridge...such an amazing structure and great for photos... we were told that to go over the bridge walking was a must for the not so faint hearted, no cameras allowed, I guess to keep the profits higher in house for the official photographers.

It's an Icon!!!!. You don't have to pay to climb to the top. Grab your camera and walk across from South to North or visa versa for fantastic views.... OR jump on a local Ferry from Circular Quay and you'll capture all aspects of the Coathanger.

Iconic Sydney feature.. We crossed over it by train and on foot, passed under it on the ferry and gazed on it from the balcony of our rented apartment. The bridge climb was not on our itinerary due to a fear of heights! Having 2 'coat hanger' bridges in my native North East England (the Tyne bridge and another over the Wear in Sunderland) the style of the bridge in very familiar but the setting of the Sydney Harbour Bridge is truly special. You really feel you have arrived when you see that outline.

Great Walk. Wanted to walk across the bridge two years ago, but could not find any stairs to get to the footpath. Finally, took a taci and told the driver we wanted to go to the Argyle Stairs. He didn't know what we were talking about and dropped us off at the Bridge Climb station. Not the correct spot....but the gave us driections to the stairs to the footpath. I guess we were at the Cumberlland entrance. It was a great adventure, not scary at all. Very pkeasant day and a check off on my bucket list. Excellent views from the top and the bridge even has a viewing point.

Bridge Climb. Well worth the effort of the climb amazing views of the city.enjoyed the whole experience from getting kitted out in the not so flattering boiler suit to watching the helicopters flying around the city. Our guide Jo was very knowledgable.Only down side was very hot when getting kitted out in all the gear harness etc

Bridge Walk is a must do event whilst in Sydney . If you only have one day in Sydney, you must climb the bridge. If timing works well for you, at sunset is best. No better view of all the sites and harbour. Memorable and monumentus. Enjoy!
Fantastic. You can see the bridge from almost everywhere.We climbed it - a fantastic (though quite expensive) experience.

Great views of Sydney Skyline. This is definitely a must visit attraction for any visitor visiting Sydney. Its best to get to the harbour via train and get off at Milson's Point train station. You could climb up the bridge and use the side walk to take some shots of the city skyline. To get hold of a good shot of the bridge, head towards Jeffrey Street Wharf (Kirribilli area). You could also fit the harbour and the Opera House, both in one frame!
Bridge Walk. This was very cool and a definite must. The view from the top of the bridge is spectacular and they even take a personalized video of you to email back home.

Bucket list top 3. The views from the top of Sydney Harbour Bridge are fantastic, but don't be fooled into thinking that the summit is what it is all about because the actual climb from 'clipping on' at the bottom until you stand at the summit, is an unbelievable experience in itself. Try to do the 'climb' either at dawn or sunset to make your experience even more memorable, but just to climb anytime is a must. If it isn't in the top 3 on your bucket, then there is something seriously wrong. I can give it my personal recommendation and on a scale of 1 to 10 ...... I give it 11. ( My visit took place in November 2003)

bucket list. What a fantastic bridge, No cost unless you do the stair walk, Very easy to find info on the companies that take you, I'm scared of heights so that wasn't a option for me, The views from the bridge are amazing Up, down, both sides. Many runners go from one side to the other, there are many stair ways that get you onto the bridge,
Great experience!. Yes this is an expensive adventure (fortunately our trip was a gift for our wedding), but it truly is an amazing view of the city. Very cool experience!
Only in Sydney. The majestic Harbour Bridge well known through out the world. Everyone who flies into Sydney see the bridge and the harbour beauty. Also great experience climbing her!

Terrific. We climbed this terrific bridge during a recent holiday. What an experience, one nobody should miss out on. Safety is taken very seriously and all the staff are very helpful. While climbing the bridge you can look down (if you feel you can) and see cars, trains and boats passing beneath you. Once at the top the views are incredible and even a short shower of rain could not dampen our sense of achievement. Back down on solid ground you can choose which of the photos, taken whilst on the bridge, you want to buy and claim your "climber certificate" (mine hangs proudly on my study wall!!!) Don't miss out on this wonderful attraction.
Beautiful to Look at. But rusty when close up !It is iconic of Sydney and the best view is to catch it from the Eastern Shore to get the Sydney opera house in front of the harbour bridge.

Awesome from every Perspective. We've taken the train across, walked across, walked underneath, walked on top and seen the bridge from a ferry.... It's all truly impressive and there are so many interesting stories about this bridge it never gets boring.

AWESOME EXPERIENCE!. Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb formed part of a 50th birthday celebration weekend in Sydney. I was initially worried about the level of physical fitness required to complete the climb and although I was exhausted, I felt a sense of achievement on completion of the climb. The entire journey was a well tuned, highly thought out, professional and informative experience. From the moment you step through the doors, to the fitting of the required "bridge climb suit" to the safety harness, the practice steps, the safety talk, fitting of headphones and the alcohol breath test (even on my 13 year old). No stone unturned in this entire experience. The staff were amazing (especially Alessandro) I would reccomend this experience to anyone.

Walking over the bridge is free and sensational.. Climbing the bridge is expensive. Walking across is free. Easier to start from north side, footpath starts next to Milsons Point train station. Stunning views, good exercise. Take precautions to avoid sunburn as it's not sheltered. The vibrations from trains can be unnerving but prove how sturdy this remarkable structure is. A small museum (with entry fee) is on top of the southern pylon. Check out the plaques at the southern end of footpath (top of stairs next to roadway) from opening day in 1932. The footpath is 70metres above the water and from up there you can appreciate how the bridge was Sydney's tallest structure for many years. The bridge feels alive with activity, the bridge keeps Sydney moving, the bridge IS Sydney. It's brilliant at night also.
Loved it!. My friends and I have done this many times and it is an amazing experience that we always want to do again.

Awesome. The history of the bridge is great. Whether it's crusing on the ferry under the bridge or doing the bridge climb we love the bridge. Lit up at night she makes a great backdrop from the quay or our hotel room she is beautiful.
Excellent View. We viewed the bridge from many areas and went through it on many ocassions. Amazing structure. The metal structure was awesome.

Impressive, mighty and iconic. We look out on the bridge and I never get tired from looking at this mighty work of engineering. The traffic on, under and above it, the lighting in the evening and its reflection in the water during the night when all is still. Don't get me started on the New Year Eve fireworks :)

More than you expect. Climbing the bridge, particularly at Sunset, is the my second most favorite experience in Australia (the first is scuba diving on the Great Barrier Reef"). You've got to admire the carefulness with which you are "trained" to make the climb and put you at ease before venturing out. It is completely safe, each climber is tethered to a bar with redundant other safety measures. But that's the mechanics. The climb itself is phenomenal and not at all hard unless you have a phobia for heights. We did it with the sun perfectly positioned and birds eye view of the harbor, the city, the Opera House, Botanical Gardens. Coming down we saw the lights from the traffic below and cityscape. If you miss this one, it's your loss...well worth the time and effort.

Once in a lifetime experience. We decided to go for the Bridge Climb, and we had a great time. The only reason I can't enthusiastically give it 5/5 is the cost, but if there is an attraction worth $250 pp then I suppose this would be included.The first hour or so is all about familiarization with the safety equipment and a practice run on some ladders. Once the bridge climb starts, you head out as a group with your leader and are tied off with a belt at all times. The climb leaders did a great job talking to everyone over headsets and keeping any people with fear of heights motivated to keep going. We did the standard experience, and we took lots of breaks which kept everyone from over exerting themselves and allowed time to soak it all in. Periodically through the climb, the leader takes photos and these are available for purchase afterwards, whether you pre bought the photo package or not. We don't typically get photo packages, but these views and the experience were worth it for sure.Climbing the bridge you end up with amazing harbour views as well as Sydney skyline including the Opera House. It was a great day, and a super experience, and I'm very glad we did it.One thing to note is you will have to wear one of their bridge climb overalls, and its best to dress very light underneath or it can get hot. They give lockers, but you wont be allowed to bring ANY personal items or things in your pockets due to risked of dropped objects so plan accordingly.
Fantastic Bridge. Magnificent to drive across and when standing below looking up at this bridge. It truly is a great piece of Sydney

Bucket List Experience. I am 75 years young and did this climb as a challenge by my wife. We had a marvellous time with a great guide (Peter). The Bridgeclimb company is Extremely efficient and organized. They are all about safety - yours and the users of the bridge. You will be issued a jumpsuit. You'll have tethers for eyeglasses, sunglasses and hats. If your shoes are not up to par you'll be loaned a pair of socks and runners. Everything is spotless - they have an impressive in house laundry. They also have rain suits and fleece for poor weather. You will have a belt with a tether cable and a wireless radio/headset. Once all kitted up you will be comfortable and secure - nothing to drop or come loose in the wind. At times the walk is noisy - under the roadway and the railway, and it was breezy up top. We never felt dangerously exposed - there are hand rails and solid walkways at all times. Certainly there are long drops over the edges but it never felt precarious. We put ourselves at the end of our group, which meant we never felt pressured by anyone behind. Our guide kept close tabs on everyone, making sure the pace was good. The ladders (more like steep stairs than actual ladders) were fine - the only iffy part was transferring from a ladder to platforms between then - take your time and it's all good. We had a breezy, overcast not too hot morning and it was very comfortable. It could be a challenge on a very hot day and not so fun in rain or cold. The views are fantastic and it was a really fun thing to do. Worth the cost!
Amazing view. I didn't take the climb because it was to pricy - But the walk was amazing too and I went up in the tower and paid 13$ and got an amazing view where I could bring my camera with me.

Exhilarating attraction. Not one for the faint hearted and I am slightly anxious of heights but this Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb is the most amazing and special memorable experience ever! This was booked as a surprise and the tour was approx 3 hours long (other options are available) our tour guide was named Jon and he really made our group (max 14) feel comfortable and was awesome. Safety is paramount and initially I was gripping the barrier on the ascend, eventually at the peak I was overwhelmed by my achievement. There are a few tricky steps along the route but all manageable. Beware your calf muscles the following day plenty of stretches and massage!

Climb the Icon. WOW. To climb the iconic Sydney Harbour Bridge was great.Sydney Harbour is very picturesque; the Bridge, the Opera House, Luna Park, Botanical Gardens and so on.To see it all from the perspective of the top of the coat-hanger is amazing. And it is truly a spectacular perspective of Sydney's Harbour.Can see for miles, and the Twilight Climb that we did was pretty .... go up in day light, watch the sun begin to set and the lights come up and start to sparkle.Yes it seems expensive, but for me, worth every dollar. Once in a life time activity really.The group moves at a slow place, with amble stops for admiring the views. All very safe.Less strenuous than expected, in fact pretty straightforward. Comfy shoes make for sure feet and expect to feel like a total dork in the required overalls.

Awesome views, unique experience.. Even with my relative fear of heights, this was an incredible experience that I loved. You are always tethered with a carabiner from your harness to an anchored heavy gauge guide wire, so even though some of the heights were a bit dizzying, I always felt safe. At one point your are walking directly and high above the bridge roadway below, which might have been the scariest point. There are always handrails that help with the climbs and the nerves. It's a great adventure with a group, and pictures at the top are one of a kind. The opera house is just a stone's throw away, and the vistas of Sydney are very memorable.

Stunning. We have always wanted to see this famous bridge and was so pleased when we finally saw it. It's the backdrop for this magnificent city and represents so much about not only sydney but Australia. We watched as many people climbed the bridge but didn't have enough time in Sydney to do it ourselves. The best views we seen of the bridge were on the ferry to Manly. We were able to get up close and get some stunning pictures. A must visit if your in Sydney.
must do. if theres one thing you do in sydney its the bridgewhat a great time worth the moneyit take about 3.5 hourswith suiting up heath and safty
Sydney harbour bridge walk. Excellent way to work off your breakfast. Easy 25 minute walk one way. Lots of places to stop and get photos of the Opera House and busy Harbour.
Interesting bridge. Neat bridge with great engineering design. Climb up to the top for awesome view of the harbor and opera house. Definitely worth a visit.

Beautiful bridge!. The Sydney Harbor Bridge is beautiful and has ample opportunities for great photo ops as well as climbing for the adventurous individual! We didn't climb the bridge, but talked to several people who did and they gave it two thumbs up even with some physical challenges they faced (knees). We took dozens of pictures of the bridge both during the day and at night when it is beautifully lit against the night sky. If we go back to Sydney, we just may try to climb the bridge! And just think, Crocodile Dundee got his start as a painter on the bridge! How cool is that?!?!
Huge !!. Walked over the bridge and up one of the pylons for great views of the harbour, could not believe how big it was !

Its the best. There is something about this bridge that makes it awe inspiring. To think it was built in the early part of the 19th century costing many lives. My opinion, one of the best , if not the best bridge in the world!

3 weeks down under and this is the TOPS!!! MUST DO. Wow...this is one of those experiences that are hard to explain. Make sure you use the restroom prior to changing out of street clothes into the provided climbing garb – you’ll be in it for the next 3 hours. After testing your capability by climbing stairs in full harness and??flight suit?? still inside a controlled environment you then leave the confines of the attached warehouse to start the outside walk/climb. You single file 14 or less along a level girder walkway – sometimes seeing the road below through the slats - above the highway for ¼ - 1/3 mile before the real climb begins. Straight up and pretty close to vertical stairs take you to the top of the upper arch. The switchback stairs are not too long to take your breath away. Along the arch we stopped multiple times to gaze around the harbor and city – views are magnificent. I never felt unsafe and our guide was one of the best in knowledge and safety. We learned a lot about Sydney. Communicating through 2 way radios and headsets the pace was easy and always safe. I have pretty bad arthritis knees and I made this with ease. The engineering that went into this activity is next to amazing. There is no way anything or anyone can be dropped off the bridge…it’s that safe and exhilarating….bucket list sort of things.

Climb or Walk the Bridge. I will cover both as I can't quite figure how to separate them. The bridge climb is amazing. First go to their web site: www.bridgeclimb.com and you will find everything you need to know about all the possible climbs (more than one). I did everything from my hotel room the night before I wanted to climb. I have been hearing about this climb for 10 years when my husband went to Sydney on business. He won't climb it but that didn't stop me!  Since I am over 60 I wanted to just try it and when I saw the Bridge Climb Sampler described I decided that was the perfect climb for me. It is 1 1/2 hours and $148 for an adult. This is a very organized and safe climb. (as I'm assuming they all are). Never, ever did I doubt Brad's ability, skills, or enthusiasm for what he was doing. Nor was I ever fearful for my safety. Our group was only 5 plus the guide so we did not have headsets. We just stopped when needed and Brad told us what we were doing next.It is thrilling and fun with spectacular views. Since you cannot carry cameras or phones or anything with you you will just have to remember how wonderful the views are. While I climbed my husband walked the bridge which we both did together on another day. You get the wonderful views from a walk (which is free) if that is your desire. If you climb you get a coupon for 2 to go up in the Pylon - 200 steps but another way to get fantastic pictures. You can also pay to do this. We gave our coupon to a couple walking the bridge since we did not have time to use it. They were from the Netherlands, limited English, but were thrilled to get this coupon. They kept asking how much we wanted for it! After much explanation and charades they understood and we were happy to give it.If you have any inkling at all to do this you must. Don't leave Sydney wishing you did.I'm looking at the questions below and want to add that there are bathroom facilities in the building you are in before and after the climb but of course not during the climb.

Great Experience. There weren't many bridges you can walk across. But if if you got the chance to walk across this iconic structure do not miss it. With high fences and a policemen stationed every few hundred metres it is very safe. Walk from Milsons Point towards the city for a better view.

What a blast. Had to work hard to coach my wife to go. We had a fantastic time. Completely safe.Certainly one of the more interesting adventures we did in Australia. Absolutely loved it.The only downside, we had to hurry because there was thunder and lightning in the distance. I guess they didn't want to sign a big metal structure would lightning

Nothing short of spectacular. Simply amazing. Every penny worth. Did the night time climb and seeing the city from that high was just incredible. Our guide was funny and witty and told the group many interesting facts about the bridge. All staff were friendly. The walk was very cruisey and the guides make you feel very safe and guide you along the way. Partner and I had a lot of fun and even though he is afraid of heights, he loved the climb

Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. Great to have done and ticke off your bucket list BUT overpriced and your experience depends on how good your leader is. Our leader did not inject enough extra pazzaz and fun and we found we spent a lot of time waiting for the groups ahead to move on. OVERPRICED and out of reach for normal people

BridgeClimb - Stunning Experience. Two of us did the BridgeClimb experience during our stay. Although incredibly expensive at nearly AUD250, we would strongly recommend other visitors to splash out, take the plunge & dive in! (Not literally of course). The whole event lasts 3.5 hours for the full climb, with about 2 hours actually on the bridge. The rest is preparation and completion time, with safety as the absolute priority. The professionalism, knowledge and patience of our climb guide (Matthew) was outstanding, and he made a terrific experience even more memorable. The views of the harbour and city are to die for and the sense of achievement of the whole group was clear to see. We also bought the photo package for around AUD60 - expensive again, but the only way to have a memento of your achievement, as you can't take your own camera with you on the climb. Overall, having been doubters beforehand, we would strongly recommend this experience to other travellers.

Awesome views. I had a great climb with Darren who made it really worry-free. It was a long time spent there but it is definitely good for those who are anxious about the feat. Love love the views at the top....I didn't actually really the price as it was paid for in my vacation package in NY. I think it is a bit pricey as is the cost for the photos BUT the experience is definitely something's winderful.
Love the bridge. This trip was a drive only over, what a view.Have previously climbed the bridge. A must if you are able, and a twilight climb, up in day, and back when dark and see the lights.

Walk over the bridge. It takes about 30 minutes to walk over the Sydney harbour bridge. With a fantastic view of the harbour, opera house, the ferries going around the harbour , the traffic going past and the train in the middle lane of the bridge. There was so much to look at you could stay looking for asking as you want please do this especially if your not up to doing the bridge climb .

My first time riding a bicycle across the bridge from milsons point.... The path to walk across the bridge for pedestrians is on the east side and the path for bicycle riders is on the west side. Interesting.... The exit/entrance from the CBD side is from the Sydney observatory
spectalur. Definitely climb and ride your bike across! Be prepared for some exercise though! Mostly experienced bikers, but they were very kind to our 9 year old son who was struggling.

The Climb. We loved the bridge climb! It was well worth it! The views up there were amazing and the climb was invigorating. We climbed the sunset climb and saw the city by day going up, the beautiful sunset, and the city scene at night climbing down. It couldn't have been more perfect. It is a beautful bridge from any angle, from it's top or from it's harbour.
Do the walk. The walk across the Bridge looks scary but it isn't to be missed. It's very safe so do take the opportunity if you get it.
second time. this is the second time I have done the bridge climb and the first for my wife, views are second to none, expensive but must be done
Walk across the bridge. We enjoyed a walk across the bridge. We didn't do the bridge climb or the the pylon lookout, but the walk itself was worth it on its own!
a geat bridge. The bridge is unique in the world. It is not only big but also usuful for Sydny's people. It is high up to sea, maybe some people can not stay on it.

busy but brilliant sight. Super busy with tourists at sydney harbour, as can be expected, but a lovely walk and view can be had of harbour bridge and the opera house. Plenty of good photos opportunities.

Rise to New Heights. The Harbour Bridge Climb is intimidating and exhilarating at the same time. The initial climb stages up the ladders through the different bridge stages were somewhat unnerving, but once on top of the bridge the climb was very open and secure. The views from the top are phenomenal and the tour guides are excellent.

Iconic. We wandered around the base of the Bridge near the Rocks, then wandered through the streets to the steps leading up onto the Bridge itself. Walking out onto the Bridge and then looking over the Harbour and Opera House was worth it. Gave us more appreciation of the actual building of the Bridge. See it for yourself !!!

Part of our 3 week Honeymoon in Australia. Worth every penny we spent on this. Our guide was brilliant very informative didn't feel nervous about the climb as they put you at ease. The views are second to none very special will always remember this :-)

From the Hill Looking Out Not Impressive. Having looked from the Hill on the city side my first impression was the fog on the Tyne the Fog on the Tyne, how wrong one can be. We walked the bridge and it`s magnificent structure what an icon. We also went on the water up under the Sydney harbour bridge from Sydney Harbour to Darling Harbour fantastic we will always remember our visit

Wow such good fun. My wife and I when staying in Sydney as part if our honeymoon decided to do the bridge walk. She had done it before was my first time.Didn't know what to expect however was taken / blown away by such a brilliant experience!!Our guide was perfectThank you guys for a brilliant 3 and a half hour walk on such an iconic landmark.....

Controversial but one of the best harbours in the World. There are many Harbours in the world but I feel Sydney Harbour has to be right up there as one of the best.Take a walk across the bridge for some amazing photo's looking back over the Opera House and Circular Quay.You can walk over it and admire the breath taking views as you scale the bridge.Take a walk under it and be amazed at the size of some of those nuts and bolts holding this bridge together.Once you are done and it is the end of the day grab a cold drink from the Opera Bar and watch the bridge as the sun sets.You would be crazy if you did take at least one photo.Even us locals will take several while on a night out.

Great views. We walked the bridge in the evening to get a great view of the city at night. It is really very safe to walk - there are plenty of people doing it with you! The views are amazing - fun time.

Amazing!. Upon my first couple of days in Sydney I had booked for this bridge climb and what a fabulous experience it was.We were briefed upon the safety aspects of the bridge climb and equipped with a jump suit, harnesses and two way radio. Our guide, a gentlemen originally form the States who had been living in Australia for around 14 years, was excellent. He had brilliant knowledge of the bridge (Obviously part of his job) and was very accomodating to our questions also with a good, humourous personality. I'm not usually scared of heights, however, when you first step out on the beams its a little nervy however I adapted straight away as you are 99% safe. It also makes you think how on earth they made this spectalular bridge in the 1920's (You'll find an in-depth analysis of the history of the bridge which is facinating).I would do this again if a friend wanted company but it is great value for money and is a sort of once in a lifetime thing.

A Free View from Above. Take the time to walk, ride a bike or run across the bridge. Bring your camera to capture the vistas from up above. WE did not do the bridge climb that would have been quite expensive but opted for a nice walk. Walkers are restricted o one side of the bridge and bikes are on the other side so if you go with a gorup keep that in mind!

Just do it!. I walked the bridge with my oldest friend, as part of a big birthday year. Absolutely loved the experience, and you don't need to be afraid of doing it, as it isn't a difficult climb.Incredibly professionally organised, with great attention to safety - and suiting up in the protective clothing and doing the 'practice climb' all adds to the excitement.It's a once in a lifetime experience if you live the other side of the world as I do - so well worth the money for the memories you will have.
great bridge. we decided to see this bridge with a fantastic view of the ocean.great experence ,if you'll come here you have to visit.
Just did the pylon. Couldnt justify the cost of going on the bridge walk and as it was very windy went up the pylon which is well worth going up and the views at the top over the harbour are great

Great Views. The bridge sent tingles down my spine,we walked along the bridge and had great views, we did not do the bridge climb, it was about 248 dollars, in a way I regret that I did not do it. But my husband was not keen and did not want to do it on my own, may be next time.
beautiful from the water. Do yourself a favour and take a ferry from circular quay to Darling Harbour in order to take some spectacular photos of the bridge from the water. Well worth it.
Breathtaking. everything about this was amazing!!!! worth every centthe guides were funny, they were really knowledgeable and its easier (and less scary) than it looks

Breathtaking. We weren't sure whether to do this as we are both terrified of heights but as it was on my bucket list i wasn't going to put it off any more.There are so many days and times to choose from so its great - we rocked up a little early and they happily bumped us up to the group that left next - so happy we did our guide was this crazy young guy who was super funny. The training is great and gives you an idea of what its going to be like - not as easy as you think.You are harnessed up and hooked onto a wire so your perfectly safe, then comes the hardest bit of the whole walk - you walk across this mesh platform and your like 12m up and you can see straight down - a few deep breaths and we made it across. you then climb and walk and weave your way around to the top of the arch and you have the most breath taking view of sydney - you can see for miles.Once over the mesh bit its not scary at all, its quite an easy climb, i had a little trouble cause of my short legs - that was about it. The guides are amazing and know the answer to any questions about the bridge you could think of . . and if they don't they will have the answer for you before you reach the bottom.Make sure you do the full climb not the express one - its so worth it!!!

Sydney Bridge Climb. It was a great climb. Very well organised,very professional,all the safety measures was followed.It is a must who ever visit Sydney. Timing is maintained,keep up the time. Have to book in advance.Any time of the day is ok. Must do.Carry some food and water.

10 STAR absolutely fantastic. We were booked at 6.15pm and started the climb just after 7pm after all the registration and instructions. A very professional company and staff in every area. Our tour guide Emily was fantastic. The climb started in day light and finished after sunset with the entire city lit up. It was brilliant. The best way to see Sydney skyline out in the open air with 360 degree view. The climb is easy and slow paced to take in the view. It never feels rushed or too hard a walk. Just about any able bodied person any age can do this with minimal effort. It is a MUST DO when visiting Sydney. It is worth every cent so pay the extra and do the sunset climb. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
Amazing. The bridge is a must see and to take a picture to share when you return home. You walk up to it and across great exercise.

Worth the walk!. The bridge gives you great views of the harbour and also a different perspective of the bridge itself. It wasn't a leisurely walk, however- the bridge was very busy with traffic and people- but I'm glad I did it!

Great to Climb, even in the rain!. We climbed the bridge to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. Booked in for the twilight climb hoping to get the best of both worlds. The whole experience was well organised from start to finish, with a huge emphasis on safety. Our guide Graham was absolutely fantastic, really friendly, great fun and obviously really enjoyed his job. Unfortunately for us it did rain for pretty much the whole climb, but we were well equipped with our wet weather gear so it didn't hinder us too much. I was a little apprehensive before I started but soon felt safe and happy to just get on with it and enjoy it. We had a nice group of people, and were witness to a marriage proposal at the summit, so that was an added bonus. Grahams cheerfulness, banter and awful jokes made the whole experience even more enjoyable. If you go to Sydney the bridge climb is a must. Fabulous experience and would happily do it all over again! A******

A Fun Walk. We did not walk the very top (costs about $250) but walked for free across the bridge to North Sydney. It's a great walk, beautiful view of the Opera House, and there are a few coffee shops on the north side to take a break before returning (or you can get a bus). It's not real long, give yourself an hour or two, you will not regret it!

A must do!. One of the most iconic structures in the world and to climb it is an experience not to be missed. It isn't cheap but don't let that put you off because it is worth every penny of it.We climbed in torrential rain, topped in beautiful sunshine and all the way back down. The climb leaders are excellent and informative, with pictures taken on the way up.I would do it again but try and get a dusk climb.Not to be missed

Amazing!. What a wonderful experience. Not being that great with heights I was put at complete ease with the professionalism and friendliness of staff. JC was absolutely fantastic. It was something I never imagined doing & am so glad I did. Wouldn't hesitate to do again.

Truly amazing. You just have to do this, yes it's quite expensive but oh wow what a day 3 or so hours about 2 on the climb. Such wonderful views and information on the area as you climb. Breathtaking steps have to be completed but what a worthwhile breathtaking view! Completed the day tour around midday on a perfectly clear day!
Big and beautiful. Brilliant! Absolutely awesome to be so close and realising how big the bridge actually is. So close to all the other great things Sydney has to offer

New Year Treat. What a fantastic way to start the New Year. The evening before we watched the bridge firework display from across the harbour at the Opera house, and then the afternoon on New Years day we did the climb. AWESOME is the only way to describe this. I'm not a lover of outdoor sports by far, but when organising our trip to Australia I felt I should embrace this challenge, and with great anxiety I did. As the time ticked away to our climb time I was extremely nervous, but excited too. There was nothing to be worried about at all, what a muppet! The organisation on this was without doubt faultless. The safety element was second to none. Our afternoon was brilliant, the day was fine so of course that added to it. I knew I could do it but never thought in a million years it's something would do. So very glad I did. Jacinta our guide was wonderful. Having climbed to the top and looking across Sydney harbour/city it didn't even seem an effort and I'm not fitness fanatic either! This climb is for anyone of most abilities, if you can walk you can do this, such a great experience from start to finish.

Great Fun!. A great time! and that from someone who is not that keen on heights... The operation is well run and organized. Participants were broken into small groups, each with a guide. The guides were very informative and ensured safety (which was a given as everyone was attached at all times with a safety line. The view is magnificent, the experience incomparable. A must do in Sydney and well worth the money.

Do the Bridge Climb. The iconic Sydney Harbor Bridge is a blast to climb! It takes about 3 hours and they have an incredible system to get you up and down. They take amazing photos of you at the top also. The views are spectacular, especially during twilight. It's easy enough for older and younger folks to do. If you are afraid of heights, skip it.

Not the Bridge Walk. This is a review of the free tour of the bridge or the $13 pylon tour. Both are worth your time. I highly recommend the Pylon for great views of the city and way less hassle than the bridge walk. Maybe if you have a few days in Sydney, do the bridge walk, but that in itself will take 1/2 day. You'll want to spend some time seeing the art downtown, the opera house, and the botanic garden. All hard to do if you are coming off your $200 bridge tour. Pylon was great. It is important to note how to get there. You need to go to the East Side of the bridge as the West Side is for bikers only. You get on from a bridge access area. Take Cumberland Street toward the harbour. There will be stairs leading up to the bridge platform. It isn't the highest point on the stairs--if you get to the top and see a fence in front of you, walk down to the next platform and walk toward the harbor. You'll see the bridge clearly in about 5 minutes from that point. You can walk to the end of the street and see the underside of the bridge as well. There was a lot of construction when I was there, so not too exciting. As you are walking toward the center of the bridge, you'll come to the pylon. Take the stairs up to pay for your $13 ticket and see Sydney from a great vantage point. Overall, a great day with some great pictures to show for it.

Symbol of Sydney. Great view from anywhere in Circular Quay ( especially from the platform at CQ station) and admirable in any weather. The bridge is perhaps the most worldwide recognised icon of Sydney! Walk down George Street to explore the historic rocks area, explore the bridge pylons and the museum within for a historic perspective. Walk across the bridge to North Sydney and appreciate the amazing harbour and the architecture of the bridge. Beautiful at any time of day or night!

An icon known around the world. The 'Bridge' dominates the skyline in the central part of Sydney Harbour and should be a major feature for any visitor. A walk across the bridge, train ride or bridge climb provide atmosphere and a unique experience. Sailing under the bridge on a ferry gives a feel of the immensity of the structure.

A must see. Without a visit to the bridge you are short changing your trip to Sydney. Its as simple as that. We didnt have the courage to walk accross the top but it looked really good fun and if we were younger we would be first in the queue. Well worth it.
Amazing Architecture. Stunning piece of engineering. Great place to read up on the history of Sydney and amazing views on offer. A definite for any tourist vistiing Sydney for an extended period.
Great views with helpful staff. On my bridge climb Nick my groups guide was both cheerful and integrated superbly well and made me feel welcome and safe. Thoroughly enjoyed

nice bridge, beautiful area. There is more to do on and around this bridge than any other one. And to be here for Australia Day is a very special treat. The 'ballet of sailboats and tugs' was phenomenal!

Walk across the bridge and when you get to the middle, stop and feel the vibrations!. I highly recommend that you walk the sydney harbour bridge. Stop and stand in the middle and feel the vibrations of the traffic and trains that zip from one side of the bridge to the other. Yes, it's amazing to look at, but walking over it makes the whole experience far more intimate. It's a decent walk say 20minutes to 30minutes dependent on how fit you are, and how many little kids you're taking with you. But it's a great thing to do.

Loved it!!!!. We did the bridge walk at 9am. Takes about 3 hrs. Not difficult. Temp at that time was very comfortable w nice breeze up top. Excellent view. Easy pace. Would highly recommend as a must do!
the bridge climb is a must. doing the bridge climb on Jan 1st was so amazing. We could still smell the fireworks. the guides are great and my wife who is terrified of heights had no trouble at all.

Quintessential experience. As a first time visitors to Sydney, my boyfriend and I felt we had to do a few tourist attractions, so we decided to do the bridge climb. As it can cost a lot of money we booked months in advance (especially as we climbed on the 29th Dec, so spaces were limited).The view was fantastic. But what really made it a worth while experience (and getting value for money) was that we had well over an hour on the bridge, when actually the climb could have been done in less than 20 mins. The experience, form start to finish, took 3.5 hours. This included safety briefings, getting kitted up, a simulator, the climb, then returning kit.We went on an exceptionally hot day, but thankfully the kit we were given, including a hat, was suitable to carry on regardless. The highlight was a water fan to spray our faces before we climbed down!This is for all abilities. There are four vertical ladders (if I remember correctly), each being no higher than domestic ladder. Once you have climbed these, the curve of the bridge is all steps, so is not strenuous at all. You are always attached to a cable on the bridge with a harness - no risk you are going anywhere even if you tried.It was our tour guide, however, that made it the most fun. It was the combination of a free comedy show and a history lesson. We all felt comfortable and had a great laugh (in a group of approx 10). I recommend everyone should do it at some point.

Superb at night..... One of the Australian architectural jewels. Beautiful at night if you viewing it from the opposite side close to Opera house. The lights in and around and background adds to its beauty. We loved it and spend really long hours at the harbour enjoying the view.A must see!!

loving walk. If you start your walk from North Sydney, the Harbour Bridge itself is an easy walk with magnificent views. For us, it formed part of a lovely day that included Circular Quay but there are quite a few steps down towards the Quay.
Nice view. It s a good place for waliking. We didn't climb on the top of bridge, but even at "the first floor" from this bridge you have a nice view ofSydney ' s bay, and opra house.
So Much Fun. I rode over it on a Harley Davidson 15 minute tour. You can book it from the rocks markets, definitely worth doing.

Great icon and enjoyable walk. The Sydney Harbour Bridge (affectionately "The Coathanger") is a great Sydney icon, rivalling the Opera House in its fame. There are so many different activities involving the bridge.1. TAKE A GREAT PHOTO OF THE BRIDGE from the walkway between Circular Quay and the Opera House. It is beautiful in the morning light and when lit up at night. You can get an alternative view from the wharf outside Luna Park, or even an underneath view nearby or from Hickson Road on the southern end of the Quay. Get to Luna Park via the ferry to Milson's Point from the Quay, or take the train from Wynyard station to Milson's Point. This will take you over the bridge itself.2. WALK OVER THE BRIDGE. To do this there are many access points:a. at the eastern end of Circular Quay, take the lift to the Cahill Expressway, and walk towards the bridge. Descend a few stair cases and then stroll over the bridge. It's not too strenuous a walk, but there are stairs at both ends to negotiate. At the other end, you can either walk back, catch the ferry from Milson's Point to the Quay, or catch the train or bus at Milson's Point back to the city.b. walk west from the Quay across the little park near the northern end of Pitt Street. Look for The Nurses Steps and then follow the signs to the staircase to the bridge.c. At Milson's Point, go to the station entrance near Broughton St, turn right, and walk up the staircase to the bridge.The views from the bridge are great. See the harbour, the Opera House, the Quay, any cruise liners that are in, Fort Denison etc etc. You can also go into the small museum and lookout at the southern pylon, although the views are no better from the higher vantage point. Note: pedestrians can only walk across the eastern side of the bridge. Bike riders can use the western side of the bridge.3. DO THE BRIDGE CLIMBBridgeClimb offers safe climbing opportunities, both during the day and at night. See their website for details.4. CATCH THE TRAINCatch the train from the city to Milson's Point over the bridge and back.Whichever way you do it, you will love The Coathanger.PROS- walking across is FREE- there are many access points- there are great photo opportunities both OF the bridge and FROM the bridge- there are many activities involving the bridge- Security guards patrol the bridge- it is not a strenuous walkCONS- no wheelchair access to the bridge walkway at either end- it can get a little windy

Majestic and welcoming!. This amazing Aussie icon is truly an amazing sight to see. I have visited the bridge in several occasions and if impresses me every time. Take a stroll along the opera house side of circular quay and view the bridge from a fantastic view point or take s harbour cruise and look at it from underneath...either way it really is an amazing bridge. I've yet to do the climb but am told it is breathtaking both in the climb itself and the views you get from the top.
A lovely sight. A sight to behold and been over it in car and on train,stands out amongst all around it and you can watch people walking over the top of it ! I,ll settle for watching them.

Jewel in the crown of Sydney Harbour. The Sydney Harbour Bridge would have to be one of the most iconic landmarks in Australia. It is an iconic structure which carries cars, trains and pedestrians (and even climbers). It is a photographer's highlight of Sydney, along with its near neighbour, the Sydney Opera House. They complement each other, especially on New Year's Eve with the celebratory fireworks, giving a beautiful night vista to thousands of people occupying various vantage points around the harbour. The bridge is also a magnificent sight coming into Sydney Harbour from a cruise ship perspective.

Expensive to walk on top of the Bridge, but well worth it and anyone can do it!. I thought $308 was expensive for the bridge climb, but after doing it, I can see where the money goes. This highly organised company knows its stuff and right from the staff on reception on arrival to the people who do the induction and suit you up to the person who accompanied us on the walk, they were the most professional bunch of people I've come across in a long time. Everything has been thought of in regards to the equipment and no expense was spared in ensuring our safety and well-being. Set aside 3 hours for the walk as you'll need every minute of it. I did the twilight walk, which I believe is a bit more expensive than doing it in daytime, but the views were worth every extra cent. I shouldn't have been worried about not being fit enough as you go so slowly with very frequent stops, you don't get the chance to get tired. The only thing that will take your breath away is the view!! This is suitable for children right up to oldies, so long as you can walk and climb stairs, you'll have no problem. Highly recommended.

Stunning. I really don't know how to describe my experience of this massive piece of architecture. What I know is that I had never seen such a big bridge (pardon my not American experience of life!). I loved it and I will love it whenever I go back and see it again.

one can not avoid life time experience. most most liked attraction there is nothing disliked sydney has many attractions which are uncomparable/unparallel like opera house,under sea aqatic life,toranga zoo,ferries.visit to hunter valley,wineries,blue mountain range etc

Walk on the Top of Sydney. If you fancy it you can walk along this on the top walkways, meaning that you can see a beautiful view of Sydney Harbour. I didn't do it last time but next time I may fancy the price tag!
An icon. The bridge has a good view from every angle. Felt proud with the Australian flag on top. Really an icon!

Nice walk across the bridge, terrific views of the city. We walked half way across the bridge. We did not walk OVER the bridge. Going over the bridge means you sign up with this company, don a wind suit head to toe, a harness and then grapple onto the guide wires and yes, walk OVER the bridge... the tiny little walkway on the curved portion. Yikes, not for us.We found the stairs leading to the sidewalk that allows one to walk across. The views from the bridge are terrific and, free. It is a lot like walking across the Golden Gate bridge, not as dramatic or high but, the views are great nevertheless.

Stunning views, no photos allowed!. The views are 5/5 but it is expensive and no camera's are allowed!!My friends were suggested the pylon lookout on the south of the bridge for about $13.00, same views and they could take their own pictures. Wish I knew about this option!!http://tipi.me/ten-tourist-activities-under-a-tenner/
CLIMBED THIS!!. Cimbed the bridge on Boxing Day - brilliant experience and woud thoroughly recommend. Professional person to take you around the tour which is about 3 hours from start to finish.

View From a Height. Yes the view as you walk up on the top is great. This is one of the must visit , if in Australia. A landmark. The shimerring water beneath and vessels on the River the view more enchanting

You don't have to climb to get a great bridge experience. When you do the Bridge climb you are so high it's like being at the top of of a huge building with that perspective, but I like the perspective of the Harbour and it's splendour from the actual bridge itself as it is just wonderful to walk through the rocks, up the stairs and across the bridge and cathc the train back. You see everything you want to see and more and it's a great way to explore Sydney

Wow! a fantastic experience. The climb had been recommended to us by some friends and we're really glad we took it. The whole trip is extremely well organised from health checks to safety precautions which help to calm the nerves. Our Climb Leader, Nick made the trip both informative and humourous which definitely added to the whole experience. The climb itself is nice and steady with plenty of stops to soak up the fantastic views of Sydney and the harbour. Once at the top the views are just awesome and well worth it.

Our favourite walk and drive in Sydney. The views are always different, the light changes dependent on the weather, wear comfy shoes or trainers as its further than you think if it's your first time walking over.

Bridge climv. As part of our visit to Australia we visited Sydney and I took part in the bridge climb I'm actually scared of heights and wanted to face my fears the staff put me at ease and supported me all the way anyone thinking of going to Sydney this is one experience I highly recommend

First Sight From the Cruise ship. We were fortunate to enter the harbour on a cruise ship so had a fantastic view of the bridge on our arrival. If you are on land you can see the bridge from Circular Quay by the Opera House.

Take the Walk.... Thoroughly enjoyed walking across the bridge from Circular Quay and finding a delightful cafe on the north side which I'd forgotten the name of. If you don't want to walk back, take the train a couple of hundred metres from the north side of the bridge.

Amazing Once in a Lifetime Experience!. This was an engagement gift for my partner and I and it was the most amazing experience! We had such good weather and even though my fiance is scared of heights, he enjoyed it sooo much and would do it again! Aside this, this experience was professional and safe. The guide (whose name I have forgotten) was excellent! He told jokes and made us all feel comfortable throughout the 3 hours.

Worth doing the Bridge Walk. The Bridge Walk is fairly easy, you could do it in 30 mins but it take 3+ hours, with health and safety etc. The initial step like ladders getting onto the actual bridge are the hardest, the walk over the bridge is easy, a gentle slope and very safe! A great view and something you just have to do.

It was quite ok.. I liked it because it was the first time I walked on the harbour bridge (and it's free) but I don't think I'd do it again. It looks a lot nicer when you see it from far than when you actually walk on it :-). I think if you do it during sunset, it'd be quite nice. In my opinion, you can do it if you are in the area, and have the time.

amazeballs. Was guided with Nick, he had a great sense of humour. I done the full 3 hour. About an hour to go through things and get ready then 2 hours walking to top of bridge and back. Would deffo recommend it to anyone.

Iconic the easy way!. Take the delightful ferry to Manning...and look up to the bridge rather than hike to the top of it... The views of the bridge, the Opera House and the city are truly spectacular ....The ride out to the Harbour Heads is a tonic .... The older ferries are charming....and at the end of the trip you land in a time warp.... Deliciously slow Manning Beach... With a charming small art gallery museum to visit before hopping back on the ferry for lunch back in the city....Great late morning trip!

Must do, excellent views of the harbour and the bridge itself. I did not climb, but walked on the bridge instead. It is free and the views of the harbour and the bridge itself are stunning. Minimum level of fitness required, from its northern end you may walk back or take a train to the city.

Bridge Climb. Not as scary as it sounds. They take people "afraid of heights". You're cabled in and walk on the top of the bridge. Beware... it's rain or shine. Summer is hot, Winter cold (and sometimes wet). They give you full garb. Only your undergarments go with you.

Easier than it looks!. Really enjoyed our harbour bridge climb. Very professional organisation, staff very friendly and Richard, our guide, was knowledgeable and witty. The views were great even though it was cloudy. I recommend the climb but it is a bit expensive..

Must Do If you have time in Sydney!. Me and my husband were on our honeymoon in Sydney and really wanted to experience the walk over the Sydney Harbour Bridge. It wasn't cheap (around $400 AUD) but was definitely worth it. You cannot take your camera with you but they take a few photyos along the way which you can buy at the end. There is usually a group photo free at the end. They also supply suncream, a hat at the start and water fountains along the way. Must do if you can when in Sydney. Highly Recommend!!!

Overwhelming!!. To see a whole city celebrating the new year from this beautiful attraction is simply overwhelming, you don't know what to think!! You can't access it on the new year's eve but you can the day before or on the day that follows, it is so beautiful you will do it again..:)

Excellent. I bought this for my husband for his birthday and he loved every minute of it.As I am afraid of heights I was a little nervous, but there was no need. The only bit that I did not like was having to climb 4 ladders, but there are people there to help you if needed. The guide was very good and did not go too fast and had great knowledge of this attraction as well as the harbour. I would say this is something that should not be missed and worth every penny.
empowering. Quite an empowering thing to do, although not difficult to do at all! Obviously, a money making machine, but the guide was quite funny and informative.

Great View from the Iconic Sydney Harbour Bridge. I enjoyed walking from the Rocks to the bridge. I went into the bridge climb ticket office and it seemed like a lot of hype and a lot of expense. I paid $13 to go up to the observation deck of the pylon, and it was informative and well worth the money. Great views, very safe, no feeling of height exposure. The steps were absolutely no problem for anyone who is mildly in-shape.

Excellent. The process before you get to the climb is very thorough. Metal detector and breathelizer your not even allowed to have any jewelry and you have to wear overalls. Our guide is very entertaining and knowledgeable.everybodoby is wearing a head phone so you can hear all the commentary and stories that he has to share. The views from the top, Amazing!!! It's an experience that I will remember for a long long time and will recommend it to everyone.

Beauty in Steel, Best Harbor Bridge in World. If you are visiting Sydney, then you should not miss this spectacular attraction, it's breathtakingly beauty made in steel. It is perhaps one of the best harbours in the World! You can also climb to the top with Bridge. There are many places to see around the Horbour, like Darling Harbor, Opera House, Botanic garden, The Rocks, etc. Take a ferry and move around the harbour. I live in Sydney and I have visited Harbour bridge several times.
Sydney Harbour bridge. What a stucture and you can do a walk up to the top of the bridge for the brave for a price, or just walk across.

An old Icon.. Saw the the bridge from several ferry trips and travelled below it on a ferry. Also viewed the bridge from the opera house across the harbour, Did not get to see it at night maybe another time.

Holiday highlight. The BridgeClimb was just amazing. Incredibly well organised.Our guide Richard has been there from the start and was just fantastic.We were lucky with the weather and could see forever from the top.Just brilliant, I could do this every day!

Do a bridge climb!. The best way to appreciate the bridge is to do a climb. It's not too hard going, very safe and the views are divine. We did a morning climb on a beautiful clear winters day and I would love to go back to do a sunset one
Wow. Walking across is impressive. It is so high and the views of the harbour great. Its a little noisy due to the traffic driving across

Impressive. The iconic bridge is pretty spectacular especially at night. If you have a head for heights you can do a bridge walk, take into consideration the weather , in the height of summer it will be pretty hard going.

Enigmatic. We did not climb the bridge whilst in Sydney but saw it from below, above, both ends and went across it in a bus!Frankly, we felt that the bridge, whilst impressive, was not that exceptional as a strucrure. It's beauty has much more to to do with where it is, rather than what it is. Sydney would not be the same without it!
Do the Walk. If you walk UNDER the bridge from the Rocks to Observatory Hill, it's soooo nice. And the view from the top of the hill is ridiculously beautiful. See everything.
Beautiful. Iconic is a much over used word, but suits the bridge well. Pay a fortune to climb it or just walk over for free. Try to view from many angles, it's worth it.
Walk it.. Just stroll across the walkway for the best views in the world, thats free and the air is clean too.
worth the money and time. the tour takes about three hours and sunset tour was simply great! sadly no cameras are allowed in top, you can only buy the pic package. But worth the experience!

A good walk. If you have a nice day and want some exercise, walk over the bridge. It doesn't take that long to go over and back. No charge to do it. The views are incredible if you stop to enjoy them. There is also a paid experience where you climb to the top of the bridge but it was expensive and somewhat scary so we just walked. It was a little difficult finding the entrance to the bridge. Be sure to locate it on a map before heading out.

Ya Gotta Do It!!--the climb. Lots of trepidation going in as to the difficulty and the safety of actually going over the top of this structure. The first hour or so was spent on the safety aspects, and when I saw the harnesses and experienced how they worked, I was relieved that there would be no problem with the safety. Then it was out to the bridge. At first we had to navigate a couple of small openings and some ladders, but after that it was a pleasant and comfortable hike to the top. Lots of stops while our guide pointed out all the sights and let everyone catch up. No problems with exertion at all. The safety harnesses all have wires that slide up channels going all the way up and down the bridge, so there's no way one could fall off. Plus, the steps are very wide with comfortable railings. A highlight of this trip was the pictures that are taken at the top with the Opera House in the background that you can then purchase at the conclusion of the trip. We used ours for our annual Christmas card this year with lots of compliments. People asked if it was as fun as it looked, to which we replied "more than that"!.

Awesomeness Views. This tour really must go on anyone's bucket list. Yes, it is expensive, but it is so worth it. You are led by a tour guide and assisted along the way if needed. But the views are incredible. It is a huge rush standing at the top. Do not under any circumstances miss this.

What a climb!. It might sound a bit dangerous but it is an easy climb with all possible safety arrangements.You start with about 45 minutes of dressing up, safety drill and demonstration showing you how to find your way on the bridge. Then the climb itself with ample opportunities for photos(not taken by you but by the guide). Enough time on top for a bit of history or simply enjoying the height.Then it;s climb down and back on firm ground.

Brilliant!. What a fantastic way to take in the splendid harbour views. The Bridge walk is a must when in Sydney. The walk is organised in such a way that people of all levels of fitness can do it. There are a lot of stops on the way up and down to catch your breath and the commentary from your Guide and the views will take your mind off any aches, pains or shortness in breath. This iconic bridge is something all Australians should be proud of and what a wonderful feat of engineering.

The best bridge climb! . Climbing the bridge is one of the best things I have done in Sydney! It is not a difficult walk at all but is so rewarding when you get to the top and see the beautiful panoramic views of this incredible city! You can't miss this experience

Worth the Walk. Walking across the bridge is worth the effort for the beautiful views of Sydney. And if New Year's Eve is on your list, I absolutely recommend finding a place with the bridge in full view. The fireworks are astounding.
A must see. We only went under it by ferry but its an awesome structure to see up close! If you have nerves of steel - maybe climb her!
Great experience. Great experience. Glad I did it. Felt safe all the way. Peter, our guide knows what he is talking about and so funny.

Climb the bridge!!!. The Sydney Bridge Climb was one of the best experiences in my life. I happened to be in the city during Vivid Sydney (also a must see) and was able to book a climb at night so I could see the whole city dancing in lights. It was also the Queen's birthday on that evening so I was able to watch the fireworks while on top of the bridge. Absolutely amazing!!! I know many people are scared of the heights and safety factors, however, there is nothing to be worried about. You are constantly attached to the bridge and they have about an hour safety briefing/training with you before you go out. It is a once in a lifetime experience and I would recommend this for ANYONE. There were people of all ages on my tour.
The Bridge. Been under it many times, ferry, river cat, cruise ships and private craft. Been across it many times NYE fireworks, anniversary walk 1982 and bridge climb twice, gotta love it
must walk. Walk to the beginning of the bridge climb some stairs and you can walk across the icon. takes half an hour and breathtaking views

Do a Walk Across the Bridge. If you don't want to climb the bridge, you can still certainly walk across it. The views from the bridge back to the Opera House Circular Quay are spectacular. The walk does not take long - just be sure to take your camera with you.

Best bridge in the world. We climbed the harbour bridge, it takes about 3 hours from start to end. Sadly it rained the day we went up so the view wasn't as good as we would of hoped for, but the overall experience was wonderful and I would recommend. If any has a fear of heights you won't be scared at all, as you are securely attached to the railing and you don't feel as high up as you really are. I would recommend to anyone visiting Sydney.
Add this to your bucket list. The bridge is amazing, a jeweI in the Harbour. I saw it, I loved it, I climbed it twice and would do it all again!

Must do. The Sydney Harbour Bridge climb was excellent. We have done the day climb , so we decided to try the night climb ( which I think is better ) . The whole experience takes about 3 hours 30 minutes but it doesn't seem that long. You don't have to be super fit to climb as you stop regularly and get lots of information from the guide. ( our guide was Aaron and he was fantastic) . The view was amazing and well worth doing even though it's not cheap.

Sooo glad I did this :). This was a thing on the bucket list - kept putting it off due to my fear of heights!! But so glad i did it. The view along with the informative commentary from the staff made the climb a wonderful experience .Their attention to safety is highly commended & completely will reassure anyone worried about that. All in all Was amazing !!! Only thing , be prepared to have pangs of jelly legs at the end of the climb ;)
Iconic. It's a must do trip for tourists and anyone that never gets sick of looking at the opera house. Slick operation and you'll get memorable photos from it.

Best thing in Sydney. I'll split this review into 3 sections: looking at the bridge, walking across the bridge and doing the BridgeClimb.Firstly, there's no excuse why anybody visiting Sydney shouldn't get close enough to look at the bridge. Standing at the harbour you can see clearly both the bridge and the opera house, the iconic Sydney images. So yeah, I don't think I need to say much about that, at least go and look at it!If you want to walk across the bridge then you can. There is a pedestrian path which has been blocked off from the traffic and trains so there is no chance you being run over. Equally, there is no chance of you falling off and the walls on the path are high! It doesn't take too long to walk over and you get wonderful views of the Opera house as you go. If you have the time then take a stroll over and back for the views.Now, the best experience of all is doing the bridgeclimb. Okay, so on paper it looks pretty expensive. I'm a backpacker, on somewhat of a budget, but I thought I should give it a try. After doing this I can say that it's not something you should do, but something that you have to do. The whole experience takes around 3.5 hours , from going in, getting set up etc to coming down, getting photos and walking out the door. You could walk to the top and back quite quickly but the wonderful thing is that you are given plenty of time to enjoy the experience! It's not one of these tourist attractions that rushes you to the top, tells you to get your photo then get out. Oh no! You have an excellent amount of time here to relax, enjoy the views and just be happy that you decided to come. The climb itself isn't steep. There's one small section where you have to go up vertical ladders (you are not exposed, you will not fall off the bridge!)but for the most part the stairs are gradual and you take so many breaks anyway that it is not tiring. You also have a safety line attached to you, so there is nothing to worry about. There are no big gaps under your feet or any other terrifying features, it's all perfectly safe and secure.You can't take anything up with you in case you drop it, including cameras. You can buy photos that your guides takes of you along the way. Special shout out to my guide Tom who was an absolute legend! Within minutes he knew everybody's names, calling us in throughout the tour!! He was genuine and I really couldn't have asked for a better guide. I had pre-booked a 10 photograph package so he took plenty for me! Again, it wasn't like, okay it's a photo stop, I take one photo then move on, no! If you wanted to do lots of poses, that was fine! He also took some landscape ones without me in them as I really like those, what a guy!I got 10 photos for I think $55/60. You either get these printed, on a CD or for $5 I got them on a USB stick. You can also buy individual ones, I think these cost $15 so it works out well to get 10. There were 4 photo stops so you get the opera house in the background, the city, the harbour etc. You can also take a 10 second video at the top of the bridge (no additional cost). Everyone gets a group photo to takeaway included in the cost. There are 4 times of day you can book this for: dawn, day, twilight and night. I booked night but as it's the summer I got a bit of twilight into night. All I can say it wow, night is amazing! The city sparkles, the opera house is lit up! You also don't have the sun blaring down at you, making you hot and uncomfortable. I picked night as it was the cheapest option but honestly I think it must give the best views.All I can say is it was honestly the best thing I did in Sydney. If I ever come back one day with friends who wanted to do it, I would be happy to spend the money and do it again, it's just that good!To the BridgeClimb team, guys keep doing what you're doing! The experience is amazing and I honestly cannot think of any way for you to improve it.

Northern End and Pylon Lookout. If you are into impressive manmade structures and enjoy city views from high up, the Sydney Harbour Bridge will not disappoint. The cheapest option to get an impression of the scale is to simply walk across, and possibly continue down below the northern end for some impressive city views from the water's edge with the bridge dominating overhead. For views from high up, consider the Pylon Lookout rather than the Bridge Climb. You get 90% of the views for less than 10% of the price! The lookout is located in the south-easternmost of the 4 support pylons, i.e. the one closest to the City (duh).Been there several times over the years.Enjoy.

Overcame my Fear. I came so close to backing out of this even though booked and paid for - so glad I didn't. Yes I sat in the office with fear taking over - I'm not good with heights at all. Went along with the briefing and getting all the safety wear on - even did the trial part where you climb a set of steps in the climb office to familiarise yourself with how to manage the safety rope. Before I knew it I was out there and fastened on. I would like to say from there it was plain sailing but no! The first part walking along a narrow platform with cars below was plain scary. Then it was onto the steps, very steep steps. I was ok on them concentration took over then we were on the bridge climb proper. All I can say is this part is a doddle even if you are scared of heights. The walkway is quite wide and solid metal and you walk up the central portion so no fearsome drops to look directly down on. Yes you are high but the views are amazing. Don't think it is strenuous it is fine. I was still frightened on the walkway back but hey I had done it. Please even if you are scared do it- the guides are amazing and talk to you through the headsets giving information on the bridge and construction. I wore my complementary cap with pride all night - Amazing experience!,
What a structure. Only walked over the bridge itself plenty high enough for me and you could still take in all the views of Sydney and surrounding area

Tick this off your Bucket List!. Whilst in Sydney for the NYE fireworks I did the Bridge Climb. WOW! This is something one must do if you are not afraid of heights and want a spectacular view of one of the World's finest cities. I was particularly impressed with the level of preparation and attention to safety that one has to experience prior to the climb. The well trained and pleasant staff give you great assurance that you are in good hands as you embark on this fantastic experience. The photo moments and storytelling provided by our guide was excellent and our trip was particularly memorable as one of our couples got engaged whilst up there! What a place for this to happen and I'm sure he was relieved that she said YES! When next In Sydney I encourage you to grab the opportunity and tick this one off your bucket list!

Ring in the New Year here!. If you want an outstanding start of the New Year start here. We stayed in a hotel on the North side of the harbor so we could skip 800,000 people on the other side. There are parks, and other areas to have a picnic, and wait out the fireworks show. They have a 9Pm show for the kids, 10:45 to keep you awake and the midnight explosion. I tried to add files so you could see but this can not be done. There are venues that charge, like restaurants and boats on the harbor.

Best experience ever !!!!. My husband and I are scared of heights we climbed with our son and daughter , it was amazing. "Mitch" our guide made it a thoroughly enjoyable experience , we weren't scared at all and the views were incredible and the climb is so well organised. It is a must do when in Sydney!!

A piece of magnificent architecture. You can just stand back and appreciate it all day long I think it's just a masterpiece of engineering. We did a walk over the bridge just on the footpath and it was amazing and high enough for me there :) well worth a look and a walk along in Sydney

Walking on it Before the Fireworks. The Sydney Harbour is fantastic, and to view it from the Bridge is a real treat. We paid for the Pylon Climb and were rewarded with wonderful views all around. The observation deck included inscriptions on the glass retaining wall explaining what you can see from different vantage points.

Harbour bridge. If your in Sydney this bridge is a must its as famous as the Opra house and a part of Sydney .I didn't do the bridge climb as hate heights but a walk across the bridge is great and a great place to view Opra house .Lovely to walk across at night and see the harbour lights

Stunning looking bridge especially the new year fireworks. Picnic under the bridge is awesome but what I really want to do is bridge climb hopefully my niece can visit this year and we can do it together my hubby doesn't wanna do it at all. Fireworks display is amazing every year only watch it in our unit balcony or TV coz kids are still a bit young to go there and stay till midnight but would love to do it one day.
Walk over it once. Long walk great views a must do it from Milsons point to the city on the left hand side of the bridge
Great family fun. Very organized, fun and interesting tour. My 11 year old and I loved the experience. Our guide was awesome. It is a bit expensive, but well worth it! A must-do when in Sydney!
What a View. Cannot believe people paid to walk the whole length of the bride on the TOP. Not for someone fearful of heights.

Bridge walk. My husband and I did the bridge walk, it was an unbelievable eperience one that I will always remember, My husbamd who is scared of heights managed it with great ease, the safety and the information we were given was first class, It's expensive to do but when you think of thesafety side of it all I can understand a little why it is.
Must See. Anyone who is in this iconic city must see the bridge. It's grandness is fantastic! We walked underneath it today and hope to catch a train over the bridge to North Sydney.
Historical Beauty. The historical significance of Sidney Harbour Bridge make it a must see while visiting Sydney. I think the view from the harbor was better than walking the bridge.

Spectacular, safe and beautifully run. This is a do not miss experience. Our family of four (ages 17-60) all LOVED the experience of this climb. The views, the headphone commentary (history of bridge , etc) were spot on. Our guide was witty and knowledgeable. This was one well run organization, showcasing one of Sydney's treasures.
