I did not have the proper shoes for the climb and they lent me clean sock and shoes. This is not for those with a fear of heights, even though it is incredibly safe (you are hooked onto a safety cable the entire time). Also, those with bad knee problems may have issues. But for everyone else--GO!

Conquer your fears and do it!. I was definitely scared about doing this - I'm not exactly scared of heights but I had no idea what to expect and was nervous. But the whole operation is run so smoothly, with the guides being just the right mix of confident and concerned, and I loved every minute of it. Other than the four ladders near the beginning ( and they are not particularly long) the rest of the climb is surprisingly easy going and you stop very often, for photos etc! I am so glad I did it - we did the Sunset climb, and I'd love to do it again, this time at night!

Great view of Sydney. We didn't climb the bridge cause I'm just a little too cheap, but walking across the bridge as a pedestrian gives you a good view of Sydney, the harbor, boats, Opera House and a host of people from all over the world who are wandering around having fun. It's an easy walk if just a little windy in places. But who doesn't want a nice breeze on a hot day? This was fun and safe.

Memorable and Quite Striking. Visiting Sydney is definitely a must. And visiting the city won't be complete without a quick trip to the famous Harbourt Bridge. It's not that big really but it is striking and it's a very memorable attraction in the city. to climb the bridgem you have to cough up 200 AUD, which is really pricey. But you can just admire its gorgeousness from the many vantage points in the city like the botanical gardens, Mrs. Macquarie's chair, and Pirrama park.The best and most memorable time to see it is during the New Year's ever celebration during which the harbour shines brightly with a million lights

Do it!. Not many things you do in life compare to this experience. It may seem like nothing special to climb a bridge, but it was just awesome and such a great fun for our big group. Save up the money and if you are in Sydney, do not hesitate.

Sydney Bridge Climb - expensive but great experience. The guides are well-trained and friendly, the whole process is safety-oriented, and we had plenty of time to go up as well as come back down. They probably cater to the least able and that gives visitors lots of time to see the views from all angles. Their website is very clear, contains all the relevant information, and works well - it's a good indication of the whole experience. The only criticism I'd have is that they don't make clear the cost of the photos from the outset. I'd recommend to go early in the morning in the summer, to beat the heat, or at dusk or at night to see the city's lights.

A fantasic walk.. Fab views across the bridge, lovely walk which took about 29 mins. Lots to see from the bridge. Lovely bakery/ coffee shop on the other side, "The Flaky Tart bakery". Visited Luna Park and saw the fab open air swimming pool as well.

So much fun.. Not nearly as scary and hard as you might imagine. We only had 5 total in our group and our guide and his base personnel were funny, informative and extremely helpful and reassuring. Our guide asked us questions and encouraged us to ask anything about the city, bridge and anything else. Very nice gentleman. This was something everyone should do at least once. The views and feelings were unbelievable.

Amazing views for free!. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is a remarkable structure with some spectacular views of the harbour and Opera House. Luckily, one can see such views without spending unnecessarily, just by avoiding the tourist traps: namely the Bridge Climb and going up the Pylon Tower. When I was in Sydney last year, I walked from Circular Quay through The Rocks area. On the weekend, this area has a lovely market where you can buy all sorts of things. Walking slightly uphill from this area you can get onto the Harbour Bridge pedestrian walkway, which overlooks Circular Quay, the greater harbour area and of course the Opera House. You can even walk all the way to the other side of the bridge.A perfect example of the phrase "the best things in life are free"!
Wow!. The top of the sydney Harbour bridge and a 360deg view. Excellent tour with good value for money. Arguably the best 3 hours you could spend on a tour anywhere!

Must see. An absolute must see place in Sydney.One of the places everyone has to go if you are in Sydney. Around this place are several cafes where you can some snack or just rest to enjoy the view. It is also close to the botanic garden where you have a beautiful view of the harbour bridge.

Eiffel Tower as an acrobatic passage way. If the is a perennial attraction is Sydney that is a way remains pristine and unadulterated this is it. It offers vertiginal sensations, complex view points, technological constructivist prowess and emblematic+iconic quality unsurpassable. Explore everything: the pylons, the understructure, the passage, the links and the history

one of those things you need to do at least once. fab! def recommend paying the LOT more for the dawn climb, this way you see the city lights of syd while its still dark, and then the sunrise, and then the city by day.

What a view. My advice would be to take any kind of transport over the bridge from the Opera house side, wander around there and see some nice houses then walk back to get a drink as the bars on the south side are few and miserable. Try the Hotel Grenville.

Wonderful NYE Fireworks. We just saw the most amazing firework display from the Botanic gardens. If you're in Sydney one New Year you must get yourself a spot on the water front to see this spectacular display.
Bridge Walk. Brilliant! Very professional and even though I struggle with heights this was no problem. Thoroughly recommend this attraction to anyone visiting Sydney.

Excellent walk across the harbour. We walked across the bridge from the Rocks to North Sydney. There are some great views to be had along the way as you would expect. It took about 30 minutes for the bridge itself, and there are attractions either side dependent on your starting point.Note that this was not the bridge climb which is a separate paid attraction.Take a bottle of water, a camera, and enjoy the stroll!
Deserves the hype. It is just beautiful, we did the climb as well and loved that - I'd totally recommend it if you can afford the exorbitant price tag.
Work Of Art!. If nothing else, even if you're in Sydney for half a day... You need to get your behind down to Ciruclar Quay and The Rocks to see the bridge. MUST!
Sydney Opera House. Its a must do tour. Get your souvenir photo of family in the tour guide book.No dislikes on this tour !

Walk across the bridge for free. We took the train and went down on Milson's Point Station…but before going across the bridge we decided to take a short detour and visited the Bradfield Park which is right below the foot of the bridge. It afforded a great front view of the Sydney Harbour. We walked a few feet to the gate of the Luna Park and there was a fabulous spot where both the Sydney Opera and the Harbour Bridge. After that short detour we went up the stairs and walked across the bridge for more spectacular view of the Opera House. Sadly, the Pylon Lookout was closed (we did the walk during Christmas day) so we weren't able to go inside..there is a fee of AUD$13 which I am thinking would be worth it. Over-all this is a must do when you are in Sydney

Great views. The best views of the Sydney Harbour (and the Opera House, of course) are from that fantastic bridge. Going from one side to the other, without stoping to see anything, takes 10 minutes, but you will be unable to stop and watch the amazing views.
Great Climb Up. We just love climbing all the way up and see the fantastic view of Sydney.. Its awesome and a good exercise.. You don't feel that 3.5 hours have gone past.. Very informative too..

Massive Steel. My daughter and I planned on crossing this bridge and take some pictures during sunset. Did that happen? No, because by the end of the day, we were tired from walking. We saw this bridge from a distace, went under it on a ferry, and viewed it from so many different angles.
Night Walk - Loved It!. Did the night walk over the bridge on Jan 1. Loved it. Well organized, not too challenging. Best time is sunrise and sunset I think. Night was great, but wanted to see more.

World class icon. It's big, it's ugly, it's breath taking, it's welcoming.
Nothing says welcome to Sydney as does the bridge.
Utterly brilliant. Just beautiful and so iconic, looking at her is wonderful but if you have the chance to take the bridge walk then do it, just breathtaking and wonderful.

Walk across the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Walking from one side of the Harbour Bridge to the other is such a great way to see all of Sydney Harbour. It is not a hard or long walk and you can walk fast or slow. The option to walk up the 200 stairs to the viewing platform is great, if you want a higher view but it is not essential

Great view!. We went on our first walk across the Harbour Bridge on New Year's Day and enjoyed it very much. Young and old all get a buzz of walking across this iconic bridge. We didn't have time to go into the paid section (Pylon area) but will next time we are there.Don't miss the opportunity if visiting Sydney. By the way, it's free! Not to be confused with the Bridge Climb which is quite pricey.
WOW just WOW. There is no way i can explain the feeling i got when i saw the Sydney Harbour Bridge it was an awsome sight magestic in all its grandeur a must see also

Bridge Climb. Did the twilight climb, went up in daylight came down 'in the dark' we had headlights but the city nightlights were enough. Super organised venture - all the guides are excellent - thanks "B"
The big walk. One of the most exhilarating experiences you can imagine , a walk over the bridge ....fantastic and very very safe ...try it ...the firework display was shamazing ...
Take a stroll. Take the time to walk the bridge when you are next in Sydney. It is a leisurely stroll and a great opportunity to take in Sydney landmarks.

A great place to see the panorama of the harbor. You can do the bridge "climb" if you like...but even to walk to the midpoint of the bridge lets you take in a lot of scenery. The bridge is quite popular for pedestrians and if you visit Sydney, you want to walk at least a few steps on this bridge.

MUST DO. Very well organised. Very safe. If you have a fear of heights or fear of falling don't worry - GO! Fantastic views of Sydney. We had a great guide. Good safety briefing. The party of 12 (2 missing) went at our own pace - the pace of the slowest. Photos taken by the guide at several points in the group and in couples/parties. Informative and funny commentary by the guide. Free hat !!!!!!Expensive but must be done once.
Wow and more. This is truly a world icon, the harbour is just amazing and the city is a pleasure to reside in. We will be back to Sydney time and time again, thank you for the an amazing trip.

Huge architecture structure. Tourist marketing campaign that helped to attract a lot of people to this place is the only most impressive thing about it. In general beautiful view is obstructed with grills and metallic structures. Heavy city traffic and poor road quality when using the car.
Great photos . We took many great photos here. It's pretty crowded but worth it. The views are breath taking. This is an iconic piece of Sydney and worth visiting.

One of the man-made wonders of the world. A walk over the harbour bridge gives a tourist the opportunity to see the most picturesque harbour in the world. Once you have traversed the stairs, it is an easy stroll across the harbour to North Sydney, where you can enjoy a meal or coffee before an easy return.
Great climb. It was an amazing climb... totally worth it..I highly recommend the climb.. we were there to watch fireworks for the new years the previous day and the bridge was the highlight

A great birdge that has a spectacular view of the Opera House. This is a very interesting bridge spanning the river around Sydney. They have a bridge climb (which I did not do) that one of our group did. It is a spectacular bridge with a great vie of the Opera House. Great when you do a river cruise.
Sydney Harbour Bridge.. An engineering marvel right on the middle of the ocean...you have to see it to believe it,....An icon for Sydney Harbour ... stand out as an archtiectural beauty
Good views. Had fabulous views. Pleasant walk over bridge with small selection of restaurants at other side. Bridge climb looked good but too high for us.

Nice Atmosphere with Great View. Love the views!! Enjoy the street musicians and artists. Nice walk day and night. Many points for taking photographs.
Try to catch a ferry to Manly Beach. You can catch a clear view of the opera house and the bridge.
Impressive building. I studied the history of this building for my business course so was great to see it first hand and appreciate its majestic stature.

I loved it. When I arrived to Sydney I wanted to visit the Opera House as the main attraction, but when I saw the Bridge I was impress. It's a huge bridge and pretty awesome!!... I was in Sydney for the new years eve and the bridge was the main attraction with the fireworks...
Great program. The Bridge climb is amazing - I highly recommend it. If you have weak knees or ankles, don't go -- it's not strenuous but there are lots of steps so be careful!
A Great Walk. We walked from one end to the other end. Great view from the bridge. Took some great pictures of the Sydney Opera House, the Rock area and the Sydney Harbour.

Sydney Harbour Bridge - what else is there to say?. We decided against the walk over the top to North Sydney - at over 200 dollars I didn't need the adrenalin rush!
However the walk over to the bridge museum in the tower, the history of the bridges construction and a super place to take some stunning photos of Sydney were well worth it.

Great climb and great customer service. This is a great climb experience. It was not at all strenuous and provided a great views of the city. Also, I wanted to mention of the the good customer service from bridge climd. My flight into sydney was cancelled and I could not take the climb I pre booked. The folks at bridge climb refunded my money and allowed me to book the climb for a later date.

Magnificent. The bridge is an icon of Sydney Harbour and something to experience at many levels. I went on the Bridge climb and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. It's very safe and easy to accomplish, You have a safety belt, headphones to hear your guide's story on the history of the bridge and convict settlement. You are given training before going up and are on the bridge for 2 hours. Climbs are offered from dawn to dusk and a new group leaves every 10 minutes. If you do the climb you can't take your camera with you, but the guide takes photos of everyone at different stages of the climb.You receive free entry to the Pylon Lookout where you can take your own photos. You can also walk across the bridge on the walkway and comeback by train. I also caught a ferry at Circular Quay to Darling Harbour. This trip goes under the bridge and you can get some great photos of the entire bridge from the ferry.

Knee-wobblingly good!. We did the Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb - 3 hours of a great walking experience with outstanding views! It's a gentle climb and the only knee-trembling bit is the ladders up and off the bridge between the railway lines! Makes for a great experience and felt slightly 'Mission Impossible' - well maybe in my imagination it did! Highly recommend this activity - what a view and how special to do it a few days before the whole place was covered in spectacular fireworks.

Jaw Dropping Views – Expensive but a must!. This is a must in Sydney! The only drawback is we booked the sunset climb and by the time we got outside the sun already set. As this was for our honeymoon I wanted to surprise my wife with the sunset tour and this did not seem to happen. Our guide was great and we were glad we had done the climb. To walk on the bridge and see Sydney from above at night is truly amazing. We could not have been happier to spend the time on the bridge. If you do the climb make sure you do not drink as they breathalyze you, which is understandable! Also the pictures are expensive and these are the only photos you can get as you are not allowed cameras. Overall, this is a must when you are in Sydney!

Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. The Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb is a fun and informative experience high above the Sydney Harbour. Wonderful views of Sydney along with informative commentary from your guide on the bridge.

Wonderful Sydney icon. I'm sure it's all been said before, by the harbour bridge is so iconic of Sydney.It's great just to view, either from the harbour-side or even from on the water as part of a harbour cruise.But the best is the bridge climb - it takes quite a few hours to do but is wonderfully fulfilling and cured me of my vertigo, although I nearly did bottle out and not do the climb. But I did and am so glad. The views are amazing - I can't recommend it enough.

Pedestrian walk. Viewing this bridge never gets old. We walked across the bridge from The Rocks to Milsons Point with our 2 young children. A bit of a trek with the kids but they enjoyed it. Excellent city, opera house & harbour views.

Sydney Harbour Bridge NYE. Sydney Harbour Bridge on NYE is a must for everyone at some stage in their life. It was everything and more than what I expected. The fireworks went off in four different places at once - spectacular. If you don't want to get caught up with the crowds we stayed in North Sydney at Rydges and walked down Walker St to Lavender Park at 8pm for the 9pm fireworks and then again at 11pm for the midnight fireworks. No problems getting a clear view of the bridge. Not interested in sitting out in the sun and humidity all day when the walk takes maximum of 15 mins.

Must see for any visitor - automatically see the Opera House. Take the local commuter ferries rather than official tours if you are on a budget! We started at Darling Harbour and took day pass to Manley. You automatically stop at Circular Quai. All good!Nothing to dislike

Do the easy walk. Enjoyed walking across the bridge on a recent visit to Sydney. No we didn't do the iconic arch walk, simply the pedestrian walk at road level. Took close to an hour but very enjoyable.

Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb...Simply Amazing. This is one of the best experiences I have ever had. The bridge climb is professional, safe and exciting. The views are simply amazing. The trip was not as strenuous as I feared. I went with my 17 year old daughter and we both loved it. Arrived in Sydney from Dallas as 6 am and by 1pm we were preparing for our climb. The guides make it funny and entertaining. the views are amazing and we will treasure the "money shot" pictures forever. A must do for Sydney (but a bit pricey). Do it anyway.

The Sydney Harbour Bidge Climb - absolutely amazing experience. Travelled to Australia and toured various States. We booked the Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb experience on internet back home and had been excited since booking. The Bridge Climb experience package was well worth the money paid. The staff undertaking the pre-climb training and guiding the climb were professional, safety conscious, knowledgeable and informative. The climb took about 3 hours and was suitable for people of a reasonable fitness level. We commenced our climb at 7pm (December) during daylight as we commenced the climb and progressing to dusk and then darkness as we reached the climb summit. this provided us with fantastic photographs in particular the photograph at the climb summit with Sydney City lights and the Sydney opera house lit in the background. We would certainly recommend this experience to anyone who is visiting Sydney. What a buzz.....

Harbour Bridge Climb. Climbing the Harbour Bridge probably isn't top of the 'To Do' list for people who avoid heights, but to my surprise, I didn't really feel nervous during the climb. I did spend time looking at the web site and familiarising myself with what to expect and reading lots of reviews, especially ones from people in my (pushing 70) age group. Other people have written everything that can be said about how good the climb, the guides and the view are, so I will just add a couple of minor points. If the day is warm, do leave your top as well as your shorts/slacks in your locker. If you have prescription glasses and sunglasses, it's probably easiest to only take one pair because you have a few things attached to your suit and they can get into a bit of a tangle - your glasses, cap, ear phones and headband style torch if you are going to be on the bridge after sunset. I didn't find the climb difficult and would describe myself as moderately fit -mostly you climb at a moderate pace with frequent stops. There are some drinking fountains along the climb. Also, to be very basic, you away from the toilet for at least 3 hours, so some might find it best not to drink too much before starting out! It is a really enjoyable experience, so just relax and enjoy it!

Impressive sight.. One of the iconic images of Sydney, the bridge really does sit impressively dominating views of the harbour. Great for photos; I image amazing views should you chose to climb or walk the bridge.

Good views. There are lots of ways to enjoy the bridge. One is that won’t cost you anything and what I preferred. Simply walking across the bridge and taking in the site along the way. The other option is to actually pay a bit and you get to climb over the bridge. This is for those adrenaline junkies who would love a bit of sweating and physical activity as part of their sightseeing regime. Not for both these options there is a third one which involves a ferry ride and travelling underneath the bridge.

Worst New Year's Eve ever!!!. Paid a bomb to travel to Australia with my husband n 2 year old baby in Dec 2014. Planned to be in Sydney on New Year's eve to watch the 'oh so famous fireworks'. So disappointing. I never could. Reached early in the day around 1 pm n the place was quite crowded already. We tried to find a place for about 4 hours but the security staff(all middle eastern, paki or indian) would move us from wherever we sat. Racism was rampant in the staff. Nothing was being said to the ppl who had taken up lots of space. In such an event where ppl turn up from all over the world to watch such a hyped(yes, just a hype) event, paying large sums of money, the security shouldn't harass anyone. But it seems that these ppl wanted to please their white bosses that they are good workers by being violent and hostile to Asians. We are very well travelled ppl and very cooperative(more than required). Still, this treatment has put us off and we never ever plan to come back to Australia. I am so disappointed that being here in this city at this time(11:40pm) I am writing this review sitting in my room. I feel for those who still undergoing the ordeal there at the Harbour. This is also due to mismanagement as their was no clear marking for sitting areas, evacuation areas or passageways and the security staff was doing what they pleased. In this situation, visitors often come back before the fireworks as I saw many of them doing. And security seems to be pleased as against trying to make them comfortable and enjoy their city's celebrations. I hope they stop venting their frustrations on poor tourists and treat everyone equally. Racist ppl!! Just ruined my holiday and Anniversary as well.

Fun even though we didn't walk on top of the bridge. Attractions in Australia are expensive, so we opted to just walk across the bridge instead of paying over $100 per person to be able to walk on top of the bridge. The views are spectacular and you can take lots of pictures. One of the few things you can do in Sydney without spending any money....
Don't jump.... Instead, ride under the bridge on a ferry at night during the Verve Festival of Lights in June. An unbelievable sight from a completely different vantage point.

Nice walk and beautiful view. Walk or jog the bridge at sunrise or sunset for great views and climb the south east pylon (10:00-17:00) for views almost as high as the bridge climb for a fraction of the price ($13 AUD).
An icon of this amazing city. We are all familiar with this bridge via television and movies but it is far more impressive seen from the harbour on a ferry
Majestic . The Sydney Harbour bridge is great! The views of it and the views from it. Take some time to have a free walk over it and enjoy breathtaking scenery.
Worth doing. Bridge climb is a great experience but probably overpriced. Anyway, the view is stunning and the experience is unique.
Amazing place to visit!. Must do the walk over the bridge. Either the free walk or walk on top of bridge. I would suggest walking over top to be done at sunset as its the most amazing views
Beautiful. The Sydney Harbor Bridge is spectacular. Walking, driving or even taking the train across this iconic landmark is a must when in Sydney.

Yippee!. This is such a well organised activity, I'd urge everyone to make it a 'must'. At 65, I found it exhilarating and not really arduous. Our leader went at a good pace and had so much information that the physical climbing became secondary to the breathtaking view and the incredible history of the bridge. I'd do it again.

Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. I did the Sydney Harbour bridge climb on my birthday in Oct 2013, the experience was captivating. The view from the top of the bridge was amazing and breath taking. You gotta do it, and make sure you do it on a beautiful sunny day :)
Brilliant. Great walk across the bridge and back with ample room for pedestrians and cyclists. The road and train lines seem to work smoothly into and out of the city

Wonderful Views. We walked across the bridge, though there are options to climb about 200 stairs or scale the bridge itself. The view of the harbor and the city skyline is the best you can get for free.
Great views, good walk. Enjoyed walking the bridge and taking in the great views of the Harbour, Opera House and Botanics. It's a truly iconic bridge and it was really great to view it.

Get close to it. I saw it along with the Opera house, as soon as we got to Sydney. I saw it and passed under it travelling on the water taxi from Sydney harbour to Darling Bay. But the best way to enjoy it, is to get to a place near it on the other side, all i can tell is i was close to Jeffery street. A locality with beautiful old houses, prime location according to those that live in the city. You could walk under it, where the stone pillars support it, see and hear the commuting trains go by. Watch the locals playing pingpong, relax on garden chairs and watch the passenger ships going past the bay, all in very uncrowded very relaxed surroundings. Caution to all those new , make sure you wear clothes that protect you from strong winds. It really gets nippy. I always like to follow the local culture and see what the locals do, and this is one of it, rather than being like a tourist and walk on the bridge between a bustling expressway, a shuddering rattling commuting train and no time to just draw the entire beauty of it all in. What can i say, to each its own way, but I'm the kind of person who like to take time, and enjoy everything and from a different perspective than the usual tourist. And i did.so for those who would like to, please do enjoy this monumental feat by going where i did.

Amazing jog across the bridge. My wife & I found the price of the Sydney Harbour Bridge walk to be a bit too expensive, so we opted to go for an early morning jog across the bridge. What a great view! One of the best jogs ever!
beautiful bridge. This is an iconic bridge. This is a must do. It never loses its appeal and you can take good photos while here.

Jump if you have the courage and the time. A trip to Sydney is not complete without a trip to the Bridge. we were scheduled to walk the bridge, but because of the rain, we thought we might opt out, even though we did so at the last minute, it was fine with the guides. Next time!

What a view. Amazing view looking towards the bridge - amazing view looking down. Unfortunately growing vertigo made me pass on the bridge high walk but you can still walk across the bridge for free from one side to the other without hanging from the high beams :-) Still an amazing trip with the big bonus that you can take your camera for amazing photos of the ferries dodging in and out of the harbour with the Sydney Opera House as a back drop (cannot take cameras on the high rise bridge walk )

Walk across the bridge - a MUST do. Walking across the iconic sydney bridge is always different and interesting. Start either side - rocks or Milson point - both interesting with pubs and restsurants.
Easy walk. Best view of harbour , boats bobbing and the stunning opera house.,
a Sydney icon. The Sydney harbor bridge is an icon; integral to the life of the city. It is a sight one never tires of.
Pylon Lookout!. Be sure to climb the pylon lookout! It's much cheaper than actually climbing the bridge and the view is almost as good!

Never loses its appeal. See it so often but it is always special - have seen many bridges around the world but there is always something different about this bridge - it is both a link between the city and northern suburbs and a thing of beauty - will always define Sydney. Probably better seeing it from a ferry or a harbour suburb like Milsons Point - difficult to appreciate while driving across.

Iconic Building. Such a beautiful iconic building one of the most recognizable land marks in the world. You can climb it (very expensive) but we just walked along it for free! Not as high up but still a nice thing to do, but regardless the best way to view it is from a distance (ideally from the Opera House)

Walk it!. You can walk over the top of it with a company or across it on the pedestrian walkway. Its a nice walk has some stairs to get to the main bridge deck but the view is spectacular. Walk from the Rocks in Sydney to Milsons Point and back. From the bridge you can see the Opera House. Its a nice walk

Walk the Bridge. Wonderful views and history as you walk. It's puts Sydney in perspective. Big and bold like New York in places. Also small and quaint in the suburbs you can see, we never saw two houses or buildings the same even on foot. It took us about an hour to walk slowly and I was surprised how few people were walking it. Puts a whole new meaning to trains, planes and automobiles , need to include ferries, sailboats, yatch s and helicopters not forgetting shanks pony.

Great Views. Sydney Harbour bridge offers several different types of tours from a free walk across the bridge to a $13 tower tour with great views to a couple hundred dollars to do one of 2 different top of bridge climbing tours.As long as you don't mind walking and some stairs I think most would enjoy doing one of these.Great views of Sydney

Bridge climb Sydney. My 12 year old daughter and I enjoyed the Sydney bridge climb. I loved the safety precautions and fun gear we got to wear. I felt safe and had fun the whole time. Maybe too much stopping and starting for me, waiting while the guide took pictures of all groups, but since we couldn't bring our own cameras, it was necessary.

Great City Views - plan on an evening walk. Without shelling out big bucks, you can enjoy a walk across the span of the Sydney Harbour Bridge. The walkway is protected and patrolled at night and you will not be alone. I went out after dark to get a view of the Sydney Opera House and harbor (see the pictures with this review.) It is easy, it's free and it will provide you with an eye-popping view of the city.

Great visual, but bridge walk is too expensive. The bridge is iconic but they want between $250 and $400 to do the bridge walk. Seriously? A friend said she walked across the pedestrian way for free and saw enough to be impressed.

Coat hanger. Bridge is ok but the view and the place here it is , is awesome sight . It has a bit of old charm to it . The walk below it is pretty much relaxed with cool breeze : the area is pretty much tourist attraction with opera and rocks as well near by .

Amazing view of the harbor. The bridge climb is an amazing experience and the view from the top is absolutely stunning
Cons: The climb is definitely overpriced and you are not allowed to carry any camera/phones. The price includes a free picture which turned out to be the group picture only (you cannot get your solo or family picture instead)

Bridge climb, excellent adventure. The bridge climb to the summit of the Sydney Harbour Bridge is not only a unique adventure, with marvelous views of the Opera House, harbour and city, but achievable for most people of good health. The tour takes about 3 1/2 hours and involves climbing ladders, stairs, and catwalks above the harbour. The climb is well organized, safe and slow paced, photos are taken along the way and available for sale after the climb. But, all this comes at a price! Depending on the season and demand, tickets start at $148 AU per person, so it is easy to pay about $500 AU for a two person climb.

Great views. Great views from the pedestrian walk way or from the paid bridge climb itself. Views across the Harbour and out to the east and western suburbs. A must visit and see if you come to Sydney.
Bridge climb. A great way to get a good view of Sydney, was in a very small group for the climb which allowed extra time to take in the view

New years at Sydney Harbour. Amazing, one of best nights i have had. Fireworks were Amazing out of this world, on new year...we got the VIP tickets for Luna park and were right by the bridge. Atmosphere was awesome, music loud and great spirits and it looked fab as did the opera house. would recommend new year here.

Try the Pylon Lookout. The bridge is an attraction not to be missed but we were rather put off the climb by the price and the fact that you could not use your own camera but have to rely on the organisers prints. We can recommend the alternative the Pylon Lookout - good views across to the Opera House and the harbour at a fraction of the cost of the climb. Added to that a concession for over 65 made my day!!!
daunting. Beautiful had intention of walking across but $250AUD so not this time plus no phones or cameras allowed so you have to pay for photos they take adding to expense.....

The Climb of your Life. Climbing over the top of Sydney Harbour Bridge was "must do" contingent of our trip to Sydney. I do believe that it is over-priced but in all other respects the experience was absolutely brilliant. Every member of the team, from booking to climb was cheerful, efficient, informative and fun. The climb was a thoroughly exhilarating experience. I'd do it again if it wasn't so expensive!

Amazing bridge you can walk on it !. Amazing ! A bridge you can walk on it ! But, it is a quite walk, if your knee is not good enough, or you are having problem of height, then don't try it. Otherwise, it is life experiences you must have ! We love it !

Great Views!. The bridge in itself is amazing, but the views from the bridge are awesome. You will get a lot of exercise. There are a lot of stairs to climb even if you don't take the stairs to the top of the bridge. Just walking to the middle of the bridge from either end can take several minutes.
The Bridge Walk is amazing!. My partner did the Bridge Walk at twilight. He thought it was amazing... the views were breathtaking.... he truly enjoyed the experience.

One of the experiences of my life.. Firstly. Don't be put off by being scared of heights. Once you're up there it's really like climbing the broadest, shallowest set of stairs you can imagine. It is true there are some steep ladders to traverse and some issues with limited access. However the staff and the organisers have done absolutely everything possible including attaching you to a harness and give your foul weather gear to make sure that you enjoy your experience.The interest isn't just limited to the walk, the visitors centre boasted an impressive mini-museum dedicated to the bridges construction and it's impact on Sydney and the country. the staff were friendly and helpful, their processes making sure you are 100% prepared for the climb and safe to do so.This is all about standing atop a world icon and saying "I've done that." You get to do that with places like this, the Eiffel tower and the Empire State building (2/3 achieved), and the experience fulfilled my desire completely.On a more practical note. Everyone is breathalysed before being allowed to climb the bridge. I made the mistake of taking a drink earlier and wasn't admitted. The staff were very helpful and we re-scheduled for the following night. Obviously I knew I couldn't climb paraletic, but I'd only had the one beer and the margins for climbing are obviously extremely narrow. Have that celebratory drink on the way down.

Stunning views, an unmissable sight in Sydney, an icon!. You can drive over it, walk over it, Climb it, and check out the harbour from the South Pylon Lookout.You can photograph it from almost any angle: from the water, from the street, from outside the opera house, from a helicopter... and however you view Sydney's "Coat-hanger" it is magnificent!Some things cost money (eg small cost for the Pylon Lookout, more in cost to do a Bridge Climb)

well its nice.... especially at night it serves for a good look...other than that its not, in my opinion, something to put on the big bridge list like the Golden Gate or the Brookling bridge....although....there is this thing with the fireworks on new years day....hmmm maybe it is indeed more than average ;-)by the way...you can buy an adventure ticket to walk up the bridge and enjoy the view from the very top!

Bridge walk with a view. Excellent,a bit unsure whether I could manage the walk and the height,so glad I did,one of the best experiences of my life.Climbing up through the structure was'nt too bad,a bit tight height wise in places for me but Rob the leader of the group ensured I was ok every 2 minutes until we got out onto the main bridge structure,from there to the top was a relatively easy walk on quite a broad girder,you could not see through the metal work into the harbour but the views out over the harbour area were spectacular.Suiting up and the safety talk takes 40 minutes and about 30 on your return,so you spend approx 2-2.30 hours actually on the bridge or the ladders,at the top group photo taken followed by individual or couples have their photo taken.Wonderful experience,bought the t shirt as well so I can dine out on this for years to come!

Can't imagine Sydney Harbour without this. This bridge is an indispensable part of the view of Sydney Harbour. Apart from being a marvellous piece of engineering and a bit overcrowded now it still stands strong. On taking a ferry or cruise one can pass below it and see it from close and far. One can also get up on to the end towers for free. But to get on top of the bridge the price is hefty.
beautiful landmark. Beautiful landmark with breath taking views. Visit the pylon and see it being build or do the climb to make your stay unforgettable.

Fun Walk!. We had a great family walk from Sydney to North Sydney across the Harbour Bridge! Enter at the Cumberland Street stairwell and exit at the first option at Milsons Point on the north side. Takes about 30-45 minutes, depending on speed. No admission- just enjoy yourselves. Walk down the street at Milsons Point to Luna Park, and take a ferry back to Circular Quay. A great addition to your Sydney stay! Note: If looking for amazing pictures, note a 10 foot high suicide fence makes any shots not as good.

Bridge Climb. Absolutely fantastic! Expensive but very much worth it. Dont go to Sydney without doing the climb - for those scared of heights its very safe - you are always attached so dnt fret!! The best "attraction" I have ever been on.
Fantastic. I have done this climb twice and everytime I've done it, I noticed that the staff are always friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. You can tell the staff love their job.

Amazing bridge. Wonderful Australian bridge that you never get tired of looking at. Stands above Australia's most beautiful harbour. Whether driving on it, sailing under it, or climbing it on a bridge tour, you are assured of amazing views and picturesque landscape. Certainly a must see/do when in Sydney. even better if the cruise ships are in port.
Bridge climb to get the best view. We didn't just go there to see this tourist attraction, we climbed it. And highly recommended for all to do so. Was in awe with the view.
Nice to be back Sydney. Always been in my travel list in Sydney, good view, nice walk and perfect weather this December.....

Bridge Climb - A unique way to see the bridge and city. Leading up to the climb everything is well organised so that you get all the right equipment and know the procedures. I am not good with heights but I felt safe, even on some of the more hair raising parts. The climb was at a good pace, with the guide providing excellent information about the bridge, city and country through earphones. You are not allowed to take cameras with you so there are the multiple photo sessions , which you can buy at the end of the tour.

What a structure. Everyone has the opportunity to walk over the bridge from one side of the harbour to the other and it is a must for a fantastic experience. Those more able should take the bridge walk over the arch to see the views and appreciate the structure.

A Not to be missed experience. Climbing the bridge is safe, the company running the climbs are professionally safety conscious.If you are a visitor to Sydney do not miss the climb,on a clear day you can see the Blue Mountains,and of course the Harbour and Opera House, WOW!!!. When you are done and the adrenalin is still with you,visit one of the many restaurants in the nearby "Rocks" for a feed and a celebration drink. One of the great days of my life.

As for Climbing the Bridge, The Anticipation was the Worst Part. I'm nearly 58 years old and don't like high places. Could I climb the 300 feet from sea level? Would I get nervous and chicken out? Would the height and standing over the harbor from such a dizzying height cause me to fall off the bridge? All these things and more kept going through my mind ... but I still wanted to try. ...and I am so glad I did! They take care of everything as soon as you get there, are very careful to test you out and get you familiar with what you must prepare for. They have made every effort to make it as safe as getting out of bed. So if you are having doubts, let them go. Just go ahead and climb that old bridge and have the time of your life! The views, the experience, and the satisfaction of knowing you have done it are worth every second you have spent worrying about doing it. ...and for most of us, it will be a once in a lifetime experience, so just go do it!

Sydney Harbor Express Bridge Climb. We did the Express climb on a Tuesday morning just before we boarded our cruise ship for a 12 day cruise. This climb was exciting, educational and picturesque all wrapped into one great experience. Our guide told us a lot of history about the bridge along the way and she was both fun and safety minded. The trek was not at all strenuous, with plenty of stops along the way to capture views of the city, the opera house and the harbor below. This was one of the highlights of my trip to Sydney and I would recommend it to everyone who is up for a bit of fun and adventure.

Can't miss it!. I drove across the Sydney Harbour Bridge that was a experience in its self. This is a must do when visiting Sydney, you really can't miss it, the bridge is huge! I highly recommend grabbing a cold beer or drink across from the Bridge next to the Opera house and enjoy the view.

"It's MY bridge!!". Having lived in Sydney on and off for five years, I have to say that the Sydney Harbour Bridge is what keeps pulling me back. When you fly into Sydney, you can see it from the sky and it gives you that warm fuzzy feeling of a place that you belong. It distinguishes your place - North Shore vs. Eastern Suberbs vs. West vs. Where-ever else. For me, this sight is so much more than a bridge. So much more than the history that defines the city. So much more than the sad story of lives lost while building was completed. It's the road to the city and the structure the brings us 'North Shore' types into the hyper-activity of the city offerings. It's the ride home after an intense meeting, day in the office or a booze fueled all-nighter. It's the source of fireworks that light the sky for various occasions. It's a place for city workers to take a lunch-time run and loose themselves. It's the pathway for tourists to stop, take photos and see the highlights of this place that I now call 'home'.

Harbour Bridge Climb- expensive yet unforgettable experience. Yes it is very expensive but the experience is unforgettable. Being an aussie who lived overseas for so many years, these iconic landmarks(Opear house, Uluru etc.) hold a special place in my heart. They are symbols of home.I did the bridge climb on a beautiful sunny day, and the view atop the bridge is breathtaking. Apart from the stunning view, which some claims the same as what you get at the rooftop bar somewhere, the most impressive feature of the bridge climb is the detailed explanation of the history and engineering of the bridge. The guide we had was very professional and passionate about his job but not over the top. Other staff we had contact with were all very helpful and friendly. The safety procedures and the use of equipment were explained so you feel safe. The climb itself was not difficult, except that some people might feel uneasy at the steep ladder section with narrow steps.Overall a very enjoyable experience. Now, the tourist trap! You are not allowed to take camera or mobile phone onto the bridge so we stopped at 3 different spots for everyone to have their photo taken individually plus a group photo. At the end of the tour you have to walk through the counter selling photos of you with the one and only world-famous Opear House in the background. And who could resisit it when seeing a very happy self so close and personal to the riveting steel structure of Harbour Bridge? Or was the photo atop the bridge 134-metre above the sea level more representative of your bridge clime experience? What about the nice people you share the day with whom you would never see again? Well, you only need ONE "$15" photo to commemorate and to prove your bridge climb experience so don't buy more. Seriously, the best souvenir is the momory of the day.Tip, check weather forecast. They are quite flexible with your appointment as tours are quite frequent.

Stunning views. The Bridge Climb was on our list of things we must do and it didn't disappoint! Health and safety was a priority with the team so you never had any concerns about the climb itself. Although this is an expensive excercise, it delivered on every level. Brilliant experience!
Iconic walk. Do this walk from the Rocks and enjoy a coffee afterwards. Its iconic. we just did the pedestrian walk not the climb.

Don't pay for the walk. I don't know why you'd pay $175 to walk the arch of the bridge. Yes, you'll get amazing views of the harbor and of downtown Sydney. But, you can't take your own camera so what's the point? You can walk across the pedestrian / street level and get just as good of view and take pictures with your camera...so, there's your amazing views on camera. Then, you can take the train back across the bridge back to the neighborhood and keep on sight seeing the Rocks neighborhood. But, I didn't meet anyone who was disappointed in doing the bridge walk. Up to you and your budget, I suppose.

Sydney Habour Bridge Climb. Spectacular and breathtaking views of all corners of Sydney on this adventure, went on a clear Saturday (13/12) just after 9 days of storms and rains and was treated to great weather, the history and knowledge of the group leaders was remarkable, I will do this again and again and again......

Best view of Sydney!. I walked across the bridge with my friends, and we were all incredibly impressed by the views of the harbor and the Sydney Opera House! Definitely a must-do for anyone in the area!

Fun Bridge climb. The bridge climb is fun but it is definitely too expensive compared to other activities you can do in other countries - those have more thrills so they're better value for money.If you have money to spend then go for the bridge climb but if you're tight on cash then I wouldn't say it is worth it. If you go for the night climb be prepared for finishing VERY late! I did the Twilight climb and I only left the bridge after 10pm and since I was alone I did not feel great walking out alone to catch the train at that time.The photographs are also so expensive so I really think they could put more effort into creating value for the customers.The views from the top of the bridge are beautiful but it sucks that you cannot take pics and the pics they take are so expensive! The climb is really easy but for elders the steps might be a bit stressful. If you're an adrenaline junkie then this will not scratch your itch so your money will be better spent elsewhere.

Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. I have done this four times and it never gets boring. The scenery and information gleaned from the guides is wonderful and a truly great experience. Breathtaking views and not as strenuous as people might think. I am not a big fan of heights and I am comfortable with this attraction.
Beautiful place. Would recommend taking a boat ride which will take you around the harbor bridge and Opera House! Well worth the 10 AUD I spent!
Bridge Climb. Love the experience - third time climbing and I could never tire of it! What a view!! I definately recommend the night climb to everyone.

Sydney harbour bridge climb. We climbed the bridge last summer. It was amazing, we did the evening climb so we could see everything lit up. It was breathtaking! Never imagined it would be so lovely. It only took a couple of hours and we were not fit at all. It's very manageable. The hardest part is a few steps to get on to the bridge, after that it's so easy :) would do again in a heart beat :)

Awesome by night!. This experience was very exhilarating. We have lived in Sydney for 4 years and never got round to doing the bridge climb until family came over from the UK and suggested we did it.I wasn't nervous about the climb and i'm not particularly scared of heights but as we set off the butterflies kicked in and once we were walking over the road before we started to climb I did get a bit panicky..... I think because the pathway was narrow and you could see below my mind took over and I did question myself if I needed to go back!! after expressing my thoughts with my mother we decided to not look down and press on. We then came to the stairs which we climbed one at a time and waited in turn, I did question the girl a staff member who assisted with groups going up if it gets any easier as I was struggling with the height and the vertical view directly below, she assured me the worst was done and the next level was 3 times as wide and not see through below. I am glad I persisted as all my nerves disappeared and the experience then became an enjoyable one and I was able to relax and get stuck in to the experience. The walkway up was wide and I felt totally confident.Our guide was very good and provided confidence throughout, he was very knowledgable and fun.We originally wanted a day trip but due to other commitments we did the night climb and I believe for us it was better and far more impressive.If you don't fancy the climb I would highly recommend a trip up the Pylon which also has amazing views. If you have family or friends doing the climb they will also get free tickets to go up the Pylon which is great for taking pictures if you time it right with the climbers.

Cruising under the Harbour Bridge.. A night boat trip which goes under the Harbour Bridge is a must do in Sydney. Try a dinner cruise or just a ferry ride the views of the Harbour and Opera House at night time is lovely.

We did it. The bridge climb was well worth it. Staff are all friendly & well informed we paid $258.00 each for our climb & although I at first thought this was a lot of money, in the end it was worth it just for the experience & would recommend this to anyone. There is a lot of prep before you get to do the climb some may say it is over the top but there duty of care to visitors is paramount. In a word a must do for anyones bucket list.

Bridgeclimb is Awesome!. The brideclimb on Sydney Harbour Bridge is an absolutely awesome experience! The walk isn't as tiring as you would imagine and you feel safe the entire way. The views are amazing. Definitely worth experiencing.

What a buzz!. Just loved it, we picked a great day. Views beyond believe seems strange to be climbing such a world icon, seen so many pictures and seen the bridge in movies then to actually climb it. Fantastic would recommend to every one if you can walk, get up there you wont regret! Think we will go again later this month when back in Sydney.

best thing i did in Sydney. Initially i thought the climb would be hard, but the adrenaline rush soon made me forget how tired i was (major jet leg too). Don't think i could have picked a better day to climb the bridge, the instructor (i think he was called Nathan) made it great too, providing lots of insights n stories about Sydney and the bridge. Ticket included entry to the pylon look out, which again offers amazing views of Sydney. Only negative about the bridge climb is that you cant take your own camera up the climb. I bought one of their photo packages which included 10 photos, but the one there seemed to be the same shot just taken a few times.

Sydney Harbour bridge walk. Don't let fear stop you from this exciting experience.Yes it can be a little scary at times but you are completely safe with expert instructors ensuring your a exhilarating time.What a magnificent harbour and city views.One of the best ways to start your Sydney holiday.The climb it self is not that strenuous,I'm in my my 60s and managed easily.

Great walk. Really nice to just walk over the bridge. You can go back with the bus or just walk back. You have great views over the harbour, the Opera House and the city.
It is also possible to go to the top of the bridge. Be aware that costs around $240,- a person.

Gorgeous View. Was a gorgeous view from the tower. They also have a bridge walk but I am a coward and do not like heights so that was off the list. Interesting history of the bridge in the museum located in the tower.

Awesome. We didn't do the Bridge Climb but we did take the time to walk across this iconic Sydney landmark and it was well worth the effort. We walked across it after we'd had dinner in The Rocks area as the sun was setting which was a cool time (both literally and figuratively) to make the crossing. If you don't want to walk both ways you can always take the train back to the CBD from the Milsons Point station on the other side.

EXHILARATING. Not for the faint-hearted, this climb is one of the most unique experiences both Sydney and Australia has to offer. From the moment you first set foot in the door to the moment you step onto the bridge, you will start to feel the blood pumping as this exhilarating experience begins to unfold literally step by step. With the traffic whizzing above your head you will make your way through the catacombs of the bridge before embarking on a magnificent ascent over the arch where there are spectacular views galore. The final view which greets you on your arrival at the summit is nothing short of breathtaking as a postcard view is revealed right in front of your eyes. Brilliant tour guides will only enhance your experience!

Incredible architecture. The bridge is very impressive by its architecture. Especially since it was opened in 1932. It's really big. Take the time to get on the bridge and/or under it. The views are quite stunning.

Bridge climb is a must. Bit expensive to do the Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb, but well worth it. Very well organised and the views are fantastic. You get a free ticket to the bridge pylon lookout, which is with doing and you can take your own photos.

An absolute must. Fantastic views, great guide, lots of fun and you'll be so glad you did it afterwards!It's a little scary but you are well looked after and you soon forget how high up you are. I climbed at night and found it fantastic. The guides are really fun and like to chat to your group lots, so you'll soon feel at ease.

We really enjoyed our Harbour Bridge climb. All of the staff were very helpful cheerful and good to be around. The climb it's self was magnificent our climb guide was very informative, both of the local knowledge and the construction of the bridge. The climb itself was great and the views were stunning we would recommend this attraction to anyone, don't miss out.

The bridge. I did not take the walking tour which takes you to the top several reasons:the heat, the fact that it is a long and slow guided tour, that you are strapped and cannot take photos. I went up on the pillar instead and had the same view and took lots of photos
Rode on it and loved it. Nice architecture design and a popular place everyone in the world knows. The size is huge and the surrounding beautiful.
IT'S HUGE. Take ferry to take the picture of the bridge or from the opera house..must walk at the bridge..there's safety camera at the walk side. worth a visit.
Fabulous. Breathtaking views. Climb it if you can. Worth the effort. I credible structure. Walk the harbor below. Stop into bars and embarks the local color.

Free Walk Across. You don't need to pay to climb it, you can walk it. Did it after work one evening while visiting Sydney. Excellent views and a wonderful experience. Can't believe more Sydney-siders don't do it.
Good bars either side too!

INCREDIBLE VIEWS. The syndey harbour bridge was spendy but worth the views. We did the 8pm bridge climb. It was raining and blowing, and still worth it. The views of everything at night were spectacular. Will go again when I return in 6 months ..

Bridge Climb good but try walking across. The Bridge Climb is exciting - takes 3,5 hours and is not a cheap exercise - but everyone should do it once.
However, just taking the pedestrian walkway from Kirribilli to The Rocks or to the Botanic Gardens (or vice versa) is worth the effort and is free.

Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. Did the climb on a recent visit to Australia. Amazing experience. Very well organised and safe. Staff very helpful. Pace is leisurely (takes about 3 hours in all) so plenty of time for a rest in between. Not difficult, I feel most people could manage it. I was lucky in that the weather was ideal, not too hot and sunny, not windy or raining. If weather not 100% suitable a climb of the lower part of the bridge is done, though the higher climb, which I did, is the best. Also included is a visit to the pylons, the structures either end of the bridge, which also gives a great view of the harbour. If the whole thing gets too much there is the option to leave on the way up about half way - there are staff there to guide you down. Though no-one on my tour took this option.

World Famous Icon. Nobody visits Sydeny without going to the harbour and take photos of the Harbour Bridge (and the Opera House). You just have to do it!And if you have the time, do it in the day and again at night. It looks and feels very different, both equally as stunning in their own majestic ways.

Spectaculr. This is an Icon of Sydney and a must see. This should be seen from on top as well as from below on a cruise.The bridge is amazing and the structural view is also great.Going under the bridge and seeing it from below from the see is something different.A must do when in Sydney. The night view is great and try and time your cruise accordingly.

Best bridge climb. Finally did the bridge climb another adventure ticked of the bucket list. Perfect climb for all shapes, sizes fitness and age the tour guides were great. No need to worry about the heights.I thought the pictures at the end were to exspensive. Very organised company
Easy to climb. A marvelous construction that you could climb, which we did at sunset. Spectacular views on the harbour, Opera House and the city.
Great views. Great views of the opera house, harbor and downtown. You can also pay to climb to the top of the bridge which we didn't feel was necessary.

Thrilling. Every time we told someone we were going to Sydney they told us to do the Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. It is a 3.5 hour tour, but at least an hour of that time was safety instruction (which was boring but necessary). You are put in a group of 10 people with groups leaving about every 20 minutes so there is always a group in front of you and behind you, which made the climb slower then I would have liked (you have to wait for the group a head of you to take pictures and move before you can proceed, so there was a lot of standing around time). You each have a headset so you have no problem hearing the group leader and the only time I was scared was having to climb down ladders to get back to the starting point. Otherwise, the view was incredible and we loved the experience.Only downside is that you cannot take a camera, so we ended up buying the pictures they take and sell to you at the end of the climb (it was a once in a lifetime experience for us so we splurged on a complete packet of photos). I had also gone by the day before to make sure the shoes I had were OK to climb in - I was told yes and of course the day of the climb I was told no - but they did provide me with a comfy pair of shoes to borrow.

Not Just a Bridge!. its iconic we did not wish to climb it - walking over is free and safe - apart from the runners - even in the middle of the dayits noisy of coutrse, but the views are fabulous and its was a fabulous experience and its free!

What a view. This goes without saying. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is Sydney. When Sydney is mentioned or shown the bridge is one of the first icons you see. Joining north and south Sydney known as the Coat Hanger this bridge amazes me, the sheer size. I recommend taking the bridge climb as well.
just a bridge. I didn't do the bridge climb as the price was outrageous...as for just walking across it, it's just a bridge, didn't think it was anything special..

Be sure to walk across! It is FREE. The bridge is amazing. We did not want to pay the high price to climb the bridge SO we walked across the bridge. AMAZING views. You have to do it. We walked across had some fish and chips at a small restaurant and walked back across. There are security personnel at several points crossing and we felt very safe walking across the bridge. One side is for foot traffic other side is for bicycle traffic. Must do FREE!

What a View. Took a walk on Sydney Harbour Bridge. Like most large city bridges it was a very busy bridge. The car traffic is very busy and non stop. If you can not afford the "Bridge Climb" there is a less expensive walk up one of the towers and get a great view of the harbour and the opera house.There are a large flight of stairs to get up to the bridge level, it is about 3 stories up. This walk up the bridge tower is only open 10:am-5pm. There is an entrance fee of ($13.00aus) children under 4 are free. It is a long stair walk up to the top of the tower. The view is fantastic as you can see for miles from this location.

Worth the money. If you're going to go all the way to Sydney, spend a few extra bucks to get to the top of the bridge. The tour allows you a relaxed pace, plenty of time to hear the history and a few stories while you breath the fresh air and capture photos. The gear and facilities are clean and well maintained. The staff is delightful!

Very nice walk, and free!. Forget about paying 200-300$ per person to climb up the bridge, very expensive in my opinion. Better you save your money for something else and just cross the bridge by walk for free, you will get an amazing view as well and take tons of nice pictures of the city and the Opera House. .

Walk Across, Save the Money. We were planning on doing the Bridge Climb, but the more we thought about it, the more we thought we'd rather spend the $400 - $600+ (for two of us) on other things.We walked across the bridge deck rather than climbing part way up or to the top. The views were terrific, even if from a little lower.There are security people on the bridge. Walking is allowed on one side and bicyclists use the other. For a small fee, you can go up in one of the pylons to the lookout on top. See http://www.pylonlookout.com.au/exhibition_frs.htmSave yourself the money and walk across. But, if you really want the adventure of the climb to the top, go for it.

Bridge climb is unforgettable. It's an unbelievable experience. I went to it with very low expectations but I was surprised at how spectacular the view an whole experience was.
Make sure you buy the last session before the most expensive tickets. You get to see the sunset without paying a premium.

Fabulous. I would highly recommend this. Our guide Connor was brilliant, a mindful of information about the Bridge and lots more too. The views of Sydney were amazing. Wasn't cheap but well worth the money if you can afford it.
Bridge Climb. The bridge climb is a must the views are fantastic and even if you don't like heights it's ok. I would even do it again if we ever go back.

Dynamic view. Walked over road path crossing which is free and not so spine chilling as roof walk. Takes a while and it's advisable to take a bottle of water and camera. Train can be taken back to town or vise versa.

The bridge climb. We had a real feeling of accomplishment after we reached the summit of the bridge. From there, you have a 360 degree view of Sidney. what a view. We had a great guide who guided us through and gave us confidence as we went

Amazing. I can't put into words how good the Sydney Bridge Climb was, It's a must do if your visting Sydney. The views are amazing and the History of the bridge is very intreasting.6 million rivits, 10 thousand dropped, 16 people died while building the bridge etc etc. Must find out for yourself.Makes you appricate it all.Would do it all over again.At the end you get a free photo of your group and a certificate to say you've done the bridge climb.Again AMAZING!!!!!!!!!

Breathtaking; especially the twilight climb!. I was "coaxed" into doing the harbour bridge climb with my daughter for her graduating gift. Being one who doesn't fancy heights; I still find the "anxiety" well worth the climb! We went for the pylon tour (entrance included in the climb ticket ) on the last day of our trip and relinquished the fond memory of the climb! It was one of the best thing we did in Sydney!

Walk The Bridge. If you want a fantastic experience this Harbour Bridge three hour walk is a must. Besides getting the most amazing views of Sydney city and beyond the history of the Bridge is just fascinating - did you know there are six million rivets all heated and hammered in by hand? And there were no safety nets or harnesses and yet only one person fell to their death during the nine years of construction (although there were 16 deaths overall from other causes). It is not a cheap walk but well worth the expense.

Want the view without the cost?. The Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb is well known, and very spectacular. It's also a little pricey and not too good if you fear heights (like me).For those wanting a less expensive or less scary option - climb the pylon!There are 4 stone pylons surrounding the bridge. The one in the south-east corner (closest to the CBD), is open for climbing. It has an internal staircase which provides access to a secure viewing platform neat the top, and also houses a fascinating museum of how the bridge was built - for those who are so inclined.It is very inexpensive and provides stunning views. You will need to be able to handle some stairs though, so mobility is vital. Even moderate fitness is fine. It's not a severe workout.
Stunning. An amazing piece of architecture Worth climbing too. The view of Sydney from the top is beautiful It's expensive but worth it.

Better than the photos you have seen.. It's one of those landmark things you have to see in person, such as the Eiffel Tower in Paris or the Statue of Liberty in New York. Better than the photos. You can walk across it and view the entire harbor.

Better than expected. I was a bit skeptical that this was overrated, but was pleasantly surprised. It's a first class operation that is really well organized. Very pleasant staff. Our "guide" had been doing this for 12 years, but still seemed to enjoy it and made it fun for the whole group. Part of the fun is just getting "dressed" for the trip. If it's warm outside, wear as little as possible under the jump suit. (There are changing areas and free lockers.) Overall an amazing and worthwhile experience, even if rather pricey.

Bucket List Alert!. I am petrified of heights but have steeled myself to do the bridge climb twice now and I am sure I will do it again someday. The first time was a daytime climb and the second in twilight which is great as you get to see the city light up and the sun set from the very top of the bridge. The attention to safety is very impressive (they even make you take a breath-test before climbing) which soothed my nerves somewhat although I must admit on the first climb I was ready to turn back but the guide was very calming, encouraging me at every step until I calmed down and started really enjoying the experience. There are few things in life you do that you will never, ever forget and the bridge climb is one of them, not only for the experience of the climb itself but for the breathtaking views of Circular Quay and the harbor, the opera house and the city. Even you are a sissy like me when it comes to heights just go for it. You will love it and feel especially proud of yourself afterwards!

Unique experience. Did the Bridge Climb during our trip to Sydney. Very well organised, very safe, very knowledgeable guide. Absolutely amazing 360 degree views over Sydney. Took 3.5 hours. Totally worth it.

The best view in Sidney. If you are ever fortunate enough to visit Sidney Australia, there are a few things you must try and do, The Sidney harbour bridge climb being maybe the best one, on arrival at the bridge climb centre, after booking your climb, you get a short tutorial on what you will be doing, and how you are going to do it, ie getting into your special grey overalls or lets get technical, climbing suit !and harness, you are shown how to hook on and off etc, Don't worry it's a doddle.And then prepare for the view of a lifetime, and believe me it is.The hardest thing you do on this tour is the first few steps up a short ladder on to the walkway, yes walkway. it's that wide that walking up to the centre of the bridge really is so easy, and your enjoying the view all the way to the top, and it's not a race, it's nice and steady taking in the magnificent views, looking down on circular quey, the fantastic opera house glistening under the sun, and look far across the harbour towards Manley, and watch the busy ferries crossing to the north side of this beautiful city, oh and you even get a photograph of yourself at the summit. Go on and do it, you won't look back, no pun intended.
Great view - very scenic. Nice walk across the bridge with beautiful views. Was pretty chilly with the wind so bundle up. Great vantage point for photos of the opera house and harbour.

You have to do this...... We climbed the bridge for the second time and it was no less awe inspiring than the first time.Clearly having a bright clear day helped but it was a brilliant thing to do. Took around 90 minutes in total and the guide was excellent and informative. As last time, the scariest bit was getting to the bridge arch but none of it was really bad.In my view it is too expensive at $248 each and more (as I recall) for dusk/night climbs.But the views are to die for!!

What a view. We did the bridge walk for $250/ea. It was fun and memorable. However, if you'd like the views without the expense, pay $13 to walk up the concrete pier and get nearly the same view (and unike the bridge walk you can take your camera). Also recommended if you don't have 3.5 hours available. Trouble is, you can't brag about walking up the pier.
Iconic landmark. Fun to watch the people doing the bridge climb. Our cruise ship was docked across the bridge so we had a great view

Awesome experience!. Climbed the Sydney Harbour Bridge at twilight. Can highly recommend the bridge climb, the tour guide Tom was brilliant, very knowledgable and took good care of all in the group. I booked the climb through their own website prior to arrival in Sydney but paid additional prices for extra photos at the end. X1 group photo/certificate of climb and cap was provided in the price stated on the website. A must do while in Sydney!!!
Must see icon!. No trip to Sydney is complete without a visit to the Harbour Bridge. Whether you drive across, walk across, climb over or view via ferry, I'm awe struck each time I see it!

Stunning way to get in and out of the city. I never get tired of the walk over the harbour bridge. It is a great way to get in and out of the city and the harbour changes constantly so there is always something different to look at or photos to be taken along the way.
Do the Bridgewalk!!!. You will never forget the Bridgewalk. It was a great and unique way to see Sydney. Not for the those afraid of heights though, but very easy to do. The staff really help you.

Cool bridge. We walked from the rocks across the bridge - pretty good hike but worth if for the scenery. You can actually do a tour to climb the bridge but it costs something like $220. DEFINITELY not worth it in our opinion. You are not allowed to take a camera so you basically walk to the top of the bridge and look. We chose to stay on the main part of the bridge and took a bazillion photos of the harbour, Opera House, and Sydney skyline. At night you get some great views.

Wow. The sydney Harbour Bridge is stunning in its own right but put it together with the opera house and it certainly has the wow factor. Everyone is thriving to get that perfect photograph that includes both of these attractions. So privileged to have had the opportunity of experiencing both of these.

Didn't go to the top. I saw people climbing the superstructure and that looked like fun. But then I saw the price and thought it wasn't worth it. So I walked out onto the main deck of the bridge, not as high as the climbers, but still quite a good view - and it was free! There is also a museum in one of the pylons that will round out your bridge experience.
Sydney Harbour Bridge. Designed and built in the 1920s, completed and opened in 1932. Full detail is available on Wikipedia. This engineering marvel is best appreciated up close.

Once in a lifetime opportunity. We booked this tour as we saw it was a thing to do whilst in Sydney and glad we did! It did test out your fears of heights but once your up at the top the view is amazing! We did the Bridge Climb which takes you on the outer arch of bridge. The guide was informative and safety was their number one priority so no need to worry!
Sydney harbour bridge walk. One of the most amazing experiences of my life. From the minute you walk through the door, everything is so professional and those views...wow.Highly recommend it.
Pylon lookout. For those who don´t have the nerve to climb the "coathanger" itself, a view from the pylon lookout is maybe not as spectacular, but really worthwhile!
Best Harbour in the world. If there is only one thing you do in Sydney then take e ferry to manly, you will not be disappointed.
Harbour Bridge Climb. What an awesome experience. Its rather outrageously expensive but its a once in a lifetime experience. Glad I did it.
Beautiful Sunset. We have both done the climb during the day before. This time we climbed at sunset ABSOLUTELY beautiful!
for sale. if you are Chinese then i have a room with a view for you , this old relic from the 1920 is worth buying , sadly heritage listing you cannot knock it down but you can expand

Walk the bridge. You can climb the bridge for 180$ on top which is great or you walk the bridge free from the rocks to milsons point or visa versa perfect during the day or at night as you see the skyline. Perfect for taking pictures

An attraction not to miss. My wife and me had wanted to do the bridge climb for some time and as it turned out it was an unbelievably beautiful evening. The whole experience was very professional, from the initial induction and history of the bridge, to the climb completion. The climb itself was not too taxing (I am in my 60's) and the views were spectacular with a 360 degree view of Sydney and its' harbour and of the bridge itself. The view of the sunset in the west and later the city at night was well worth the climb on their own, we even saw a shooting star whilst at the bridge top! The safety harnesses and couplings were not really a hinderance either. A great experience, not to be missed by Sydney siders as well as visitors to Sydney.

Not so strenuous!. Whilst it is 1550 steps up, and down, if you can climb up a few two storey ladders with rails, you will enjoy the experience. The guide gives a very good briefing and you have a test ladder just before the actual climb. They go fairly slowly with stops for views and stories of the bridge and Sydney. You take nothing except your shoes ..they even give you their handkerchief and cap tied on!A draw back is no cameras, but the guide takes pictures and a video of you individually, so allow an extra $50 to buy them afterwards!! And then allow time (an hour) to afterwards climb the Bridge Pylon (included in the price) and get your panoramic photos of Sydney Harbour. Make sure you toilet stop before trip! 3 hours with no opportunities!!
A must do bridge climb, you won't be disappointed. This is an attraction that just about anyone can do. Great views, excellent guides and safety is first class

Views, views, views. We have walked across the Sydney harbour bridge many many times. Also been up to the pylon lookout on the south side on numerous occasions. Whenever one of our grandchildren turns 13 we take them on the Bridgeclimb. To date we have climbed the bridge 3 times and a few to go. It is a wonderful experience. A world class operation and venue. And even for those who may be a little afraid at first anxiousness turns very quickly turns to amazement and pure fun.

You'll enjoy the ride/walk whatever. You won't regret for taking a trip there. It's got so much to tell. What's most exciting, of course, is to also take the bridge walk. Walking across the bridge costs you nothing, but the bridge walk will.
