The reward for walking along the bridge (there are safe and secured pedestrian paths) will be the an unimpeded view of the Opera House.

best bridge in the world. you have to see it and clime it to see what the hole world is taking about it you can walk from one end to the ather or take a train ride and then have lunch at the cafes or visit the bridge at night time with all the lights on or for the best time come new year eve for a mine blowing experience
Sydney harbour bridge. My husband and I got a bridge climb for xmas last year and it was just fasntastic . I recommend this for everyone to do.

Well worth the walk on a lovely day. Great Sunday walk from the Rocks across the bridge and around Luna Park to Waverton Station. Great views of the Opera House and harbour. A lovely easy walk for the entire family
Once is amazing.. The price is very high. I did enjoy it and I glad I did it. I thought the people were great and the experience was amazing. Do do it, but try getting discount price.

Bridge Climb. Climbing the bridge was a fantastic experience. Safety is of the utmost importance and one feels very secure. The views are amazing, doing the walk at sunset is pretty special. The commentary was brilliant, we had lots of stops along the walk to view the sights and take it all in. Would definately recommend this attraction for all ages.

Bridge Climb Fun. An amazing experience that I highly recommend to anyone. My second Bridge Climb and I enjoyed it both times. One in the evening to see the city lights and one in the morning to see it all, as far as the eye can see....Sydney like you've never seen it before. You feel safe and secure and guides work as a group at everyone's pace. Photo's at the summit make it a moment to remember.

I crossed and climbed the bridge. It is one thing walk across the bridge but climbing over is way better. It takes a while to do but is worth every step and every dollar.The view is worth a million dollars.....if you have the time then put it to good use and climb the metal mountain

the Harbour Bridge Climb. Although it takes 3 hours or more this is the best attraction in Sydney. Its the only way to understand Sydney's layout as well as looking at all the famous landmarks and buildings. You can see ,on a clear day that is, from the harbour all the way to the Blue Mountains in the West down to the Southern Highland and all the way up to bush and sandstone hills adjacent to Pittwater and the Hawkesbury.You can look down at all the ferries and small craft cruising the Harbour and converging on Circular Quay and over to The Sydney Heads . Sydney s oldest buildings in the Rocks area are right below you and you can watch the aircraft coming and going to the airport only a few kilometres away.Theres nothing better than a boozy lunch in one of the great Puba around the Harbour. See you there.

Worth the trip!. Taking the ferry ride from the city to Manly is a far better option than the bus!Attending a conference in the city was a welcome excuse to travel by ferry rather than swelter on the bus.You can wander around the ferry, have a cuppa, enjoy the fresh sea air and sunshine,really appreciated after being cooped up all day listening and sitting!!

Climb the Bridge. I am not a fan of heights but I enjoyed climbing the bridge I did it twice, once during the day, the other was a twilight climb...The twilight climb was amazing, the sun setting over the city will be something I will always remember...don't be afraid, you will kick yourself later...they are very safety conscious and it is priority one...

Great Architecture. An icon for Sydney. A must see for anyone visiting this city. Good for the photographer especially on NYE when it lights up & during Vivid light show.
Walking across the bridge gives you great views of the harbour.
be energetic. its a great way to the harbour ,try a sunset climb is just woderful watching all the lights, you can see for miles .
Sensational Path. As a modern facility it survives its purpose of transferring both pedestrian & motorised traffic from one side of the harbour to the other. Good Job keep up the good work.
Family day out. Put your walking shoes on, grab a drink and take a stroll along the bridge and visit one of the many cafes, its just beauitful,

Wonderful experience. My wife and I elected to do the bridge climb but I worried thatperhaps I was making a mistake as I'm not fond of heights.Well, shouldn't have worried about this. We arrived a bit early and were given the option to take an earlier timeslot with just 2 couples. Easy decision. Very much impressed with thesafety discussion and equipment to ensure we had an eventfree experience. Our guide was very knowledgeable and,given the very small group, was able to share many facts andstories with us as we worked our way to the top. Views areamazing. Highly recommend you make some time to enjoythis adventure as it is one that will be remembered for a longtime.

Great way to get some nice photos.. After seeing the Opera House we decided that we would like to get some more photos of the magnificent building. So we walked over the bridge to get some cool panoramic shots. The view incredible ! It is a nice way to fill in some spare time you might have in your trip

Good walk in dry weather. We took a stroll across the bridge on a good fine day.You could see for miles / kms. Lots of river traffic, a cruise ship went out , then later a fuel taker went under the bridge. I Spoke to one of the many security guards patrolling the bridge to ask how many big ships like this went under the bridge ( fuel tanker) , he replied not many now, possibly going to the refinery which is in the process of being de- commissioned. Took some splendid photos, you can go up one of the towers a fee applies about $aus 13, with reset it had just closed .It is quite a climb up from the main city neR to the rocks district ,but well worth it. About 30 minutes each way including stops and starts. You can climb up over the top of bridge a very very large fee applies and need to book !,,, !!!!

Viewable, crossable, climbable. As I'm scared of heights you won't find me reviewing the Bridge Climb. But I can recommend other, cheaper experiences that give you a sense of the scale and place of the Bridge. You can walk across the Bridge on a pedestrian lane; and you can ride across on a train or bus or hire car. Ferries headed west will take you under the Bridge. From Luna Park (fun fair) at Milsons Point you can look up and see lots of the Harbour Bridge, just as you can from many other waterside venues and grassed reserves. If you are exploring The Rocks and west side of Circular Quay you can get close to a massive pylon. And if you go to the Art Gallery of NSW you can find artworks from the early 1930s showing the construction of the Bridge. There are also plenty of publications containing photos (old and recent) and facts.

Take some time to walk over the bridge.. Its worth a trip up the SE Pylon to get some great views of the city. Take a wide-angle lens with you! There is an interesting exhibition as well about the bridge construction with some great B/W photos

Scenic time-filler. We had a blank spot in our itinerary for the afternoon, and decided to kill time by taking a stroll across the bridge.Mind you, it was the free walk, not the paid climb that others did, but we enjoyed it all the same. The views are lovely on a clear day, and the walk was not overly strenuous either.Set aside about 40 minutes for a there-and-back walk. Also, watch out for pedestrians who are gaping at the views; we witnessed several collisions as quite a few people weren't watching where they were going, and walked into others. It's funny until someone drops an expensive camera.
perfect view the opera. yes, you can not leave sydney without seeing the Opera, and seeing it from the Harbour bridge is a good way to see it.
Great view and it's free. We had a walk along the sides of Sydney Harbour bridge and it was great view along the way with the Sydney opera house in full view. If you don't mind the fences, it's free.

Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. I was given a Bridge Climb as a 50th birthday present. My daughter and I thoroughly enjoyed the climb. I'm afraid of heights, but as this was one of my 'bucket list' must do's, I pushed ahead and beat my fears. Our climb guide, Jacinta, was AMAZING! Very knowledgable, and funny, she had the best recall for everyone's names in the group.I recommend a bridge climb for everyone, at least once! It's an experience that will be with you forever!Professional service from checking right through to the finish! Well done Sydney Bridge Climb.
Amazing Views. We walked across the Bridge and back one morning. It was Amazing! The views were great and the walkway is quite well protected. Great exercise!!
A beatuiful sight. The Sydney bridge, whether day or night, is a spectacular sight to see! We really enjoyed taking pictures of this beautiful structure.
Classic Sydney. The Sydney Harbour bridge climb was awesome experience. The views were breath-taking. Enjoy the time here.
This is Sydney History. The oldest, most beautiful architecture piece of Sydney. And give a beautiful view on the bay. What a extraordinary thing to run on it during the marathon.
Great view. You can climb to the top during the day or even at night.The views are amazing. I would definitely make this part of my trip to Sydney each time I go.

The bridge climb is a 'must do' experience. An amazing experience not to be missed. The organisation is excellent and the guides are very knowledgeable and helpful. Not as scary as it sounds, I don't like heights but what a feeling of achievement when we reached the top! A truly memorable moment.

Wow ! Great views must be done. We were both slightly worried about the heights and climbing but had no need to worry -the safety is first class (you cannot fall!). The views are fantastic and provide you with a one off chance to see a birds eye view of this stunning place.We went in the morning so as to avoid the heat of the afternoon , and the guide (Pete) , kept a nice steady pace , not too rushed and loads of city information.You get a free cap and group photo and can buy the extra ones .Enjoy!

Too expensive but you have to do it anyway. Very nice experience. Very nice view over Sydney. They call it the climb of your live and that is true. Although overpriced you really cannot afford to not do it. We did The express version which Goes a bit faster

Must do in Sydney!. I've heard mixed reviews of this tour and all I can say was it was one of the most memorable moments in Sydney! Must do!!! The tour company is highly trained and thoroughly organized! Every moment is like a choreographed dance! From putting on the safety suits to practicing climbing to the taking of photos it is just wonderful! The history of the bridge was awe inspiring and the views were magnificent! I never felt in danger or afraid. The bridge is quite massive and never felt afraid of heights! This is a once in a lifetime opportunity and even thought $200 seems pricey, I would pay it again for the experience! Must do!!!!
When in Sydney, do the bridge climb. The Sydney Harbour bridge climb was a phenomenal experience, the views were breath-taking. Once in a lifetime experience!

Gorgeous!. The bridge is beautiful, and its architectural beauty contrasting with the landscape of the Sydney Harbour speaks for itself. Recommendation: if you like to exercise, take an afternoon and go for a long run that takes you across the Harbour Bridge. The pedestrian entrance is a bit hard to find--its in the Rocks neighborhood--basically just follow the signs for the Bridge Walk, and you'll get there. One side is reserved for bikes and the other for pedestrians. The sidewalk is wider than I expected and easily accommodated walkers, runners, and sightseers. When you reach the other side (i.e., the non-CBD side), make sure you take time to explore the riverside park--it offers great views of the CBD, Harbour Bridge, and Opera House. One of those landmarks that defines Sydney!

A challenge but worth it. I really wanted to climb the bridge, but kept getting cold feet, it wasn't that I was scared of heights but on the ground looking at the people on the bridge you realise it's a long way up!Personally it was a challenge and I wasn't scared....I was terrified! The guide was very good and put me first, behind him, the hardest part was getting to the bottom of the arch, along the walkways and climbing the ladders. Once i started climbing the arch, the fantastic views took over any thoughts of fear. I went on the 3pm tour and on the way down saw the sunset, that was a bonus. It is expensive, and so are the photos they take, but I am so pleased I did this bridge climb.

Amazing!. We did the twilight bridge climb. It was worth EVERY PENNY. I would highly recommend doing the twilight one, so you can see day and night view from the bridge. Orientation etc was very complete and made you feelSafe and well taken care of. Guides were friendly and full of info, as you would expect. The view is amazing of course, and the experience was so much fun-to say we climbed the Sydney Harbor bridge!

Bucket list. This iconic bridge is most definitely worth the climb. One that is on a lot of peoples bucket list. Even if you are terrified of heights (me) the guides make this a great experience. The pace is moderate and you are securely attached to the walk way. The views are spectacular as you would expect them to be. Only negative is that it is quite pricey. Go for it...
Great Bridge. We walked over the bridge and then took metro to get back. Nice walk, nice views of Opera House and the bay. The bridge is really huge.
Coat hanger. The bridge is an Inspirational symbol of Australian culture, I get lump in my throat and I swell with pride every time I see it.

The twilght bridge climb is a must do in Sydney. If you visit Sydney you must try the bridge climb experience, and of the options we went for the twilight climb, so we see Sydney Harbour in all its glory both during the daylight going up, and the evening coming down.The climb itself is not strenuous so is suitable for all of the able bodied, and the guides take you through the history of the bridge, as well as some very entertaining stories relating to the heroic builders and the two openings (one unofficial) of the bridge. You'll get the chance to perchase plenty of photos of your walk as you cant cary any objects on the bridge climb itself.

A Picture on The Background is a Must. This is also an interesting view from the side of the Opera House, A Monument. A Sight which shouldn't be missed by tourists travelling to Sydney.
The best view is from the Harbor side or from the ferry ride.

Walked across Harbour Bridge. I walked across the bridge to Luna Park area from the access pylon not far from the Shangri-La Hotel on Cambridge Street. Walk up Argyle st and look for stairs and the large Pylon supporting the road leading to the actual bridge itself.It is a long walk but well worthwhile, safe and good views with photo taking made fairly easy. Security guards patrol the bridge, so very safe. You get good photos of the City, Circular Quay and the Opera House, that you can't get as good from the ground. One bridge Pylon has a climb facility to get higher up for a moderate cost. Then of course there is the more expensive bridge climb but that is not for me as I don't like heights that much. It is safe but that does not help me LOL :-) Allow 2 hours to do this .

Stunning bridge, beautiful icon but couldn't walk across it. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is absolutely stunning. We thoroughly enjoyed driving over it and admiring it's beauty from Circular Quay and the Opera House.We were so disappointed though when our family made our way on foot to the bridge with the intention of walking across it and after getting up two flights of steps, carrying the pram up security turned us away and told us that we weren't allowed to walk across it as it was 'too dangerous' with a pram. We got told the ramps that were next to the stairs were so people could ride their bike across the bridge. The Bridge itself is wonderful, however it's so disappointing that we were discriminated against because we had a pram, especially if it's ok for bikes to go across it. People in wheelchairs would be treated the same way and for an icon which has been around for so long, it's disappointing that they're so behind with the times.The Bridge needs to be more family friendly.

One of the two iconic sites in Sydney. What can you write that has not been written before about this icon of Sidney. You ee it from a distance and it is instantly recognisable but it is only when you get up close do you realise it's majesty.

Exciting Experiance. OMG Sydney Harbour Bridge awe inspiring!!!! My Husband and I went on the speedboat trip from the harbour, a must do. Seeing the bridge from underneath its huge!!! I had my eyes shut most of the time on the speedboat apart from when the driver put his foot on the brake and the boat stood on its end, absolutely thrilling ride. We were wet through when we got off but I didn't care, you just have to do this. See the bridge from under or over the harbor fantastic sight.

Worth the money. This certainly isn't the cheapest activity to do in Sydney but it is worth the money. From the moment you enter the climb building the staff are friendly and you know you are going to be in for a great experience. You don't feel rushed and part of a cattle market that so often tourist attractions feel like, the whole experience takes about 3 hours and you spend a good 2 hours on the bridge. Our guide was brilliant - funny and knowledgeable without being over bearing, you learn lots about the history of the bridge and the city and of course get some incredible views. Treat yourself to this experience in Sydney (the twilight climb is great as the city is light when you walk up but lit up by the time you come back down and the pictures look great)
Bridge Walk. amazing! but I was surprised at how steep the steps were to get to the bridge, but once over that, it was a great adventure.

You can go over, across and under.......all enjoyable to see!. The Harbour Bridge looks magnificient from a plane, and is also just as great traveling across in a train and ferrying underneath. There are three good vantage points that I've discovered for viewing the bridge......Circular Quay, Milson's Point Rail Station and McMahon's Point Ferry Wharf. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is one of the main icons that overseas travelers refer to, when thinking of Sydney.

Sydney is Sydney!. The name Sydney sparks the thought, the Harbour Bridge! What more is to say about the icon bridge! A walk, bike ride, or even a car ride is worth the toll(in a car) for the beauty and scenic views.

Get more than the views. Well worth a visit and to take part in the walk over the bridge. Learned a lot about the history from the era and of those that were involved in the construction of this iconic edifice.I agree with other reviewers that it is expensive however it is probably a once in a lifetime experience. How many times are you going to do it?

Amazing Views, Incredible Experience. Firstly, it is safe and really not that scary even if you are afraid of heights. This Bridge Climb crews are outstanding and the preparation that they go through for your safety is better than I have ever seen. I think they could do this anywhere in the world including the US without any issues.Secondly, once you are at the top, well it has been said thousands of times, there are none better in all of Sydney because you worked a little to get it and not everyone who goes to Sydney will ever have that same experience. Simply amazing.Pros: Safe, great training process and equipment, fantastic guides and several of them, absolutely beautiful views of city and harbor, amazing experience.Cons; Only one, but like much of Sydney it is pretty expensive. Not really a con, but you don't really cross the bridge, you go to the top, cross at midpoint and come back on the other side of the same span (the distance is the same as crossing the bridge)Would I do it again, without a doubt, the bridge climb is a must to experience Sydney.
a masterpiece!. an architectural marvel and must-see..... this bridge is a true thing of beauty. highly recommend climbing it for the most stunning view of Sydney possible!

EXCELLENT. We did this tour. Although we thought it was quite expensive we thoroughly enjoyed this tour. It is a must do if you go to sydney. The staff are amazing and put you at your ease, which was the case for myself. I enjoyed the whole experience and the views at to die for. BRILLIANT. well worth every penny.
Just do it. If physically able, do the climb. It's an experience you will never forget. Wish I'd taken/purchased more pics.

VIEW TO A KILL. The most magnificent and sparkling clean harbour in the world. Take a breath of fresh air and enjoy coffee with a view and the glittering lights at night are certain to captivate your imagination.

WOW!!!!!. We had not planned to do this but decided to at last minute. Only trip left was 7:30, last trip of the day. It had been a hot day so we thought that would be better as it would be cooler and we could see the night lights. Plus it was the least expensive time to go. We were thrilled with the experience. All the staff were very friendly, knowledgeable and most helpful. We were disappointed to learn it took 3 and a half hours and couldn't imagine why. We didn't realize first hour is preparation and that we would make a lot of stops along the way. This worked beautifully (pun intended) as it gave us plenty of time to enjoy the beauty and kept us from being fatigued at all. It was a very safe experience and our guide did a great job of telling us the history of the bridge. While it seems like it would be a significant physical challenge, it was not. If you have only modest conditioning, you will be fine. If this is not on your bucket list, add it NOW! Two things I wish were different: really would like to bring my own camera and I wish it was not as expensive.

Great views. Walked over the bridge but didn't go up the walkway to the top, a bit too high for me. The views from the pedestrian walkway were well good enough. Take your time there are plenty of good photo opportunities.
bridge. loved the bridge went there of a night so my friend could see it lite up .she has never been to sydney .my second time i love it there

Iconic Sydney Part 1. I love Sydney Harbour Bridge. Designed by Bradfield, not only is it a magnificent structure but it is the perfect viewing platform for one of the prettiest harbours in the world. Walking across the bridge is said to add a year to the length of your life. From the walkway you can see Sydney's other icon, the Opera House. You can safely cross from South to North or vice versa either on foot or via bicycle. The bicycle track begins near the Sydney Observatory at the Rocks (home of Sydney's oldest English settlement) and ends at Milson's Point. The walking track ends in Kirribilli (a 10 minute wander to see the sometime home of the Australian Prime Minister.) The view from the bridge is spectacular and unencumbered. Well worth it.My daughter and I once took a train to Milson's Point, walked .across the bridge, went to the Markets at the Rocks, ate at Pancakes on the Rocks, went to Manly via the ferry at Circular Quay. We swam then ate dinner at one of the many restaurants at Manly. Then took the ferry back to the Quay. What a lovely day.

Twilight climb experience never to be forgotten. I climbed the bridge, experienced the construction and form whilst being informed of its history. Experienced Sydney harbour at day ( walking up ) watched the sun set before experiencing Sydney harbour at night ( walking down) Totally break taking and a once in a life time thing to do.Can get a little windy

Do it. If you're worried about your fitness don't. I'm unfit, mildly asthmatic, with dodgy knees and it was fine. The guide was very knowledgeable and made it fun. The stops to point out the amazing views, talk about the building of the bridge or the history meant you were never out of breath.It's very safe but I can't say don't worry if you're afraid of heights. It is high and you can see down.

the bridge. there are more than 20 bridges in Sydney but Sydney harbor bridge is the most famous bridge in Sydney and Australia. it is also one of the most photographed spots in the world.it is the place with which Australian new year is associated as people witness fireworks at this venue on the night of 31st December every year.
Astonishing. worth walking across if you don't fancy climbing looks stunning from every direction amazing one of worlds great bridges
Its a marvel.. Each time I see this beautiful bridge it takes my breath away how it stands over the beautiful harbour and how it takes you in.

Great experience. I love walking over the bridge. It'd be good to team it with a visit to the Kirribilli markets which run on the north side of the bridge on a saturday morning. The south pylon of the bridge let people up three stories for around $16. Much cheaper than the bridge climb - although this is definitely on my bucket list!
Takes your breath away. It's both intrigueing and mesmerising to look at, very few landmarks compare and there are some lovely spacious and relaxing places to view it from, enjoy !!!

Most over-hyped tourist place. Since I have traveled a lot of India and Europe, and I was visiting this third continent - Australia for the first time, I did have a basic expectation of finding something worthwhile, especially because even the hemisphere was different. But to be very frank, Sydney was a big disappointment for me, as without any culture of their own, and overly planned city, it looked and felt too bland. And harbor bridge and Opera house were another reason for my disappointment. My experience with Eiffel Tower in the day light was a similar one, but at night the sight totally changed and was extremely attractive. But i did not feel the same for the harbor bridge and the opera house area. it is hopelessly crowded and in the normal days, even the lights are not that attractive. So much so for one of the most livable city in the world!!! Trust me if ppl can, but India and Europe are far more beautiful and "living".
Iconic place to see. Amazing views over Sydney and its harbour.But, the walkway seems a bit like a prison, with barbed wire and CCTV on it about every 10metres
Nice walk over the bridge with awesome views. Don't miss a walk above the 1,6km long Habour Bridge. You'll get awesome views of the Habour, the Opera and Circular Quay!
Bridge climb. Although expensive and you have to buy their photos as you cannot take your camera in case you drop it and kill someone, the climb is worth every dollar. Amazing views!

Breathtaking. Brilliant we did the bridge walk well worth it if a bit scary at times and what a view, you may think three hours is long but it fly's over the guides are informative and make it a memorable experience

Bridge walk. Fantastic views of the harbour, be warned however you are only allowed to stop for short periods of time for photo shoots as they are worried of potential jumpers !
Great backdrop for photos of friends or loved ones.
Boat trip of harbour well worth a visit if you gave the time .

Expensive, but worth it for the view!. Having seen it from the Opera house, and from the Rocks, we finally got to climb it. It's nowhere near as strenuous as they make out, but it can be very windy up there. It is very expensive, but where else can you do this? Great memories.

Walking the bridge is great and relatively easy. To be honest, the bridge itself is not very impressive compared to the great bridges of the world. But one thing it does have is the best views of Sydney and the opera house. That's what makes it such a great part of Sydney. And it is a free and relatively easy walk.

Lively harbour. The park is full of children, there are street-shows, it is a very lively place.Many restaurants on the harbour.The mall on the left side of the harbour is a cool place to go shopping, you also have a lot of tourist stuff, like shirts and uggs. On this harbour is also located the aquarium, the wild life center and the Madame Tussaud Museum. You can do many things in this area. Just around the corner is the chinese garden and paddy's market, both must see in Sydney.
Gorgeous. The best way to look at it is either by ferry or from the opera house. Try a sunny day! It's iconic! Mate!

iconic bridge the must see. i and my bf flew over to sydney from Jakarta 2011, it was my first visit and we stayed at Cambridge hotel. after some hours resting we hit the street from hotel to hyde park, from there we walked down to the bride and it was fantastic view, as you can see the opera house down there. there are many cafes but very pricey. yes sydney is one of the most expensive city in the world, we went to the sea world at Darling Harbour, which show us alive sharke, very impressive!on way back we sat at one of the cafe there to have coffee, impressive price as well! then we took a cab, 15 min ride costed 20 AUD!!! just advise never take a cab! overall sydney is one of my fav destination.
Iconic. Great old bridge, a must to see and photograph if your are in Sydney Harbour. A great back drop to photos of couples or groups. Magnificent architecture.

Nice View. It looked huge when we watched it from the Opera house but you go close and the word huge become small. Bets thing is that you can buy tickets and go on a guided walk to the top of bridge wall. Do try the walk and see the world from a different perspective.
One place to visit. This the harbour bridge and beautiful lookout for opera house like a scenic helicopter view. Don't miss this place. Make sure you walk along this.

One of a kind. There are certainly more beautiful and attractively-designed bridges in the world, but this incredible setting makes Sydney Harbour Bridge among the most breathtaking -- and definitely one of the most recognizable. A walk across - while a bit touristy - is quite fun with spectacular views, especially of the Opera House and Sydney skyline.
Beautiful Bridge. this is a beautiful bridge, Great for walking and seeing the beautiful views of the Harbour and city, this is a definite must do while you are in Sydney.

We climbed it!!. Amazing experience, definitely glad we made the effort to do this. It was not cheap and I do feel that it is a shame that not everyone would be able to afford this! The tour guide (Steve) was fantastic, he was approachable, friendly and really knowledgeable about the history of the bridge, he was also very happy to answer any questions that the group put to him. Another experience crossed off my bucket list :)

Yahoo!. This was a much easier climb than I had imagined and so well organised from start to finish it made it such a smooth experience. For someone who is not totality comfortable with heights I managed the climb well and loved every moment. Must commend the guides they take their time to let everyone fully savour the experience. Thanks!!!

Walk the bridge for free. Wow what a massive steel sculpture. You've seen it n the photos but walk underneath around the rocks area of Sydney or climb atop and take the free walk across the Harbour to North Sydney and back enjoying the most spectacular views of the Opera House CBD Circular Quay and Harbour.
Great spot for a over view of Sydney. I recommend you to just walk on the regular sidewalks. I did not paid for the climbing (too expansive in my backpacker opinion), but the view is still great.
awesome. This walk up high on the gridge is great , was happy with the safety harness it is very high was great to see the place at close quarters .

great views, but not the best in sydney. a most-do walk or cycle, but not the best view in sydney! try the zoo or botanical gardens for a more sedate way to see the city from a different angle.it's noisy and smelly from the constant traffic, and very windy, but that said, you should still do it!

Beautiful Views - Great Walk. This is a must-do when in Sydney! Our hotel looked right over the Bridge and we were able to see it each morning and each night all lit up! It's gorgeous!!We did not do the Climb, but we did walk across (for free) and were able to take lots of photos of the Opera House from the Bridge, it's the best spot for a photo op for sure!! I definitely recommend walking across the bridge, you might regret it if you don't!

Greaat Views. It's a fair walk along the bridge & back again. Plenty of people do the bridge walk, which I believe is expensive & does look amazing, but that was not for me, too high! However pay $13 & you can go up one of the viewing towers which gives spectacular views. I would recommend doing this, as the walk along the bridge is good but views are obviously obstructed with all the railings.

Breathtaking view. I personally wouldn't consider spending the AU$600 for a climb to the top, especially when the view from the harbor is free and spectacular! Best way to view: take a ferry ride from Circular Quay.

Iconic and scenic. beautiful...This Bridge is truly an engineering design and technical achievement of international importance. What a steel arch rests on its combination of span, width and load bearing capacity, and for the difficulties overcome in its erection. It contains the heaviest steelwork of its kind ever constructed.

Climb an icon. Great experience. I was unsure about the feelings of being so high and the steepness of the climb but, felt safe at all times completely surrounded and firm under foot with a harness too (There is NO chance you could fall or slip). The steepness was not an issue either as, it is a slow climb with plenty of stops to rest and take in the view. The worst part is the rather prolonged saftey talk before climbing, but made worthwhile with the fantastic view when you get to the top. Photo's are a bit cheesy but fun and proof you did it.
Engineering Beauty. Nicely engineered bridge. A technology beauty in the Syndney Harbour. No way am i ever going to walk on the top.

An icon you can walk on and over. Any one living in Sydney is used to the bridge and many of us travel over it daily, but for me it never gets old knowing that I traveling over one of the most iconic bridges of the world, and partnered with the view of the opera house you are living the promise of the films, series and other TV images youve seen over the years.

Express Climb is the one. A vastly more enjoyable climb with a great overview of the bridge structure and of course there is reaching the summit which is breathtaking - only 30 mins shorter than the major climb but far more interesting as you get the best of both worlds - first hand bridge structural experience and of course the views from the top Our guide Dean was spot on and given the route we climbed we could easily assimilate to the stories told ....... 5 Star

Spectatular. My husband and son did the Harbour Bridge climb at night, they said it was the best experience and something that everyone has to do in their lifetime. I didn't go, as I don't like heights. My husband said that it would have been ok for me to do and they felt safe at all times.
Awesome views. Great for any ages to take a stroll over the bridge. Impressive views of the city, habour and Opera House, and plenty of places for a coffee or snack on the other side.

Spectacular Australian landmark. Drove across the Sydney Harbour bridge a few time. It is awe inspiring to look at it's massive arches and framework. Amazingly large and well-made for it's age. You can walk across it for free. Bridge toll was $4 by car. An Australian icon.

bridge walk. DO IT!!Brilliant! You won't forget it or regret it!No one else in my family would do it with me so I went with a group of total strangers of all nationalities, ages and abilities! You are kitted up with all the safety gear and have a "practice" climb" to get the feel of what to expect on the bridge climb!.... And then you're off on the real thing!The views are amazing! Make sure to have a souvenir photo as you'll probably only do it once! Then you can tick it off your "bucket list" Expensive but for once in a lifetime thing....go for it! FAB!!

Awesome Bridge - Get in it and on it... Along with the Opera House, you just have to visit the bridge, If you want to walk up to the top of the bridge. Take something warm on as it is breezy! But amazing views of Sydney.

The View was Just Breathtaking!. Decided to the bridge walk as many reviewers said it is a must do. Did the Bridge Climb back in 2012 with quite a fee but this was free. Got a bit lost looking for the stairs leading up to the bridge but after that it was straight forward walking along the bridge and the view was breathtaking. Plus, it was wonderful day with sunny blue sky and the ferries service were in full swing when we were up there. Built up an appetite after the walk and went to the Rocks Foodies Market to grab some grub.

Admired from a distance. While I did not do the Harbour walk I did have a great view from Circular Quay. On the beautiful day that I visited we had a great view from many places. You certainly cant come to Sydney and miss the impressive structure

Great views. Although we did not do the Bridge Walk as it was pricey, my wife and I walked over the bridge and the views are really great of the harbour and downtown Sydney. A marathon race was on that day so we were able to watch them run over the bridge and through The Rocks. Good place for pictures.

Awesome Experience. I was booked to go on the Bridge Walk through my employer as a team building thing. What else can I say except that it was AWESOME!!The whole experience was amazing. The instructors go through every aspect of the climb, and talk you through the whole thing. Once we were all geared up the nerves started kicking in. Probably the scariest part was walking out to the bridge along the mesh walkway. After that, everything else was a breeze.We walked up and through one of the pylons (which is an awesome experience in itself) it was like stepping back into the 1930's. Once we got to the underside of the bridge, we walked up through the street level and up onto one of the arches. This may take a little effort, like walking up a ladder. Then once we were on top of the arch, it was a simple, uphill stroll, up and over the arch. Just a note here, the arch is very, very wide. Standing on the arch, you cannot see straight down. I would say the arch is about 2.5 to 3.0 meters wide. So if you have a fear of heights like I do then don't worry, it is wide enough to think you are on the ground. There are plenty of great photo opportunities for photos to be taken by the guide, which you can buy for a fee. (sorry, no cameras) Having said that, when we got to the top, the walkway between the arches is a bit thinner, but by this time we were all used to being up there. A bit scary for some. Then we descended on the other arch and went back the way we came.All in all, an awesome experience and one that everyone should do at least once in their lifetime. That goes for us Sydney-siders as well. A must do experience for everyone, highly recommended.

Amazing. We have done the Sydney harbour bridge climb on a beautiful afternoon . It is not to be missed and I must say that it is an experience you will never forget . The whole operation is run like clockwork by the most professional people and even if you don't like heights ( like myself ) you do not feel at all unsafe and at all times your guide is there encouraging you along . The views are to die for and the history that you learn about the bridge is fantastic . So just do it , you will not regret it and you will have an experience that will last a very long time .

Outstanding views!!. The climb can be a little tough and tiring but it is so worth it! It is quite high up so not for the faint hearted but it is honestly a lifetime experience that will be well worth the money spent!
Take ferry. Take the inner harbour ferry abut $12 return takes you under bridge etc. Goes to Luna park and around to Darling harbour. Great for taking pictures well worth the money.

The second most famous landmark in Sydney. Whether you walk to the Rocks, or through the botanical gardens or take a boat ride on the bay - you will always get chances of seeing this beautiful bridge!

Wonderful walk. Fantasic views, it took us a while to find the walkway on to the bridge, but it was well worth it. We visted the Luna park once over the otherside. This would be a great thing to do with the kids and it is all for free. But I guess it could get expensive if you do take the kids, as the rides at Luna park are not free!

Tiring. This is a must do or all visitors to the city. We climbed to the top of the bridge tower for magnificent views over the harbour & Sydney. Be warned though the stairs seem never ending, but it does give you a brief history of the Bridge & it's construction.

Amazing!. The views were unbelievable! Our guide was wonderful and taught us a lot about the bridge and surrounding areas. They won't let you bring your own camera, so budget an extra bit of money (trust me, you are going to want them). The best deal is 10 pictures for $50, which you can split between friends. I want to go again and will do so next time I am in Sydney :)
Iconic. Great museum, amazing structure. A wonderful experience to stand on such an impressive piece of great architecture and engineering.

Moved the entrance to the bridge pylon outlook. After walking through The Rocks to the pylon lookout entrance - as shown on the map provided to me by iVenture card - my friends and I discovered that the entrance had been moved due to construction. There were no signs anywhere letting my group and I know that the entrance had moved or to where. We ended up taking a cab to Bondi Beach instead of trying to walk back to wherever the entrance was now located.

Don't be afraid of heights - the experience is amazing!. Did the Sydney harbour bridge climb on 3rd October. It was kill or cure time: my fear of heights and of bridges! A couple of wobbly moments but WOW! it was worth it. A lot of instructions, form filling out and a little breatherlyzer test and our group of 14 made our way out. Fully locked onto the harness wire. Lots of photos taken by our guide. You can pay extra for the photo package but it's worth the money. They say bring your sunnies and a smile as all other personal belongings have to be put in lockers. Can't exactly remember how long the whole experience lasted - didn't care though really as I was having too much fun. You'd be daft not to do this if you've travelled so far. Have fun!

Magnificent. We walked across the bridge, decided that spending £300 for the 2 of us to walk over it was just too much. It's a fantastic feat of engineering and well worth a look. Got some great photos of the bridge from the little park just below at the grand harbour side.

BridgeClimb. It is a little pricey but if you can afford it then do yourself a favour and do it. It is an experience like none other. I did the twilight tour and enjoyed seeing the city in the daylight, the sunset and then the city in the dark. Three amazing experiences in one! The staff are fantastic and safety comes first. I'm not the biggest fan of heights but felt secure throughout the experience. The staff take their time and take photos of you which you can purchase later although you do get a complimentary 8 second video of yourself and also a group photo. Definitely worth the money... Every penny

We took the walk on the Harbour Bridge and it was very good experience. We took the walk on the Harbour Bridge and it was very good experience. It is not a very tough task unless you look down into the water. Try taking the sunset time so you can enjoy both the sunset and then the city lights.

Walk it, it is worth it.. We actually climbed the bridge. I never thought I would do it but would go again. It is well done and I did not feel any panic climbing. The view at the top is beyond words. It is so stunning that words are not needed. You just fill your soul. Hearing about the history of the bridge is also cool. Recommend to all visitors.

Give it a go. It really isn't as strenuous as you would imagine.The climb is quite easy. If you are afraid of heights leave it to the others.You are supplied with special one piece suits and EVERYTHING is attached. No cameras . Well worth it though.

Climbed it. i took full advantage of the bridge and climb it. a little pricey but well worth it the views alone spectacular and the sense of achievement incredible. included in the price is a group photo which was a nice extra.

An impressive sight. Next to the Opera House the Harbour bridge is one of THE things to see in Sydney. And it doesn't disappoint.When you sit in one of the restaurants at the Opera House with the view of the Harbour Bridge....well, that is an impressive sight. Especially at dusk or at night. The light...the colours. We enjoyed the views for hours and came back every night.Be sure to take a boat for more views. You could take a tour. But a regular ferry (going to Darling Harbour and back) does the trick. Costs much less...same views....and lots of space on the boat. We also drove across the Harbour Bridge (by accident ... I took a wrong turn). When you are that close you can see the great architecture. Nicely done. Of course you also can walk the bridge or even climb it.So, when in Sydney, be sure not to miss it!Wanna know more about me and my trips? Check my profile.

The Pylon View. The Harbour Bridge, 'Coathanger' or the Iron Lung is as iconic as the Opera House.Make sure to get photos of it all times during the day. Especially gorgeous at sunset with the silhouette outlined of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge.I only went up the Pylon and didn't do the bridge climb as I felt it wasn't worth the money.The Pylon itself gives you a good panoramic view of the opera house, the skyline and the harbour for a fraction of the price of the bridge climb. Besides there is no view you get from doing the bridge climb that you don't get from going up the Pylon.

I never really crossed it. But it was a beautiful sight with its huge arch over the water. Plus seeing the many different ships that sailed under it. If you are brave enough, you can even get a tour to climb to the top and get a different view of Sydney
Iconic bridge. Walked across on foot as too scared to scale the heights and wear the harness. It's a great bridge, marvelous for that iconic photo which everyone will recognize.

200 steps up to The Pylon but worth it. We decided not to do the bridge climb and saved our energy by just walking up the steps on Cumberland Street, The Rocks to the bridge. We then walked along the bridge to The Pylon entrance where a sign warned there were 200 steps to the top. After the first set of stairs there is a 13 dollar entrance fee to pay which includes a film and interesting displays about the making of the bridge. There are seats on landing areas to the top where you can take a rest. The view from the top is amazing and you can take panoramic photographs of the harbour and all around. This visit makes you realise what an amazing city Sydney really is and that the bridge is a true master piece of engineering.
Spectacular Sydney Harbour. We had an amazing time walking around taking in all the sights. We enjoyed a ferry ride and took in all the beautiful views.

Great for photo taking. Very nice landmark every tourist should visit to take photographs. However there's nothing much to do there other than dining and buying touristy items so travellers don't really need to spend much time there

Amazing Structure. Toured the Sydney Harbour Bridge, my husband did the Climb and just loved it, I did the Pillars tour and the views were amazing from that let alone on top of the Bridge. If you do not have a fear of heights you must do the Climb everyone coming off it had a smile from ear to ear.
Magnificent. If your visiting Sydney you must do the harbour bridge climb its the most exciting and breathtaking experience. Worth every cent. I want to do it again.

Unforgettable Sydney. You'd struggle not to see the Sydney Harbour Bridge during any visit to Sydney. It's just 'there" in your face. But this view is taken from the northern shore just on the Milson's Point ferry wharf in front of Luna Park. Looking under the bridge you can see the Opera House in the background. Unforgettable Sydney.

Sydney Harbour Bridge Our Beloved Coat Hanger. Sydney Harbour bridge is one of the worlds iconic bridges. It may not be the longest, largest or most colourful, yet its ours and we love it. Many a tourist whether flying into Sydney or arriving by cruise liner who gaze in wonderment at a bridge, that connects the city to the northern part of the city.The coat hanger can be climbed, driven, cycled, trained across. Do take the walk across the bridge to Kirribilli to see Sydney's skyline from a different perspective, grab a coffee, if the cake shop outside on the right hand side of the entrance to the station, go pick up a cream bun, lamington or custard tart,take a stroll to a side of Sydney thats relaxing. Sydney's is my town ,I make no bones, I love it when I fly in.PS: On News Years Eve the bridge will be lit up by fire works. What a beautiful site!

Unbelievable experience. The whole experience was just so good...possible the best run tour we have been on anywhere!! Graham our guide...a dude with a fun filled attitude, from the moment you enter the reception to when you leave...brilliant. Every Aussie needs to do it to appreciate this city we have.

Brilliant Bridge Climb!. I have considered doing the Bridge Climb ever since it started many years ago. Then last year friends invited me to join them for it. I initially baulked at the price then thought 'why not!'I was so glad I did it! It was the most amazing experience and well worth every cent! It is one of those experiences that will be etched in my memory for life. I was a little concerned about being so high up but I needn't have worried. It felt so safe and was like a walk in the park! With the most incredible view of Sydney. 11 out of 10!

Another Must Do. Yes, I have a little fear of heights. And yes, I did the Sydney Bridge climb and loved every minute of it! They take safety very seriously and for that I am so grateful! I felt safe and secure the entire time - the views were spectacular.

Enjoyable Experience. Interesting, informative and fun (the guides were great!). OH&S is strictly followed, you cannot fall off the bridge. The views from the top are excellent. The whole thing takes about 3 hours with "explicit training" - but done with humour! The pace is gentle, there is no rush, but it is best done if there are NO strong winds.

Bridge Climb.. To climb the bridge was one of the life long ambitions and I was not disappointed. I did a twilight climb which is well worth the extra cash, but I do think its a bit much to try and charge you ~$15 for each photos after you spend almost $400 on the climb.

Live Life to the Fullest. Expensive but worth it. The bridge climb is totally safe---but You'll never find an event like this in the US---we're all about litigation and preventing people from a little dare-devilish activity. The climb requires mild physical activity but really people between 10-80 year old can easily do this climb. You're strapped in securely at all times---which can be reassuring in the winds that can swirl around the bridge....but the VIEWS, oh the VIEWS!! It's a once-in-a-lifetime experience. Book this in advance---it's a popular attraction and they won't have room if you show up at the door.

You have to do it.. We did the Bridge walk, the full three and a half hours and it was just breathtaking. The views from the top of the bridge are just spectacular. Expensive but worth it as you cannot describe the thrill of this, you just have to do it to experience it. Do not leave Sydney without doing it. You will regret it.

Great to walk or drive over!. The drive is a little too quick and you don't really take in the amazing architecture as you do when you are walking. It is a good walk and doesn't take that long. It is another of the things that you should have on your list of things to do in Sydney. I have been travelling over it since I was a small child, by car, train, bus and by foot, and it never ceases to impress me.

Pylon. We went to the pylon because we couldn't afford the bridge climb. At $13 it was great value, the displays were informative and interesting and the views were fantastic. Would highly recommend to anyone who can't afford the bridge climb.

You have to Climb it!. Such a great bridge, an icon in this city. You won't miss it when you're in sydney with vantage points of it from everywhere around this amazing city. Climbing the bridge is a must. Sunrise or sunset are the best times to do it, that is however the most expensive and busiest time too.
Love the Ferry. There is nothing that compare with the ferry ride to get to Manly beach. It beats the train, bus and car. Enjoy the ride and the sun once you arrive at Manly.
Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. Have been on this climb twice now......fabulous way to see Sydney Harbour.......and it is easy, so dont be frightened by all the stairs......it is such an adventure
A must do in Sydney .... Great views , felt extremely safe at all times , gets the heart pumping though , however would recommend it ......connected both sides to the bridge at all times ....
Bridge climb recommended. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is beautiful with the harbour, you must do the bridge climb to see the lovely views of the harbour and the city of Sydney. Very special place.
Walk across it!. We didn't walk across the top of it (too chicken) but we did walk across it on the pedestrian walkway. You get a great view of the harbour area plus it's a very pleasant stroll.

walking across the Sydney Harbour Bridge. If you have just arrived in Sydney you probably haven't been able to book to climb over the top of the bridge. No worries! Walking across is almost as good. The walk starts in the Rocks - well signposted or ask the way. Once you get to the other side at Milson's Point there are some nice little restaurants where you can have a pleasant lunch.

The Coat Hanger. For anyone who visits Sydney you really do need to venture over the Sydney harbour bridge. Either by simply walking over the padestrian footpath or up the south tower and even for the adventurous the bridge climb up to the top of the bridge for some the most magnificent views one will admire anywhere in the world. The bridge is a must for the whole family and it's great excersise!
What A view. Walk across this bridge will give you the most spectacular views of the Sydney harbour and Opera House.

A must for any tourist. A walk along the bridge, will give you an absolute perfect view of Sydney Harbour. Walk through the Rocks, so many historical sites/restaurants/shops and pubs to choose from. The walk along the bridge (10-15 minute easy walk) and come to North Sydney/Kirribilli and Milsons Point. My favourite place to have a meal would be with Ripples or Aqua Dining'

5 Star Scary ... You have to try!!!. The harbour bridge is an iconic Sydney attraction. While it's perfectly functional as a bridge, it excels at combining the thrills of a mid city climb with the spectacular views of a harbour city in all it's glory. Prepare yourself, the Harbour Bridge Climb is neither cheap nor for the faint hearted. But if you can rally your pennies and your courage, you will have the experience of a life time. The whole experience lasts about 3 hours ( they dress and prep you before the climb) and is completely safe. You are tethered at all times and apart the walk underneath the deck (that you can see the traffic move beneath) it's more awe inspiring that scary. Actually ... i'm lying. If you're scared of heights ... you're going to love this. If, however, the height is too much ... then try walking across. Start at North Sydney and walk back to the city. The walk is pleasant and the view is lovely. You will end up in the rocks .. .and there you will find pubs. Lots of them. And lets face it ... you deserve a drink. Especially if you've done the climb first !!!
Walk the Free Walk!. Loved being able to take our time on the bridge and take in all the views the weather was perfect for the walk

Harbour bridge climb. Great way to see Sydney harbour. A little pricy and you will need at least 3 hours set aside for the climb but well worth it. If you can do it at the end of the day (sunset) then you will have the best of both - daylight on way up then lights on way back down.

One of the most wonderful things I ever did. During my time I'm Sydney this is one of the many things I did. The bridge climb was fantastic. The climb is a total of about 3 1/2 hours and the guides are great!!! Well worth every penny

BUCKET LIST. If this isn't on your bucket list you should add it right now.Very well organzed bridge climb with safety being paramount.They make sure you understand everthing you need to know before you make the trek up the bridge.I can't say enough about this.... great tour and fantastic photo op!
Sydney Harbour Bridge. Oh wow - you MUST do this Bridge Climb. It is SPECTACULAR!! Safety is taken very seriously and DON'T have a drink before you go - they breathalyse you!!!
fantastic landmark. the harbour bridge is beautiful and for the fit and able you can walk over the top for the less able you can walk along the pavement underneath the views are stunning

Great views from the Bridge. Harbour Bridge and the Opera House really dominate the skyline of central Sydney. Based on a suggestion from friends who live there, we took the train in from the suburb where we stayed and got off on the north side of the Bridge. This allowed us to walk across it and "get up close and personal' (about a 20-30 minute walk). We were able to take some wonderful pictures of the Opera House and Circular Quay area. Our time was somewhat limited so we decided to forego the climb (takes 3-4 hours) and instead go up the Pylon Lookout. It's a couple hundred steps to the top or almost 300 feet. This allows for great pictures of several kilometres of surrounding Sydney (you can't take pictures while doing the Bridge Climb!). There are several stops going up the Pylon that provides a fascinating story of how it was constructed. Whatever you decide to do in the Bridge area, you won't regret it!

At least once in a lifetime. We visited here in January 2012. I have put the date as Dec 2013 as we were not doing trip advisor when we visited Australia. Pity as we have many reviews from our time there. Anyway, I thought we would write this one as it was very special. First of all, the walk itself is over 3 hours long as you walk up one side, then cross over at the top and walk down the other side. The walk starts with a briefing and questionnaire, followed by a breathalyzer test to make sure you are not worse for wear. A very good idea indeed. Then you get undressed and dressed in their boiler suits and all the accoutrements that go with your walk. Even having attachments for your glasses and peak caps so as not to fall off. After this it is into the practice arena for practicing attaching to each other and the safety hand rails. All of this is completed under the watchful eyes of the professional guides who answer all your questions with pride. Once all this is done, then the walk starts along gantries and ladders for quite a time until you reach the base of the bridge. Half way up and at the top, the guide takes photos of you all (approx10 persons are allowed in each party at any one time). All the time the guide is giving you running commentary on the various view points and history that goes with it through the headsets that you all have attached. As I said, this all takes over 3hours but it is so worth it and never forgotten even if one of the best things was that my husband is terrified of heights but still managed to accomplish this epic task. One other thing, and that is that the New Year fireworks are fantastic but everywhere in Sydney goes up in price and to get near the bridge is very very difficult as most of the streets etc are blocked off. Another option and one that we did was to go there for Australia Day 26 January and the Chinese New Year when there are many more firework displays to watch (especially the one in Darling Harbour). There are also many more street parties and parades and it is also a great deal cheaper. Lastly, although the bridge walk is expensive, a lot of this was due to the exchange rate at the time which has actually increased to date but the experience is well worth the trouble.

Amazing bridge!. I am in awe looking at this massive bridge, all steel and you can't help but imagine how they could have possibly built it centuries ago without the modern machines and facilities. Amazing!
Iconic. It is commonly shown in brochures. I did not do the climb, but it is offered. If you take a boat tour you will get a better idea of the size and intricacies.

The Bridge. I took a walk over the bridge you get a amazing view of the city skyline and the harbour, I would say go early as it does get busier during the day. But you can't go to Sydney and do the walk.

You can walk and feel the breath of the city :-). Walk over this iron bridge and feel its ground was shaking under your feet (because of the traffic on it), an interesting feeling. The pathway along was nice, but I hate some "love locks" there.It offered a spectacular view over the harbour, the Sydney Opera House, and if you dare enough, with some fee, you can even climb to the highest point of the bridge (me: no way!).At the end of the walk, we enjoyed a little rest at the park next to the bridge, simply lying on the grass, while still the shaking feeling remain on the feet.

To climb or not to climb ! That was the Q !. The weather unfortunately made up our minds. It was wet and cold and we decided not to pay the very high charge to do the full climb. Bear in mind that doing the full climb will take up almost half a day of your time in SydneyInstead we walked the bridge for free and climbed the Pylon Lookout which in itself provides all the info you will ever need on the history etc of the bridge. The views from the viewing area are spectacular.

Fun and beautiful views. I wasn't thinking I could do it. It's not as hard as I thought it was going to be. So if you are just thinking about it stop and just do it. They stop and talk along the way so it's not that hard. You will have to take off you clothes to but on a jump suit. I didn't know that. They need to make the changing rooms larger. They give you a hat to wear and you get to keep it and they give you a picture to take home. They also make a 8 second video of you at the top if you want and they e-mail it to wherever you want too. That was cool.
Cool view. I could take some nice photos under the bridge and from the boat. Some people are climbing the bridge( have to pay). If you aren't fear of heights, you can do it.

A must do if you go to Sydney. This was our first trip to Sydney so my wife & I decided to undertake this iconic climb. Yes it's not cheap but having done it I know that it is value for money. After going through all the safety equipment & checks we then did the climb, its not easy & some of the ladders are vertical, however it is very safe. When you get to the top you realise that all the hardwork was worth it, the view from the top is outstanding & we have a great picture of the two of us with Sydney opera house in the background. Our guide was fantastic & very humorous which made the climb memorable. If you don't do the climb then you are missing out.

Totally worth it!. One of the best experiences I did whilst in Australia. I would highly recommend it! Yes, it's expensive but the view is simply breath taking and the whole experience is just once in a lifetime. The staff are incredibly helpful and friendly, everything is explained clearly and efficiently. Absolutely amazing views, walk done at sunset and I would 100% do it again and recommend it to anyone.
Great fun but a little pricey. Loved the guide loved the view very safe worth doing but a little over priced I think, if the cut the price in half a lot more people would get to enjoy this fab icon

Iconic, and a good walk!. Up close, the bridge is probably not as beautiful as you would expect but you still need to do a walk across it because it's the Harbour Bridge! Set aside an hour to stroll across the bridge and take a few photos. You can get some nice shots of the Opera House and the Harbour through the barriers. No fee of this however if you're intending to do a climb or a walk up the tower there will be fees. Otherwise a great free attraction!

Not as scary as you would think. My husband did it and the safety system is very good. Not just the rope and harness system but the thorough training before hand. They let you try a few steps set up in the training room. It's steps not a ladder. Very safe .... Staff is superb. People of all ages and physical fitness levels were there doing it.

Bucket list tickoff opportunity?. Climbed the Bridge with my wife as part of our 30th anniversary celebration. Quite pricey for what you get, but it's not as if you'll do it more than the once. Guide was very informative and friendly, and the pace up and down was leisurely enough to have regular stops to take in the views. Did the Sydney Tower walkabout a couple of nights previously, and that's another viewpoint altogether. Would recommend both to anyone looking to do the "tourist" thing in Sydney.

Iconic sight. Definitely an inconic sight in Sydney apart from the Opera House.If it's within your budget, go for the bridge climb for an upclose and personal experience (the packages are overpriced nonetheless) - see http://www.bridgeclimb.com/ for details.Otherwise visiting the Pylon Lookout is a good enogh alternative - see http://www.pylonlookout.com.au/ for details.For a completely FREE experience - walking across Sydney Harbour Bridge is free, and you take the pedestrian walkway on the eastern side of the Sydney Harbour Bridge roadway from The Rocks at the southern end of the bridge to Milsons Point at the northern end. Or start at Milsons Point and cross over the bridge to The Rocks.
Pylon view. Decided to do the pylon climb...$13 very well spent! Beautiful views, nice little museum to brush up on the history of the bridge.

Make sure you do the free walk over the bridge. This is fantastic, I would catch the train to Milson's Point Railway Station. This is one of the firststations to the north of the city. You can then access the Harbour Bridge from the station and walk back over the bridge towards the Opera House and Botanical Gardens. It's a great free tourist attraction, stunning views and very safe. Don't miss it if you are going to Sydney.

Overpriced. Stayed in decent hotel overlooking SHB perhaps effected my bridge climb but for 500 bucks for the 2 of us it was very expensive and in my opinion was worth around 50 bucks, would advise any potential climbers to walk across as the views are almost the same. Compared to a helicopter ride it's very poor

Climbed it, got the T-shirt. Really well organised, safety was obviously at the top of the list. Relaxed easy pace, several stopping points so you can take in the views and commentary through headphones so easy to hear.
Climb the bridge!!. This was a once in a lifetime experience that is well worth the expense. We climbed at night, so the view was unreal.

Our frost time here and it was great . Love it here we came on a cruise tot his place and love the tall building and the bridge was great and like the downtown malls out side it was great to it was greatttttttt

SIMPLY THE BEST. We came to Sydney especially for the climb and it didn't disappoint. I highly recommend it. We did rhe discovery climb and was very lucky that it was just my father and a friend and myself plus the guide in our group so we got to take time.

Pricey but great experience.. Fabulous experience, have planned to do this as part of our Australian experience trip. A bit on the pricey side. Friendly staff who made me feel quite safe (heights make me nervous) - great preparation and information provided before the climb.

Stunning. I loved gazing at the bridge and driving over it! Seeing things from different angles was very enjoyable. Being able to see the Sydney Opera House from a different point of view as well! You can also climb the bridge or bungie jump off of it, when the weather is fair.

An absolute shambles getting a refund! . I know this would have been amazing if we had got to do the walk! We'd waited 14 years to this as last time we had young children with us. However we only got to the first platform due to a severe storm coming in and did come in! We fully understand why it was cancelled. What we don't accept is all the tricks you tried to get out of refunding us the money! We were flying out the next morning! We couldn't re book!! Well give you a credit note!! We live in the uk don't know if well be back!! Well call you then!! Good luck with that were on a plane!! Then they eventually after going round in circles agreed a refund, but couldn't because there card machine didn't work! Then maybe you could email us and well arrange a refund!!Eventually we had a cash refund! Our last evening in Sydney ruined spending nearly 2 hours achieving this!!

Have to do but it'll cost you. I've wanted to walk the top of the bridge since it opened. However, the cost is a lot. The average tour is around $250aus. Saying that if you fear heights you can do this. It's not scary at all and the safety employed by the bridge operation is amazing. Tour guides are really great and friendly. My sister has a fear of heights and she was fine. The view spectacular. If you can stomach the price DO IT. Failing that it's free to walk across the bridge and back. That takes about 30mins. Fairly easy walk. There is some stairs to get to walk way that the elderly May find challenging. But it is doable. And you can take some good shots. For a smaller fee you can climb the pillions. You actually get a free pass when you do the bridge climb. Pillion climb is challenging.

Climbing the SHB. Wow! My wife and I climbed the Sydney Harbour Bridge in October 2014 and even though I balked at the price - it was worth every Australian dollar. It takes at least three hours of your time, but you will appreciate the preparation (emphasis on safety) that they put you through - everything is oriented toward making the entire event memorable and you are not rushed through like a Disney ride. Both my wife and I are over 65 years old and we had no trouble on the climb - so do it!

Climb the bridge!. Excellent adventure (see the little people groups in the photo below)!!! Not as scary as you would think at first. Scariest part (for me) were the ladders from the lower deck to the span (both up and down). But crossing the span is a no-brainer! This one is FOR the feint of heart! Spectacular views of the Opera House, harbor, etc. And it's a very close walk to Lord Nelson's Pub afterwards for a first class beer! The tour is a bit pricy even for Aussie dollars but it is VERY safe and the guides are wonderful. Mitch was fantastic and funtastic!

Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. My daughter (adult) and I did the climb together, as both our husbands have issues. Thought I was in pretty good shape for my age ( 50's) , but boy oh boy!!! Lots of stairs, the tour guide had legs of steel! He did stop periodically to rest and enjoy the view, but even so.......We had perfect weather and a fantastic time. The view is magnificent. Quite expensive, but as it's a one time thing, not that bad. I'm very glad to have been able to go and share this experience with my daughter.I do recommend this for most, but realize it is very physical, so start training!!!

Do the bridge climb.. :). This is a great site to see and you MUST do the bridge climb.. It was amazing and the views across Sydney from the top are breath taking.. Its not too expensive at all either! It was scary at first but your all buckled in so you'll be fine

Sydney Harbour Bridge. I did the Sydney Harbour Bridge climb. It was fantastic. The day was cool and it was windy on the bridge. The preparations for the climb were thorough. It was easier than I expected. The first part was the steepest, going up ladders onto the bridge. The actual climb was gentle and solid. We could not see through at all. It was a great experience. The staff were helpful and went by the ability of the participants. A really good few hours.
The climb option is great.. It's like the Eiffel of Paris, the Sydney Harbour Bridge never fails to amaze me everytime I visit Australia. It's a great place to walk around as well.
Compulsory easy walk.. Best to train to Milsons point then walk back. An easy walk with exceptional views. Not even really an incline at all. A must do while in Sydney

CLIMBING THE BRIDGE. We decided to spend a sunny morning (and a lot of money) climbing the Harbor Bridge in Sydney. What a decision! This is a mostly adrenalinic and panoramic experience! Highly recommended (if don't fear the high, very high point of view).

Bridge Climb your way to Stunning Sydney Harbour Views.. If you ever get the chance to see Superlative Sydney, than your best bet is to see it from high above. Sydney Harbour Bridge is iconic and what a better way to see Sydney than perched high above the traffic of the bridge looking down over the majestic harbour and its foreshore. The climb takes about 2 hours or alternatively you can walk across the bridge from City (east) to North Sydney (North) 30mins. Both will be exhilarating, one more expensive than the other and most notably the climb more memorable than the walk. I highly recommend booking well in advance for Bridge Climb and be sure to choose a day session rather than night as more can be seen from afar.

Loved the Views and the Climb Option. My younger sister did the climb - very wonderful - I wasn't up to the height challenged but loved all the photo ops of the bridge and walking up to the bridge road to see the car and foot traffic cross the magnificent structure.

Nice bridge views. Bridge is nice, not one of the best I have visited. It is very easy to traverse on foot (or jogging). A short distance to walk to here from Circular Quay. There's also an option to climb the bridge or to go to the Pylon and climb the stairs for a good view.

Impressive engineering. You really have to make the effort to walk across the bridge whilst in Sydney. Relatively easy walk, and gives the opportunity to appreciate the engineering and see the bridge from both sides of the harbour.

WOW!. Did the walk last christmas with my cousins, it was a gift for my visit to SydneyOK, in the begining the thought of going up there was too scary as i am afraid of heights, but when we reached their office, they gave us info and special equipment/clothes to use. OK, you go TOO high but there is nothing to be afraid of, they tie you with a one-way wire and you can't go anywhere, although it seems too small the path you follow is very good, especially when you walk on the arch...we had the luck to walk at night, last group, so we could see Syd by night...the view was MAGNIFICENT. for sure, everyone visiting Syd should do it!!!!

Great view!. There's a great view from the bridge, it's a fairly easy walk, and it's free to walk across. What more could you want? It costs money to go into the observation tower, but you don't need to do that to have an enjoyable time checking out the harbor from up high.

marvelous. it is a nature world wonder how this magnificent bridge was constructed in an era with very little automatic, one things of how hard it would have been for those that toiled day after day during construction, and the immense satisfaction that would have occurred upon completion, these are the founders of our great country

A must do. We booked the climb long before we left the UK. When we arrived ready for the climb we were so impressed by the friendliness of the staff. Our guide, Albert, kitted us out and then took us through the ladder trading session. We then set off on the climb. Once we climbed up onto the bridge proper, it was an unmissable experience. The climb was very gradual with a stop very 20 metres or so while Albert gave us information coupled with humour. The views at the top are unbelievable. The journey back down was just as enjoyable and it was such a shame when it was all over. I would recommend the climb to everyone visiting Sydney.
Lovely to look at. A must see in Sydney! Everytime I visit Sydney I come to see it. You should also walk over it or get a picture from the Opera House.
Stunning!. Likes: the sheer presence of the Bridge in the harbour.Dislikes: so expensive to climb it and the queues are legendary.

You have got to climb it. we booked online before our trip, that was the easy part, when we arrived in Sydney a few days before our climb we wondered if we had made the right decision. Our hotel the four seasons an excellent hotel by the way overlooked the bridge and we thought about our booked clime every time we looked at the bridge. On the day of our climb we arrived and got prepared, the staff are very professional and dedicated to your safety, the briefing and getting kitted up take just over an hour, they are very safety conscious with the gear you put on and even do a trial ladder climb to ensure you are comfortable. You are secured to a safety line before you leave the centre and this continues until your back at this point on your return. Once you are out from under the bridge structure and clime the near vertical ladders through the bridge deck up onto the main span, this in my view is the most difficult part it is easy the rest of the way to the top of the bridge. You stop a couple of times for photos and admire the many views of the harbour and city then in no time you are at the top. When you cross over at the top to descend down the other side it can be a bit unnerving looking down to the traffic below. Overall it's a very well organised tour and worth doing if you have travelled a long way to Sydney and a once in a life time trip.

Didn't think I could do it!. Get to climb area well before you are scheduled to go. It's at the westerly side of Circular Quay. There is a lot of procedural stuff to do before you are fully suited up to climb. Guides are well informed and able to share many facts regarding bridge. Don't be afraid to try it.

worth the climb. climbed the Sydney tower bridge, it looks and seems very scary but you are well clamped to the railing and it is very safe and adventurous. I saw elderly people also enjoying every bit of it.. well worth the price. mid way your picture is taken which you get at the end of the climb..must do..
Bridge Walk. My wife intended to do the bridge climb but when she seen the actual height , she chickened out .We walked the bridge path and the sights were awesome , what a lovely walk

Expensive but worth it. Even if you are Australian it is a must do!!!, travelers you cant go to Sydney and not do this!!!
