Go at sunset is also a must do!! however unless u like the cold go in the warmer months... Even for those who are afraid of heights its a must and not that scary as the stairs are so wide you cant really see down on the way up the arch..also you couldn't jump off it you tried....safety is insane!!(that must be what you pay for) Also ladies don't rely on bobbie pins to tie your hair up..there not aloud...:/

Bridge Climb. My wife and I did the bridge climb during our stay in Sydney.I had very high expectations as everyone I had spoken to said it was a must see attraction.Maybe I had unrealistic expectations.I thought it was ok, expensive for what we did.I am a adrenaline junkie and thought the bridge would give you a thrill.It's very safe, my wife wasn't keen on the initial idea of completing the climb but managed no problem at all.The climb with safety briefing takes 3 1/2 hours, I should have done the express climb.It's one of those that you kind of have to do when in Sydney.Amazing views, no picture opportunities unless you buy the over priced photos at $15 each.I wouldn't do it again. If you are pushed for time or watching the pennies you could easily miss this one out.
Amazing view from the bridge. A must watch in Sydney; trip to Sydney ca not be completed without seeing this bridge; general walk to the bridge takes only 20-25 min from Circular Quay (one way)

Bridge Climb. We did the express climb and yes it's expensive but worth doing. Very helpful, professional staff and extremely well organised. Only complaint is what they charge for photos. If you don't buy them you have no memories really as nothing can be taken up with you. Really ripped off with the photos but what can you do?

Bridge Climb worth every bit!. If you're not afraid of heights, this climb is relatively easy and with spectacular views. They equip you with a "onesy", headphones, jacket, cap, gloves and you are connected to the bridge at every step. The hardest part is four ladder climbs to get to the arch, but the arch is easy to walk. And the whole way you get to see the harbor! We happened to end our climb just as the sun was setting and we could "hear the sizzle" as it dipped into the water. What a memory I'll have for the rest of my life!

Beautiful Views. Riding over the Sydney Harbour Bridge on a bicycle was one of the highlights of our trip to Sydney. The views of, from, and around the bridge are spectacular. You can walk across the bridge on one side, or bike across the bridge from the other. There are also opportunities to actually climb the bridge, which we did not do this trip but would definitely consider for future trips.

Breathtaking views. It's a beautiful walk going across the bridge. No trip to Sydney is complete without it. With the Sydney Opera House close by and the stunning water views, it's a memory that you'll keep for a very long time.

A Lovely stroll even if you don't climb on top. We walked across the bridge on the main walkway, on the same level as the automobiles but safely behind a barrier. The views were quite lovely.There's also the opportunity of walking across the very top of the bridge. Even though one is tied in, it's very high and quite narrow. We decided that our fear of heights would be too great; plus, it's quite expensive to take the special stroll (even if you get a T shirt to commemorate the trip).

An Achievement. Take the climb to the top of Sydney Harbour Bridge and feel you have achieved something. The only drawback is that you cannot take any loose objects, including cameras, so you will have to rely on the official photos for your memories. But definitely worth while.

Breath Taking Views!!. Yes the price is expensive $310pp but sometimes you need to take the plunge as you can't put a price on the amazing memorises you'll have. we did the climb for the twilight, and we saw the beautiful city transform. it was amazing to see a lovely sunset and the city light up bit by bit. We were up on the bridge for 3+ hours leant some history of the Bridge and city. MUST do if visiting this magnificent city!!!

A must go in Sydney!. The best time to view the bridge is around evening, so you can have the chance to enjoy the view on daytime, sunset in the evening (the sunset view is outstanding ,must not miss) and the night view. There are cafés along the harbour and best to sit down, order your favourite coffee or tea, or even meal and dine, enjoy the view while eating. You can spend to climb up the bridge if you like, but you also can climb out the pylon lookout (just 13 dollar) to go up there and you can see the entire city of Sydney.

Awesome to see , a must to visit.. Brilliant to see for sure. Was really magnificent and something not to be missed if visiting Sydney. One of the tours is great as you learn quote a bit of history etc.

Expensive but worth it, not for those scared of heights..... This is an expensive trip but well worth it. It's completely safe and full protection is given including some really fetching grey overalls.Some fantastic views, very iconic, a must do for anyone visiting Sydney.

For a bridge lover this is my favourite. Sydney, Sydney, Sydney..!
I love this city. I love this bridge.
Climb it if your budget allows, and if not, go up into the pylon tower museum. You will get STUNNING sunset photos from the top of the pylon lookout tower.

Worth the effort!. After surviving 7 knee surgeries I wasn't sure if a I could make the climb and had my doubts. After the urging of my son and daughter in law I decided to give it a go. WOW! So happy I did. The views were spectacular as one can imagine, great guides, non threatening environment as much as possible but a tad pricey. The sharing of an adventure with my wife and son....PRICELESS!
Awesome Twilight Bridge Climb!. This is a must if you are in Sydney. I would definitely recommend doing the twilight bridge climb.. the views of the city at night were awesome.
Good Views. Great views of the harbour - obscured by the heavy and obviously necessary guardrails. Worth a walk across to view the city from a new angle.
Bridge Climb is Incredible. The bridge climb is amazing, my wife and I are not great with heights but this blew us away, the twilight climb was incredible seeing the city change from day to night.

bridge climb. The bridge climb was a fantastic experience, well organised and any health problems taken care of with sympathy . Elizabeth our climb leader was very informative and entertaining at her job. You definitely need a head for heights not for the nervous type. A must do in Sydney.

Do the Climb - Even if You're AUSSIE!. Harbour Bridge Climb is well worth the cheap fee. Being Australian, and having already visited other icons and been under-whelmed or a little bored, so excited after doing the climb (it isn't a climb - it is very large sturdy wide stairs with safety lines connected at all times)... MUST DO FOR ALL VISITORS TO SYDNEY - GOTTA DO IT AT LEAST ONCE!

The Brooklyn Bridge of Sydney. It is the crown in the city of Sydney and for two hundred dollars they do have climbs up the outer part of the bridge. I went over it a few times in a van the best way to go and it was free.

Amazing and exhilarating!. The climb was brilliantly organised with military precision, giving me a 1st time frightened climber the confidence of safety and security! Our guide was confident, knowledgable and humorous, which made the climb well worth doing! The views were simply stunning and well worth the walk. As explained in the briefings the 1st part of the climb was a I had some little nerves, but once on the outer arch of the bridge the metal was safe sturdy and in no way did we feel like we might blow off!! All credit to the team that run the operation! Amazing!!

On top of the world. The climb was a birthday present to me from our two daughters and my husband, so the four of us climbed together at twilight. That was brilliant as we started during daylight and returned during darkness with all the lights of the city glowing. We were also lucky enough to have a P&O cruise liner pass under the bridge when we were almost 2/3 of the way up. The climb was easy, and the safety equipment and care is second to none, plus everyone that we met who were working there were so friendly and kind. We had a guide who has worked there since the beginning (Guy) and he was fantastic and full of so much information. The guides take photos of each group within their group at several points on the bridge, plus you receive one of the entire group that is included in the cost of the climb. You are able to purchase a USB stick with 10 photos of yourselves on it, plus 4 generic photos thrown in, which were a pleasant surprise. I really cannot recommend it highly enough. Yes, it is expensive but it is such a once in a lifetime experience that it is worth the money - we couldn't stop talking about it afterwards, so go for it!

Harbour bridge twilight climb. This is expensive but very nice to do. The view from the bridge is amazing and the twilight climb gives you a bit extra like a sunset and you see the city light coming up.If you don't want to spend the money you can also go into the museum in the tower for $15 and get "almost" the same nice view

FUN EXPERIENCE. The Harbor Bridge climb is really something special to do. We did a mid-morning climb (9:30AM) and it was perfect, both weather and experience. There are two option the regular and the express. If you want or need a slow pace the regular is your best choice. It takes three plus hours and the pace is easy. We are avid hikers and for us it was not enough exercise. On the other hand if this is your first climb I would recommend this option because the commentary the guide provided was interesting and informative and he was also quite funny. I imagine the express climb is for second timers or those who do want the exercise.Just a few more thoughts. I don't like heights but I never felt uncomfortable in the slightest way. The operators take a lot of care to insure your safety. The gear is top rate and clean. You actually have to change out of your clothes and into a bridge jump suit. You are very close to the oldest part of Sydney, take the time after the climb for lunch at the Hero of Waterloo (cool pub).

Get your climbing shoes on!. Although expensive, the bridge climb proved incredible. We took the nighttime climb, which gave us a view of Sydney's lights from above. For anybody in decent shape, the climb is doable.

bridge climb offers amazing views. figured if we came all the way to sydney, we should go all the way and do the sydney harbour bridge climb. although expensive for us americans, it was still a great experience! the tour takes ~3 hours from start to finish and the entire process was very well streamlined. our tour guide was fantastic... keeping it entertaining and educating throughout the tour. during the bridge climb, you are rewarded with beautiful views of the harbour you can ONLY get on the bridge climb. unfortunately, they don't let you bring your cell phones/cameras, but they'll take pictures of you... and sell it to you for a price. you'd figure for the price, they'd throw in a picture for you but i digress.it was only our 2nd day in australia, so we didn't realize how quickly the weather changes. we made reservations for our 4th day (because it was supposed to be sunny), but we happened to be near the area and decided to call an audible and try to go out while it was sunny... we were SO lucky!! we completed our tour right before the rain set in, and the 4th day was rainy all day. so do yourself a favor, and seize the opportunity when it strikes!!
Great view. Expensive but once you reach top span and view harbor and opera house you really realize it was worth the entrance feeI am afraid of heights and guides made me totally feel at easeA must

super climb. Did the bridge climb which took about 3 hours, The climb was fantastic as the sun was out the views are outstanding as you walk up one side, across the top and back down the other side. The guide was great fun with great fact about the history. It is expensive but if spending the money to fly to Oz, then it is worth it as once in a lifetime.

Sydney Harbor Bridge, but not the bridge tour. We took the On Off bus to the base f the bridge and followed the asphalt path and steps up to the road. We did not take the bridge you, but walked out on the bridge to the hallway point. The bridge is high so ocean-going ships can pass under it and the views are spectacular. You get to see as much as they do on the bridge tour, but without the drama. You can also take pictures - I understand that cameras aren't allowed on the tour since they could be dropped on the traffic below.
One to tick off the list of life. Where else in the world can you climb a public bridge legally!Did the express climb which was perfect = check sunset times to plan your climb perfectly.
our coat hanger. What can you say about one of our most incredible icons. We are all so proud of our Harbour Bridge and I never stop marvelling at the beauty and architecture every time I am near it
amazing. The bridge was amazing,did not do any of the paid tours,but walked under the bridge an got amazing photos and walked on the bridge to the other side great views

The awesome climb. The Sydney harbour bridge climb was a fantastic experience that everyone should do. The whole experience was very organised and well set up from beginning to end. The staff were very friendly and supportive of the whole group. The views were breathtaking a must do for all ages and abilities Just Awesome

The Bridge. The harbour bridge is my fave thing about Sydney! It's incrediable to look at it and the walk across is a must! You can see across Sydney and the view is beautiful! You can even out a padlock on the bridge so a part of you will always be in Sydney!

An amazing structure. There is something surreal about the Sydney Harbour Bridge. It is like two big arms holding the land together. At the same time, it is old and it is new and it is constantly changing persona, according to the light and mood of the sky. Love it!

The Sydney Harbor Bridge Climb. Had the best time Tom our guide was fantastic spaced out the stops during the climb perfectlyand was very knowledgeable. All staff were polite and friendly which adds to the experience. Had a great sense of achievement at the end for someone who is a bit of a chicken. I did it, will be talking about this experience for years to come and have purchased the poster to brag and show family and friends. A must do in Sydney

Climbed the bridge. Always a beautiful bridge to have in your photos but the chance to climb it was amazing. I only got scared on 1 part, other than that just amazing. We went at sunset which was even more amazing!!

A sight to be seen. You can't ignore the presence of the Sydney Harbour Bridge, it is amazing! It hovers above the harbour and simply provides the most wonderful photo opportunities.I've never climbed the bridge myself, but I'd say that would have to be a fabulous experience, I'll be sure to do it one day.

Must do it. We did the discovery tour which goes up on the middle arch, then up and across the top before coming back down. I am told that this one won't be available anymore soon, and I would highly recommend it if you can. Tour staff were lovely and made it all feel very easy and safe. I am not that happy about heights usually, but apart from some minor apprehension at times I got through it ok. Give it a go its a great experience

Good views of the city/harbor. Worth the time to walk out on the bridge and scale one of the towers. I opted to do this instead of walking the bridge support cables since cameras were not allowed on the cables. You are able to get almost just as high, use your camera, and it's much cheaper.

Great walk!. We took the ferry to Lunar Park and walked up the hill to the pedestrian stairs leading up to the bridge (about a 10 minute walk). We then strolled over to the other side, which took about 30 minutes. This is a much cheaper option than doing the commercial bridge walk.

Harbour Bridge. the Sydney Harbour Bridge was opened in 1932 and since then as become an icon.Visit the Pylon Lookout and Museum,accessible via pedestrian pathway on eastern side of the bridge to learn more about this bridge.

need to walk across it. Besides taking a ferry ride or viewing it from a distance, if you have time, a walk across the Sydney Harbour Bridge is a must while visiting Sydney. Ride the City Rail to Milson's Point in time for the sunset. It was around 5p.m when we visited early July as it was winter there. It is a good time to experience the sunset and changing colors over the Sydney Opera House as well as Sydney Harbour. Great views from there of the left side of the Opera Theatre wing and right side of the Concert Hall. Allow about 1/2 hour to walk across as taking photos make occupy some additional time. It is free admission and you make walk at your own pace with the company of many others as well as bicyclists. If you start from Milson's Point, you will end up in the Rocks area of Sydney. A great walk to enjoy the skyline of Sydney as well. Must do.

1st Bridge walk. What an awesome experience. My daughter is scared of heights but once there and right up top she loved it. Not as hard a climb as I thought. Guide was excellent and there was no rushing our group to hurry up. would go again.
Take the Bridge Climb. The bridge climb was fun and well worth it. We did the twilight climb and thoroughly enjoyed it. Don't miss out!

Still a grand structure today!. One day I would love to climb to the top with the group. Was deterred due to the cost and weather! I believe the view of the Sydney Harbor would be breathless, just not for those who have issues with height!

The Bridge. The Sydney Habour Bridge is such an icon. It joins the city with the north side in such a visual way.Then there is the Bridge Climb a must for everyone. The climb is easy and wonderful . The 360 degree look of Sydney is amazing. The twilight climb is the best of both day then sunset really spectacular .

Worth the 22 hour flight. Spending 22 hours in the air is incredibly hard but to see the Harbour Bridge in all it's glory, is worth every painstaking minute on that plane. Don't spend the money to climb the stairs to get a little higher up for pics. Just walk across it and stop and enjoy the views and get your photos from there. What an experience!

Pleasant walk with a great view. Walked with the family across the bridge which was only a few minutes from our hotel. It took about half an hour and aside from the lack of shade for the reasonably sunny day that it was, it's a really nice walk with great views of the harbour and the Opera House of course. Quite doable for young and old alike.
fantasic and Grand specially at night. It is beautiful when it is let at night with surrounding area and the Barbour including the opera house and building and the lights of the boats in the harbour

Tips from a local. walkers - use the pathway on the eastern side of the bridge for the best views. Photographers - a shot taken from the park on the North Western side will give you an excellent shot of the bridge itself AND the opera house and harbour beyond. Don't ignore the underside of the bridge also as the steel work etc is quite spectacular. The best general view though is standing in front of the opera house looking west. Do the bridge climb if you can, you won't regret it I promise you or you can't climb to the top of the south east pylon which is almost as good (and free!!). Finally check out the view of the bridge and the north side of the harbour from the rotunda on Observatory Hill.

Easy to navigate- one of the only free things to do. Didn't want to part with the $200 pp climb of the bridge so I just walked across it. Great pedestrian path. Wonderful views of the harbor and the Opera House. If you want to get a perspective from the top of the bridge without having to fork over big bucks, the is an elevator that will take you to the top for $13.

Wow!. Well, I am a (newish) pensioner and if I can manage this - so can you! The hard bit is at the beginning with 4 pretty vertical ladders of 25 steps each to climb, and then you are on the bridge. Once there, having got over the shock, it's is incredibly easy to climb. Groups go slowly & the leader gives a brilliant running commentary over headphones. The views are absolutely stunning and the pictures taken are brilliant (I rarely buy them, but these were a must). Safety is a priority and the briefing is first class.Do have a go; you'll regret it if you don't. I had a great time, despite a lot of rain when half way up
Mesmerizing view. Another example of amazing and marvellous architecture.It is just mesmerizing whether you pass under it by a boat or on it by a car/cab.Try it once and you will never forget it.
AMAZING!!. All I have to say everything about it was brilliant.Don't miss out.Tour guides are brilliant and the whole experience.

Twilight Climb - WOW. This activity is very well organized with safety as the priority. Our guide was humorous and attentive to ensure we had the best experience, great pictures and learned the history of the bridge. The view was unbelievable. It was a bit freaky at the top and coming down with the train rushing by as well as looking down at all the vehicle traffic. Not for anyone with fear of heights!

A must look at and walk on.. See the bridge from the city then walk across it to the other side of the harbour and look back with the city in the background- what a spectacular sight on a nice sunny day, The whole setting of the bridge, harbour and Opera is unique.

BridgeClimb was AWESOME SAUCE. We lucked out on our tour where we got some of the sunset and the night time climb. It had been raining on and off and amazingly enough it wasn't raining a drop when we started the climb.The intro and safety parts were great so we really knew what we were getting into. Our guide had some great tidbits and stories that made the tour very enjoyable. Got some great pictures from the top & even made a fun short video to post to facebook. Also got a great cruise boat in our view so the night view was perfect. Highly recommended and perfect way to end our Australia trip.

Bridge Climb. The view of the Bridge and Opera house from the Quay is wonderful. Its a nice walk from the Quay up through the rocks and under the bridge. Its a must that you climb the bridge. The view is splendid, the climb is not difficult if you can do lots of stairs. It is not inexpensive, but well worth it.
A great walk. If you get the opportunity take a stroll across the harbour bridge... fantastic views and an easy walk
Awesome views!. The best way to see it besides from the Opera House, is to walk on the bridge or climb it, both highly recommended.
Sky high fun. Amazing experience, do it! This is a highlight in Sydney, true Australian story of spirit, determination and an engineering feat!
the climb. The bridge climb is a must whatever age you are, such wonderful sights from up there, so safe and have the photo is a must.

Record breaker. I was part of the Rotary International group who had the honor to be part of the record breaking Bridge climb in June this year. We managed to break the record for the largest single group of people on the Bridge at the same time - brill -, our second record breaking thing was that we held more flags of the world than any other group has done. The whole experience was well organized from start to finish. We were well briefed, kitted up and ready to go. Our group guide was brilliant, she kept us well informed of all the information about the Bridge. You don't get to take your camera, bit of a bummer, as you are encouraged to buy the photo's at the end.If you are going down under and would like to do the Bridge tour, it's a bit expensive, but worth it. You're not going to do this again.

CLIMB THE BRIDGE. Being scared of heights was against me to climb, although I'd secretly wished I'd do it one day. My husband had bought tickets for us to climb for my birthday as a surprise, he didn't tell me we were doing it and when we rocked up there I was a bit scared. Our guide that we had was absolutely amazing, talking to me the entire time - he was even walking backwards talking to me in the places where he knew of people struggling. I reached the top and cried - I was so happy to make it up there, the view from the top was SPECTACULAR. I highly recommend this to anyone.

Great Landmark, Do the Climb. My only regret is I didn't do the climb to the top. Take the tour and your get to climb to the top of the bridge from the outside. People said it was an amazing experience. Must do next time I'm in Sydney.

Brilliant bridge climb!. We completed the bridge climb in Sydney and this was one of the highlights of our trip to Australia. The exhibition adjacent to the reception area is very interesting and gives an insight into how the bridge was designed and built. The climb itself is very well organised and the staff who run the tours are informative and approachable, with a positive, friendly attitude.The views we had from the top of the bridge were spectacular, and the weather on the day was perfect; so good we could see the Blue Mountains in the distance!

What a thrill -- The Sydney Harbor Bridge Climb. We decided to do the Sydney Harbor Bridge Climb --- never in a million years did I imagine that I would be on top of this iconic landmark. And what a thrill it was. Our guide Darren was absolutely fantastic. He gave us a lot of fun facts about the bridge on our climb to the top. The tour takes about 3.5 hours -- my only concern was not being able to use the bathroom --- but lucky for me I did limit my beverage intake the day of the climb. You tour with groups of 12 with people from all over the world -- you actually become a little team. The views are spectacular. I don't think I would recommend this tour with those who fear heights --- but you certainly do feel secure and safe on this tour. Loved every minute and well worth the $228 USD fee per person. Would do it again in a heartbeat. The tour is very well organized and this operation makes safety a priority.

BridgeClimb is extremely overpriced, but still great. We did the BridgeClimb over the Harbour Bridge and while it is very steeply overpriced, about 310 AUD or so (when you get your photos afterwards, because you can't take cameras up there), it is definitely "a walk to remember".Of course, everything you see from the top of the bridge, you will see from the Pylon Lookout as well. And that is just around 13 AUD... It is unfortunate that BridgeClimb has overpriced the walk but there is no denying it is very well organised and planned.

Amazing views. Climbing the Harbour Bridge was brilliant. We went up on the twilight climb, which meant we set off in daylight, then watched the sun go down over the Blue Mountains & then came down in the dark, seeing Sydney lit up below us. Well worth it. Our guide was really knowledgeable & very friendly.

If you want to take a walk. Lovely to look at a thrill to walk ( so I heard ) the view was enough for me had a fantastic view from my hotel room ( Holiday Inn Potts Point) yes I also got a zillion pictures.

Exceeded all our expectations!. The bridge climb is without a doubt the best thing to do in Sydney. We saved this until last and were so glad we did.The experience lasts a good three and half hours. Forty five minutes of that is orientation and preparation before hooking on and beginning the climb.Our tour guide (Scott) was extremely knowledgeable, enthusiastic and helpful. From the ground the climb looks quite steep. However it is a very easy climb even for those of us that are out if shape. There are plenty of stops and water breaks so no need to worry.We opted for the ten photo package. You also get a free group shot and eight second video clip in with the climb.Do this if you're in Sydney, you won't regret it.

A wonderful experience for all aspects. There are many wonderful ways to enjoy and marvel at this Sydney landmark:1) have a sip of great wine at Circular Quay area and watch the bridge during sun rise, sun set, and bridge climbers2) take on the expansive views on top deck of the ferry boats from any of the Circular Quay docks3) Be one of the adventureous ones who try out the bridge climb - your truly also tried this one during one of the "Engineering knowledge climb" which went through many engineering details in desciptions and in reality, then ending up on the top of the bridge for its amazinf view of the harbour and the cityscape4) climb on to one of the side of the bridge via the "Rock" neighbourhood, enjoy another view of the bridgeHighly recommend and a must for anyone visiting Sydney - it is for all ages and all kinds of visitors.

Family hoilday with teenage kids. We spent 8 days in sydney as one of the best was the three teenage kids climbing the sydney harbour bridge you need to pre book but well worth the money spent . They go over all saftey aspects so this takes an hour befire you actually climb the bridge

Worth the walk. Definitely worth the walk over the bridge and if you stomach the bridge climb tour, even better. Lots of history displayed on the bridge itself. Views, as you would expect, are amazing. Just walking over the road/rail bridge is free but the bridge climb to the top is payable.
Have a go. It's an impressive structure but if you really want to appreciate it, do the climb. It's safe, fun and spectacular when you get to the top. Worth the cash ;-)
go for a walk. Walking over Sydney Harbour Bridge was excellent I was not aware that you could walk over the bridge, and it was difficult to find initially.

Harbour Bridge Climb. Sensational, highly recommend this. Staff are wonderful. This is a life long experience. You are breathalized prior so be careful if you have been out to lunch. Only a few places are a bit scarey where you have to change over ladders, but generally not difficult. Have done this climb 2 times now, we loved it so much.
Wonderful views . We went on the Sydney harbour bridge climb it was a wonderful day and gorges views and our tour guide was very informative a bit expensive but the views where wonderful

Go on the bridge walk - too expensive but a great experience. I lived for ten years looking across the water from the Harbour Bridge but, after many years back in the UK, started to visit Sydney again. A lot of things have changed .. not all for the better ... but the Harbour Bridge is everything you want in a bridge and walking across the top of it is the icing on the cake. It's jaw droppingly expensive but a once in a lifetime experience. I'm not brilliant at heights but there is nothing to fear - safety is very well catered for. Most disappointing aspect is that cameras are forbidden and the official photos are pretty hopeless .. so photographic memories are in short supply.

Iconic bridge. This is probably the most iconic bridge in the world and is a must to see and walk across, it also looks great from the Manley ferry. For the strong hearted, and certainly not for people worried about heights there are guided tours across the pylons. We walked one way and ran back on the return journey, amazing how much can be seen across the harbour.
It's a bridge. What can I say - it's a bridge. My husband is an engineer so he was quite excited about it but once you've seen it - well I guess you've seen it. Definitely worth a one time look

Walked the bridge for free. After a sensational lunch in the Rocks, found the entrance to the Sydney Harbour bridge free walk (walk track runs along the full length of the East side) and two couples and 5 kids (10 yo - 7 yo) enjoyed a wonderful walk, magnificent views of the Opera House, photo op's, and a kick of the footy at Milsom Point park on the other side. Short ferry ride back to Circular Quay, ripping afternoon.
Walk it - the free way. Take a stroll over the bridge. Marvel at the view and take a ferry home to town from down by Luna Park.It is a lovely walk.

must see. When in Sydney you must walk across the harbor bridge and eat on the other side and make the return trip to marvel at the opera house from the mid span. The bridge climb is well worth it as well.
Great. Great guide. So glade I did it amazing view from the topDid it at night so I saw Australia at night.

Sydney Harbor Bridge Climb. This was well worth the time and cost to participate. We enjoyed the spectacular views from the bridge of the harbor. We anticipated the climb to be strenuous, but it was not and did not include steep steps or major inclines. If I can do it anyone can do it.

Easy walk with great views. I walked across the Harbour Bridge early one morning for some exercise - about 5:30am. Access to the cycleway and walking access is clearly marked from The Rocks. There were security guards at intervals across the bridge and plenty of opportunities to take pictures of the bridge, pylons, harbour and Opera House. I recommend being on the bridge by 5:45am for some amazing photo opportunities of the sun rise over the Opera House.

Walk across for free and enjoy the spectacular views.. Walk across this massive bridge and see the Harbour and the city from this most amazing vantage point. Catch the train to Circular Quay for closest train station to the bridge. If you have a Seniors Card from anywhere you can get a ticket for $2.50 at newsagents which will take you on trains, ferries and buses for 24 hours from time of first use. Such good value! Walk across the bridge for free and then take a ride on a ferry around the Harbour.

Everyone photographs it and you can understand why!. Undoubtedly there would not be a single tourist that has visited Sydney who has not taken a photo of the world reknown, Harbour Bridge. This being the case, as a tourist in Sydney I thought I would take my share. The bridge dominates the Sydney landscape to such an extent that it is almost impossible to ignore it. From the moment we approached Sydney from the air, the bridge appeared as a striking feature. From ground/water level, it's dimensions are awesome. Walking under it and driving over it, you can't help but be impressed with the engineering that went into the construction. From the vantage point of the rooftop terrace of the Rocks YHA, we were able to observe numerous groups make the intrepid journey up the main span of the bridge, to stand below the massive flags that flutter from the highest mid-point of the bridge. On this visit, watching was the bravest we got, but a 'walk' is on the bucket list for the future.

Most beautiful views of the harbor. The walk on the bridge is free -- something that is hard to come by in Australia where there is a fee for almost everything! The views were gorgeous and it's an easy walk. We only went half way across because we were pressed for time. You walk through Red Rocks on the way which is an added bonus. Go in the evening when the sun is low, and you will get some beautiful photos of the Opera House!

Amazing Views of the Harbour. Safety is of the utmost importance to the staff at the Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. It's a bit of a steep hike so make sure you're in good physical shape! You really can't beat the 360 degree views from the top of the bridge; just incredible.

Worth to do it!. awesome view at the top of the bridge, the guide was patient to tell us the story. he must be repeated the story for hundred times, but admirer his passion towards this beautiful city!

A Sydney Highlight. Strictly for the fit and intrepid, the bridge climb was easily tied with Bondi Beach as my favorite destinations. The bridge climb comes with comprehensive training from experts to keep you safe, very safe. Have your photo taken at the top to amaze friends and family. You will earn your stripes!

WOW!. I felt a little nervous beforehand, and getting geared up was taken very seriously but the climb itself was a great experience. The guide was super, kept us all entertained and well informed. The views were breath-taking, we did our tour at twilight, the sun was shining when we set off, then we went through sunset, dusk and darkness so saw these stunning views in all lights, the sunset was romantic and the darkness was quite enchanting with all the bright colours of lighting over the city. This was a once in a lifetime experience and I'm so glad we were able to do it

Darling Harbour. It was amazing and beautiful scenic. So clean and well maintained..I enjoyed the Captain Cook Cruises. Worth the money. My trip with my husband was incredible and m husband had a surprise on the lunch in the Cruise. We felt so much of loves and we really enjoyed the food on board.
The best climb. Very well done,great knowledge from our guide ,plus a great personality ,plus safety was excellent, felt really relaxed

Average experience. maybe the climb would be more exciting but the trip we did around the harbour to view the bridge and the opera house was average its just not that exciting maybe best to climb it or to just see it on the way to somewhere on the ferry nice to see but not very exciting!!!
What an icon.. It.s free to walk across it to have a marvellous view of the City. Costly to climb over. Amazing design since it was built so long ago.
Best views I've ever seen. Climbing up to the pylon was the best decision I could've taken. Those $13 were worh it, those 360° views of Sydney are just breathtaking
Must visit. Best view from there ferry.. This is another icon of Sydney. I find the best view is from the ferry to Manly or Watson's Bay. Get your camera ready!

Great view. If you do the bridge climb, make sure it is a nice day. Although we went on a cold winters day, the view was fantastic, The cold made it slightly unpleasant but once you pushed the cold aside it was a great experience.

Above us only Sky. Big day today. We finally get to see if we are afraid of heights.Many months ago, while we where still at the planning stage, I put today's activity at the top of my list. It's finally here.Today, we climb the bridge. Believe it or not, we set out nice and early for a change and arrived at the location in time for the 9.00am climb. We were given a breathalyser test and asked to complete health and safety forms. Once these had been completed we were given our jumpsuits (not a good choice of words considering the heights we would be scaling today) and hats.We were then given utility belts that housed our harnesses and radios. When we were done, we looked like members of a comedy swat team. We had a practice climb on a set of steps and ladders and then we were off.All around us were photos of the numerous celebrities that had made the climb before us.Robert De Niro, Matt Damon, Will Smith, Will Ferrell and even Harry Potter who apparently chose to climb and pay the £120, even though he could have flown up on his Nimbus 3000.The climb took us through narrow timber walkways with cars passing us over head.Below us the water glimmered in the early morning sun and a train road to our right as it shook the bridge. The ascent took approximately 2 hours and the views from the top were well worth the effort. The massive natural harbour stretched out in every direction. We arrived at the top just in time to observe a minutes silence directly beneath the half mast flags at the summit of the bridge. We had climbed the bridge and reached it's pinnacle at 11 minutes past 11 on the 11th of the 11th. It was an eerie moment as we stood in silence at what felt like the top of the world.We posed for some photographs (such a shame that you couldn't take up your own camera), before finally setting off back down. The trip down is a little trickier as you are walking above the cars and trains and can be a little unsettling. Annette did prefer the trip up to the one back down and her legs began to shake.She was informed that it was due to a build up of lactic acid at the back of her legs and the only known cure was to have two ice cold beers (one for each leg) on her arrival back down. At least we know we are not scared of heights.

A surprise find of a view from the North Side. It was a Surprise find when I drop in to have a drink and dinner at the Kirribilli Club.This view of the LUNA Park and the Ship sailing pass were an amazing experience.Worth dropping to have Dinner, Drinks or Coffee and soak in the Sydney Harbour Bridge night View.The Water View Grill restaurant has a good range of selections.

Cold evening climb. I was a bit concerned that is was cold and rainy the day we were to climb. It didn't rain on us but it was cold and windy. We were outfitted with plenty of warm gear and the walk was fantastic.

The coathanger. Yep this is what it is called by locals. Sydney Bridge is almost as famous as the opera house and defines Sydney Harbor. One of the most photographed icons in the world. Believe me you cannot miss seeing it from many different angles.

Fantastic twilight views over an approaching thunder cloud. Took the twilight package which is a little cheaper!! The instructor had the right mix of humour and factual information to ease the nerves as we started climbing.Unfortunately we didn't climb too far before we had to descend again due to a thunder cloud edging its way closer (although it was very pretty in pink with the sun setting)I did get a full refund as I was returning home the next day

Fantastic experience. Appart from the ladders at start abd end, the climb was not steep. The pace makes it comfortable even for we the not so fit!! Getting to the top and seeing the views was worth it. Our guide Graham was both entertaining and informative. Great experience

Sometimes, less is more. We decided against the bridge walk, which we thought was hideously expensive, and instead opted for the Pylon Lookout at a fraction of the price. This attraction is excellent value for money! If you have any concerns at all about your physical ability to manage the bridge walk, the Pylon Lookout could be a great alternative as the stairs up it are nothing like as many as you might expect. The museum inside the pylon gives a fascinating insight into the history of the bridge and its construction, and the view from the outside at the top is mesmerising. Take your camera of course, and if you're there in Winter a windproof jacket. Allow yourself a couple of hours to get the most from the museum and the view.

Harbour Bridge activities. My two daughters and I took the train across the bridge and walked back. We enjoyed the walk. There were three security guards on the bridge. Later, my daughters participated in an afternoon Bridge Walk and loved their time on the bridge with a great group leader. We would recommend both activities.

Bridge climb... at twilight!. Wow, just wow!! Decided to pay the extra and go with the 'twilight' climb as we'd seen the whole of Sydney from the Westfield Tower during the day time a few days prior. So glad we did as this was truly and unforgettable experience. Views during this time were totally magnificent! And Nick, our tour guide, was totally awesome too... very informative and full of humour! This was by far our best experience in our 3 weeks in Australia. Book it now or you'll regret it! :)

Sydney Harbour Bridge Walk Attraction. If you travel to Sydney and are not too afraid of heights, please consider the bridge walk. A small group of my soccer team decided to take this tour and we didn't regret it. The views are breathe taking and stunning. It is well organized and totally safe. So glad I was brave enough and would do it again.

I climbed it, it's awesome. Must do. If I can climbed it, anyone can do as I'm not an adventurous person and was a bit scare of the height but I went thru with it as part of group activity. I'm glad I did it as the whole preparation, safety procedure will make you will feel at ease. They put very high security at heart and the your guide was vey knowledgable. Once you got up to the submit, the view of Sydney Barbour and Opera house will just blow your breath away. I would strongly that climbing the bridge is a must do activity in your list.
Awsome. An amazing experience whether you are enjoying a leisurely stroll across the bridge or doing the bridge climb.

Amazing views but not an amazing experience. The most fascinating part of this climb is the whole safety procedure you need to go through before you even get close to the climb. I think it's all part of the build up and in my view just slightly over the top. They even breathalyse you. The company that developed the climb has installed a very sophisticated system of harnesses and cables all along the route that takes you up to the highest point which in itself is pretty amazing. Apart from this you are just walking along the top of the bridge which isn't as difficult as it is made out to be. The views from the top are spectacular though and worth the effort. Not sure if it was worth the price.
A must do. One of the best experiences of my life. The set up, management and structure of the tour is super, our climb leader Tara was exceptional, she made the experience awesome

Quite a long walk but it was nice. It was so cold in the winter especially when the wind is blowing so hard but it is certainly worth to try. You can see the amazing view of the Opera house and the city from the Harbour Bridge

Iconic Sydney Harbour Bridge. You will feel the dramatic steel presence of this bridge contrasting with the Opera House's undulating sails.Drive across it,climb it or simply gaze at it from any angle.Don't miss the spectacular Pylon Lookout,reached via pedestrian pathway on the eastern side of the bridge,for one of the best landscape views that Sydney has to offer.

Definitely worth it. The BridgeClimb is one of the best things I have done in Australia. It gives fantastic views do the whole of Sydney, make sure you pick a day with sunny conditions. It takes about 3.5 hours to climb, it is not very strenuous but the ladders are steep to get onto the arch. You do not feel the wind as they give you a onesie with a hat, they also have fleeces, beanies, waterproofs. You are attached to a cable the whole time and at no point do you feel unsafe. The climb leader Tash was great, very knowledgable, always happy and smiling. She took great photos of the group and individual photos looking over the Opera House and the summit of the bridge.Just to make people aware it is loud underneath the bridge due to road traffic and trains. If you get a chance when in Sydney definitely do the bridgeclimb

Bridge Climb yourself. Great experience to view the bridge from the Opera House. Walked over from the Northern part of the city. Bridge climb centre is near the Australian Hotel and is pricey. You can view the bridge from all parts of Sydney

Spectacular at sunset. I'm a Sydneysider and often saw people climbing up the bridge and admiring the view but had never given it a go myself. I absolutely loved the view at sunset and it gives you a whole new appreciation for what a beautiful city Sydney is. The staff were professional and friendly and it was definitely worth it. My only criticism was that I thought it was a bit too expensive.
Gorgeous. It looked brilliant in the pouring rain and freezing cold weather as we pulled out of the harbour on a cruise ship. It was all lit up and I loved it
Great. The view was amazing from the wharf. Esp when the ships pass the bridge, it was breathtaking. In the night , the bridge was lit up with lights

The Sunset Climb is Amazing!!. We went to Sydney to visit my Daughter who was studying in Adelaide. We did a lot of things in a short amount of time, but one of the best was to Climb the Harbor Bridge at Sunset!! The preparation takes quite some time, they give you a breathalyzer before you begin the setup, so watch the beers before you go...or you wont be going. They give you head lamps & jumpsuits for warmth. But to be up there & see the views from the Opera House to Darling Harbor at night is just amazing. It was a great opportunity, top notch operation & so worth the money you spend.
Sydney Harbour Bridge. Walked across the bridge with beautiful views certainly worth the enjoyable walk. Enjoyed the whole experience.

Treat Yourself - go climb it!. What's there to dislike? The old coat hanger is an icon and since opening it's doors to allow folks to climb it, it has offered us another view of Sydney's skyline. The safety talk takes some time but the walk/climb to the top of the bridge is exhilarating, not to mention the view. No cameras or any other loose items allowed, tho!

Spectacular views, worth every step of the climb. This is a must do in Sydney. The climb is fairly easy and quite enjoyable. There are only two parts which may be a challenge for some - you will be required to climb up 4 sets of "ladder" and then down another 4. The rest of it is a breeze. All aspects of health and safety are in place and you will feel very safe making the climb. The whole experience took about 3.5 hours and an hour of that is devoted to making sure we are properly kitted out and know exactly what we are doing while we make the climb.

Sunset bridge climb. We did the sunset bridge climb - fortunately on he only pleasant day of our stay in Sydney. Fabulous experience and a wonderful time of day to go - we saw the view in daylight, caught the sunset and watched the lights come on in the city. The climb is not physically demanding - highly recommended!
Amazing Climb. Went on the bridge climb with my auntie on a visit to Australia and could not have asked for less, the staff and our walk guide were amazing!
It's a bridge. Nothing particularly amazing about it really... You'll see it because it's next to the opera house but apart from that don't make a trip specially to see it

Many similar bridges but none like Sydney's...... This is THE classic bridge shaped like a coat hanger and only Sydney Harbour Bridge set in this magical harbour is renowned as the pinnacle of New Years celebrations around the globe. You wouldn't call it a handsome structure but rather, a functional one that allows a huge volume of traffic, train and water vehicles to pass under or over it.For that wow factor try the bridge climb or simply walk over it to experience some of the best views of the city skyline and Opera House. The pylons stand sentinel on both sides of the harbour and viewing it from underneath on a ferry is something special. We never tire of seeing whenever we visit Sydney and it has to be one of the most recognisable bridges in the world.Enjoy your experience!

Walk across and take it all in. Brilliant as doesn't matter how many times i go. I find myself drawn to this old beauty who only gets better with age... Must do if in Sydney walk over and take in the view.

Unbelivably beautiful scenery from up top!!. I did the climb up to the top of the Harbor Bridge and it really was worth it.Alot of preparations and briefings before hand and all safety checks were done.Then off to the depths of the bridge ..walking among the steel and concrete.Finally we start our climb up.They take about 10 people per group and we were given overalls and a safety harness which clips onto the railings.As expected..climbing up was a bit tough because its steep and high up.We had the view of the eastern side of the harbor.But the pace the guide set was good with stops to relax and admire the view.You wear headsets as to be able to hear what your guide will be commenting on.I had the fortunate experience to walk up while the sun was still high..and by the time we got up to the top..the sunset was beginning.Lovely spectacular view.A really must do if you are in Sydney.Then its across to the other side of the bridge...while cars are whizzing past you a few hundred metres below.Then down we came on the western side of the bridge.Good stuff!!!But beware if you are afraid of heights then better not do it.

Must do!. One of the best experiences and very impressively run/organised. So I know, it's expensive, however, if you can possibly do it, then you won't be disappointed! 19 yo son and 'us' did the express climb and there were only the three of us. Really great afternoon and I highly recommend it!

Worth visiting and climbing. Dont miss the walk on the bridge and climbing it if you get the chance, the view is amazing, the small museum of the bridge is nice and explains the history of it, the price is relatively high for climbing but if you like doing such things, I am sure you wont regret climbing it at all
Classic. Unfortunately construction was going on under the bridge during our visit but did not mar its grandure.
Beautiful and functional Bridge. I would like to travel the bridge again as it is very beautiful and functional bridge in Sydney and Australia as well.

Pricey but if you're going to do it just once..... I went for the evening climb which enable me to watch daylight, sunset and also night view. So it was quite breathtaking at times. It was quite pricey but I guess if you are someone who is going to do it just once, it will be quite worth it. Only complaint is that we're not allowed to bring our own cameras.....

Sydney Harbour Bridge Walk. Don't want to pay top dollar or get up early to climb the Bridge, then next best option is walk across the Bridge for free. You have all the time you want to take in the views and get that great shot of the Opera House. A must do on your trip to Sydney with the added bonus of a bit of exercise!

What a climb!. The Sydney Bridge climb was one of the most memorable and fun activities we enjoyed on our visit. We did the twilight climb which was really amazing with spectacular views. It started out sunny and then we saw a great sunset. We had so much fun and even though I have a fear of heights, I was not afraid. We were hooked onto a cable and felt very safe. The guides are professional, helpful, and supply everything one needs, including a climbing suit, jacket, gloves, hat, and light. Even though it is expensive, it is well worth it and an unforgettable experience!

The "Coathanger". This bridge is 'a must see' if visiting Sydney. There are many viewing points at ground level, north or south of the bridge or from one of the many ferries that leave Circular Quay. You may want to walk across the bridge at street level or take a train ride. All of these are wonderful but of course the big adventure is a bridge climb. My wife & I have scaled the bridge twice & on the first climb she got 'stuck' (she had, until this excursion, been afraid of heights). Within seconds a member of staff appeared from nowhere & skillfully encouraged her to continue. When we arrived back at ground level our 'team' gave her a big round of applause. This is truly an experience not to be missed.

Really not good. I disliked this attraction due to the fact that they were doing building works on it when I was in Oz and it was closed of...it was really disappointing i couldn't even get a decent photo without builders being in the background.

Sydney Harbour Bridge Walk. Great, fantastic, a must do activity. Great views, excellent professional staff. I do not like heights, the open part at the bottom is a bit difficult, but the bridge is fine. No narrow walkways and are safely tied to a cable for the complete walk. The views are amazing.

Climbed and walked the bridge. Love that structure.. You can actually climb the bridge, too, if you book a tour with the one agency in charge of it. I walked across it about 5 years ago, and climbed it this time. It's a truly enormous bridge and modeled after a bridge in New York, but super-sized. It even has trains running on it.

If you haven't done it.. you MUST. Have you ever climbed to the top of a bridge? Have you ever looked down to fast moving cards or looked over to a never ending area of water? If you haven't then you MUST! Climbing to the top of the Sydney harbour bridge was nothing shy of amazing. They give you a neat little tutorial at the beginning, strap you in and you are on your way. It is very safe and even if your scared of heights I still say go for it. It was so informative and at the end all I kept thinking was I never have or will do anything like that again. If your visiting for months, living in Australia or just visiting for a week or so id say that needs to be on your top 5 things to do while in Sydney! Plus you get an awesome group picture! The only down fall like many well known attractions is its a little pricy, well a lot pricy about $200 (US)

harbour bridge walk. What a way to visit the little village of kirribilli, view the opera house from the north shore, many restaurants,parks and joy rides in kirribilli. Likewise walking over the bridge overlooking the harbour entering the historical rocks area is a walk never to tire of.
Still special. After some time away, there are a few things that you love about coming home. Flying over the harbour and bridge on the way in always makes you realise what a special place Sydney is

Loved walking across. We took a ferry to luna park and walked back via the rocks. It was a very good walk and the bridge itself is iconic. Lots of joggers on the bridge as we crossed and security guards presumably to stop people jumping off.

Sydney bridge walk. If you can, take a relaxing walk across the Sydney Harbor Bridge. You get a great view of both sides of the harbor and a little exercise as well. I started from the downtown Sydney side and caught the ferry back from the north side. Very enjoyable.

The view is outstanding and the experience...Once in a lifetime!. My husband got to go on his "climb" over the Sydney Harbour Bridge while I took an exciting speed boat adventure under the bridge and around Sydney Harbour. We both came back with much to share. 1. My husband was hesitant to go alone and came back so happy with his experience! The climbers were given jumpsuits to wear so that nothing could fall from that height. He was then attached to the bridge so he too was safe :-). The walk/climb over the bridge took about 2 1/2 hours and the pictures from the top vantage point is outrageously fun with all the climbers smiling and waving enthusiastically, as the helicopter flies over and takes their picture. One does not have to be "in good shape" to do this climb/walk....just willing to take the time, being able to go up stairs and to be patient as you wait for all the "walkers" in your group of 10-12 people. There is much structure to hold on to so no insecurity about one's safety.2. My speed boat trip around the Syndney Harbour was with a group of 10-12 and was exciting with a speed boat that could stop on a dime and turn on that same dime. I was able to stay reasonably dry but was wearing an outfit and shoes that were fit for this occasion on the water. The tour of the Harbour was fantastic and fun on the water was had by all. If you are someone who gets car sick, this is not the experience for you. It is fast moving....a bit on the wild side but I was up for something fun. The weather and water were perfect while the pilot knew his history and historical sites. I wish I could give you the name of this adventure but you can catch this boat trip on the Harbour boat dock, the day you want to go. Go early to be the first in line and sit on one side of these large speed boats or on the other side. The view and experience is more fun with none on both sides of you.

Thrillseeker. The bridge is wonderful,and you can take a tour on it.You canwalk on the very top of the bridge if you like.You can see alot fromup there.The people who work ou the bridge,they know what theyare doing.

Iconic Bridge, worth framing!. Being a photographer myself, I found the Sydney Harbour Bridge an amazing opportunity to try framing with different angles. It looks breathtaking with the sunset in the backdrop. The best point to view the bridge is from Mrs Macquarie's Chair and from Lavender Bay

Bridge Climb. On my trip to Australia we did the Sydney harbor Bridge climb.Amazing experience.The guides are so knowledgable about the history of the bridge and of Sydney,The climb is safe,You are tethered to a cable for safety purposes,and they do test to see if you have been drinking,Reaching the top and the amazing view is so worth the climb! I highly recommend it.

Worth every $ - Iconic landmark. If you like heights and the small climb do it! The view is amazing ( though can be experienced from just climbing the pillars). If you get a good tour guide( I've climbed this structure twice and not been disappointed) your experience is amazing. Yes it's pricey photos are expensive too but all worth it !!!!

Sydney Harbour Bridge best kept secret. Visit the Harbour Bridge Pylon Lookout when walking across the Harbour Bridge. On the way up there is a great exhibition about how the bridge was built. The view from the top is awesome - out to the Blue Mountains on the west side and across the harbour on the east side. So much cheaper than the Bridge Climb for those on a budget. Access from Cumberland Street in the city.

Certainly an Icon. The title says it all. Certainly if you are in Sydney, its a must-see, if only to say you've been there, seen it and possibly thought about buying the t-shirt! However it's only a bridge and maybe a fantastic feat of engineering but the earth did not move for me just by looking at it. However, my wife had done the climb with my son some months earlier and she rated highly that experience, so for visitors, that is something possibly to think about.

Fear of heights?. As I'm fearful of heights I really didn't was to do the Bridge climb but a great deal of family pressure persuaded me to do it. In the entrance hall there were many pictures of celebrities who have done the climb and one picture was of a woman who was 100 years old. If she could do so could I at 74. The climb itself was extremely well organised and with everything fixed on to your overalls there was no danger of anything falling off. The young guide was knowledgeable and very caring of our party of 12 and no one felt they were holding anyone up. We all felt very safe and the actual climb was not difficult. I felt very proud that I had managed to face my fear.

Bridge Climb. The Bridge Climb on top of the Harbour Bridge is surely not to be missed. With breath taking views like no other and a scene of Sydney on top of one of Australia's iconic structures, you are guaranteed an enjoyable day out. There are options of dawn climb and dusk climb allowing you to see Sydney for what it's worth, along with an experienced guide who will take you on a historical story telling you the journey of how the bridge came to be. This is good for people who are looking for 1 day activities as it will only take you 2 - 3 hours to climb the bride and back down again in total whilst also being able to see the sunrise or sunset from the top of the bridge.

Sydney Harbour bridge walk. Highly recommended on your visit to Sydney. Exhilarating and breath taking views of the City and surrounds as far as the eye can see. Opportunity for self photo or group as a memento of your once of a lifetime experience that will never be forgotten. Close to Circular Quay and darling Harbour also a must visit all spactacular

Worth the wait, amazingly beautiful. I got the Bridge Climb as a 50th birthday pressie from my kids and friend. Did the sunset tour and it was just amazing. My partner and I are both not great with heights but because of the scenery and the whole atmosphere you just get caught up in what you are doing and forget your fears. Would do it all again in a heart beat.

Impossible to under estimate this Sydney Icon. More than a transport link between the North and South (CBD) sides of Sydney, the "SHB" dominates and defines Sydney harbour (Port Jackson).Well worth the experience of walking across whether you're a visitor or resident OR join the bridge climb if you're so inclined. The views of Sydney and the Harbour are fantastic from the bridge.

Great. The breathtaking view all angles for picture taking is limitless. Every nooks & corners of the Sydney Harbour Bridge is to be explored slowly as I love taking pictures of the scenic & picturesqe view

The wow moment. Being a local it's one of those things we know you should get around to doing, but never do. Friends visiting from overseas was the ideal prompt. Extremely well organised with all the safety boxes ticked. Climbing this Sydney icon was an emotional journey as well as the visual experience. Not to be missed

The Best View In Sydney. What a spectacular icon we have in the Sydney Harbour Bridge whether you go up in the pylon, walk across the bridge or do the more expensive version and climb the bridge. I have done all 3 and it is fantastic for the best views in Sydney. A great day out to explore the inner city.

Fantastic Bridgeclimb. I did the Bridgeclimb with my 20 year old son before he took off to Europe for a year. It was a great experience to share and we both enjoyed it immensely. The staff were friendly, knowledgable and very professional and the views were just awesome.

Amazing view. The Bridge climb is amazing. A few different options to choose from, but all are great. Good instructions prior to the bridge climb. Very safe and the most amazing views of Sydney Harbour, The Sydney Opera House and The Rocks.

Bridge walk. Have visited Sydney before but this Time my wife Eve decided to attempt the Bridge walk , it was awsome she really enjoyed it and the guides were fantastic, I recorded her walk from the tower.
Beautiful.. Just Brilliant what can one say this is Australia.at night when the lights were on from our ship and the Harbour bridge was Beautiful.
Spectacular. Not much to say except it is a beautiful landmark. Lovely to look at when it is lit up at night. We enjoyed having a coffee at a local cafe overlooking the bridge.
Sydney Harbour Bridge. Great place to visit especially in the evening when the stars are out. Also a bike tour along the coast line is a amazing thing to do. Simply breathtaking.

Worth it. My nervous wife, myself and our 11 an 15 year old climbed on a day when the weather threw everything possible at it.... and it was fantastic. The operation is slick and professional and by the time you start the climb you know you are in safe hands. We had high wind, a burst of heavy rain and sun, but never felt at risk despite the height. They equip you out perfectly. My wife is unhappy at heights but managed it, and the climb is taken at a pace that most can manage. My 65 year old unfit mother-in-law had done it 10 years previously so we were confident we could do it. The views and the experience are unforgettable and we are so pleased we did it. One free photo and a cap comes in the top line price, as well as a 10 second video to post on social media. Extra pictures are about Aus$15. You cannot take anything like your own camera in case it drops! It is a Sydney must do.

Once In A Lifetime. A friend and I were staying in Sydney for 3 weeks over Christmas and New Year and knew we just had to climb the Sydney Harbour Bridge! It is something you must do. The staff were great, you do a trial before hand on an indoor simulator which is good if you are a little nervous about how it all works. You cant take any of your belongings but they do take pictures of you at the top and on the way up and the way down. The views from the top are to die for, it is a must if you are in Sydney
Pretty Sight!. I went during the VIVID festival and the lightings on the bridge was awesome! Traveling through this bridge was a different experience too!

Great Views. The top of the Sydney Harbour Bridge offers some excellent views of the Harbour, North Sydney and the city. Even for those faint of heart regarding heights, the views from the pillars are excellent and less costly and time consuming.

Breath taking. If you want to view Sydney the do the Harbour Bridge climb. It looks much steeper then it really is. It is an easy climb for all ages. The guides were excellent and very informative. Highly recommend.

Loved this. I took my 13 year old daughter to climb the bridge with her friend!!! We had the best time. The view is truly unforgettable. They prepare you really well. It isn't a hard climb at all. It is a gradual climb so as long as your not afraid of heights you will be fine. Standing in the middle of the bridge was amazing and climbing through it is really fascinating.

I Climbed The Sydney Harbour Bridge. I climbed the Sydney Harbour Bridge, a present for my 60th Birthday, what an exhilarating, fantastic experience. What I saw from the very top was absolutely breath taking. Ask for Richard the guide, he knows his stuff and is very entertaining.Would recommend this adventure to everyone.
Climb the bridge. This experience is very doable and totally memorable. The views from above are unlike any other in the city.

Just walk over it. I'm not fit enough to attempt the bridge climb, or go up all the stairs to the Pylon Lookout Point, but the view you get from the normal walkway is already spectacular, I recommend it.

Bridge climb. I was very nervous about the climb but really wanted to do it, I pushed my self and thanks to our guide Dan who was so very kind to me, I made it and enjoyed the whole experience Dan has a very special talent for story telling..excellent experience

What a view. To walk over this bridge is something really special, it's a once in a life time experience and the views from the top take your breath away and they will live with you forever, it's defiantly a must

Iconic But Not That Great. It is an Australian Icon but frankly it rattles and vibrates and looks pretty tacky as you walk across the bridge. The view is something else but there are much better places to view the Harbour around Sydney.

Bridge climb wonder. As soon as we started our research for our trip to Australia, we decided this is a must. We booked a month in advance and whilst we had been recommended to do the sunrise/sunset, this was quite a bit more expensive we opted just to do the standard day tour. The tour lasts for a couple of hours as on arrival, you have a safety talk, need to get suited and booted and toy run through a practice climb of the ladders. With one of our group being nervous of heights, our wonderful climb leader, Albert put us at the front of the group. This meant he was able to check on us and be quite reassuring. You head out onto some very narrow paths which give you the first feel of the climb, before making your way up to some paths where you can see below the 'mesh-like' floor. This is probably the scariest part of the climb as you could see the drop. Four steep ladders later and you were on the main frame of the bridge. With this being solid, it was a bit more relaxed. You take a slow walk up to the top where you are given some wonderful stories by your leader through a radio and headphones. They also take photos of you and your group as you head up. Reaching the top, you have some wonderful views of the harbour and surrounding areas before heading back down the other side of the bridge. It was an amazing experience and we are glad we bought the 10 photo package as it meant we didn't have to be too selective with our choices. I would highly recommend!

Sydney Harbour Bridge Tour. It is one of the most unique tours you can do travelling in Australia and in particularly Sydney. Whether you do a day time tour or my favourite the sunset evening tour it gives you a very special view of the Bridge and Sydney because of it towering heights over Sydney.I have been very lucky to work for the company over many years and had the opportunity to walk across the bridge for free and experienced its glory many times but I never underestimated the beauty and sights I experienced.On our last anniversary and later on our granddaughter’s birthday after I retired I arranged two night tours. Both tours were spectacular and we experienced some of the most incredible sights across Sydney Harbour has to offer. The day time tours are also great, you just don’t get to experience the lights of the ferries, the Opera House and all off those beautiful lights across the city.It is an expensive tour costing about $240 USD but worth every cent and every step that you climb or decline, you experience the bridge and the surrounding city that you would never capture with a camera. You can’t take cameras onto the climb, but included in the price is a tour of the Southern Pylon.The pylon rises about 2/3 of the height of the bridge, gives you incredible views of the city and the harbour bridge and you can take you camera and take as many photos as you wish.The Southern Pylon is accessible from Circular Quay by a ten minute walk through the original and historic Sydney town to the platform of the Sydney Harbour Bridge. The price is about $10 USD to walk the 300 steps to the top of the Pylon. The views across Sydney are incredible. You can photograph the Opera House, the Harbour, the Bridge and on a clear all the way out to sea. The Southern Pylon is the cheapest way to view Sydney and also get some great pictures.If you are reading this review, want to visit my city, include the Harbour Bridge Tour as one of your special memories.

Great walk and amazing view. You can walk across the bridge for free (rather than climb it) at your own pace which to me is a must-do for visitors to Sydney. The bridge has a separate side for cyclists and so walkers do not need to worry about being run down when stopping to admire the view. If you are not much of a walker and would like to do a one-way walk only, it's best to catch the train from the city to Milsons Point and walk back to the city.

Outstanding Views. This is an iconic structure and is best appreciated up close. The sheer size of it is impressive. Against the water with a ferry running around it is picture perfect and the best thing about Sydney
Amazing!. This bridge is amazing! You have to stand underneath it to appreciate the enormity of it. We had hoped to do the bridge walk but it had to be pre-booked and was very expensive.

Impressive. The Sydney Harbor Bridge is - contrary to the one in Auckland, NZ - accessible and makes a noisy but impressive walk with spectacular views over the harbor and Opera House, especially on a sunny day.

AMAZING BRIDGE. as i look up the bridge from behind you can see the big steels that connects to the other side of the city. it is near to the historic opera of the city. good architecture. and wonderful creation.

Fantastic!. This year I went for a night walk over the Harbour Bridge. I loved walking over it!It was such a fantastic view of the Harbour and monuments in Sydney, I would definitely recommend anyone, to go for a walk at night over it!
bai. Well worth the ffort to do the sydney harbor bridge , great views from the top , the guide was excellent and explained everything about the bridge .

A great way to see the city, for free. We walked across the bridge and back, just like you can do on the Golden Gate Bridge in the States. We really enjoyed it. There were low key police security guards at both entrances and one in the middle, so nervous walkers can relax. The entrance was easy to find using the local city tourist map and following the signs from the Circular Quay. There are lots of good places to take pictures. Good exercise, and it doesn't take a long time, maybe 20 minutes to cross one way, if that, depending on how fast you walk.

Not to be missed. We went on the twilight walk and can thoroughly recommend. Able to see Sydney in all it's glory as the Sun sets for breathtaking views. Our guide was excellent and added to the overall experience. Would definitely do it again - maybe at sunrise

Once in a lifetime experience. Absolutely fantastic. They were very safety conscious. The guide we had was very knowledgable and had a good sense of humour. The weather wasn't great on the way up (rain & wind) but once we got to the top and got to appreciate the views, it was fantastic. Would definitely recommend doing it at twilight. As you go up in the light but once you reach the top and walk back down the city lights have turned on and it makes for excellent photos!!
sydney harbour bridge. It is quite tiring climbing up with my niece and nephew. We took many photos of the panoramic views and was a memorable trip
Climb the bridge!. my sis and I climbed it right to the summit , its must for th best view in Sydney. Was a tad pricey but very understandable.
Do the bridge climb. Do the bridge climb. Yes it is pricey but it so much fun and the view is beautiful. How many times do you get the chance to climb a bridge ?!
Spectacular!!!!!. My son and I did the climb late in the afternoon, not quite twilight but we were fortunate to see the sunset. It is an amazing experience and so glad I found the bottle to do it

Bridge Climb. One of the best steel arch in the world, and I climbed it! I was unlucky with the weather, I was in Sydney in winters and it was raining on the day I had to climb. I would definitely recommend it. It was expensive, AUD 188 + charges for photos and prints but it is worth it. I went in the evening, by the time we reached the top it was dark and the whole city looked beautiful, amazing view of Opera house which is very close to the bridge. Our guide also made the whole experience amazing. Highly recommended.
What a sight. It is a beautifull bridge in the city centre an icon.It was even more beautifull in de evening/night.

Amazing Bridge Climb. My husband and I did the Bridge Climb, we didn't take our kids with us, I don't think they could've done it(too scared of heights) I am very scared of heights as well, so it was a struggle to get to the very top, but I managed and it was absolutely worth it. The view is just amazing. We did ours as sunset so we got to see the night Sydney which was so beautiful! Yes it's expensive, but it's an amazing experience, we are both very glad we did it!
Lovely spot to see city. I recomanded this part if you want enjoy the view of the city and take faboulous pictures. I think it's a must for the visit of the city.

The Bridge Climb a brilliant experience. My husband & son in law climbed the bridge to celebrate their Birthdays in August. The whole experience was so professionally done & they can not rate this highly enough. A must when visiting Sydney!
amazing architecture!. in my opinion better than the opera house. looks amazing at day and night, the history was fantastic and its spectacular.

Twilight Climb is beautiful!. We chose to do the Twilight Climb and got to see the sunset from the top of the bridge, and it was beautiful! In case you are wondering, you do not need to be in great shape to do this climb, as you might think. The guides take plenty of breaks and give you lots of information about the bridge along the way. Although you are not allowed to take your cameras for obvious reasons, they do take plenty of photos of you up there, and of course you can buy those after the climb. Although this experience is a bit expensive, it was well worth it!

A must do. If you come to Australia you must see the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. If you can afford it, do the bridge climb. Its a great experience and fantastic views of the harbour. You can drive through the bridge, walk from Sydney to CBD to Milsons Point, or take the train.Visit my blog for great travel articles www.mskotravels.com
