Express Climb to the Bridge is a very good choice. We chose the express climb and we had a great time. The express climb goes through the structure which offers for me as an engineer the best views. We had a great guide and a small group. The express climb is also possible for normal visitors (not just for iron man)

Bridge Climb. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!! YES, it was expensive, YES it was worth it! I believe it was around $240 but worth ever cent once you reach the top. The climb wasn't too bad at all and it gets easier the closer to the top you get. This would never be allowed in USA but was an experience I will never forget. Guide made it fun and entertaining while walking up with many breaks and recommend it for any one 16-70

Sydney Harbour Bridge. Fantastic looking bridge in a world class location. Amazing piece of engineering too. Excellent view of the Opera House, from the bridge. If you have the guts you can climb it to the top ( we didn't)Cheers Niels and Mary, Humpty Doo, NT, Australia, Down Under
Grandiose.. It sort of a rip-off of one of the bridges in New York, but it doesn't mean it looks any less spectacular against the skyline.

Bridge climb. Husband, daughter and I did bridge climb August 2014. Not cheap but fantastic and a must do in Sydney. Our guide was excellent, knowledgable, friendly and made the experience a total joy. I was a little apprehensive that it would be difficult but it was easy - anyone could do it!

A "Must See" when in Sydney. Enjoy the fabulous view around.. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is certainly worth a visit when visiting Sydney, Australia.You can just walk across or beyyer still, jog across for some refreshing exercise. Its a good walk starting from Circular Quay. Once on the other side of the bridge, you can take a train back from Milsons Point station which is located close to the bridge.

Don't miss it!!. Go to the South East tower and do the tour up there.
Almost as good as climbing the bridge and a hell of a lot cheaper with fantastic views.
Great little museum with loads of info as well.
Just do it.

A Great bridge. so lovely to see from a distance a magnificint sight, and we caught the ferry and went underneath it a and headed to circular quay to see the Opera House in the same trip a highlight of our trip

Must be done. Yes its expensive at about $240 but its money well spent when you get to the top. Amazing views from the ocean to the Blue Mountains. Very well organised and informative tour guides. The climb itself is not difficult as most of it is along the "footpath/steps" on the arch with a short ladder climb to start and finish. You get a group photo for free but extra charges apply for individual photos- which is not surprising but a bit cheeky given the cost of the climb.

The Harbour Bridge has great views!. The Sydney Harbour Bridge gets a lot of press, and frankly the views are great. We looked into climbing to the top of the rafters of the bridge, but it was quite expensive. So we opted to walk the Bridge from end to end and back, and really you get some great views just doing that. And it's free! Wear comfortable shoes and bring your camera - but keep the camera on a safety strap so you don't lose it over the edge.

Fantastic Experience.. I climbed Sydney Harbour Bridge with my family during a family holiday. It was one of the highlights of our trip and an experience we will never forget! The views are fantastic and the climb is not as scary as it looks!! The guide we had was wonderful and really put everyone at ease every step of the way. He was very reassuring and his commentary (everyone wears headsets as it's so windy at the top) was great, enough information with being boring and some laughs too! Before you climb you have to change into an all in one 'climbers' suit, and are supplied with a cap and gloves. Before going onto the actual bridge you get to practice inside which is fun and allows you to get used to being attached to a rope. I'd advise to book ahead as it gets very busy, and can be cancelled in bad weather. A must do in Sydney!!

No fear!. I completed the bridge climb earlier this week and just loved it. I did an express climb which meant some great views around the outside of the bridge and an amazing feeling of reaching the top. Albert, the guide was knowledgeable and was great if you were a little afraid of heights. The group I climbed with were lovely and although it was a wet and windy day, it was totally worth it. They kit you out with a climb suit, fleece, beanie, waterproof pants and a raincoat. I was pretty dry and warm! Well worth it!

Amazing experience. My partner and I have just completed the bridge walk across the harbour. It is an amazing experience and I would highly recommend it. The views from the top are fantastic. The guides are also very good. They don't rush you up and down and they are extremely friendly and informative about the bridge and the area. A fantastic thing to do and one that I'll always remember.
Pylon climb. Climbed to the top of the bridge pylon. Beautiful 360 degree view of Sydney. As close as you can get to doing the bridge climb but for cheaper.

Walk Across It or Climb Over It. You can walk over it for free and take your own photos or you can climb over the top of it for the ridiculously expensive sum of $300 per person and have somebody take photos of you, then charge you $10 for each of them. We did both and the walk across was just as exciting as the climb over. The views of the harbour, Opera House and Sydney are magnificent. Only do the climb if you have money to burn.

You must do this if you are in Sydney. This is a 'must do' experience if you are visiting Sydney. Although it may look daunting at first, the staff are very experienced and don't rush the group and make everybody feel at ease. Remember to have a kiss under the light at the top for good luck. You should book ahead of your visit though as it is very popular.

Do it nothing like that in the uk. Watched billy Connelly do it, and thought, go on, have a go, I am so glad I did. Staff very friendly helpful, and there is no stress at all. It's easy to climb, much better than I I imagined, expensive yes, but it's only money and the views you get fro. The top, looking down over the opera house, where else can you get that. Do it !!

Gotta do the Climb!!. Walking across the top of Sydney Harbour Bridge is an amazing experience - the harbour below, Opera House across the water and the views to the city and inland too!!While the history is interesting, it is the views that make this experience what it is, pity you can't take your own photos and video - damned health and safety!!
A bit disapointed. Definitely a must see but I think that the Sydney harbour Bridge is a bit overhyped.Have a walk around and continue in the rocks area
Good view.. Not much else. Good view of Sydney from up here, but not much else to do.Good way to conquer a fear of heights! After seeing the view head to a shopping mall and have a relaxing afternoon

Fantastic, breathtaking, amazing. The bridge is such an iconic image that it takes your breath away just to look at it; however we did the bridge climb and "oh my god" i actually cried. the views were amazing. this is quite an expensive thing to do and i was a little apprehensive at first but so glad I did it. I would recommend this to anyone visiting Sydney.

What a bridge.. We had considered doing the bridge climb, but it is expensive and it's was mid winter and cold. Instead we did the pylon climb. You pay to enter, can't remember how much. There are lots of stairs so it's not for the faint hearted. You are rewarded with an amazing view all round the harbour. Great for photos. At the top of the tower you are about half way up the span of the bridge , you can watch the people doing the climb!!After we walked across the span of the bridge to the other side of the bridge. Then walked through a little place called Kiribilli down to the underside of the bridge. Amazing views. There are lots of small cafés and and eateries so it's a delightful place for lunch before more walking!!

Spectacular. If you are not afraid of heights this is a must do Sydney Activity, one to remember for sure. Dean was a great guide, informative and looked after us all really well. The views speak for themselves after a relatively easy climb, don't be put off it is not a arduous climb and is very safe. The guide takes a number of unforgettable photos during the climb, definitely a highlight of our visit to Sydney.

Steeped in history, fantastic views, real high point of our trip. Brilliant landmark to Sydney's history and spirit offering fantastic views of the harbour and easily accessible via the Cahill walk. Bridge climb offers thrilling activity and views but must be booked in advance for good slots and at $200 each is unreasonably expensive.

Fantastic. The Sydney Harbor Bridge Climb was fantastic! The entire staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The process leading up to the Bridge Climb can take a little long, but the process is highly efficient. Our guide leader was Delphi and she was great. She had a great sense of humor and was very knowledgeable. Delphi made the experience that much better. I highly recommend this activity!
We loved the bridge climb. A fantastic experience for my 50th birthday. We climbed the Bridge at night during Vivid Sydney. It was absolutely amazing and anyone can do it - age is no barrier.

A must do!!. We had a great day doing the climb. My wife was initially worried that the kids wouldn't be safe, but those fears where quickly erased. This is a top notch professional experience. The safety equipment and briefing were thorough and our guide was friendly and extremely knowledgeable. The walk itself was brilliant and we had a perfectly clear day with as some views over Sydney.If your going to Sydney, you've got to to the bridge.
exiting. you really feel small when yo walk underneath the bridge or pass by boat. I do it every time I am there.

Harbour bridge. Did not climb over the bridge but went up inside the bridge and found the information and video show quite fascinating. We climbed fairly high. Maybe next time I shall climb right over.

Magnificent View In Any Direction. Like the fact that this world famous landmark can be seen from the train station (Circular Quay), and is photographable in every direction. Enjoyed the walk along it but it can be very hard on the feet so be sure to wear good appropriate footwear. Didn't climb the bridge but was told to do so would cost a lot of money.
Totally Awesome. Brilliant, so spectacular walk over to the North Side was lovely, nothing quiet like it! Will defiantly come back here again much more majestic in real life
what a great landmark. this bridge is very lovely to look at and to also walk along it gives you a lovely look at the sydney scenery. i am glad to say that i have been to see it and walk on it.

Magnificent. I was lucky last year when we started a cruise from Sydney. Our ship was docked in Sydney and we could see the Harbour Bridge on one side and the Opera House on the other side. The bridge is a magnificent structure which dominates the harbour. You can walk or drive across it or you can climb it. Whichever way you do it you will get magnificent views of different parts of Sydney.

Walk the bridge for free or pay more and get up high. You can walk back and forth over the bridge along a safe pedestrian path just below the level of the cars so you can enjoy views and not feel as if you are I traffic. For $13 you can visit one of the support towers and climb up higher, and for even more you can strap on a harness and climb with other intrepid adventurers up the framework. I was happy to just stay at the lower level and take it all in from there. We did walk towards the end of the day and while there were security guards on the bridge decided we would not be so keen to walk the bridge after dark. The areas at each end are a bit industrial and isolated feeling, not far from hotels, cafés, Luna Park but still not where you feel comfortable alone at disk or later.

Sydney bridge walk. It is what it is on the postcards. The walk across to the harbour is great. Get to see the opera house and harbour from a different view. See the cruise ships close up. The climb to the top looks fantastic - don't do this on a windy day!

Beautiful city view. We did the climb as our first activity since we thought the steps would require us to be fresh. But the climb was not so hard. However, the view was spectacular and breath taking. Another must do. The tour guides are very good and take care of things very well and safety is a priority.

Walk across Sydney Harbour Bridge: the best Sydney "freebie!". I am biased,as this is my home town.However, I am very well-travelled and often enjoy also being a tourist in my own city, something we all should do, from time to time :)There are many beautiful places in the world to visit...but truly, Sydney is up the top, amongst the most beautiful harbours! Clean, expansive and a vision to sail into! (See for yourself you will likely agree!)Sydney Harbour Bridge is wonderful!I regularly walk across it; enjoy a coffee and walk back home to my suburb of Kirribilli ( also the home of our Prime Minister, when in Sydney...and also our Governor General).There is no fee to walk across the walkway/road on the bridge. (Many city workers walk across it, to their places of employment: some in gym gear, carrying suit-packs etc!)( Do not confuse with walking across the "span" of the bridge. This is called the " BRIDGE CLIMB." This is an privately-operated excursion for which there is a cost. )You can walk from either, north side to south side ( Milsons Point to Circular Quay)... or vice versa, in about 15 minutes at a steady walking pace. Do it slowly and it should take no longer than about 30 minutes, even allowing time for photographs, along the way.As you are at a very high elevation, above the harbour, the breeze can be very strong, so a jacket is recommended at all times of the year...though of course, you may need to shed it, mid-walk, in summer. The entrance to the bridge walk ( on the north side) is at Milsons Point (about 100 metres south of the train station entrance) via a steep set of about 50 stairs ( the most difficult part of the walk!) The bridge road walk, itself is quite easy...and oh so enjoyable, apart from traffic whizzing by, though you quickly become oblivious to this as your attention shifts to the magnificent harbour sights...and maybe, the ocean liner, that may be in port.The exit on the south side, is at the back of the historic " Rocks" area, ( more stairs) which is adjacent to Circular Quay, a gorgeous and bustling area, which leads along to the "Sydney Opera House." ( There are several quaint and very enjoyable "pubs" here as you arrive, should you feel like a beer or so.)Circular Quay, is the busy hub for "Sydney Harbour Ferries" which operate the charming cream and green boats that efficiently connect so many beautiful waterfront areas of Sydney, including Manly, Taronga Park Zoo, Parramatta...and further afar. Visitors can easily spend a half day or more enjoying all that Circular Quay area offers: museums, theatres, galleries, street performers, aboriginal musicians and dancers, cafes, restaurants, pubs, bars, souvenir shops etc.Please note: Alcohol is strictly banned on the bridge walkway and foolhardy/risky/dangerous behaviour is also not tolerated. Security staff are stationed along the walkway. Enjoy your walk! Great excursion for all the family!

Walk across using the pedestrian walkway .... it's free and fun. If you are unable to do a bridgeclimb the next best thing is to walk across the pedestrian walkway. The steps at the beginning of the pedestrian walkway are manageable (if not sure where to access just ask one of the businesses in the Rocks area) and it takes about 1/2 hour to stroll across from the Rocks area to the Kirribilli side. Nice cafes and areas to walk around before heading back. Plenty of security on the bridge, they have security personnel stationed at each end of the bridge and cameras as well.

Impressive and Iconic. My wife and I walked from Sydney Harbour to the Harbour Bridge and it is mighty impressive. We were not brave enough to do the high walk (you can walk up the bridge by prior arrangement). But walking across the bridge gives you the best views of Sydney Harbour. Its such an impressive structure. There are dedicated paths for pedestrians. Only think is if you are walking it during the day when sunny, make sure you apply some sun block!
Climb. Climbed across it and it was the one of the most beautiful experiences. When you find out the background information, you truly appreciate it.

Amazing Bridge. The bridge is fantastic to walk across or ride your bike across. The view from the bridge (just walking across) is amazing. Even just looking at the bridge while having a picnic from mcmahons point is a fantastic experience.
Iconic. Didn't do the climb but travelled across it. Whether you are up close or from a distance, this structure is so impressive day and night. Great advertisement for Sydney
The Bridge. A fantastic bridge the climb is a must do and gives the best views across the whole of Sydney Harbour
Big. Great iconic sight. Great, colourful and humorous history. Went jogging on it. Great views from the bridge. Very impressive structure.
Overview of the city and water. Not at all scary, but a little windy, so be prepared with a wind breaker, easy walk. Beautiful overview of the entire area from up there, a must to do!

Incredible. The Sydney harbour bridge is a must see whilst in the city! My family and I did the bridge walk and after spending 2 and half weeks travelling up the east coat it was the best thing I did whilst in Australia. Up the bridge you can see the incredible views of the harbour and listen to your guide talk about the history of the bridge and surrounding area. Definitely would recommend to anyone visiting Sydney!

So impressive. A true icon.... The Sydney Harbour Bridge is a true icon that should be viewed. It doesn't matter from what angle, from the Harbour, walking underneath, or driving over it, it is truly majestic. One of the best viewing points is from underneath and from The Rocks area. It is massive and you get a good view of all the rivets that keep the old girl together.

A MUST for your bucket list. Just brilliant. If you go to NYC you gave to do the Empire State and Statue of Liberty, the same applies here for SydneyEven on a cloudy day, it's pretty amazing.Some folk might get a bit worried about the height, my advice us DONT, it's so safe and well organised that you can't come to any harm whatsoever.The only slight downside is the cost, especially for a family.Otherwise, just brilliant

I'm sad. While in Sydney I obviously saw the bridge every day, especially from Sydney Boat Tours. Because I had been ill, I was unable to climb the bridge, so I am very sad. However it was just great to slowly sail under it and Andrew, who owns the tour boat, allowed me to take the helm as we went under. It still appeared magnificent, especially with the climbers on the apex. I am jealous.One day I will return and do it!
An experience in itself. Beautifully crafted this is a scenic experience that cannot be missed. the attraction gains full power when visited at night, Colours blend and the romance is enticing.
Beautiful!. Looking at the Harbour Bridge, whether up close or from a distance is always a breathtaking site. I love visiting or just looking at it at sunset. Beautiful!

Must do when you are in Sydney!. The trip to Sydney (for tourists) is not complete until you climb the bridge! I did it once a few years ago when I was there alone. This summer our whole family was back, climbed the bridge together. Our guide RICHARD is amazing, he is so knowledgeable, funny, made the trip so much fun!

Sydney Harbor Bridge Climb. If you are on a cruise or with a tour group, if you have the time walk to the offices on your own and you will save about $75 off your ticket. Tours book in advance so plan ahead. The walk itself comes after getting into one of the jumpsuits they provide. If it is in the summer, its best to strip down to your underwear before getting into the suit as it can get very warm. There are obviously changing rooms. The walk is not for anyone with a disability or trouble climbing and descending vertical steps (yes straight up) for around 100 steps and several other sections with less steps, but none the less physical requirement. You are wired to a cable, but will be exposed to ledges that give you views straight down several hundred feet, so keep that in mind if you are afraid of heights this will not be for you. If you are of wide girth there are also some tight spots to get through and step over. From the attached picture your climb begins to the far left and you proceed up to the top of the bridge structure, and climb that structure up to the midpoint of the bridge, then cross to the opposite side of the bridge and return down to your point of origin. No cameras are allowed, and only eye/sun glasses are permitted with a provided lanyard. Each group is broken down into about 12 people with a guide in front and back. They do take a personal and group picture for you at the top with the Sydney Opera House in the background. This is an amazing tour, one of the highlights of our trip. It was much more rigorous than we expected, but if you are accustomed to walking and can climb a ladder this will be a highlight of your trip as well. The guides were amazing and very well informed. Don't know how well the picture will show, but if you look closely you can see tour groups at the top of the bridge.

Bridge climb. Awesome views, great tour guide. Can't remember his name though. Was hubby's birthday present, he loved it. We went up at night. I nearly froze, even with the extra beanie and gloves. If you don't like the cold go during the day!

The climb was exhilarating, informative and entertaining. Loved the climb; our guide was friendly and knowledgeable. He remembered people's names and was highly entertaining. It is a bit pricey, though - especially when paying for four.

Great free attraction. Great free attraction, spend an hour or more just walking across this great structure. A Bridge climb is essential at least once in every Sydney siders life but for a less expensive option make sure you visit the Pylon, fantastic view over the whole harbour from the heads to the Blue mountains. All for a cost of $13 including the Museum and short history movie.
Worth the climb. Brian did the Bridge Climb - which isn't cheap but he said was well worth it. The views were fantastic.

New Year's Celebrations 2013/14. WOWMy first time in Australia, thanks to my best mate emigrating earlier in 2013.it's a bucket list opportunity for some people and I was lucky enough to get there before I have to add it to my Bucket List.Fantastic, well organisedAlcohol free zone, meant there was no trouble, and what you see on the TV in the UK is just the tip of the ice berg in the way the celebrations continue from 5pm in the evening, till the small hours.An early firework session, kept families entertained, while bands, boat parades kept the adults going till Midnight.A trip to remember

Bridge of memories. Amazing architecture, incredible engineering and a breath taking piece of art with great history. Whether you're driving, taking the train or even walking it, each experience is complete new one. Incredible views whether day or night. Although I probably should have been wearing trainers and not heels!
It is Sydney.. Walk it, ride a train over it, take the Bridge Climb experience, walk under it.It is the backdrop of a beautiful harbour and must be in every holiday photo album that has Sydney in it.

Awesome!. This bridge sits deeply in the psyche of most......the bridge, the bay and the opera house sit as one.......I sucked up the lot and loved every moment! I even took time to run across the bridge and back....and then on to the botanic gardens.....this space and place feels very special.....I have no links with it beyond the New Years welcome...but somehow the bay has some amazing grip on you......it's here one appreciates this place is very very special...enjoy! I did!
Go On Climb It. Don't just admire it, climb it, I'm no spring chicken but its suitable for most ages as long as reasonably fit and healthy and the view at the top well nothing compares - DO IT!

Amazing architecture!. It's such a beautiful piece of work, definitely a must see in Sydney! If you want to learn more about how it was built there is also a Pylon open to the public which tells you all about it.

A Must. You can't visit Sydney without walking across the Harbour Bridge. Start in the Rocks Area and follow the signs up the steps to the Bridge and across to Milson's Point. It is an easy walk and very beautiful.

Fabulous structure. You can climb and walk over the bridge, which I did not do due to the time commitment. I did however climb the tower, which offered fabulous views of the Opera House and Harbor. The exhibit (in the tower) about the building of the bridge was also very interesting.
It's so tall!. A great attraction in Sydney Harbour! Spectacular views over the water in mid-day. It is highly recommended!
Vista. A must to walk across on a beautiful winters day, Opera House sparkles under the sun light the harbour picture perfect
Wow. Nice view! I walked up one of the towers too, which provided an even better view. Did not do the bridge climb, because it cost a lot of money.
Bridge Climb. Brilliant! has to be on every persons bucket list. Well organised, and fun. Not as strenuous as people think the views are spectacular.

Good walk and fun. You do not need to spend your money on the towers, just walk across the bridge and pay for the tour of the two bridge towers (not walking on the span). Great views and VERY inexpensive with a free history lesson.

here with mom on her trip. had a chance to do the harbour bridge run. they had it on july 13. i came in the day before and had a chance to run it. also, last time, i had a chance to do the sydney harbour bridge walk on top. thats kind of nice. please do not take the parents. as for the walk across the bridge itself, it is fun. you will have to start from the rocks and follow the directions. its a lot of fun and great to see. the opera house is a neat sight from the bridge.have fun. please go.

climb the harbour bridge on a budget. Here is a tip from a local, You don't need to spend hundreds of dollars climbing the harbour bridge, you can do it for about $12.00. You need to get yourself onto the footpath that crosses the bridge from south going north, and walk about ten minutes until you reach the first pylon ( this is the pylon that is clossest to the Opera house) and from about 10 am to 5 pm you can climb up through the inside of the pylon and come out on the top. The views are still amazing and it won't brake the bank.

Lovely sight. Great to actually see it at last, and saw people doing the "bridge walk" wow they looked like little ants trooping up along the curve, not for the faint hearted but M sure it's a fantastic experience :)

Don't do it if you are afraid of heights!. My wife did the bridge walk, not me - a fear of heights. She loved it - but give yourself time - it takes a few hours. Pretty windy, but they tie everything on. One of those must-do's if you can handle the heights

Walk across the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Get down at Milsons Point train station , walk out of station and up the steps. You can walk the bridge from the city to Milsons point and then catch the train back to the city. In the colder months , dress warmly as it gets really windy on the bridge on most days.There are Shops on both sides of the bridge if you want to have a bite or a drink. If you stop for a few pictures and to take the view in , think one way it will be a lesuirely 15-20 min walk at the most.Best views of Sydney and its all free. Must do. This is not the harbour bridge climb which is a seperate and much more expensive exercisce.
Walking across the bridge. Walked across the bridge ourselves to Luna Park, Very accessible from Argylle Street and Cumberland street.

Australia Defined. The Bridge is a much loved icon of all Australians. It's beautiful to behold both from afar an atop, and any time, night or day.
I did the tour with teenage children a couple of years ago, and was left with amazing memories.
See it, climb it, enjoy it!
Nice to see in real. Every visitor has seen this bridge in books but nice to see in real. It is essential part of visit to Australia.

Beautiful and Easy Walk. Definitely walk across the bridge and walk all around the parks on either side. Also, there is a pylon where you can go up and get a better view of everything---it also has the history of the bridge documented. It's about $15 to go up the pylon (inside), but far less expensive (and less scary) than the $250 bridge climb.
Excellent. Liked all the view it was really busy with all the tourist but us in our 20's really enjoyed it definitely will visit it again
Awesome. Arrived last night and went straight past the bridge. The views at night spectacular. Really worth seeing. The opera house next to the bridge amazing photos. What a great view.

Out of Ordinary. Really enjoyed living in Sydney and visiting Harbour Bridge every month or so. So adventurous walk over the bridge with stunning views. Spectacular fireworks on 31st December on the bridge
Majestic. A beautiful human masterpiece, I have walked across many times, and also ran across many times in the evening after work which is beautiful.

The climb was awesome!!. What an adrenaline rush! We signed up to climb the Sydney Bridge. They fit you with special jumpsuits, radios and headphones so you can hear your guide. You can't have any cameras or loose objects. They give you lockers to put your things in. You are in a group of about 12-14 people and all of you have individual safety lines hooked to the railing. The guide will take pictures for you and you can purchase them later, You need to be able to climb ladders straight up and climb stairs. They give you a test run in the prep room where you climb a sample ladder and stairs. As the guide narrates, you climb and stop at certain points to enjoy the view. When you reach the top, the guide takes another picture of the group and any individual pictures. Then you cross to the other side and go back down from where you came. The views are awesome!! You can see the cars going by below and the occasional train that run along tracks next to the bridge. It takes about 3 hours total. It is worth every cent! If you want a real adrenaline rush then go for it!!

An Adventure NOT to be MISSED!. I'm an American that lived in the Sydney suburbs for 3 yrs. It wasn't until my last few months in the city that I finally got enough confidence to do the Bridge Climb. No doubt it's intimidating for people like me with height issues! However, I'm glad I faced my fears & did it- I'm sure it would've been something I'd regret! The views are truly stunning, the guide is incredibly patient and chock full of great history & information. I also felt very comfortable being completely attached to the line. Face your fear if you are afraid of heights- the Sydney Bridge Climb is a MUST for everyone!
Wow!. Awesome! It just has to be done! Amazing views, brilliant guide, if a little windy. Worth every penny.

A Must. This is a must for tourists and Sydney siders. Every one is extremely friendly and very knowledgeable. We went as the sun was setting so saw the whole city light up. The best view you will find in Sydney, absolutely beautiful
Photo opp. Took lots of good photos of the bridge from the opera house. Easy to pose all of the family members. Wish the tour to climb up the bridge was easier to organise.

Walk across the Sydney Harbor Bridge. The view from the bridge from a car or a bus is great. But it's only when you walk across the bridge that you can appreciate the glories of Sydney Harbor.
Not to be missed!

Walked over the Harbour Bridge (not on top of). We wanted to walk on top of the bridge but after the tour of the Opera House, We were almost as high as the top of the bridge. It was cold and a little windy the day we thought about doing it. I think if it was just me, the kids and some sunshine I would of went for it. You can pay $10 and walk up the tower for a better view and this might be a better option then climbing the bridge for $199-$300.

Sydney Harbour Bridge. This bridge is one of the sure access bridge from your way into Sydney, when driving through, make sure to look at the structure which is so magnificent. At night it forms a beautiful backdrop together with the Opera house and the water ways. Lovely sight and icon of Sydney

Even for an acrophopic , the bridge climb is not to be missed. Its an amazing structure to look at and the history of the making is very captivating but climbing it ...I thought I would skip.. I am acrophobic ... nevertheless , the more I hear about it and my gf's desire to do the climb , I decided to do it especially after reading about the accident free record of the bridge climb.Once we got there , I understood why it is very safe ...the briefings , the safety gear , the clothing provided , the training given and most importantly; very well trained and very pleasant to be around Climb Leaders.The journey up is around 20 minutes with plenty of stops and a lot of explanations about the structure and the history. Winds get stronger as you go up and you might feel that the wind will blow you away but do like I did , hold on to the rails as strong as you can :)I wasn't comfortable but I felt euphoric when I finished it ...was worth all the discomfort.
Great view. Fantastic sight. A priority must see in Sydney for the whole family and friends. Don't forget the camera!
A classic icon that never disappoints.. Viewed from any angle the bridge never disappoints. Take a walk in the botanic gardens to get perfectly framed pictures of both the bridge and the opera house.

Time of my life!. This was one of the best experiences of my life! I was a little unsure at first, but i decided as traveller to give it a go! It was absolutely amazing and the tour guide made such great efforts to make it fun! If you in Sydney you must do this!

It's a must do!. Finally climbed the bridge after countless trips to Sydney. Was amazing- the views were incredible (we had a clear albeit windy day). I'm not going to lying I was slightly pooping myself at the start of the climb as you can see right through the scaffolding you initially walk across, but that doesn't last to long until the real climbing of the arches begin. I was so proud of myself for giving it a shot, I'm not always so good with heights so it's def a sense of accomplishment and a memory with friends I'll have always. Give it a go!
Brilliant. Lovely to be at Darling harbour and see such an iconic structure. I really love vibe this city emanates. Wish I had more time there but will definately go back in the near future.
Gotta walk across!. I say dont go on the opera house tour, just walk across the bridge and get the best view of the city!

An Australian Icon. Never have climbed the bridge itself. But if you're after a great view, climb inside the pylon on the Rocks side of the bridge. You can take your camera and get nearly the same views that you can't photograph from the top of the bridge. Even if you don't climb it, viewing it from a distance, driving over it, or ferrying under it, are all nice ways to enjoy it.
Bridge Climb. Absolutely fantastic, even though I don't likes heights this was the most awesome experience. The view was fantastic and our climb instructor was excellent.

Don't miss the Pylon Lookout!. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is such a beautiful piece of engineering. Check out the Pylon lookout for fantastic views of the bridge and the rest of the harbour. There's a museum on the climb up; learn about the bridge's fantastic history.

Memorable walk across the bridge...looks just like the pictures. Seeing the bridge in person for the first time, after so many years of seeing pictures was exciting, but walking across it was memorable. Seeing the Opera House from the bridge, with the ferries in the harbor on a gorgeous sunny day was fabulous.

Amazing!!. The best way to see Sydney! Stunning views and very informative. Very sunny day so the views of Sydney were amazing and learnt about the history of the harbour and how one of the most iconic structures in the world was built. Although a little pricey it is a must do when visiting Sydney!

Harbour Bridge Climb - Unmissable. The bridge climb was one of the highlights of our time in Sydney. It does take a lot of time. About an hour from arrival to prepare and then 2 hours of climbing. This was an incredibly well-organised tour. The views from the bridge were incredible. The commentary and explanations given during the climb were extremely interesting. Onbly word to use to describe this tour is UNMISSABLE Unfortunately Trip advisor does not allow 6 stars

Beautiful views of Sydney Harbour from the bridge. There are great views of the Sydney Harbour from the bridge on both sides. I took the train over the bridge and enjoyed the views of the boats, city sites including the Opera House, Goat Island, the Rocks to name a few. I might try walking over the bridge at some time or even climb to the top. The bridge is very tall so being on top would be amazing.

A Sydney icon not to be missed. What an engineering marvel! Wherever you are, whatever time you're there, the coat hanger is such an interesting icon to photograph. Love the fact that the Bridge carries so many modes of transport. Be sure to visit the Bridge both in the daylight and at night.

Our unforgettable day climbing Sydney Harbour Bridge. We were a group 9 together crossing the bridge and were grouped with another 2 couples for our bridge climb. We had our trip booked a while and there was a cyclone about so it was a very wet climb, but we just laughed the whole time. WE were given wet gear so we didn't get too wet. The hardest part of the climb was at the beginning to get up to the height, but it was only just that the steps were a little steep but once you started crossing the bridge it was very easy. I thought we were climbing from one side to another, but we only climbed to the centre and then turned back and came back the other side of the bridge. However our guide was great and gave us lots of information and one of the couples got engaged on the very top of the bridge, which was great fun. It was much easier than I expected and we got some great photos taken by the guide. It was a great day out but I thought it was a bit overpriced.

Great Views from Sydney Harbour Bridge. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is great for many reasons. It's a nice short walk (maybe 15mins including lots of photo stops, one way). If walking over and back is too much, you can take the train to Milsons Point and walk back over the bridge. You get great views of the harbor, the Sydney Opera House, the Circular Quay and all the boats coming in and out. Once back over the bridge you are in The Rocks (which is another interesting area to roam) and it's free!Now, to get great views of the bridge, you need to be in the Circular Quay, the Sydney Opera House, along the coast of the Botanical Gardens on your way to MacQuarie's Point or take the Manly Ferry. Don't forget to see it at night lit up!
A must while in Sydney. The Iconic bridge is the perfect background for the sunset or the sunrise.If you are feeling adventurous you can even climb the bridge

Historic landmark, but not to spend a lot of time on. This is what many locals consider to be their most notable landmarr, so definitely worth checking out. That said, I didn't think it was necessarily that incredible or unique compared to other bridges I've seen. It does offer some nice views of the harbour though. We didn't do the bridge climb, which is time consuming and expensive - but did look cool.

Wow what a structure the Bridge is. Loved going under the Bridge in the ferries, we had the most beautiful weather too.We went to Watson bay and could still see the bridge from there, also park on ferries right near the bridge when it pulls into Luna Park.Really amazing structure

Fun! . We climbed the bridge at night and were not disappointed. The climb was not scary at all. I am scared of heights when I don't feel safe, but this didn't scare me one bit. When we got to the top of the bridge, we were lucky to have a firework show over the harbor. Our guide let us stay at the summit until the show was over. Could not have asked for a better experience! Our guide was very knowledgeable and the view was perfect.

A beautiful bridge. Before we arrived in Sydney, I really wanted to climb this bridge. I was really all set to give it a try. Then I tried to talk my wife into it. She's a good sport but that wasn't happening. Then I read you have to empty your pockets and can't have a camera. Then I saw how expensive it was and that was enough to discourage me.

Recommend heading up at night!. We the the bridge climb at night with a couple of friends as a birthday treat. It was a brilliant experience. You cannot take your own pictures, but they do take pictures of you at suitable points on the bridge.Definitely worth heading up at night, the lights are spectacular and the Opera House looked so beautiful.There is the opportunity to buy the pictures and extra pieces of mechandise when you come down. It isn't cheap, but is definitely worth it. You can't go to Sydney without climbing the bridge!

Iconic construction, best viewed from the water level.. Considered climbing over the bridge but chickened out. Fantastic views from P&O Arcadia which Sailed into Sidney Harbour and berthed in Darling Harbour overnight. Spent five fantastic days in Sidney so saw the bridge from many different angles and positions.

Breathtaking. Brilliant attraction for Sydney.The views are fantastic during the day and stunning when lit up in the evening, both from the side and from the ferryJust sorry I am afraid of heights as I would have loved to have climbed this.

Options. So the Bridge is there, you can't take photos when you get to the top. So climb the Pillar. View from the top is spectacular, lots of photos, lots of time. Very good option climb the stairs without the rip off!

Amazing. I drove over the bridge, not on my most recent visit to Sydney, but some months before with my family. Our children were gob smacked! It really is a great experience to drive over, and anyone visiting Sydney shouldn't miss the opportunity to pass over the bridge and admire this amazing architecture!
bridge climb. climbed the sydney harour bridge. did the twighlight clim and it was awesome. an experience not to be missed

Go up but not for the faint of heart. We went up the tower, fantastic view and lovely exhibition. I didn't fancy the walk up the bridge, I'm too nervous of heights. I do believe that it is exhilarating if you like that sort of thing!

Even if you don't want to climb it, still walk it.. Whilst not with the same excitement or awe as the Bridge Climb, consider the walk across the bridge. There's a pedestrian walkway on the Opera House side, noting the other (Southern) side is reserved for bicycles, which provides a great view over Circular Quay, the Opera House and the wider harbour. Tip - Should you just want to walk in the one direction, I'd recommend a short ferry ride from Circular across to Jeffereys Street Wharf, then it's just a short walk up through Bradfield Park onto the bridge - noting the view is more impressive on the walk into the city.

Winter walk. Walked the bridge today,what a fantastic experience, it was on my bucket list and although a little anxious to start with thoroughly enjoyed it very well organised and totally safe and even though the weather turned while we were out we were well prepared with fleece, waterproof, hat and gloves attached to our own utility belt, not to mention the radio headset our guide talked to us, keeping us informed of interesting features on and off the bridge, we were kept at an easy pace and he did a great job of the photographs. Best advice I can give is definitely wear the gloves the handrails are cold and I was glad to have them.

Walk the Bridge. I decided to walk from the Kirribilli end of the bridge to the city side ( about 20 mins). A lot of people had the same idea. It was sunny, the water sparkled and yachts, ferries, water taxis and rivercats moved along beneath us. At the other end, down the steps and along a bit was the Rocks with food and music and shops.

Walk it, don't climb it!. Walk across it and have lunch on the other side rather than doing the very expensive and time consuming Bridge climb. The views are just as good and you can take your camera.

You just have to do it. Excellent time. It really isn't that difficult as I was a little worried beforehand. The guide was great gave us some funny facts as we climbed. It is a bit pricey but you jsut have to do it. Also on the booking website it tries to get you to buy photos, I fell for this and went with a really expensive package when actually you can just choose different ones at the end.

Do the climb. While in Sydney the bridge climb is a must at sunset. early morning, lunch whenever do it you won't forget it. The views from the top are amazing and it's a life time chance. so book now and don't waste time!!!

A must do. Our girls are too young to do the bridge walk, so we walked the bridge. You can still walk along the bridge and get a great view of the harbour. You can then walk under the bridge and look up and marvel and the massive construction.

A "Must Do" when visiting Sydney!. Climbing the Sydney Harbour Bridge is an INCREDIBLE and UNFORGETTABLE experience! When there, buy your photo package at the end! It is worth the price. The pictures are beautiful and they also have kiosk that allow you automatically post your pictures to Facebook!

Must try the bridgeclimb!. The harbour bridge is one of Sydney's landmarks, and the fact that you can climb the bridge should be reason enough to visit. You'll be 134m above sea level and get to see the gardens and opera house and the rest of the city all in one place.
Top view. Guide was a crack up. Views were incredible. Climb was very easy, didn't feel high up at all. Price a bit on the high side but a once in a lifetime experience not to be missed.

Icon of Sydney!. You absolutely cannot miss the Harbour Bridge and I mean literally - you can see if from all over the city! I could not stop photographing this impressive masterpiece of architecture. We took a walk across the bridge on a blustery, cold winter day! We felt like we were going to be blown off but the views and experience were well worth it!
Scared. I was scared whit less but what an amazing experience. I would suggest you just go with the flow and let it happen!

Worth it!. My girlfriend and I had the pleasure of climbing the Bridge at night time. We started the tour at 16:25 and by the time you go up 17:25 or so, the sun was setting. Firstly the tour guide takes you all through (group of 12 I think) to get kitted up and do a mock test on ladders inside before heading out onto the bridge. (You can not take any of your belongings with you except any medicine which the guide will keep on them)The bridge climb really is amazing and throughout the tour you all have a RF headset with the tour guide telling you the history of the bridge and it's surroundings. The hardest physical bit of the climb is at the start. Where you are basically climbing a ladder. Throughout the whole climb you are hooked up to a secure steel wire that you cannot detach for safety. There is also always a railing to hold onto.A couple of interesting facts about the bridge based on the tour guides knowledge:• No safety equipment was used during the erection. You can experience what this felt like by stepping in between the steps near the top onto the rivets of the bridge (this is all they had for grip), really scary to think of being up there without the ladders and no harness!!• After the workers going on strike for danger money and being refused, the union requested the mayor to climb the bridge to experience what they are up against, he got to the top, looked over the side and basically said "give them what ever they want!" They got a 25% rise from that day on. • 16 people died during the erection of the bridge• Longest single span bridge in the world• The two towers at the bridge are not there for support - but for cosmetic.The bridge climb also comes with free entry to the look out towers, which if you have time is a nice place to take in the view and take pictures with your own camera. To finalise, the bridge climb is something worth experiencing and I would highly recommend it to anyone capable of doing it.

Walk the Across Bridge return on the Train. The view of Sydney from the bridge is fantastic--you can put the small boats, cruise ships, Opera House and surrounding gardens into perspective from this vantage point, plus take some terrific photos of Sydney and people who are climbing to the top of the bridge. If you don't have the money or time to climb to the top, for a few dollars you can take stairs to the top of a pylon about midway on the bridge that offers an even higher view. When you get to the other side, the train station is just off to the right and you can take the train (or catch a bus) back if you've had enough walking.
As perfect as ever...... This iconic bridge has the ability to look spectacular each and every time you look at it. No wonder it is one of the worlds most photographed.

Bridge Climb=Must do. There was an awesome view from the bridge and the guides provided a lot of interesting background information and facts about the area we would have never known otherwise. It really makes you appreciate the harbor and bridge on a whole new level.

excellent view. Rather expensive, but then you are paying for a wonderful view! Fully safe and harnessed in, you have three choices of which climb to take. Sunset is impressive. Lots of stairs to climb though.

Nice views and nice walk. We crossed the bridge by train and on foot. there are security every few hundred meters and we enjoyed the view. Not sure if the wind always blow on the bridge but it did when we were there. Noisy due to the cars and trains, but still awesome.

Great views, easy walk. Walking over the Harbour Bridge is amazing. We got the train to Milsons Point and then walked back into the city. The views are amazing and the walk is easy and free. Great thing to do if you are in the city. Takes about 20 minutes to cross the bridge at a leisurely pace. My kids 12 & 10 loved it.

Pylon is a brilliant place to view the Harbour. For a third of the price of the mostly unpleasant Sydney Tower experience, you can visit and climb one of the Harbour Bridge Pylons - the history of the bridge is simply and thoughtfully set out with a number of interesting displays and the views are stunning - you are hovering right over the Harbour, getting a stunning view of the Bridge and Bennelong Point and you're in the open air. Highly recommended.

photo opportunity. It's very popular to climb the Bridge and that's is wonderful for those discerning people, but for those of us with our feet stuck a little more firmly to the ground, THIS is the alternative. Walk across the bridge - it's free and safe and what hundreds of commuters do everyday to get from one side to the other.You can also climb up the inside of the towers (on the Opera House end) to get a history of the building of the bridge, focussing on engineering aspects, the statistics and the social and political back story to the building of the bridge.And you get great photo's of the Harbour from up here.

A must. When I went here, I heard this was a cool thing. Now, looking back it was the pinnacle of all things we did. The view, the staff, and the experience stay with me. Great suggestion and great memory. Do not consider, just do it!

Stunning views. Stunning views over the city and beyond. You can appreciate the history of the settlement from the beginning. Beautiful stunning city can be seen from miles around from the amazing vantage point. Just don't go on the beer the night before.

A long way up for official photo taking session. (I made this trip in April 2013 and didn't write a review then)There is a lot of prep for this rather pricey climb. It is not as difficult as it's set up to be. The ascent is not at all hard and moves at a grandfatherly pace.I think there are too many restrictions with regard to no cameras. I think that tethers can be provided or be a requirement.There's the annoying wait at the top as the guide becomes the official camera person to take a shot of everyone in the group. Then they sell you an expensive CD of photos.I felt it was a bit of a letdown.

Walk on the Wild Side. Awesome walk over the bridge with excellent guide. Lovely sunny day made it very enjoyable. An hour is taken up with getting kitted out and all the safety stuff, so the walk is only 2 hours. It is VERY VERY expensive.

great experience. This is almost the best thing i have done. The day was clear and you could see for miles on top of the bridge. the tour guide we had was Bernie was amazing. I thought the price was reasonable for the climb but the price for the photos after were too expensive.

Great exercise. Walk across the bridge (you don't need to go over it!) it's great exercise (but watch out for the ever present joggers) see the full expanse of the harbour laid out in front of you. All for zero cost.

iconic bridge. I traveled across the bridge while on my way to darling harbour. Its one of the best bridges in the world. I want to do the over bridge walk next time though I got an eye full from road level.

One of my favourite memory's!. Walking across the Sydney Harbour Bridge was just amazing! My partner and I experienced it together and I would recommend it to anyone! It was windy but you feel so safe as you are hooked up to the bridge as you move. We have some fantastic photos and brilliant memories of this wonderful walk.We experienced this climb in the day and now I want to do one in the evening/night to see how amazing Sydney looks at a different time of day!DO IT!!!!!

Walk across the bridge. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is lovely and a marvel of architecture. It's definitely worth it to walk across the bridge via the pedestrian walkway. The views of the harbor are spectacular. It took my husband and I about an hour to walk over the bridge and back at a leisurely pace, stopping frequently for pictures. The noise and smells from the traffic going over the bridge is a slight annoyance but easily compensated for by the views. It's a very easy walk and is suitable for all ages and physical levels. Definitely worth it.For an additional fee you can go into the small museum they have there (we didn't do this so I can't rate it). For a large additional fee you can walk across the top of the bridge (I'm not so keen on heights so again we didn't do this and I can't rate it - but it is quite high off the ground!)
Beatiful to see. An excellent spot to see in both day and night. You might also catch a glimpse of some of the cruise ships which are awesome.

Unreal. Honestly was a bit hesitant that this would be boring but I was proved wrong. Great guide in Bernie. Really interesting and seriously impressive views. I left with a sense of achievement and some very cool photos. It's not physically taxing at all and it's something I'll never forget. Definetely do thus or you'll regret it.

Sydney's Landmark. It does not matter whether you go over it, under it or around it. This bridge is Sydney's beautiful landmark. To take full advantage of this wonderful structure, take a night cruise to see the bridge in all it's splendor. My only regret was that I did not have the time to cross it by foot ,nor was I in physical shape to tackle this challenge.

A must see when in Sydney. The bridge is old, big and an amazing sight. We walked across it and saw the city lights at night. There are expensive climbs (about $200 per person) to climb the bridge, but we didn't do that option because of the expense.
This Bridge Must be Seen. This bridge must be seen, it exceeds anything anyone could ever say about it and its construction and its architect.

Don't miss the bridge climb. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is great to look at (especially at twilight as the lights come on) and it's great to climb. The3 view of the city is excellent and again a twilight climb is a good idea if you want to see both day and night views of the city and harbour. Aside from an initial ladder, the climb is pretty easy. Expensive but worth it.

Great experience and what a view at the top!. Took a team of friends some local who had never climbed the bridge before, chose a good day could see for miles. The staff were terrific we had one nervous walker who was made to feel quite at ease particularly going up the ladders.
A truly iconic bridge. I have been under the bridge, Kirribilli side, and it's fantastic. The view was amazing and the bridge view from there is a truly different perspective.

Twilight bridge climb. This was a very unique experience, highly recommended. Definitely not cheap but it was worth it to do it once. Twilight climb is nice because you walk up by day and spend sunset at the top and then walk down when the city is lit up. Really easy climb up, they take a ton of breaks (too many). If there was a twilight express climb, it would be perfect. 4 stars only because of the price compared with the Skywalk, which was 1/5 the price and had similar views and experience.

Best when seen from a ferry or opera house. It is best during sunsets and seen best from ferries and opera house. We didnt do the climb but i guess the city view or the opera house view from there would be good too.
Sydney Bridge. If you come to Sydney, this icon is a MUST SEE. If you are adventurous and in shape you can do the bridge walk. Nothing says SYDNEY like this bridge and the Opera house.
Nice walk and great view.. Walked the harbour bridge during the day and at night for free following cahill walk. One side is for bikes and opera house side for pedestrians.
Well worth walking across. We enjoyed walking across the entire bridge then catching a train back over it. The Pylon Lookout is worth the money - amazing views over the Harbour

Take a hike across the bridge. We took a (long) walk across the bridge from the Rock. When we were there, we had a lovely view of the bridge and the Opera House. We then walked to Luna Park area and took the ferry back to Circular Quay.

Great experience. Just knowing you are crossing one of the most iconic bridges in the world is quite an experience, the views from it are beyond words. The only thing I noticed is that people like to leave their trash behind and that is a pitty

Recommend the bridge climb twilight. Me, my husband and mother in law chose to do the twilight bridge climb. The staff are very knowledgable and kit you out for the climb. You have to walk out on wooden boards above the roads then up 4 ladders then you start climbing the arch. At the top we watched the sunset which was an amazing experience never to forget. Then you make your way back. It was great. If you do go to Sydney do this!

BRIDGING at Sydney. Sydney's attractions are easily accessible by trains.Circular Quay was the station I alighted to walk around the warfs, which connects a lot of attractions by the ferries.The station and the surroundings is great for a walk around for shopping for souvenirs, clothes, food and also for taking pics.The walk leads to the opera house and also to the harbour bridge.I have to record that the people were extra friendly, and always willing to help.
Beautiful landscape. We saw the bridge by day and by night, by land and water. It was always a lovely landmark for photos.

good views. It is must while in sydney to walk the harbour bridge. It isnt for the faint hearted though it takes quite a while to walk halfway and back. Was awesome to see the metal work close up and the views were amazing.
Walking. We caught the train to North Sydney and then walked back so that we could walk over the harbour bridge. It was a great experience and the views are wonderful.

Worth a visit. Most people visitSydney to see the Opera House, but to me the main draw became the bridge. It is simply stunning, especially at night. We walked both across it and over the top (during the day) and both are well worth it. I loved it!

Never Tiring. We often take time to walk over the bridge from the Rocks to Kirribilli and North Sydney. You can also cycle over the one side of the bridge although we have never done it. Spoil yourself with a Bridge climb. A bit expensive but something to cross off the bucket list

Don't be scared!. Choose a sunny day (not too breezy) and you will be treated to the best views in the city from the blue mountains to the Pacific Ocean and 360 degrees round the harbour. The whole walk takes about 3 1/2 hours with excellent preparation and guiding. You will get to the top of the bridge which looks scary from below but you are clipped on and the stairs and walkways are so wide you feel very much as if you are on terra firma.

unforgettable experience. I almost didn't do the climb because of my fear of heights, but it is my most memorable experience of sydney, the staff are friendly and definitely know what they are doing, during the climb you get a lot of information about the history of the bridge, the harbour and sydney which I found very Interesting, you are completely secured and I couldn't have felt any safer, you aren't allowed to take any of your belongings on the bridge which is a shame because I would have loved to take some of my own pictures as the views are amazing, however it is for health and safety reasons and completely understandable, the climb is completely worth while and I would definitely do it again, once I got to the top it all became a bit of a blur but for good reasons I GOT ENGAGED :-) not a bad way to propose at all, the views are stunning !!! If your planning a trip to sydney soon then book a bridge climb it's not to be missed x

It's a national icon!. I love the bridge. In response to how feasible it is in 2014, such critics need to get a grip. It was built in 1932, after construction started in 1923. The population of Sydney, in 1930, was about 1.2 million people. It was a monumental achievement. The bridge connects Milsons Point (a small village with some good eateries) to The Rocks (great pubs and some great restaurants nearby - Circular Quay etc).I have climbed the bridge (Bridge Climb) and was impressed. I climbed the inside arch and got up to the top. The 360 degree perspective of Sydney is awesome. However, if you don't want to splash out on BridgeClimb, then do not worry. You can climb up one of the pylon's. It costs $13.00.It is the distinguishable point of the city. NYE wouldn't be complete without it. Sydney is less of a place without it.

Fantastic. Climbing to the top of the bridge was a brilliant experience and not to be missed. A bit scary at first but you are well secured so there is no fear really. The views are amazing, you have to wear an overall and not carry anything but it really is a must. You can go at different times of the day and evening so next time when the lights are on would be so different.

Unforgettable!. After spending 6 weeks in Australia for my 60th birthday, I have to say the Bridge Climb was the most memorable experience of the entire trip. My nerves were settled once I realized you climb with a safety harness and are attached to the structure. Even though the training session and climb takes three hours, the climb is easier than I had anticipated. Once you reach the top of the bridge, the views are breathtaking. I would definitely do the climb again if I ever have the opportunity to return to Australia.

Walk across this iconic bridge for free - the views are amazing. My husband and I have walked across the bridge many times and we usually try to do it each time we are in Sydney. I am a former Sydneysider and I just love the whole harbour area, I never get tired of it's beauty. Why anyone would bother with the ridiculously priced Bridgeclimb is beyond me, you can walk the length of the Harbour Bridge anytime you want for free. Granted you are not up as high and the view is somewhat obstructed because of the mesh security wire, but you can still see the whole harbour area and it is so lovely, especially at night. Be warned that the bridge is of course used by buses, trains and cars so it can be somewhat noisy. I like to get the train to Milsons Point and then walk across back to the Circular Quay end, I then walk through the Rocks area and get a coffee. I highly recommend this experience to anyone visiting Sydney.

Bridge climb. If your looking for an adrenalin rush then your looking in the wrong place. Done the climb with a group of friends and for me what made the climb was the company.the climb is way overpriced to slow , not thrilling , but the group I went with I had a ball with. No I wouldn't do it again and at the price I probably wouldn't recommend it .
Brilliant climb. Yes the Bridge climb is way too expensive, but we only live once. My daughter wanted to go so we went. I enjoyed the view very much.

Bridge Walk... Across., not up !. Yes.... You CAN walk across the bridge without going Up !!! We walked from The Rocks across the bridge to Kirribilly, had lunch at a lovely little pub, had a wander around then walked back across the bridge. It was just lovely., a balmy day, fabulous views and the walk is not hard (as opposed to climbing "up" the bridge ) the path was wide and you are totally safe. So glad we decided to do it. It's a pretty steep climb up from rocks to bridge, just take your time, there's not too many steps, if I can do it.....

Iconic view. I've only walked across the bridge, not done the bridge climb over the top. But the views from the bridge are something else.One word of advice - the path on the west side of the bridge is for cycles only. We walked nearly halfway across before getting stopped by security and turned around, because we were on the wrong side. (What?)) It was 1:00 am, and there wasn't a cyclist to be seen.

A Wonderful Experience of a Lifetime. I am a little "old in the tooth" and didn't quite know what to expect.My wife decide against it and went for a tour of The Opera House instead. I think that I got the best deal by far.Climbing was easier than I thought and we were so lucky with the weather which was sunny and very little wind. The views were beyond expectation, there was so much going on below, with the coming and going of the ferries, just amazing!!!!I would do it again tomorrow, given the chance, it was certainly one of my all time favourites.

Crossing on foot. This review is more for people who wish to walk across the bridge on foot. You take a lift from Circular Quay (on your right when you face the water) and you start walking along Cahill Expressway for quite a long distance before you get on the bridge itself. Along the way there are ample prime spots for taking photos of both the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Sydney Opera House. The bridge is a long way across (don't underestimate the distance!) and you will be braving strong winds, traffic fumes (plus vertigo for me). However, you will be able to take excellent, unobstructed photos of the Sydney Opera House from the front. Once you reach the other end, you can take the stairs down, cross under the bridge, and make your way to Luna Park where you can take further (still stunning) photos of the two Sydney icons. To finish, you can take the ferry from Milson Point (right next to Luna Park) back to Circular Quay.

Great View when you climb to the Top. We took a hike to the top of the bridge. The entire bay was below us which give a unforgettable view of the Opera House, Board Walk, Reflecting Ocean waters, Boats, People, which was truly unique experience.

Lovely!. A really beautiful bridge as seen from any location. Great for sunset views and excellently located at the Sydney Harbour with good accessibility from the Opera House. A must-visit when in Sydney.

Bridge Climb. The Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb is amazing. The climb going up is the hardest, the descent is much easier. Fabulous views. Do the Twilight climb as you go up in daylight and back down in the dark, the views at night are amazing! The Climb is definitely a bucket list event, do it while you can, it's worth the cost and is a once off Must Do!!!
Climb of your life. Just stunning! Very safe and a great experience. Need to be reasonably fit, able to walk. Fascinating history and the views are stunning. Highly recommended.

Breezy Bridge Climb. We did the team building exercise on 24th June, and it was doubtful that the climb would happen due to the high winds in Sydney at the time. We arrived about 4pm and it takes a long time in preparation until you actually get going, but the attention to detail & safety is excellent. It was dark by the time we started the climb, and we soon experienced the chill factor - average wind gust was 86km/hr, with gusts reaching 125 km/hr!I am 58yrs, overweight & out of shape, but this was still easily achievable.......and not as scary as the Story Bridge climb in Brisbane, as the steps are covered below you (when you look down).The views are excellent, the staff are amazing....and do not forget to have a look at the history of the bridge back at the starting point - it is quite incredible.Highly recommended. Note: No cameras or mobile phones allowed on the climb.

Worth the money!. I did the Bridge Climb on the last evening we were in town. It wasn't on my bucket list but after I got up there I realized it probably should have been! I did the first evening climb (15:55) and got the benefit of seeing the city as the sun set and as the evening lights came on (it was a bit cheaper too). The staff prepared you and made you feel safe at all times. I was glad they gave us a fleece to wear -- it was cold at the top. Be prepared to dedicate some time -- it takes over three hours -- but worth it.

Sydney Bridge Climb. I would most definitely recommend the Sydney Bridge Climb when visiting Sydney!!! It's the best way to get the best views of Sydney. Although it's not the cheapest day tour it's so worth it! Most of the locals haven't even tried it but I would do it again!!

Gotta love the Coat Hanger!. The Bridge is THE Sydney icon. However, not only does it look good but, nearly a century after it was planned, it is still a great transport link. Genius to build it so wide in the 1920s - particularly in contrast to the awful decision to build a just a 2 lane tunnel in the 90s.

One of Sydney's best recognised icon. Enjoy great views of the harbour by taking a walk across the bridge. Great photo opportunity from the south pylon viewing platform whilst enjoying the 360 degree views

Walked our socks off, but worth it!. We were staying at a hotel near the station, so bought a big bus day ticket to explore the city. The nearest bus stop was not far from the bridge, but quite a climb. A good footpath and lots of steps take you up onto deck level. We then walked across the bridge and admired the breathtaking views, sharing the deck with both cars and trains. Others would possibly climbed the cables, but that was not for us. We left there and walked along the elevated walkway, over the ferry jetties to get some striking shots of the bridge. A free elevator then deposits you down on the quayside on the approach to the opera house. Plenty of walking, but well worth doing. We picked up our big bus at the quayside after lunch and a opera house visit

Amazing. Climbed the harbour bridge it's amazing it is expensive but worth it went to the Great Barrier Reef snnorkling great been all over as my daughter lives there bondi beach is not what it's made out to be
breathtaking views!. great sights. we walked end to end and enjoyed the harbour view. especially the cruise and small boats from the top and above all opera house was a lovely view!
Worth seeing in person. Especially if you get lovely blue skies or one of the night time light festivals. Absolutely worth paying for a bridge climb.

Must see. One of the great icons of the world I think.
Walking across the bridge on the pedestrian walkway is a must-do if you visit Sydney. It's amazing views from both sides of the bridge.

Great view but pricey. It was a challanging climb and a little scary at times. The views were great, but the guide kept us moving so we could not take in the views for extended periods. At $250AU it was a little costly .
A great view. Such a picture postcard view, but walk to the other side closer to the Rocks, and then view is really amazing as you also get a different view of the Opera House

Imposing. The Coat Hanger, as the locals are supposed to be calling this, is an imposing monument and hung around us like a portrait in the home drawing room, during our visit to Sydney. All the time, we seemed to be going around it - in some form, fashion or way. Not at all complaining about it because it was just imposing and very very impressive to be there.
Sydney Bridge Climb. I climbed the Bridge. It is not as scary as I thought though thrilling because it is a new experience. Our Climb Leader was helpful and great! Such a pleasant experience!

Wow. I did the Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb with my two teenage daughters. We were given the bridge climb vouchers as birthday presents before we left for Sydney, otherwise I'm not sure I would have booked to do it. I am very unfit and have a dodgy knee so was rather concerned about whether I would make it to the top, and the instructions you get before you set off are so thorough they didn't do much to calm my nerves. But it really isn't too hard at all as you go at such a slow pace with the fantastic guides giving you information all the way. The only part that was quite strenuous was climbing the ladders but there is no rush and it wasn't a problem. Once you get out on to the top of the bridge it is incredible. The views are breathtaking and I could have stayed up there all day just watching everything that was going on below - the traffic whizzing past, the ferries constantly nipping in and out of the harbour, the people including a bride and groom having their wedding pictures taken, the opera house, etc, etc.We had two guides during the trip and they were very informative and really fun. They got the group talking and enhanced the whole experience. There were several stops for photographs, the group one is included in the cost of the climb. Luckily we had some credit from the vouchers we were given and instead of just having to forfeit the difference,we could use it to purchase additional photos, so we have some excellent shots of the three of us. They are almost too good as it looks as though we have been superimposed on a shot of the opera house.Throughout the trip we felt very safe and secure. You are connected at all times by way of a strap, and the outfits and caps (which you get to keep), and all the accessories are well designed. There are a couple of water fountains on the walk if you get thirsty.Altogether an excellent experience.

I recommend the road level bridge walk. My recommendation is that you take the ferry from Circular Key to Kirribilli . From there you can stroll through Kirribilli (including Admiralty House), enjoting the views back to the city, and then walk from the Kirribilli side of the harbour back into the city. This way the whole vista of the city opens up in front of you. The bridge walk ends up in the Rocks on the Sydney City side of the Bridge.I have walked the bridge the other way but you find yourself looking over your shoulder most of the time

One of the best bridge walks in the world. I mean the footpath from North Sydney to The Rocks at traffic level. It is an easy walk and the views are stunning. Its safe, free and accessible to everyone.

One of the most amazing experiences I've had. The Sydney Harbour Bridgeclimb was just wonderful. It sounds kind of scary at first but I believe that anyone can do this. Sounds like it can be quite exerting but it's not really. You go with a group with a guide and you're constantly stopping for photos (and to catch your breath!) I went with two other friends and we all paid for the climb and the whole picture package which promised around 12 photos. Kind of expensive but WELL WORTH IT!!! Amazing views of the harbour and city from the bridge! The whole experience was very well organized, from filling out the paperwork and doing a breathalizer test, to the issuing of their equipment and clothing, down to the preliminary obstacle course (which simulates all the different types of obstacles you'll encounter on the bridge). This part takes about an hour but if you don't feel comfortable or change your mind during this time, you can. I think that's why it's so organized and can be lengthy. During the climb, the guide/photographer snapped photos my group individually and with us as a group. When we went to select our photos after the climb, because we had all paid up front for the picture package, they gave us all our individual photos along with any of the ones we took in a group. Way more than the 12 promised! It was such a great experience, that I told everyone about. My parents ended up visiting Sydney and I was telling them they HAD to do the climb. They flat out said no, they're too old (They're both in their early 60's but both pretty active) but I guess they ended up doing it and loved it! Said they were both so glad that I talked them into doing it! Fun for people of all ages!
Iconic.. We visited this iconic bridge from a distance and up close. A lot more metal close up than I thought it would be but glad I saw it in the flesh.

Bridge climb. It's not as difficult as it seems. Even people with a fear of heights would be able to do this climb.
The view is spectacular. Safety is a high priority. Our guide was very informative and interesting. The whole event took around 3.5 hours which included gearing up and a practice climb. Enjoyed it thoroughly.

Just do it. Do the bridge walk. If you miss this it's like going to Paris and not seeing the Eiffel Tower. We did the sunset tour and it was incredible. The tour is about 3 hours which includes an hour of prep work. They go at a nice comfortable pace. Our guide was well versed and very interesting to listen to. If you have a fear of heights it isn't that big of deal, my wife was really worried about it. But the cat walk are plenty wide, and hand rails and tethers help with the sense of security. It also is not that physically demanding. The hardest part is 4 sets of steep steps. It was really worth every dime we spent.
Gorgeous view!. Something fun and exciting to do if you can spare the time. A unique and great experience, and a breath-taking view to boot!

Worth every penny!. Bianca is an awesome guide! All the staff are friendly. The night view from the top is breathtaking! :) If you are contemplating about going for the climb due to the price, let me tell you...it's worth it! Great experience and I enjoyed it a lot!
