These are the same steps the maintenance crews use to work on the bridge.Is it Scary? NO - you are 100% safe. You ware a harness that is attached to a cable the whole time during the climb. The cable/harness system is setup so you can NOT unhook even if you wanted to do so. Also the route is enclosed with hand rails on both sides of you and each side has a lower, middle and top rail so there is no way to even slip out of the path.We did the evening climb in the Dark and Rain and it still was safe and fun and what a view from the top of the bridge. You can't bring a camera so you'll have to rely on the photos the staff take and buy them at the end of the tour.My wife and I rated it 2nd only to Scuba Diving the Great Barrier Reef (which we love to dive)

Excellent. My husband and I booked this tour through our travel agent and we thoroughly enjoyed it, the guides are so informative and knowledgable. Our safety was paramount we would highly recommend it.
Sydney icon. Oh, yeah. You've seen on tv, internet, friend's photos... Time to see it for yourself. This bridge is Sydney. Take the guided climb. No regrets.

Steel behemoth. If you want to follow Oprah's footsteps. Book a walking tour at the very top of the bridge and see one of the world best cities in full 360 view. If you don't care much for heights, you can see the mechanical marvel anywhere around the pretty harbour.

must do excursion. If you are in Sydney I would highly recommend the Bridge Climb we did the Discovery Climb and it was amazing getting to see underneath the bridge and be told all the information about the bridge and then popping out at the top of the bridge. The best part was it was quite a hot day and because we were under the bridge of most of the climb we did not get sunburnt.

Expensive and Worth It. We heard about the Bridge Climb Experience and I immediately asked my family. All were up for it. This was a very expensive day out but it was one of the most memorable things we did in Australia, I highly recommend it. There is no fear of falling as the restraint system and jumpsuit you must wear all but precludes any danger. I would suggest that even people who are not accustomed to strenuous exercise will have no problems with this at all. The view at the top is work the expense. DO IT.

Amazing experience. We walked the Harbour Bridge on Good Friday. You are professionally prepared and taken through the walk to the top at a safe controlled manner with a very informative history of the bridge. Our young host Emily took the time to ensure everyone was not rushed and heard all the key information through earphones. The walk is expensive however the bridge is iconic and the views at the top are awesome. You will be well kitted out in proper gear and continually harnessed. Secure lockers are provided as you cannot take anything onto the bridge except spectacles. Be warned you are breathalyser beforehand. Highly recommended.

One of the best vantage points of the harbor!. Completed in 1932, this bridge cost the lives of 16 brave workers during its construction.Definitely a must do for any visitor to Sydney. If you don't want to spend too much, you need not go on the bridge climb, or pay to go up the the Southeast pylon- just walking across and back will reward you with stunning views of the harbor if its a beautiful day!

The bridge climb - never again. At first I was very concerned as I am absolutely terrified of heights (even though I am a roofingcontractor). Kitting up and briefing by staff fine, first part of climb - thought to myself, can't do this too frightening even with safety harness and line on but as there were women in front of me, some over 70 years old and not showing signs of bother i thought, I had better do this. After the initial shock and worry the horizontal walks and the vertical climbs between the road way AND the railway were a bit frightening but once you get on the main spans it's fantastic. The views arephenomenal and the stress of the climb almost disappears for me it did anyway. To anybody in or going to Australia and in particular Sydney, do it, climb the bridge. It's scary if you don't like heights like me but perfectly safe and one of those things you have got to do before you die.Brilliant.

Iconic Sydney . The bridge climb is way to expensive when you can walk the bridge for free but the bridge is so iconic to Sydney it's almost a must do and see! It's beautiful I promise stop and enjoy the sights!

Incredible experience!. Absolutely worth the money for this unbelievable experience. We did the late afternoon climb so got to watch an amazing sunset over the blue mountains from the summit. The views are incredible up there & it really is one of the must do's for Sydney. The bridge is iconic & to view the city & surrounding areas from such a landmark is brilliant. The climb is suitable for any level of fitness as it's taken at a nice pace that allows you to take in 360 panoramic views of Sydney. The climb leaders are great at calming nervous climbers, and once you're up there you completely forget any fear you may have had. Unforgettable experience, can't recommend it enough.

You can walk the bridge. The Bridge climb takes you to the top of the bridge. Unfortunately it rained when I was there. I also feel there are other vantage points that can give you a better view of Sydney Harbour

You have to have a photo standing near the bridge. The bridge is of course one of the most recognised structures in the world and we spent some time taking photos. It is so expensive if you want to climb it. I'm afraid they would have to pay me to climb it, not the other way round !
climb is interesting.. yeah, so the bridge is just a bridge, but the climb is so so worth doing. Views are great and the whole experience is so nice.

Bridge Climb. Where else would you get the opportunity to Clamber over one of the worlds iconic landmarks.Truly breathtaking,with views of the Opera house,out towards Manly and back to the city.Quite expensive,but when you consider the experience and the time spent up there well worth it.
Bridge climb. Well worth the cost of the climb, 2 climbs available, we went up the middle to the top and were rewarded with fantastic views from the top....

Great climb. Expensive. No photos. Climbed the harbour bridge. It is quite expensive and you can't bring anything with you. They give you free access to the bridge pylon so that is where you can take your photos and get some great memories. I'd recommend doing this first if you can.

Fantastic experience... A "Must Do" event.... A most iconic structure... You MUST take a walk over the top of the bridge... Very professionally carried out, breathtaking... Views of the harbour, circular quay and the opera house that cannot be beaten.... Don't worry about the height; It's not a scary experience... Well worth the charge and so memorable... When ever you see the bridge in the future you can say " I've stood on the top of there".. Priceless.

A stroll across the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Just wander down George St and follow the signs through the Rocks to get to the footpath that takes you over the Bridge. There are great views over the Rocks, the ferry terminal and the Harbour and the Opera House.
great view!!. A must do in Sydney. You get to see the great views of the city on top of the bridge, hear great commentary from your guide.

Sydney Icon - the Harbour Bridge. The bridge combined with the Opera House are must see Sydney icons, it is easy to include both in a picture. To experiene fantastic views and to learn the history of the bridge, nothing beats the Bridge Climb. It is not strenuous and takes 4 hours from start to end.
1999. I walked over as the sun was rising. It has amazing views of harbour and coast. Some great pictures can be taken.

Don't just look at it walk it!. You don't have to do the harbour bridge climb to enjoy this bridge. From The Rocks area some steep steps take you to the edge of the bridge. A protected walkway is flat and easy to walk across and you can get some terrific views of the opera house and surrounding areas.

Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. Just fabulous. Was very apprehensive in doing this climb on our trip, as not a lover of heights but wow and wow again if you get chance do it, the view are fabulous and it worth the money.Safely is second to none and the guides are very helpful . you have a chance to climb the ladders before actually going out in a mock up, you are hooked up all the time and secure from the moment you leave base camp till you return after the climb. They took some lovely photo's of us at different stages of the climb. Once you have climbed the ladders 4 in total only small ones its just like walking up a steep hill with steps to the top.so so pleased I overcome the nerves and did it.
GREAT!! do the CLIMB~. Seeing the bridge is a must and if you can, do the climb. great way to learn about the history of the city and at night the view is spectacular!!!

You cannot miss seeing it if you visit Sydney. It is great to look at from any vantage point but if you get a chance, walk across it. You can catch a train or bus back. On the other side is beautiful Kirribilli full of restaurants and bars. You can also go to Luna Park.

Gateway to Sydney!. It is impossible to miss this icon while on the harbour. The gateway to Sydney, it welcomes all those who come to visit. Citizens, tourists, old and young, the Sydney Harbour Bridge represents the harbour town with style, grace and elegance. She stands with pride and embraces all around her and is the focal point on New Year's Eve as she entertains thousands from around the world with a spectacular fireworks display. For those who are fit and enjoy exhilaration, try the Harbour Bridge Climb where the views are nothing like you will ever see again and a memory that will last forever.

Yes!. Walk across the harbour bridge in Sydney. It's among the best free things to do there. Excellent views, and worth looking at the information about its construction on the way. You can come back by train, or walk back. Highly recommended.

Walk, Climb or Drive over Sydney Harbour Bridge. This is a magnificant masterpiece. Enjoy it from near or further away.Overseas visitors will love it especially with the Harbour, Rocks and Opera House right there too.

A must. Nice walk around the boulevard area lots of places to eat, I went there in the mid afternoon once and also at night on another day. Different view and feeling. Do it if you have the extra time to spare, I did.
Excellent experience. I liked the total experience of bridge climb. The way they prepared us for the bridge climb to the amazing view we saw on the top and had great fun seeing the sunset.

Excellent experience. Amazing experience - a must do!
Once you are up there it doesn't feel that high so don't be worried if you are afraid of heights

Bridge Climb - Fantastic Experience. This is a must do if you're going to Sydney. We had a lovely clear day which made the climb even more worth while. It was very well organised and our guide, Joel, was very knowledgeable. The climb caters to all needs. My husband is petrified of heights (It was his choice to do the climb, I hasten to add) and he really enjoyed it too.
You have to do the climb. It is the best way to view the harbour and see all the other features, still want to do it at night to see the lights, can't wait

The Pylon Climb is a comparative bargain. As many travelers have commented, the view of the Opera House from the bridge is excellent, even if you don't do the bridge climb., and is well worth the walk. If you don't have the time (3 hours plus) or the dollars ($250) for the bridge climb, the Pylon tour provides a cost effective ($13) option. The Pylon (one of the 4 towers incorporated into the structure) has several informative displays, a short movie and a view from the top that is exceptional (although clearly not the same as the top of the bridge).It is highly recommended.

It's a bridge… but we love it all the same. Go down to the quay for your photographs, best view of this bridge is from here. When you drive across, you won't see view. I hear people climb the bridge these days. Good luck with that! Sydney is beautiful. Take a ferry from the quay for a good look and some great photo opportunities.
Good. Its a beautiful bridge to view. From the bridge you can view the opera house which looks stunningly beautiful. You can walk along the bridge to take glimpses of sydney.

Do the bridge climb. If you can the bridge climb is a must. You have fantastic views from all stages of the climb. You do not need to be a super fit athlete but of reasonable level of fitness. If you get the opportunity do it.
Climb. I did this climb it was amazingVery safe ,a bit challenging from the climbing ladders point of view Amazing vies and a great sense of achievement

amazing views. We did the sydney twilight bridge climb which i fully recommend.Was really scared on the run up to it and the steps unto the bridge are really steep but wow what a view. it was so worth it the views are second to none the staff are friendly and know so much about the bridge. such a fantastic experience would really encourage anyone who has the time to do this

In iconic part of Sydney. If you are Sydney for any length of time, walking across the bridge is a must. There you get the best camera shots of the Opera House, and walking across is absolutely free. You can climb the bridge with a licensed guide for a couple hundred bucks, but you have to leave your camera down for safety reasons. So I would recommend just walking across it.
Climbing Sydney Bridge. I'm sure this is a great adventure and a "must do" for many people, however, you must book ahead of time, therefore I didn't get to do it. Just be aware the cost is about $240

Wonderful experience but...... I really enjoyed the Sydney Bridge Climb. The night climb is amazing and beautiful. Yes you can walk across the bridge at street level and have great views of the harbor but they are not as great as the view you have at the height of the arch. There are two route to climb. The outer (the highest arch) and the inner. I climbed the outer and believe it has to be the best. The views are great but you are unable to take a camera on your climb. Understandable as any thing that falls to street level could be detrimental to those below. There are at least 5 photo spots on the bridge were your tour guide will take pictures of you or the entire group. One picture is included in your climb then the first purchased picture is $25 Australian dollars. The remainder are less. The climb was enjoyable because of the information imparted by the tour guide about the building of the bridge. Do not expect a quick climb. It takes about 45-60 for safety and outfitting and then another 2-2.5 hours to climb. You start with a questionnaire then a test for alcohol. You are given a climbing suit and fitted with a climbing beat, fleece, head set, etc. You then have to practice on a simulated bridge climb. This is all before you climb the true bridge. There are groups going on the climb every 10-15 mins. This in itself prevents you from having a fast climb. My climb took over 3 hours total (safety included). There was a delay because the cast from Modern Family took pictures on the bridge ahead of us and then the group climbing in front of us had a proposal at the top of the bridge. Be prepared for a delay. It is not a difficult climb. It has great views. It is pricey. You also get free entrance to the tower at the end of the Bridge. You will have good views with the ability to take pictures.

Must do when in Sydney. There is so much to see and to do around the Sydney Harbour Bridge, the least of which is the walk on top, I am sure. Definitely take in the sight from various vantage points - the Ooera House, the ,many great restaurants, the ships in the harbour and especially the people! You can spend days watching it all and still enjoy more.

The coathanger. Maybe I'm biased but there are some imitations (like the bridge that you see from the tower of the Empire State building in NY - its only half the size in comparison, we have the best)If you don't mind the heights then you can also climb it and what a great view and photo you would get.You can also walk over the bridge, drive over and catch a train over it, as well as sailing under it. The best I like is when you have been overseas on a holiday its always good to look out the plane window and see the bridge and Opera House, its our welcome home icons.

Surperb viewed from The Opera House.. We enjoyed the view from the Opera House and watched the line of walkers going over the bridge.We wanted to do this but found it far too expensive and time consuming nevertheless it was fascinating to see the people as a tiny little line of individuals trekking on top of the bridge.

Breathtaking views!. 7 of us did the bridge climb and it was awesome! we ranged in age to 75! no one had a problem with the climb it is really quite easy as you stop a lot to take photos and enjoy the view and listen to info on how the bridge was built. There are a few ladders to climb first which is not hard but the climb itself is easy. The staff were wonderful, funny and had loads of interesting info to tell you. The views over Sydney Harbour are just breathtaking! I don't think there is a harbour in the world as beautiful as ours! Well worth the $309 I would definitely do it again!
WOW. The number one thing to do in Sydney - if you're afraid of heights, make yourself do it anyway - you won't regret it. About two hours total, from check in to finish. Expensive, but worth it!
Dull. Maybe worth the bridge walk, but apart from that dull and uninteresting. Forth Rail Bridge in Scotland lots better.

Great views walking across the bridge. There is a spectacular bridge walk on over the top or in the inside arch, but it may be too pricey for some. The walk across the bridge may not be as thrilling, but its still affords you great views back to the opera house and outer harbor. I did it as a jog and it was great exercise as there are some stairs to climb as well to but from The Rocks up to the roadway level of the bridge. I stopped for a delightful lunch in Kirribilli on the right side of the bridge then jogged back. A great way to spend several hours.
We climbed the bridge.. Great bucket list activity. We did it at night which was magical. even if you have a fear of heights. DO IT. My wife has and she did it and loved it.

Walked over the bridge. For the first time I walked over the bridge. Driven over rit many times. It is a great vantage point to see Sydney Harbour, the heads and the opera house. Its about 1.3km across and the same back, all on a dedicate pedestrian area.

Picked the free option. Decided to just walk across the bridge on the pedestrian walkway as it cost me nothing and I knew that I’d be able to see spectacular views for around $30 when I visited the Skytower (big saving on the bridge climb prices). For me it was the best decision. It was a lovely fine day, a bit breezy but the walk was easy with lots of opportunities to just stop and take photos along the way. Just loved it.

Enjoyed the walk to here and on it. It's really quite a majestic view, especially you are able to see the whole of Circular Quay from here, taking in the view of Sydney Opera house also at the same time. There's also a Pylon lookout where you are able to get even higher up. Didn't go for it though, already getting palms sweaty when taking pictures from the bridge (afraid of dropping the camera), but if you're in for some adventure, should go ahead and try out the Pylon lookout.
stunning views from up here. This is somewhere you have to visit if you're coming to Australia. The views are unbelievable and the tour is great value for money.
something romantic. if you want to spent some good time with partner go for this place. a place to be loved been there really fabulous.
Bridge Climb. Bridge Climb was one of the highlights of our trip. Simply awesome and worth the money! Great view even thought it was raining when we climbed.

It is just a bridge. When you think of Sydney, you think of the bridge and the opera house so of course we wanted to walk across the bridge. Initially we were going to pay and do the bridge climb but our travel agent gave us some great advice to just walk across the main bridge which was free and the views were essentially the same. We were glad we listened to that. The bridge was just a bridge - there is nothing grand about it once you are walking across it. It did allow for some nice photos of the opera house and harbor from some different angles, but if you are short on time and have to choose whether to walk across the bridge or do something different - I would chose the "something different." It was quite windy when we were there and I was told that is common so keep that in mind if you do decide to cross. Also, the traffic was very loud.
Amazing. Just go for a walk in the night time with your loved ones, it will be so romantic. Please take a jacket as it rain anytime during April-June.

Easy, even with asthma!. I wanted to do the bridge walk but was worried if my asthma would hinder me? I booked at the Tourist Information Centre in The Rocks area of Sydney and they reassured me the asthma should not be a problem. I did the bridge walk at 13.35hr on 30th March 2014, at the end of my month long trip to Australia. Some say pricey .... but it was sooo worth it! The whole process from getting ready to doing the walk is finely tuned and you feel safe and reassured from the start of the walk. You get to know the other participants on the walk who were all friendly. The views are outstanding, at the top you get the chance to shout as loud as you can, take in the fresh air, contemplate the walk up and the beautiful views ..... a very reflective time at the top. Oh yes, the asthma? The walk guide carried my ventolin inhaler for me in his pouch, but the stops along the walk meant I could catch my breath normally as the pace was good ... so no ventolin required!! Bonus! ;o)

Good view. Why did not I do this earlier?!. Nice leisure walk, windy and good view. Perfect to combine with the Sunay market at the Rocks! We returned to Circular Quay and ended with dinner at the Wild Fire just before the Terminal is to be renovated. Highly recommended.Wonder why I did not do this earlier despite many trips to Sydney! another page added to my travel journey on blogspot. nice! Highly recommended

Free walk across the bridge. We didn't want to do the Bridge Climb but wanted to experience walking across the bridge. We started at Circular Quay and took the elevator up to the 3rd floor above the train track. Once there, you walk toward the bridge until you hit the bridge path. Keep walking, and it will take you across the bridge. We passed another entrance at The Rocks. The pedestrian path is only on one side (Opera House side), so you can't see off the other side. But that is ok because the views are stunning, and you can spend as much time as you like looking at all of the scenery and activity in the harbor.We went all the way across and then walked back. You can get off the bridge and take one of the ferries back to Circular Quay if you like. The Hop-On Hop-Off stopped as we got there, and some people took it. We wanted to just enjoy the experience of walking it again.The walk costs nothing and takes only time. Reminded me of walking across the Golden Gate Bridge but was warmer. Would do it again in a heartbeat.

No different. Like a lot of similar places it's just a large metal bridge, with a road, train and walkway crossing over.I did not do the bridge climb therefor I cannot comment on that.but as someone wrote on it and I quote 'same s*!& different place'.

nice cityscape sight. took a walk from the opera house to the bridge, taking pictures and sight seeing is worth it, don't even cost a cent. Lots of place to eat along the way starting from the opera house to the bridge. I took some pictures along the way and it was just so nice. Wait till sunset when the light are still there and the opera house starts it's light shining on the dome that's when it's the most beautiful time.

Impressive looking bridge. We didn't do the bridge walk, but as part of a 4 hour bike tour we biked about halfway across the bridge and back. One can do the across the top of the bridge walk -- strikes me as rather expensive ($200+) for that, especially as one can't bring a camera.

Easy to walk across the Sydney Harbour Bridge. My husband and I took a nice walk from the Rocks across the bridge. We did not have enough time to do the Bridge Climb ( It takes like 3 hours) so we at least wanted to walk across! We went close to Sunset so the views and buildings looked awesome. There are two look out places that make great picture spots and plenty of walkers to help you get a good photo. We saw lots of families walking with their children and couples too. Nice stroll and a must in Sydney! We got some good photos of the sunset as well.
Worth a walk. Take a stroll across the bridge - treat yourself to fish and chips on the other side and then get the ferry back from Luna Park - wonderful!

Climb The Bridge!!. If you are here, definitely try out the Bridge Walk. It might be a little pricey, but its a once in a lifetime experience. The guided tours up to the top of the bridge is relatively easy, even for those as unfit as myself. The staff were very friendly and made the entire adventure extremely enjoyable. Does take a bit of time from beginning to the end but well worth the time and money spent. Give it a try!

A great sight. Tho we did not walk over the bridge on this visit as I had planned. I took lots of pictures from Rocks and Sydney Opera House where you have great views of the bridge. We did drive over it in a bus heading to Palm Beach, well maintained looking and good flow of traffic across it. Plenty of people on bridge climb.

Walk it…..IF you dare :-/. We took the BRIDGEWALK….a few in our group of 50 were understandably nervous..but if you have EVER stairclimber (like in a gym) then you CAN do this with ease….they take small breaks on the platforms, to take in the views…rest…grab water, etc….you are FIRMLY attached, given a suit, hat, ear listening device, etc…to ENSURE your safety. It was fun! During our walk, we saw TWO weddings happening in a park below…..many cruise ships sail under the bridge, better able to SEE the varying SIX lanes of traffic, the Opera House, to the city hustle and bustle. It was a rather cool way to START OFF our trip…..HIGHLY Recommended GROUP activity!!!At the conclusion, you can buy photos, videos…etc…They actually PROVIDE you with ONE free pic, which was nice in and of itself.

Excellent views of the harbour. Excellent views of the sydney harbour and well signed to get onto it. Don't bother doing the walk or pay to enter the towers there. The view from the bridge is sufficiently nice. :)

You can hike the bridge..... For you adventurous types, you can book a private hike up and over the top span of the bridge. A memorable experience that takes a bit of fitness but is doable and the views are spectacular.

Nice Experience, Better ways to spend your money. Climbing the bridge is a nice a experience do not take me wrong, The guided tour was really friendly and also enjoyable, however my suggestion is to spend your money in another place. I would say that is way too expensive for what you receive in change. Although the view from top of the bridge is nothing more than spectacular, forget about taking your camera, phone or any other thing with you, not even a goPro attached to your helmet or chest is allowed as they are taken from you as you enter and saved in a locker, so your memories will have an "additional charge", I understand the safety requirements but I believe that are better solutions rather than restraining you to use your own photographic equipment.At the end of the day was a nice experience but a taste of disappointment is still present.
Awesome. Must experience for all travelers. Great views and gorgeous experience. There are bridge climbing also available, but I did not opt for the activity.

On the Top Down Under!. WOW! What an experience to climb this superstructure. Put your nerves and fear of heights aside as this experience places safety first as you are harnessed to a cable at all times and are with tour guides who ensure that you are comfortable at all times. After getting suited up and removing all items on your wrist and in your pockets (lockers provided) you are instructed in the skills of climbing up and down what are essentially a series of ladders used to get to the actual arch of the bridge. Once there, it's a relatively easy walking climb to the top stopping as many times along the way as you'd like to take in the spectacular view. We did this climb in the late afternoon so that we could be at the top to watch the lights come on in Sydney. I'd highly recommend this time as it was truly beautiful to watch evening fall from atop the world. Your guide takes lots of photos so although cameras aren't allowed on the climb, you will have a record of doing this. Don't miss this!!!
Another great attraction in Sydney. A very busy bridge linking N and S Sydney. Popular bridge "walks" available , where you climb the arch, 'way above the water, with a guide and safety harness.

Best thing to do in Sydney!. We went on the "twilight" climb, which started in daylight & by the time we had reached the halfway point it was just turning to dusk. The views are sensational, the guide we had was very friendly, explained all the facts about the 'bridge & answered all the groups questions & was very "easy going". After we had started to descend, our guide asked us all to stop, turn around & look at the magnificent sunset over the Blue Mountains. He took most of our photos then, & he explained that he had been doing the 'bridge climb tours for 7 years, but he had never had this opportunity to take such great pictures with the sunset in the background. He was chuffed, & so were all of our group! The climb is not "scary" (I am not "fond" of heights!), but VERY safe & well worth the little bit of physical "exercise" it took to do the climb, certainly not strenuous or dangerous. Costly, but worth it for the experience.

Epic!. It has to be seen to truely get a sense of how striking this bridge is! If your not so keen on spending the $180+ to scale the bridge then I highly recommened climbing the south east tower for just $11. There is a great bit of history on the making of the bridge and the view from the top is just as good as from the top of the arc. I was surprised to find how interesting the making of a bridge could be too!

Once in a lifetime. The experience took 4 hours from the time you start orientation to finish. It was a good experience but only something you do once in a lifetime. Great view and great history! Personally the tour guide we had made it from my perspective. He was fun, well informed, and very accommodating!!

Loved the Night Climb!. My sister and I booked the night climb in February. It was a wonderful way to appreciate Sydney's skyline by night. We had already been up the Sydney Tower Eye during the day. The night climb was perfect for my sister - who was a little hesitant at times with the ladders. The guides were very supportive and encouraging of everyone on the climb and there is no race to finish first/pressure to hurry along. The night climb works out to be a little cheaper too - coming in at $198AUDpp. We also pre-booked a 2 pack of photos for $30 (they also provide a link for you to upload these directly to Facebook!). You get given a souvenir hat, 30-second video (that you can upload to social media), a group photo and certificate. Remember to wear fully enclosed footwear. My sister had on Sketchers, which covered her toes and heel, yet because they only had a Velcro strap across the top of the foot, she was given Volleys to switch into. They provide beanies, cloths (for sweat/tears etc.) and straps if you have glasses to secure them. You cannot take cameras and/or any loose items. You wear a headset to listen to commentary provided by the guide. This was perhaps our only negative. Our guide was very difficult to hear in the training and with headsets on. Nonetheless, she was lovely. Oh and when they ask you to strip down to your jocks/knickers - they are serious! (Don't worry this happens in a change room) The overalls are thick and they also provide wet weather trousers - so I'd imagine you'd certainly overheat. I thought the joke was on me!It was a wonderful night on the bridge that ended with a great sense of achievement.

There isn't a better place to see the city. Please make it a point to try and squeeze in a trip to the bridge a day climb if you've the stomach for heights. The photos are incredible and the view is pretty phenomenal.
the hanger. the wife did the climb in the morning and I filmed here from the harbour not for me because of the hights but she filled one more off her bucket list it looks great

A sight to see!. This bridge is a must see, but then how can you not see it from nearly anywhere around the downtown. If it is out of sight it soon looms again in the distance as you ride the Hop On-Hop-Off. Did go to the bridge but one gets a better view from a distance.

I Climbed the Bridge. A must experence if visiting Sydney. At around £135 the Bridge Climb is not cheap but well worth the cost. It is very well organised and the staff are extrenmely helpful and friendly. All gear is provided within the cost . The climb was not as strenuous as expected and with a party of around 12 persons the guide gave us ample number of rests throughout the climb that accommodated all abilities. Very safe and the views from the summit are fantastic. Even on the Bridge the temperatures get fairly high during the day so i recommend booking a tour (takes circa 2 hours) for early morning. I booked 9.00 and that was fine.

If you have a head for heights this is a must. This is certainly an experience of a life time. Very well managed and brilliants group guides. The safety features ensure that nothing untoward can happen. Certainly set a side a whole morning. There are various times that can be booked, early morning, afternoon and even evening to see the setting sun. A truly magical experience and not too difficult even for a wrinkly as my self. Also included in the price was two tickets to visit the towers of the bridge, which can be shared with others that do not want to climb. Very expensive but a memory of a lifetime.
Best free thing to do in Sydney. This is a lovely walk with fantastic harbour views. A must do in Sydney. Great views of opera house, cruise ships and surrounds.
a must. The walk was spectacular , the view was fantastic , very high up , makes you realize how tall the bridge is , a great tour , reccommended .

Fabulous Views. I walked across the Sydney Harbour Bridge starting from the elevator at ground level in Circular Quay, stopping to climb the 210 steps ($13 Aus) in the first tower (amazing views) and then continuing across the bridge to the opposite tower. This was not the "Bridge Climb", but just walking across on our own. We could have walked a bit further across and found our way to ground level and taken a ferry back to Circular Quay, but in the time frame that we had, we turned around at the furthest tower and walked back across. From the bridge I finally got to see the Opera House from the angle which I have most often see in movies - when you're standing beside (or near) the Opera House it is difficult to put all the pieces into the proper place to make sense of it all. It is a beautiful walk with stunning views and really gives another perspective of the Sydney skyline.

WOW!. Suit up, take the training, put on your safety belt gear and hard hat then away we go! The best time to go is an hour or so before sunset. Typical stupid government story trying to stop this adventure experience from happening. The guides are well trained and friendly. The views en route are amazing as its great to snake your way up to the top. The photo they take and offer is awesome . . . . we took our own!
Bridge Climb. A must do. Great sights and learning about the building of the bridge was very interesting. It was all so well organised and very safe

Get More For Less!. Sydney Harbor Bridge is as iconic for this city as its famous Opera House, and we had made up our minds before we arrived to swallow the outrageous $200 pp cost and climb its arch to the peak. Well, the Bridge Climb is not what we expected, and we are glad that we decided NOT to do it.First, it took us quite a while even to find the place where you pay your money and join a group -- we had to ask directions from a police officer we happened to see in the restaurant where we stopped for breakfast.Second, we learned that we were required to stay with a group and we were NOT permitted to bring our camera with us! While we can understand why this regulation exists, we were not about to spend that kind of money and be denied the opportunity to take any photos. That rule was a deal-breaker for us.However, we learned that we could climb one of the south pylons for only $16 per person, and while doing so we could stay up on the observation deck as long as we wanted, AND -- most important -- we could take all the photos we pleased! This opportunity struck us as a genuine bargain, and we jumped at it. This is not a long, dull climb, either. After every few courses of stairs, there was a landing with exhibits, a souvenir shop and friendly people willing to answer questions. And the last thing you see when leaving the pylon is a short film about how the bridge was built. This was a fun and interesting thing to do, and we recommend it!We took dozens of photos (the viewing platform offers a 360-degree walk-around, with views in every direction) and enjoyed the experience. This is a far more reasonable way to enjoy the SHB and the fine views it affords.
Bridge. Just walked across on our own. Great picture taking for Opera House. Access is in the Rocks area. If was a fun way to explore the harbour

Unique experience to climb the bridge. We walked there from nearby Park Hyatt and pay $13 for entrance fee to climb the pylon (200 steps). The views from up there are nice and we could see that some people were climbing the arch of the bridge. We did not have enough time, but it certainly was an interesting experience judging from the way people climb it...

Harbour Bridge by Ferry. We took the ferry from Circular Quai to the small zoo on Kings street and crossed under the Harbour Bridge. You have a great view on the bridge and the Sydney Opera House behind - enjoy.

An Insured Trek on Top of the Bridge. The harbor is so big that you really have to see it from more than one vantage point. Of course, there is the opera building and all the boats and ships to watch. Right now Sydney is beginning to lose it's place as the number one port in Australia to Melbourne. Both cities are about 4.5 million people.Anyway, if you like bungee jumping this is the bridge for it. The activity that I have never seen until the Sydney Harbour Bridge is a group of people trekking on top of the bridge. Not on the roadway or the walkway at that level but up above -- part of the structure that keep the bridge from falling -- on the curved part. There are people who do this very thing. The cost is over AU$250 to go with a group of people who are suitably linked together across the top of the bridge. It's windy. The high cost for a walk is the cost of insurance. This walk is for the strong of heart. It was the most amazing use of a bridge that I have yet to see. At the very top of the bridge the view is breathtaking. (So I was told since I do not have a passion for walks that are on architecture that is very high and windy.)

Lots of Hype. Before leaving home everyone we encountered said we had to climb the SHB. Once we got there, I enjoyed looking at the bridge and learning about its history, but walking across the bridge was good enough for me.Actually we were one of the few people who were walking across the bridge. Sounds like a lot of hype and marketing to me. Walking across the bridge was free and you could take all the photos that you wanted. We had great views of the city and the Opera House. The last I checked it cost over $200 to climb the bridge and it monopolizes half of your day.

the one and only. you have to walk the bridge if you want to say you've been everywhere and done everything man! The views are of course amazing-both up and down-up you can watch the brave souls aka fools who walk over the top-not for me!! and down of course it's the Opera House ,Australian naval base, sailors etc. Do it from the Rocks and then catch a ferry back from Lunar Park.

An iron monstrosity. This massive structure, which has served to welcome visitors to this wonderful harbor for decades, is a huge disservice to this city. While its technical functioning, with 6 lanes of traffic, two pedestrian walkways, and a rail line, has doubtless been critical to the city's economy, the sight itself is jarring, the polar opposite of the opera house. Its oppressive mass was perfect, no doubt, for futurism and art-deco, with their deification of the industrial age, but that time is gone. Bridges now seek to appear light and elegant. I hope this great city will find the means and will to do something about this (as they have in another part of the city, one, unfortunately, much less visible).
awesome. if you get chance, have a walk over the bridge, you get some stunning views of the harbour, opera house etc.

You don't need to do the bridge climb for a great experience!. For just a few dollars you can skip the bridge climb (for hundreds of dollars) and go to the top of one of the pylons! The views are fantastic and you can take pictures, which you can't do on the bridge climb!

Bridge climb. Scary but so glad I agreed to do the Bridge Climb. The first part is the hardest as it's so steep but the actual arch of the bridge is quite gradual. We had a wonderful guide who kept talking the whole time so that we could hear his voice through the ear-phones. I realised half way up that this was just a ploy to keep our minds from focussing on the drop beneath but we were very secure, attached to the wire run right the way along. Surprised that we only climbed one half and descended the same half but it was still quite an achievement. Loved it.
What can you say!. The Harbour Bridge along with the opera house, symbolises the city. It's graceful arch is beautiful , it's an engineering marvel and the views from the footpath are stunning.

Walk or run but dont miss it!. Go for a walk across the bridge or at least half way across for fantastic views of the Bay. Bikes are allowed only on one side of the bridge so you don't have to worry about being run over unless it is a jogger. It is difficult to photograph through the protective fencing but it is possible to climb the tower (fee) for incredible views straight out!

The walk is free. Just walked across the bridge. We were lucky enough to have perfect weather for our stay. Great view of the city and harbour. Once we got to the far side, we could have caught the ferry back to Circular Quay, walked back over the bridge or taken the train... All very readily accessible.
iconic structure. I have visited the Brooklyn bridge and the San Francisco bridge and I have to admit the Sydney harbour bridge was just as magnificent.
Do the Bridge Walk!. Not to be missed, so worth the money! How often do you get to say, I just walked over the top of the Sydney Harbour Bridge! Surreal!!!!

Awesome. This was a big plus for me...I am not fond of heights but decided to do this as I knew I would regret it if I didn't. Pricey but there's no alternative. The views are amazing and once you're on the arch of the bridge it's fine. Staff are brilliant and make sure everyone is at their ease. Organisation is first class....which it would have to be when they get a climb every five minutes in the height of the season. I was lucky, into Autumn and there were only nine in my group. Choose early in the morning as it's cooler or even the sunrise climb. Night time is said to be stunning too. Guess whenever you go it's brilliant. My husband didn't want to do the climb but received a free entry to the south pylon so he could photograph me. Each climb ticket includes free entry to the pylon lookout any time during your stay.
Great day out.. Sitting there watching people climb the bridge is good, dont think I could ever do it myself but likes watching others do it.
Spectacular views. Spectacular views, great tour guides, Maria was so friendly and knowledgeable. The 360 degree views are truly amazing, the guides take photos so wonderful memories to take home,

It defines Sydney. Probably more than any other structure, even the Opera House, this defines Sydney. It is still difficult to explain - it is not unique and I have seen similar bridges in America but for some reason, it symbolises Sydney I see it most days from my window in Sydney and it dominates the horizon, it is even more special at night with a sunset behind it.

This experience is worth the price!. When my friend and I decided to visit Sydney, the Bridge Climb was at the top of our list. It was a bit pricey but completely worth it. We had an amazing experience. The tour is well set up and professional and we felt safe the entire time. The views were fantastic and we actually learned a lot about the history and construction of the bridge on our tour. I would recommend buying a photo package before hand because you aren't allowed to bring your own cameras or phones on the tour.

Has to be done. Wow this is a great experience and well worth the money. From start to finish it is professional, well run and very informative. We did the 1615h walk and had Steve has our leader. He was great, lots of good info, lots of time to enjoy the whole thing... we had 2 nervous climbers, who Steve supported and his choice of stories and language was brilliant at calming any fears anyone had. Highly recommend this attraction. I would guess all the leaders are like Steve, it seems a very well run organisation. Good fun, go do it when you're in Sydney.
Photo Opportunity. If you are looking for photo opportunity, this is a place to capture the bridge as well as the Opera house. Great view.
Anyone can do it!. All my little worries disappeared as we walked and talked. The greatest part is the climbing. The view is a bonus.!
A scenic treat of architecture!. This old suspension bridge is a sight to behold. I would strongly recommend taking the ferry to the Opera House and you can see the bridge in all its glory!

View from Above. Although my wife was a little hesitant to do the climb, once we got in and say how professional and organized they were, she was a little more relaxed. Our guide was very knowledgeable and made sure everyone was relaxed and had a enjoyable experience. Definitely something to do and see while in Sydney. The views from the top are exceptional and it is not really hard climb.We did the express tour which was about 2 1/2 hours but it goes by pretty quickly.Really had a good time and would do it again.
beautiful. especially at night time!!! should go for the sunset so you get the both of day and night views of it
Do it!!!!. No trip is complete without doing the bridge climb. I was unsure at first but am so glad I did do it. E tour guides no all about the bridge and the views are magnificent.

A 'MUST'. It's a bit expensive but it's an 'once in a lifetime' event. Well organised and can take up to 2 and a half hours. It's not as difficult as you may think. Our guide Darren was very informative and had a good sense of humour. We were not allowed to take any cameras or phones but you receive a ticket to visit the Pylon Lookout whenever you wish and you can then take your camera.

Bridge Climb. I am not a person to tackle heights but this was the best thing i could have done to climb the bridge. Amanda was a magnificent guide and made us all feel safe the photos were great,the view spectacular,the cost worth every cent. I wore my bridge climb blue cap for days after,my certificate is framed on the wall and my photo too. I am so pleased i did this i recommend this to anyone with a fear of heights to overcome it.

Sydney harbour Bridge walk. Great views, we walked across and got the ferry back. The walk is on the seaward side only. Go under the bridge on the North side and down to the ferry. You can do a climb over the top, its high and steep.

Absolutely awesome!. On a visit to Australia was given this experience as a birthday treat..wow what an experience it was!.. Something I wanted to do but not being very keen on heights was a bit apprehensive.. The three hour tour is fantastic. The safety aspect is taken seriously with a comprehensive overview and dry run before you start the real thing.. The guide is very informative and friendly and soon puts you at ease.. A complimentary group photo and certificate are given to you at the end and the opportunity to purchase a personal photograph of yourself plus a free video message sent to your e mail address..I understand this is not a cheap attraction, however it is a must if ever in Sydney.. It is certainly an experience I will never forget and the views from the summit are amazing!

Take the Low Road. No need to splash out on the commercial bridge climb when you can just do the walk across. The views are almost the same ... spectacular ... and you can save the climb tour cost to buy great Australian red wine.

Expensive but fab views when you get to the top. Not a cheap thing to do but really glad we did it. Extremely well organised from arriving to leaving. The tour starts with a safety briefing and health questionnaire, plus being breathalyzed . Next you get kitted up and then move onto the actual bridge climb. Prior to going I phoned as I was worried that I may not be fit enough to get to the top as there are around 1400 steps, I was told that you needed to have a reasonable level of fitness. I must have underestimated my fitness and to be honest I found it quite easy so need not have worried. The guide was extremely knowledgeable and very friendly. One group photo is included and you can email the photo home. Views from the top of the bridge were great.

A 'must do'?. This is not a cheap activity but a 'must do' for many. We did the twighlight climb and had the sun setting over the distant Blue Mountains and the lights of Sydney coming on; a magic experience. The guide / climb leader was friendly and knowledgeable and allowed people to go at their own pace. Everything is so safety first that you are never in any doubt that it is well managed. My one criticism is that, whereas spectacles are secured to your person, this option for cameras is not available and you are limited to (a) the photos taken by the climb leader and (b) expensive photos then 'having' to be purchased. They could have made some money by hiring the cameras securing gadgets and allowing photos to be taken by individuals. The person responsible for bringing the climb into reality had to overcome 64 objections from those in authority; it is a shame that the 65th was not overcome also.

It's very big!. We climbed all 200 steps up into the Pylon, so we had a fabulous view out over the Opera House to the Harbour, not to mention being able to see the carriageway, railway and footpath over the bridge and crazy people climbing it. We could see down into Circular Quay, where the ferries come and go all the time and there is always a huge cruise ship moored. The day we went up it was the Rhapsody of the Seas.

Excellent Climb. The Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb was amazing and so well organised. There was alot of health and safety to go through, which is to be expected, but the climb itself was breath-taking, and the guide was very informative.

Lower walkway also impressive. I found the cost of walking on the top of the Sydney Harbour Bridge to be prohibitive so I decided to walk from one side of the bridge to the other on the sidewalk at the roadway level. The views from this level were impressive enough and I had a lot more $$ in my pocket at the end of the walk. The distance from one side to the other is approximately .75 miles so a walk over and back was an easy 1.5 mile hike with good views of Sydney Harbour and the Opera House.

Great Bridge. Everyone who goes to Sydney has to go the the Sydney Harbour Bridge.Amazing structure and the history to go with it.Really well maintained and great area to have a meal with a view.A must in Sydney

If you have no fear of heights...do it... The bridge walk speaks for it`s self .. a must for adrenaline junkies.. When I was there all ages were taking part .. but beware.. any sign. Or smell of Dutch courage and you will not be let on. Do even think of it if heights are not 4 u.. you will wind up the whole group you are with, if I did it again, a night walk is the one to go for

Great Views. If you are up to the walk this is one of the most amazing picture ops you will find .We walked the bridge amidst commuters and jiggers alike and took photos along the way. We later realized however that there is a bridgewalk where they bring you to the top of the girders in harnesses did not try this part too high for my liking but I am sure the views and photos would be even more spectacular

An impressive masterpiece of engineering. The Harbour Bridge is simply a must-do in Sydney. Although walking over the top is somewhat expensive, it is definitely something you must experience. The view of the City is simply impressive, as well as the bridge structure itself. The museum is Ok.

It made our day. We were really excited by this experience. It was a pleasant surprise. The weather was nice, no wind, a few clouds. The clump was not hard at all, the view was stunning. Our guide had a lot of interesting facts to tell about the bridge and the city. We did it!

EXPENSIVELY EXCITING. There were many people who shared their thrilling experiences climbing the Sydney Bridge. I was full of exhilarating and anticipation during my visit to Sydney. However, It hadn't occurred to me that there was a cost associated with the climbing adventure (DUH), but I still wasn't deterred. I surveyed the bridge and was more determined to make the climb. Off I went to make my payment...until the full cost was revealed (close to$200-depending on what time of day you select). My budget couldn't stretch that far, so I opted to walk the bridge and visit the museum located in one of the stone pillars. My stroll allowed me to interact with some local school children, other visitors, and many locals. The view was wonderful and I fully agree that it is a must do in Sydney. Even the shock of the astronomical fees to climb the bridge didn't deter my excitement and enjoyment of my adventure.
Thrilling. We walked across the bridge, not over the top (for lots of money). There were a lot of tourists walking with us, as well as locals who were jogging across.

A head for heights. If you have a head for heights then this a must it's absolutely brilliant the views are outstanding you can't leave Sidney without walking over the bridge. It's a little expensive about £125 per person but well worth it.

Walk the Bridge!. This was the first place we stopped when we arrived in Sydney. We all walked the bridge, got great views of the city and the Opera House, plus got to see a ton of people. We took the stairs up to a little museum inside one of the stone blocks. It was well worth the few bucks. The Bridge is a must do while in Sydney.

Bridge Climbing. Best way to watch the Sydney harbor, Opera house and Sydney's suburbs 360 degrees. Coolest attraction in Sydney - you get a climbing suite and learn and practice climbing in the safety of the attraction facility.Unfortunately you can't take your camera with you, so your guider will take your photos - you can get it on a CD or a printed copy at the time of payment when you climb your way down tierd and happy!The experience is expensive, so pay attention to the price, because it changes according to the time of day.

Awesome experience!. It is expensive but we decided to splurge on the bridge climb to celebrate a special occasion. Absolutely worth it. To save some dollars, we chose the day climb slot just before the twilight session, thus saving AUD50-60 per person. You get to see the sunset on the way down just as the twilight session comes up. In fact, we were just across the bridge from the early twilight session group and shared the same amazing sunset view from the top of the bridge.The entire climb is very safe, with good safety briefing and equipment. The grey overalls are not the most fashionable but it absolutely makes sense to blend in with the bridge, even if it doesn't photograph nicely.

Great time !. We had the opportunity to cross the gate by food and it was really good. Everything is safe and you can see a lot of love deals in the bridge with lockers... Its beautiful and the view is the best !

You can climb this thing. Walked right by the office - there are guided tours on top of the bridge. This is probably the best view of the harbour you will ever get and the guides are professional and will give you a lot of interesting facts on the tour. set aside 2-3 hours - you will not regret it.

Awesome structure. Absolutely love this structure, and the views over the harbour that it affords. As a Brit, I'm very keen on engineering and all things construction, we have such fabulous bridges back home, however, it has to be said, the Sydney. Harbour Bridge is an iconic beauty!
very good. well informed guided tour - really interesting fantastic - a little expensive but you see why when you book it

Loved the bridge climb!. If you go to Sydney, the Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb is a must!!! The views are stunning, and it's such a memorable experience. Like most, I'd seen photos of friend's on the bridge with the wide stairway behind them... It wasn't until actually doing the climb that I realized there are some tighter, less open spaces en route (may be a bit nerve-wracking for the claustrophobic but simple enough, just duck here and angle here...). The whole experience is a lot of fun. You arrive (probably with some down time to explore the gift shop), get decked out in a jumpsuit and go over safety procedures, then as you climb the guide shares anecdotes and historical facts via the provided headphones. You can feel the powerful gusts of wind as you climb higher and higher (don't worry, you have a harness so you're very secure) all the while enjoying the most amazing views of the glittering harbour and bustling city below. I strongly recommend you pay the extra for the souvenir photo (you can't take your own camera - or anything else - as there's a risk of dropping items on the traffic below). I feel so happy each time I look back at the images as it is such a wonderful memory. It may be a bit pricey but it's well worth it for the experience. The staff are very professional yet fun and they use quality equipment so you feel safe every step of the way. DO IT!!! You won't be disappointed.
Must See. Be sure to do the bridge climb - worth EVERY dollar but hope for good weather and be ready to climb.

Beautiful bridge. You can see the Harbour Bridge from almost anywhere on the water front. You can climb all the way to the top if you so desire, we did not wish to do this. But the view must be awesome.

Bridge Climb well worth the money!. I know it's expensive, but the bridge climb is worth every penny. The guide, Pete, was knowledgable, funny and helpful. The views were amazing, something I will remember forever. A must-do if you're in Sydney!

Definitely a must. If you have the time, this is a must in Sydney! Took the express climb (which is 2 1/4 hour) and did not find it difficult at all. The staff was very helpful in explaining all the various pieces of equipment and what you will have to do whilst on the bridge. The guide we had was fantastic, he provided us with a lot of information. Once we were near the top you have a photo taken and then again once you reach the very top, where we had about 15 min to enjoy the beautiful views.

Such a great walk. If you have some free time I would recommend walking across the Sydney Harbor Bridge from the Rocks Neighborhood to Kirribilli. It takes about an hour to do it but you don't even realize it. Just watch for runners.

Loved the climb!. I climbed the bridge first in 2011 & decided to do it again on my travels back to Sydney. It is expensive but worth it. The views as you climb are breath taking & you get to spend a while at the top. Both times I really enjoyed the climbs as the different guides tell you different stories. One of the best things to do in Sydney!

I climbed it!. Even with an enormous fear of heights, I climbed that sucker. The ladders are the scariest part, but the actual trek up to the top of the arch and back is beautiful and those 360 degree views are well worth the cost. The guides inform and entertain via headsets for a large portion of the trip. Also, I've taught climbing and ropes courses and know effective safety measures when I see them. The steps taken to keep climbers safe is actually quite impressive.

Great experience. Thoroughly recommend the bridge climb. Took the express 21/4 hour climb, which was not at all strenuous. Instructor was very knowledgeable, safety equipment terrific, and views amazing. A must if you are visiting Sydney!

what views!. I was lucky enough to be treated to the Bridge Walk for my 60th birthday and had a fabulous time. The guide that escorted our group was friendly and informative and the whole thing was very well organised. All this and I was rewarded with fabulous views.

Great views for free!. We thought about doing the bridge climb but thought it was a bit overpriced. You can walk across the bridge for free and the views are still amazing. There don't seem to be too many people doing this so it wasn't overcrowded.

The Most Amazing Thing I've EVER Done!. We did the Sydney Bridge Climb. This is a MUST when in Sydney! Beautiful views and not difficult. Very safe and professional. They will access your ability to perform, everyone must take a Breathalyzer test and flight suits are worn to avoid accidently dropping ANYTHING on traffic below. They take all the pics which you can purchase. Recommend!
Harbour Bridge. It does look like a coat hanger!Its bigger than you think and longer too, its an icon for tourist photos and if you are brave enough you can take the walk over the top

Top things I've done. This is a must. Well worth the money, very knowledgable staff, views are breathtaking, great pics, safety equipment top notch, not as hard as you think it's gonna be, just four ladders to contend with and it's pretty straight from there.

Amazing man made iconic bridge of the world. Sydney Harbour Bridge is one of Sydney’s most famous landmarks. The bridge spans the 1600 feet gap from the north to the south shore, which was previously only accessible by ferry, and accommodates pedestrian walkways, two railway lines and an eight-lane road. Visitors can experience the bridge in an adventurous way by climbing to the top as part of organized group for breathtaking views. I did not try climbing. For the less daring 200 steps lead to Pylon Lookout for equally fantastic views at 285 feet above the water, with three levels of exhibits on the way up depicting the history and construction of the bridge.Sydney Harbour Bridge is a feat of engineering genius. It took 1400 workers (16 of whom died in the process) eight year to complete. Sydney Harbour Bridge, Sydney Opera House, The Rocks, Circular Quay ---are all in same place. These are can be enjoyed in a full day.

A bit pricey but a must, and great at night time !. We had an early evening booking just as the sun was going down. Staff all very friendly and helpful, and views across the harbour and city were truly spectacular. Total time was between 3 and 4 hours but a lot of this was the safety talks and equipment instruction before the walk and cleaning the equipment after ! Can't praise the staff enough but cost was a little expensive and whilst they don't allow you to take cameras up, the guides will take pictures of you (for which they do charge a small fortune).Although 140metres above the harbour, not at all scary - in fact the only unsettling part was up and down the two series of vertical ladders.Despite the above, a must-do experience which we all thoroughly enjoyed.

Bridge climb. Well worth the money, very knowledgeable staff on safety and the induction to the climb, once on the bridge the views are breath taking and the guides very learned on the history of the bridge, 4 sets of steep ladders to climb but the rest is pretty well straight , recommended good sports shoes non slip and comfortable clothing, but the clothing not that important because they give you a jump suit to wear ,
Bridge Tower. Excellent view of the Opera House, Sydney Bridge and the surrounding area, well worth the climb and not expensive.

Harbour Bridge Climb. If you're ever in the beautiful city of Sydney - you MUST climb the Harbour Bridge. I'm a person who is scared of heights and with our guide, I was able to go the distance. I'd said for years that I'd like to do it, but never got around to it, then my husband had purchased it for me as a surprise birthday gift. What a magnificent view from the top. I was so glad and proud of myself that I actually made it, I cried. If you have a fear of heights - let them know and they will talk with you, help and guide you through the scariest parts. A MUST DO while in Sydney.
Majestic and Iconic. Sail under it, drive over it, or climb up it which ever you choose it will stay in your memory . No other New Years eve fireworks display comes close to it .

Worth it!. We walked the upper bridge tour. It was expensive but worth the money. The outing is extremely well organized. There is a practice session to acclimate your climb and the equipment is safe.The views are spectacular and cannot be seen from any other vantage point. You are not allowed to bring your own cameras and to that end you walk through a metal detector. The tour guide will take a few pictures for you which are sufficient. I do not recommend the shorter tour as it is along the lower level of the bridge.

A focal point on the sydney horizon. The bridge is a marvel considering that it was built in 1938 and is in far better repair than any other bridge I know of! Viewing it during the day is great but after the sun sets and the lights come on it is still beautiful.

Impressive. Although I haven't done the bridge climb, I have walked over the bridge several times (takes about 15 mins to walk one way) and done the pylon lookout. Both definitely worth doing. I'd recommend walking over on the Opera House side for better views.
Amazing. I love walking across the bridge once a week to work. View is beautiful. The bridge is wide enough to fit all the peak hour walkers on it so there is no stress.

The bridge, never tire of it. As I was working in the CBD and a friend's place was in nth Sydney, I walked over it a number of times, day and night, recently. It's a magnificent structure and I'll never get sick of it. I usually walked the main harbour side, stopping for snaps of the opera house, ships etc. takes about 20 minutes.Coming back there is a choice between the Rocks or the Bangaroo area, just need to walk under the bridge as you get off.If you are keen, book a Bridgeclimb - did it a few years ago and it was really worth it. Not strenuous and the views are extraordinary.

Doing the Pylon Lookout Climb. Not knowing if our knees would survive the Bride climb, we opted for the Pylons Lookout climb which we found to be most enjoyable and not at all taxing. The views were terrific, and we felt that our photos were just as good as from the bridge above. Met lots of folks from all over while awaiting opening time - you should make sure that you know that the Lookout climb doesn't open till 10 AM. We had read this in our research, but it eluded us the day of climbing, so we ending up waiting half an hour for the ticket box to open. Still we had a great time and recommend this shorter climb to others. The price is well worth the view. And there is a senior price as well.

Walked over it in the rain.. Be careful not to be run over by very keen runners. Shame there is now so much protective wire to stop jumpers. But there is a space for the camera to go under for a good picture.Padlocks have started appearing on the wire.
what a bridge. It is an amazing site as we came in under it looking up at it from cruise boat ,thought we were going to hit it. so coming towards it and leaving it behind it looks lovely.
Sydney Harbour Bridge / Luna Park. Sydney is always amazing :-) great for everyone Monday to Sunday, Plenty to see and do and well worth while.
One of the world's best attractions. I enjoyed being near it, going under it, enjoying a meal with friends with it in view and seeing a cruise liner going underneath it.
Toon bridge but huge.. Only one word Awsome. Did not have time to go to the top but it must be a great sight. Did drive accross though.
Bridge Climb. My mum and I did the bridge climb and it was spectacular! Our guide was amazing and very fun! It was not terribly strenuous. The views were spectacular! Loved it!

Iconic Sydney. Structurally and as an engineering feat, it isn't that impressive, it's a pretty standard bridge structure. However, in this precise location it totally dominates the entrance to Sydney and is an iconic symbol of the city.

Fun activity to do in Sydney. The Sydney bridge climb is a great way to see Sydney. The climb is expensive, but very well co-ordinated. We arrived, were briefed, kitted out and started the climb within 30 min. The climb is easy, done very slowly (a lot of hurry up and wait). The views are spectacular. Our guide Mat was very informative. There are a few ladders to climb but they are easy to navigate. You are harnessed in so it's so incredibly safe. Definitely something to do whilst in Sydney

Amazing bridge climb. We did the bridge climb. Yes it was hard work for us unfit people, some vertical stair climbs. Unreal to see the trams buses and cars driving under the bridge as you climb. The views from the top made it all worth while. Amazing once in a lifetime experience. Would highly recommend. Our guide was so informative

Has to be done. A once in a lifetime experience that I'd recommend doing. It's quite pricey but I wouldn't like to go to Sydney and come back having not done it. The staff and the whole set up is very professional. Only negative is not bring able to take up your own camera. Be easy to attach a lanyard so unable to be dropped. Just a way of making you buy there expensive photos. That aside did enjoy the experience besides hitting the wallet hard.

Great 360 view, picturesque,....museum is okay.. The view is amazing. You can see it all and it is well worth the visit. It is unfortunate they charge you for this. The museum is okay. Do not stay for the movie. We thought you would learn something about building the bridge but it is just a movie showing the bridge from different angles.

Fantastic Experience. We did the Bridge Climb and if you visit Sydney it is a must do. Yes if you don't like heights it can be a bit scarey but my wife is a bit like that but once she got over the initial hurdle she absolutely loved it and has the photos to prove it. Our guide Romeo (true) was excellent and told us loads of information about the bridge etc and made sure everyone was part of his team. Don't miss it.

The "Coathanger". To actually gaze up at the marvelous structure and see groups of people climbing on top was breathtaking! One can only imagine how she looks when she comes alive with firework display and made me add that to my bucket list to see it on New Years Eve!! Plus knowing Paul Hogan and all those brave men who built her must have had a amazing view over Sydney!
fantastic. you must visit this sight its amazing travelling to manley bay the beach is amazinging and the food and shops when you get there are fantastic well worth a visit
So picturesque. One of the highlights of the Sydney skyline. Didn't take the walk on the bridge, pretty windy while we there. Lit up at night, just beautiful.

Loved it!. been to Sydney a couple of times and never done the Bridge Climb until now, enjoyed every minute of it. Very relaxed, great view and felt like good excersice to finish off the holiday.Would recconmend

Amazing views at the harbour. I decided to climb it up as i realized that it must be awesome view from up there. At first i was concerned about the heights, you get to go up to 134 m above the sea. However, i managed to overcome my occasional fear of the heights. The safety precautions are great. U are always attached to the railings. The guides are doing great job, you hear stories not only about the bridge but Sydney history and major highlights as well.I must admit I expected that the climb will be even more strenuous, however it is done at moderate pace, giving commentaries on the way, making you take a breath, while they are taking photos of you as well. The best is to take a climb at dawn or dusk, but it is incredible experience at any time. It is expensive adventure but well worth it. Next time i watch New Year's fireworks from Sydney, i would be able to say: i was there-on the top!!!!

How overrated is this!. You get used to seeing pictures of iconic places...some (like thenTaj) live up to the reality whereas others are a disappointment.Despite being in Sydney for three days and seeing the bridge from all sides and angles I remain totally underwhelmed by the whole experience. In my view one of the most overrated tourist attractions I've seen in 40 years of travel.

A must see. We took a harbor cruise that went under the around the bridge and under. Gave you a wonderful up close view! Would have loved to do the climb but since my husband had recently had a knee replacement it just wasn't on our list this time. But we did see two groups of people climbing - looked like fun! Just imagine the view from up there! Although we didn't do the climb we still enjoyed our cruise under the bridge!

Don't miss this!. We did the bridge climb in January. Believe me, DON'T MISS THIS! We even had one acrophobic woman in our group and even she made it! The company that runs this concession is extremely well run and very cautious. They don't miss anything to ensure climbers' safety. The views from the top of the bridge are breathtaking and even though this is a very expensive experience, when will you be in Sydney again???Btw, we are both in our 60s and easily made this climb.Lastly, special thanks to our guide, Em! She was terrific, knowledgeable, friendly, and fun.

Amazing - a must do!. We did the bridge climb at 6pm on 30.01.2014. We booked for this time as people had recommended it so that you get to see the sunset and it was certainly worth it! It takes about 1,5hours in all to actually climb the bridge and the rest is for preparing, safety talks etc. I'm not a lover of heights but this was truely awesome. You are nowhere the edges and the leaders are really great giving you information about the different things you can see from the bridge as well as its construction. I'd definitely recommend! I'm glad we did the twilight as we got to see Sydney in the daylight (also while it wasnt really hot) and then also at sunset/night.

Bridge Climb- a must do!. The bridge climb was about $250 pp but worth the money. The guides were fantastic and it is very safe to do this climb. I thought I would hold people up but the guide stops often gives nice information out while everyone catches their breath. I never felt over exerted and I am not in the best shape. Good for all physical leves as long as you can walk stairs! :-)
brilliant. Well worth spending the three hours walking the bridge. Loved it and the breathtaking views. The tour guides were informative and funny.

the coathanger. The bridge is iconic and must see in sydney. I did not do the bridge climb as it looked too difficult. Wish they would install some device that takes you to the top - a la eiffel tower

An absolute MUST.... I almost didn't do this because of height and money....but I would have missed out on the best part of trip. Everything about the experience was top notch...our guide, the safety, the walk, and time it took was good. We did the walk in the afternoon of Sunday, on Australia Day. The day was somewhat cloudy and slightly cooler than I expected, but it turned out to be perfect. With the special jumpsuit over my clothing I was very comfortable. There are a few water fountains on the trip up and back. The guides take pictures of your group and individually as you are not allowed to carry anything. Spend the money and don't miss this. The views and history were well worth it.
Great Experience. We were given bridge climb vouchers for gifts and enjoyed it immensely!! Never get tired of the views from any angle of our beautiful Harbour.
An icon of Sydney. It was our first visit to this iconic bridge and a must if you are in Sydney. It is the most famous in Australia for its engineering design back then. Worth our visit.

Harbour bridge tour. It was nice tour with great explanation along the tour about the atchitecture of bridge, historic of it, the view but abit expensive and no promotion rate....it will take about 3.5hrs including briefing, safety and putting on gears

An experience to tick off the bucket list!. This walk is well worth the cost. The views that you get are simply magical. We opted for the 3.5hr climb and were treated to twilight as we were descending the bridge. The whole team are professional and make you feel safe and secure at all times.If you've ever thought about climbing the Bridge, it is something that you should seriously look into. Even as locals, we loved every minute of the climb.

Get on it!. Well worth the effort to either climb it, walk across it or go up the lookout. I've done all 3 and they all offer a different perspective. Walking across it in your own time is possibly the best - you can stop and soak up the view and best of all it's free and healthy!
extortionate. When I found out it cost over $200 I immediately changed my mind about going on the climb.You can't take photo's either they take them and charge you
Sydney attractions. Many people climb the bridge. If you are afraid of height like I am, you can still walk the whole length of the bridge. The view of the harbor is magnificient.

Iconic. We were fortunate to drive over, sail under & climb over the bridge but by far the best experience was the bridge climb. The whole climb is fantastically organised & perfectly safe. It even cured my wife's fear of heights! The guides do a great job of telling you a bit about the history of the bridge & pointing out important landmarks. On a hot day we had plenty of stops which gives your guide chance to take individual & group photo's.
