Dissapointed. We couldnt believe the large ammounts of rubbish lying around as we were on the approach to the bridge from the city and on the bridge itself. We commented that for such an icon, the filth was disgusting.

amazing views!. Woohoo did the express climb which took 2.15mins for $212 which is a short cut to the top. I am afraid of heights but as you are clipped on to guard rails did not fret too much, was well worth the effort to get to the top, highly recommended!

Just looking at it is enough. -But then you climd it and see it from an entirely different perspective. there are 2 main center pieces in Sydney Harbor, the Bridge and the Opera house and up on the bridge you can see just how amazing Sydney is clear across the horizon. The Bridge is one of those structures that is amazing in pictures but a must see. New Years eve in Sydney, the bridge is THE center piece with the exploding color of the worlds best fireworks spectacle.
Can't get enough of this bridge. The view of this bridge from all angles was amazing. Didn't get to walk on it, but seeing it from far, the bridge was beautiful in every way.

15 magic minutes - walk across the Harbour Bridge. A sunny Sunday in May was the ideal day to leave my car at Kirribilli and walk across the Bridge. It's only a little over 1km and a very easy walk. Anyone put off the Bridge Walk (over the arch) by fear of heights or cost, would find this a great alternative. It's totally free. $11 ($6.50 concession & $ children) if you want to climb up the pylon on the southern side for a birds' eye view.Walk on the eastern side and if you are only going to do the walk one way, walk from Milsons' Point to the city, so the Opera House & cityscape are in front. The northern entry is via steps just south of the Milsons Point railway station, on the eastern side. Don't walk on the western side - that's for cyclists only. Really. They fly along the narrow pathway and it's dangerous for them and any unwary (or stupid) pedestrians who venture onto it.The elevated view gives a new perspective to the buzzing harbour, with ferries, sailing and motor boats of all sizes passing the Opera House and under the Bridge. The sails of the Opera House glisten in the sunshine and the much maligned "Toaster" melts into insignificance when you can see the Botanic Gardens from this height.The exit on the southern (city) side is via steps onto Cumberland street and it's only a few minutes' walk to the Rocks Market.With lots of stops for photos and "WOW" moments, it took me 20 minutes.
Nice walk!. Chance to climb the bridge as well. Don't miss it, even though is very expensive.

The bridge. We did the discovery harbour bridge climb. A great tour of the bridge, with a very friendly and knowledgable guide. It took about 3 hrs including the briefing. The tour was well run and our group size of 9 was good. It's a must do whilst in Sydney, although it is quite pricey, but hey it's a one off.
Walk Across. Beautiful to look at from afar, you can also walk across in order to reach Luna Park and for great views of the Opera House. Best of all it is free :)
Iconic. Impressive bridge, superb location. One of the great bridges of the world.
Awesome. We did not do the walk but went up one of the center pillars for an incredible view. I believe they only charge $5 for this instead of $200+ for the walk.

Very good view in night. It look very good in night, I had a party in opera house in the night and it was beautiful to watch the bridge from inside opera house lounge. I was told that it looks best on new year night.

DO IT!. I definitely recommend doing the bridge climb.You get properly harnessed up and then do a practise small assault course, to make sure you know how to move your harness around efficiently.You are connected by your harness at all times.... so don't be worried about falling because it's impossible to do that! The views form the top are just amazing!! and don't worry if you don't feel your physically ready for it. anyone can take part and I've seen many elderly people going up there so if they can do it you can! There are steps quite a lot of the way up but I didn't even feel like they were an effort, I was too busy looking at the views around me. It is quite expensive but I think it's definitely worth it.... once in a lifetime experience and all that!hope this helps :)
Fun to see it in real life, such a Sydney icon. Enjoyed the Sydney Harbour Bridge and took photos form every imaginable angle.
Great climb at twilight. Twilight is the best time to do the climb. We climbed up while the sun was up, watched it set and climbed down at dusk! A must thing to do in Sydney!

One of the world's greatest views. Climbing the pylon of the Sydney Harbour Bridge is MUCH cheaper that doing the Bridge Climb, and the views over the harbor and city are magnificent. The exhibition about the construction of the bridge really makes you appreciate what a feat it was in the 1920s-30s. This is one of the best views in the world, and it's very difficult to turn and leave!
nice bridge.. i have been through it a lots of times. the toll is expensive and it connects sydney with north sydney.

Walk it, run it, photograph it, see it in the morning in the night!. A beautiful iconic part of sydney. You can walk it for free, or pay to climb over it. You can sit on the grass under it, have a picnic and enjoy the view across the harbour. Whatever you choose - spend sometime viewing this beautiful bridge.

Breathtaking!. The old "coat-hanger" dominates the Sydney skyline. The first time I went to Sydney it was the item which I most wanted to see. I was not disappointed. It is still a wonderful sight no matter how many times you visit Sydney. It also stands as a tribute to the amazing engineering feat which was accomplished in that era and during the time of the Great Depression.

Its a bridge. Honestly I dont remember the history of the bridge but it looks amazing in the sunset from the harbour. Plus if you are the adventerous type you can actually climb on top the bridge for some amazing views of Sydney!
A must do. You will enjoy the spectacular views, Frightened of heights ? dont worry; you feel safe and secure as you walk to the top of the arch.
a lot to do for young people. beautifull recomended for young people walk around a great experience but not for seniors
Best View of Sydney. If you are in Sydney this is a must, enjoy the Bridge and the harbour. Vivid festival is a must to see in the city in May - make sure you dress warm and check it out.
Be sure to do it!. The tour guides were so professional and made the entire time out on the bridge fun.
can be improved. my concern is that they only turn on the lights after dark, hence not good for sunset photography

Bridge Climb at Dusk. The bridge climb is well worth doing, we did the dusk walk which gives amazing views of the sun setting over Sydney when you're at the top.
The walk is not physically too difficult, just remember it takes a few hours (although a lot of time is spent waiting/admiring the view) and there are some steep steps at some points.
Harbour Bridge. Take an harbour cruise and take a photo of the bridge lit up . Great for the budding photographer.
bridge. i suggest to go on day before sun go down, the view is fantastic for romantic view and memory. at night it also good for taking picture.

Splendid design!. Looking across from Sydney Harbour, the bridge looks just splendid. I would consider this to be a masculine design based on the materials used & clean line structure. See the national flags & tankships on top! Wow. What an unusual installation.

An easy walk across. Walking the bridge appears to be a lot easier than climbing it. We got a birds eye view of the Opera House and surrounding areas. The end of the bridge is a perfect place to have lunch. There are several places to pick up a take away and eat at a picnic table nearby. The one way walk should only take about 20 mins. if you are walking at average speed.

Can't go to Sydney without seeing the Bridge. Love the Harbour Bridge, especially when viewing it from the Botanic Gardens with the Opera House also in the background. It's a great way to watch the sun come up while on a morning run. The bridge also makes a great place to run along (nice couple of kms from Milsons Point to the city) but be aware you entre the bridge on the correct side for walkers or bikers (one side for each type of traveller).
Harbour Bridge. Walking over Harbour Bridge was my favorite experience whilst in Sydney.

Glad I did it but not really as good as you would expect.. We did the walk over the top of the bridge. It was fine - taking a few hours to complete with the guide. All very safe but in reality, you could do the walk in half the time and whilst you think it is going to feel high and exhilerating, it was really just a pleasent (and expensive) walk! One of those things that i am glad i did, althought would not do it again.
Beautiful. Beautiful attraction! Saw it from a boat ride and was stunned at how amazing it looked at sunset!
Great views. Well worth walking along the path on the bridge.. We loved the fabulous views of Sydney Harbour and the Opera House.

Another must-do free bridge walk. We did this on a weekday to avoid weekend crowds. We walked all the way through Darling Harbour found the right entrance by following the signs. This is an easy walk - flat and not far. The view towards the city includes the CBD and Opera House. In the distance you can see all the way towards Manly in the East. We had a quiet lunch on the other side at Milsons Point where there are plenty of places to choose from. Be sure to get a photo of the Bridge as you walk to the ferry terminal for the trip back to the City. Yep, I think everyone should do this.
A 'mountain' to conquer. To scared to climb the bridge but it's a great landmark to see

Iconic Landmark. What can you say about the Harbour Bridge, an iconic landmark of Sydney Harbour. You can drive a car over it, you can catch a train to go over it, you can walk, run or ride a bike over it, you can even walk over the top of it. You can catch a ferry and ride under it. What a great tourist attraction this is.
Brilliant experience.... Obviously we had to walk across the bridge while in Sydney. Views are amazing especially at night.
Best view in the world. The Bridge Walk is a complete must - views are amazing and extremely safe / no feeling of vertigo even from the top
A good climb. We did the climb ,what an experience,3 hours well spent ,a once in a lifetime thing todo .

Our Famous "Coathanger". It is a photographers staple - the walk looks exciting but not being fond of heights I only look at groups walking so high up.- for locals and tourists alike this is a special part of Sydney - the pylons each end are scenic and the setting well worth a visit. When Sydney goes into "Lighting up landmarks" This is exceptional. The traffic it handles is awesome and in all weather in all seasons it is a wonderful experience to just see it for yourself.

Impressive. The harbour Bridge is quite impressive in how it spans across the harbour. A must for fans of great engineering structures of the 19th century. I have walked across on the normal pedestrian path, but am very tempted to try the bridge climb all the way to the top next time. Is a bit expensive, but think it will be an exiting experience that offers even more breathtaking views!!
Harbour Bridge. Spectacular to drive under, fairly boring to drive over. But lloking at how it has been engineered, it is an amazing piece of Aussie history.
Amazing view of the habour. What more can one say than this? It is quite the experience to cross the bridge and to see the history and the immensity of this structure.

Morning run on the bridge is so exclusive. Enjoyed a very early run (5.00 AM) on the Bridge. 2 security guards on the Jogging alley where locals come & enjoy the place. Be aware that Opera House is not lighten all night....so poor view till Sunset !!! But a great experience. Thank you Sydney !!!

One of the best free things to do in Sydney. Forget the bridge climb and all that Jazz, put your walking shoes on and walk across the pedestrian access way from the Rocks to the North Shore, On the North side get off down the steps east of the bridge and walk around the little harbour side suburb get a coffee and walk back. I go to Sydney on business and try to fit this walk in to burn off a few calories. I have taken family and friends on it and most enjoy it.

Always pulls at the heart strings. There is never a time that approaching the Sydney Harbour Bridge fails to pull at the heart strings! It is such an awesome structure!Avoid crossing it at peak times, but it is quite spectacular late at night.
Scenic. Love the view, especially at sunset on a ferry on the harbour. It just looks so magical!!!
Iconic. The "Bridge Climb" is expensive, but not my thing anyhow. Instead, walk across the bridge for free, or go up the south-east Pylon for a small fee.

Perfection in everyway. My 11 year old son and I done the bridge climb, and we could not fault the way this climb is conducted, very professional in everyway and very organised - needless to say that the views from the top and on the way up and down are just amazing.We could not of had a more perfect day - the sun was shining and there was no wind at the top at all - perfection is all I can say. The young girl we had as our guide (can't remember her name) sorry, was simply amazing and seemed to remember everyone's name in our group and asked us alot of questions about where we were from and seemed interested in us as a group as well, but was also very informative on the surroundings in Sydney. The only question she could not answer was from my 11 year old son, who asked "Where was the Biggest Loser filmed?" She said that she had never been asked that question before, but to everyone out there that may think about doing this and maybe think that the price is steep, I can tell you it is worth every cent you spend on doing this amazing attraction. Congratulations to the wonderful staff that run this to perfection!!!!!!

Sydney bridgeclimb = Tourist trap. The bridge itself is a beautiful construction, and the view from the arch is nice. But still the bridgeclimb is a tourist trap, very very expensive and definitely not worth the money. I fell for the trap and paid a lot of money to walk up the arch on the 2 hour fast tour, it was not at all worth it. Instead you can just walk across the bridge or pay a small amount (~15 AUD) and walk up some stairs in one of the towers, in retrospective that is what I should have done. The bridge climb in order to be worth the money needs to come down 80% in price, the current price and value for money is a bad joke.

View it, travel over and under it, climb it, see it in full glory on NYE. When I moved to Australia I kid you not I was expecting to see a suspension bridge like the Golden gate at San Fran.Years later now I have so many memories of driving, training, walking , sailing underneath, watching it while eating out and most of all climbing to the top of it. The Bridge is an extraordinary engineering feat and for me it is at its best and in all its' glory on NYE with the fireworks going off from it and a special message appearing on it. Brilliant!!
Beautiful bridge. You can walk over the bridge, beside the road in your own lane enjoying the views, and you can pay a small fortune to walk over the arch. I hear it is worth the cash.

Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. AMAZING!! We did the sunset climb and it was fabulous. The staff were very knowledgable and enthusiastic. Being able to see the city, the opera house and all the way out to the Blue Mountains was unbelievable. The view changed as the day changed to evening to night time. I would recommend this experience to anyone!
Bridge Climb from Heaven. Climbing the Bridge is awesome, viewing the bridge from the bottom is brilliant, the night climb is mind blowing
great views. we did the walk across the bridge (not the one you pay for, which seems very over priced). the views are great and you can get great pictures of the opera house!

AMAZING. This was a surprise gift from my partner (now my husband) at the time. Although so excited about the prospect of seeing amazing views, I was so reluctant and a bit terrified about climbing those heights.My mind was set at ease as soon as we entered the reception area where we registered and all safety aspects were very clearly explained & in a fun manner. You are so harnessed in, it would be actually impossible to fall off the bridge, if anything the safety was over kill, but totally understandable and much appreciated! As for people that are sacred of heights, it’s strange you get a sense of absolute fearlessness once on the top, and really there is only part that is a vertical climb for a very short distance, once you have passed this point it is a gradual climb, you don’t even realise you’ve reached the top until you look down.The views once you have reached the top, WOW, you really haven’t ‘seen’ Sydney. The guide was also wonderful, explaining landmarks and some historical areas.Well worth it!

Far, far too expensive, but you only live once........ Title says it all. Over 200 bucks for a short walk is ludicrous, but this is a well oiled professional operation that will offer you once in a lifetime views over one of the worlds greatest cities. Guide was a legend, and a couple got engaged at the top in our group, so memorable even once the pain of the cost was a distant memory. Grin and bear the price and get to the top!

The scale impresses. I cross this bridge everyday and the scale of it never ceases to amaze me. The western sunset views are gorgeous, and it is worth taking time to admire the structure from all angles. The Sydney Harbour Bridge IS the symbol of Sydney.

Disappointing. I hate to say this, but it looked very ordinary. I was unable to see what the fuss about this bridge is all about. I have to admit that I did not climb to the top of the bridge, so maybe I missed some of teh excitement, but even so, there are a million bridges all over the world which are as good. At night with all the lights , it looks a lot better, but still.....
rip off. What a rip off this place is.It costs a small fortune to go up the bridge and you can get the same view from the pubs on the rocks

Great views!. you can walk across! Busy bridge but you can see some good views of both sides of sydney and some of the islands whilst walking--if you can't afford the bridge climb, try this, definitely not as cool, but affordable

Windy up on top. I didn't climb the Bridge but many people do and love it. It was too windy when I was there so got photos from below.The" coat hanger" is an icon and made more famous by Crocadile Dundee who used to work on it painting.
Wonderful Day Out. Yes it's expensive however get past this and you will have a really incredible time. The bridge is amazing, the views...million $
CLIMB IT!. This has to be one of the best things you could ever do in your life!!! We are both very scared of heights but it doesn't even come into it - this is absolutely amazing!!!
great views. going over the sydney harbour bridge you will have a beautiful view of the opera house and of sydney.
Sydney Harbour Bridge Walk. Definitely a bucket list item. Very enjoyable regardless if you fear heights, even to the very top. The climb is easy, the experience spectacular!

Full of history. We did the Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb, that was a once in a life time opportunity for me. Our leader gave us a very warmth welcome and detailed explanation of the bridge history. Excellent birdview of the Harbour, enjoyed every moment of it.
great. we didn't do the walk but enjoyed watching others like ants climbing up and down

hmmm. Huge iron and steel structure - looks great from all angles.. could do with a coat of paint though!!
i was not able to do it, but if possible you should try the bridge walk

A bit over rated unless you doing the top climb.. Allow plenty of time or book to do the top climb, but just the climb to the traffice level is ok on a hot day. Lovely views of the gardens and harbour.

New Year firework. It was magical, New Year firework. It was worth to fly to Australia for firework. We wathched from restaurant and had great view. Hotels were expensive New Year Eve, but on January 1 prices dropped 3 times. Try to book separate before and after New Year Eve.

Do the climb!. Climbed the Sydney Harbour Bridge...what an experience! It was pricey but so worth it to see Sydney from this view and soak up a wealth of knowledge about the area from the guides. Nick guiding our group and was fantastic. Make sure you do this whilst in Sydney!

enjoy the beautiful views day and night. Go through the bridge in the day and at night, you can see different beauty of Sydney Harbor. I went to the Hunter Valley. I started the coach trip in the day. When I came back to Sydney, it was about 9 pm. It was terrific and cost little. I strongly suggest travelers, especially the youth, have the red wine trip and enjoy the beautiful views on the bridge.

The bridge climb is an amazing experience. I did the Discovery bridge climb with some cruise friends while in Sydney. It was certainly the highlight of my trip.Our guide (from Bath, England!) was excellent and provided so much information during the climb. They are well organised and very professional. Safety is is taken very seriously. We were provided with headphones so it was easy to listen to our guide.Do take time either before or after the climb to visit the theatre and exhibits where you check in. Ticket also includes free admission to the tower where you can learn more about the bridge, get a great view, take photos and say hi to the climbers as they go by.Their photos are expensive to buy but you cannot take your own camera with you on the climb.I would certainly do this climb again when next in Sydney.Andrew
Absolutely brilliant. A must do experience, especially if you are into engineering (and have no problem with heights, of course!)
Bridge Climb. Bridge Climb was amazing....this is a must to do while you are in sydney.

Top of the World - good times!!. Missed out on this in 2004 - so pleased we made it up this time. A fabulous experience; you take a while to get kitted up and go through the safety talk, however it's a relief that they take such care with you. The whole thing seemed totally safe and once you are up on the bridge any fear of heights is easily forgotten. It's fair to say that a reasonable level of fitness helps.Thanks to Darren for an unforgettable 3 hours - good times, as he kept saying!!

Look, a coathanger!. The Sydney Harbor Bridge, lovingly known as the Coat Hanger (see it and you'll know why), stands as an icon of Sydney Harbor. The bridge itself is somewhat interesting, but not necessarily worth a long visit in and of itself. Besides, if you're in and around Sydney Harbor, you'll see it anyways.
On top. Great experience being on the top of the bridge.It was an momentous occassion spending my birthday on a world icon.

One of the best attractions in Sydney. You can see it from far, you can see it from close, you can see it from the bottom, you can sail under it, and you can walk across it, you can drive across it, you can cycle across it, and you can walk over it or you can just go across it in a train. So in all and all a fantastic attraction and there are many ways to experience it. If you visit Sydney it's unlikely that you will miss it as it's right there in the heart of Sydney.Lovingly called - Coat Hanger :)

Bridge climb is a must. Hi thereMy wife and I are stay at the Novotel in darling habour ok hotel stayed in better .Have just done the habour bridge climb it was a great experiance we come to sydney once a year and we were looking for something to do bridge climb was great we love it a must do !!!

Bridge Climb was worth it!!. If you are looking for the Spectacular views of the beautiful city of Sydney - You must try the Sydney harbour Bridge Climb!! A great adventure, leave the fear for heights and just go!! The chains you are hooked too are reliable :) Overall a great experience!!

Good vibe. Well, at arrival of Sydney, I was a little disappointed as the taxi drove through the Harbour bridge and overlooking the Opera House, weather was a bit dull that day, so view didn't look as great.But over the weekend, taking a walk in Circular Quay (somehow.. it pronounces as "key" not "kway", confuse the hell out of me) with nice sea breeze and little sunshine (it is April, it starts to chill a bit). And a nice Opera Bar where you could enjoy wine / beer with family and friends and enjoy the fresh air and music and the view. Awesome place to be :)

Truly amazing bridge. Everyone who has seen a picture of Sydney knows about the Sydney Harbour Bridge. It was built during the depths of the 1920s recession and kept many people in gainful empolyment during those difficult times. There is a really interesting museum on the Sydney side tower that is well worth a visit. Not too expensive and it has great historical records, photographs and artefacts. The view from the top of the tower is wonderful - you can shout across to the people on the bridge climb as they begin the ascent to the top.Love the fact that the towers at either end were built for show - they do not perform any structural purpose.Second only to the Forth Bridge in Scotland as one of the bridging wonders of the engineering world.

I've done the Bridge Climb!!. The best attraction of Sydney!! would have to be The Harbour Bridge....I did the Bridge climb on my 60th birthday.....best thing I have ever done so exciting to see the city come to life with all the lights, and the views of the boats on the water, to be able to also stroll across the bridge is also great.

Fantastic - if you can book the Bridge Climb.. The bridge is great but the bridge climb is fantastic. Do not worry what it looks like - it is so well organised and so safe that it can be done by people of all ages from 8 to 80! If you do only one thing in Sydney do this - a once in alifetime experience!
Climb it, if you dare!. An amazing experience! Well organised, friendly and knowledgeable guides, and views to die for!If you're in Sydney, and have 3 hours to spare - do it!
high up. We didn't do the bridge climb as the children were too young, but we did climb all the steps up to the bridge and walk along it, just a fabulous thing to be able to do.

Wonderful views. The views from this bridge are pretty great! You'll be taking so many photos! Just another wonderful vantage point of the Opera House, down to "the Rocks", all the wonderful views in Sydney Harbour. You can pay to go up the tower, but we didn't bother - it was beautiful enough from the main deck.

Delight your senses and defy gravity!. Once you think you are high, keep going up!! Jaw-dropping views and safety-minded tour guides make for a wonderful experience. It's a bit pricey but oh-so-worth-it!

Everyone should walk across it.... A great memory. Everyone should walk across the iconic Sydney Harbour Bridge....kind of like how you really shouldn't go to NYC without walking over the Brooklyn bridge. A bit windy but beautiful.

Coathanger at Twilight!. Planning our Australian Adventure....the BridgeClimb was on our list of "must- do`s"! We booked the "Twilight Climb"....ascending as the Sun was setting and gazing over the Sydney night lights!!.....it was WOW!!! The 3.5 hr experience was so Professionally run from the booking to the training and equipping to the climb itself. The girl in charge of our group of 12 was so enthusiastic, knowledgable and had a keen sense of humour....she was even a good photographer!! We were lucky with weather and absolutely loved it!! When we see New Year fireworks from Sydney we`ll smile and think....."got the T-shirt"!!
Sydney Harbour Bridge. Reviewed it from the harbour. For those who seek adventure and an overwhelming pulsating thrill you can climb up the bridge. I was tempted but did not this time

Never to be forgotten experience. Yes I climbed the bridge! An experience I relive every time I see the bridge in the media or adverts. I regard it as my ultimate achievement as I don't do heights at all! The whole event was safe with good briefings and excellent equipment issued by the staff. I felt totally safe. Don't ask me about the view as I never looked down! My wife who does not fear heights accompanied me. I will do it again if I get the chance.
interesting architecture. there is a posibility to climb the bridge, very tempting but didn't have the time (3 hours) and the price is high - 208$.

Amazing Site. We watched many people climb the ridge. It would be quite exhillarating as the height is unbeleivable. The one drawback is the cost to climb the bridge. It was out of my price range. We did climbed the pylon which was at 94 meters as compared to the 134 meters of the bridge. The pylon had 220 steps to climb but it seemed to go quite fast. Great views at the top but not quite the adventure of climbing the bridge. The price to climb the pylon was more in my range at $11 AUD. Do not miss being on the bridge and do either the bridge climb or the pylon depending on what you feel you are willing to do.

Iconic. You can't walk round Sydney without getting views of the bridge, sometimes unexpectedly. We didn't have time for the walk but I am assured by friends that it is worthwhile, will be doing it on next visit.
Coathanger. Bridge view from the top was only average. If you want the best view try it from underneath at the footings next to the Rocks.

Such an icon..... After viewing it from the YHA, the road and the harbour, we decided to walk across it and had a great time! Nice wide walkway and the views up and down the harbour reward the little effort required to walk it...
Bridge Walk. The bridge walk was an unbelievable experience. I would suggest that when visiting Sydney, this is a must on the list
Easy to walk accross. The organised trip over the top is expensive. We walked over the footpath alongside the road way one evening for fantastic views of the city at night. Ferry back!

Nice view across Harbour Bridge. Had a great time eating hamburger from Hungry Jacks while sitting across the Harbour Bridge, watching people come and go and enjoy the sights of different lights on the bridge...

Gorgeous bridge, and you can see it cheaply if you try. I took about a gazillion photos of the bridge, during the day, at sunset and at night, but I wasn't willing to spend $208 to climb it. Instead, I climbed the pylon, which goes up to 90 meters (the bridge is 130 meters) and I took great pictures from there. The pylon normally costs $10AU but because my son and husband climbed the bridge, we got 3 passes to do the pylon for free (not sure why I got the pass when I didn't climb, but I'm grateful). I then walked the bridge from one side to the other and back, snapping photos along the way. You can have a nice cuppa coffee in Kiribilli (which my local friends say is native language for "really expensive real estate") or stop in at a cute restaurant for lunch. The walk is a nice walk, and definitely worth it. If you climb the bridge, you cannot take any pictures, so you'd need to do the pylon anyway if taking photos is your intent.

"Bridge climb" delivers best views of Sydney Harbor. If you are not afraid of heights, this is the ultimate way to see all of sydney harbor. It is very safe, you are in a jumpsuit that is hooked on to the rail. You wear head phones and listen to the history of the bridge and the city. Make sure to get your photo taken up there for purchase as you are not allowed to carry anything because of the cars below. Great experience!
another must see!. another iconic structure that can't be missed; we didn't do the BridgeWalk (looked kinda scary and pricey); but we did walk across the bridge

Go up in the Pylon, Cheaper than Bridge Climb and a Great View. Such a cool walk across the bridge. If you want to get a nice view of the Opera House and the harbour but don't want to pay for the Bridge Climb and are afraid of heights go to the first pylon you come to when coming from the harbor side. You can climb up into the Pylon for about $10 a piece. They have a nice museum that talks about the building of the bridge as well. Definately a nice way to have a good view and not spend a lot of $$.
fantastic view. great view. although bridge climbing is not my cup of tea, the mere viewing of the bridge is a great pleasure in itself.
WOW!. Even if you don't 'do' the climb, just walk across and take in the views!

The Bridge Climb. We climbed the brisge and it was awsome. No danger of fallen off as your are connected to rail and only the guide can release you. We are in our middle sixties and found it quite easy on the legs
Beautiful bridge. Take the walk from Milsons Point to The Rocks and you'll realise what a beautiful harbour Sydney has and how great the Harbour Bridge is. Really good experience.
Impressive. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is beautiful - a bigger version of our Harbour Bridge in Auckland NZ
Get a car and drive across. We drove our car across the bridge and it was awesome.

Sydney Harbour Bridge. You can't visit Sydney without visiting the Bridge. It's an icon and a must do. Catching a train to Milson's Point on the north side is an ideal way to then take the easy and beautiful walk across the Bridge - loads of photo opportunities!!! There are the pylons which you can climb up (for a small fee I think) and I'm sure the views would be spectacular! Once you have got to the other end you will be in The Rocks - the historic beginnings of Sydney that are filled with delightful gift shops, cafe's and pubs.

Climb of my life. Climbed the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Had a great morning with Phil, the climb guide, who made everything a fantastic once-in-a-lifetime experience.This has to be on everyone's Bucket List.

Discover Bridge Climb - a blast!. We did the discovery bridge climb through the Harbour Bridge Climb organization and absolutely loved the experience. The staff were very attentive and engaging and the views were beautiful. I highly recommend for anyone traveling to Sydney!

Bridge Climb. Fantastic, a must if this sort of thing interests you, great commentary and amazing 360 degree views. A bit pricey but well worth it. Great for people of most ages and not to exhausting with plenty of stops included in the tour. I believe there is an age limit for children of 10 and older.
Across...not over!. A nice walk across the bridge. Fun to watch the people doing the climb. One lady looked terrified and I can't help but wonder why pay to be scared!

Mighty Bridge.. Its an icon of Sydney. Sydney is incomplete without this massive structure of engineering. You can climb it, watch it, take a ferry to see it, watch it from Sydney Opera as well. This structure will surely change your thinking and ideas about past engineering thinkers, how did they construct it. The metallic bridge is a must visit attraction in Sydney. Go and pay tribute to all the engineers / labors who build this ICON.
An engineering marvel. I've run along it countless times, I'm looked out from the top of the pylon and I've climbed it - this bridge is one of the my favpourite man made objects ion the world

The nearside tower. There is a museum with displays and film in the nearside tower. For just $11 you can see a superb history of the building of the bridge. You can also walk to the top of the tower to take the best photos of the bridge and Opera House.
just do it. love this bridge. the heart of sydney. drive on it , catch a train over it , jog over it , stumble home drunk over it , or climb it , sail under it , fly over it. the best bridge

A must. Fantastic views. The day we climbed it was very hot and humid, so the climb was harder than we had anticipated but we managed. A very knowledgeable guide led us up and what a great sense of achievement when you get to the top. The only downside was the very sore calf muscles which lasted for 2 days after the climb.

Great view. We climbed the 200 steps to the Pylon Lookout. The stairs are not continuous; there are platforms to stop along the way and of course, a gift shop. Also, as you walk up the stairs, the history of the bridge and and its construction are displayed for those who are interested. Definitely worth it for 11$ if you want to see the view but not climb the actual arch. Great view of the Opera house from up top. Once you're back down, you can also just walk across the bridge itself to the other side; there is a pedestrian walkway. Watch for the runners that also use the path for their jog. Note: children will be able to climb the stairs but once at the top, the railings are high so depending on their height, they might not see anything unless in someone's arms.
Walking across is free. If you can't afford the climb then you can walk across the bridge. Choose a lovely day and have lunch at the Rocks.
80 years old bridge. Hard to believe this bridge is 100 years old. Well maintained bridge. You can enjoy the view from different parts of the city.

Bridge climb. Well organised with just about every detail covered. The views were exhilerating and the climb was not as intimidating as I imagined it would be. It was like a lovely morning stroll except with sore calf muscles on the way down. Great value excellent views. A definite must do.

the Coat Hanga'. Also known as the Coat Hanger, it's an impressive bridge. I recommend the Bridge Climb if you're up for it. I found out that I'm not afraid of heights (it's really not that bad), and it's not that difficult physically. It's more like a long walk with a little climbing but I think most could do it. And the views from the top are amazing!

an experience to remember. It was my first time in sydney, what better way to experience this magnificent city than to do the historic bridge climb! Personalities such as oprah winfrey, will smith to name a few have tried this attraction. Do it and you will have this experience of a lifetime to see the best view of opera house and circular QUAY. Very safe and it includes tour guide and photo stops for purchase.
The bridge. Can understand why it's the centre piece for New Year. Loved it.

The bridge is average. It is the landmark of the city, but to be honest it is just a bridge after all. Although it is built like 80 years ago under limited technology and resources, but I think the history itself do not worth you to walk many couple hours on it and spending probably several hundreds AUD to climb on it. I did it, the experience was just so so.

Beautiful architecture. This amazing bridge is very aesthetically pleasing and is nice to walk over. The walk is pretty good, overlooking the water, ending at luna park but the only downside is the constant traffic. I recommend not to go at peak hour 7:30-9am and 4:30-6pm and not at all on Friday afternoon as the traffic is hectic.
sightseeing. We didn't do the 'bridge walk' as quite expensive but just viewing the bridge from the ferry and on land was great.

Massive structure. Disappointed that you can't see much when you are driving over it - and that the walk across the top is so expensive (we didn't do it). But the structure is so dominant and spectacular from below in particular.
Thumbs up for Sydney Bridge Climb. A great walk (3.5 hours). Very professional, safe, with excellent guides and most of all - fantastic view of the beautiful Sydney Harbour.

Bridge Walk. Don't be put off by looking at the walkers from a distance. It is a delightful sloping stroll. The walk is not at all strenuous and the guide stops frequently. It is an exhillarating, unique experience and the views are extraordinary! Do it. You will not be disappointed.

One of the most spectacular bridges in the world. As an engineer, it's easy to get excited about this bridge. But as a world traveller, it's even easier to understand the magnetic draw of this iconic structure that links Sydney's North and south. As a local, it's actually a pain to cross every day but as a visitor you will enjoy the crossing no matter what mode of transport you use. I recommend walking across from the Rocks to Milsons Point for a bite to eat, and then catching the ferry back into the city. It's not what most guide books would suggest but I think it's the best way to appreciate the harbour bridge from both the harbour itself and on foot. Another great trip is to take the ferry over to Balmain, walk up to the East Village pub for a tasty local meal and then ferry back. You get longer on the boat and see one of Sydney's premier suburbs that most visitors won't bother to visit.

ARCHITECTURAL ICON. Walk across it. It's free. Walk over the top. It costs hundreds of dollars. Breathtaking harbor view. Kind of a long walk, but find a coffee shop at the far end and sit in the shade with a cold drink before you start back.

My favourite!. While I do think every visitor to Sydney must visit the Sydney Opera House, I find that travelers(and myself) are even more pleased by the Harbour Bridge. It's both free and has breathtaking views of the city and harbour. Definitely see the Opera House, but do not skip the Sydney Harbour Bridge!
bridge walk. worth every cent. I have lived in Sydney all my life and walked across the bridge a number of times but never on top of it. The guides were brilliant and it is truly an amazing structure
Priviledge. To see either the harbour bridge or opera house in one view is amazing but to see both is mind blowing, felt like flying high on top of the world.
Best bridge in the world!. There is something about the bridge and the Opera house that just shouts Australia, It is a must see and a friend LOVED the bridge climb she did last year.

The Coathanger design is an icon. This bridge gave life to the city back in the 1930s, and the old girl's life blood is still pumping strong. You can even walk across the top if your nerves are good (and you book ahead). Placed opposite the wonderful Opera House, together they frame this part of our beautiful harbour.

landmark. it is a huge bridge all in iron or something. There is two ways to see it. First it is a powerful connection between the north region and the city centre and secondly it is a postcard.It is overwhelming.

Iconic. Tourists always complain that its too small, How big do you want it to be people? I just think it screams Sydney and it is telling me I'm home. Its a really nice walk up the stairs of The Rocks to the other side of North Sydney. With some epic views inbetween of the bays and points of the harbour and of course the Opera House.
Lovely- wortha visit.. Ohh such a beautiful site to visit. A must see attration when one is in Sydney.
Walk across the bridge. Definitely a must-do because you get great views and it's free! I loved it!
Loved the View. IT is well worth your time to walk across the bridge and enjoy a superb view of the harbour, the Opera House and many other sites.
Claims And Walks.. Outstanding view if you are ever walked or driven across it is wonderful way Sydney Harbour.
nice and huge bridge. we just passed under it by bus and by the cruise , one of the famous bridges in the world

Do it!. We decided to walk the Bridge instead of paying to climb it or go up a Pylon. It was fantastic! And free!The security is amazingly tight with security guards, cameras and fences, including barbed wire.The views of the Opera House were stunning.If you are having trouble finding your way onto the brisge, just ask a friendly local. They are happy to help!

Nice walk on the bridge. I recommend waking over the bridge to the north side and then eventually coming back again or getting the train back.You can get the lift from the Circular Quay area then walk on the bridge that goes over it and join the bridge.
You'll have too many photos of this fun spot!. It's a huge heavy structure that is a fun contra to the rest of the town.
Walk across the Sydney Harbor Bridge. Its smaller, closer than it appears. Do it any time of day. Photos and stories can't convey the feeling and grand vistas.
Fantastic Views. Gr8 walk over the iconic bridge, we walked from the city to Kirribilly, caught the ferry back
walked across it took 20 min max. Walked everywhere....so many steps up/down seemed like everywhere. Caught train across the bridge, than walked back......easy as!

Nice bridge, but think twice about the walk.. The bridge is very cool and very photogenic. But I do not believe it is worth $250 per person to climb it. It would be a once in a lifetime experience, for certain. But everything in Sydney is expensive (average cost for a 16 oz bottle of Coke in Sydney is $6 and that's when the US exchange rate was about 1:1). There is a lot to see and do here in Sydney, and if this is the only pricy thing you do, fine, do it. But you can walk over it for free, take a ferry under it for a couple of bucks and even climb up the inside of one of the pylons (Sydney east side) for only $11. So before you books that climb, give it some serious consideration.
An icon and rightly so. You can get a great view of the bridge from The Rocks- just walk towards it and you can walk underneath the bridge and get an idea of the size of the whole structure.

Spectacular!. I visited the Harbour Bridge in March of 2012 with a group of study abroad students. We went on the Bike Buffs tour throughout Sydney and were able to bike across the bridge. It was an amazing experience being able to see the architecture up close and personal, and seeing the views of the Harbour!
Pylon Lookout. Take a twilight walk across then bridge...great views!
An Engineering Marvel.. Get great views from circular quay and the opera house.
Free to walk over - very good.. It was a great walk across the bridge and to see Sydney from it. It is free and took about 30 minutes. Well worth doing , for all ages.
The Cot Hanger. I went over & under it round it and through it very impressed I had the same feelings when I first saw the Collesium in Rome for the first Time

Walk It!. I walked from the Museum of Contemporary Art (go there), through The Rocks to the Harbour Bridge, and walked across it. It is quite easy, although a lot of steps at the beginning. It was a beautiful day, the views were magic, it costs nothing and you are exercising as well! It can't get any better.

great to see even in the rain!. so when your in Sydney im surer everyone will see the bridge. We were in sydney three days and managed to get some amazing photos even though the weather was horrid! its the best place to get photos of the opera house too
great bridge. Didn't walk bridge due to time but looked amazing from view from ferry and Opera House.

Memorable experience. Fantastic and very worthwhile.
The organisation of the climb was brilliant and so well thought out and planned.
A clearly spoken informative guide took us up and the pace, level of information given and atmosphere created by him was really excellent.
Engineering marvel. One of the worlds iconic bridges. Just celebrated its 80th birthday
Bridge Climb. It's not cheap but the Bridge Climb is fabulous! Don't risk it if you're afraid of heights, but if not, it's the best view you'll ever get!
Just walk it!. Ana amazing structure! The pylon tour is cheap and interesting... If you have money and more time, the BridgeClimb is a not to be missed event!

What a view. We went to Aus on Honeymoon, and with a little fear of heights were skeptical this would be enjoyable, but we could not miss out.What a view and what a tour that should not be missed. The value of information the instructor gives you and the many opportunitites to see the city from way up high, curbed our fear and made the trip up magical.You need to pre book tickets as the attraction gets pretty full really early on in the Summer seasons, but its safe and fun really. You even get to have some picks while you up there.Just remember to wear comfy shoes and you cant take anything up with u .;)
Best Harbour in the World. I go often as I visit friends and family. Manly ferry gives good viewing!!!

Climb the Sydney Harbour Bridge, its awesome.. Climbed the Sydney Harbour Bridge at dusk. Spectacular view. Great to be able to view the skyline in daylight and darkness. Easy climb and walk too. Met some nice people in our group also.
Second time better than first. It was perfect. It was the spot I told my husband how much I love him. It is truly a magical experience. A must do for all.

Amazing Structure. Amazing structure and something you should not miss when visiting Sydney - take a ride under it in a water taxi, walk over it or take the climb - anyone of these will give you a thrill

walking the bridge. An iconic site, easy to book over the internet.The welcome is very warm,fill in the paperwork and recieve your baseball cap. You are called thru and told the procedures , then kitted out,including your cap and hankie .Off to the the practice climb,then thru the wall and then clipped onto the safety wire. The walk is easier than you think and very safe. the view is amazing ,to see the Opera House from the Bridge is very different. You walk halfway then crossover and comeback down the walk takes about two hours the whole visit three hours.If you are in Sydney you will go to see the bridge make the effort to walk it . Excellient value for a once in a lifetime experience.

AN ICONIC OLD BRIDGE WITH A WORLD CLASS VIEW. The SYDNEY HARBOUR BRIDGE is to Sydney, Australia what the Empire State Building is to New York City. Aussies love this bridge. Good reason for this! It is in the heart of everything and it is a good looking bridge. Moreovr, the bridge affords a world class view of the Sydney Opera House and the Harbour. We decided to walk over the bridge to take in the views.It took us about 30 minutes which allowed us to stop frequently to appreciate the vistas. Coming back we walked about 5 minutes and caught the train coming back to the Circular Quay.There is an attraction where some folks even climb to the top of the bridge. We did not but it appears very safe from all reports we had. The best view of the bridge (as opposed to from the bridge) in our opinion was from the Royal Botanic Garden harbour walk.You can frame the bridge over the Opera House if you want a very memorable picture,
Great View. Great view of the Sydney Opera House. I walked from Milson's Point to Circular Quey everyday to get some exercise instead of taking the train.
A bridge too far. When travelling with children they can only take so much of sitting in prams. The bridge walk to Luna Park may have been a little long for them.

MEGASTRUCTURE. WOW ! What a structure, a real megastructure. What ever angle you view it from in Sydney it is impressive. Looks great from a boat on the harbour and also looks great when you get a taxi and drive over it. I recommend a good photo spot is on the other side of the bay by the Luna park them park. You can get some great shots of the bridge with the opera house in the distance.

spectacular views - but only from the train. if you travel on the bridge and use the trains, your eyes are in for a treat, from the harbor's views. it is just breath-taking. make sure you find a good seat on the higher level of the trains.However if you drive a car, you wont be able to see a thing due to the high barriers of the bridge. There was also a good market right beneath the bridge.
Really cool. Yeah it's expensive but if you don't focus on the price, the experience was really awesome. Totally recommend it if it's in your budget

Rated No. 1. Any vist to Sydney cannot exclude the harbour bridge, and the added luxury of walking across it, seeing the spectacular structure grow upon your eyes as you walk it's length, and note that it 80 years old, and is a riveted steel structure (no bolts!) adds to its beauty.Add the amazing height of the bridge, the spread of the view you'll have of the harbour and city, especially on Australia Day, seeing the activity of a busy harbour, ferries rushing across commuting people and the occasional freighter or passenger liner berthing at Circular Quay, or a naval ship coming into Garden Island, the harbour from the bridge is always amazing.
Bridge. View amazing great walk across the bridge. Took about half an hour. Found I was not afraid of height going over bridge. Came back on the ferry which also was great.

A view for free. Having never been able to afford the bridge climb the next best thing is to access the bridge via steps from the Rocks (behind the Australian Hotel), and then walk along the pedestrian walkway. Photos opportunities galore
Loved it. Always a beautiful site, particularly loved going under the bridge on the ferry

Sydney Icon. walk across the harbour then catch a ferry back under the harbour. Start in Milsons Point and finish in Milsons point. Maybe a glass of wine in circular Quay and one at Ripples Milsons point
Take a look from the wonderful bridge. Fantastic to take a walk over and view the wonderful harbour from this fantastic bridge.

Breathtaking views. A must do activity in Sydney is to walk over the bridge and enjoy the awesome views and soak up the atmosphere of Sydney. Walk back or get a ferry from Kiribilli.
Check out my blog, Sydney in 7 days on www.sydney-jono.blogspot.com
Amazing Views!. This was an amazing structure and the tour staff were great
Iconic Bridge. Just as in the photographs - if you are brave (and can afford it) climb up to the top - otherwise go up the pylon lookout for magnificant views.

The coat hanger. Crossing the Sydey Harbour Bridge can sometimes be a night mare during peak hours. Neverthe less it is the best way to go from the northern side into the city. One can walk across the bridge or catch a train from Milson's Point to Circular Quay or Wynyard stations. If not the driver of the car the view of the buildings is great, An experience not to be missed. We have just celebrated the 80th anniversay of the opening this week.

Great views and very informative. We did the Discovery Climb where they tell you all about the bridge construction, history etc. The guide was informative and pleasant and knew his stuff. It is a little expensive, ($200 each) but if it's on the Bucket List it just has to be done. Most of the walk is gentle and you don't really feel the height because you are surrounded by the superstructure. You are also clipped on very securely and that bridge is going nowhere!

A Multi Million Dollar view and a bonding experience.. It takes 3 hours from safety talk,suiting up and leisurely walk over to half way and then cross over and back to same side of bridge. I did the top span, you can do the under span. It is not difficult--I am in my 70's, but active. Wonderful views of all of City and harbour. Cannot take any pictures, they take them for you of the group (small,only approx.12) not the scenery but you see it in the background of photo. Great earphones to hear the guides talk about points of interest. All concrete wide and not high steps. Take good flat footware. Must climb 2 narrow small ladders-one up and then at end one down. See the trains pass within a few feet of you when on one ladder. The driver toots his horn. You are attached to the bridge at all times--you CANNOT FALL.

Don't pay for the climb--walk across!. My wife and I took the pedestrian walk across the bridge and it was wonderful and FREE! When you reach the other side, you can catch the ferry back from Luna Park. Unless you have money to burn and are a committed thrill-seeker, the walk is a terrific thing to do with wonderful city and harbor views.

awe inspiring. the harbour bridge is every bit as beautiful in real life as it is in photos my husband did the bridge climb and said he has never done anything as good as this in his whole life !!!!! i did not do the climb personally as i am not good with heights but it must have been awesome! he was away for over 4 hours so i spent my time shopping

A masterpiece! A great walk and spectacular to look at. The bridge is deceiving at how long it is to walk over but the walk is worthwhile! One side of the bridge is reserved for bike riders and the other side for pedestrians. This makes it much easier to enjoy the experience with out pedestrians and bikes clashing.Due to safety there is fencing which ruins the atmosphere a bit but I understand why it is necessary.
Best View of Sydney. Climb the bridge for the most spectacular panorama.

Sydney's iconic bridge. What's not to like? Best to walk across from Kirribilli in to the city and stroll around in The Rocks. Some of the best views of Sydney are from the top of the bridge on the bridge climb. An accidental architectural treasure.

Nice views, even in the rain. It was pouring rain the day we walked on the bridge, and there were guards all along the route. (I think the bridge is open all night, but we went in the afternoon). I walked up to the Bridge Museum, which was quite a few steps, and was gone about an hour. Not much up there, but terrific views and some salient facts about the bridge. I also watched a movie, which was interesting. You can see the "Bridge Climbers" from the Pylon (that's where the museum is). No, I did not climb the bridge! Anyway, it was raining, and I'm sure some of those climbers had booked online in hopes of a lovely day, but they were then committed, financially, and had to follow through or lose their "investment." My husband dislikes heights, so he stayed down on the bridge and spent the hour speaking with one of the guards (they were friendly guards--probably work for the Chamber of Commerce!).
Interesting bridge. Didn't get the nerve to do the bridge climb but watching the ones who were doing it, it looked like they were really enjoying the experience.

An Easy and Memorable Walk That Offers Stunning Views. Strolling across the Sydney Harbour Bridge is a 'must do'. On the southern side, stairs from 'The Rocks' take you onto the bridge. On the north side of is the historic, upper class suburb of Kirribilli with its lovely tree-lined streets and great coffee shops and fabulous views of the Bridge and the Sydney Central Business District. While walking the Bridge, be sure to go up the South Tower for great views that don't cost the earth. Check tower opening times- it would be a shame to miss the experience. If a walk back on the bridge is too much, take the train from Milson's Point to Circular Quay.

Great icon!. I travel the bridge everyday to work and let me tell you the traffic is terrible! However, that's not about my review... so, I love the Harbour Bridge for what it is for the Sydney-siders - the locals, who admire it from a distance or like me, who travel on it daily! The HB is a symbol of what Sydney is, it's mad-rush traffic, the head office hub for most organisations, the hard working, fun loving people that Sydney-siders are! And it is a world-highlight every NYE! To some extent the image of the Harbour Bridge + Opera House have become symbols, not just of Sydney but Australia!

Well worth the Walk. Though now well signed posted at all ; the walk downtown and across the bridge as the sun risers was really scenic and good for you! Terminate at Milson Point pool for a swim to complete
Climb & walk. We walked across the footpath to the other side , while our family did the climb, great views.

A great sight, just a walk across is good.. We walked across and back and also took the trip up the tower to the look-out at the top. The kids thought this was awesome. I didn't fancy the bridge walk and my youngest son wasn't old enough either so we did the alternative. An amazing structure and the information about how it was built inside the tower is great to read - even for kids!

Must see. The New Year celebrations have to be seen to be believed, amazing experiences and the fireworks are awesome. Arrive early as the vantage points get taken soon, be prepared with food and drink (non alcoholic) as once the place gets packed you wont be able to move. Enjoy the fireworks
The bridge climb was an adventure and not scary at all.. The crew were very knowledgeable and generous. The climb was interesting and the views and photos were great!
Good views of bridge. Had many good panaramic views of the bridge from the hotel, Sydney Harbor, Opera Hous, ferry, and walking by The Rocks.

A must visit, skip the bridge climb.. Great views of the city from the pylon. We opted to skip the harbor bridge climb since it's over 200 dollars per person and you can't bring cameras with. Got wonderful views fo the city from the pylon and only had to pay 11 dollars.

WOW!!! AMazing Attraction. This is called, "Climb the Bridge" where you actually walk up to the top of the arch of the bridge overlooking the Opera House. It might be a little scary at first, but they put harnesses and equipment on you. They are very strict about the rules and really with all the protection you have, you couldn't even jump off if you wanted to!We went in the evening and it was great. Not cheap, but how many times are you going to be in Sydney Australia? Definitely a fun unique thing to do.
A great walk that gives wonderful views of the Harbour. Had a very clear and hot day when we walked over the bridge. Loved the views you get.
fabulous. A fabulous sight to behold right beside the specatular Opera House. A bridge climb for the adventurous is very popular.

About the best view in Sydney. The walk up with Sydney Bridge Climbs was easy, we were well trained and inducted before we left in our funny suits and clips to wire guidelines. The morning we went it was busy and made sure we found the place (up past where the Rocks Markets are held) in plenty of time, checked in, had a coffee etc before doing the induction and heading off. The view may have been restricted somewhat if the weather had been cloudy and raining or foggy.

bridge climb - do it. it is amazing. i have a fear of heights and was able to overcome it. it is spectacular!!! the weather was perfect so we were fortunate. the guide was fantastic - we had a small group of 4 which helped. i sailed under the bridge several times and knew i had to do the climb. it is a must when in sydney!
Walked the bridge. Unbelievable view and worth the time. If you cross the bridge go on over to Luna Park - great fun place.

Wow!!!!. I did the bridge climb yesterday with my boyfriend and although I am very scared of heights I had the most amazing time!We chose to do the twilight climb which started at 5.05pm, it is more expensive for the twilight experience but it is definitely worth the extra money - I think the last day climb would be just as good if you can get on it and its less expensive.It is rather pricey but its a once in a lifetime experience. The guide was fab, good fun and very knowledgeable.The scariest part is getting on and off the bridge as there are some vertical ladders to climb, however I felt very safe and once I got on the bridge I was a lot less nervous.All in all I would highly recommend!!!!

A wonderful icon. You can climb it, walk across it or just look at it.. I'm an ex-Sydney guy. I used to run across it at lunchtime, I've driven across it a thousand times (probably much more!) and I have climbed it once. It defines Sydney in many ways. One story is that It was a great sign of the vision of the leaders at the time, because when it was built there were only four cars on the north shore. I doubt that a little, but I get the picture!Read the story about it on line before you see it, particularly the engineering challenges of the construction at the time. And about the cutting of the ribbon!It is a beautiful structure. It looks in balance in photographs, and more so when you are close to it.And the view of Sydney, arriving on a plane for the first time, landing from the north: one of the most memorable sights you will ever have.

Sydney Harbour Bridge. The Bridge is world famous and the view from the plane coming in to land and from around the Harbour was fabulous. To walk the Bridge? it was just another Bridge in another City !

Climb it, walk across, ride under it. Our bridge is there to be experienced. It's a grand old thing, and a workhorse carrying trains and traffic across the city. You can climb the arch (expensive but stunning), or take a free walk from the Rocks to/from Milsons Point (catch the train or ferry if you don't want to walk both ways). Plenty of ferries go under the Bridge too, so you can experience it from the water as well. A lovely part of Sydney life.

Great backdrop for the Opera House. Looks impressive, especially if on the top deck of a ship going under it. Not much clearance. I went there a couple of times while therebecause of it's proximity to Central Quay (the main ferry hub for Sydney. I didn;t do it but saw others do the bridge climb, way up there. I wasn't that brave.

Excellent Views from the bridge. Did the walk across the bridge as we were short on time for the climb, however the views across the harbour are pretty stunning on both sides and it also provides one of the best views of the Opera House.Took the train to Milsons point and from there its a couple of mins walk. Took us about 30-40 mins to walk across with lots of photo stops on the way, you get lovely shots of the harbour from the bridge and the best views of the bridge itself are probably from Opera House (how apt that two of their biggest icons share this relation). Both look amazing at night with the lights on. Definitely worth the effort to walk across although the bridge climb would definitely have been a better experience.

The Worlds favorite bribge. This structure is just so imposing and a credit to its creators and it is maintained perfectly and dare I say it lovingly all Sydneysiders love the bridge it used to get called THE COATHANGER by earlier generation of proud Aussies not so much now
Magical day and night. This bridge is awesome and so pretty at night all lit up...
stunning. what can you say about the Sydney Harbour Bridge, an icon to Australia and a definite must see for tourists

Frames Sydney Harbour. Sydney Harbour would have to be one of the most beautiful in the world and this bridge is the perfect way to take in the views. You can walk across the bridge and if you cannot afford the cost of the bridge climb you can go up in one of the pylons and get a fabulous view of the harbour

Good views, overpriced climb fee, great views without the tour.. The walk is a moderately based activity if you intend to walk the entire length of the bridge.The bridge is only walkable from (from the city) on the right hand side as the other side is a bike path. The walk can take 40 minutes or longer to the other side and return depending on how many pictures you take. The only steps necessary are the 3 flights up at the beginning of the trek and remaining portion is a gradual slope. The tower on the far side of the bridge is free and climbable. The view is similar to the top of the bridge for the paid climb. And additional 30 minutes for the tower is necessary.The free walk will give you great views and pictures of the harbor, Opera House and city. There is a climb which gives you an explanation of the bridge and Sydney. At 200$ this was not a value since the free climb of the tower was available. This is a great walk to plan before or after a lunch in the Rocks section of Sydney.

WALKED THE HARBOUR BRIDGE. It wasnt a good day, drizzling with rain (and no coat) only a well worn umbrella we at the last minute decided to walk the bridge, it was spectacular even though misty, due to the weather we were not allowed to go over the top which I didint mind, there are 2 walks one along the side of the rail tracks and the big one over the top . One costs nothing the other does!which ever one you do you wont be sorry these views are spectacular and the size of the harbour is mammoth. Not suitable for small children walking or in prams too many steps.This is a must while in Sydney what a great place.
Sight for Sore Eyes!. Amazing view, especially when you walk round the corner and see the Opera House and Bridge together! Breath taking!
Excellent Experience. It is worth seeing place. Cruise ride is an added advantage.

Walk it. We walked over and back- great views. You can go up one of the towers, but not much higher than walking deck. Bridge climb is expensive (over $200) and might be worth it for some, but most of the experience is available free by just walking over.

Just take a walk. My earlier review of the Harbour suggested a simple walk over the bridge with the residents of this great city. Aim for Luna Park and have some fun. Try the ferry for your return to Circular Quay

to climb is fun but otherwise its just a CBD access road congested by cars when everyone could ride above ground tunnel. lack of political s=will and rpinciple has meant that commercial interests are served ahead of the social integrety of the city...scooters and bicycles are certainly the ideal for Australian climate...i have seen Russians transporting well in minus 20 degrees on these and we do have a very gentle climate in general...
Take a walk. Lovely to look at and even better when you are standing on top looking at the view. I have a fear of heights but this is not at all scary, just breathtaking.
Bridge walk. This is a spectacular view of Sydney from the iconic bridge over Sydney Harbour especially the sunset walk. Book in Advance.

Welcome to Sydney. This bridge is just such a beautiful sight, when you are flying in from overseas and flying over Sydney Harbour you get that warm tingly feeling inside.......... It is so impressive to enter Sydney Harbour by plane or ship everyone should do it at least once.

Iconic Sydney #1. This is the BIG icon of Sydney and has been since 1932. Other than the bridge climb experience (which is not for all) you can walk across it for free and it this is a great experience to see the harbour and city in all its moods and vistas from a different angle. It also is a good walk although the traffic may give you a fumes-based headache if the wind is wrong!

Don't to the tour!!. Just don't go there. It's just so boring all the safety crap. And presented in an painstakingly monotone aussie accent. Just walk across the foot bridge for free, trust me the view is great and you'll need your saved cash for the food prices.
the backdrop. the bridge is iconic with sydney and is treated as such british engineering at its best
Train across the bridge. Good trip for visitors to take. It gives a lovely perspective of the city as the train emerges downtown .
Nice walk!. Go ahead and walk across it, you can always take a ferry, bus or train back! The views are superb!
A must -. Excellent teaching - which set you ease as soon as you get there
Excellent. Def not to be missed on any visit to Sydney simply breathtaking

The Icon. If you can take the time to walk across. Start on the CBD side, the stairs can be accessed from the cut in the Rocks. Once you get to the other side take the time for a coffee or lunch/drink in Kirribilli. You can always get the train back from Milsons Point station if you're tired.
Iconic Sydney. get on a ferry across sydney harbour is amazing; on a clear day you really get to enjoy the gorgeous harbour.
A recognisable icon. You know youre in Sydney when you see the coathanger
Walk the bridge.. The bridge walk is a must do if you visit Sydney. The views from the top are braeth taking!!
Iconic Sydney structure.. Always spectacular! A great view of the Bridge can be obtained from Lady Macquarie's Chair.
The Bridge - Walk across for FREE. Little known but you can walk across (street level for free)
Wasn't up to the bridge climb, but walking over was worth it. Best views of Sydney and the train ride back was worth it in 28c heat
Bridge Climb. It was excellent! never thought that I could do the bridge climb. So scared of heights. But I had no problem and the views were fantastic and the guide was excellent

Wow!. At least try the Twilight, Discovery tour. This has to be the best. The Discovery takes place on the lower arch and meanders up the bridge to culminate at the apex with other walkers from other tours. Watched the sunset over the mountains and ventured down to be surrounded by passing trains near the deck - WOW!

Top Of The World. Perhaps we were just lucky but we did the twilight bridge climb on a beautiful sunny day so saw a wonderful sunset and then the Sydney skyline at night. At first thought, this seemed expensive but to be honest, it was worth every dollar,
Amazing. This is an absolute must. So much fun, great view and we lived to tell our tale!

Interesting. Interesting to walk all along the bridge. Only one side is available for walkers, joggers, and cyclers. At the end of the bridge you have a place with several shops to get some food or coffee. There are also tables so you can bring your own picnic. The view of the opera is grand from the bridge! It is possible to climb the pilars (10 dollars i think) or onto the bridge metal structure - even more expensive. Great experience!

Great pictures of Sydney Harbour Bridge. It's a beautiful bridge that appears in quite a few pictures taken while we walked around the Sydney Harbour and from a ferry (both during the day and it's spectacularly lit at night). While we didn't get a chance during our short stay, one can either walk along the bridge at the same level as the cars....or if so inclined, can even join one of the many groups who actually walk up / climb the bridge!

New Year Eve 2011. We went to Sydney from Dec 26, 2011 Jan 6, 2012. The firework display on the bridge was great. We went to the North Island by ferry. Bring your own food and water because once you are there you don't want to loose your spot. It's hot bring allot of sun screen, water, and food.

The Old Coat Hanger. What can I say, I am a Sydneysider by birth, although I don't live there now. The Harbour Bridge is a magnificent structure and a joy to walk over - travel over by train or express bus, even by car if it's not peak hour, then it is best to avoid it. The views from the bridge are stunning - I enjoy going over it much more now that I am a casual visitor to Sydney then I did when I lived there, and would recommend every International or out of state visitor to Sydney to take a walk across it - or over the top of it!

It's a must see in Sydney. We climbed the bridge (bridge climb) and the next day we travelled under it on a ferry. It's quite lovely and an icon in Sydney....really a must see if you are travelling here.

Great New Years Eve Display. This bridge is lit up each year at New Year as fireworks are set off. The best view of the bridge is from the water, but if you don't have a boat, many of the waterfront areas offer a terrific vantage point.
Iconic. Amazing. We have all seen the pictures, up close it is set amongst one of the world's most spectacular vistas
Well worth the climb. What a great experience if you don't mind heights.

WOW! Once in a lifetime and worth the expense.. Ben was our guide up the bridge and he was excellent. Funny and very professional and made us all feel part of a little family during our three hour experience. He was wonderful. There is no getting away from the fact this is a very expensive experience but it is worth every penny for those views at the top. Me and my other half had an amazing time and we will remember it for as long as we live.
You have to walk across the Bridge. Great experience & views to walk across teh Bridge.I'd love to try the walk on top of the bridge!
You can walk over it!. I prefer to walk on it or catch a train on it and look at the view
Wow. The sheer scale of the bridge takes your breath away. We have all seen the pictures but to see it up close (especially from the water) and to walk its span is some thing else.

Beautiful bridge. It seems a bit pointless reviewing something like the Sydney Harbour Bridge, but, given I can I might as well. The Bridge itself is quite lovely; its iconic span is visually nice and provides good views from its deck. For a few bucks you can climb one of the towers and get a higher viewpoint.
Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. I loved this! The BridgeClimb staff are really great, helpful and the climb itself is a fabulous experience - I did a day climb. Do it!!!

Impressive. This bridge is impressive. I know it's just a bridge, but it was a huge feat considering the era which it was constructed. There's a bit of history that goes along with the bridge. Its worth checking out. You can walk over the bridge or cross with a group underneath, but each of these costs quite a bit of money. If you take any tours to the north part of Sydney you'll cross over and usually the tour guides elaborate a little on the bridges construction.

You can see it from everywhere. The bridge dominates the skyline wherever you are in the harbor. You don't have to do anything to it, just float under it, climb over it or look at it. It is beautiful.
Iconic. Didn't do the climb but walked across and under. Enjoyable to watch the climbers throughout the day. Sailing under on the ferry got a good view.
The Bridge Climb is a must do when in Sydney. The views from here are just sensational. This is one of the iconic locations of the world, it lives up to every expectation you may have.
Amazing site. one of the wonders of the world....a must see, its beautiful. You can also do the walk over the arch of the bridge
another land mark of sydney. it's a beatiful unique bridge you got to see, beautiful sydney was and so till now.

The Icon. It's just such a photo opportunity. One of the best views of the Bridge and the Opera House combined is from Mrs Macquarie's Chair. Hubby took some visiting relatives on a twilight Bridge Climb and they came back with stars in their eyes. A fabulous experience. You can also walk along the Bridge from The Rocks to Kirribilli, but wait for a day of sunshine.
Big - Bad - Bridge. As bridges go, this bridge is impressive. It's worth a look.
The Coat Hanger Bridge. The bridge dominates the harbour but it is not an intrinsically beautiful structure like, for example, the Golden Gate in San Francisco.
An icon with a view. If you have nexer climbed this icon I suggest you do. Fantastic views across the city - even on a stomy day in th erain.
Love this bridge. Over the most beautiful harbour in the world! What more could you want. A great walk at night! A must do for visitors and residents
Gotta love the coathanger. I love to see it, to drive it and know its there. No mistaking what city you are in, once it comes into view. Iconic.
bridge. to me it was just a bridge. yes it was cool to see

Good Harbour Views. Had every intention of walking the bridge to the very top but the price was way too expensive, it was raining and as I am slightly disabled would not have managed the metal upright ladders to get to the start of the main climb.So my friend and I not only walked the main walkway to the other side, after a coffee and a snack at Milsons point we walked back. We could have caught the light railway or the ferry but we decided to walk. Got some good photos.The opera house looks entirely different in the rain to when the sun shines,
Home is where the heart is. No one could hate this, my number one joy is driving over it every morning as the sun rises over the harbour
